Text

ï»¿The [White Ladies of [Worcester]1-worcester]262-white ladies of worcester

CHAPTER I

THE SUBTERRANEAN WAY

The slanting rays of afternoon sunshine , pouring through stone arches , lay in broad , golden bands , upon the flags of [the Convent cloister]263-the convent cloister .

[The old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , stepped from the cool shade of [the cell passage]265-the cell passage and , blinking at the sunshine , shuffled slowly to [her]264-the old lay - sister appointed post at the top of [the crypt steps]266-the crypt steps , up which would shortly pass the silent procession of [nuns returning from Vespers]267-nuns returning from vespers .

Daily [they]262-white ladies of worcester went , and daily [they]262-white ladies of worcester returned , by the underground way , a passage over a mile in length , leading from [the Nunnery of [the White Ladies at [Whytstone]3-whytstone in [Claines]4-claines]2-the white ladies at whytstone in claines]268-the nunnery of the white ladies at whytstone in claines , to [the Church of St. Mary]269-the church of st. mary and [St. Peter]86-st. peter , [the noble Cathedral within the walls of [the city of]271-the city of [Worcester]1-worcester]270-the noble cathedral within the walls of the city of worcester . Entering [this passage]272-this passage from [the crypt]273-the crypt in [[their]262-white ladies of worcester own cloisters]274-their own cloisters , [they]262-white ladies of worcester walked in darkness below [the sunny meadows]275-the sunny meadows , passed beneath [the Fore - gate]276-the fore - gate , moving in silent procession under [the busy streets]277-the busy streets , until [they]262-white ladies of worcester reached [the crypt of [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral]278-the crypt of the cathedral .

From [the crypt]273-the crypt , a winding stairway in the wall led up to [a chamber above [the choir]282-the choir]281-a chamber above the choir , whence , unseeing and unseen , [the White Ladies of [Worcester]1-worcester]283-the white ladies of worcester daily heard [the holy monks below chant Vespers]284-the holy monks below chant vespers .

To [Sister Mary Antony]85-mary antony fell the task of counting [the five - and - twenty veiled figures]285-the five - and - twenty veiled figures , as [they]285-the five - and - twenty veiled figures passed down the steps and disappeared beneath the ground , and of again counting [them]285-the five - and - twenty veiled figures as [they]285-the five - and - twenty veiled figures reappeared , and moved in stately silence along [the cloister]286-the cloister , each entering [[her]85-mary antony own cell]287-her own cell , to spend , in prayer and adoration , the hours until the Refectory bell should call [them]285-the five - and - twenty veiled figures to the evening meal .

This counting of [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies dated from the day , now more than half a century ago , when [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha , weakened by prolonged fasting , and chancing to walk last in the procession , fainted and , falling silently , remained behind , unnoticed , in the solitude and darkness .

It was the habit of [this saintly lady]289-this saintly lady to abide in [[her]289-this saintly lady own cell]287-her own cell after Vespers , dispensing with the evening meal ; thus [her]289-this saintly lady absence was not discovered until the following morning when [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , finding [the cell]291-the cell empty , hastened to report that [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha having long , like [Enoch]88-enoch , walked with [God]89-god , had , even , as [Enoch]88-enoch , been translated !

[The nuns who flocked to [the cell]291-the cell , inclining to [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's view of the strange happening , kneeled upon the floor before the empty couch]292-the nuns who flocked to the cell , inclining to mary antony 's view of the strange happening , kneeled upon the floor before the empty couch , and worshipped .

[The Prioress of that time]294-the prioress of that time , however , being of a practical turn of mind , ordered the immediate lighting of the lanterns , and [herself]294-the prioress of that time descended to search the underground way .

[She]294-the prioress of that time did not need to go far .

The saintly spirit of [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha had indeed been translated .

[They]295-they found [her]87-sister agatha frail body lying prone against the door , the hands broken and torn by much wild beating upon its studded panels .

[She]87-sister agatha had run to and fro in the dank darkness , beating first upon the door beneath [the Convent cloisters]296-the convent cloisters , then upon the door , a mile away , leading into [the Cathedral crypt]297-the cathedral crypt .

But [the nuns]298-the nuns were shut into [[their]298-the nuns cells]299-their cells , beyond [the cloister]286-the cloister ; [the good people of [Worcester city]302-worcester city]301-the good people of worcester city slept peacefully , not dreaming of the despairing figure running to and fro beneath [them]301-the good people of worcester city tottering , stumbling , falling , arising to fall again , yet hurrying blindly onwards ; and [the Cathedral Sacristan]303-the cathedral sacristan , when questioned , confessed that , hearing cries and rappings coming from [the crypt]273-the crypt at a late hour , [he]303-the cathedral sacristan speedily locked the outer gate , said an " Ave , "[303-the cathedral sacristan] and went [home]305-home to supper ; well knowing that , at such a time , [none save spirits of evil]306-none save spirits of evil would be wandering below , in so great torment .

Thus , through much tribulation , poor [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha entered into rest ; being held in deepest reverence ever after .

More than fifty years had gone by . [The Prioress of that day]307-the prioress of that day , and most of [those who walked in that procession]308-those who walked in that procession , had long lain beside [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha in [the Convent burying - ground]309-the convent burying - ground . But [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , now [oldest of [the lay - sisters]311-the lay - sisters]310-oldest of the lay - sisters , never failed to make careful count , as [each veiled figure]312-each veiled figure passed , nor to impart the mournful reason for this necessity to [all new - comers]313-all new - comers . So that [the nun whose turn it was to walk last in the procession]314-the nun whose turn it was to walk last in the procession , prayed that [she]314-the nun whose turn it was to walk last in the procession might not hear behind [her]314-the nun whose turn it was to walk last in the procession the running feet of [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha ; while [none]315-none went alone into [the cloisters]316-the cloisters after dark , lest [they]315-none should hear the poor thin hands of [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha beating upon the panels of the door .

Thus does the anguish of a tortured brain leave its imperishable impress upon the surroundings in which the mind once suffered , though the freed spirit may have long forgotten , in the peace of [Paradise]5-paradise , that slight affliction , which was but for a moment , through which it passed to the eternal weight of glory .

Of late , [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , had grown fearful lest [she]85-mary antony should make mistake in this solemn office of the counting . Therefore , in the secret of [her]85-mary antony own heart , [she]85-mary antony devised a plan , which [she]85-mary antony carried out under cover of [her]85-mary antony scapulary . Twenty - five dried peas [she]85-mary antony held ready in [her]85-mary antony wallet ; then , as [each veiled figure]312-each veiled figure , having mounted the steps leading from [the crypt]273-the crypt doorway , moved slowly past [her]85-mary antony , [she]85-mary antony dropped a pea with [her]85-mary antony right hand into [her]85-mary antony left . When [all the holy Ladies]320-all the holy ladies had passed , if all had returned , five - and - twenty peas lay in [her]85-mary antony left hand , none remained in the wallet .

This secret dropping of peas became a kind of game to [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . [She]85-mary antony kept the peas in a small linen bag , and often took them out and played with them when alone in [[her]85-mary antony cell]321-her cell , placing them all in a row , and settling , to [her]85-mary antony own satisfaction , which peas should represent [the various holy Ladies]322-the various holy ladies .

A large white pea , of finer aspect than the rest , stood for [the noble Prioress]323-the noble prioress [herself]323-the noble prioress ; a somewhat shrivelled pea , hard , brown , and wizened , did duty as [Mother Sub - Prioress]324-mother sub - prioress , [an elderly nun]325-an elderly nun , not loved by [Mary Antony]85-mary antony because of [her]85-mary antony sharp tongue and strict fault - finding ways ; while a pale and speckled pea became [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , held in high scorn by [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , as [a traitress , sneak , and liar]327-a traitress , sneak , and liar , for if ever tale of wrong or shame was whispered in [the Convent]328-the convent , it could be traced for place of origin to the slanderous tongue and crooked mind of [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca .

When all the peas in line upon the floor of [[her]85-mary antony cell]321-her cell were named , [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony marked out [a distant flagstone]330-a distant flagstone , on which the sunlight fell , as heaven ; another , partially in shadow , purgatory ; a third , in [a far corner of exceeding darkness , hell]331-a far corner of exceeding darkness , hell . [She]85-mary antony then proceeded , with well - directed fillip of thumb and middle finger , to send [the holy Ladies]332-the holy ladies [there]333-there where , in [her]85-mary antony judgment , [they]332-the holy ladies belonged .

If the game went well , [the noble Prioress]323-the noble prioress landed safely in [heaven]335-heaven , without even the most transitory visit to purgatory ; [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , rolling into purgatory , remained there ; while the pale and speckled pea went straight to hell !

When these were safely landed , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony rubbed [her]85-mary antony hands and , chuckling gleefully , finished the game at gay hap - hazard , it being of less importance where the rest of [the holy Ladies]332-the holy ladies chanced to go .

CHAPTER II

[SISTER MARY ANTONY]85-mary antony DISCOURSES

As [Mary Antony]85-mary antony shuffled slowly from the shadow into the sunshine , a gay little flutter of wings preceded [her]85-mary antony , and a robin perched upon the parapet behind the stone seat upon which it was [the lay - sister]337-the lay - sister 's custom to await the sound of the turning of the key in the lock of the heavy door beneath [the cloisters]316-the cloisters .

" [[Thou]85-mary antony good - for - [nothing imp]4200-nothing imp]4199-thou good - for - nothing imp ! "[85-mary antony] exclaimed [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , [her]85-mary antony old face crinkling with delight . " [[Thou]85-mary antony little vain man]4201-thou little vain man , in [thy]85-mary antony red jerkin ! Beshrew thine impudence , intruding into a place where [women]4202-women alone do dwell , and [no male thing]4203-no male thing may enter . [I]85-mary antony would have [thee]85-mary antony take warning by the fate of [the baker 's boy , who dared to climb into a tree]4204-the baker 's boy , who dared to climb into a tree , so that [he]4204-the baker 's boy , who dared to climb into a tree might peep over the wall and spy upon [the holy Ladies]332-the holy ladies in [[their]332-the holy ladies garden]4206-their garden . Boasting afterward of that which [he]4204-the baker 's boy , who dared to climb into a tree had done , and making merry over that which [he]4204-the baker 's boy , who dared to climb into a tree pretended to have seen , [[our]4207-our great Lord [Bishop]92-bishop]4208-our great lord bishop heard of it , and sent and took [that baker 's boy]4209-that baker 's boy , and though [he]4204-the baker 's boy , who dared to climb into a tree cried for mercy , swearing the whole tale was an empty boast , [they]4208-our great lord bishop put out [his]4204-the baker 's boy , who dared to climb into a tree bold eyes with heated tongs , and hanged [him]4204-the baker 's boy , who dared to climb into a tree from the very branches [he]4204-the baker 's boy , who dared to climb into a tree had climbed . [They]4208-our great lord bishop 'd do the like to [thee]4204-the baker 's boy , who dared to climb into a tree , [[thou]4204-the baker 's boy , who dared to climb into a tree little vain man]4201-thou little vain man , if [Mary Antony]85-mary antony reported on [thy]4204-the baker 's boy , who dared to climb into a tree ways . Wouldst like to hang , in [thy]4204-the baker 's boy , who dared to climb into a tree red doublet ? "[85-mary antony]

[The robin]339-the robin had heard this warning tale many times already , told by old [Mary Antony]85-mary antony with infinite variety . Sometimes the tongue of [the baker 's boy]340-the baker 's boy was cut out at the roots ; sometimes [he]340-the baker 's boy lost [his]340-the baker 's boy ears , or again , [he]340-the baker 's boy was tied to a cart - tail , and flogged through the Tything . Often [he]340-the baker 's boy became [a pieman]341-a pieman , and once [he]340-the baker 's boy was a turnspit in [the household of [the Lord Bishop [himself]343-the lord bishop himself]343-the lord bishop himself]342-the household of the lord bishop himself . But , whatever the preliminaries , and whether [baker]344-baker , [pieman , or turnspit]345-pieman , or turnspit , [his]340-the baker 's boy final catastrophe was always the same : [he]340-the baker 's boy was hanged from a bough of the very tree into which , impious and greatly daring , [he]340-the baker 's boy had climbed .

This was an ancient tale . [All who might vouch for it]346-all who might vouch for it , saving [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , had passed away ; and , of late , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony had been strictly forbidden by [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , to tell it to [new - comers]348-new - comers , or to speak of it to [any of [the nuns]298-the nuns]349-any of the nuns .

So , daily , [she]85-mary antony told it to [the robin]339-the robin ; and [he]340-the baker 's boy , being neither [[baker]344-baker 's lad]353-baker 's lad , [pieman , nor turnspit]354-pieman , nor turnspit , and having a conscience void of offence , would listen , wholly unafraid ; then , hopping nearer to [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , would look up at [her]85-mary antony , eager inquiry in [his]340-the baker 's boy bright eyes .

On this particular afternoon [he]340-the baker 's boy flew up into the very tree climbed by [[the prying and ill - fated baker]355-the prying and ill - fated baker 's lad]356-the prying and ill - fated baker 's lad , settled on a bough which branched out over [the Convent wall]357-the convent wall , and poured forth a gay trill of song .

" Ha , [[thou]340-the baker 's boy little vain man]4201-thou little vain man , in [thy]340-the baker 's boy brown and red suit ! "[85-mary antony] chuckled [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , leaning [her]85-mary antony gnarled hands on the stone parapet , as [she]85-mary antony stood framed in one of the cloister arches overlooking [the garden]358-the garden . " Is that [thy]340-the baker 's boy little ' grace before meat ' ? But , [I]85-mary antony pray [thee]340-the baker 's boy , [Sir Robin]94-sir robin , who said there was cheese in [my]85-mary antony wallet ? Nay , is there like to be cheese in a wallet already containing [five - and - twenty holy Ladies]4212-five - and - twenty holy ladies on [their]4212-five - and - twenty holy ladies way back from Vespers ? Out upon [thee]340-the baker 's boy for a most irreverent little glutton ! [I]85-mary antony fear [me]85-mary antony [thou]340-the baker 's boy hast not only a high look , [thou]340-the baker 's boy hast also a proud stomach ; just the reverse of [the great French Cardinal who came , with much pomp , to visit [us]4214-us at Easter time]4213-the great french cardinal who came , with much pomp , to visit us at easter time . [He]4213-the great french cardinal who came , with much pomp , to visit us at easter time had a proud look and a Come down again , [[thou]340-the baker 's boy little naughty man]4215-thou little naughty man , and [I]85-mary antony will tell [thee]340-the baker 's boy what [the Lord Cardinal]4216-the lord cardinal had under [his]4213-the great french cardinal who came , with much pomp , to visit us at easter time crimson sash . ' Tis not a thing to shout to the tree - tops . [I]85-mary antony might have to recite ten Paternosters , if [I]85-mary antony let [thee]340-the baker 's boy tempt [me]85-mary antony so to do . For whispering it in thine ear , [I]85-mary antony should but say one ; for having remarked it , none at all . Facts are facts ; and , even in the case of so weighty a fact , the responsibility rests not upon [the beholder]4217-the beholder . "[85-mary antony]

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony leaned over the parapet , looking upward . The afternoon sunlight fell full upon the russet parchment of [her]85-mary antony kind old face , shewing the web of wrinkles spun by ninety years of the gently turning wheel of time .

But [the robin , perched upon the bough]359-the robin , perched upon the bough , trilled and sang , unmoved . [He]359-the robin , perched upon the bough was weary of tales of [bakers and piemen]360-bakers and piemen . [He]359-the robin , perched upon the bough was not at all curious as to what had been beneath [the French Cardinal]95-the french cardinal 's crimson sash . [He]359-the robin , perched upon the bough wanted the tasty morsels which [he]359-the robin , perched upon the bough knew lay concealed in [Sister Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's leathern wallet . So [he]359-the robin , perched upon the bough stayed on the bough and sang .

[The old face]361-the old face , peering up from between the pillars , softened into tenderness at the robin 's song .

" [I]85-mary antony can not let [thy]359-the robin , perched upon the bough little grace return unto [thee]359-the robin , perched upon the bough void , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony said , and fumbled at the fastenings of [her]85-mary antony wallet .

A flick of wings , a flash of red . [The robin]339-the robin had dropped from the bough , and perched beside [her]85-mary antony .

[She]85-mary antony doled out crumbs , and fragments of cheese , pushing them toward [him]359-the robin , perched upon the bough along [the parapet]363-the parapet ; leaving [her]85-mary antony fingers near , to see how close [he]359-the robin , perched upon the bough would adventure to [her]85-mary antony hand .

[She]85-mary antony watched [him]359-the robin , perched upon the bough peck a morsel of cheese into five tiny pieces , then fly , with full beak , on eager wing , to the hidden nest , from which five gaping mouths shrieked a shrill and hungry welcome . Then , back again swift as an arrow from [the archer]364-the archer 's bow noting , with bright eye , and head turned sidewise , that the hand resting on the coping had moved nearer ; yet brave to take all risks for the sake of those yellow beaks , which would gape wide , in expectation , at sound of the beat of [his]359-the robin , perched upon the bough wings .

" Feed [thyself]359-the robin , perched upon the bough , [thou]359-the robin , perched upon the bough little worldling ! "[85-mary antony] [chuckled old Antony]85-mary antony , and covered the remaining bits of cheese with [her]85-mary antony hand . " Who art [thou]359-the robin , perched upon the bough to come here presuming to teach [thy]359-the robin , perched upon the bough betters lessons of self - sacrifice ? First feed [thyself]359-the robin , perched upon the bough ; then give to the hungry , the fragments that remain . Had [I]85-mary antony five squealing children here which Heaven forbid [I]85-mary antony should eat [mine]85-mary antony own mess , and count [myself]85-mary antony charitable if [I]85-mary antony let [them]4218-them lick the dish . [The holy Ladies]332-the holy ladies give to [the poor]4220-the poor at [the Convent]328-the convent gate , that for which [they]332-the holy ladies have no further use . Does [[thy]359-the robin , perched upon the bough jaunty fatherhood]4222-thy jaunty fatherhood presume to shame [our]4223-our saintly celibacy ? [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress did chide [me]85-mary antony sharply because , to [a poor soul with many hungry mouths to feed]4224-a poor soul with many hungry mouths to feed , [I]85-mary antony gave a good piece of venison , and not the piece which was tainted . Truth to tell , [I]85-mary antony had already made away with the tainted piece ; but [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress was pleased to think it was in the pot , seething for [the holy Ladies]332-the holy ladies ' evening meal ; and wherefore should [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress not think as [she]91-mother sub - prioress pleased ?[85-mary antony]

" ' [Woman]4226-woman ! ' [she]91-mother sub - prioress cried ; ' Woman ! ' and when [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress says ' Woman ! ' [the woman [she]91-mother sub - prioress addresses feels [her]91-mother sub - prioress estate]4227-the woman she addresses feels her estate would be higher had [God Almighty]96-god almighty been pleased to have let [her]91-mother sub - prioress be [the Man]4228-the man , or even [the Serpent]4229-the serpent , so much contempt does [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress infuse into the name ' Woman ! ' said [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , ' wouldst [thou]4230-thou make [all the Ladies of [the Convent]328-the convent]4231-all the ladies of the convent ill ? ' "[0-i] ' Nay , ' said [I]0-i , ' that would [I]0-i not . Yet , if any needs must be ill , ' twere easier to tend [the holy Ladies]332-the holy ladies in [[their]332-the holy ladies cells]299-their cells , than [the Poor]4220-the poor , in [humble homes]368-humble homes , outside [the Convent]328-the convent walls , tossing on beds of rushes . '

" ' Tush , [fool]4233-fool ! ' snarled [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress . "[4220-the poor] ' [The Poor]4220-the poor are not easily made ill . '

" [Tush]97-tush indeed ! [I]4220-the poor tell [thee]4234-thee , [little bright - eyed man]4235-little bright - eyed man , [old Antony]85-mary antony , can ' tush ' to better purpose ! That night there were strong purging herbs in the broth of [Mother Sub - Prioress]324-mother sub - prioress . Yet [she]324-mother sub - prioress did but keep [her]324-mother sub - prioress bed for one day . Like [the Poor]4220-the poor , [she]324-mother sub - prioress is not easily made ill ! . . . Well , have [thy]4234-thee way ; only peck not [my]4220-the poor fingers , [Master Robin]98-master robin , or [I]4220-the poor will have [thee]4234-thee flogged through the Tything at the cart - tail , as was done to [a certain pieman]4238-a certain pieman , whose history [I]4220-the poor will now relate .[4220-the poor]

" Once upon a time , when [Sister Mary Antony]85-mary antony was young , and fair to look upon Nay , wink not [thy]4234-thee naughty eye "[4220-the poor]

At that moment came the sound of a key turning slowly in the lock of the door at the bottom of the steps leading from [the crypt]273-the crypt to [the cloister]286-the cloister .

CHAPTER III

[THE PRIORESS]373-the prioress PASSES

A key turned slowly in the lock of the oaken door at the entrance to [the underground way]374-the underground way .

[The old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister seized [her]264-the old lay - sister wallet and pulled out the bag of peas .

Below , the heavy door swung back upon its hinges .

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony dropped upon [her]85-mary antony knees to the right of the steps , [her]85-mary antony hands hidden beneath [her]85-mary antony scapulary , [her]85-mary antony eyes bent in lowly reverence upon the sunlit flagstones , [her]85-mary antony lips mumbling chance sentences from the Psalter .

The measured sound of softly moving feet drew near , slightly shuffling as [they]376-they reached the steps and began to mount , up from the mile - long darkness , into the sunset light .

First to appear was [a young lay - sister , carrying a lantern]377-a young lay - sister , carrying a lantern . Hastening up the steps , [she]264-the old lay - sister extinguished the flame , grown sickly in the sunshine , placed the lantern in a niche , and , dropping upon [her]264-the old lay - sister knees , opposite old [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , sought to join in [the latter]378-the latter 's pious recitations .

" Adhaesit pavimento anima mea , "[85-mary antony] chanted [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . " Wherefore are [the holy Ladies]332-the holy ladies late to - day ? "[85-mary antony]

" [One]4240-one fell to weeping in the darkness , "[379-the young lay - sister] intoned [the young lay - sister]379-the young lay - sister , " whereupon [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress caused all to stand still while [she]91-mother sub - prioress strove , by the light of [my]379-the young lay - sister lantern held high , to discover [who had burst forth with a sob]4241-who had burst forth with a sob . None shewing traces of tears , [she]91-mother sub - prioress gave [me]379-the young lay - sister back the lantern , [herself]373-the prioress walking last in the line , as all moved on . "[379-the young lay - sister]

" Convertentur ad vesperam , and the devil catch the hindmost , "[85-mary antony] chanted [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , with fervour .

" Amen , "[99-sister abigail] intoned [Sister Abigail]99-sister abigail , eyes bent upon the ground ; for the tall figure of [the Prioress , mounting the steps]380-the prioress , mounting the steps , now came into view .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress passed up [the cloister]286-the cloister with a stately grace of motion which , even beneath the heavy cloth of [her]373-the prioress white robe , revealed the noble length of supple limbs . [Her]373-the prioress arms hung by [her]373-the prioress sides , swaying gently as [she]373-the prioress walked . There was a look of strength and of restfulness about the long fingers and beautifully moulded hands . [Her]373-the prioress face , calm and purposeful , was lifted to the sunlight . Suffering and sorrow had left thereon indelible marks ; but the clear grey eyes , beneath level brows , were luminous with a light betokening the victory of a pure and noble spirit over [passionate and most human flesh]383-passionate and most human flesh .

[No sinner]384-no sinner , in [her]373-the prioress presence , ever felt crushed by hopeless weight of sin ; [no saint]385-no saint , before the gaze of [her]373-the prioress calm eyes , felt sure of being altogether faultless .

So truly was [[she]373-the prioress woman]386-she woman , that all humanity seemed lifted to [her]373-the prioress level ; so completely was [she]373-the prioress [saint]387-saint , that sin did slink away abashed before [her]373-the prioress coming .

[They]388-they who feared [her]373-the prioress most , were most conscious of [her]373-the prioress kindness . [They]388-they who loved [her]373-the prioress best , were least able to venture near .

In the first bloom of [her]373-the prioress womanhood [she]373-the prioress had left [the world]389-the world , resigning high rank , [fair lands]390-fair lands , and the wealth which makes for power . [Her]373-the prioress faith in human love having been rudely shattered , [she]373-the prioress had sought security in Divine compassion , and consolation in the daily contemplation of [the Man of Sorrows]391-the man of sorrows . In [[her]373-the prioress cell]321-her cell , on a rough wooden cross , hung a life - size figure of [the dying Saviour]393-the dying saviour .

[She]373-the prioress had not reached [her]373-the prioress twenty - fifth year when , fleeing from [the world]389-the world , [she]373-the prioress joined [the Order of [the White Ladies of [Worcester]1-worcester]283-the white ladies of worcester]395-the order of the white ladies of worcester , and passed into the seclusion and outward calm of [[the Nunnery]397-the nunnery at [Whytstone]3-whytstone]398-the nunnery at whytstone .

Five years later , on the death of [the aged Prioress]399-the aged prioress , [she]373-the prioress was elected , by [a large majority]400-a large majority , to fill [the vacant place]401-the vacant place .

[She]373-the prioress had now , during two years , ruled [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery wisely and well .

[She]373-the prioress had ruled [her]373-the prioress own spirit , even better . [She]373-the prioress had won the victory over [the World]389-the world and [the Flesh]100-the flesh ; there remained but [the Devil]404-the devil . [The Devil]101-the devil , alas , always remains .

As [she]373-the prioress moved , with uplifted brow and mien of calm detachment , along [the sunlit cloister]405-the sunlit cloister to [the lofty , stone passage]406-the lofty , stone passage , within , [the Convent]328-the convent , [she]373-the prioress was feared by [many]408-many , loved by [most]409-most , and obeyed by [all]410-all .

And , as [she]373-the prioress passed , [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony , bowing almost to the ground , dropped a large white pea , from between [her]85-mary antony right thumb and finger , into the horny palm of [her]85-mary antony left hand .

Behind [the Prioress]373-the prioress there followed [a nun]412-a nun , tall also , but ungainly . [Her]373-the prioress short - sighted eyes peered shiftily to right and left ; [her]373-the prioress long nose went on before , scenting possible scandal and wrong - doing ; [her]373-the prioress weak lips let loose a ready smile , insinuating , crafty , apologetic . [She]373-the prioress walked with hands crossed upon [her]373-the prioress breast , in attitude of adoration and humility . As [she]373-the prioress moved by , old [Mary Antony]85-mary antony let drop the pale and speckled pea .

Keeping [their]413-their distances , mostly with shrouded faces , bent heads , and folded hands , [all the White Ladies]414-all the white ladies passed .

[Each]415-each went in silence to [[her]373-the prioress cell]321-her cell , there kneeling in prayer and contemplation until the Refectory bell should call to the evening meal .

As [the last , save one]417-the last , save one , went by , the keen eyes of [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister noted that [her]373-the prioress hands were clenched against [her]373-the prioress breast , that [she]373-the prioress stumbled at the topmost step , and caught [her]373-the prioress breath with a half sob .

Behind [her]373-the prioress , moving quickly , came the spare form of [the Sub - Prioress]419-the sub - prioress , ferret - faced , alert , vigilant ; fearful lest sin should go unpunished ; wishful to be [the punisher]420-the punisher .

[She]373-the prioress must have heard the half - strangled sob burst from [the slight figure stumbling up the steps before [her]373-the prioress]421-the slight figure stumbling up the steps before her , had not [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony been suddenly moved at that moment to uplift [her]85-mary antony voice in a cracked and raucous " Amen . "[85-mary antony]

Startled , and vexed at being startled , [the Sub - Prioress]419-the sub - prioress turned upon [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . " Peace , [woman]4226-woman ! "[419-the sub - prioress] [she]419-the sub - prioress said . " [The Convent cloister]263-the convent cloister is not [a hen - yard]4244-a hen - yard . Such ill - timed devotion well - nigh merits penance . Rise from [thy]85-mary antony knees , and go at once about [thy]85-mary antony business . "[419-the sub - prioress]

[The Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress hastened on .

Scowling darkly , [old Antony]85-mary antony bent forward , looking , past [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , up [the cloister]286-the cloister to [the distant passage]424-the distant passage . [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine had reached [[her]102-sister seraphine cell]321-her cell . The door was shut .

[Old Antony]103-mary antony 's knees creaked as [she]103-mary antony arose , but [her]103-mary antony wizened face was once more cheerful .

" [Beans]104-beans in [her]103-mary antony broth to - night , "[103-mary antony] [she]103-mary antony said . " One for ' [woman]4226-woman ' ; another for [the hen - yard]4246-the hen - yard ; a third for threatening penance when [I]103-mary antony did but chant a melodious ' Amen . ' [I]103-mary antony 'll give [her]103-mary antony beans castor beans ! "[103-mary antony]

Down the steps [she]103-mary antony went , pushed the heavy door to , locked it , and drew forth the key ; then turned [her]103-mary antony steps toward [the cell of [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother]426-the cell of the reverend mother .

On [her]103-mary antony way thither , [she]103-mary antony paused at a certain door and listened , [her]103-mary antony ear against the oaken panel . Then [she]103-mary antony hurried onward , knocked upon the door of [[the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's cell]428-the reverend mother 's cell and , being bidden to enter , passed within , closed the door behind [her]103-mary antony , and dropped upon [her]103-mary antony knees .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress stood beside the casement , gazing at the golden glory of the sunset . [She]373-the prioress was , for the moment , unconscious of [her]373-the prioress surroundings . [Her]373-the prioress mind was away behind those crimson battlements .

Presently [she]373-the prioress turned and saw [the old woman]430-the old woman , kneeling at the door .

" How now , dear [Antony]85-mary antony ? "[430-the old woman] [she]430-the old woman said , kindly . " Get up ! Hang the key in its appointed place , and make [me]430-the old woman [thy]430-the old woman report . Have all returned ? As always , is all well ? "[430-the old woman]

[The old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister rose , hung the massive key upon a nail ; then came to the feet of [the Prioress]373-the prioress , and knelt again .

" [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , "[264-the old lay - sister] [she]264-the old lay - sister said , " [all who went forth]4247-all who went forth have returned . But all is not well . [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine is uttering wild cries in [[her]102-sister seraphine cell]321-her cell ; and much [I]264-the old lay - sister fear [me]264-the old lay - sister , [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress may pass by , and hear [her]102-sister seraphine . "[264-the old lay - sister]

The face of [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress grew stern and sad ; yet , withal , tender . [She]373-the prioress raised [the lay - sister]337-the lay - sister , and gently patted the old hands which trembled .

" Go [thy]430-the old woman ways , [dear Antony]85-mary antony , "[430-the old woman] [she]430-the old woman said . " [I]373-the prioress [myself]373-the prioress will visit [the little Sister]4249-the little sister in [[her]4249-the little sister cell]321-her cell . [None]315-none will attempt to enter while [I]373-the prioress am [there]333-there . "[373-the prioress] CHAPTER IV

" GIVE [ME]373-the prioress TENDERNESS , "[373-the prioress] [SHE]373-the prioress SAID

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress knelt before a marble group of [the Virgin and Child , placed where the rays of evening sunshine , entering through the western casement]434-the virgin and child , placed where the rays of evening sunshine , entering through the western casement , played over its white beauty , shedding a radiance on the pure face of [the Madonna]435-the madonna , and a halo of golden glory around [the Infant Christ]105-christ .

" [Mother of God]89-god , "[373-the prioress] prayed [the Prioress]373-the prioress , with folded hands , " give [me]373-the prioress patience in dealing with wilfulness ; grant [me]373-the prioress wisdom to cope with unreason ; may it be given [me]373-the prioress to share the pain of this heart in torment , even as when [thou]4253-thou didst witness the sufferings of [[thy]4253-thou dear Son]4254-thy dear son , [[our]4255-our Lord]4256-our lord , on [Calvary]6-calvary a sword pierced through thine own soul also .[373-the prioress]

" Give [me]373-the prioress this gift of sympathy with suffering , though the cross be not [mine]373-the prioress own , but another 's .[373-the prioress]

" But give [me]373-the prioress firmness and authority : even as when [thou]4253-thou didst say to [the servants at [Cana]7-cana]4257-the servants at cana : ' Whatsoever [He]4258-he saith unto [you]4257-the servants at cana , do it . ' "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress waited , with bowed head .

Then , of a sudden [she]373-the prioress put forth [her]373-the prioress hand , and touched the marble foot of [the Babe]438-the babe .

" Give [me]373-the prioress tenderness , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said .

CHAPTER V

THE WAYWARD NUN

[Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine lay prone upon the floor of [[her]102-sister seraphine cell]321-her cell .

Tightly clenched in [her]102-sister seraphine hands were fragments of [her]102-sister seraphine torn veil .

[She]102-sister seraphine beat [her]102-sister seraphine knuckles upon the stones with rhythmic regularity ; then , when [her]102-sister seraphine arms would lift no longer , took up the measure with [her]102-sister seraphine toes , in wild imitation of a galloping horse .

As [she]102-sister seraphine lay , [she]102-sister seraphine repeated with monotonous reiteration : " Trappings of crimson , and silver bells : mane and tail , like foam of the waves ; a palfrey as white as snow ! "[102-sister seraphine]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress entered , closed the door behind [her]102-sister seraphine , and looked searchingly at [the prostrate figure]441-the prostrate figure ; then , lifting the master - key which hung from [her]102-sister seraphine girdle , locked the door on the inside .

[Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine had been silent long enough to hear the closing and locking of the door .

Now [she]102-sister seraphine started afresh .

" Trappings of crimson , and silver bells "[102-sister seraphine]

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress walked over to the narrow casement , and stood looking out at the rosy clouds wreathing a pale green sky .

" Oh ! . . . Oh ! . . . Oh ! . . . "[102-sister seraphine] wailed [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , writhing upon the floor ; " mane and tail , like foam of the waves ; a palfrey as white as snow ! "[102-sister seraphine]

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress watched [the swallows on swift wing , chasing flies in the evening light]442-the swallows on swift wing , chasing flies in the evening light .

So complete was the silence , that [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine notwithstanding that turning of the key in the lock fancied [she]102-sister seraphine must be alone .

" Trappings of crimson , and silver bells ! "[102-sister seraphine] [she]102-sister seraphine declaimed with vehemence ; then lifted [her]102-sister seraphine face to peep , and saw [the tall figure of [the Prioress standing at the casement]444-the prioress standing at the casement]443-the tall figure of the prioress standing at the casement .

Instantly , [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine dropped [her]102-sister seraphine head .

" Mane and tail , "[102-sister seraphine] [she]102-sister seraphine began then [her]102-sister seraphine courage failed ; the " foam of the waves "[444-the prioress standing at the casement] quavered into indecision ; and indecision , in such a case , is fatal .

For a while [she]102-sister seraphine lay quite still , moaning plaintively , then , of a sudden , quivered from head to foot , starting up alert , as if to listen .

" [Wilfred]106-wilfred ! "[102-sister seraphine] [she]102-sister seraphine shrieked ; " [Wilfred]106-wilfred ! Are [you]106-wilfred coming to save [me]102-sister seraphine ? "[102-sister seraphine]

Then [she]102-sister seraphine opened [her]102-sister seraphine eyes , and peeped again .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , wholly unmoved by the impending advent of " [Wilfred]106-wilfred , "[91-mother sub - prioress] stood at the casement , calmly watching the swallows .

[Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine began to weep .

At last the passionate sobbing ceased .

Unbroken silence reigned in [the cell]291-the cell .

From without , the latch of the door was lifted ; but the lock held .

Presently [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine dragged [herself]102-sister seraphine to the feet of [the Prioress]373-the prioress , seized the hem of [her]102-sister seraphine robe , and kissed it . Then [the Prioress]373-the prioress turned . [She]102-sister seraphine firmly withdrew [her]102-sister seraphine robe from those clinging hands ; yet looked , with eyes of tender compassion , upon [the kneeling figure at [her]102-sister seraphine feet]448-the kneeling figure at her feet .

" [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , "[102-sister seraphine] [she]102-sister seraphine said , " for [you]102-sister seraphine must shew true penitence e'er [I]102-sister seraphine can permit [you]102-sister seraphine to be called by [[our]4259-our Lady]4260-our lady 's name [you]102-sister seraphine will now come to [[my]102-sister seraphine cell]4261-my cell , where [I]102-sister seraphine will presently speak with [you]102-sister seraphine . "[102-sister seraphine]

[Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine instantly fell prone .

" [I]102-sister seraphine can not walk , "[102-sister seraphine] [she]102-sister seraphine said .

" [You]102-sister seraphine will not walk , "[373-the prioress] replied [the Prioress]373-the prioress , sternly . " [You]102-sister seraphine will travel upon [your]102-sister seraphine hands and knees . "[373-the prioress]

[She]102-sister seraphine crossed to the door , unlocked and set it wide .

" Moreover , "[102-sister seraphine] [she]102-sister seraphine added , from the doorway , " if [you]102-sister seraphine do not appear in [my]102-sister seraphine presence in reasonable time , [I]102-sister seraphine shall be constrained to send for [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress . "[102-sister seraphine]

[The cell of]450-the cell of [the Prioress]373-the prioress was situated at the opposite end of [the long , stone passage]452-the long , stone passage ; but in less than reasonable time , [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine crawled in .

The unwonted exercise had had a most salutary effect upon [her]102-sister seraphine frame of mind .

[Her]102-sister seraphine straight habit , of heavy cloth , had rendered progress upon [her]102-sister seraphine knees awkward and difficult . [Her]102-sister seraphine hands had become entangled in [her]102-sister seraphine torn veil . Each moment [she]102-sister seraphine had feared lest cell doors , on either side , should open ; [old Antony]85-mary antony might appear from the cloisters , or greatest disaster of all [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress might advance toward [her]102-sister seraphine from [the Refectory stairs]453-the refectory stairs ! In order to attain a greater rate of speed , [she]102-sister seraphine had tried lifting [her]102-sister seraphine knees , as [elephants]454-elephants lift [their]454-elephants feet . This mode of progress , though ungainly , had proved efficacious ; but would have been distinctly mirth - provoking to [beholders]455-beholders . The stones had hurt [her]102-sister seraphine hands and knees far more than [she]102-sister seraphine hurt them when [she]102-sister seraphine beat upon the floor of [[her]102-sister seraphine own cell]287-her own cell .

[She]102-sister seraphine arrived at [the [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's footstool]457-the reverend mother 's footstool , heated in mind and body , ashamed of [herself]102-sister seraphine , vexed with [her]102-sister seraphine garments , in fact in an altogether saner frame of mind than when [she]102-sister seraphine had called upon " [Wilfred]106-wilfred , "[102-sister seraphine] and made reiterated mention of trappings of crimson and silver bells .

Perhaps [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress had foreseen this result , when [she]102-sister seraphine imposed the penance . Leniency or sympathy , at that moment , would have been fatal and foolish ; and had not [the Prioress]373-the prioress made special petition for wisdom ?

[She]102-sister seraphine was seated at [her]102-sister seraphine table , when [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine bumped and shuffled into view . [She]102-sister seraphine did not raise [her]102-sister seraphine eyes from the illuminated missal [she]102-sister seraphine was studying . One hand lay on the massive clasp , the other rested in readiness to turn the page . [Her]102-sister seraphine noble form seemed stately calm personified .

When [she]102-sister seraphine heard [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine panting close to [her]102-sister seraphine foot , [she]102-sister seraphine spoke ; still without lifting [her]102-sister seraphine eyes .

" [You]102-sister seraphine may rise to [your]102-sister seraphine feet , "[102-sister seraphine] [she]102-sister seraphine said , " and shut to the door . "[102-sister seraphine]

Then the waiting hand turned the page , and silence fell .

" [You]102-sister seraphine may arrange the disorder of [your]102-sister seraphine dress , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , and turned another page .

When at length [she]102-sister seraphine looked up , [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , clothed and apparently in [her]102-sister seraphine right mind , stood humbly near the door .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress closed the book , and shut the heavy clasps .

Then [she]373-the prioress pointed to an oaken stool , signing to [the nun]461-the nun to draw it forward .

" Be seated , [[my]373-the prioress child]4262-my child , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , in tones of infinite tenderness . " There is much which must now be said , and [your]102-sister seraphine mind will pay better heed , if [your]102-sister seraphine body be at rest . "[373-the prioress]

With [her]373-the prioress steadfast eyes [the Prioress]373-the prioress searched the pretty , flushed face , swollen with weeping , and now gathering a look of petulant defiance , thinly veiled beneath surface humility .

" What was the cause of this outburst , [[my]373-the prioress child]4262-my child ? "[373-the prioress] asked [the Prioress]373-the prioress , very gently .

" While in [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , up in [[our]4265-our gallery]4266-our gallery , [I]373-the prioress , being placed not far from a window , heard , in a moment of silence , the neighing of a horse in [the street]4267-the street without . It was like to the neighing of [mine]373-the prioress own lovely palfrey , waiting in [the castle court]4268-the castle court at [home]305-home , until [I]373-the prioress should come down and mount [him]4270-him . Each time that steed neighed , [I]373-the prioress could see [Snowflake]107-snowflake more clearly , in trappings of gay crimson , with silver bells , amid many others prancing impatiently , champing [their]4271-their bits as [they]4271-their waited ; for it pleased [me]373-the prioress to come out last , when [all]410-all were mounted . Then [the riders]4273-the riders lifted [their]4273-the riders plumed caps when [I]373-the prioress appeared , while [Wilfred]106-wilfred , pushing [my]373-the prioress page aside , did swing [me]373-the prioress into the saddle . Thus , with shouting and laughter and winding of horn , [we]4274-we would all ride out to the hunt or the tourney ; [I]373-the prioress first , on Snowflake ; [Wilfred]106-wilfred , close behind . "[373-the prioress]

Very quietly [the Prioress]373-the prioress sat listening . [She]373-the prioress did not take [her]373-the prioress eyes from the flushed face . A slight colour tinged [her]373-the prioress own cheeks .

" Who was [Wilfred]106-wilfred ? "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress asked , when [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine paused for breath .

" [[My]373-the prioress cousin]4275-my cousin , whom [I]373-the prioress should have [we]4274-we d if "[373-the prioress]

" If ? "[373-the prioress]

" If [I]373-the prioress had not left [the world]389-the world . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress considered this .

" If [your]373-the prioress heart was set upon wedding [[your]373-the prioress cousin]4277-your cousin , [[my]373-the prioress child]4262-my child , why did [you]373-the prioress profess a vocation and , renouncing all worldly and carnal desires , gain admission to [our]4274-we sacred Order ? "[373-the prioress]

" [My]102-sister seraphine heart was not set on marrying [[my]102-sister seraphine cousin]4275-my cousin ! "[102-sister seraphine] cried [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , with petulance . " [I]102-sister seraphine was weary of [Wilfred]106-wilfred . [I]102-sister seraphine was weary of everything ! [I]102-sister seraphine wanted to profess . [I]102-sister seraphine wished to become [a nun]412-a nun . There were [people]4281-people [I]102-sister seraphine could punish , and [people]4281-people [I]102-sister seraphine could surprise , better so , than in any other way . But [Wilfred]106-wilfred said that , when the time came , [he]106-wilfred would be there to carry [me]102-sister seraphine off . "[102-sister seraphine]

" And when the time came ? "[373-the prioress]

" [He]106-wilfred was not there . [I]102-sister seraphine never saw [him]106-wilfred again . "[102-sister seraphine]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress turned , and looked out through the oriel window . [She]373-the prioress seemed to be weighing , carefully , what [she]373-the prioress should say .

When at length [she]373-the prioress spoke , [she]373-the prioress kept [her]373-the prioress eyes fixed upon the waving tree - tops beyond [the Convent wall]357-the convent wall .

" [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " [many who embrace the religious life]4283-many who embrace the religious life , know what it is to pass through the experience [you]4284-you have now had ; but , as a rule , [they]4283-many who embrace the religious life fight the temptation and conquer it in the secret of [their]4283-many who embrace the religious life own hearts , in the silence of [[their]4283-many who embrace the religious life own cells]4285-their own cells .[373-the prioress]

" Memories of the life that was , before , choosing the better part , [we]4286-us left [the world]389-the world , come back to haunt [us]4286-us , with a wanton sweetness . Such memories can not change the state , fixed forever by [our]4286-us vows ; but they may awaken in [us]4286-us vain regrets or worldly longings . Therein lies [their]4283-many who embrace the religious life sinfulness .[373-the prioress]

" To help [you]4284-you against this danger , [I]373-the prioress will now give [you]4284-you two prayers , which [you]4284-you must commit to memory , and repeat whenever need arises . The first is from the Breviary . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress drew toward [her]373-the prioress a black book with silver clasps , opened it , and read therefrom a short prayer in Latin . But seeing no light of response or of intelligence upon the face of [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , [she]373-the prioress slowly repeated a translation .

Almighty and [Everlasting God]108-everlasting god , grant that [our]469-our wills be ever meekly subject to [Thy]470-thy will , and [our]469-our hearts be ever honestly ready to serve [Thee]470-thy . Amen .

[Her]373-the prioress eyes rested , with a wistful smile , upon the book .

" This prayer might suffice , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " if [our]469-our hearts were truly honest , if [our]469-our wills were ever yielded . But , alas , [our]469-our hearts are deceitful above all things , and [our]469-our wills are apt to turn traitor to [our]469-our good intentions .[373-the prioress]

" Therefore [I]373-the prioress have found for [you]470-thy , in the Gregorian Sacramentary , another prayer less well - known , yet much more ancient , written over six hundred years ago . It deals effectually with the deceitful heart , the insidious , tempting thoughts , and the unstable will . Here is a translation which [I]373-the prioress have [myself]373-the prioress inscribed upon the margin . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress laid [her]373-the prioress folded hands upon the missal and as [she]373-the prioress repeated the ancient sixth - century prayer , in all its depth of inspired simplicity , [her]373-the prioress voice thrilled with deep emotion , for [she]373-the prioress was giving to another that which had meant infinitely much to [her]373-the prioress own inner life .

[Almighty God]109-god , unto Whom all hearts be open , all desires known , and from Whom no secrets are hid : Cleanse the thoughts of [our]469-our hearts by the inspiration of [Thy]470-thy Holy Spirit , that [we]469-our may perfectly love [Thee]470-thy , and worthily magnify [Thy]470-thy Holy Name , through Christ [[our]469-our Lord]4256-our lord . Amen .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress turned [her]373-the prioress face from [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine 's unresponsive countenance and fixed [her]373-the prioress eyes once more upon the tree - tops . [She]373-the prioress was thinking of the long years of secret conflict , known only to [Him]4256-our lord from Whom no secrets are hid ; of the constant cleansing of [her]373-the prioress thoughts , for which [she]373-the prioress had so earnestly pleaded ; of the fear lest [she]373-the prioress should never worthily magnify that Holy Name .

Presently [her]373-the prioress heart filled with humble tenderness [she]373-the prioress turned to [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine . " These prayers , [[my]373-the prioress child]4262-my child , which [you]4262-my child will commit to memory before [you]4262-my child sleep this night , will protect [you]4262-my child from a too insistent recollection of [the world]389-the world [you]4262-my child have resigned ; and will assist [you]4262-my child , with real inward thoroughness , to die daily to self , in order that the Holy Name of [[our]4290-our dear Lord]4291-our dear lord may be more worthily magnified in [you]4262-my child . "[373-the prioress]

But , alas ! this gentle treatment , these long silences , this quiet recitation of holy prayers , had but stirred the naughty spirit in [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine .

[Her]102-sister seraphine shallow nature failed to understand the deeps of the noble heart , dealing thus tenderly with [her]102-sister seraphine . [She]102-sister seraphine measured its ocean - wide greatness , by the little artificial runnels of [her]102-sister seraphine own morbid emotions . [She]102-sister seraphine mistook gentleness for weakness ; calm self - control , for lack of strength of will . [Her]102-sister seraphine wholesome awe of [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress was forgotten .

" But [I]102-sister seraphine do not want to die ! "[102-sister seraphine] [she]102-sister seraphine exclaimed . " [I]102-sister seraphine want to live to live to live ! "[102-sister seraphine]

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress looked up , astonished .

The surface humility had departed from the swollen countenance of [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine . The petulant defiance was plainly visible . " Kneel ! "[373-the prioress] commanded [the Prioress]373-the prioress , with authority .

[The wayward nun]475-the wayward nun jerked down upon [her]475-the wayward nun knees , upsetting the stool behind [her]475-the wayward nun .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress made a quick movement , then restrained [herself]91-mother sub - prioress . [She]91-mother sub - prioress had prayed for patience in dealing with wilfulness .

" [We]4292-we die that [we]4292-we may live , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress said , solemnly . " [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , this is the lesson [your]102-sister seraphine wayward heart must learn . Dying to self , [we]4292-we live unto [God]109-god . Dying to sin , [we]4292-we live unto righteousness . Dying to [the world]389-the world , [we]4292-we find the Life Eternal . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

On [her]102-sister seraphine knees upon the floor , [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine felt [her]102-sister seraphine position to be such as lent itself to pathos .

" But [I]102-sister seraphine want to live to [the world]389-the world ! "[102-sister seraphine] [she]102-sister seraphine cried , and burst into tears .

Now Convent life does not tend to further individual grief . Constant devout contemplation of the Supreme Sorrow which wrought [the world]389-the world 's salvation lessens the inclination to shed tears of self - pity .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress was startled and alarmed by the pathetic sobs of [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine . [This young nun]478-this young nun had but lately been sent on to [the Nunnery at [Whytstone]3-whytstone]398-the nunnery at whytstone from [a convent at [Tewkesbury]8-tewkesbury in which [she]478-this young nun had served [her]478-this young nun novitiate]480-a convent at tewkesbury in which she had served her novitiate , and taken [her]478-this young nun final vows . [The Prioress]373-the prioress now realised how little [she]373-the prioress knew of the inner working of the mind of [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , and blamed [herself]373-the prioress for having looked upon the outward appearance rather than upon the heart , taken too much for granted , and relied too entirely upon the reports of [others]482-others . [Her]373-the prioress sense of failure , toward [the Community]483-the community in general , and toward [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine in particular , lent [her]373-the prioress a fresh stock of patience .

[She]373-the prioress raised [the weeping nun]484-the weeping nun from the floor , put [her]373-the prioress arm around [her]484-the weeping nun , with protective gesture , and led [her]484-the weeping nun before [the Shrine of [the Madonna]435-the madonna]485-the shrine of the madonna .

" [[My]373-the prioress child]4262-my child , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " there are things [we]4296-we are called upon to suffer which [we]4296-we can best tell to [[our]4296-we blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady , [herself]4297-our blessed lady . Try to unburden [your]4262-my child heart and find comfort . . . Does [your]4262-my child mind hark back to the thought of the earthly love [you]4262-my child resigned in order to give [yourself]4262-my child solely to the heavenly ? . . . Are [you]4262-my child troubled by fears lest [you]4262-my child wronged [the man [you]4262-my child loved]4298-the man you loved , when , leaving [him]4298-the man you loved , [you]4262-my child became [the bride of Heaven]4299-the bride of heaven ? "[373-the prioress]

[Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine smiled a scornful little smile . " Nay , "[102-sister seraphine] [she]102-sister seraphine said , " [I]102-sister seraphine was weary of [Wilfred]106-wilfred . But there were [others]482-others . "[102-sister seraphine]

The voice of [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress grew even graver , and more sad .

" Is it then the Fact of marriage which [you]91-mother sub - prioress desired and regret ? "[91-mother sub - prioress]

[Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine laughed a hard , self - conscious , little laugh .

" Nay , [I]102-sister seraphine could not have brooked to be bound to [any man]4301-any man . But [I]102-sister seraphine liked to be loved , and [I]102-sister seraphine liked to be First in the thought and heart of another . "[102-sister seraphine]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress looked at the pretty , tear - stained face , at the softly moulded form . Then an idea came to [her]373-the prioress . To voice it , lifted the veil from the very Holy of Holies of [her]373-the prioress own heart 's sufferings ; but [she]373-the prioress would not shrink from aught which could help this soul [she]373-the prioress was striving to uplift .

With [her]373-the prioress eyes resting upon the Babe in the arms of [the Virgin Mother]488-the virgin mother , [she]373-the prioress asked , gravely and low :

" Is it the ceaseless longing to have had [a little child of [your]91-mother sub - prioress own]4302-a little child of your own to hold in [your]91-mother sub - prioress arms , to gather to [your]91-mother sub - prioress breast , to put to sleep upon [your]91-mother sub - prioress knees , which keeps [your]91-mother sub - prioress heart turning restlessly back to [the world]389-the world ? "[373-the prioress]

[Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine gazed at [the Prioress]373-the prioress , in utter amazement .

" Nay , then , indeed ! "[102-sister seraphine] [she]102-sister seraphine replied , impatiently . " Always have [I]102-sister seraphine hated [children]4304-children . To escape from the vexations of motherhood were reason enough for leaving [the world]389-the world . "[102-sister seraphine]

Then [the Prioress]373-the prioress withdrew [her]373-the prioress protective arm , and looked sternly upon [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine . " [You]91-mother sub - prioress are playing false to [your]91-mother sub - prioress vows , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said ; " [you]91-mother sub - prioress are slighting [your]91-mother sub - prioress vocation ; yet no worthy or noble feeling draws [your]91-mother sub - prioress heart back to [the world]389-the world . [You]91-mother sub - prioress do but desire vain pomp and show ; all those things which minister to the enthronement of self . Return to [[your]91-mother sub - prioress cell]4307-your cell and spend three hours in prayer and penitence before the crucifix . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress lifted [her]373-the prioress hand and pointed to the figure of [the Christ]492-the christ , hanging upon the great rugged cross against the wall , facing the door . The sublimity of a supreme adoration was in [her]373-the prioress voice , as [she]373-the prioress made [her]373-the prioress last appeal .

" Surely , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , ' surely no love of self can live , in view of the death and sacrifice of [[our]493-our blessed Lord]494-our blessed lord ! Kneel then before the crucifix and learn "[373-the prioress]

But the over - wrought mind of [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , suddenly convinced of the futility of its hopeless rebellion , passed , in that moment , altogether beyond control .

With a shout of wild laughter , [she]373-the prioress flung back [her]373-the prioress head , pointing with outstretched finger at the crucifix .

" Death ! Death ! Death ! "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress shrieked , " helpless , hopeless , terrible ! [I]373-the prioress ask for life , [I]373-the prioress want to live ; [I]373-the prioress am young , [I]373-the prioress am gay , [I]373-the prioress am beautiful . And [they]4308-they bid bid bid [me]373-the prioress kneel long hours watching death . "[373-the prioress] [Her]373-the prioress voice rose to a piercing scream . " Ah , HA ! That will [I]373-the prioress NOT ! [A dead God]4309-a dead god can not help [me]373-the prioress ! [I]373-the prioress want life , not death ! "[373-the prioress] Shrieking [she]373-the prioress leapt to [her]373-the prioress feet , flew across [the room]495-the room , beat upon the sacred Form with [her]373-the prioress fists ; tore at It with [her]373-the prioress fingers .

One instant of petrifying horror . Then [the Prioress]373-the prioress was upon [her]373-the prioress .

Seizing [her]373-the prioress by both wrists [she]373-the prioress flung [her]373-the prioress to the floor , then pulled a rope passing over a pulley in the wall , which started the great alarm - bell , in [the passage]497-the passage , clanging wildly .

At once there came a rush of flying feet ; calls for [the Sub - Prioress]419-the sub - prioress ; but [she]419-the sub - prioress was already there .

When [they]499-they flung wide the door , lo , [the Prioress]373-the prioress stood with white face and blazing eyes , [her]373-the prioress arms outstretched between [them]499-they and the crucifix .

Upon the floor , a crumpled heap , lay [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine .

[The nuns]298-the nuns , in [a frightened crowd]502-a frightened crowd , filled the doorway , none daring to speak , or to enter ; till [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony , pushing past [the Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , kneeled down beside [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , and , lifting the hem of [her]85-mary antony robe , kissed it and pressed it to [her]85-mary antony breast .

Slowly [the Prioress]373-the prioress let fall [her]373-the prioress arms .

" Enter , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said ; and [they]298-the nuns flocked in .

" [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , in awful tones , " has profaned the crucifix , reviling [[our]298-the nuns blessed Lord]494-our blessed lord , Who hangs thereon . "[373-the prioress]

[All the nuns]505-all the nuns , falling upon [their]505-all the nuns knees , hid [their]505-all the nuns faces in [their]505-all the nuns hands .

There was a terrifying quality in the silence of the next moments .

Slowly [the Prioress]373-the prioress turned , prostrated [herself]373-the prioress at the foot of the cross , and laid [her]373-the prioress forehead against the floor at its base . Then [the nuns]298-the nuns heard one deep , shuddering sob .

Not a head was lifted . [The only nun who peeped]508-the only nun who peeped was [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , prone upon the floor . After a while , [the Prioress]373-the prioress arose , pale but calm .

" Carry [her]102-sister seraphine to [[her]102-sister seraphine cell]321-her cell , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said .

[Two tall nuns to whom [she]373-the prioress made sign lifted [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine]510-two tall nuns to whom she made sign lifted sister seraphine , and bore [her]102-sister seraphine out .

When the shuffling of [their]510-two tall nuns to whom she made sign lifted sister seraphine feet died away in the distance , [the Prioress]373-the prioress gave further commands . " [All]410-all will now go to [[their]410-all cells]299-their cells and kneel in adoration before the crucifix . Doors are to be left standing wide . [The Miserere]4314-the miserere is to be chanted , until the ringing of the Refectory bell . [Mother Sub - Prioress]324-mother sub - prioress will remain behind . "[373-the prioress]

[The nuns]298-the nuns dispersed , as quickly as [they]298-the nuns had gathered ; seeking [[their]298-the nuns cells]299-their cells , like frightened birds fleeing before a gathering storm .

[The tall nuns who had carried [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine]514-the tall nuns who had carried sister seraphine returned and waited outside [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's door .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress stood alone ; [a tragic figure in [her]91-mother sub - prioress grief]515-a tragic figure in her grief .

[Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress drew near . [Her]91-mother sub - prioress narrow face , peering from out [her]91-mother sub - prioress veil , more than ever resembled a ferret . [Her]91-mother sub - prioress small eyes gleamed with a merciless light .

" Is [mine]91-mother sub - prioress the task , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother ? "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress whispered .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress inclined [her]91-mother sub - prioress head .

[Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress murmured a second question .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress turned and looked at the crucifix .

" Yes , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress said , firmly .

[Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress sidled nearer ; then whispered [her]91-mother sub - prioress third question .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress did not answer . [She]373-the prioress was looking at the carved , oaken stool , overthrown . [She]373-the prioress was wondering whether [she]373-the prioress could have acted with better judgment , spoken more wisely . [Her]373-the prioress heart was sore . Such noble natures ever blame [themselves]517-themselves for the wrong - doing of [the worthless]518-the worthless .

Receiving no reply , [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress whispered a suggestion .

" No , "[91-mother sub - prioress] said [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress .

[Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress modified [her]91-mother sub - prioress suggestion .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress turned and looked at the tender figure of [the Madonna]435-the madonna , brooding over [the blessed Babe]520-the blessed babe .

" No , "[91-mother sub - prioress] said [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress .

[Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress frowned , and made a further modification ; but in tones which suggested finality .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress inclined [her]91-mother sub - prioress head .

[The Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , bowing low , lifted the hem of [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's veil , and kissed it ; then passed from [the room]495-the room .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress moved to the window .

The sunset was over . The evening star shone , like a newly - lighted lamp , in a pale purple sky . The fleet - winged swallows had gone to rest .

[Bats]110-bats flitted past the casement , like [homeless souls who know not where to go]523-homeless souls who know not where to go .

Low chanting began in [the cells]524-the cells ; [the nuns , with open doors]525-the nuns , with open doors , singing Miserere .

But , as [she]91-mother sub - prioress looked at the evening star , [the Prioress]373-the prioress heard again , with startling distinctness , the final profanity of poor [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine : " [I]102-sister seraphine want life not death ! "[102-sister seraphine]

Along [the corridor]527-the corridor passed a short procession , on [its]528-its way to [the cell of [Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine]529-the cell of mary seraphine . First went [a nun]412-a nun , carrying a lighted taper .

Next , [the two tall nuns who had borne [Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine to [[her]102-sister seraphine cell]321-her cell]531-the two tall nuns who had borne mary seraphine to her cell .

Behind [them]531-the two tall nuns who had borne mary seraphine to her cell , [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , holding something beneath [her]91-mother sub - prioress scapulary which gave to [her]91-mother sub - prioress more of a presence than [she]91-mother sub - prioress usually possessed .

Solemn and official , nay , almost sacrificial was [their]531-the two tall nuns who had borne mary seraphine to her cell measured shuffle , as [they]531-the two tall nuns who had borne mary seraphine to her cell moved along [the passage]497-the passage , and entered [the cell of [Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine]529-the cell of mary seraphine .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress closed [her]373-the prioress door , and , kneeling before the crucifix , implored forgiveness for the sacrilege which , all unwittingly , [she]373-the prioress had provoked .

[The nuns]298-the nuns , in [[their]298-the nuns separate cells]537-their separate cells , chanted the Miserere . But suddenly with one accord , [their]298-the nuns voices fell silent ; then hastened on , in uncertain , agitated rhythm .

[Old Mary Antony]103-mary antony below , playing [her]103-mary antony favourite game , also paused , and pricked up [her]103-mary antony ears : then filliped the wizen pea , which stood for [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , into the darkest corner , and hurried off to brew a soothing balsam .

So , when the Refectory bell had summoned all to the evening meal , [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister crept to [the cell of [Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , carrying broth and comfort]539-the cell of mary seraphine , carrying broth and comfort .

But [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine was better content than [she]102-sister seraphine had been for many weeks .

At last [she]102-sister seraphine had become the centre of attention ; and , although , during the visit of [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress to [[her]102-sister seraphine cell]321-her cell , this had been a peculiarly painful position to occupy , yet to the morbid mind of [Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , the position seemed worth the discomfort .

Therefore , [her]103-mary antony mind now purged of its discontent , [she]103-mary antony cheerfully supped [old Antony]103-mary antony 's broth , and applied the soothing balsam ; yet planning the while , to gain favour with [the Prioress]373-the prioress , by repeating to [her]103-mary antony , at the first convenient opportunity , the naughty remarks concerning [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , now being made for [her]103-mary antony diversion , by [the kind old woman who had risked reproof , in order to bring to [her]103-mary antony , in [her]103-mary antony disgrace , both food and consolation]542-the kind old woman who had risked reproof , in order to bring to her , in her disgrace , both food and consolation .

CHAPTER VI

[THE KNIGHT OF THE BLOODY VEST]543-the knight of the bloody vest

" Nay , [I]103-mary antony have naught for [thee]264-the old lay - sister this morning , "[103-mary antony] said [Mary Antony]103-mary antony to the robin ; " naught , that is , save spritely conversation . [I]103-mary antony can tell [thee]264-the old lay - sister a tale or two ; [I]103-mary antony can give [thee]264-the old lay - sister sage advice ; but , in [my]103-mary antony wallet , [little Master Mendicant]4316-little master mendicant , [I]103-mary antony have but [my]103-mary antony bag of peas . "[103-mary antony]

[The old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister sat resting in [the garden]358-the garden . [She]264-the old lay - sister had had a busy hour , yet complicated in its busy - ness , for , starting out to do weeding , [she]264-the old lay - sister had presently fancied [herself]264-the old lay - sister intent upon making a posy , and now , sat upon the stone seat beneath the beech tree , holding a large nosegay made up of many kinds of flowering weeds , arranged with much care , and bound round with convolvulus tendrils .

Keen and uncommon shrewd though [old Antony]103-mary antony certainly was in many ways , [her]264-the old lay - sister great age occasionally betrayed itself by childish vagaries . [Her]264-the old lay - sister mind would start off along the lines of a false premise , landing [her]264-the old lay - sister eventually in a dream - like conclusion . As now , when waking from a moment 's nodding in the welcome shade , [she]264-the old lay - sister wondered why [her]264-the old lay - sister old back seemed well - nigh broken , and marvelled to find [herself]264-the old lay - sister holding a big posy of dandelions , groundsel , plantain , and bindweed .

On the other end of the seat , stood the robin . The beech was just near enough to [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , [the pieman]547-the pieman 's tree , and [his]547-the pieman own particular yew hedge , to come within [[his]547-the pieman little kingdom]548-his little kingdom .

Having mentioned [her]264-the old lay - sister bag of peas , [Mary Antony]103-mary antony experienced an irresistible desire to view them and , moreover , to display them before the bright eyes of the robin .

[She]264-the old lay - sister laid the queer nosegay down upon the grass at [her]264-the old lay - sister feet , turned sidewise on the stone slab , and drew the bag from [her]264-the old lay - sister wallet .

" Now , [Master Pieman]111-master pieman ! "[264-the old lay - sister] [she]264-the old lay - sister said . " At thine own risk [thou]4317-thou doest it ; but with [thine]4317-thou own bright eyes [thou]4317-thou shalt see [the holy Ladies]332-the holy ladies ; the Unnamed , all like peas in a pod , as [the Lord]4319-the lord knows [they]332-the holy ladies do look , when [they]332-the holy ladies walk to and fro ; but first , if so be that [I]264-the old lay - sister can find [them]332-the holy ladies , the Few which [I]264-the old lay - sister distinguish from among the rest . "[264-the old lay - sister]

Presently , after much peering into the bag , the fine white pea , the wizened pea , and the pale and speckled pea , lay in line upon the stone .

" This , "[103-mary antony] explained [Mary Antony]103-mary antony , pointing , with knobby forefinger , to the first , " is [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , [Herself]427-the reverend mother large , and pure , and noble . . . . Nay , hop not too close , [Sir Redbreast]112-sir redbreast ! When [we]4321-we enter [[her]427-the reverend mother chamber]4322-her chamber [we]4321-we kneel at the threshold , till [she]427-the reverend mother bids [us]4321-we draw nearer . True , [we]4321-we are merely soberly - clad , [holy women]4323-holy women , whereas [thou]4317-thou art [a gay , gaudy man]4324-a gay , gaudy man ; bold - eyed , and , doubtless , steeped in sin . But even [thou]4317-thou must keep [thy]4317-thou distance , in presence of [this most Reverend Pea of great price]4325-this most reverend pea of great price .[103-mary antony]

" This , "[103-mary antony] indicating the shrivelled pea , " is [Mother Sub - Prioress , who would love to have the whipping of [thee]4317-thou]91-mother sub - prioress , [thou naughty little rascal]4326-thou naughty little rascal ![103-mary antony]

" This is [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca who daily grows more crooked , both in mind and body ; yet who ever sweetly smileth .[103-mary antony]

" Now will [I]103-mary antony show [thee]4317-thou , if so be that [I]103-mary antony can find [her]427-the reverend mother , [Sister Teresa]113-sister teresa , [a kindly soul]4327-a kindly soul and gracious , but with a sniff which may be heard in [the kitchens]4328-the kitchens when [that holy Lady]4329-that holy lady taketh [her]4329-that holy lady turn at the Refectory reading .
