And when , the reading over , having sniffed every other minute , [she]4329-that holy lady at length , feels free to blow , beshrew [me]103-mary antony , [Master Redbreast]114-master redbreast , one might think [our]4330-our old dun cow had just been parted from [a newly - born calf]4331-a newly - born calf . [Yea]4332-yea , [a kind , gracious soul]4333-a kind , gracious soul ; but noisy about the nose , and forgetful of the ears of [other people]4334-other people , [her]4329-that holy lady own necessity seeming excuse enough for veritable trumpet blasts . "[103-mary antony]

[Mary Antony]103-mary antony , half turning as [she]103-mary antony talked , peered into the open bag in search of [Sister Teresa]113-sister teresa .

Then , quick as thought , the unexpected happened .

Three rapid hops , a jerky bend of the red breast , a flash of wings

The robin had flown off with the white pea ! The shrivelled and the speckled alone remained upon the seat .

Uttering a cry of horror and dismay , [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister fell upon [her]264-the old lay - sister knees , lifting despairing hands to trees and sky .

Down by the lower wall , in earnest meditation , [the Prioress]373-the prioress moved back and forth , on the [Cypress Walk]9-cypress walk .

[Mary Antony]103-mary antony 's shriek of dismay , faint but unmistakable , reached [her]103-mary antony ears . Turning , [she]103-mary antony passed noiselessly up the green sward , on the further side of the yew hedge ; but paused , in surprise , as [she]103-mary antony drew level with the beech ; for [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister 's voice penetrated the hedge , and the first words [she]103-mary antony overheard seemed to [the Prioress]373-the prioress wholly incomprehensible .

" Ah , [[thou]103-mary antony Knight of the Bloody Vest]4335-thou knight of the bloody vest ! "[103-mary antony] moaned [Mary Antony]103-mary antony . " Heaven send [thy]103-mary antony wicked perfidy may fall on thine own pate ! Intruding thyself into [[our]4336-our most private places]4337-our most private places ; begging food , which could not be refused ; wheedling [old Mary Antony]103-mary antony into letting [thee]103-mary antony have a peep at the holy Ladies [thou]103-mary antony bold , [bad man]4338-bad man ! and then carrying off [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , [Herself]93-the reverend mother ! [Ha]4339-ha ! Hadst [thou]103-mary antony but caught away [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , [she]93-the reverend mother would have reformed [[thy]103-mary antony home]4340-thy home , whipped [[thy]103-mary antony children]4341-thy children , and mended [thine]103-mary antony own vile manners , [thou]103-mary antony graceless churl ! Or hadst [thou]103-mary antony taken [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , [she]93-the reverend mother would have brought the place about [thine]103-mary antony ears , telling [[thy]103-mary antony wife]4342-thy wife fine tales of thine unfaithfulness ; whispering that [Mary Antony]103-mary antony is younger and fairer than [she]90-sister mary rebecca . But , nay , forsooth ! Neither of these will do ! [Thou]103-mary antony must needs snatch away [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , [Herself]337-the lay - sister ! Oh , [sacrilegious fiend]4344-sacrilegious fiend ! Stand not there mocking [me]103-mary antony ! Where is [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother ? "[103-mary antony]

" Why , here am [I]373-the prioress , dear [Antony]103-mary antony , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , in soothing tones , coming quickly from behind the hedge .

One glance revealed , to [her]373-the prioress relief , that [the lay - sister]337-the lay - sister was alone . Tears ran down the furrows of [her]337-the lay - sister worn old face . [She]337-the lay - sister knelt upon the grass ; beside [her]337-the lay - sister a large nosegay of flowering weeds ; upon the seat , peas strewn from out a much - used , linen bag . Above [her]337-the lay - sister on a bough , a robin perched , bending to look , with roguish eye , at the scattered peas .

To [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress it seemed that indeed [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister must have taken leave of [her]337-the lay - sister senses .

Stooping , [she]337-the lay - sister tried to raise [her]264-the old lay - sister ; but [Mary Antony]103-mary antony , flinging [herself]103-mary antony forward , clasped and kissed [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's feet , in an abandonment of penitence and grief .

" Nay , rise , [dear Antony]103-mary antony , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , firmly . " Rise ! [I]373-the prioress command it . The day is warm . [Thou]4346-thou hast been dreaming . [No bold , bad man]4347-no bold , bad man has forced [his]4347-no bold , bad man way within these walls . [No ' Knight of the Bloody Vest]4348-no ' knight of the bloody vest ' is here . Rise up and look . [We]4349-we are alone . "[373-the prioress]

But [Mary Antony]103-mary antony , still on [her]103-mary antony knees , half raised [herself]103-mary antony , and , pointing to the bough above , quavered , amid [her]103-mary antony sobs : " [The bold , bad man]4350-the bold , bad man is there ! "[103-mary antony]

Looking up , [the Prioress]373-the prioress met the bright eye of the robin , peeping down .

Why , surely ? Yes ! There was the " Bloody Vest . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress smiled . [She]91-mother sub - prioress began to understand .

[The robin]339-the robin burst into a stream of triumphant song . At which , [old Mary Antony]103-mary antony , still kneeling , shook [her]103-mary antony uplifted fist . [The Prioress]373-the prioress raised and drew [her]103-mary antony to the seat .

" Now sit [thee]103-mary antony here beside [me]373-the prioress , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " and make full confession . Ease thine old heart by telling [me]373-the prioress the entire tale . Then [I]373-the prioress will pass sentence on [the robin]339-the robin if , true to [his]339-the robin name , [he]339-the robin turns out to be [a thief]4352-a thief . "[373-the prioress]

So there , in [the Convent garden]560-the convent garden , while [the robin]339-the robin sang overhead , [the Prioress]373-the prioress listened to the quaint recital ; the dread of making mistake in the daily counting ; the elaborate plan of dropping peas ; the manner in which the peas became identified with the personalities of [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies ; the games in [the cell]291-the cell ; the taming of the robin ; the habit of sharing with the little bird , interests which might not be shared with [others]482-others , which had resulted that morning in the display of the peas , and this undreamed of disaster the abduction of [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress listened with outward gravity , striving to conceal all signs of the inward mirth which seized and shook [her]373-the prioress . But more than once [she]373-the prioress had to turn [her]373-the prioress face from the peering eyes of [Mary Antony]103-mary antony , striving anxiously to gather whether [her]373-the prioress chronicle of sins was placing [her]373-the prioress outside the pale of possible forgiveness .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress did not hasten the recital . [She]373-the prioress knew the importance , to the mind with which [she]373-the prioress dealt , of even the most trivial detail . To be checked or hurried , would leave [Mary Antony]103-mary antony with the sense of an incomplete confession .

Therefore , with infinite patience [the Prioress]373-the prioress listened , seated in [the sunlit garden]570-the sunlit garden , undisturbed , save for the silent passing , once or twice , of a veiled figure through the cloisters , who , seeing [the Reverend Mother seated beneath the beech]571-the reverend mother seated beneath the beech , did reverence and hastened on , looking not again .

When [the garrulous old voice]572-the garrulous old voice at last fell silent , [the Prioress]373-the prioress , with kind hand , covered the restless fingers clasping and unclasping in anxious contortions and firmly held them in folded stillness .

[Her]373-the prioress first words were of a thing as yet unmentioned .

" [Dear Antony]115-dear antony , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " is that [thy]373-the prioress posy lying at [our]4353-our feet ? "[373-the prioress]

" Ah , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , "[264-the old lay - sister] sighed [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , " in this did [I]264-the old lay - sister again do wrong meaning to do right . [Sister Mary Augustine]116-sister mary augustine , coming into [the kitchens]4328-the kitchens with leave , from [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , to make the pasties , and desiring to be free to make them heavy unhampered by [my]264-the old lay - sister advice which , of a surety , would have helped [them]4355-them to lightness bade [me]264-the old lay - sister go out and weed [the garden]358-the garden .[264-the old lay - sister]

" Weeding , [I]373-the prioress bethought [me]373-the prioress how much liefer [I]373-the prioress would be gathering a posy of choicest flowers for [[[our]4353-our sweet Lady]4357-our sweet lady 's shrine]4358-our sweet lady 's shrine ; and , thus thinking , [I]373-the prioress began to do , not according to [Sister Mary Augustine]116-sister mary augustine 's hard task , but according to [mine]373-the prioress own heart 's promptings . Yet , when the posy was finished , alack - a - day ! it was a posy of weeds ! "[373-the prioress]

Tears filled the eyes of [the Prioress]373-the prioress ; at first [she]373-the prioress could not trust [her]373-the prioress voice to make reply .

Then , stooping [she]373-the prioress picked up the nosegay .

" [[Our]4353-our Lady]4260-our lady shall have it , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said . " [I]373-the prioress will place it before [[her]4260-our lady shrine]4360-her shrine , in [[mine]373-the prioress own cell]4361-mine own cell . [She]4260-our lady will understand knowing how often , though the hands perforce do weeding , yet , all the time , the heart is gathering choicest flowers .[373-the prioress]

" Aye , and sometimes when [we]4353-our bring to [God]109-god offerings of fairest flowers , [He]109-god sees but worthless weeds . And , when [we]4353-our mourn , because [we]4353-our have but weeds to offer , [He]109-god sees them fragrant blossoms . Whatever , to the eye of [man]4362-man , the hand may hold , [God]109-god sees therein the bouquet of the heart 's intention . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress paused , a look of great gladness on [her]373-the prioress face ; then , as [she]373-the prioress saw [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister still eyeing [her]373-the prioress posy with dissatisfaction : " And , after all , dear [Antony]115-dear antony , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " who shall decide which flowers shall be dubbed ' weeds ' ? [No plant of [His]109-god creation]4363-no plant of his creation , however humble , was called a ' weed ' by [the Creator]4364-the creator . When , for [man]4362-man 's sin , [He]109-god cursed [the ground]4366-the ground , [He]109-god said : ' Thorns also and thistles shall it cause to bud . ' Well ? Sharpest thorns are found around the rose ; the thistle is the royal bloom of [Scotland]10-scotland ; and , if [[our]4353-our old white ass]4367-our old white ass could speak [her]4367-our old white ass mind , doubtless [she]4367-our old white ass would call it King of Flowers .[373-the prioress]

" Nowhere in [Holy Books]11-holy books , is any plant named a ' weed . ' It is left to [man]4362-man to proclaim that the flowers [he]4362-man wants not , are weeds .[373-the prioress]

" Look at each one of these . Could [you]264-the old lay - sister or [I]373-the prioress , labouring for years , with all [our]4353-our skill , make anything so perfect as the meanest of these weeds ?[373-the prioress]

" Nay ; they are weeds , because they grow , there where they should not be . The gorgeous scarlet poppy is a weed amid the corn . If roses overgrew the wheat , [we]4353-our should dub them weeds , and root them out .[373-the prioress]

" And [some of [us]4353-our]4369-some of us have had , perforce , so to deal with the roses in [our]4353-our lives ; those sweet and fragrant things which overgrew [our]4353-our offering of the wheat of service , [our]4353-our sacrifice of praise and prayer .[373-the prioress]

" Perhaps , when [our]4353-our weeds are all torn out , and cast in a tangled heap before [His]4362-man Feet , [[our]4353-our Lord]4256-our lord beholds in [them]4371-them a garland of choice blossoms . The crown of thorns on earth , may prove , in Paradise , a diadem of flowers . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress laid the posy on the seat beside [her]373-the prioress .

" Now , [Antony]115-dear antony , about [thy]373-the prioress games with peas . There is no wrong in keeping count with peas of [those who daily walk to and from Vespers]4372-those who daily walk to and from vespers ; though , [I]373-the prioress admit , it seems to [me]373-the prioress , it were easier to count one , two , three , with folded hands , than to let fall the peas from one hand to the other , beneath [thy]373-the prioress scapulary . Howbeit , a method which would be but a pitfall to one , may prove a prop to another . So [I]373-the prioress give [thee]373-the prioress leave to continue to count with [thy]373-the prioress peas . Also the games in [[thy]373-the prioress cell]4373-thy cell are harmless , and lead [me]373-the prioress to think , as already [I]373-the prioress have sometimes thought , that games with balls or rings , something in which eye guides the hand , and mind the eye , might be helpful for all , on summer evenings .[373-the prioress]

" But [I]93-the reverend mother can not have [thee]373-the prioress take upon [thyself]373-the prioress to decide the future state of [the White Ladies]117-the white ladies . Who art [thou]373-the prioress , to send [me]93-the reverend mother to [Paradise]5-paradise with a fillip of thine old finger - nail , yet to keep [[our]4374-our excellent Sub - Prioress]4375-our excellent sub - prioress in Purgatory ? Shame upon [thee]373-the prioress , [Mary Antony]103-mary antony ! "[93-the reverend mother] But the sternness of [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's tone was belied by the merriment in [her]93-the reverend mother grey eyes .

" So no more of that , [[my]93-the reverend mother [Antony]103-mary antony]4376-my antony ; though , truth to tell , [thy]373-the prioress story gives [me]93-the reverend mother relief , answering a question [I]93-the reverend mother was meaning to put to [thee]373-the prioress . [I]93-the reverend mother heard , not an hour ago , that [Sister Antony]85-mary antony had boasted that with a turn of [her]85-mary antony thumb and finger [she]85-mary antony could , any night , send [Mother Sub - Prioress]324-mother sub - prioress to [Purgatory]12-purgatory . "[93-the reverend mother]

" Who said that of [me]85-mary antony ? "[85-mary antony] stuttered [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . " Who said it , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother ? "[85-mary antony] " A little bird , "[373-the prioress] murmured [the Prioress]373-the prioress . " A little bird , dear [Antony]85-mary antony ; but not [thy]373-the prioress pretty robin . Also , the boast was taken to mean poison in the broth of [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress . Hast [thou]373-the prioress ever put harmful things in the broth of [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress ? "[373-the prioress]

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony slipped to [her]85-mary antony knees .

" Only beans , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , castor beans ; and , when [her]85-mary antony temper was vilest , purging herbs . Nothing more , [I]118-hastily swear it ! [Old Antony]103-mary antony knows naught of poisons ; only of mixing balsams ah , ha ! and soothing ointments ! [[Our]4378-our blessed [Lady]4380-lady]4297-our blessed lady knows the tale is false . "[118-hastily]

[Hastily]118-hastily [the Prioress]373-the prioress lifted the nosegay and buried [her]373-the prioress face in bindweed and dandelions .

" [I]373-the prioress believe [thee]373-the prioress , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , in a voice not over steady . " Rise from [thy]373-the prioress knees . But , remember , [I]373-the prioress forbid [thee]373-the prioress to put aught into [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress 's broth , save things that soothe and comfort . Give [me]373-the prioress [thy]430-the old woman word for this , [Antony]85-mary antony . "[373-the prioress]

[The old woman]430-the old woman humbly lifted the hem of [the Prioress]373-the prioress 's robe , and pressed it to [her]430-the old woman lips .

" [I]430-the old woman promise , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , "[430-the old woman] [she]430-the old woman said , " and [I]430-the old woman do repent [me]430-the old woman of [my]430-the old woman sin . "[430-the old woman]

" Sit beside [me]373-the prioress , "[373-the prioress] commanded [the Prioress]373-the prioress . " [I]373-the prioress have more to say to [thee]373-the prioress . . . . Think not hard thoughts of [the Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress . [She]91-mother sub - prioress is stern , and extreme to mark what is done amiss , but this [she]91-mother sub - prioress conceives to be [her]91-mother sub - prioress duty . [She]91-mother sub - prioress is [a most pious Lady]4381-a most pious lady . [Her]91-mother sub - prioress zeal is but a sign of [her]91-mother sub - prioress piety . "[373-the prioress]

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's keen eyes , meeting those of [the Prioress]373-the prioress , twinkled .

Once again [the Prioress]373-the prioress took refuge in the posy . [She]373-the prioress was beginning to have had enough of the scent of dandelions .

" [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress is sick , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said . " The cold struck [her]91-mother sub - prioress last evening , after sunset , in [the orchard]4382-the orchard . [I]373-the prioress have bidden [her]91-mother sub - prioress to keep [her]91-mother sub - prioress bed awhile . [We]4383-we must tend [her]91-mother sub - prioress kindly , [Antony]85-mary antony , and help [her]91-mother sub - prioress back to health again .[373-the prioress]

" [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca is also sick , with pains in [her]91-mother sub - prioress bones and slight fever . [She]91-mother sub - prioress too keeps [her]91-mother sub - prioress bed to - day . Strive to feel kindly toward [her]91-mother sub - prioress , [Antony]85-mary antony . [I]373-the prioress know [she]91-mother sub - prioress oft thinks evil where none was meant , telling tales of wrong which are mostly of [her]91-mother sub - prioress own imagining . But , in so doing , [she]91-mother sub - prioress harms [herself]91-mother sub - prioress more than [she]91-mother sub - prioress can harm [others]482-others .[373-the prioress]

" By stirring up the mud in a dark pool , [you]4385-you dim the reflection of the star which , before , shone bright within it . But [you]4385-you do not dim the star , shining on high .[373-the prioress]

" So is it with the slanderous thoughts of [evil minds]4386-evil minds . [They]4386-evil minds stir up [their]4386-evil minds own murkiness ; but [they]4386-evil minds fail to dim the stars .[373-the prioress]

" [We]4387-we must bear with [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca . "[373-the prioress]

" Go not nigh [them]4386-evil minds , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , "[85-mary antony] begged [old Antony]85-mary antony . " [I]85-mary antony will tend [them]4386-evil minds with due care and patience . These pains in bones , and general shiverings , are given quickly from one to another . [I]85-mary antony pray [you]4385-you , go not near . Remember [you]4385-you were taken alas ! alas ! and [they]4386-evil minds were left ! "[85-mary antony]

At this [the Prioress]373-the prioress laughed , gaily .

" But [I]264-the old lay - sister was not taken decently , with pains in [my]264-the old lay - sister bones and a - bed , dear [Antony]85-mary antony . [I]264-the old lay - sister was carried off by [a bold , bad man [thy]93-the reverend mother [Knight of the Bloody Vest]4389-knight of the bloody vest]4388-a bold , bad man thy knight of the bloody vest . "[264-the old lay - sister] " Oh , pray ! "[264-the old lay - sister] cried [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister . " [I]264-the old lay - sister fear [me]264-the old lay - sister it is an omen . [The angel Gabriel]4390-the angel gabriel , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , sent to bear [you]4385-you from [earth]4391-earth to [heaven]335-heaven . ' [The one]4393-the one shall be taken , and the other left . ' Ah , if [he]4388-a bold , bad man thy knight of the bloody vest had but flown off with [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress ! "[264-the old lay - sister]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress laughed again . " [Dear [Antony]85-mary antony]4394-dear antony , [thy]93-the reverend mother little bird took the first pea [he]4388-a bold , bad man thy knight of the bloody vest saw . Had there but been a crumb , or a morsel of cheese , [he]4388-a bold , bad man thy knight of the bloody vest would have left [thee]93-the reverend mother [thy]93-the reverend mother white pea . . . Hark how [he]4388-a bold , bad man thy knight of the bloody vest sings [his]4388-a bold , bad man thy knight of the bloody vest little song of praise ! . . . Is it not wonderful to call to mind how , centuries ago , when [white - robed Druids]4395-white - robed druids cut mistletoe from [British]13-british oaks , [the robin redbreast]4396-the robin redbreast hopped around , and sang ; when , earlier still , [men]4397-men were wild and savage , dwelling in holes and caves and huts of mud , when [churches]4398-churches and cloisters were unknown in [this land]4399-this land and the one true God undreamed of , robins mated and made [their]4396-the robin redbreast nests , the speckled thrushes sang , ' Do it now Do it now , ' as [they]4396-the robin redbreast sought food for [[their]4396-the robin redbreast young]4400-their young , the blackbirds whistled , and the swallows flashed by on joyous wing . Aye , and when [Eve]119-eve and [Adam]120-adam walked in [Eden]14-eden , amid strange beasts and gaily plumaged birds , here in these [Isles]15-isles [the robin redbreast]4396-the robin redbreast sang , and all [our]4402-our British birds busily built [[their]4396-the robin redbreast nests]4403-their nests and reared [[their]4396-the robin redbreast young]4400-their young ; living [their]4396-the robin redbreast little joyous lives , as [He]4405-he Who made [them]4396-the robin redbreast taught [them]4396-the robin redbreast how to do .[373-the prioress]

" And , in the centuries to come , when all things may be changed in [[this]4406-this [our]4402-our land]4407-this our land , when [we]4402-our shall long have gone to dust , when [[our]4402-our loved cloisters]4408-our loved cloisters may have crumbled into ruin ; still [the hills of [Malvern]16-malvern]4409-the hills of malvern will stand , and the silvery Severn flow along [the valley]4410-the valley ; while here , in [this very garden]4411-this very garden if it be [a garden]4412-a garden still [the robin]339-the robin will build [his]339-the robin nest , and carol [his]339-the robin happy song .[373-the prioress]

" Mark [you]4414-you this , [dear Mary Antony]85-mary antony : all things made by [man]4362-man hold within [them]4362-man the elements of change and of decay . But nature is at one with [God]109-god , and therefore immutable . [Earthly kingdoms]4416-earthly kingdoms may rise and wane ; mighty cities may spring up , then fall into ruin . [Nations]4417-nations may conquer and , in [their]4417-nations turn , be conquered . [Man]4362-man may slay [man]4362-man and , in [his]4362-man turn , be slain . But , through it all , [the mountains]4420-the mountains stand , [the rivers]4421-the rivers flow , [the forests]4422-the forests wave , and [the redbreast]4423-the redbreast builds [his]4423-the redbreast nest in the hawthorn , and warbles a love - song to [[his]4423-the redbreast mate]4424-his mate . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress rose and stretched wide [her]373-the prioress arms to [the sunlit garden]570-the sunlit garden , to the bough where [the robin]339-the robin sang .

" Oh , to be one with [God]109-god and with Nature ! "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress cried . " Oh , to know the essential mysteries of Life and Light and Love ! This is Life Eternal ! "[373-the prioress]

[She]373-the prioress had forgotten [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister ; aye , for the moment [she]373-the prioress had forgotten [the Convent]328-the convent and [the cloister]286-the cloister , the mile - long walk in darkness , the chant of [the unseen monks]595-the unseen monks . [She]373-the prioress trod again the springy heather of [her]373-the prioress youth ; [she]373-the prioress heard the rush of the mountain stream ; the sigh of [the great forest]596-the great forest ; the rustle of the sunlit glades , alive with , life . These all were in the robin 's song . Then

Within [the Convent]328-the convent , the Refectory bell clanged loudly .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress let fall [her]373-the prioress arms .

[She]373-the prioress picked up the nosegay of weeds .

" Come , [Antony]85-mary antony , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " let [us]4425-us go and discover whether [Sister Mary Augustine]116-sister mary augustine hath contrived to make the pasties light and savoury , even without the aid of the advice [she]373-the prioress might have had from [thee]85-mary antony . "[373-the prioress]

[Old Mary Antony]103-mary antony , gleeful and marvelling , followed the stately figure of [the Prioress]373-the prioress . Never was shriven soul more blissfully at peace . [She]373-the prioress had kept back nothing ; yet [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother had imposed no punishment , had merely asked a promise which , in the fulness of [her]373-the prioress gratitude , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony had found it easy to give .

Truly the broth of [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress should , for the future , contain naught but what was grateful and soothing .

But , as [she]373-the prioress entered [the Refectory behind [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother]601-the refectory behind the reverend mother and saw [all the waiting nuns]602-all the waiting nuns arise , [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony laid [her]85-mary antony finger to [her]85-mary antony nose .

" That ' little bird ' shall have the castor beans , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " That ' little bird ' shall have them . Not [my]373-the prioress pretty robin , but the other ! "[373-the prioress]

And , sad to say , [poor Sister [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine]603-poor sister seraphine was sorely griped that night , and suffered many pangs .

CHAPTER VII

THE MADONNA IN [THE CLOISTER]286-the cloister

[The Prioress]373-the prioress knelt , in prayer and meditation , before the figure of [the Virgin Mother]121-the virgin mother holding upon [her]121-the virgin mother knees [the holy Babe]606-the holy babe . Moonlight flooded [the cell]291-the cell with a pure radiance .

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's posy of weeds , offered , according to promise , at [[the Virgin]608-the virgin 's shrine]609-the virgin 's shrine , took on , in that silver splendour , the semblance of lilies and roses .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress knelt long , with clasped hands and bowed head , as white and as motionless as the marble before [her]373-the prioress . But at length [she]373-the prioress lifted [her]373-the prioress face , and broke into low pleading .

" [Mother of God]89-god , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " help this poor aching heart ; still the wild hunger at [my]373-the prioress breast . Make [me]373-the prioress content to be at one with the Divine , and to let Nature go . . . . [Thou]4426-thou knowest it is not [the man [I]373-the prioress want]4427-the man i want . In all the long years since [he]4427-the man i want played traitor to [his]4427-the man i want troth to [me]373-the prioress , [I]373-the prioress have not wanted [the man]4228-the man . [The woman [he]4427-the man i want we d]4429-the woman he we d may have [him]4427-the man i want , unbegrudged by [me]373-the prioress . [I]373-the prioress do not envy [her]4429-the woman he we d the encircling of [his]4427-the man i want arms , though time was when [I]373-the prioress felt them strong and tender . [I]373-the prioress do not want [the man]4228-the man , but O , [sweet Mother of [God]89-god]4431-sweet mother of god [I]373-the prioress want [[the man]4228-the man 's little child]4433-the man 's little child ! [I]373-the prioress envy [her]4433-the man 's little child the motherhood which , but for [her]4433-the man 's little child , would have been [mine]373-the prioress . . . . [I]373-the prioress want the soft dark head against [my]373-the prioress breast . . . . [I]373-the prioress want sweet baby lips drawing fresh life from [mine]373-the prioress . . . . [I]373-the prioress want the little feet , resting together in [my]373-the prioress hand . . . . All Nature sings of life , and the power to bestow life . Yet [mine]373-the prioress arms are empty , and [my]373-the prioress strength does but carry [mine]373-the prioress own self to and fro . . . . Oh , give [me]373-the prioress grace to turn [my]373-the prioress thoughts from Life to Sacrifice . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress rose , crossed the floor , and knelt long in prayer and contemplation before the crucifix .

The moonlight fell upon the dying face of [the suffering Saviour]612-the suffering saviour , upon the crown of thorns , the helpless arms out - stretched , the bleeding feet .

O , Infinite Redeemer ! O , mighty Sacrifice ! O , Love of [God]89-god , made manifest !

[The Prioress]373-the prioress knelt long in adoring contemplation . At intervals [she]373-the prioress prostrated [herself]373-the prioress , pressing [her]373-the prioress forehead against the base of the cross .

At length [she]373-the prioress rose and moved toward [the inner room]614-the inner room , where stood [[her]373-the prioress couch]615-her couch .

But even as [she]373-the prioress reached the threshold [she]373-the prioress turned quickly back , and kneeling before [the Virgin and Child]616-the virgin and child clasped the little marble foot of the Babe , covered it with kisses , and pressed it to [her]373-the prioress breast .

Then , lifting despairing eyes to the tender face of [the Madonna]435-the madonna : " O , [Mother of God]4434-mother of god , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress cried , " grant unto [me]373-the prioress to love the pierced feet of [[thy]435-the madonna dear Son crucified]4435-thy dear son crucified , more than [I]373-the prioress love the little , baby feet of [the Infant Jesus]4436-the infant jesus on [thy]435-the madonna knees . "[373-the prioress] A great calm fell upon [her]373-the prioress after this final prayer . It seemed , of a sudden , more efficacious than all the long hours of vigil . [She]373-the prioress felt persuaded that it would be granted .

[She]373-the prioress rose to [her]373-the prioress feet , almost too much dazed and too weary to cross to [the inner cell]618-the inner cell .

A breath of exquisite fragrance filled the air .

At the feet of [the Madonna]435-the madonna stood a wondrous bouquet of lilies of [the valley]4410-the valley and white roses .

Pale but radiant , [the Prioress]373-the prioress passed into [[her]373-the prioress sleeping - chamber]622-her sleeping - chamber . [The loving heart of [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony]623-the loving heart of old mary antony had been full of lilies and roses . It was not [her]373-the prioress fault that [her]373-the prioress old hands had been filled with weeds . [Divine Love]122-love , understanding , had wrought this gracious miracle .

As [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress stretched [herself]91-mother sub - prioress upon [her]91-mother sub - prioress couch , [she]91-mother sub - prioress murmured softly : " [The Lord]4319-the lord seeth not as [man]4362-man seeth : for [man]4362-man looketh on the outward appearance , but [the Lord looketh on the heart]4440-the lord looketh on the heart .[91-mother sub - prioress]

" And , after all , this miracle of the Divine perception doth take place daily .[91-mother sub - prioress]

" Alas , when [our]4441-our vaunted roses and lilies appear , in [His]4319-the lord sight , as mere worthless weeds .[91-mother sub - prioress]

" [The Lord]4319-the lord looketh on the heart . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

When [the Prioress]373-the prioress awoke , the sunlight filled [[her]373-the prioress chamber]4322-her chamber .

[She]373-the prioress hastened to the archway between [the cells]524-the cells , and looked .

The dandelions seemed more gaily golden , in the morning light . The bindweed had faded .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress was disappointed . [She]91-mother sub - prioress had counted upon sending early for old [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . [She]91-mother sub - prioress had pictured [her]85-mary antony bewildered joy . Yet now the nosegay was as before .

Morning light is ever a test for transformations . Things are apt to look again as they were .

But a fragrance of roses and lilies still lingered in [the chamber]627-the chamber .

[The blessed Virgin]628-the blessed virgin smiled upon [the Babe]438-the babe .

And there was peace in [the heart of [the Prioress]373-the prioress]630-the heart of the prioress . [Her]91-mother sub - prioress long vigil , [her]91-mother sub - prioress hours of prayer , had won for [her]91-mother sub - prioress the sense of a calm certainty of coming victory .

Strong in that certainty , [she]91-mother sub - prioress bent , and gently kissed the little feet of [the holy Babe]606-the holy babe .

Then , as was [her]91-mother sub - prioress wo nt , [she]91-mother sub - prioress sounded the bell which called [the entire community]633-the entire community to arise , and to begin a new day .

CHAPTER VIII

ON THE WINGS OF THE STORM

In the afternoon of that day , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony awaited , in [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , the return of [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies from [Vespers]17-vespers . Twenty only , had gone ; and , fearful lest [she]91-mother sub - prioress should make mistake with the unusual number , [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister spent the time of waiting in counting the twenty peas afresh , passing them back and forth from one hand to the other .

[Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress was still unable to leave [her]91-mother sub - prioress bed .

[Sister Mary Augustine]116-sister mary augustine stayed to tend [her]91-mother sub - prioress .

[Sister Teresa]113-sister teresa was in less pain , but fevered still , and strangely weak . [The Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother forbade [her]113-sister teresa to rise . Shortly before the bell rang calling [the nuns]298-the nuns to form procession in [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine declared [herself]102-sister seraphine unable for the walk , and begged to be allowed to remain behind . [The Prioress]373-the prioress found [herself]373-the prioress misdoubting this sudden indisposition of [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine who , though flushed and excited , [shewed]640-shewed none of the usual signs of sickness .

Not wishing , however , to risk having [a third patient]641-a third patient upon [her]91-mother sub - prioress hands , [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother gave leave for [her]91-mother sub - prioress to stay , but also elected to remain behind , [herself]91-mother sub - prioress ; letting [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , who had recovered from [her]90-sister mary rebecca indisposition , lead the procession .

Thus [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother contrived to keep [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine with [her]427-the reverend mother during the absence of [the other nuns]644-the other nuns , giving [her]102-sister seraphine translations from the Sacramentaries to copy upon strips of vellum , until shortly before the hour when [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies would return from Vespers , when [she]427-the reverend mother sent [her]102-sister seraphine to [[her]102-sister seraphine cell]321-her cell for the time of prayer and meditation .

Left alone , [the Prioress]373-the prioress examined the copies , fairly legible , but sadly unlike [her]373-the prioress own beautiful work . [She]373-the prioress sighed and , putting them away , rose and paced [the room]495-the room , questioning how best to deal with [the pretty but wayward young nun]649-the pretty but wayward young nun .

Two definite causes led [the Prioress]373-the prioress to mistrust [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine : one , that [she]102-sister seraphine had called upon " [Wilfred]106-wilfred "[102-sister seraphine] to come and save [her]102-sister seraphine , and had admitted having expected [him]651-him to appear and carry [her]102-sister seraphine off before [she]102-sister seraphine made [her]102-sister seraphine final profession ; the other , that [she]102-sister seraphine had tried to start an evil report concerning [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . [The Prioress]373-the prioress pondered what means to take in order to bring [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine to a better mind .

As [the Prioress]373-the prioress walked to and fro , unconsciously missing the daily exercise of the passage to [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral , [she]373-the prioress noted a sudden darkening of [[her]373-the prioress chamber]4322-her chamber . Going to the window , [she]373-the prioress saw the sky grown black with thunder clouds . So quickly the storm gathered , that the bright summer world without seemed suddenly hung over with a deep purple pall .

[Birds]123-birds screamed and darted by , on hurried wing ; then , reaching [home]305-home , fell silent . All nature seemed to hold its breath , awaiting the first flash , and the first roll of thunder .

Still standing at [her]373-the prioress window , [the Prioress]373-the prioress questioned whether [the nuns]298-the nuns were returned , and safely in [[their]298-the nuns cells]299-their cells . While underground [they]298-the nuns would know nothing of it ; but [they]298-the nuns loved not passing along [the cloisters]316-the cloisters in a storm .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress wondered why [she]373-the prioress had not heard the bell announcing [their]298-the nuns return , and calling to the hour of prayer and silence . Also why [Mary Antony]85-mary antony had not brought in the key and [her]85-mary antony report .

Thinking to inquire into this , [she]373-the prioress turned from the window , just as a darting snake of fire cleft the sky . A crash of thunder followed ; and , at that moment , the door of [the chamber]627-the chamber bursting open , [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony , breathless , stumbled in , forgetting to knock , omitting to kneel , not waiting leave to speak , both hands outstretched , one tightly clenched , the other holding the great key : " Oh , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother ! "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony gasped . Then the stern displeasure on that loved face silenced [her]85-mary antony . [She]85-mary antony dropped upon [her]85-mary antony knees , ashen and trembling .

Now [the Prioress]373-the prioress held personal fear in high scorn ; and if , after ninety years ' experience of lightning and thunder , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony was not better proof against [their]298-the nuns terrors , [the Prioress]373-the prioress felt scant patience with [her]85-mary antony . [She]373-the prioress spoke sternly .

" How now , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony ! Why this unseemly haste ? Why this rush into [my]373-the prioress presence ; no knock ; no pause until [I]373-the prioress bid [thee]85-mary antony enter ? Is [the storm - fiend]4443-the storm - fiend at [thy]85-mary antony heels ? Now shame upon [thee]85-mary antony ! "[373-the prioress]

For only answer , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony opened [her]85-mary antony clenched hand : whereupon twenty peas fell pattering to the floor , chasing [one another]666-one another across [[the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother 's cell]428-the reverend mother 's cell .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress frowned , growing suddenly weary of these games with peas .

" Have [the Ladies]4444-the ladies returned ? "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress asked .

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony grovelled nearer , let fall the key , and seized the robe of [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress with both hands , not to carry it to [her]85-mary antony lips , but to cling to it as if for protection .

With the clang of the key on the flags , a twisted blade of fire rent the sky .

As the roar which followed rolled away , echoed and re - echoed by [distant hills]670-distant hills , [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister lifted [her]264-the old lay - sister face .

[Her]264-the old lay - sister lips moved , [her]264-the old lay - sister gums rattled ; the terror in [her]264-the old lay - sister eyes pleaded for help .

This was the moment when it dawned on [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress that there was more here than fear of a storm .

[Stooping]124-stooping [she]373-the prioress laid [her]373-the prioress hands firmly , yet with kindness in [their]672-their strength , on the shaking shoulders .

" What is it , dear [Antony]85-mary antony ? "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said .

" [Twenty White Ladies]4445-twenty white ladies went , "[264-the old lay - sister] whispered [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister . " [I]264-the old lay - sister counted [them]4445-twenty white ladies . [Twenty White Ladies]4445-twenty white ladies went ; but "[264-the old lay - sister]

" Well ? "[373-the prioress]

" [Twenty - one]4447-twenty - one returned , "[85-mary antony] chattered [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , and hid [her]85-mary antony face in the [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's robe .

Two flashes , with [their]674-their accompanying peals of thunder passed , before [the Prioress]373-the prioress moved or spoke . Then raising [Mary Antony]85-mary antony [she]373-the prioress placed [her]85-mary antony in a chair , disengaged [her]85-mary antony robe from the shaking hands , passed out into [the cell passage]265-the cell passage , and [herself]373-the prioress sounded the call to silence and prayer .

Returning to [[her]373-the prioress cell]321-her cell [she]373-the prioress shut the door , poured out a cordial and put it to the trembling lips of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . Then taking a seat just opposite , [she]373-the prioress looked with calm eyes at [the lay - sister]337-the lay - sister .

" What means this story ? "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress .

" [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , [twenty holy Ladies]4448-twenty holy ladies went "[373-the prioress]

" [I]373-the prioress know . And twenty returned . "[373-the prioress]

" Aye , "[430-the old woman] said [the old woman]430-the old woman more firmly , nettled out of [her]430-the old woman speechlessness ; " twenty returned ; and twenty peas [I]430-the old woman dropped from hand to hand . Then when no pea remained yet [another White Lady]4449-another white lady glided by ; and with [her]4449-another white lady went an icy wind , and around [her]4449-another white lady came the blackness of the storm .[430-the old woman]

" Down [the steps]4450-the steps [I]373-the prioress fled , locked the door , and took the key . How [I]373-the prioress mounted again , [I]373-the prioress know not . As [I]373-the prioress drew level with [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , [I]373-the prioress saw [that twenty - first White Lady]4452-that twenty - first white lady , for whom [Saint Peter]125-saint peter knows [I]373-the prioress held no pea , passing from [the cloisters]316-the cloisters into [the cell passage]265-the cell passage . As [I]373-the prioress hastened on , fain to see whither [she]4452-that twenty - first white lady went , a blinding flash , like an evil twisting snake , shot betwixt [her]4452-that twenty - first white lady and [me]373-the prioress . When [I]373-the prioress could see again , [she]4452-that twenty - first white lady was gone . [I]373-the prioress fled to [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , and ran in on the roar of the thunder . "[373-the prioress]

" Saw [you]373-the prioress [her]4452-that twenty - first white lady face , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony ? "[430-the old woman]

" Nay , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother . But , of late , [the holy Ladies]332-the holy ladies mostly walk by with [their]332-the holy ladies faces shrouded . "[373-the prioress]

" [I]430-the old woman know . Now , see here , dear [Antony]85-mary antony . Two peas dropped together , the while [you]373-the prioress counted one . "[430-the old woman]

" Nay , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother . Twenty peas dropped one by one ; also [I]373-the prioress counted [twenty White Ladies]4445-twenty white ladies . And , after [I]373-the prioress had counted twenty , yet another passed . "[373-the prioress]

" But how could that be ? "[373-the prioress] objected [the Prioress]373-the prioress . " If twenty went , but twenty could return . Who should be [the twenty - first]4458-the twenty - first ? "[373-the prioress]

Then [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony leaned forward , crossing [herself]85-mary antony .

" [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony whispered , tremulously . " [Poor Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha returned to [us]4459-us again . "[85-mary antony]

But , even as [she]85-mary antony said it , swift came a name to the mind of [the Prioress]373-the prioress , answering [her]85-mary antony own question , and filling [her]85-mary antony with consternation and a great anger . " [Wilfred]106-wilfred ! [Wilfred]106-wilfred , are [you]106-wilfred come to save [me]102-sister seraphine ? "[102-sister seraphine] foolish little [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine had said . Was such sacrilege possible ? Could one from [the outside world]683-the outside world have dared to intrude into [[their]684-their holy Sanctuary]685-their holy sanctuary ?

Yet [old Antony]85-mary antony 's tale carried conviction . [Her]85-mary antony abject fear was now explained .

That [the Dead]686-the dead should come again , and walk and move among the haunts of [men]4397-men , seeking out the surroundings [they]686-the dead have loved and left , seems always to hold terror for the untutored mind , which knows not that [the Dead]126-the dead are more alive than the living ; and that there is no death , saving the death of sin .

But to [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , guarding [her]93-the reverend mother flock from sin or shame , [a visitor from [the Unseen World]18-the unseen world]688-a visitor from the unseen world held less of horror than [a possible intruder from [the Seen]19-the seen]689-a possible intruder from the seen .

A rapid glance as [she]93-the reverend mother sounded the bell , had shown [her]93-the reverend mother that [the passage]497-the passage was empty .

[Which cell]691-which cell now sheltered two , where there should be but one ?

[The Prioress]373-the prioress walked across to a recess near the south window , touched a spring , and slid back a portion of the oak panelling . Passing [her]373-the prioress hand into a secret hiding place in the wall , [she]373-the prioress drew forth a beautifully fashioned dagger , with carved ivory handle , crossed metal thumb - guard , blade of bevelled steel , polished and narrowing to a sharp needle point . [She]373-the prioress tested the point , then slipped the weapon into [her]373-the prioress belt , beneath [her]373-the prioress scapulary . As [she]373-the prioress closed the panel , and turned back into [the chamber]627-the chamber , a light of high resolve was in [her]373-the prioress eyes . [Her]373-the prioress whole bearing betokened so fine a fearlessness , such noble fixity of purpose that , looking on [her]373-the prioress , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony felt [her]85-mary antony own fears vanishing .

" Now listen , [dear Antony]85-mary antony , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , holding [the old woman]430-the old woman with [her]373-the prioress look . " [I]373-the prioress must make sure that [this twenty - first White Lady of thine]4460-this twenty - first white lady of thine is but a trick played on [thee]85-mary antony by [thy]85-mary antony peas . Should [she]4460-this twenty - first white lady of thine be anywhere in [the Convent]328-the convent [I]373-the prioress shall most certainly have speech with [her]4460-this twenty - first white lady of thine .[373-the prioress]

" Meanwhile , go [thou]85-mary antony to [[thy]85-mary antony kitchens]4462-thy kitchens , and give [thy]85-mary antony mind to the preparing of the evening meal . But ring not the Refectory bell until [I]373-the prioress bid [thee]85-mary antony . Nay , [I]373-the prioress [myself]373-the prioress will sound it this evening . It may suit [me]373-the prioress to keep [the nuns]298-the nuns somewhat longer at [their]298-the nuns devotions .[373-the prioress]

" Should [I]373-the prioress sound the alarm bell , let all [[thy]85-mary antony helpers]4464-thy helpers run up here ; but go [thou]85-mary antony to [the cell of [Mother Sub - Prioress]324-mother sub - prioress]4465-the cell of mother sub - prioress and persuade [her]4460-this twenty - first white lady of thine not to rise . If needful say that it is [my]373-the prioress command that [she]4460-this twenty - first white lady of thine keep [her]4460-this twenty - first white lady of thine bed . . . . Great heavens ! What a crash ! May [[our]4467-our Lady]4260-our lady defend [us]4467-our ! The lightning inclines to strike . [I]373-the prioress shall pass to [each cell]4469-each cell and make sure that [none]315-none are too greatly alarmed . "[373-the prioress]

" Now , haste [thee]85-mary antony , [Antony]85-mary antony ; and not a word concerning [thy]85-mary antony fears must pass [thy]85-mary antony lips to any ; no mention of [a twenty - first White Lady]4471-a twenty - first white lady nor "[373-the prioress] [the Prioress]373-the prioress crossed [herself]373-the prioress " of [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha , to whom may [[our]4467-our Lord]4256-our lord grant everlasting rest . "[373-the prioress]

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony , kneeling , kissed the hem of [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress 's robe . Then , rising , [she]85-mary antony said with unwonted solemnity and restraint : " [The Lord]4319-the lord defend [you]91-mother sub - prioress , [Reverend Mother]4474-reverend mother , from foes , seen and unseen , "[85-mary antony] and , followed by another blinding flash of lightning , [she]85-mary antony left [the cell]291-the cell .

CHAPTER IX

[THE PRIORESS]127-the prioress SHUTS THE DOOR

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress waited until [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister 's shuffling footsteps died away .

Then [she]91-mother sub - prioress passed out into [the long , stone passage]452-the long , stone passage , leaving [her]91-mother sub - prioress own door open wide .

Into [each cell]4469-each cell [the Prioress]373-the prioress went .

In each [she]373-the prioress found [a kneeling nun]702-a kneeling nun , absorbed in [her]702-a kneeling nun devotions . In [no cell]703-no cell were there two white figures . So simple were the fittings of [these cells]704-these cells , that no place of concealment was possible . One look , from the doorway , sufficed .

Outside [the cell of [Sister Seraphine the Prioress]128-sister seraphine the prioress]705-the cell of sister seraphine the prioress paused , hearing words within ; then entered swiftly . But [Sister Seraphine]128-sister seraphine the prioress was alone , reciting aloud , for love of hearing [her]128-sister seraphine the prioress own voice .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress now moved toward the heavy door in the archway leading into [the cloisters]316-the cloisters . [It]708-it opened inwards , and had been left standing wide , by [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . Indeed , in [summer]709-summer [it]708-it stood open day and night , for coolness .

As [the Prioress]373-the prioress walked along [the dimly lighted passage]711-the dimly lighted passage , [she]373-the prioress could see , through the open door , sheets of rain driving through [the cloisters]316-the cloisters . The storm - clouds had burst , at last , and were descending in floods .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress stood in the shelter of the doorway , looking out into [the cloisters]316-the cloisters . The only places [she]373-the prioress could not view , were the entrance to [the subterranean way]714-the subterranean way , and the flight of steps leading thereto . [She]91-mother sub - prioress would have wished to examine these ; but it seemed scarcely worth passing into the driving rain , now sweeping through the cloister arches . After all , whatever possible danger lurked down those steps , the safety of [the Convent]328-the convent would be assured if [she]91-mother sub - prioress closed this door , between [the passage]497-the passage and [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , and locked it .

Stepping back into [the passage]497-the passage , [she]91-mother sub - prioress seized the heavy door and swung it to , noting as [she]91-mother sub - prioress did so , how far too heavy it was for the feeble arms of [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony , and deciding for the future to allot the task of closing it to [a young lay - sister]719-a young lay - sister , leaving to [Mary Antony]85-mary antony merely the responsibility of turning the key in the lock .

This [the Prioress]373-the prioress was [herself]373-the prioress proceeding to do , when something impelled [her]91-mother sub - prioress to turn [her]91-mother sub - prioress eyes to the angle of wall laid bare by the closing of the door .

In that dark corner , motionless , with shrouded face , stood [a tall figure , garbed in the dress of [the nuns of the Order of the White Ladies of [Worcester]1-worcester]722-the nuns of the order of the white ladies of worcester]721-a tall figure , garbed in the dress of the nuns of the order of the white ladies of worcester .

Perhaps the habit of silence is never of greater value than in moments of sudden shock and horror .

One cry from [the Prioress]373-the prioress would have meant the instant opening of many doors , and the arrival , on flying feet , of [a score of [frightened nuns]725-frightened nuns]724-a score of frightened nuns .

Instead of screaming , [the Prioress]373-the prioress stood silent and perfectly still ; while every pulse in [her]373-the prioress body ceased beating , during one moment of uncontrollable , cold horror . Then , with a leap , [her]373-the prioress heart went on ; pounding so loudly , that [she]373-the prioress could hear it in the silence . Yet [she]373-the prioress kept command of every impulse which drove to sound or motion .

Before long [her]373-the prioress pulses quieted ; [her]373-the prioress heart , beating steadily , was once again the well - managed steed upon which [her]373-the prioress high courage could ride to victory .

And , all the while , [her]373-the prioress eyes never left [the white figure]727-the white figure ; knowing it knew itself discovered and observed .

[Her]373-the prioress hand was still upon the key .

[She]373-the prioress turned it , and withdrew it from the lock .

A deafening crash of thunder shook the walls . A swirl of wind and rain beat on the door .

When the last echo of the thunder had died away , [the Prioress]373-the prioress spoke ; and that calm voice , sounding amid the storm , fell on [the only ears that heard it , like the Voice of Power on Galilee , which bid the tempest cease , and the wild waves be still]729-the only ears that heard it , like the voice of power on galilee , which bid the tempest cease , and the wild waves be still .

" Who art [thou]730-the figure , and what doest [thou]730-the figure here ? "[729-the only ears that heard it , like the voice of power on galilee , which bid the tempest cease , and the wild waves be still]

[The figure]730-the figure answered not .

" Art [thou]730-the figure [a ghostly visitor]4475-a ghostly visitor come back amongst [us]4476-our , from [the Realm of [the Unseen]20-the unseen]4477-the realm of the unseen ? "[730-the figure] [The figure]730-the figure made no sign . " Art [thou]730-the figure then flesh and blood , and mortal as [ourselves]4476-our ? "[730-the figure]

Slowly [the figure]730-the figure bowed [its]730-the figure head .

" Now [I]730-the figure adjure [thee]730-the figure by [[our]4476-our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady to tell [me]730-the figure truly . Art [thou]730-the figure , in very deed [a holy nun]4479-a holy nun , [a member of [our]4476-our sacred Order]4480-a member of our sacred order ? Answer [me]730-the figure , yea or nay ? "[730-the figure]

[The figure]730-the figure shook [its]730-the figure head .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress advanced a step , passed the key into [her]373-the prioress left hand and , slipping [her]373-the prioress right beneath [her]373-the prioress scapulary , took firm grip of the dagger at [her]373-the prioress girdle .

" Then , masquerader in [our]4476-our sacred dress , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " to [me]373-the prioress [you]730-the figure have to answer for double sacrilege : the wearing of these robes , and [your]730-the figure presence here , unbidden . [I]373-the prioress warn [you]730-the figure that [your]730-the figure life has never hung by frailer thread than now it hangs . [Your]730-the figure only hope of safety lies in doing as [I]373-the prioress bid [you]730-the figure . Pass before [me]373-the prioress along [this passage]272-this passage until [you]730-the figure reach a chamber on the right , of which the door stands open . Enter , and place [yourself]730-the figure against the wall on the side farthest from the door . There [I]373-the prioress will speak with [you]730-the figure . "[373-the prioress]

With the shuffling steps of [a woman , and the bent shoulders of the very old ,]735-a woman , and the bent shoulders of the very old , [the figure]730-the figure moved slowly forward , stepped upon the front of the white robe , stumbled , but recovered .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress watching , laughed a short scornful laugh , holding more of anger than of merriment .

With an abrupt movement [the figure]730-the figure straightened , stood at its full height , and strode forward . [The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress marked the squaring of the broad shoulders ; the height , greater than [her]91-mother sub - prioress own , though [she]91-mother sub - prioress was more than common tall ; the stride , beneath the folds of the long robe ; and [she]91-mother sub - prioress knit [her]91-mother sub - prioress level brows , for well [she]91-mother sub - prioress knew with whom [she]91-mother sub - prioress had to deal . [She]91-mother sub - prioress was called to face a desperate danger . Single - handed , [she]91-mother sub - prioress had to meet [a subtle foe]738-a subtle foe . [She]91-mother sub - prioress asked no help from [others]482-others , but [she]91-mother sub - prioress took no needless risks .

As [she]91-mother sub - prioress passed [the cell of [Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine]529-the cell of mary seraphine , using [her]91-mother sub - prioress master - key , [she]91-mother sub - prioress locked [that lady]741-that lady in !

CHAPTER X

" [I]91-mother sub - prioress KNOW [YOU]741-that lady FOR [A MAN]4482-a man "[91-mother sub - prioress]

Entering [[her]91-mother sub - prioress cell]321-her cell , [the Prioress]373-the prioress saw at once that [her]91-mother sub - prioress orders had been obeyed .

[The hooded figure]744-the hooded figure stood on the far side of [the chamber]627-the chamber , leaning broad shoulders against the wall . Under the cape , the arms were folded ; [she]91-mother sub - prioress could see that the feet were crossed beneath the robe . The dress was indeed the dress of [a White Lady]746-a white lady , but the form within it was so obviously that of [a man]4482-a man [a big man]748-a big man , at bay , and inclined to be defiant that , despite the strange situation , despite [her]91-mother sub - prioress anger , and [her]91-mother sub - prioress fears , the contrast between the holy habit and [its hidden wearer]749-its hidden wearer , forced from [the Prioress]373-the prioress an unwilling smile .

Closing the door , [she]91-mother sub - prioress drew forward a chair of dark Spanish wood , the gift of [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop ; a chair which well betokened the dignity of [[her]91-mother sub - prioress high office]752-her high office .

Seating [herself]91-mother sub - prioress , [she]91-mother sub - prioress laid [her]91-mother sub - prioress left hand lightly upon the mane of one of the carved lions which formed , on either side , the arms of the chair ; but [her]91-mother sub - prioress right hand still gripped unseen the ivory hilt ; while leaning slightly forward , with feet firmly planted , [she]91-mother sub - prioress was ready at any moment to spring erect .

" [I]91-mother sub - prioress know [you]4483-you for [a man]4482-a man , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress said .

The thunder rumbled far away in the distance .

The rain still splashed against the casement , but the storm had spent itself ; the sky was brightening . A pale slant of sunshine broke through the parting clouds and , entering the casement , gleamed on the jewelled cross at the breast of [the Prioress]373-the prioress , and kindled into peculiar radiance the searching light of [her]91-mother sub - prioress clear eyes .

" [I]91-mother sub - prioress know [you]4483-you for [a man]4482-a man , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress said again . " [You]4483-you stand there , [revealed]4486-revealed ; and surely [you]4483-you stand there , shamed . By plotting and planning , by assuming [our]4487-our dress , [you]4483-you have succeeded in forcing [your]4483-you undesired presence into [this sacred cloister]4488-this sacred cloister , where dwells [a little company of women who have left [the world]389-the world , never to return to it again]4489-a little company of women who have left the world , never to return to it again ; who have given up much in order to devote [themselves]4489-a little company of women who have left the world , never to return to it again [to a life of continual worship and adoration]4491-to a life of continual worship and adoration , gaining thereby a power in intercession which brings down blessing upon [those who still fight life 's battles in [the world without]4493-the world without]4492-those who still fight life 's battles in the world without .[91-mother sub - prioress]

" But it has meant the breaking of many a tender tie . There are [fathers]4494-fathers and [brothers]4495-brothers dear to [them]4489-a little company of women who have left the world , never to return to it again , whom [the nuns]298-the nuns would love to see again ; but [they]4489-a little company of women who have left the world , never to return to it again can not do so , save , on rare occasions , in [the guest - room at the gate]4497-the guest - room at the gate ; and then , with the grille between .[373-the prioress]

" [Saving Bishop]4498-saving bishop or [Priest]4499-priest , [no foot of man]4500-no foot of man may tread [[our]4501-our cloisters]4502-our cloisters ; no voice of [man]4362-man may be heard in [these cells]704-these cells .[91-mother sub - prioress]

" Yet by trick and subterfuge [you]730-the figure have intruded . Methinks [I]373-the prioress scarce should let [you]730-the figure leave [this place]4505-this place alive , to boast what [you]730-the figure have done . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress paused .

[The figure]730-the figure stood , with folded arms , immovable , leaning against the wall . There was a quality in this motionless silence such as [the Prioress]373-the prioress had not connected with [her]373-the prioress idea of [Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine 's " Cousin [Wilfred]106-wilfred . "[102-sister seraphine] This was not [a man to threaten]757-a man to threaten . [Her]373-the prioress threat came back to [her]373-the prioress , as if [she]373-the prioress had flung it against a stone wall . [She]373-the prioress tried another line of reasoning .

" [I]373-the prioress know [you]106-wilfred , [Sir Wilfred]106-wilfred , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said . " And [I]373-the prioress know why [you]106-wilfred are here . [You]106-wilfred have come to tempt away , or mayhap , if possible , to force away [one of [[our]4507-our number]4508-our number who but lately took [her]4506-one of our number who but lately took her final vows final vows]4506-one of our number who but lately took her final vows . There was a time , not long ago , when [you]106-wilfred might have thwarted [her]4506-one of our number who but lately took her final vows desire to seek and find the best and highest . But now [you]106-wilfred come too late . [No bride of Heaven]4509-no bride of heaven turns from [[her]4506-one of our number who but lately took her final vows high estate]4510-her high estate . [Her]4506-one of our number who but lately took her final vows choice is made . [She]4506-one of our number who but lately took her final vows will abide by it ; and so , [Sir Knight]129-the knight , must [you]106-wilfred . "[373-the prioress]

The rain had ceased . The storm was over . [Sunshine]130-sunshine flooded [the cell]291-the cell .

Once more [the Prioress]373-the prioress spoke , and [her]373-the prioress voice was gentle .

" [I]373-the prioress know the disappointment to [you]106-wilfred must be grievous . [You]106-wilfred took great risks ; [you]106-wilfred adventured much . How long [you]106-wilfred have plotted this intrusion , [I]373-the prioress know not . [You]106-wilfred have been thwarted in [your]106-wilfred evil purpose by the faithfulness of [one old woman]4511-one old woman , [[our]4512-our aged lay - sister]4513-our aged lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , who never fails to count [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies as [they]288-the white ladies go and as [they]288-the white ladies return , and who reported at once to [me]373-the prioress that [one more had returned than went]4515-one more had returned than went .[373-the prioress]

" Do [you]106-wilfred not see in this the Hand of [God]89-god ? Will [you]106-wilfred not bow in penitence before [Him]89-god , confessing the sinfulness of the thing [you]106-wilfred had in mind to do ? "[373-the prioress]

The shrouded head was lifted higher , as if with a proud gesture of disavowal . At the same time , the hood slightly parting , the hand of [a man , lean and brown]760-a man , lean and brown , gripped it close .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress looked long at that lean , brown hand .

Then [she]91-mother sub - prioress rose slowly to [her]91-mother sub - prioress feet .

" Shew [me]91-mother sub - prioress [thy]730-the figure face , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress said ; and the tension of each word was like a naked blade passing in and out of quivering flesh .

At sound of it [the figure]730-the figure stood erect , took one step forward , flung back the hood , tore open the robe and scapulary , loosing [his]730-the figure arms from the wide sleeves .

And as the hood fell back [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress found [herself]91-mother sub - prioress looking into a face [she]91-mother sub - prioress had not thought to see again in life the face of [him]730-the figure who once had been [[her]91-mother sub - prioress lover]762-her lover .

[CHAPTER XI

THE YEARS ROLL BACK]131-chapter xi the years roll back

" [Hugh]132-hugh ! "[91-mother sub - prioress] exclaimed [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress .

And again , in utter bewilderment : " [Hugh]132-hugh ? "[91-mother sub - prioress]

And yet a third time , in a low whisper of horror , passing [her]91-mother sub - prioress left hand across [her]91-mother sub - prioress eyes , as if to clear from [her]91-mother sub - prioress outer vision some nightmare of the inner mind : " [Hugh]132-hugh ! "[91-mother sub - prioress]

[The silent Knight]763-the silent knight still made no answer ; but [he]763-the silent knight flung aside the clinging robes , stepped from out them , and strode forward , both arms outstretched .

" Back ! "[91-mother sub - prioress] cried [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress . But [her]91-mother sub - prioress hand had left the hilt of the dagger . " Come no nearer , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress commanded .

Then [she]91-mother sub - prioress sank into [her]91-mother sub - prioress chair , spreading [her]91-mother sub - prioress trembling hands upon the carven manes of the lions .

[The Knight]764-the knight , still silent , folded [his]764-the knight arms across [his]764-the knight breast .

Thus for a space [they]765-they gazed on one another [these two , who had parted , eight years before , with clinging lips and straining arms]766-these two , who had parted , eight years before , with clinging lips and straining arms , a deep , pure passion of love surging within [them]766-these two , who had parted , eight years before , with clinging lips and straining arms ; [a union of heart , made closer by the wrench of outward separation]767-a union of heart , made closer by the wrench of outward separation .

[The Knight]764-the knight looked at the lips of [the noble woman before [him]764-the knight]769-the noble woman before him ; and as [he]764-the knight looked those firm lips quivered , trembled , parted

Then the years rolled back

It was moonlight on the battlements . The horses champed in [the courtyard below]770-the courtyard below . [They]766-these two , who had parted , eight years before , with clinging lips and straining arms two had climbed to [the topmost turret]771-the topmost turret , that [they]766-these two , who had parted , eight years before , with clinging lips and straining arms might part as near the stars as possible , and that , unseen by [others]482-others , [she]91-mother sub - prioress might watch [him]764-the knight ride away .

How radiant [she]91-mother sub - prioress looked , in [her]91-mother sub - prioress robe of sapphire velvet , jewels at [her]91-mother sub - prioress breast and girdle , a mantle of ermine hanging from [her]91-mother sub - prioress shoulders . But brighter than any jewels were the eyes full of love and tears ; and softer than softest velvet , the beautiful hair which , covered [her]91-mother sub - prioress , as with a golden veil . Standing with [his]764-the knight arms around [her]91-mother sub - prioress , it flowed over [his]764-the knight hands . Silent [he]764-the knight stood , looking deep into [her]91-mother sub - prioress eyes .

Below [they]766-these two , who had parted , eight years before , with clinging lips and straining arms could hear [Martin Goodfellow]133-martin calling to [the men - at - arms]773-the men - at - arms .

[Her]91-mother sub - prioress lips being free , [she]91-mother sub - prioress spoke .

" [Thou]4516-thou wilt come back to [me]91-mother sub - prioress , [Hugh]132-hugh , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress said . " [The Saracens]134-the saracens will not slay [thee]764-the knight , will not wound [thee]764-the knight , will not touch [thee]764-the knight . [My]91-mother sub - prioress love will ever be around [thee]764-the knight , as a silver shield . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

[She]91-mother sub - prioress flung [her]91-mother sub - prioress strong young arms about [him]764-the knight , long and supple , enfolding [him]764-the knight closely , even as [his]764-the knight enfolded [her]91-mother sub - prioress .

[He]764-the knight filled [his]764-the knight hands with [her]91-mother sub - prioress soft hair , straining [her]91-mother sub - prioress closer .

" [I]764-the knight would [I]764-the knight left [[thee]91-mother sub - prioress wife]4517-thee wife , not [maid]4518-maid . Could [I]764-the knight have [we]4519-we d [thee]91-mother sub - prioress first , [I]764-the knight would go with a lighter heart . "[764-the knight]

" [Wife]4520-wife or [maid]4518-maid , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress answered , [her]91-mother sub - prioress face lifted to [his]764-the knight , " [I]91-mother sub - prioress am all thine own . Go with a light heart , [dear man of [mine]91-mother sub - prioress]4522-dear man of mine , for it makes no difference . [Maid]4518-maid or [wife]4520-wife , [I]91-mother sub - prioress am thine , and none other 's , forever . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

" Let those be the last words [I]764-the knight hear [thee]91-mother sub - prioress say , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight murmured , as [his]764-the knight lips sought [hers]91-mother sub - prioress .

So , a little later , standing above [him]764-the knight on [the turret steps]774-the turret steps , [she]91-mother sub - prioress bent and clasped [her]91-mother sub - prioress hands about [his]764-the knight head , pushing [her]91-mother sub - prioress fingers into the thickness of [his]764-the knight hair . Then : " [Maid]4518-maid or [wife]4520-wife , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress said , and [her]91-mother sub - prioress voice now steady , was deep and tender ; " [Maid]4518-maid or [wife]4520-wife , God knows , [I]91-mother sub - prioress am all thine own . "[91-mother sub - prioress] Then [she]91-mother sub - prioress caught [his]764-the knight face to [her]91-mother sub - prioress breast . " [Thine]135-thine and none other 's , forever , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress said ; and [he]764-the knight felt [her]91-mother sub - prioress bosom heave with one deep sob .

Then turning quickly [he]764-the knight ran down the winding stair , reached [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , mounted , and rode out through the gates of [Castle Norelle]21-castle norelle , and into [the fir wood]776-the fir wood ; and so [down south]777-down south to follow [the King , who already had started on the great Crusade]778-the king , who already had started on the great crusade .

And , as [he]764-the knight rode , in moonlight or in shadow , always [he]764-the knight saw the sweet lips that trembled , always [he]764-the knight felt the soft heave of that sob , and the low voice so tender , said : " Thine and [none other]4529-none other 's , forever . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

And now

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress sat in [her]91-mother sub - prioress chair of state .

Each moment [her]91-mother sub - prioress face grew calmer and more stern .

[The Knight]764-the knight let [his]764-the knight eyes dwell on the fingers which once crept so tenderly into [his]764-the knight hair .

[She]91-mother sub - prioress hid them beneath [her]91-mother sub - prioress scapulary , as if [his]764-the knight gaze scorched them .

[He]764-the knight looked at the bosom against which [his]764-the knight head had been pressed .

A jewelled cross gleamed , there where [his]764-the knight face had laid hidden .

Then [the Knight]764-the knight lifted [his]764-the knight eyes again to that stern , cold face . Yet still [he]764-the knight kept silence .

At length [the Prioress]373-the prioress spoke .

" So it is [you]764-the knight , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said .

" Yes , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , " it is [I.]764-the knight "[764-the knight]

[Wroth]136-wroth with [her]91-mother sub - prioress own poor heart because it thrilled at [his]764-the knight voice , [the Prioress]373-the prioress spoke with anger . " How did [you]764-the knight dare to force [your]764-the knight way into [this sacred cloister]4488-this sacred cloister ? "[373-the prioress]

[The Knight]764-the knight smiled . " [I]764-the knight have yet to find the thing [I]764-the knight dare not do . "[764-the knight]

" Why are [you]764-the knight not with [[your]764-the knight wife]4531-your wife ? "[91-mother sub - prioress] demanded [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress ; and [her]373-the prioress tone was terrible .

" [I]764-the knight am with [[my]764-the knight wife]4532-my wife , "[764-the knight] replied [the Knight]764-the knight . " [The only wife [I]764-the knight have ever wanted]4533-the only wife i have ever wanted , [the only woman [I]764-the knight shall ever [we]4535-we d]4534-the only woman i shall ever we d , is [here]4536-here . "[764-the knight]

" [Coward]4537-coward ! "[373-the prioress] cried [the Prioress]373-the prioress , white with anger . " [Traitor]4538-traitor ! "[373-the prioress] [She]373-the prioress leaned forward , clenching [her]373-the prioress hands upon the lions ' heads . " [Liar]4539-liar !
