" Cease to be angry , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight . " Thine anger affrights [me]764-the knight not , yet it hurts [thyself]4541-thyself . Listen , [[mine]764-the knight own beloved]4542-mine own beloved , and [I]764-the knight will tell [thee]4542-mine own beloved the cruel , and yet blessed , truth .[764-the knight]

" Seven months after [I]373-the prioress left [thee]4542-mine own beloved , [a messenger]4543-a messenger reached [[our]4544-our camp]4545-our camp , bearing letters from [England]22-england ; no word for [me]373-the prioress from [thee]4542-mine own beloved ; but a long missive from [[thy]4542-mine own beloved half - sister]4546-thy half - sister [Eleanor]138-eleanor , breaking to [me]373-the prioress the news that , being weary of [my]373-the prioress absence , and somewhat over - persuaded , [thou]4542-mine own beloved hadst wedded [Humphry]139-humphry ; [Earl of [Carnforth]23-carnforth]4547-earl of carnforth .[373-the prioress]

" It was no news to [me]764-the knight , that [Humphry]139-humphry sought to win [thee]4542-mine own beloved ; but , that [thou]4542-mine own beloved hadst let [thyself]4542-mine own beloved be won away from [thy]4542-mine own beloved vow to [me]764-the knight , was hell 's own tidings .[764-the knight]

" In [my]373-the prioress first rage of grief [I]373-the prioress would have speech with none . But , by - and - by , [I]373-the prioress sought [the messenger]4548-the messenger , and asked [him]4548-the messenger casually of things at [home]305-home . [He]4548-the messenger told [me]373-the prioress [he]4548-the messenger had seen [thy]4542-mine own beloved splendid nuptials with [the lord of [Carnforth]23-carnforth]4550-the lord of carnforth , had been present at the marriage , and joined in the after revels and festivities . [He]4548-the messenger said [thou]4542-mine own beloved didst make [a lovely bride]4551-a lovely bride , but somewhat sad , as if [thy]4542-mine own beloved mind strayed elsewhere . [The fellow]4552-the fellow was [a kind of lawyer 's clerk]4553-a kind of lawyer 's clerk , but lean , and out at elbow .[373-the prioress]

" Then [I]764-the knight sought ' [Frida]140-frida , [[my]764-the knight cousin]4275-my cousin . [She]140-frida too had had a letter , giving the news . [She]140-frida told [me]764-the knight [she]140-frida long had feared this thing for [me]764-the knight , knowing the heart of [Humphry]139-humphry to be set on winning [thee]4542-mine own beloved , and that [Eleanor]138-eleanor approved [his]139-humphry suit , and having already heard that of late [thou]4542-mine own beloved hadst inclined to smile on [him]139-humphry . " ' What good were it , ' [she]140-frida said , ' to beg [the King]4555-the king for leave to hasten [home]305-home ? If [you]764-the knight kill [Humphry]139-humphry , [Hugh]132-hugh , [you]764-the knight do but make [a widow of [the woman [you]764-the knight have loved]4558-the woman you have loved]4557-a widow of the woman you have loved ; nor could [you]764-the knight [we]4559-we d [the widow of [a man [yourself]764-the knight had slain]4561-a man yourself had slain]4560-the widow of a man yourself had slain . Stay here , and play [the man]4228-the man . '[373-the prioress]

" So , by [the messenger]4548-the messenger , [I]764-the knight sent [thee]764-the knight back a letter , asking [thee]764-the knight to write [me]764-the knight word how it was that [thou]764-the knight , being [[my]764-the knight betrothed]4565-my betrothed , hadst come to do this thing ; and whether [Humphry]139-humphry was good to [thee]764-the knight , and making [thy]764-the knight life pleasant . To [Humphry]139-humphry [I]764-the knight sent a letter saying that , [thy]764-the knight love being round [him]139-humphry as a silver shield , [I]764-the knight would not slay [him]139-humphry , wound [him]139-humphry , or touch [him]139-humphry ! But if [he]139-humphry used [thee]764-the knight ill , or gave [thee]764-the knight any grief or sorrow , then would [I]764-the knight come , forthwith , and send [him]139-humphry straight to hell .[764-the knight]

" These letters , with [others from [the camp]4567-the camp]4566-others from the camp , went back to [England]22-england by [that clerkly messenger]4568-that clerkly messenger . No answers were returned to [mine]764-the knight .[373-the prioress]

" Meanwhile [I]764-the knight went , with [my]764-the knight despair , out to [the battlefield]4569-the battlefield .[764-the knight]

" No tender shield was round [me]373-the prioress any more . [I]373-the prioress fought , like a mad wild beast . So often was [I]373-the prioress wounded , that [they]4570-they dubbed [me]373-the prioress ' [The Knight of the Bloody Vest]543-the knight of the bloody vest . '[373-the prioress]

" At last [they]4570-they brought [me]764-the knight back to [camp]4572-camp , delirious and dying . [[My]764-the knight cousin]4275-my cousin ' Frida , there biding [her]4275-my cousin time , nursed [me]764-the knight back to life , and sought to win for [herself]4275-my cousin [I]764-the knight shame to say it the love which [thou]4574-thou hadst flouted . [The Queen]4576-the queen [herself]4576-the queen as good as bid [me]764-the knight [we]4577-we d [[her]4576-the queen favourite Lady]4578-her favourite lady . [The Queen]4576-the queen [herself]4576-the queen had to discover that [she]4576-the queen could command [an English soldier]4580-an english soldier 's life , but not [his]4580-an english soldier love .[764-the knight]

" Back in [the field]4581-the field again , [I]373-the prioress found [myself]373-the prioress one day , cut off , surrounded , hewn down , taken prisoner ; but by [a generous foe]4582-a generous foe .[373-the prioress]

" Thereafter followed years of much adventure ; escapes , far distant wanderings , strange company . Many months [I]764-the knight spent in a mountain fastness with [a wise Hebrew Rabbi]4583-a wise hebrew rabbi , who taught [me]764-the knight [his]4583-a wise hebrew rabbi sacred Scriptures ; going back to the beginning of all things , before [the world]389-the world was ; yet shrewd in judgment of the present , and throwing a weird light forward upon the future . [A strange man]4585-a strange man ; wise , as are [all of that Chosen Race]4586-all of that chosen race ; and [a faithful friend]4587-a faithful friend . [He]4585-a strange man did much to heal [my]764-the knight hurt and woo [me]764-the knight back to sanity .[764-the knight]

" Later , more than a year with [a band of [holy monks]4589-holy monks in [a desert monastery , high among the rocks]4590-a desert monastery , high among the rocks]4588-a band of holy monks in a desert monastery , high among the rocks ; [good Fathers who believed in Greek and Latin as surest of all balsams for a wounded spirit , and who made [me]373-the prioress to become deeply learned in Apostolic writings , and in the teachings of [the Church]4592-the church]4591-good fathers who believed in greek and latin as surest of all balsams for a wounded spirit , and who made me to become deeply learned in apostolic writings , and in the teachings of the church . But , for all [their]4588-a band of holy monks in a desert monastery , high among the rocks best endeavours , [I]373-the prioress could not feel called to the perpetual calm of [the Cloister]286-the cloister . [We]4594-we are a line of [fighters and hunters]4595-fighters and hunters , [men to whom pride of race and love of hearth and home]4596-men to whom pride of race and love of hearth and home , are primal instincts .[373-the prioress]

" Thus , after many further wanderings and much varying adventure , having by a strange chance heard news of the death of [[my]764-the knight father]4597-my father , and that [[my]764-the knight mother]4598-my mother mourned . In solitude , the opening of this year found [me]764-the knight landed in [England]22-england [I]764-the knight who , by most , had long been given up for dead ; though [Martin Goodfellow]133-martin , failing to find trace of [me]764-the knight in [Palestine]24-palestine , had gone back to [Cumberland]25-cumberland , and staunchly maintained [his]133-martin belief that [I]764-the knight lived , [a captive]4599-a captive , and should some day make [my]764-the knight escape , and return .[764-the knight]

" [I]373-the prioress passed with all speed to [[our]4594-we Castle on [the moors]4601-the moors]4600-our castle on the moors , knowing [a mother]4602-a mother 's heart waited here , for [mothers]4603-mothers never cease to watch and hope . And , sure enough , as [I]373-the prioress rode up , the great doors flew wide ; [the house]4604-the house waited [its master]4605-its master ; [the mother]4606-the mother was on the threshold to greet [[her]4606-the mother son]4607-her son . Aye ! It was good to be at [home]305-home once more even in [the land where [[my]373-the prioress woman]4610-my woman]4609-the land where my woman was bearing [children]4304-children to [another man]4612-another man .[373-the prioress]

" [We]4594-we spent a few happy days , [I]764-the knight and [[my]764-the knight mother]4598-my mother , together . Then the joy of hope fulfilled being sometimes a swifter harbinger to [another world]4614-another world than the heaviest load of sorrow [she]4606-the mother passed , without pain or sickness , smiling , in [her]4606-the mother sleep ; [she]4606-the mother passed leaving [[my]764-the knight home]4615-my home desolate indeed .[764-the knight]

" Not having known of [my]373-the prioress betrothal to [thee]4606-the mother , because of the old feud between [[our]4594-we families]4616-our families , and [my]373-the prioress reluctance to cross [her]4606-the mother wish that [I]373-the prioress should [we]4594-we d [Alfrida]137-alfrida , [thy]4606-the mother name was not spoken between [us]4594-we ; but [I]373-the prioress learned from [her]4606-the mother that [[my]373-the prioress cousin]4275-my cousin ' Frida lay dying at [[her]4606-the mother manor]4618-her manor , nigh to [Chester]26-chester , of some lingering disease contracted in [eastern lands]4619-eastern lands . "[373-the prioress]

" With the first stirrings of Spring in [forest and pasture]4620-forest and pasture , [I]764-the knight felt moved to ride south to [the Court]4621-the court , and report [my]764-the knight return to [the King]4555-the king ; yet waited , strangely loath to go abroad where any turn of [the road]4623-the road might bring [me]764-the knight face to face with [Humphry]139-humphry . [I]764-the knight doubted , should [we]4594-we meet , if [I]764-the knight could pass , without slaying [him]139-humphry , [the man who had stolen [[my]764-the knight betrothed]4565-my betrothed from [me]764-the knight]4624-the man who had stolen my betrothed from me . So [I]764-the knight stayed in [[my]764-the knight own domain]4626-my own domain , bringing things into order , working in [the armoury]4627-the armoury , and striving by hard exercise to throttle [the grim demon of despair]4628-the grim demon of despair .[764-the knight]

" April brought a burst of early summer ; and , on the first day of May , [I]373-the prioress set off for [Windsor]27-windsor .[373-the prioress]

" Passing through [Carnforth]23-carnforth on [my]764-the knight way , [I]764-the knight found [the town]4629-the town keeping high holiday . [I]764-the knight asked the reason , and was told of a Tourney now in progress in [the neighbourhood]4630-the neighbourhood , to which [the Earl]4631-the earl had that morning ridden in state , accompanied by [[his]4631-the earl Countess]4632-his countess , who indeed was chosen [Queen of Beauty]141-queen of beauty , and was to sit enthroned , attended by [[her]4632-his countess little daughter]4633-her little daughter , [two tiny sons acting as pages]4634-two tiny sons acting as pages .[764-the knight]

" A sudden mad desire came on [me]373-the prioress , to look upon [thy]4635-thee face again ; to see [thee]4635-thee with [the man who stole [thee]4635-thee from [me]373-the prioress]4636-the man who stole thee from me ; with [the children]4637-the children , who should have been [mine]373-the prioress own .[373-the prioress]

" Ten minutes later , [I]764-the knight rode on to [the field]4581-the field . Pushing in amid [the gay crowd]4639-the gay crowd , [I]764-the knight seemed almost at once to find [myself]764-the knight right in front of the throne .[764-the knight]

" [I]373-the prioress saw [the Queen of Beauty]4640-the queen of beauty , in cloth of gold . [I]373-the prioress saw [the little maiden]4641-the little maiden and the pages in attendance . All this [I]373-the prioress saw , which [I]373-the prioress had come to see . But the face of [[Humphry]139-humphry 's Countess]4644-humphry 's countess was not [thy]139-humphry face ! In that moment [I]373-the prioress knew that , for seven long years , [I]373-the prioress had been fooled ![373-the prioress]

" [I]764-the knight started on a frenzied quest after the truth , and news of [thee]139-humphry .[764-the knight]

" [[Thy]139-humphry sister]4645-thy sister [Eleanor]138-eleanor had died the year before . To [[thy]139-humphry beautiful castle and lands]4646-thy beautiful castle and lands , so near [mine]764-the knight own , [[Eleanor]138-eleanor 's son]4647-eleanor 's son had succeeded , and ruled [there]333-there in [thy]139-humphry stead . [He]4647-eleanor 's son being at [Court]28-court just then , [I]373-the prioress saw [him]4647-eleanor 's son not , nor could [I]373-the prioress hear direct news of [thee]139-humphry , though rumour said a convent .[373-the prioress]

" Then [I]764-the knight remembered [[my]764-the knight cousin]4275-my cousin , [Alfrida]137-alfrida , lying sick at [[her]137-alfrida manor in [Chester]26-chester]4650-her manor in chester . To [her]137-alfrida [I]764-the knight went ; and , walking in unannounced [I]764-the knight , whom [she]137-alfrida had long thought dead [I]764-the knight forced the truth from [her]137-alfrida . The whole plot stood revealed . [She]137-alfrida and [Eleanor]138-eleanor had hatched it between [them]4651-them . [Eleanor]138-eleanor desiring [[thy]139-humphry lands]4652-thy lands for [herself]137-alfrida and [[her]137-alfrida boy]4653-her boy , and knowing [children of thine]4654-children of thine would put [hers]137-alfrida out of succession ; [Alfrida]137-alfrida it shames [me]764-the knight to say it desiring for [herself]137-alfrida , [[thy]139-humphry lover]4655-thy lover .[764-the knight]

" [The messenger who brought the letters]4656-the messenger who brought the letters was bribed to give details of [thy]139-humphry supposed marriage . On [his]4656-the messenger who brought the letters return to [England]22-england , [my]373-the prioress letters to [thee]139-humphry and to [Humphry]139-humphry [he]4656-the messenger who brought the letters handed to [Eleanor]138-eleanor ; also a lying letter from ' [Frida]140-frida , telling of [her]140-frida marriage with [me]373-the prioress , with [the Queen]4576-the queen 's consent and approval , and asking [Eleanor]138-eleanor to break the news to [thee]139-humphry . [The messenger]4548-the messenger then mingled with [[thy]139-humphry household]4659-thy household , describing [my]373-the prioress nuptials in detail , as , when abroad , [he]4548-the messenger had done thine . Hearing of this , [[my]373-the prioress poor Love]4660-my poor love did even as [I]373-the prioress had done , sent for [him]4548-the messenger , questioned [him]4548-the messenger , heard the full tale [he]4548-the messenger had to tell , and saw , alas ! no reason to misdoubt [him]4548-the messenger .[373-the prioress]

" By the way , [[my]764-the knight cousin]4275-my cousin ' [Frida]140-frida knew where to lay [her]140-frida hand upon [that clerkly fellow]4662-that clerkly fellow . Therefore [we]4663-we sent for [him]4548-the messenger . [He]4548-the messenger came in haste to see [the Lady Alfrida]137-alfrida , from whom , during all the years , [he]4548-the messenger had extorted endless hush - money .[764-the knight]

" [I]373-the prioress and [[my]373-the prioress men]4664-my men awaited [him]4548-the messenger .[373-the prioress]

" [He]4548-the messenger had fattened on [his]4548-the messenger hush - money ! [He]4548-the messenger was no longer lean and out at elbow .[764-the knight]

" [He]4548-the messenger screeched at sight of [me]373-the prioress , thinking [me]373-the prioress risen from the dead .[373-the prioress]

" [He]4548-the messenger screeched still louder when [he]4548-the messenger saw the noose , flung over a strong bough .[764-the knight]

" [We]4663-we left [him]4548-the messenger hanging , when [we]4663-we rode away . [That Judas kind]4665-that judas kind will do the darkest deeds for greed of gain . [The first of [the tribe]4667-the tribe]4666-the first of the tribe [himself]4666-the first of the tribe shewed the way by which it was most fitting to speed [them]4667-the tribe from [a world into which it had been good for [them]4667-the tribe never to have been born]4668-a world into which it had been good for them never to have been born .[373-the prioress]

" From [Alfrida]137-alfrida [I]764-the knight learned that , as [Eleanor]138-eleanor had foreseen , [thy]137-alfrida grief at [my]764-the knight perfidy drove [thee]137-alfrida to [the Cloister]286-the cloister . Also that [[thy]137-alfrida Convent]4670-thy convent was near [Worcester]1-worcester .[764-the knight]

" To [Worcester]92-bishop [I]373-the prioress came , and made [myself]373-the prioress known to [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop , with whom [I]373-the prioress supped ; and finding [him]751-the lord bishop most pleasant to talk with , and ready to understand , deemed it best , in perfect frankness , to tell [him]751-the lord bishop the whole matter ; being careful not to mention [thy]137-alfrida name , nor to give any clue to [[thy]137-alfrida person]4672-thy person .[373-the prioress]

" Through chance remarks let fall by [the Bishop]4673-the bishop while giving [me]764-the knight the history of [the Order]4674-the order , [I]764-the knight learned that already [thou]137-alfrida wert [Prioress of the White Ladies]4675-prioress of the white ladies . ' [The youngest Prioress in [the kingdom]4677-the kingdom]4676-the youngest prioress in the kingdom , ' said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , ' yet [none]315-none could be wiser or better fitted to hold high authority . ' Little did [he]4673-the bishop dream that any mention of [thee]137-alfrida was as water to [the parched desert]4680-the parched desert ; yet [he]4673-the bishop talked on , for love of speaking of [thee]137-alfrida , while [I]764-the knight sat praying [he]4673-the bishop might tell [me]764-the knight more ; yet barely answering yea or nay , seeming to be absorbed in [mine]764-the knight own melancholy thoughts .[764-the knight]

" From [the Bishop]4673-the bishop [I]373-the prioress learned that [the Order]4674-the order was a strictly close one , and that [no man]4683-no man could , on any pretext whatsoever , gain speech alone with [one of [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies]4684-one of the white ladies .[373-the prioress]

" But [I]764-the knight also heard of the underground way leading from [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral to [the Convent]328-the convent , and of the daily walk to and from [Vespers]17-vespers .[764-the knight]

" [I]373-the prioress went to [the crypt]273-the crypt , and saw the doorway through which [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies pass . Standing unseen amid the many pillars , [I]373-the prioress daily watched [the long line of silent figures]4690-the long line of silent figures , noted that [they]4690-the long line of silent figures all walked veiled , with faces hidden , keeping a measured distance apart . Also that several were above usual height . Then [I]373-the prioress conceived the plan of wearing the outer dress , and of stepping in amongst those veiled figures just at the foot of the winding stair in the wall , leading down from the clerestory to [the crypt]273-the crypt . [I]373-the prioress marked that [the nun]461-the nun descending , could not keep in view [the nun in front who had just stepped forth into [the crypt]273-the crypt]4693-the nun in front who had just stepped forth into the crypt ; while [she]461-the nun , moving forward , would not perceive it if , slipping from behind a pillar , [another white figure]4695-another white figure silently joined [the procession behind [her]461-the nun]4696-the procession behind her . Once within [the Convent]328-the convent , [I]373-the prioress trusted to [[our]4698-our Lady]4260-our lady to help [me]373-the prioress to speech alone with [thee]4700-thee ; and [[our]4698-our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady hath not failed [me]373-the prioress .[373-the prioress]

" Now [I]764-the knight have told [thee]4700-thee all . "[764-the knight]

With that [the Knight]764-the knight left speaking ; and , after the long steady recitation , the ceasing of [his]764-the knight voice caused a silence which , seemed , to hold the very air suspended .

Not once had [the Prioress]373-the prioress made interruption . [She]373-the prioress had sat immovable , [her]373-the prioress eyes upon [his]764-the knight face , [her]373-the prioress hands gripping the arms of [her]373-the prioress chair . Long before the tale was finished [her]373-the prioress sad eyes had overflowed , the tears raining down [her]373-the prioress cheeks , and falling upon the cross at [her]373-the prioress breast .

When [he]764-the knight had told all , when the deep , manly voice now resolute , now eager , now vibrant with fierce indignation , yet tender always when speaking of [her]373-the prioress at last fell silent , [the Prioress]373-the prioress fought with [her]373-the prioress emotion , and mastered it ; then , so soon as [she]373-the prioress could safely trust [her]373-the prioress voice , [she]373-the prioress spoke .

CHAPTER XII

ALAS , THE PITY OF [IT]791-it !

At length [the Prioress]373-the prioress spoke .

" Alas , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " the pity of it ! Ah , the cruel , cruel pity of it ! "[373-the prioress]

[Her]373-the prioress voice , so sweet and tender , yet so hopeless in the unquestioning finality of its regret , struck cold upon the heart of [the Knight]764-the knight .

" But , [[my]764-the knight beloved]4702-my beloved , [I]764-the knight have found [thee]373-the prioress , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , and dropping upon one knee at [her]373-the prioress feet , [he]764-the knight put out [his]764-the knight hands to cover both hers . But [the Prioress]373-the prioress was too quick for [him]764-the knight . [She]373-the prioress hid [her]373-the prioress hands beneath [her]373-the prioress scapulary . [The Knight]764-the knight 's brown fingers closed on the lions ' heads .

" Touch [me]373-the prioress not , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress .

[The Knight]764-the knight flushed , darkly .

" [You]373-the prioress are [mine]764-the knight , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said . " [Mine]764-the knight to have and to keep . During these wretched years [we]4703-we have schooled [ourselves]4703-we each to think of [the other]4704-the other as wedded . Now [we]4703-we know that neither has been faithless . [I]764-the knight have found [thee]373-the prioress , [[my]764-the knight beloved]4702-my beloved , and [I]764-the knight will not let [thee]373-the prioress go . "[764-the knight]

" [Hugh]132-hugh , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , " [I]373-the prioress am wedded . [You]132-hugh come too late . Saw [you]132-hugh not the sacred ring upon [my]373-the prioress hand ? Know [you]132-hugh not that [every nun]4706-every nun is [the bride of [Christ]105-christ]4707-the bride of christ ? "[373-the prioress]

" [You]373-the prioress are mine ! "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , fiercely ; and [he]764-the knight laid [his]764-the knight great hand upon [her]373-the prioress knee .

From beneath [her]373-the prioress scapulary , [the Prioress]373-the prioress drew the dagger .

" Before [I]373-the prioress went to the cloister door , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " [I]373-the prioress took this from its hiding - place , and put it in [my]373-the prioress girdle . [I]373-the prioress guessed [I]373-the prioress had [a man]4482-a man to deal with ; though , [Heaven]142-heaven knows , [I]373-the prioress dreamed not it was [thou]4482-a man ! But [I]373-the prioress tell [thee]373-the prioress , [Hugh]132-hugh , if [thou]4482-a man , or [any man]4301-any man , attempt to lay defiling touch upon [any nun in [this Priory]4711-this priory [myself]373-the prioress]4710-any nun in this priory myself , or another [I]373-the prioress strike , and [I]373-the prioress strike [home]305-home . This blade will be driven up to the hilt in [the offender]4713-the offender 's heart . "[373-the prioress]

[The Knight]764-the knight rose to [his]764-the knight feet , stepped to the window and leaned , with folded arms , against the wall .

" Put back [thy]764-the knight weapon , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , sternly , " into its hiding - place . [No other man]4714-no other man is [here]4536-here ; yet , should another come , [my]764-the knight sword would well suffice to guard thine honour , and the honour of [[thy]764-the knight nuns]4716-thy nuns . "[764-the knight]

[She]802-she looked at [his]764-the knight dark face , scornful in its pain ; then went at once , obedient , to the secret panel .

" Yes , [Hugh]132-hugh , "[802-she] [she]802-she said . " That much of trust indeed [I]802-she owe [thy]764-the knight love . "[802-she]

As [she]802-she placed the dagger in the wall and closed the panel , something fell from [her]802-she , intangible , yet real .

For so long , [she]802-she had had to command . Bowing , kneeling , [hurrying women]803-hurrying women flew to do [her]802-she behests . [Each]415-each vied with [the others]805-the others to magnify [[her]802-she Office]806-her office . Often , [she]802-she felt lonely by reason of [her]802-she dignity .

And now [a man]4482-a man 's dark face frowned on [her]802-she in scornful anger ; [a man]4482-a man 's stern voice flung back [her]802-she elaborate threat with a short command , which disarmed [her]802-she , yet which [she]802-she obeyed . Moreover , [she]802-she found it strangely sweet to obey . Behind the sternness , behind the scornful anger , there throbbed a great love . In that love [she]802-she trusted ; but with that love [she]802-she had to deal , putting it from [her]802-she with a finality which should be beyond question .

Yet [the " Prioress]4717-the " prioress "[802-she] fell from [her]802-she , as [she]802-she closed the panel . It was [the Woman]809-the woman and [the Saint]810-the saint who moved over to the window and stood beside [the Knight]764-the knight , in the radiance of a golden sunset after storm . There was about [her]802-she , as [she]802-she spoke , a wistful humbleness ; and a patient sadness , infinitely touching .

" [Sir Hugh]132-hugh , "[802-she] [she]802-she said , " [[my]802-she dear]4718-my dear Knight , whom [I]802-she ever found brave and tender , and whom [I]802-she now know to have been always loyal and true there is no need that [I]802-she should add a word to [your]132-hugh recital . The facts [you]132-hugh wrung from [Alfrida God]143-god grant forgiveness to that tormented heart are all true . Believing [the messenger]4548-the messenger , not dreaming of doubting [Eleanor]138-eleanor , [my]802-she one thought was to hide from [the world]389-the world [my]802-she broken heart , [my]802-she shattered pride . [I]802-she hastened to offer to [God]143-god the love and the life which had been slighted by [man]4362-man . [I]802-she confess this has since seemed to [me]802-she but a poor second - best to have brought to [Him]4362-man , Who indeed should have [our]4722-our very best . But , daily kneeling at [His]4362-man Feet , [I]802-she said : ' A broken and a contrite heart , [Lord]4723-lord , [Thou]143-god wilt not despise . ' [My]802-she heart was ' broken , ' when [I]802-she brought it [here]4536-here . It has been ' contrite ' since . And well [I]802-she know , although so far from worthy , it has not been despised . "[802-she]

[She]812-she lifted [her]812-she eyes to the golden glory behind the battlements of purple cloud .

" [[Our]815-our blessed [Lady]4726-lady]4297-our blessed lady interceded , "[812-she] [she]812-she said , simply ; ' [she]812-she , who understands [a woman]813-a woman 's heart . "[812-she]

[The Knight]764-the knight was breathing hard . The folded arms rose and fell , with the heaving of [his]764-the knight chest . But [he]764-the knight kept [his]764-the knight lips firm shut ; though praying , all the while , that [[our]815-our Lady]4260-our lady might have , also , some understanding of the heart of [a man]4482-a man !

" [I]812-she think it right that [you]764-the knight should know , dear [Hugh]132-hugh , "[812-she] went on the sad voice , gently ; " that , at first , [I]812-she suffered greatly . [I]812-she spent long agonizing nights , kneeling before [[our]815-our Lady]4260-our lady 's shrine , imploring strength to conquer the love and the longing which had become sin . "[812-she]

A stifled groan broke from [the Knight]764-the knight .

The golden light shone in [her]812-she steadfast eyes , and played about [her]812-she noble brow .

" And strength was given , "[812-she] [she]812-she said , very low .

" [Mora]144-mora ! "[764-the knight] cried [the Knight]764-the knight [She]764-the knight started . It was so long since [she]764-the knight had heard [her]764-the knight own name " [You]144-mora prayed for strength to conquer , when [you]144-mora thought it sin ; just as [I]764-the knight rode out to meet [the foe]4728-the foe , to fight and slay , and afterward wrestled with unknown tongues , doing all those things which were hardest , while striving to quench [my]764-the knight love for [you]144-mora . But when [I]764-the knight knew that [no other man]4714-no other man had right to [you]144-mora or ever had had right , why then [I]764-the knight found that nothing had slain [my]764-the knight love , nor ever could . And [Mora]144-mora , now [you]144-mora know that [I]764-the knight am free , is [your]144-mora love dead ? "[764-the knight]

[She]764-the knight clasped [her]764-the knight hands over the cross at [her]764-the knight breast . [His]820-i voice held a deep passion of appeal ; yet [he]820-i strove , loyally , to keep it calm .

" Listen , [Hugh]132-hugh , "[764-the knight] [she]764-the knight said . " If , thinking [me]764-the knight faithless , [you]144-mora had turned for consolation to another ; if , though [you]144-mora brought [her]764-the knight but [your]144-mora second best , [you]144-mora yet had won and [we]4730-we d [her]764-the knight ; now , finding after all that [I]764-the knight had not wedded [Humphry]139-humphry , would [you]144-mora leave [[your]144-mora bride]4731-your bride , and try to wake again [your]144-mora love for [me]764-the knight ? "[764-the knight]

" [You]764-the knight seek to place [me]820-i , "[820-i] [he]820-i said , " in straits in which , by [mine]820-i own act , [I]820-i shall never be . Loving [you]764-the knight as [I]820-i love [you]764-the knight , [I]820-i could [we]4732-we d [no other]4733-no other while [you]764-the knight live . "[820-i]

[She]821-she paled , but persisted .

" But , if , [Hugh]132-hugh ? If ? "[764-the knight]

" Then , no , "[820-i] [he]820-i said . " [I]820-i should not leave one [I]820-i had [we]4732-we d. But "[820-i]

" [Hugh]132-hugh , "[821-she] [she]821-she said , " thinking [you]132-hugh faithless , [I]821-she took the holy vows which wedded [me]821-she to [Heaven]335-heaven . How can [I]821-she leave [[my]821-she heavenly Bridegroom]4735-my heavenly bridegroom , for love of [any man upon [this earth]4737-this earth]4736-any man upon this earth ? "[821-she]

" Not ' [any man]4301-any man , ' "[820-i] [he]820-i answered ; " but [[your]764-the knight betrothed]4739-your betrothed , returned to claim [you]764-the knight ; [the man to whom [you]764-the knight said as parting words : ' [Maid]4518-maid or [wife]4520-wife , [I]820-i am all thine own]4740-the man to whom you said as parting words : ' maid or wife , i am all thine own ; thine and none other 's forever . ' Ah , that brings the warm blood to [thy]764-the knight cheek ! Oh , [my]820-i Heart 's Life , if it was true then , it is true still ! [God]143-god is not [a man that [he]143-god should lie , or rob another of [[his]143-god bride]4744-his bride]4743-a man that he should lie , or rob another of his bride . If [I]820-i had [we]4745-we d [another woman]4746-another woman , [I]820-i should have done that thing , honestly believing [thee]4746-another woman [the wife of [another man]4612-another man]4747-the wife of another man . But , all these years , while [thou]4749-thou and [I]820-i were both deceived , [He]143-god , Who knoweth all , has known the truth . [He]143-god knew [thee]4746-another woman betrothed to [me]820-i . [He]143-god heard [thee]4746-another woman say , upon the battlements , when last [we]4745-we stood together : ' [God]143-god knows , [I]820-i am all thine own . ' [He]143-god knew how , when [I]820-i thought [I]820-i had lost [thee]4746-another woman , [I]820-i yet lived faithful to the pure memory of [our]4745-we love . The day [thy]4746-another woman vows were made , [He]143-god knew that [I]820-i was free , and [thou]4746-another woman , therefore , still pledged to [me]820-i . Shall [a man]4482-a man rob [God]143-god ? Ay , [he]143-god may . But shall [God]143-god rob [a man]4482-a man ? Nay , then , never ! "[820-i]

[She]822-i trembled , wavered ; then fled to [the shrine of [the Virgin]608-the virgin]823-the shrine of the virgin , kneeling with hands outstretched .

" [Holy Mother of [God]143-god]4752-holy mother of god , "[822-i] [she]822-i sobbed , " teach [him]825-his that [I]822-i dare not do this thing ! Shew [him]825-his that [I]822-i can not break [my]822-i vows . Help [him]825-his to understand that [I]822-i would not , if [I]822-i could . "[822-i]

[He]825-his followed , and kneeled beside [her]822-i ; [his]825-his proud head bent ; [his]825-his voice breaking with emotion .

" [Blessed Virgin]145-blessed virgin , "[825-his] [he]825-his said . " [[Thou]4753-thou who didst dwell in [the earthly home at [Nazareth]30-nazareth]4755-the earthly home at nazareth]4754-thou who didst dwell in the earthly home at nazareth , help [this woman of mine]4756-this woman of mine to understand , that if [she]4756-this woman of mine break [her]4756-this woman of mine troth to [me]825-his , holding [herself]4756-this woman of mine from [me]825-his , now when [I]825-his am come to claim [her]4756-this woman of mine , [she]4756-this woman of mine sends [me]825-his forth to an empty life , to a hearth beside which [no woman]4757-no woman will sit , to a home forever desolate . "[825-his]

Together [they]826-they knelt , before the tender image of [Mother]827-mother and [Child]828-child ; together , yet apart ; [he]825-his , loyally mindful not so much as to brush against a fold of [her]827-mother veil .

The dark face , and the fair , were lifted , side by side , as [they]826-they knelt before [the Madonna]435-the madonna . For a while so motionless [they]826-they kneeled , [they]826-they might have been finely - modelled figures ; [he]825-his , bronze ; [she]827-mother , marble .

Then , with a sudden movement , [she]827-mother put out [her]827-mother right hand , and caught [his]825-his left .

Firmly [his]825-his fingers closed over [hers]827-mother ; but [he]825-his drew no nearer .

Yet as [they]826-they knelt thus with clasped hands , [his]825-his pulsing life seemed to flow through [her]827-mother , undoing , in one wild , sweet moment , the work of years of fast and vigil .

" Ah , [Hugh]132-hugh , "[827-mother] [she]827-mother cried , suddenly , ' spare [me]0-i ! Spare [me]0-i ! Tempt [me]0-i not ! "[827-mother]

Loosing [her]827-mother hand from [his]825-his , [she]827-mother clasped both upon [her]827-mother breast .

[The Knight]764-the knight rose , and stood beside [her]827-mother .

" [Mora]144-mora , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , and [his]764-the knight voice held a new tone , a tone of sadness and solemnity ; " far be it from [me]764-the knight to tempt [you]144-mora . [I]764-the knight will plead with [you]144-mora but once again , in presence of [[our]4758-our Lady]4260-our lady and of [the Holy Child]4760-the holy child ; and , having so done , [I]764-the knight will say no more .[764-the knight]

" [I]764-the knight ask [you]144-mora to leave [this place]4505-this place , which [you]144-mora would never have entered had [you]144-mora known [[your]144-mora lover]4762-your lover was [yours]144-mora , and needing [you]144-mora . [I]764-the knight ask [you]144-mora to keep [your]144-mora plighted word to [me]764-the knight , and to become [[my]764-the knight wife]4532-my wife . If [you]144-mora refuse , [I]764-the knight go , returning not again . [I]764-the knight leave [you]144-mora here , to kneel in peace , by night or day , before [the shrine of the Madonna]485-the shrine of the madonna . But [I]764-the knight bid [you]144-mora to remember , day and night , that because of this which [you]144-mora have done , there can be [no Madonna]4765-no madonna in [[my]764-the knight home]4615-my home . [No woman]4757-no woman will ever sit beside [my]764-the knight hearth , holding [a little child]4768-a little child upon [her]4757-no woman knees .[764-the knight]

" [You]144-mora leave to [me]764-the knight the crucifix heart broken , love betrayed ; feet and hands nailed to the wood of cruel circumstance ; side pierced by spear of treachery lonely , forsaken . But [you]144-mora take from [me]764-the knight all the best , both in life and in religion ; all that tells of love , of joy , of hope for the years to come .[764-the knight]

" Oh , [[my]764-the knight beloved]4702-my beloved , weigh it well ! There are so many , with a true vocation , serving Heaven in [Convent]4770-convent and in [Cloister]4771-cloister . There is but [one woman in [the whole world]4773-the whole world]4772-one woman in the whole world for [me]764-the knight . In the sight of [Heaven]142-heaven , nothing divides [us]4774-us . [Convent]4770-convent walls now stand between but [they]4776-they were built by [man]4362-man , not [God]143-god . Vows of celibacy were not meant to sunder loving hearts . [Mora]144-mora ? . . . Come ! "[764-the knight]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress rose and faced [him]832-you .

" [I]373-the prioress can not come , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said . " That which [I]373-the prioress have taught to [others]482-others , [I]373-the prioress must [myself]373-the prioress perform . [Hugh]132-hugh , [I]373-the prioress am dead to [the world]389-the world ; and if [I]373-the prioress be dead to [the world]389-the world , how can [I]373-the prioress live to [you]832-you ? Had [I]373-the prioress , in very deed , died and been entombed , [you]832-you would not have gone down into [the vaults]4781-the vaults and forced [my]373-the prioress resting - place , that [you]832-you might look upon [my]373-the prioress face , clasp [my]373-the prioress cold hand , and pour into deaf ears a tale of love . Yet that is what , by trick and artifice , [you]832-you now have done . [You]832-you come to [a dead woman]4782-a dead woman , saying ; ' Love [me]373-the prioress , and be [[my]373-the prioress wife]4532-my wife . ' [She]4782-a dead woman must , perforce , make answer : ' How shall [I]373-the prioress , who am dead to [the world]389-the world , live any longer therein ? ' Take [a wife]4785-a wife from among [the Living]4786-the living , [Hugh]132-hugh . Come not to seek [a bride among the Dead]4787-a bride among the dead . "[373-the prioress]

" [Mother of God]4434-mother of god ! "[764-the knight] exclaimed [the Knight]764-the knight , " is this religion ? "[764-the knight]

[He]764-the knight turned to the window , then to the door . " How can [I]764-the knight go from here ? "[764-the knight]

The stifled horror in [his]764-the knight voice chilled the very soul of [the woman to whom [he]764-the knight spoke]834-the woman to whom he spoke . [She]834-the woman to whom he spoke had , indeed at last made [him]764-the knight to understand .

" [I]834-the woman to whom he spoke must get [you]764-the knight hence unseen , "[834-the woman to whom he spoke] [she]834-the woman to whom he spoke said . " [I]834-the woman to whom he spoke dare not pass [you]764-the knight out by the Convent gate . [I]834-the woman to whom he spoke fear [me]834-the woman to whom he spoke , [you]764-the knight must go back the way [you]764-the knight came ; nor can [you]764-the knight go alone . [We]4789-we hold the key to unlock the door leading from [[our]4789-we passage]4790-our passage into [the Cathedral crypt]297-the cathedral crypt . [I]834-the woman to whom he spoke will now send [all [the nuns]298-the nuns to [the Refectory]4794-the refectory]4792-all the nuns to the refectory . Then [I]834-the woman to whom he spoke [myself]834-the woman to whom he spoke must take [you]764-the knight to [the crypt]273-the crypt . "[834-the woman to whom he spoke]

" Can [I]764-the knight not walk alone , "[764-the knight] asked [the Knight]764-the knight , brusquely ; " returning [you]764-the knight the key by messenger ? "[764-the knight]

" Nay , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , " [I]373-the prioress dare run no risks . So quickly rumours are afloat . To - morrow , this strange hour must be a dream ; and [you]764-the knight and [I]373-the prioress alone , [the dreamers]4796-the dreamers . Now , while [I]373-the prioress go and make safe the way , put [you]764-the knight on again the robe and hood . When [I]373-the prioress return and beckon , follow silently . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress passed out , closing the door behind [her]91-mother sub - prioress .

CHAPTER XIII

" SEND [HER]839-her nuns TO [ME]373-the prioress ! "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress stood for a moment outside the closed door . The peaceful silence of [the passage]497-the passage helped [her]373-the prioress to the outward calm which must be [hers]373-the prioress before [she]373-the prioress could bring [herself]373-the prioress to face [[her]373-the prioress nuns]839-her nuns .

Moving slowly to the farther end , [she]373-the prioress unlocked [the cell of [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine]840-the cell of sister mary seraphine , feeling a shamed humility that [she]373-the prioress should have made so sure [she]373-the prioress had to deal with " [Wilfred]106-wilfred , "[373-the prioress] and have thought such scorn of [him]841-him and [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine . Alas ! The wrong deeds of those [they]842-they love , oft humble [the purest , noblest spirits]843-the purest , noblest spirits into the soiling dust .

Next , [the Prioress]373-the prioress [herself]373-the prioress rang the Refectory bell .

The hour for the evening meal was long passed ; [the nuns]298-the nuns hastened out , readily .

As [they]298-the nuns trooped toward the stairs leading down to [the Refectory]4794-the refectory , [they]298-the nuns saw [[their]298-the nuns Prioress]847-their prioress , very pale , very erect , standing with [her]847-their prioress back to the door of [[her]847-their prioress chamber]4322-her chamber .

[Each nun]849-each nun made a genuflexion as [she]847-their prioress passed ; and to each , [the Prioress]373-the prioress slightly inclined [her]373-the prioress head .

To [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , who kneeled at once , [she]90-sister mary rebecca spoke : " [I]90-sister mary rebecca come not to the meal this evening . In the absence of [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , [you]90-sister mary rebecca will take [my]90-sister mary rebecca place . "[90-sister mary rebecca]

" Yes , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , "[90-sister mary rebecca] said [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , meekly , and kissed the hem of the robe of [the Prioress]373-the prioress ; then rising , hastened on , charmed to have a position of authority , however temporary .

When all had passed , [the Prioress]373-the prioress went into [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , walked round [them]316-the cloisters ; looked over into [the garden]358-the garden , observing every possible place from which prying eyes might have sight of the way from [the passage]497-the passage to [the crypt]273-the crypt entrance . But [the garden]358-the garden , already full of purple shadows , was left to [the circling swifts]858-the circling swifts . [The robin]339-the robin sang an evening song from the bough , of [the pieman]547-the pieman 's tree .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress returned along [the passage]497-the passage , looking into [every cell]863-every cell . Each door stood open wide ; [each cell]4469-each cell was empty . [The sick nuns]865-the sick nuns were on a further passage , round the corner , beyond the Refectory stairs . Yet [she]373-the prioress passed along this also , making sure that the door of [each occupied cell]866-each occupied cell was shut .

Standing motionless at the top of the Refectory steps , [she]373-the prioress could hear the distant clatter of platters , the shuffling feet of [the lay - sisters]311-the lay - sisters as [they]311-the lay - sisters carried the dishes to and from [the kitchens]4328-the kitchens ; and , above it all , the monotonous voice of [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca reading aloud to [the nuns]298-the nuns while [they]298-the nuns supped .

Then [the Prioress]373-the prioress took down one of [the crypt lanterns]871-the crypt lanterns and lighted it .

Meanwhile [the Knight , left alone]872-the knight , left alone , stood for a few moments , as if stunned .

[He]872-the knight , left alone had played for a big stake and lost ; yet [he]872-the knight , left alone felt more unnerved by the unexpected finality of [his]872-the knight , left alone own acquiescence in defeat , than by the firm refusal which had brought that defeat about .

It seemed to [him]872-the knight , left alone , as [he]872-the knight , left alone now stood alone , that suddenly [he]872-the knight , left alone had realised the extraordinary detachment wrought by years of cloistered life . Aflame with love and longing [he]872-the knight , left alone had come , seeking [the Living among the Dead]126-the dead . It would have been less bitter to have knelt beside [[her]373-the prioress tomb]873-her tomb , knowing the heart forever still had , to the last , beat true with love for [him]872-the knight , left alone ; knowing the dead arms , lying cold and stiff , had [he]872-the knight , left alone come sooner , would have been flung around [him]872-the knight , left alone ; knowing the lips , now silent in death , living , would have called to [him]872-the knight , left alone in tenderest greeting .

But this cold travesty of [the radiant woman [he]872-the knight , left alone had left]874-the radiant woman he had left , said : " Touch [me]874-the radiant woman he had left not , "[874-the radiant woman he had left] and bade [him]872-the knight , left alone seek [a wife]4785-a wife elsewhere ; [he]872-the knight , left alone , who had remained faithful to [her]373-the prioress , even when [he]872-the knight , left alone had thought [her]373-the prioress faithless .

And yet , cold though [she]373-the prioress was , in [her]373-the prioress saintly aloofness , [she]373-the prioress was still [the woman [he]872-the knight , left alone loved]876-the woman he loved . Moreover [she]373-the prioress still had the noble carriage , the rich womanly beauty , the look of vital , physical vigour , which marked [her]373-the prioress out as meant by Nature to be [the mother of [brave sons]878-brave sons and [fair daughters]879-fair daughters]877-the mother of brave sons and fair daughters . Yet [he]872-the knight , left alone must leave [her]373-the prioress to this !

[He]872-the knight , left alone looked round [the room]495-the room , noted the low archway leading to [the sleeping chamber]881-the sleeping chamber , took a step toward [it]881-the sleeping chamber , then fell back as from [a sanctuary]882-a sanctuary ; marked the great table , covered with missals , parchments , and vellum . It might well have been the cell of [a learned monk]883-a learned monk , rather than [the chamber of [the woman [he]872-the knight , left alone loved]876-the woman he loved]884-the chamber of the woman he loved . [His]872-the knight , left alone eye , travelling round , fell upon [the Madonna and Child]886-the madonna and child .

In the pure evening light there was a strangely arresting quality about the marble group ; something infinitely human in the brooding tenderness of [the Mother]4606-the mother , as [she]4606-the mother bent over [the smiling Babe]888-the smiling babe . It spoke of [home]305-home , rather than of [the cloister]286-the cloister . It struck a chord in the heart of [the Knight]764-the knight , a chord which rang clear and true , above the jangle of disputation and bitterness .

[He]872-the knight , left alone put out [his]872-the knight , left alone hand and touched the little foot of [the Holy Babe]606-the holy babe .

" [Mother of [God]143-god]4434-mother of god , "[872-the knight , left alone] [he]872-the knight , left alone said aloud , ' send [her]606-the holy babe to [me]0-i ! Take pity on a hungry heart , [a lonely home]893-a lonely home , [a desolate hearth]894-a desolate hearth . Send [her]606-the holy babe to [me]0-i ! "[872-the knight , left alone]

Then [he]872-the knight , left alone lifted from the floor the white robe and hood , and drew them on .

CHAPTER XIV

FAREWELL HERE , AND NOW

When [the Prioress]373-the prioress , a lighted lantern in [her]373-the prioress hand , opened the door of [[her]373-the prioress chamber]4322-her chamber , [a tall figure in the dress of the White Ladies of Worcester]897-a tall figure in the dress of the white ladies of worcester stood motionless against the wall , facing the door .

" Come ! "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress whispered , beckoning ; and , noiselessly , [it]897-a tall figure in the dress of the white ladies of worcester stood beside [her]373-the prioress . Then [she]373-the prioress closed the door and , using [her]373-the prioress master - key , locked it behind [her]373-the prioress .

Silently [the two white figures]898-the two white figures passed along [the passage]497-the passage , through [the cloister]286-the cloister , and down the flight of steps into [the Convent crypt]901-the convent crypt . [The Prioress]373-the prioress unlocked the door and stooping [they]898-the two white figures passed under the arch , and entered [the subterranean way]714-the subterranean way .

Placing the lantern on the ground , [the Prioress]373-the prioress drew out the key , closed the door , and locked it on the inside .

[She]373-the prioress turned , and lifting the lantern , saw that [the Knight]764-the knight had rid [himself]764-the knight of [his]764-the knight disguise , and now stood before [her]373-the prioress , very straight and tall , just within the circle of light cast by [her]373-the prioress lantern .

With the closing and locking of the door a strange sense came over [them]898-the two white figures , as of standing together in a third world neither [his]764-the knight nor [hers]906-hers tomblike in its complete isolation and darkness ; heavy with a smell of earth and damp stones ; the slightest sound reverberating in hollow exaggeration ; yet , in itself , silent as the grave .

This tomblike quality in [their]898-the two white figures surroundings seemed to make [their]898-the two white figures own vitality stronger and more palpitating .

The seconds of silence , after the grating of the key in the lock ceased , seemed hours .

Then [the Knight]764-the knight spoke .

" Give [me]764-the knight the lantern , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said .

[She]373-the prioress met [his]764-the knight eyes . Again the dignity of [[her]373-the prioress Office]806-her office slipped from [her]373-the prioress . Again it was sweet to obey . [He]764-the knight held the lantern so that its light illumined [her]373-the prioress face and [his]764-the knight .

" [Mora]144-mora , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , " it is long since [thou]4798-thou and [I]764-the knight last walked together over [the sunny fields]4799-the sunny fields , amid buttercups and cowslips , and the sweet - smelling clover . To - night [we]898-the two white figures walk beneath [the fields]4800-the fields instead of through [them]4800-the fields . [We]898-the two white figures are under the grass , [[my]764-the knight sweet]4801-my sweet . [I]764-the knight seem to stand beside [thee]373-the prioress in the grave . And truly [my]764-the knight hopes lie slain ; the promise of [our]898-the two white figures love is dead , and shall soon be buried . Yet [thou]4798-thou and [I]764-the knight still live , and now must walk together side by side , the sad ghosts of [our]898-the two white figures former selves .[764-the knight]

" So now [I]909-his ask [thee]373-the prioress , [Mora]144-mora , for the sake of those past walks among the flowers , to lay [thy]373-the prioress hand within [my]909-his arm and walk with [me]909-his in gentle fellowship , here in [this place of gloom and darkness]4802-this place of gloom and darkness , as , long ago , [we]898-the two white figures walked among the flowers . "[909-his]

[His]909-his dark eyes searched [her]910-her face . An almost youthful eagerness vibrated in [his]909-his voice .

[She]910-her hesitated , lifting [her]910-her eyes to [his]909-his . Then slowly moved toward [him]909-his and laid [her]910-her hand within [his]909-his arm .

Then , side by side , [they]911-they paced on through the darkness ; [he]909-his , in [his]909-his right hand , holding the lantern , swinging low , to light [their]911-they feet ; [she]910-her , leaning on [his]909-his left arm , keeping slow pace with [him]909-his .

Over [their]911-they heads , in [the meadows]912-the meadows , walked [lovers]913-lovers , arm in arm ; [young men]914-young men and [maidens]915-maidens out in the gathering twilight . All nature , refreshed , poured forth a fragrant sweetness . But the rose , with its dewy petals , seemed to [the youth]916-the youth less sweet than the lips of [the maid]917-the maid . This , [he]909-his shyly ventured to tell [her]910-her ; whereupon , as [she]910-her bent to its fragrance , [her]910-her cheeks reflected the crimson of those delicate folds .

So walked and talked [young lovers]918-young lovers in [the [Worcester]1-worcester meadows]919-the worcester meadows ; little dreaming that , beneath [their]911-they happy feet , [the Knight]764-the knight and [the Prioress]373-the prioress paced slowly , side by side , through the darkness .

No word passed between [them]911-they . With , [her]910-her hand upon [his]909-his arm , [her]910-her face so near [his]909-his shoulder , [his]909-his arm pressing [her]910-her hand closer and closer against [his]909-his heart , silence said more than speech . And in silence [they]911-they walked .

[They]911-they passed beneath the city wall , under [the Foregate]922-the foregate .

[The Sheriff]923-the sheriff rode [home]305-home to supper , well pleased with a stroke of business accomplished in [a house in which [he]923-the sheriff had chanced to shelter during the storm]925-a house in which he had chanced to shelter during the storm .

[The good people of [Worcester]1-worcester]926-the good people of worcester bought and sold in [the market]927-the market . [Men whose day 's work was over]928-men whose day 's work was over , hastened to reach the rest and comfort of [wife]4520-wife and [home]305-home . [Crowds]931-crowds jostled gaily through [the streets]932-the streets , little dreaming that beneath [their]911-they hurrying , busy feet , [the Knight]764-the knight and [the Prioress]373-the prioress paced slowly , side by side , through the darkness .

Had [the Knight]764-the knight spoken , [her]373-the prioress mind would have been up in arms to resist [him]764-the knight . But , because [he]764-the knight walked in silence , [her]373-the prioress heart had leisure to remember ; and , remembering , it grew sorely tender .

At length [they]911-they reached the doorway leading into [the Cathedral crypt]297-the cathedral crypt .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress carried the key in [her]91-mother sub - prioress left hand . Freeing [her]91-mother sub - prioress right from the grip of [his]764-the knight arm , [she]91-mother sub - prioress slipped the key noiselessly into the lock ; but , leaving it there unturned , [she]91-mother sub - prioress paused , and faced [the Knight]764-the knight .

" [Hugh]132-hugh , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress said , " [I]91-mother sub - prioress beg [you]132-hugh , for [my]91-mother sub - prioress sake and for the sake of all whose fair fame is under [my]91-mother sub - prioress care , to pass through quickly into [the crypt]273-the crypt , and to go from thence , if possible , unseen , or in such manner as shall prevent any suspicion that [you]132-hugh come from out this hidden way . Tales of wrong are told so readily , and so quickly grow . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

" [I]764-the knight will observe the utmost caution , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight .

" [Hugh]132-hugh , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress said , " [I]91-mother sub - prioress grieve to have had , perforce , to disappoint [you]132-hugh . "[91-mother sub - prioress] The brave voice shook . " This is [our]4804-our final farewell . Do [you]132-hugh forgive [me]764-the knight , [Hugh]132-hugh ? Will [you]132-hugh think kindly , if [you]132-hugh ever think on [me]764-the knight ? "[764-the knight]

[The Knight]764-the knight held the lantern so that its rays illumined both [her]91-mother sub - prioress face and [his]764-the knight .

" [Mora]144-mora , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , " [I]764-the knight can not as yet take [thine]144-mora answer as final . [I]764-the knight will return no more , nor try to speak with [thee]144-mora again . But five days longer , [I]764-the knight shall wait . [I]764-the knight shall have plans made with the utmost care , to bear [thee]144-mora , in safety and unseen , from [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral . [I]764-the knight know the doors are watched , and that [all who pass in and out]4806-all who pass in and out are noted and observed . But , if [thou]144-mora wilt but come to [me]764-the knight , [beloved]4807-beloved , trust [me]764-the knight to know how to guard [mine]764-the knight own . . . . Nay , speak not ! Hear [me]764-the knight out .[764-the knight]

" Daily , after Vespers , [I]940-i shall stand hidden among the pillars , close to the winding stair . One step aside only one step and [my]940-i arm will be around [thee]144-mora . A new life of love and [home]305-home will lie before [us]4809-we . [I]940-i shall take [thee]144-mora , safely concealed , to [the hostel where [I]940-i and [[my]940-i men]4664-my men now lodge]4810-the hostel where i and my men now lodge . There , horses will stand ready , and [we]4809-we shall ride at once to [Warwick]32-warwick . At [Warwick]32-warwick [we]4809-we shall find [a priest one in high favour]4812-a priest one in high favour , both in [Church]4813-church and State who knows all , and is prepared to [we]4809-we d [us]4809-we without delay . After which , by easy stages , [[my]940-i wife]4532-my wife , [I]940-i shall take [thee]941-she [home]305-home . "[940-i]

[He]940-i swung the lantern high . [She]941-she saw the lovelight and the triumph , in [his]940-i eyes . " [I]940-i shall take [thee]941-she [home]305-home ! "[940-i] [he]940-i said .

[She]941-she stepped back a pace , lifting both hands toward [him]940-i , palms outward , and stood thus gazing , with eyes full of sorrow .

" [[My]941-she poor [Hugh]132-hugh]4817-my poor hugh , "[941-she] [she]941-she whispered ; " it is useless to wait . [I]941-she shall not come . "[941-she]

" Yet five days , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , " [I]764-the knight shall tarry in [Worcester]1-worcester . Each day , after Vespers , [I]764-the knight shall be here . "[764-the knight]

" Go to - day , [dear Hugh]132-hugh . Ride to [Warwick]32-warwick and tell [[thy]941-she priest]4818-thy priest , that which indeed [he]4818-thy priest should know without the telling : that [a nun]412-a nun does not break [her]412-a nun vows . This is [our]4820-our final farewell , [Hugh]132-hugh . [Thou]941-she hadst best believe it , and go . "[941-she]

" [Our]4820-our last farewell ? "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said .

" [Our]4820-our last . "[941-she]

" Here and now ? "[941-she]

" Here and now , [dear Hugh]132-hugh . "[941-she]

Looking into that calm face , so lovely in its sadness , [he]764-the knight saw that [she]943-her meant it .

Of a sudden [he]764-the knight knew [he]764-the knight had lost [her]943-her ; [he]764-the knight knew life 's way stretched lonely before [him]764-the knight , evermore .

" Yes , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , " yes . It is indeed farewell here and now forever . "[764-the knight]

The dull despair in the voice which , but a few moments before , had vibrated with love and hope , wrung [her]943-her heart .

[She]943-her still held [her]943-her hands before [her]943-her , as if to ward [him]764-the knight off .

" Ah , [Hugh]132-hugh , "[943-her] [she]943-her cried , sharply , " be merciful , and go ! Spare [me]943-her , and go quickly . "[943-her]

[The Knight]764-the knight heard in [her]943-her voice a tone it had not hitherto held . But [he]764-the knight loved [her]943-her loyally ; therefore [he]764-the knight kept [his]764-the knight own anguish under strong control .

Placing the lantern on the ground , [he]764-the knight knelt on one knee before [her]943-her .

" Farewell , [[my]764-the knight Love]4821-my love , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said . " [[Our]4822-our Lady]4260-our lady comfort [thee]943-her ; and may [Heaven]142-heaven forgive [me]764-the knight , for that [I]764-the knight have disturbed [thy]943-her peace . "[764-the knight]

With which [he]764-the knight lifted the hem of [her]943-her robe , and pressed [his]764-the knight lips upon it .

Thus [he]764-the knight knelt , for a space , [his]764-the knight dark head bent .

Slowly , slowly , [the Prioress]373-the prioress let drop [her]373-the prioress hands until , lightly as the fall of autumn leaves , sad autumn leaves they rested upon [his]764-the knight head , in blessing and farewell .

But feeling [his]764-the knight hair beneath [her]373-the prioress hands , [she]373-the prioress could not keep from softly smoothing it , nor from passing [her]373-the prioress fingers gently in and out of its crisp thickness .

Then [her]373-the prioress heart stood still , for of a sudden , in the silence , [she]373-the prioress heard a shuddering sob .

With a cry , [she]373-the prioress bent and gathered [him]764-the knight to [her]373-the prioress , holding [his]764-the knight head first against [her]373-the prioress knees , then stooping lower to clasp it to [her]373-the prioress breast ; then as [his]764-the knight strong arms were flung around [her]373-the prioress , [she]373-the prioress loosed [his]764-the knight head , and , as [he]764-the knight rose to [his]764-the knight feet , slipped [her]373-the prioress arms about [his]764-the knight neck , and surrendered to [his]764-the knight embrace .

[His]764-the knight lips sought [hers]373-the prioress , and at once [she]373-the prioress yielded [them]946-them . [His]764-the knight strong hands held [her]373-the prioress , and [she]373-the prioress , feeling the force of [their]947-they constraint , did but clasp [him]764-the knight closer .

Long [they]947-they stood thus . In that embrace a life - time of pain passed from [them]947-they , a life - time of bliss was born , and came with a rush to maturity , bringing with it a sense of utter completeness . A world of sweetest trust and certainty filled [them]947-they ; a joy so perfect , that the lonely vista of future years seemed , in that moment , to matter not at all .

All about [them]947-they was darkness , silence as of [the tomb]948-the tomb ; the heavy smell of earth ; the dank chill of the grave .

Yet [theirs]947-they was life more abundant ; theirs , joy undreamed of ; [theirs]947-they , love beyond all imagining , while those moments lasted .

Then

The hands about [his]764-the knight neck loosened , unclasped , fell gently away .

[He]764-the knight set free [her]373-the prioress lips , and [they]947-they took [their]947-they liberty .

[He]764-the knight unlocked [his]764-the knight arms , and stepping back [she]373-the prioress stood erect , like a fair white lily , needing no prop nor stay .

So [they]947-they stood for a space , looking upon [one another]666-one another in silence . This thing which had happened , was too wonderful for speech .

Then [the Prioress]373-the prioress turned the key in the lock .

The heavy door swung open .

A dim , grey light , like a pearly dawn at sea , came downwards from [the crypt]273-the crypt .

Without a word [the Knight]764-the knight , bending [his]764-the knight head , passed under the archway , mounted the steps , and was lost to view among the many pillars .

[She]373-the prioress closed the door , locked it , and withdrawing the key , stood alone where [they]947-they had stood together .

Then , sinking to the ground , [she]373-the prioress laid [her]373-the prioress face in the dust , there where [his]764-the knight feet had been .

It was farewell , here and now ; farewell forever .

After a while [the Prioress]373-the prioress rose , took up the lantern , and started upon [her]373-the prioress lonely journey , back to the cloister door .

CHAPTER XV

" SHARPEN THE WITS OF [MARY ANTONY]85-mary antony "[373-the prioress]

When [the Prioress]373-the prioress started upon [her]373-the prioress pilgrimage to [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral with [the Knight]764-the knight , [she]373-the prioress locked the door of [[her]373-the prioress chamber]4322-her chamber , knowing that thus [her]373-the prioress absence would remain undiscovered ; for if any , knocking on the door , received no answer , or trying it , found it fast , [they]958-they would hasten away without question ; concluding that some special hour of devotion or time of study demanded that [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother should be free from intrusion .

The atmosphere of [the empty cell]960-the empty cell , charged during the past hour with such unaccustomed forces of conflict and of passion , settled into the quietude of an unbroken stillness .

[The Madonna]146-the madonna smiled serenely upon [the Holy Babe]147-the holy babe . [The dead Christ , with bowed head]961-the dead christ , with bowed head , hung forlorn upon the wooden cross . The ponderous volumes in black and silver bindings , lay undisturbed upon the table ; and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's chair stood empty , with that obtrusive emptiness which , in an empty seat , seems to suggest an unseen presence filling [it]963-it . The silence was complete .

But presently a queer shuffling sound began in [the inner cell]618-the inner cell , as of something stiff and torpid compelling itself to action .

Then [a weird figure , the wizen face distorted by grief and terror]965-a weird figure , the wizen face distorted by grief and terror , appeared in the doorway [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony , holding a meat chopper in [her]85-mary antony shaking hands , and staring , with chattering gums , into [the empty cell]960-the empty cell .

[That faithful soul]967-that faithful soul , although dismissed , had resolved that [the adored Reverend Mother]968-the adored reverend mother should not go forth to meet [dangers ghostly or corporeal alone and unprotected]969-dangers ghostly or corporeal alone and unprotected .

Hastening to [the kitchens]4328-the kitchens , [she]85-mary antony had given instructions that the evening meal was not to be served until [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother [herself]93-the reverend mother should sound the bell .

Then , catching up [a meat chopper]971-a meat chopper , as being the most murderous - looking weapon at hand , and the most likely to strike terror into the ghostly heart of [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha , [old Antony]85-mary antony had hastened back to [the passage]497-the passage .

Creeping up [the stairs]973-the stairs , hugging the wall , [she]85-mary antony had reached the top just in time to see , in the dim distance , the two tall white figures confronting [one another]666-one another .

Clinging to [[her]85-mary antony chopper]975-her chopper , motionless with horror , [she]85-mary antony had watched [them]976-they , until [they]976-they began , to come toward [her]85-mary antony , moving in the direction of [the [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's cell]428-the reverend mother 's cell . [They]976-they were still thirty yards away , at the cloister end of [the passage]497-the passage . [Old Antony]103-mary antony was close to the open door .

Through it [she]85-mary antony had scurried , unheard , unseen , a terrified black shadow ; yet brave withal ; for with [her]85-mary antony went [the meat chopper]979-the meat chopper . Also [she]85-mary antony might have turned and fled back down [the stairs]973-the stairs , rather than into the very place whither [she]85-mary antony knew [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother was conducting [this tall spectre of the long dead [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha , grown to most alarming proportions during [her]87-sister agatha fifty years ' entombment]981-this tall spectre of the long dead sister agatha , grown to most alarming proportions during her fifty years ' entombment ! But being brave and faithful [old Antony]103-mary antony had sped into [the inner cell]618-the inner cell , and crouched there in a corner ; ready to call for help or strike with [her]85-mary antony chopper , should need arise .

Thus it came to pass that [this old weaver of romances]983-this old weaver of romances had perforce become [a listener to a true romance so thrilling , so soul - stirring]984-a listener to a true romance so thrilling , so soul - stirring , that [she]85-mary antony had had to thrust the end of the wooden handle of [the chopper]985-the chopper into [her]85-mary antony mouth , lest [she]85-mary antony should applaud [the noble Knight]986-the noble knight , cry counsel in [his]986-the noble knight extremities , or invoke blessings on [his]986-the noble knight enterprise . At each mention of [the Ladies Eleanor]138-eleanor and [Alfrida]143-god , [she]85-mary antony shook [her]85-mary antony fist , and made signs with [her]85-mary antony old fingers , as of throttling , in the air . And when [the clerkly messenger]987-the clerkly messenger , arriving to speak with [the Lady Alfrida]137-alfrida who , [Saint Luke]148-saint luke be praised , was by that time dying found [the Knight]764-the knight awaiting [him]987-the clerkly messenger with a noose flung over a strong bough , [old Antony]103-mary antony had laid down [the chopper]985-the chopper that [she]85-mary antony might the better hug [herself]85-mary antony with silent glee ; and when [the Knight]764-the knight rode away and left [him]764-the knight hanging , [she]85-mary antony had whispered " [Pieman]111-master pieman ! [Pieman]111-master pieman ! "[85-mary antony] then clapped [her]85-mary antony hands over [her]85-mary antony mouth , rocking to and fro with merriment . When [the Knight]764-the knight made mention that [they]992-they called [him]764-the knight " [Knight of the Bloody Vest]4389-knight of the bloody vest , "[764-the knight] [old Antony]103-mary antony had started ; then had shaken [her]85-mary antony finger toward the entrance , as [she]85-mary antony was used to shake it at the robin , and had opened [her]85-mary antony wallet to search for crumbs of cheese . But soon again the story held [her]85-mary antony and , oblivious of the present , [she]85-mary antony had been back in the realms of romance .

Not until [the Knight]764-the knight ceased speaking and [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's sad voice fell upon [her]85-mary antony ear , had [old Antony]103-mary antony realised the true bearing of the tale . Thereafter [her]85-mary antony heart had been torn by grief and terror . When [they]992-they kneeled together , before [the Madonna]435-the madonna , with uplifted faces , [Mary Antony]103-mary antony had crawled forward and peeped . [She]103-mary antony had seen [them]992-they kneeling [a noble pair]995-a noble pair had seen [the Prioress]373-the prioress catch at [his]764-the knight hand and clasp it ; then , crawling back had fallen prostrate , overwhelmed , a huddled heap upon the floor .

The ringing of the Refectory bell had roused [her]103-mary antony from [her]103-mary antony stupor in time to hear the impassioned appeal of [the Knight]764-the knight , as [he]764-the knight kneeled alone before [[the Virgin]608-the virgin 's shrine]609-the virgin 's shrine .

Then , [the Knight]764-the knight and [the Prioress]373-the prioress both being gone , [Mary Antony]103-mary antony had arisen , lifted [her]103-mary antony chopper with hands that trembled , and now stood with [distraught mien]1002-distraught mien , surveying [the empty cell]960-the empty cell .

At length it dawned upon [her]103-mary antony that [she]103-mary antony and [her]103-mary antony weapon were locked into [[the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother 's cell]428-the reverend mother 's cell ; [she]103-mary antony , who had been most explicitly bidden to go to [the kitchens]4328-the kitchens and to remain [there]333-there . It had been a sense of the enormity of [her]103-mary antony offence in having disobeyed [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's orders which , unconsciously , had caused [her]103-mary antony to stifle all ejaculations and move without noise , lest [she]103-mary antony should be discovered .

Yet now [her]103-mary antony first care was not for [her]103-mary antony own predicament , but for [the two noble hearts]1008-the two noble hearts , of whose tragic grief [she]103-mary antony had secretly been [a witness]1009-a witness .

[Her]103-mary antony eye fell on [the Madonna]435-the madonna , calmly smiling .

[She]103-mary antony tottered forward , kneeling where [the Prioress]373-the prioress had knelt .

" [Holy Mother of God]89-god , "[103-mary antony] [she]103-mary antony whispered , " teach [him]764-the knight that [she]435-the madonna can not do this thing ! "[103-mary antony]

Then , moving along on [her]103-mary antony knees to where [the Knight]764-the knight had kneeled : " [Blessed Virgin]145-blessed virgin ! "[103-mary antony] [she]103-mary antony cried , ' shew [her]435-the madonna that [she]435-the madonna can not leave [him]764-the knight desolate ! "[103-mary antony]

Then shuffling back to the centre , and kneeling between [the two places]1013-the two places : " [Sweetest Lady]149-sweetest lady , "[103-mary antony] [she]103-mary antony said , " be pleased to sharpen the old wits of [Mary Antony]103-mary antony . "[103-mary antony] Looking furtively at [the Madonna]435-the madonna , [she]103-mary antony saw that [[our]1015-our Lady]4260-our lady smiled . [The blessed Infant]1017-the blessed infant , also , looked merry . [Mary Antony]103-mary antony chuckled , and took heart . When [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother smiled , [she]427-the reverend mother always knew [herself]427-the reverend mother forgiven .

Moreover , without delay , [her]427-the reverend mother request was granted ; for scarcely had [she]427-the reverend mother arisen from [her]427-the reverend mother knees , when [she]427-the reverend mother remembered the place where [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother kept the key of [[her]427-the reverend mother cell]321-her cell ; and [she]427-the reverend mother , having locked the door , on leaving , with [her]427-the reverend mother own master - key , the other was quickly in [old Antony]103-mary antony 's hand , and [she]427-the reverend mother out once more in [the passage]497-the passage , locking the door behind [her]427-the reverend mother ; sure of being able to restore the key to its place , before it should be missed by [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother .

[Sister Mary Antony]85-mary antony slipped unseen past [the Refectory]4794-the refectory and into [the kitchens]4328-the kitchens . Once there , [she]85-mary antony fussed and scolded and made [her]85-mary antony presence felt , implying that [she]85-mary antony had been waiting , a good hour gone , for the thing for which [she]85-mary antony had but that moment asked .

[The younger lay - sisters]1024-the younger lay - sisters might make no retort ; but [Sister Mary Martha]150-sister mary martha presently asked : " What have [you]103-mary antony been doing since Vespers , [Sister Antony]85-mary antony ? "[150-sister mary martha]

By aid of the wits [[our]1025-our Lady]4260-our lady had sharpened , [old Antony]85-mary antony , at that moment , realised that sometimes , when [you]1027-you needs must deceive , there is nothing so deceptive as the actual truth .

" Listening to a wondrous romantic tale , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony made answer , " told by [the Knight of the Bloody Vest]543-the knight of the bloody vest . "[85-mary antony] " [You]103-mary antony verily are foolish about that robin , [Sister Antony]85-mary antony , "[150-sister mary martha] remarked [Mary Martha]150-sister mary martha ; " and [you]103-mary antony will take [your]103-mary antony death of cold , sitting out in [the garden]358-the garden in the damp , after sunset . "[150-sister mary martha]

" Well so long as [I]85-mary antony take only that which is [mine]85-mary antony own , [others]482-others have no cause to grumble , "[85-mary antony] snapped [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , and turned [her]85-mary antony mind upon the making of a savoury broth , favoured by [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother .

And all the while [the Devil]404-the devil was whispering in [the old woman]430-the old woman 's ear : " [She]4260-our lady will not return . . . . Make [thy]430-the old woman broth , [fool]4233-fool ; but [she]4260-our lady will not be here to drink it . . . . [The World]33-the world and the Flesh have called ; [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother will not come back . . . . Stir the broth well , but flavour it to thine own taste . [Thou]430-the old woman wilt sup on it thyself this night . When [the World]33-the world and [the Flesh]4830-the flesh call loudly enough , [the best of [women]4202-women]4831-the best of women go to [the Devil]101-the devil . "[404-the devil]
