" Liar ! "[85-mary antony] said [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , brandishing [her]85-mary antony wooden spoon . " Get [thee]430-the old woman behind [me]85-mary antony nay , rather , get [thee]430-the old woman in front of [me]85-mary antony ! [I]85-mary antony have had [thee]430-the old woman skulking behind [me]85-mary antony long enough . Also in front of [me]85-mary antony , just now , being into the fire , [thou]430-the old woman wilt feel at [home]305-home , [Master Devil]101-the devil ! Only , put not [thy]430-the old woman tail into [[the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's broth]4834-the reverend mother 's broth . "[85-mary antony]

When [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies passed up from [the Refectory]4794-the refectory , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony chanced to be polishing the panelling around the picture of [Saint Mary Magdalen]151-saint mary magdalen , beside the door of [[the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's cell]428-the reverend mother 's cell .

Presently [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , arriving , lifted [her]90-sister mary rebecca hand to knock .

" Stay ! "[85-mary antony] whispered [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . " [The Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother may not be disturbed . "[85-mary antony]

[Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca veiled [her]90-sister mary rebecca scowl with a smile .

" And wherefore not , good [Sister Antony]85-mary antony ? "[90-sister mary rebecca]

" ' Wherefore not ' is not [my]85-mary antony business , "[85-mary antony] retorted [old Antony]85-mary antony , as rudely as [she]85-mary antony knew how . " It may be for special study ; it may be for an hour of extra devotion ; it may be only the very natural desire for a little respite from the sight of [two such ugly faces as yours]4836-two such ugly faces as yours and [mine]85-mary antony . But , be the reason what it may , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother has locked [her]93-the reverend mother door , and sees [nobody this even]4837-nobody this even . "[85-mary antony] After which [old Antony]85-mary antony proceeded to polish the outside of the [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's door panels .

[Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca lifted [her]90-sister mary rebecca knuckles to rap ; but [old Antony]85-mary antony 's not over clean clout was pushed each time between [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca 's tap , and the woodwork .

Muttering concerning the report [she]90-sister mary rebecca would make to [the Prioress]373-the prioress in the morning , [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca went to [[her]90-sister mary rebecca cell]321-her cell .

When all was quiet , when every door was closed , [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister crept into [the cloisters]316-the cloisters and , crouching in an archway just beyond the flight of steps leading to [the underground way]374-the underground way , watched and waited .

Storm clouds were gathering again , black on a purple sky . The after - glow in the west had faded . It was dark in [the cloisters]316-the cloisters . Thunder growled in the distance ; an owl hooted in the Pieman 's tree .

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's old bones ached sorely , and [her]85-mary antony heart failed [her]85-mary antony . [She]85-mary antony had sat so long in cramped positions , and [she]85-mary antony had not tasted food since the mid - day meal .

[The Devil]101-the devil drew near , as [he]101-the devil is wo nt to do , when [those who have fasted long , seek to keep vigil]1040-those who have fasted long , seek to keep vigil .

" [The Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother will not return , "[101-the devil] [he]101-the devil whispered . " What wait [you]85-mary antony for ? "[101-the devil]

" Be off ! "[85-mary antony] said [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . " [I]85-mary antony am too old to be keeping company , even with [thee]85-mary antony . Also [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca awaits [thee]85-mary antony in [[her]90-sister mary rebecca cell]321-her cell . "[85-mary antony]

" [The Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother ever walked with [her]427-the reverend mother head among the stars , "[404-the devil] sneered [the Devil]404-the devil . " Why do the highest fall the lowest , when temptation comes ? "[404-the devil]

" Ask that of [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , "[85-mary antony] said [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , " next time [she]373-the prioress bids [thee]85-mary antony to supper . "[85-mary antony]

Then [she]85-mary antony clasped [her]85-mary antony old hands upon [her]85-mary antony breast ; for , very softly , in the lock below , a key turned .

Steps , felt rather than heard , passed up into [the cloister]286-the cloister .

Then , in the dim light , the tall figure of [the Prioress]373-the prioress moved noiselessly over the flagstones , passed through the open door and up [the deserted passage]1044-the deserted passage .

Peering eagerly forward , [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister saw [the Prioress]373-the prioress pause outside the door of [[her]373-the prioress chamber]4322-her chamber , lift [her]373-the prioress master - key , unlock the door , and pass within .

As the faint sound of the closing of the door reached [her]264-the old lay - sister straining ears , old [Mary Antony]85-mary antony began to sob , helplessly .

CHAPTER XVI

THE ECHO OF WILD VOICES

When [the Prioress]373-the prioress entered [[her]373-the prioress cell]321-her cell , [she]373-the prioress stood for a moment bewildered by the rapid walk in the darkness . [She]373-the prioress could hardly realise that the long strain was over ; that [she]373-the prioress had safely regained [[her]373-the prioress chamber]4322-her chamber .

All was as [she]373-the prioress had left [it]4322-her chamber . Apparently [she]373-the prioress had not been missed , and had returned unobserved . [Hugh]132-hugh was by now safely in [the hostel at [Worcester]1-worcester]1051-the hostel at worcester . [None]315-none need ever know that [he]132-hugh had been [here]4536-here .

None need ever know Yet , alas , it was that knowledge which held [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress rooted to the spot on which [she]373-the prioress stood , gazing round [[her]373-the prioress cell]321-her cell . [Hugh]132-hugh had been [here]4536-here ; and when [he]132-hugh was here , [her]373-the prioress one desire had been to get [him]132-hugh speedily away .

But now ?

Dumb with the pain of a great yearning , [she]373-the prioress looked about [her]373-the prioress .

Yes ; just there [he]132-hugh had stood ; here [he]132-hugh had knelt , and there [he]132-hugh had stood again .

This calm monastic air had vibrated to the fervour of [his]132-hugh voice .

It had grown calm again .

Would [her]373-the prioress poor heart in time also grow calm ? Would [her]373-the prioress lips stop trembling , and cease to feel the fire of [his]132-hugh ?

Yet for one moment , only , [her]373-the prioress mind dwelt upon [herself]373-the prioress . Then all thought of self was merged in the realisation of [his]132-hugh loneliness , [his]132-hugh suffering , [his]132-hugh bitter disillusion . To have found [her]373-the prioress dead , would have been hard ; to have lost [her]373-the prioress living , was almost past bearing . Would it cost [him]132-hugh [his]132-hugh faith in [God]89-god , in truth , in purity , in honour ?

[The Prioress]373-the prioress felt the insistent need of prayer . But passing the gracious image of [the Virgin and Child]616-the virgin and child , [she]373-the prioress cast [herself]373-the prioress down at the foot of the crucifix .

[She]373-the prioress had seen [a strong man in agony , nailed , by the cruel iron of circumstance , to the cross - beams of sacrifice and surrender]1058-a strong man in agony , nailed , by the cruel iron of circumstance , to the cross - beams of sacrifice and surrender . To [the suffering Saviour]612-the suffering saviour [she]373-the prioress turned , instinctively , for help and consolation .

Thus speedily had [her]373-the prioress prayer of the previous night been granted . The pierced feet of [[our]1060-our dear Lord]4291-our dear lord , crucified , had become more to [her]373-the prioress than the baby feet of [the Infant Jesus]4436-the infant jesus , on [[His]4436-the infant jesus Mother]1063-his mother 's knee .

Yet , even as [she]373-the prioress knelt supplicating , interceding , adoring there echoed in [her]373-the prioress memory the wicked shriek of [Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine : " [A dead God]4309-a dead god can not help [me]102-sister seraphine ! [I]102-sister seraphine want life , not death ! "[102-sister seraphine] followed almost instantly by [Hugh]132-hugh 's stern question : " Is this religion ? "[132-hugh]

Truly , of late , wild voices had taken liberty of speech in [the cell of [the Prioress]373-the prioress]1064-the cell of the prioress , and had left [their]1066-their impious utterances echoing behind [them]1066-their .

CHAPTER XVII

THE DIMNESS OF [MARY ANTONY

The Prioress]152-old antony had been back in [[her]373-the prioress cell]321-her cell for nearly an hour , when a gentle tap came on the door .

" Enter , "[373-the prioress] commanded [the Prioress]373-the prioress , and [Mary Antony]152-old antony appeared , bearing broth and bread , fruit and a cup of wine .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress sat at [her]91-mother sub - prioress table , parchment and an open missal before [her]91-mother sub - prioress . [Her]91-mother sub - prioress face was very white ; also there were dark shadows beneath [her]91-mother sub - prioress eyes . [She]91-mother sub - prioress did not smile at sight of [old Antony]152-old antony , thus laden . " How now , [Antony]152-old antony ? "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress said , almost sternly . " [I]91-mother sub - prioress did not bid [thee]152-old antony to bring [me]91-mother sub - prioress food . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

" [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , "[264-the old lay - sister] said [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , in a voice which strove to be steady , yet quavered ; " for long hours [you]152-old antony have studied , not heeding that the evening meal was over . Chide not [old Antony]152-old antony for bringing [you]152-old antony some of that broth , which [you]152-old antony like the best . [You]152-old antony will not sleep unless [you]152-old antony eat . "[264-the old lay - sister]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress looked at [her]264-the old lay - sister uncomprehendingly ; as if , for the moment , words conveyed no meaning to [her]91-mother sub - prioress mind . Then [she]91-mother sub - prioress saw those old hands trembling , and a sudden flood of colour flushed the pallor of [her]91-mother sub - prioress face .

This sweet stirring of fresh life within [her]91-mother sub - prioress own heart gave [her]91-mother sub - prioress to see , in [the old woman]430-the old woman 's untiring devotion , [a human element hitherto unperceived]1072-a human element hitherto unperceived . It brought a rush of comfort , in [her]91-mother sub - prioress sadness .

[She]373-the prioress closed the volume , and pushed aside the parchment . " How kind of [thee]152-old antony , dear [Antony]152-old antony , to take so much thought for [me]373-the prioress . Place the bowls on the table . . . . Now draw up that stool , and stay near [me]373-the prioress while [I]373-the prioress sup . [I]373-the prioress am weary this night , and shall like [thy]152-old antony company . "[373-the prioress]

Had the golden gates of [heaven]335-heaven opened before [her]373-the prioress , and [Saint Peter]125-saint peter [himself]125-saint peter invited [her]373-the prioress to enter , [Sister Mary Antony]85-mary antony would not have been more astonished and certainly could hardly have been more gratified . It was a thing undreamed of , that [she]373-the prioress should be bidden to sit with [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother in [[her]373-the prioress cell]321-her cell .

Drawing the carven stool two feet from the wall , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony took [her]85-mary antony seat upon it .

" Nearer , [Antony]85-mary antony , nearer , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress . " Place the stool here , close beside the corner of [my]373-the prioress table . [I]373-the prioress have much to say to [thee]85-mary antony , and would wish to speak low . "[373-the prioress]

Truly [Sister Antony]85-mary antony found [herself]85-mary antony in [the seventh heaven]1077-the seventh heaven !

Yet , quietly observing , [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress could not fail to note the drawn weariness on the old face , the yellow pallor of the wizen skin , which usually wore the bright tint of a russet apple .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress took a portion of the broth ; then pushed the bowl from [her]85-mary antony , and turned to the fruit .

" There , [Antony]85-mary antony , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said . " The broth is excellent ; but [I]373-the prioress have enough . Finish it thyself . It will pleasure [me]373-the prioress to see [thee]85-mary antony enjoy it . "[373-the prioress] Faint and thankful , [old Antony]85-mary antony seized the bowl . And as [she]373-the prioress drank the broth , [her]373-the prioress shrewd eyes twinkled . For had not [the Devil]404-the devil said [she]373-the prioress would sup on it [herself]373-the prioress ; knowing that much , yet not knowing that [she]373-the prioress would receive it from the hand of [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother ?

It has been ever so , from Eden onwards , when [the Devil]404-the devil tries [his]404-the devil hand at prophecy .

For a while [the Prioress]373-the prioress talked lightly , of flowers and birds ; of [the garden]358-the garden and [the orchard]4382-the orchard ; of the gift of three fine salmon , sent to [them]1084-them by [the good monks of [the Priory at [Worcester]1-worcester]1086-the priory at worcester]1085-the good monks of the priory at worcester .

But , presently , when the broth was finished and a faint colour tinted the old cheeks , [she]373-the prioress passed on to the storm and the sunset , the rolling thunder and the torrents of rain . Then of a sudden [she]373-the prioress said :

" By the way , [Antony]85-mary antony , hast [thou]4841-thou made mention , to any , of [thy]85-mary antony fearsome tale of the walking through [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , in line with [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies , of [the Spectre of [the saintly Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha]4844-the spectre of the saintly sister agatha ? "[373-the prioress]

" Nay , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , "[85-mary antony] said [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . " Did not [you]373-the prioress forbid [me]373-the prioress to speak of it ? "[373-the prioress]

" True , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress . " Well , [Antony]85-mary antony , [I]373-the prioress went in the storm , to look for [her]87-sister agatha ; but [I]373-the prioress found not [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha . "[373-the prioress]

" That [I]85-mary antony already knew , "[85-mary antony] said [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , nodding [her]85-mary antony head sagaciously .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress cast upon [her]85-mary antony a quick , anxious look .

" What mean [you]85-mary antony , [Antony]85-mary antony ? "[373-the prioress]

Then [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony fell upon [her]85-mary antony knees , and kissed the hem of [the Prioress]373-the prioress 's robe . " Oh , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony stammered , " [I]85-mary antony have a confession to make ! "[85-mary antony]

" Make it , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , with white lips .

" [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , when [you]373-the prioress sent [me]373-the prioress from [you]373-the prioress , after making [my]373-the prioress report , [I]373-the prioress went first , as commanded , to [the kitchens]4328-the kitchens . But afterward , in [[my]373-the prioress cell]4261-my cell , [I]373-the prioress found these . "[373-the prioress]

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony opened [her]85-mary antony wallet and drew out the linen bag in which [she]85-mary antony kept [her]85-mary antony peas . Shaking its contents into the palm of [her]85-mary antony hand , [she]85-mary antony held out six peas to view .

" [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony said , " there were twenty - five in the bag . [I]85-mary antony thought [I]85-mary antony had counted twenty out into [my]85-mary antony hand ; so when all the peas had dropped and yet [another holy Lady]4847-another holy lady passed , [I]85-mary antony thought that made twenty - one . But when [I]85-mary antony found six peas in [my]85-mary antony bag , [I]85-mary antony became aware of [my]85-mary antony folly . [I]85-mary antony had but counted nineteen , and had no pea to let fall for [the twentieth holy Lady]4848-the twentieth holy lady . Yet [I]85-mary antony ran in haste with [my]85-mary antony false report , when , had [I]85-mary antony but thought to look in [my]85-mary antony wallet , all would have been made clear . Will [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother forgive [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony ? "[85-mary antony]

[She]85-mary antony shot a quick glance at [the Prioress]373-the prioress ; and , at sight of the immense relief on that loved face , felt ready for any punishment with which it might please [Heaven]142-heaven to visit [her]85-mary antony deceit .

" [Dear Antony]115-dear antony , "[427-the reverend mother] began [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , smiling .

" [Dear Antony]115-dear antony "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony said , and laughed aloud .

Then [she]85-mary antony placed [her]85-mary antony hand beneath [the old woman]430-the old woman 's arm , and gently raised [her]430-the old woman . " Mistakes arise so easily , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony said . " With the best of intentions , [we]4850-we all sometimes make mistakes . There is nothing to forgive , [[my]85-mary antony [Antony]85-mary antony]4376-my antony . "[85-mary antony]

" [I]337-the lay - sister am old , and dim , and stupid , "[337-the lay - sister] said [the lay - sister]337-the lay - sister , humbly ; " but [I]337-the lay - sister have begged of [[our]1096-our sweet Lady]4357-our sweet lady to sharpen the old wits of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . "[337-the lay - sister]

After which statement , made in a voice of humble penitence , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , unseen by [the thankful Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , did give a knowing wink with the eye next to [the Madonna]435-the madonna . [[Our]1096-our blessed [Lady]1098-lady]4297-our blessed lady smiled . [The sweet Babe]147-the holy babe looked merry . [The Prioress]373-the prioress rose , a great light of relief illumining [her]373-the prioress weary face .

" Let [us]1096-our to bed , [dear Antony]85-mary antony ; then , with the dawn of a new day [we]1096-our shall [all]410-all arise with hearts refreshed and wits more keen . So now [God]89-god rest [thee]85-mary antony . "[373-the prioress]

Left alone , [the Prioress]373-the prioress knelt long in prayer before [the shrine of the Madonna]485-the shrine of the madonna . Once , [she]373-the prioress reached out [her]373-the prioress right hand to the empty space where [Hugh]132-hugh had knelt , striving to feel remembrance of [his]132-hugh strong clasp . At length [she]373-the prioress sought [her]373-the prioress couch . But sleep refused to come , and presently [she]373-the prioress crept back in the white moonlight , and kneeling pressed [her]373-the prioress lips to the stone on which [Hugh]132-hugh had kneeled ; then fled , in shame that [our Lady]4260-our lady should see such weakness ; and dared not glance toward the shadowy form of [the dead Christ]1103-the dead christ , crucified . For with the coming of [Love]122-love to seek [her]373-the prioress , Life had come ; and where Life enters , Death is put to flight ; even as before the triumphant march of the rising sun , darkness and shadows flee away .

Yet , even then , [[our]1104-our Lady]4260-our lady gently smiled , and [the Babe]438-the babe on [her]373-the prioress knees looked merry .

CHAPTER XVIII

IN [THE CATHEDRAL CRYPT]297-the cathedral crypt

On the day following , in the afternoon , shortly before the hour of Vespers , a stretcher was carried through [the streets of [Worcester]1-worcester]1108-the streets of worcester , by [four men - at - arms]1109-four men - at - arms wearing the livery of [Sir Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh .

Beside it walked [the Knight]764-the knight , with bent head , [his]764-the knight eyes upon the ground .

The body of [the man upon the stretcher]1111-the man upon the stretcher was covered by a fine linen sheet , over which lay a blue cloak , richly embroidered with silver . [His]1111-the man upon the stretcher head was swathed in a bandage of many folds , partially concealing the face .

[The little procession]1112-the little procession passed through [the Precincts]1113-the precincts ; then entered [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral by the great door leading into [the nave]1115-the nave . Here [a monk]1116-a monk stood , taking careful note of [all who passed in or out of [the building]1118-the building]1117-all who passed in or out of the building . As [the stretcher]1119-the stretcher approached , [he]1116-a monk stepped forward with hand upraised .

There was a pause in the measured tramp of [the bearers]1120-the bearers ' feet .

[The Knight]764-the knight lifted [his]764-the knight eyes , and seeing [the monk]1122-the monk barring the way , [he]764-the knight drew forth a parchment and tendered it .

" [I]764-the knight have the leave of [the Lord Bishop]92-bishop , [good father]4854-good father , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , " to carry [this man]4855-this man upon the stretcher daily into [the crypt]273-the crypt , and there to let [him]4855-this man lie before [the shrine of [Saint Oswald]153-saint oswald]4857-the shrine of saint oswald , during the hour of Vespers ; from which daily pilgrimage and prayer , [we]4858-we hope a great recovery and restoration . "[764-the knight]

At sight of [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop 's signature and seal , [the monk]1122-the monk made deep obeisance , and hastened to call [the Sacristan]1125-the sacristan , bidding [him]1125-the sacristan attend [the Knight]764-the knight on [his]764-the knight passage to [the crypt]273-the crypt and give [him]1125-the sacristan every facility in placing [the sick man]1128-the sick man there where [he]1128-the sick man might most conveniently lie before [the holy altar of [the blessed Saint Oswald]1130-the blessed saint oswald]1129-the holy altar of the blessed saint oswald .

So presently , the stretcher being safely deposited , [the men - at - arms]773-the men - at - arms stood each against a pillar , and [the Knight]764-the knight folded back the coverings , in order that [the man who lay beneath]1133-the man who lay beneath , might have sight of the altar and [the shrine]1134-the shrine .

As [the Knight]764-the knight stood gazing through the vista of many columns , [he]764-the knight found [the old Sacristan]1136-the old sacristan standing at [his]764-the knight elbow .

" [Most worshipful Knight]4859-most worshipful knight , "[1137-the old man] said [the old man]1137-the old man , with deference , " [[our]4860-our Lord Bishop]4861-our lord bishop 's mandate supersedes all rules . Were it not so , it would be [my]1137-the old man duty to clear [the crypt]273-the crypt before Vespers . See [you]764-the knight that [stairway yonder]4863-stairway yonder , beneath the arch ? Not many minutes hence , up those steps will pass the holy nuns from [the Convent of [the White Ladies at [Whytstone]3-whytstone [noble ladies]4866-noble ladies all]4865-the white ladies at whytstone noble ladies all]4864-the convent of the white ladies at whytstone noble ladies all , and of great repute for saintliness . Daily [they]4866-noble ladies come to [Vespers]17-vespers by a secret way ; entering [the crypt]273-the crypt , [they]4866-noble ladies pass across to a winding stair in the wall , and so arrive at [a gallery above [the choir]282-the choir , from which [they]4866-noble ladies can , unseen , hear the chanting of [the monks]4870-the monks]4868-a gallery above the choir , from which they can , unseen , hear the chanting of the monks . [I]1137-the old man must to [my]1137-the old man duties above . Will [you]764-the knight undertake , [Sir Knight]129-the knight , that [[your]764-the knight men]4871-your men go not nigh where [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies pass , nor in any way molest [them]4871-your men ? "[1137-the old man]

" None shall stir hand or foot , as [they]4871-your men pass , nor in any way molest [them]4871-your men , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight .

[Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh was kneeling before the altar , [his]132-hugh folded hands resting upon the cross on the hilt of [his]132-hugh sword , when the faint sound of a key turning in a distant lock , caught [his]132-hugh ear .

Then up the steps and across [the crypt]273-the crypt passed , in silent procession , [the White Ladies of [Worcester]1-worcester]283-the white ladies of worcester .

There was something ghostly and awe - inspiring about those veiled figures , moving noiselessly among the pillars in [the dimly - lighted crypt]1141-the dimly - lighted crypt ; then vanishing , one by one , up the winding stairway in the wall .

[The Knight]764-the knight did not stir . [He]764-the knight stayed upon [his]764-the knight knees , [his]764-the knight hands clasped upon [his]764-the knight sword - hilt ; but [he]764-the knight followed [each silent figure]1143-each silent figure with [his]764-the knight eyes .

The last had barely disappeared from view when , from above , came the solemn chanting of [monks]1144-monks and [choristers]1145-choristers .

This harmony , descending from above , seemed to uplift the soul all the more readily , because the sacred words and noble sounds reached [the listener]1146-the listener , unhampered by association with the personalities , either youthful or ponderous , of [the singers]1147-the singers . All that was of [the earth]1148-the earth remained unseen ; while that which was so near akin to heaven , entered the listening ear .

Kneeling in lowly reverence with bowed head , [the Knight]764-the knight found [himself]764-the knight wondering whether the ascending sounds reached that distant gallery in the clerestory where [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies knelt , as greatly softened , sweetened , and enriched , as [they]288-the white ladies now came stealing down into [the crypt]273-the crypt . Were the hearts of [those veiled worshippers]1152-those veiled worshippers also lifted heavenward ; or being already above the music did the ascending voices rather tend to draw [them]288-the white ladies down to [earth]4391-earth ?

Upon which [the Knight]764-the knight fell to meditating as to whether that which is higher always uplifts ; whereas that which is lower tends to debase . Certainly the upward look betokens hope and joy ; while the downward casting of the eye , is sign of sorrow and despondency .

" Levavi oculos meos in montes "[4870-the monks] chanted [the monks]4870-the monks , in the choir above .

[He]764-the knight certainly looked high when [he]764-the knight lifted the eyes of [his]764-the knight insistent desire to [the Prioress of the White Ladies]1156-the prioress of the white ladies . So high did [he]764-the knight lift [them]1157-them , and so unattainable was [she]1156-the prioress of the white ladies , that [most men]1158-most men would say [he]764-the knight might as well ask the silvery moon , sailing across the firmament , to come down and be [[his]764-the knight bride]4744-his bride !

[He]764-the knight had held [her]1156-the prioress of the white ladies high , in [her]1156-the prioress of the white ladies maiden loveliness and purity . But now that [he]764-the knight had found [her]1156-the prioress of the white ladies , [a noble woman]1160-a noble woman , matured , ripened by sorrow rather than hardened , yet firm in [her]1156-the prioress of the white ladies determination to die to [the world]389-the world , to deny self , crucify the flesh , and resist the Devil [he]764-the knight felt indeed that [she]1156-the prioress of the white ladies walked among the stars .

Yet [he]764-the knight could not bring [himself]764-the knight to regard [her]1156-the prioress of the white ladies as unattainable . It had ever been [his]764-the knight firm belief that [a man]4482-a man could win [any woman upon whom [he]764-the knight wholly set [his]764-the knight heart always supposing that [no other man]4714-no other man had already won [her]1156-the prioress of the white ladies]1163-any woman upon whom he wholly set his heart always supposing that no other man had already won her . And [this woman]1165-this woman had been [[his]764-the knight own betrothed]1166-his own betrothed , when treachery intervened and sundered [them]1167-they . Yet that did not now count for much .

[He]764-the knight had left [a girl]1168-a girl ; [he]764-the knight had come back to find [a woman]813-a woman . [That woman]1170-that woman had infinitely more to give ; but it would be infinitely more difficult to persuade [her]1170-that woman to give it .

At the close of [their]1167-they interview in [[her]1170-that woman cell]321-her cell , the day before , all hope had left [him]764-the knight . But later , as [they]1167-they paced together in the darkness , hope had revived .

The strange isolation in which [they]1167-they then found [themselves]1167-they between locked doors a mile apart , [earth above]1172-earth above , [earth beneath]1173-earth beneath , [earth]4391-earth all around [them]1167-they , [they]1167-they two alone , entombed yet vividly conscious of glowing life had brought [her]1170-that woman nearer to [him]764-the knight ; and when at last the moment of parting arrived and again [he]764-the knight faced it as final , there had come all unheralded the sudden wonder of [her]1170-that woman surrender .

True , [she]1170-that woman had afterwards withdrawn [herself]1170-that woman ; true , [she]1170-that woman had sent [him]764-the knight from [her]1170-that woman ; true , [he]764-the knight had gone , without a word . But that was because no promise could have been so binding , as that silent embrace .

[He]764-the knight had gone from [her]1170-that woman on the impulse of the sweetness of obeying instantly [her]1170-that woman slightest wish ; buoyed up by the certainty that [no Convent walls]1175-no convent walls could long divide lips which had met and clung with such a passion of mutual need .

That evening when , after much adventure , [he]764-the knight at length gained [the streets of [the city]1177-the city]1176-the streets of the city , [he]764-the knight had trodden [them]1176-the streets of the city with [the mien of [a victor]1179-a victor]1178-the mien of a victor .

That night [he]764-the knight had slept as [he]764-the knight had not slept since the hour when [his]764-the knight whole life had been embittered by a lying letter and a traitorous tongue .

But morning , alas , had brought its doubts ; noon , its dark uncertainties ; and as the hour of Vespers drew near , [he]764-the knight had realised , with the helpless misery of despair , that it was madness to expect [the Prioress of the White Ladies]1156-the prioress of the white ladies to break [her]1156-the prioress of the white ladies vows , leave [[her]1156-the prioress of the white ladies Nunnery]1181-her nunnery , and fly with [him]764-the knight to [Warwick]32-warwick .

Yet [he]764-the knight carried out [his]764-the knight plan , and kept to [his]764-the knight undertaking , though here , in the calm atmosphere of [the crypt]273-the crypt , holy chanting descending from above , the remembrance still with [him]764-the knight of the aloofness of those stately white figures gliding between the pillars in the distance , [he]764-the knight faced the madness of [his]764-the knight hopes , and the mournful prospect of a life of loneliness .

Presently [he]764-the knight arose , crossed [the crypt]273-the crypt , and took up [his]764-the knight position behind a pillar to the right of the exit from the winding stair .

The chanting ceased . Vespers were over .

[He]764-the knight heard the sound of soft footsteps drawing nearer .

[The White Ladies]288-the white ladies were coming .

[They]288-the white ladies came .

[The Knight]764-the knight was not kept long in suspense . [The Prioress]373-the prioress walked first . [Her]373-the prioress face was hidden , but [her]373-the prioress height and carriage revealed [her]373-the prioress to [[her]373-the prioress lover]762-her lover . [She]373-the prioress looked neither to right nor left but , turning away from the pillar behind which [the Knight]764-the knight stood concealed , crossed to the steps leading down to [the subterranean way]714-the subterranean way , and so passed swiftly out of sight .

[The Knight]764-the knight stood motionless until all had appeared , and had vanished once more from view .

One , tall but ungainly , crooked of body , and doubtless short of vision , missed [her]1191-her way among the columns and passed perilously near to [the Knight]764-the knight . With [his]764-the knight long arm , [he]764-the knight could have clasped [her]1191-her . How old [Antony]85-mary antony would have chuckled , could [she]1191-her but have known ! " [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca embraced by [the Knight of the Bloody Vest]543-the knight of the bloody vest ? Nay then ; [the Saints]4874-the saints forbid ! "[85-mary antony]

The stretcher , borne by [four men - at - arms]1109-four men - at - arms , passed out from [the Cathedral]35-the cathedral .

[The Knight]129-the knight walked beside [it]1194-it , with bent head , and eyes upon the ground .

As [it]1194-it passed through [the Precincts]1113-the precincts , [the Lord Bishop]92-bishop [himself]92-bishop rode out on [his]92-bishop white palfrey , on [his]92-bishop way to [the Nunnery at [Whytstone]3-whytstone]398-the nunnery at whytstone .

[The Knight]764-the knight , being downhearted , did not lift [his]764-the knight eyes .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop looked , kindly , upon the stretcher and upon [the Knight]764-the knight 's dark face .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop had known [Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh as [a boy]1201-a boy .

[He]4673-the bishop grieved to see [him]132-hugh thus in sorrow .

Yet [the Bishop]4673-the bishop smiled as [he]4673-the bishop rode on .

Perhaps [he]4673-the bishop did not put much faith in the efficacy of relics , for so heavily bandaged a broken head as that upon the stretcher .

For there was a whimsical tenderness about [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's smile .

CHAPTER XIX

[THE BISHOP]92-bishop PUTS ON [HIS]92-bishop BIRETTA

[Symon]154-symon of worcester , [Lord Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]92-bishop , having received a letter from [the Prioress of the White Ladies]1156-the prioress of the white ladies , praying [him]92-bishop for an interview at [his]92-bishop leisure , sent back at once a most courtly and gracious answer , that [he]92-bishop would that same day give [himself]92-bishop the pleasure of visiting [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , at [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery , an hour after Vespers .

The great gates were thrown open , and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop rode [his]4673-the bishop palfrey into [the courtyard]775-the courtyard .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress [herself]373-the prioress met [him]4673-the bishop at the door and , kneeling , kissed [his]4673-the bishop ring ; then led [him]4673-the bishop through [the lower hall]1210-the lower hall , where [the nuns]298-the nuns knelt to receive [his]4673-the bishop blessing , and up the wide staircase , to the privacy of [[her]373-the prioress own cell]287-her own cell .

There [she]373-the prioress presently unfolded to [him]4673-the bishop the history of [her]373-the prioress difficulties with [that wayward little nun , [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine]1213-that wayward little nun , sister mary seraphine .

" But the point which [I]373-the prioress chiefly desire to lay before [you]4673-the bishop , [Reverend Father]4875-reverend father , "[373-the prioress] concluded [the Prioress]373-the prioress , " is this : If the neighing of a palfrey calls more loudly to [her]373-the prioress than the voice of [God]89-god ; if [her]373-the prioress mind is still set upon the things of [the world]389-the world ; if [she]373-the prioress professed without a true vocation , merely because [she]373-the prioress wished to be [the central figure of a great ceremony]4877-the central figure of a great ceremony , yet was all the while expecting [a man]4482-a man to intervene and carry [her]373-the prioress off ; if all this bespeaks [her]373-the prioress true state of heart , then to [my]373-the prioress mind there comes the question : Is [she]373-the prioress doing good , either to [herself]373-the prioress or to [others]482-others , by belonging to [our]4880-our Order ? Would [she]373-the prioress not be better away ?[373-the prioress]

" [[My]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord , [I]373-the prioress fear [I]373-the prioress greatly shock [you]4881-my lord by naming such a possibility . But truly [I]373-the prioress am pursued by the remembrance of [that young thing]4882-that young thing , beating the floor with [her]373-the prioress hands , and singing a mournful dirge about the crimson trappings of [her]373-the prioress palfrey . And , alas ! when [I]373-the prioress reasoned with [her]373-the prioress and exhorted , [she]373-the prioress broke out , as [I]373-the prioress have told [you]4881-my lord , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , into grievous blasphemy for which [she]373-the prioress was severely dealt with by [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , and has since been outwardly amenable to rules and discipline .[373-the prioress]

" But , though [she]373-the prioress may outwardly conform , how about [her]373-the prioress inward state ? Well [I]373-the prioress know that [our]4883-our vows are lifelong vows ; [all who belong to [our]4883-our Order]4884-all who belong to our order are wedded to Heaven ; [we]4883-our are thankful to know that the calm of [the Cloister]286-the cloister shall be exchanged only for the greater peace of [Paradise]5-paradise . But , supposing [a young heart]4886-a young heart has mistaken its vocation ; supposing the voice of [an earthly lover]4887-an earthly lover calls when it is too late ; would it seem right or possible to [you]4673-the bishop , [Reverend Father]4875-reverend father , to grant any sort of absolution from the vows ; tacitly to allow the opening of the cage door , that the little foolish bird might , if it wished , escape into the liberty for which it chafes and sighs ? "[373-the prioress]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop sat in the Spanish chair , drawn up near the oriel window , so that [he]4673-the bishop could either gaze at the glories of the distant sunset , or , by slightly turning [his]4673-the bishop head , look on the beautiful but grave face of [the Prioress]373-the prioress , seated before [him]4673-the bishop .

While [she]373-the prioress was speaking [he]4673-the bishop watched [her]373-the prioress keenly , with those bright searching eyes , so much more youthful than aught else about [him]4673-the bishop . But now that [he]4673-the bishop must make reply , [he]4673-the bishop looked away to the sunset .

The light shone on the plain gold cross at [his]4673-the bishop breast , and on the violet silk of [his]4673-the bishop cassock . [His]4673-the bishop face , against the background of the black Spanish wood , looked strangely white and thin ; strong in contour , with a virile strength ; in expression , sensitive as [a woman]813-a woman 's . [He]4673-the bishop had removed [his]4673-the bishop biretta , and placed it upon the table . [His]4673-the bishop silvery hair rolled back from [his]4673-the bishop forehead in silky waves . [His]4673-the bishop was the look of [the saint]810-the saint and [the scholar]1219-the scholar , almost of [the mystic]1220-the mystic save for the tender humour in those keen blue eyes , gleaming like beacon lights from beneath the level eyebrows ; eyes which had won the confidence of [many a man who else had not dared unfold [his]4673-the bishop very human story]1221-many a man who else had not dared unfold his very human story , to one of such saintly aspect as [Symon]154-symon of worcester , [Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]1222-bishop of worcester . [They]1223-they were turned toward the sunset , as [he]4673-the bishop made answer to [the Prioress]373-the prioress .

" [The little foolish bird]4889-the little foolish bird , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop and [he]4673-the bishop spoke in that gently musing tone , which conveys to the mind of [the hearer]1226-the hearer a sense of infinite leisure in which to weigh and consider the subject in hand " The little foolish bird might soon wish [herself]4889-the little foolish bird back in the safety of the cage . On such as [she]4889-the little foolish bird , [the cruel hawks of life]4890-the cruel hawks of life do love to prey . Absorbed in the contemplation of [her]4889-the little foolish bird own charms , [she]4889-the little foolish bird sees not , until too late , the dangers which surround [her]4889-the little foolish bird . Such little foolish birds , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , are best in [the safe shelter of [the cloister]286-the cloister]4892-the safe shelter of the cloister . Moreover , of what value are they in [the world]389-the world ? None . If [Popinjays]156-popinjays [we]4895-we d [them]156-popinjays , [they]156-popinjays do but hatch out broods of [foolish little Popinjays]4896-foolish little popinjays . If [true men]4897-true men , caught by mere surface beauty , [we]4895-we d [them]156-popinjays , it can mean naught save heartbreak and sorrow , and deterioration of the race . [Women of finer mould]4898-women of finer mould "[4673-the bishop] for an instant [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's eyes strayed from the sunset " are needed , to be [the mothers of [the men who , in the years to come , are to make [England]22-england]4900-the men who , in the years to come , are to make england great . Nay , rather than let one escape , [I]4673-the bishop would shut up all the little foolish birds in [a Nunnery]4901-a nunnery , with [[our]4895-we excellent Sub - Prioress]4375-our excellent sub - prioress]4899-the mothers of the men who , in the years to come , are to make england great . nay , rather than let one escape , i would shut up all the little foolish birds in a nunnery , with our excellent sub - prioress to administer necessary discipline . "[4673-the bishop]

With [his]4673-the bishop elbows resting upon the arms of the chair , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop put [his]4673-the bishop fingers together , so that the tips met most precisely ; then bent [his]4673-the bishop lips to them , and looked at [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress .

[She]91-mother sub - prioress , troubled and sick at heart , lifting deep pools of silent misery , met the merry twinkle in [the Bishop]92-bishop 's eyes , and sat astonished . What was it like ? Why it was like the song of a robin , perched on a frosty bough , on Christmas morning ! It was so young and gay ; so jocund , and so hopeful .

Meeting it , [the Prioress]373-the prioress realised fully , what [she]373-the prioress had many times half - divined , that [the revered and reverend Prelate]1230-the revered and reverend prelate sitting opposite , for all [his]1230-the revered and reverend prelate robes and dignity , [his]1230-the revered and reverend prelate panoply of Church and State , had the heart of [a merry schoolboy]1231-a merry schoolboy out on a holiday .

For the moment [she]373-the prioress felt much older than [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , infinitely sadder ; more travel - worn and worldly - wise .

Then [she]373-the prioress looked at the silver hair ; the firm mouth , with a shrewd curve at either corner ; the thoughtful brow .

And then [she]373-the prioress looked at the [Bishop]92-bishop 's ring .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop wore a remarkable ring ; not a signet , but a large gem of great value , beautifully cut in many facets , and clear set in massive gold . This precious stone , said to be a chrysoprasus , had been given to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop by [a Russian prince]1235-a russian prince , in acknowledgment of a great service rendered [him]1235-a russian prince when [he]1235-a russian prince came on pilgrimage to [Rome]37-rome . The rarity of these gems arose partly from the fact that [the sovereigns of [Russia]38-russia]1236-the sovereigns of russia had decreed that they should be held exclusively for royal ornament , forbidding [their]1236-the sovereigns of russia use or purchase by [people of lesser degree]1237-people of lesser degree .

But its beauty and its rarity were not the only qualities of the precious stone in [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's ring . The strangest thing about it was that its colour varied , according to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's mood and surroundings .

When [the Prioress]373-the prioress looked up and met the gay twinkle , the stone in the [Bishop]92-bishop 's ring was a heavenly blue , the colour of forget - me - nots beside a [meadow brook]1241-meadow brook , or the clear azure of the sky above a rosy sunset . But presently [he]4673-the bishop passed [his]4673-the bishop hand over [his]4673-the bishop eyes , as if to shut out some bright vision , and to turn [his]4673-the bishop mind to more sober thought ; and , at that moment , the stone in [his]4673-the bishop ring gleamed a pale opal , threaded with flashes of green .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress returned to the subject , with studied seriousness .

" [I]373-the prioress did not suppose , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , that it was to be of any advantage to [the world]389-the world , that [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine should return to it . The advantage was to be to [her]102-sister seraphine , and also to [this whole Community]4904-this whole community , well rid of the presence of one who finds [[our]4905-our sacred exercises]4906-our sacred exercises irksome ; [[our]4905-our beautiful Nunnery]4907-our beautiful nunnery , [a prison]4908-a prison ; [[her]102-sister seraphine cell]321-her cell , [a living tomb]4910-a living tomb . [She]102-sister seraphine cries out for life . ' [I]373-the prioress want to live , ' [she]102-sister seraphine said , ' [I]373-the prioress am young , [I]373-the prioress am gay , [I]373-the prioress am beautiful ! [I]373-the prioress want life . ' "[373-the prioress]

" To such as [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , "[4673-the bishop] remarked [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , gravely , " life is but a mirror which reflects [themselves]4911-themselves . Other forms and faces may flit by , in the background ; dimly seen , scarcely noticed . There is but one face and form occupying the entire foreground . Life is , to such , the mirror which ministers to vanity . Should [a husband]4912-a husband appear in the picture , [he]4912-a husband is soon relegated to the background , receiving only occasional glances over the shoulder . If [children]4304-children dance into the field of vision , [they]4304-children are petulantly driven elsewhere . Tell [me]4673-the bishop ? Did [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine 's desire for life include any expression of the desire to give life ? "[4673-the bishop]

Involuntarily [the Prioress]373-the prioress glanced at the sweet Babe upon [the Virgin]608-the virgin 's knees .

" No , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , very low .

" [I]4673-the bishop thought not , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " [Self - centred , shallow natures]4914-self - centred , shallow natures are not capable of the sublime passion for motherhood ; partly , no doubt , because [they]4914-self - centred , shallow natures [themselves]4914-self - centred , shallow natures possess no life worth passing on . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress rose quickly and , moving to the window , flung open a second casement . It was imperative , at that moment , to hide [her]373-the prioress face ; for the uncontrollable flood of emotion at [her]373-the prioress heart , could scarce fail to send a tell - tale wave to disturb the calm of [her]373-the prioress countenance .

Whereupon [the Bishop]4673-the bishop turned , to see at what [the Prioress]373-the prioress had glanced before answering [his]4673-the bishop question .

" No , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop mused , as [she]373-the prioress resumed [her]373-the prioress seat , [his]4673-the bishop eyes upon the tree - tops beyond the casement , " [the Seraphines]4915-the seraphines have not the instinct of motherhood . And the future greatness of [[our]4916-our race]4917-our race depends upon [those noble women who are able to pass on to [[their]4918-those noble women who are able to pass on to their sons and daughters sons and [daughters]4920-daughters]4919-their sons and daughters]4918-those noble women who are able to pass on to their sons and daughters a life which is true , and brave , and worthy ; a life whose foundation is self - sacrifice , whose cornerstone is loyalty , and from whose summit waves the banner of unsullied love of hearth and [home]305-home .[4673-the bishop]

" [A woman with the true instinct of motherhood]4922-a woman with the true instinct of motherhood can not see [a little child]4768-a little child without yearning to clasp it to [her]4922-a woman with the true instinct of motherhood bosom . When [she]4922-a woman with the true instinct of motherhood finds [[her]4922-a woman with the true instinct of motherhood mate]4924-her mate , [she]4922-a woman with the true instinct of motherhood thinks more of being [the mother of [[his]4924-her mate children]4926-his children]4925-the mother of his children than the object of [his]4924-her mate devotion , because the Self in [her]4922-a woman with the true instinct of motherhood is subservient to the maternal instinct for self - sacrifice . [These women]4927-these women are pure as snow , and [they]4927-these women hold [[their]4927-these women men]4928-their men to the highest and the best . [Such women]4929-such women are needed in [the world]389-the world . [[Our]4931-our Lady]4260-our lady knoweth , [I]4673-the bishop speak not lightly , unadvisedly nor wantonly ; but were [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine such an one as this , [I]4673-the bishop should say ; ' Leave the door on the latch . Without permission , yet without reproach let [her]102-sister seraphine go . ' "[4673-the bishop]

" Were [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine such an one as that , [[my]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , firmly , " then would there be no question of [her]102-sister seraphine going . If the cornerstone of character be loyalty , the very essential of loyalty is the keeping of vows . "[373-the prioress]

" Quite so , "[4673-the bishop] murmured [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ; " undoubtedly , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter . Unless , by some strange fatality , those vows were made under a total misapprehension . [You]4673-the bishop tell [me]4673-the bishop [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine expected [a man]4482-a man to intervene ? "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop sat up , of a sudden keenly alert . [His]4673-the bishop eyes , no longer humorous and tender , became searching and bright young still , but with the fire of youth , rather than its merriment . As [he]4673-the bishop leaned forward in [his]4673-the bishop chair , [his]4673-the bishop hands gripped [his]4673-the bishop knees . Looking at [his]4673-the bishop ring [the Prioress]373-the prioress saw the stone the colour of red wine .

" What if , after all , [I]4673-the bishop can help [you]373-the prioress in this , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " What if [I]4673-the bishop can throw light upon the whole situation , and find a cause for [the little foolish bird]4889-the little foolish bird 's restless condition , proving to [you]373-the prioress that [she]4889-the little foolish bird may have heard something more than the mere neighing of a palfrey ! Listen ![4673-the bishop]

" [A Knight]4937-a knight arrived in [this city]4938-this city , rather more than a month ago ; [a very noble Knight , splendid to look upon]4939-a very noble knight , splendid to look upon ; [one of [[our]4941-our bravest Crusaders]4942-our bravest crusaders]4940-one of our bravest crusaders . [He]4937-a knight arrived here in sore anguish of heart . [[His]4937-a knight betrothed]4943-his betrothed had been taken from [him]4937-a knight during [his]4937-a knight absence from [England]22-england , waging war against [the Turks]157-the turks in [Palestine]24-palestine taken from [him]4937-a knight by a most dastardly and heartless plot . [He]4937-a knight made many inquiries concerning [this Nunnery]4944-this nunnery and Order , rode north again on urgent business , but returned , with [a large retinue]4945-a large retinue , five days since . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress did not stir . [She]373-the prioress maintained [her]373-the prioress quiet posture as [an attentive listener]1255-an attentive listener . But [her]373-the prioress face grew as white as [her]373-the prioress wimple , and [she]373-the prioress folded [her]373-the prioress hands to steady [their]1256-their trembling .

But [the Bishop , now eagerly launched]1257-the bishop , now eagerly launched , had no interest in pallor , or possible palsy . [His]1257-the bishop , now eagerly launched vigorous words cut the calm atmosphere . The gem on [his]1257-the bishop , now eagerly launched finger sparkled like red wine in a goblet .

" [I]1257-the bishop , now eagerly launched knew [him]4937-a knight of old , "[1257-the bishop , now eagerly launched] [he]1257-the bishop , now eagerly launched said ; " knew [him]4937-a knight as [a high - spirited lad]4946-a high - spirited lad , yet loving , and much beloved . [He]4937-a knight came to [me]1257-the bishop , now eagerly launched , in [his]4937-a knight grief , distraught with anguish of heart , and told [me]1257-the bishop , now eagerly launched this tale of treachery and wrong . Never did [I]1257-the bishop , now eagerly launched hear of such a network of evil device , such a tragedy of loving hearts sundered . And when at last [he]4937-a knight returned to [this land]4399-this land , [he]4937-a knight found that [the girl whom [he]4937-a knight had thought false , thinking [him]4937-a knight so]4948-the girl whom he had thought false , thinking him so , had entered [a Nunnery]4901-a nunnery . Also [he]4937-a knight seemed convinced that [she]4948-the girl whom he had thought false , thinking him so was to be found among [[our]4950-our White Ladies of [Worcester]1-worcester]4951-our white ladies of worcester . Now tell [me]1257-the bishop , now eagerly launched , [dear Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , think [you]91-mother sub - prioress [she]4948-the girl whom he had thought false , thinking him so could be [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine ? "[1257-the bishop , now eagerly launched]

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress smiled ; and truly it was a very creditable smile for a face which might have been carved in marble .

" From [my]91-mother sub - prioress knowledge of [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress said , " it seems unlikely that for loss of [her]4948-the girl whom he had thought false , thinking him so , so noble a Knight as [you]91-mother sub - prioress describe would be distraught with anguish of heart . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

" Nay , there [I]4673-the bishop do not agree , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " It is ever opposites which attract . The tall [we]4950-our d the short ; the stout , the lean ; the dark , the fair ; the grave , [the gay]4952-the gay . Wherefore [[my]4673-the bishop stern Crusader]4953-my stern crusader may be breaking [his]4953-my stern crusader heart for [your]91-mother sub - prioress foolish little bird . "[4673-the bishop]

" [I]373-the prioress do not think so , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , shortly ; then hastened to add : " Not that [I]373-the prioress would presume to differ from [you]91-mother sub - prioress , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father . Doubtless [you]91-mother sub - prioress are better versed in such matters than [I.]373-the prioress But if it be as [you]91-mother sub - prioress suppose what measures do [you]91-mother sub - prioress suggest ? How am [I]373-the prioress to deal with [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine ? "[373-the prioress] [The Bishop]4673-the bishop leaned forward and whispered , though [not another soul]1261-not another soul was within hearing ; but at this juncture in the conversation , a whisper was both dramatic and effective . Also , when [he]4673-the bishop leaned forward , [he]4673-the bishop could almost hear the angry beating of the heart of [the Prioress]373-the prioress .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop held [the Prioress]373-the prioress in high regard , and loved not to distress [her]373-the prioress . But [he]4673-the bishop did not think it right that [a woman]813-a woman should have such complete mastery over [herself]813-a woman , and therefore over [others]482-others . A fine quality in [a man]4482-a man , may be a blemish in [a woman]813-a woman . For which reason [the Bishop]4673-the bishop leaned forward and whispered .

" Let [her]373-the prioress fly , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter ; let [her]373-the prioress fly . If [his]4482-a man arms await [her]373-the prioress , [she]373-the prioress will not have far to go , nor many dangers to face . [[Her]373-the prioress lover]762-her lover will know how to guard [his]4482-a man own . "[4673-the bishop]

" [[My]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , now flushed with anger , " [you]4881-my lord amaze [me]373-the prioress ! Am [I]373-the prioress to understand that [you]4881-my lord would have [me]373-the prioress open the Convent door , so that [a renegade nun]4957-a renegade nun may escape to [[her]4957-a renegade nun lover]762-her lover ? Or perhaps , [[my]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord , it would better meet [your]4881-my lord ideas if [I]373-the prioress bid [the porteress]4960-the porteress stand wide the great gates , so that [this high - spirited Knight]4961-this high - spirited knight may ride in and carry off [the nun [he]4961-this high - spirited knight desires]4962-the nun he desires , in sight of all ! [[My]373-the prioress Lord [Bishop]92-bishop]4963-my lord bishop ! [You]92-bishop rule in [Worcester]1-worcester and in [the cities of [the diocese]4965-the diocese]4964-the cities of the diocese . But [I]373-the prioress rule in [this Nunnery]4944-this nunnery ; and while [I]373-the prioress rule here , such a thing as this shall never be . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress flashed and quivered ; rose to [her]373-the prioress feet and towered ; flung [her]373-the prioress arms wide , and paced the floor .

" [The Knight]764-the knight has bewitched [you]92-bishop , [[my]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said . " [You]92-bishop forget the rules of [[our]4969-our holy Church]4970-our holy church . [You]92-bishop fail in [your]92-bishop trust toward [the women who look to [you]92-bishop as [[their]4971-the women who look to you as their spiritual father and guide spiritual Father]4972-their spiritual father and [guide]4973-guide]4971-the women who look to you as their spiritual father and guide . "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress walked up and down [the cell]291-the cell , and each time [she]373-the prioress passed [her]373-the prioress chair [she]373-the prioress wheeled , and gripping the back with [her]373-the prioress strong fingers , shook it . Not being able to shake [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , [she]373-the prioress needs must shake something .

" [You]4673-the bishop amaze [me]373-the prioress ! "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said . " Truly , [[my]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord , [you]4673-the bishop amaze [me]373-the prioress ! "[373-the prioress]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop put on [his]4673-the bishop biretta .

Only once before , in [his]4673-the bishop eventful life , had [he]4673-the bishop made [a woman]813-a woman as angry as this . Very young [he]4673-the bishop was , then ; and [the angry woman]1277-the angry woman had seized [him]4673-the bishop by [his]4673-the bishop hair .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop did not really think [the Prioress]373-the prioress would do this ; but it amused [him]4673-the bishop to fancy [he]4673-the bishop was afraid , and to put on [his]4673-the bishop biretta .

Then , as [he]4673-the bishop leaned back in [his]4673-the bishop chair , and [his]4673-the bishop finger tips met , the stone in [his]4673-the bishop ring was blue again , and [his]4673-the bishop eyes were more than ever the eyes of [a merry schoolboy out on a holiday]1280-a merry schoolboy out on a holiday .

Yet , presently , [he]4673-the bishop sought to calm the tempest [he]4673-the bishop had raised .

" [[My]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " [I]4673-the bishop did but agree to that which [you]4891-my daughter [yourself]4891-my daughter suggested . Did [you]4891-my daughter not ask whether it would seem to [me]4673-the bishop right or possible to grant absolution from [her]4891-my daughter vows , tacitly to allow the opening of the cage door , that the little foolish bird might , if [she]4891-my daughter wished it , escape ? Why this exceeding indignation , when [I]4673-the bishop do but yield to [your]4673-the bishop arguments and fall in with [your]4673-the bishop suggestions ? "[4673-the bishop]

" [I]91-mother sub - prioress did not suggest that [a lover]4976-a lover 's arms were awaiting one of [[my]91-mother sub - prioress nuns]4977-my nuns , "[91-mother sub - prioress] said [the angry Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress .

" [You]91-mother sub - prioress did not mention arms , "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , gently ; " but [you]91-mother sub - prioress most explicitly mentioned a voice . ' Supposing the voice of [an earthly lover]4887-an earthly lover calls , ' [you]91-mother sub - prioress said . And having admitted that [I]4673-the bishop am better versed in such matters than [you]4891-my daughter [you]4891-my daughter must forgive [me]4673-the bishop , [dear Prioress]4979-dear prioress , if [I]4673-the bishop amaze [you]4891-my daughter further by acquainting [you]4891-my daughter with the undoubted fact , recognised , in [the outer world]4980-the outer world , as beyond dispute , that when [a lover]4976-a lover 's voice calls , [a lover]4976-a lover 's arms are likely to be waiting . [Earthly lovers]4983-earthly lovers , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , by no means resemble those charming cherubs which [you]4891-my daughter may have observed on the carved woodwork in [[our]4985-our Cathedral]4986-our cathedral . Otherwise [you]4891-my daughter might have just a voice , flanked by seraphic wings . Some such fanciful creation must have been in [your]4891-my daughter mind for [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine ; for , until [I]4673-the bishop made mention of [the noble Knight who had arrived in [Worcester]1-worcester distraught with anguish of heart by reason of [his]4987-the noble knight who had arrived in worcester distraught with anguish of heart by reason of his loss loss]4987-the noble knight who had arrived in worcester distraught with anguish of heart by reason of his loss , [you]4891-my daughter had decided leanings toward tacitly allowing flight . Therefore it was not the fact of the broken vows , but the idea of [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine wedded to [the brave Crusader]4988-the brave crusader , which so greatly roused [your]4891-my daughter ire . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress stood silent . [Her]91-mother sub - prioress hot anger cooled , enveloped in the chill mantle of self - revelation and self - scorn .

It seemed to [her]91-mother sub - prioress that the gentle words of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop indeed expressed the truth far more correctly than [he]4673-the bishop knew .

The thought of [Hugh]132-hugh , consoling [himself]132-hugh with [some foolish , vain , unworthy , little Seraphine]1283-some foolish , vain , unworthy , little seraphine , had stung with intolerable pain .

Yet , how should [she]91-mother sub - prioress , the cause of [his]132-hugh despair , begrudge [him]132-hugh any comfort [he]132-hugh might find in the love of [another]1284-another ?

Then , suddenly , [the Prioress]373-the prioress knelt at the feet of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" Forgive [me]373-the prioress , [most Reverend Father]155-reverend father , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said . " [I]373-the prioress did wrong to be angry . "[373-the prioress]

[Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester extended [his]154-symon of worcester hand , and [the Prioress]373-the prioress kissed the ring . As [she]373-the prioress withdrew [her]373-the prioress lips from the precious stone , [she]373-the prioress saw it blood - red and sparkling , as the juice of purple grapes in a goblet .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop laid [his]4673-the bishop biretta once more upon the table , and smiled very tenderly on [the Prioress]373-the prioress , as [he]4673-the bishop motioned [her]373-the prioress to rise from [her]373-the prioress knees and to resume [her]373-the prioress seat .

" [You]373-the prioress did right to be angry , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " [You]373-the prioress were not angry with [me]4673-the bishop , nor with [the brave Crusader]4988-the brave crusader , nor with [the foolish Seraphine]102-sister seraphine . [Your]373-the prioress anger , all unconsciously , was aroused by a system , a method of life which is contrary to Nature , and therefore surely at variance with the will of [God]89-god . [I]4673-the bishop have long had [my]4673-the bishop doubts concerning these vows of perpetual celibacy for [women]4202-women . For [men]4397-men , it is different . The creative powers in [a man]4482-a man , if denied [their]4397-men natural functions , stir [him]4482-a man to great enterprise , move [him]4482-a man to beget fine phantasies , creations of [his]4482-a man brain , [children of [his]4482-a man intellect]4994-children of his intellect . If [he]4482-a man stamp not [his]4482-a man image on [brave sons]878-brave sons and [fair daughters]879-fair daughters , [he]4482-a man leaves [his]4482-a man mark on life in many other ways , both brave and fair . But it is not so with [woman]4226-woman ; in the very nature of things it can not be . Methinks these Nunneries would serve a better purpose were [they]4397-men schools from which to send [women]4202-women forth into [the world]389-the world to be [good wives]5000-good wives and [mothers]4603-mothers , rather than [store - houses filled with sad samples of Nature]5002-store - houses filled with sad samples of nature 's great purposes deliberately unfulfilled . "[4673-the bishop]

[The merry schoolboy]1290-the merry schoolboy look had vanished . [The Bishop]92-bishop 's eyes were stern and searching ; yet [he]92-bishop looked not on [the Prioress]373-the prioress as [he]92-bishop spoke .

[Amazement]158-amazement was writ larger than ever , on [her]373-the prioress face ; but [she]373-the prioress held [herself]373-the prioress well under control .

" Such views , [[my]92-bishop lord]4881-my lord , if freely expressed and adopted , would change the entire monastic system . "[92-bishop]

" [I]4673-the bishop know it , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " And [I]4673-the bishop would not express them , saving to [you]373-the prioress and to one other , to whom [I]4673-the bishop also talk freely . But the older [I]4673-the bishop grow , the more clearly do [I]4673-the bishop see that systems are man - made , and therefore often mistaken , injurious , pernicious . But Nature is Divine . Those who live in close touch with Nature , who rule [their]5004-their lives by Nature 's rules , do not stray far from the Divine plan of [the Creator]4364-the creator . But when [man]4362-man takes upon [himself]4362-man to say ' [Thou]5007-thou shalt , ' or ' [Thou]5007-thou shalt not , ' quickly confusion enters . A false premise becomes the starting - point ; and the goal , if it stop short of perdition , is , at best , folly and failure . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop paused .

The eyes of [the woman before [him]4673-the bishop]1294-the woman before him were dark with sorrow , regret , and the dawning of a great fear . Presently [she]373-the prioress spoke .

" To say these things here , [[my]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord , is to say them too late . "[373-the prioress]

" It is never too late , "[154-symon of worcester] replied [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester . " ' Too late ' tolls the knell of the coward heart . If [we]5009-we find out a mistake while [we]5009-we yet walk [the earth]1148-the earth where [we]5009-we made it , it is not too late to amend it . "[373-the prioress]

" Think [you]4673-the bishop so , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father ? Then what do [you]4673-the bishop counsel [me]373-the prioress to do with [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine ? "[373-the prioress]

" Speak to [her]102-sister seraphine gently , and with great care and prudence . Say to [her]102-sister seraphine much of that which [you]4673-the bishop have said to [me]373-the prioress , and a little of that which [I]373-the prioress have said to [you]4673-the bishop , but expressed in such manner as will be suited to a foolish mind . [You]4673-the bishop and [I]373-the prioress can hurl bricks at [one another]666-one another , [[my]373-the prioress dear Prioress]5012-my dear prioress , and be the better for the exercise . But [we]5009-we must not fling at little [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine aught harder than a pillow of down . Empty heads , like empty eggshells , are soon broken . Tell [her]102-sister seraphine [you]4673-the bishop have consulted [me]373-the prioress concerning [her]102-sister seraphine desire to return to [the world]389-the world ; and that [I]373-the prioress , being lenient , and holding somewhat wider views on this subject than [the majority of [prelates]5015-prelates]5014-the majority of prelates , also being well acquainted with the mind of [His]373-the prioress Holiness the Pope concerning [those who embrace the religious life for reasons other than a true vocation]5016-those who embrace the religious life for reasons other than a true vocation , have promised to arrange the matter of a dispensation . But add that there must be no possibility of any scandal connected with [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery . Since [the Lady Wulgeova]159-the lady wulgeova , [mother of [Bishop Wulstan , of blessed memory]5019-bishop wulstan , of blessed memory]5018-mother of bishop wulstan , of blessed memory , took the veil here a century and a half ago , [this house]5020-this house has ever been above reproach . [You]4673-the bishop will tacitly allow [her]102-sister seraphine to slip away ; and , once away , [I]373-the prioress will set matters right for [her]102-sister seraphine . But nothing must transpire which could stumble or scandalise [the other members of the Community]5021-the other members of the community . The peculiar circumstances which [the Knight]764-the knight made known to [me]373-the prioress always , of course , without making any mention of the name of [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine can hardly have occurred in any other case . It is not likely , for instance , that [[our]5023-our worthy Sub - Prioress]5024-our worthy sub - prioress was torn by treachery from the arms of [a despairing lover]5025-a despairing lover ; and [she]5024-our worthy sub - prioress would undoubtedly share [your]4673-the bishop very limiting ideas of [a lover]4976-a lover 's physical qualities and requirements ; possibly not even allowing [him]4976-a lover a voice .[373-the prioress]

" Now [I]373-the prioress happen to know that [the Knight]764-the knight daily spends the hour of Vespers in [the Cathedral crypt]297-the cathedral crypt , kneeling before [the shrine of [Saint Oswald]153-saint oswald]4857-the shrine of saint oswald beside a stretcher whereon lies [one of [[his]764-the knight men]5031-his men , much bandaged about the head , swathed in linen , and covered with a cloak]5030-one of his men , much bandaged about the head , swathed in linen , and covered with a cloak . [The Knight]764-the knight has [my]373-the prioress leave to lay [the sick man]1128-the sick man before the holy relics , daily , for five days . [I]373-the prioress asked of [him]764-the knight what [he]764-the knight expected would result from so doing . [He]764-the knight made answer : ' A great recovery and restoration . ' "[373-the prioress]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop paused , as if meditating upon the words . Then [he]4673-the bishop slowly repeated them , taking evident pleasure in each syllable .

" A great recovery and restoration , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , and smiled .

" Well ? [The blessed relics]5034-the blessed relics can do much . [They]5034-the blessed relics may avail to mend a broken head . Could [they]5034-the blessed relics mend a broken heart ? [I]4673-the bishop know not . That were , of the two , the greater miracle . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop glanced at [the Prioress]373-the prioress .

[Her]373-the prioress face was averted .

" Well , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , matters being as they are , [you]4891-my daughter may inform [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine that , should [she]102-sister seraphine chance to lose [her]102-sister seraphine way among the hundred and forty - two columns , when passing through [the crypt after Vespers]5036-the crypt after vespers , [she]102-sister seraphine will find [a Knight , who will doubtless know what to do next]5037-a knight , who will doubtless know what to do next . But it would be well that [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine should have some practice in mounting and riding , before [she]102-sister seraphine goes on so adventurous a journey . [She]102-sister seraphine may remember the crimson trappings of [her]102-sister seraphine palfrey , and yet have forgotten how to sit [him]5037-a knight , who will doubtless know what to do next . It is for [us]5041-we to make sure that [the Knight]764-the knight 's brave plans for the safe capture of [[his]764-the knight lady]5043-his lady , do not fail for lack of any help which [we]5041-we may lawfully give . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop stretched out [his]4673-the bishop hand and took up [his]4673-the bishop biretta .

" When did [the nuns]298-the nuns last have a Play Day ? "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop asked .

" Not a month ago , "[373-the prioress] replied [the Prioress]373-the prioress . " [They]298-the nuns made the hay in [the river meadow]5045-the river meadow , and carried it [themselves]298-the nuns . [They]298-the nuns thought it rare sport . "[373-the prioress]

" Give [them]298-the nuns a Play Day , [dear Prioress]4979-dear prioress , in honour of [my]373-the prioress visit . Tell [them]298-the nuns [I]373-the prioress asked that [they]298-the nuns should have it the day after to - morrow . "[373-the prioress]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop rose , crossed [the cell]291-the cell , and knelt long , in prayer , before the crucifix .

After which : " Benedictio Domini sit vobiscum , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ; and made the sign of the cross over the bowed head of [the Prioress]373-the prioress .

CHAPTER XX

[HOLLY AND MISTLETOE

Symon]161-holly , [Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]1222-bishop of worcester , had bidden [Sir Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent to sup with [him]4673-the bishop at [the Palace]1309-the palace .

It was upon the second day after [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's conversation with [the Prioress]373-the prioress in [[the Convent]328-the convent at [Whytstone]3-whytstone]1313-the convent at whytstone ; the evening of [the Nun]461-the nun 's Play Day , granted in honour of [his]4673-the bishop visit . [The Bishop]4673-the bishop and [the Knight]764-the knight supped together , with much stately ceremony , in [the great banqueting hall]1317-the great banqueting hall .

Knowing [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's love of the beautiful , and [his]4673-the bishop habit of being punctilious in matters of array and deportment , acquired no doubt during [his]4673-the bishop lengthy sojourns in [France]39-france and [Italy]40-italy , [the Knight]764-the knight had donned [his]764-the knight finest court suit white satin , embroidered with silver ; jewelled collar , belt , and shoes ; a small - sword of exquisite workmanship at [his]764-the knight side . A white cloak , also richly embroidered with silver , hung from [his]764-the knight shoulders ; white silk hose set off the shapely length of [his]764-the knight limbs . The blood - red gleam of the magnificent rubies on [his]764-the knight breast , sword - belt , and shoe - buckles , were the only points of colour in [his]764-the knight attire .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop 's keen eyes noted with quiet pleasure how greatly this somewhat fantastically beautiful dress enhanced the dark splendour of [the Knight]764-the knight 's noble countenance , displayed [his]764-the knight superb carriage , and shewed off the supple grace of [his]764-the knight limbs , which , in [his]764-the knight ordinary garb , rather gave the idea of massive strength alone .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop [himself]4673-the bishop wore crimson and gold ; and , just as the dark beauty of [the Knight]764-the knight was enhanced by the fair white and silver of [his]764-the knight dress , so did these gorgeous Italian robes set off the frail whiteness of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's delicate face , the silvery softness of [his]4673-the bishop abundant hair . And just as the collar of rubies gleamed like fiery eyes upon [the Knight]764-the knight 's white satin doublet , so from out the pallor of [the Prelate]1326-the prelate 's countenance the eyes shone forth , bright with the fires of eternal , youth , the gay joy of life , the twinkling humour of a shrewd yet kindly wit .
