[They]1327-they supped at a round table of small size , in the very centre of [the huge apartment]1328-the huge apartment . It formed a point of light and brightness from which all else merged into shadow , and yet deeper shadow , until the eye reached the dark panelling of the walls .

The light seemed to centre in [the Knight]129-the knight white and silver ; the colour , in the figure of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop crimson and gold .

In and out of the shadows , swift and silent , on sandalled feet , moved [the lay - brothers serving the feast]1330-the lay - brothers serving the feast ; watchful of each detail ; quickly supplying every need .

At length [they]1327-they loaded the table with fruit ; put upon it fresh flagons of wine , and finally withdrew ; [each black - robed figure]1331-each black - robed figure merging into the black shadows , and vanishing in silence .

[[The Bishop]4673-the bishop 's Chaplain]1333-the bishop 's chaplain appeared in a distant doorway .

" Benedicite , "[154-symon of worcester] said [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester , looking up .

" [Deus]162-deus , "[1334-the chaplain] replied [the Chaplain]1334-the chaplain , making a profound obeisance .

Then [he]1334-the chaplain stood erect [a grim , austere figure , hard features , hollow eyes]1335-a grim , austere figure , hard features , hollow eyes , half - shrouded within [his]1334-the chaplain cowl .

[He]1334-the chaplain looked with sinister disapproval at the distant table , laden with fruit and flagons ; at [the Bishop]4673-the bishop and [the Knight]764-the knight , now sitting nigh to [one another]666-one another ; [the Bishop in [his]4673-the bishop chair of state]1339-the bishop in his chair of state facing the door , [the Knight]764-the knight , on a high - backed seat at [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's right hand , half - way round the table .

" [Holly]161-holly and [Mistletoe]161-holly , "[1334-the chaplain] muttered [the Chaplain]1334-the chaplain , as [he]1334-the chaplain closed the great door .

" [Yea]5051-yea , verily ! [Mistletoe]161-holly and [Holly]161-holly , "[1334-the chaplain] [he]1334-the chaplain repeated , as [he]1334-the chaplain strode to [[his]1334-the chaplain cell]1343-his cell . " [The Reverend Father]5052-the reverend father sups with [the World]389-the world , and indulges [the Flesh]4830-the flesh . Methinks [the Devil]404-the devil can not be far off . "[1334-the chaplain]

Nor was [he]1334-the chaplain .

[He]1334-the chaplain was very near .

[He]1334-the chaplain had looked over [the Chaplain]1334-the chaplain 's shoulder as [he]1334-the chaplain made [his]1334-the chaplain false obeisance in the doorway .

But [he]1334-the chaplain liked not the pure white of [the Knight]764-the knight 's dress , and [he]1334-the chaplain feared the clear light in [the Prelate]1326-the prelate 's eyes . So , when [the Chaplain]1334-the chaplain closed the door , [the Devil]404-the devil stayed on the outside , and now walked beside [the Chaplain]1334-the chaplain along the passage leading to [[his]1334-the chaplain cell]1343-his cell .

There is no surer way of securing the company of [the Devil]404-the devil , than to make sure [he]404-the devil is at that moment busy with another particularly if that other chance to be [the most saintly man [you]1353-you know]1352-the most saintly man you know , and merely displeasing to [you]1353-you , at the moment , because [he]404-the devil hath not bidden [you]1353-you to sup with [him]404-the devil . [The Devil]404-the devil and [the Chaplain]1334-the chaplain made a night of it .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop 's gentle " Benedicite "[4673-the bishop] spread white wings and flew , like an affrighted dove , over the head of [the bowing Chaplain]1357-the bowing chaplain , into [the chill passage beyond]1358-the chill passage beyond .

But , just as the great door was closing , it darted in again , circled round [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall , and came back to rest in the safe nest of the kindly heart which had sent [it]1360-it forth .

No blessing , truly vitalised , ever ceases to live . If [the blessed]1361-the blessed be unworthy , it returns on swift wing to [the blesser]1362-the blesser .

CHAPTER XXI

SO MUCH FOR [SERAPHINE]102-sister seraphine !

A sense of peace fell upon [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall , with the closing of the door . All unrest and suspicion seemed to have departed . An atmosphere of confidence and serenity pervaded [the great chamber]1364-the great chamber . It was in [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's smile , as [he]4673-the bishop turned to [the Knight]764-the knight .

" At length the time has come when [we]5056-we may talk freely ; and truly , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , [we]5056-we have much to say . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Knight]764-the knight glanced round [the spacious hall]1368-the spacious hall , and [his]764-the knight look implied that [he]764-the knight would prefer to talk in [a smaller chamber]1369-a smaller chamber .

" Nay , then , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " No situation can be better for a private conversation than the very centre of [a very large room]5058-a very large room . Have [you]764-the knight not heard it said that walls have ears ? Well , in [a small room]5059-a small room , [they]5060-they may use them to some purpose . But [here]4536-here , [we]5056-we sit so far removed from the walls that , strain [their]5060-they ears as [they]5060-they may , [they]5060-they will hear nothing ; even the very key - hole , opening wide its naughty eye , will see naught , neither will the adjacent ear hear anything . [We]5056-we may speak freely . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop , signing to [the Knight]764-the knight to help [himself]4673-the bishop to fruit , moved the wine toward [him]4673-the bishop . At [his]4673-the bishop own right hand stood a Venetian flagon and goblet of ruby glass , ornamented with vine leaves and clusters of grapes . [The Bishop]4673-the bishop drank only from this flagon , pouring its contents [himself]4673-the bishop into the goblet which [he]4673-the bishop held to the light before [he]4673-the bishop drank from it , enjoying the rich glow of colour , and the beauty of the engraving . [[His]4673-the bishop guests]1374-his guests sometimes wondered what specially choice kind of wine [the Bishop]4673-the bishop kept for [his]4673-the bishop own , exclusive use . If [they]1374-his guests asked , [he]4673-the bishop told [them]1374-his guests .

" The kind used at the marriage feast at [Cana]7-cana in [Galilee]41-galilee , when the supply of an inferior quality had failed . This , [[my]4673-the bishop friends]5062-my friends , is pure water , wholesome , refreshing , and not costly . [I]4673-the bishop drink it from glass which gives to it the colour of the juice of the grape , partly in order that [[my]4673-the bishop guests]5063-my guests may not feel chilled in [their]5063-my guests own enjoyment of more gay and luscious beverage ; partly because [I]4673-the bishop enjoy the emblem .[4673-the bishop]

" The gifts of circumstance , life , and nature , vary , not so much in themselves , as in the human vessels which contain them . If the heart be a ruby goblet , the humblest form of pure love filling it , will assume the rich tint and fervour of romance . If the mind be , in itself , a thing of vivid tints and glowing colours , the dullest thought within it will take on a lustre , a sparkle , a glow of brilliancy . Thus , whensoever [men]4397-men or matters seem to [me]4673-the bishop dull or wearisome , to [myself]4673-the bishop [I]4673-the bishop say : ' [Symon]154-symon of worcester ! [Thou]5065-thou art this day , [thyself]5065-thou , a pewter pot . ' "[4673-the bishop]

Then [the Bishop]4673-the bishop would fill up [his]4673-the bishop goblet and hold it to the light .

" Aye , the best wine ! "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop would say . " ' [Thou]5065-thou hast kept the best wine until now . ' The water of earth drawn by [faithful servants]5066-faithful servants , acting in unquestioning obedience to the commands of [the blessed Mother of [[our]5068-our Lord]4256-our lord]5067-the blessed mother of our lord transmuted by the word and power of [the Divine Son]5070-the divine son ; outpoured for [others]482-others , in loving service ; this is ever ' the best wine . ' "[4673-the bishop]

[The Knight]764-the knight filled [his]764-the knight goblet and took some fruit . Then , leaving both untouched , turned [his]764-the knight chair sidewise , that [he]764-the knight might the better face [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , crossed [his]4673-the bishop knees , leaned [his]4673-the bishop right elbow on the table and [his]4673-the bishop head upon [his]4673-the bishop hand , pushing [his]4673-the bishop fingers into [his]4673-the bishop hair .

Thus , for a while , [they]1379-they sat in silence ; [the Knight]764-the knight 's eyes searching [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's face ; [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , intent upon the colour of [his]4673-the bishop ruby goblet . At length [Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh spoke .

" [I]132-hugh have been through [deep waters]5072-deep waters , [Reverend Father]4875-reverend father , since last [I]132-hugh supped with [you]4875-reverend father . "[132-hugh]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop put down the goblet .

" So [I]4673-the bishop supposed , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son . Now tell [me]4673-the bishop what [you]5057-my son will , neither more nor less . [I]4673-the bishop will then give [you]5057-my son what counsel [I]4673-the bishop can . On the one point concerning which [you]5057-my son must not tell [me]4673-the bishop more than [I]4673-the bishop may rightly know , [I]4673-the bishop will question [you]5057-my son . Have [you]5057-my son contrived to see [the woman [you]5057-my son loved]5075-the woman you loved , and lost , and are now seeking to regain ? Tell [me]4673-the bishop not how , nor when , nor where ; but have [you]5057-my son had speech with [her]5075-the woman you loved ? Have [you]5057-my son made clear to [her]5075-the woman you loved the treachery which sundered [you]5057-my son ? Have [you]5057-my son pleaded with [her]5075-the woman you loved to remember [her]5075-the woman you loved early betrothal , to renounce these later vows , and to fly with [you]5057-my son ? "[4673-the bishop]

[The Knight]764-the knight looked straight into [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's keen eyes .

At first [he]764-the knight could not bring [himself]764-the knight to answer .

[This princely figure]1386-this princely figure , with [his]1386-this princely figure crimson robes and golden cross , so visibly represented the power and authority of [the Church]4592-the church .

[His]764-the knight own intrusion into [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery , [his]764-the knight attempt to win away [a holy nun]4479-a holy nun , suddenly appeared to [him]764-the knight , as the most appalling sacrilege .

With awe and consternation in [his]764-the knight own , [he]764-the knight met [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's eyes .

At first they were merely clear and searching , and [the Knight]764-the knight sat tongue - tied . But presently there flicked into [them]1392-them a look so human , so tender , so completely understanding , that straightway the tongue of [the Knight]764-the knight was loosed .

" [[My]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , [I]764-the knight have , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said . " All those things have [I]764-the knight done . [I]764-the knight have been in [heaven]335-heaven , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , and [I]764-the knight have been in [hell]5078-hell "[764-the knight]

" Sh , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , "[4673-the bishop] murmured [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " Methinks [you]5057-my son have been in [a place which is neither [heaven nor hell]5081-heaven nor hell]5080-a place which is neither heaven nor hell ; though it may , on occasion , approximate somewhat nearly to both . How [you]5057-my son got [there]333-there , is a marvel to [me]4673-the bishop ; and how [you]5057-my son escaped , without creating a scandal , an even greater wonder . Yet [I]4673-the bishop think it wise , for the present , not to know too much . [I]4673-the bishop merely required to be certain that [you]5057-my son had actually found [[your]5057-my son lost betrothed]5083-your lost betrothed , made [her]5083-your lost betrothed aware of [your]5057-my son proximity , [your]5057-my son discovery , and [your]5057-my son desires . [I]4673-the bishop gathered that [you]5057-my son had succeeded in so doing ; for , two days ago , [the Prioress]373-the prioress [herself]373-the prioress sent to beg a private interview with [me]4673-the bishop , in order to ask whether , under certain circumstances , [I]4673-the bishop could approve the return of [a nun]412-a nun to [the world]389-the world , and obtain absolution from [her]373-the prioress vows . "[4673-the bishop]

The rubies on [the Knight]764-the knight 's breast suddenly glittered , as if a bound of [his]764-the knight heart had caused [them]1396-them all to leap together . But , except for that quick sparkle , [he]764-the knight sat immovable , and made no sign .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop had marked the gleam of the rubies .

[He]4673-the bishop lifted [his]4673-the bishop Venetian goblet to the light and observed it carefully , as [he]4673-the bishop continued : " [The Prioress]373-the prioress [a most wise and noble lady]5088-a most wise and noble lady , of whom [I]4673-the bishop told [you]5057-my son on the day when [you]5057-my son first questioned [me]4673-the bishop concerning [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery has been having trouble with [a nun]412-a nun , by name [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine . [This young and lovely lady]5091-this young and lovely lady has , just lately , heard [the world]389-the world loudly calling on [her]5091-this young and lovely lady own shewing , through the neighing of a palfrey bringing to mind past scenes of gaiety . But [the Prioress]373-the prioress suspicioned the voice of [an earthly lover]4887-an earthly lover ; and [I]4673-the bishop , knowing how reckless and resolute [an earthly lover]4887-an earthly lover was attempting to invade [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery , [we]5097-we both [the Prioress]373-the prioress and [I]4673-the bishop drew [our]5097-we own conclusions , and proceeded to face the problem with which [we]5097-we found [ourselves]5097-we confronted , namely : whether to allow or to thwart the flight of [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Knight]129-the knight , toying with walnuts , held at the moment four in the palm of [his]129-the knight right hand . [They]1398-they broke with a four - fold crack , which sounded but as one mighty crunch . Then , all unconscious of what [he]129-the knight did , [the Knight]764-the knight opened [his]129-the knight great hand and let fall upon the table , a little heap of crushed nuts , shells and white flesh inextricably mixed .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop glanced at the small heap . The veiled twinkle in [his]4673-the bishop eyes seemed to say ; " So much for [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine ! "[4673-the bishop]

" [I]764-the knight know [not any lady of that name]5099-not any lady of that name , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight .

" Not by that name , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son . [The nuns]298-the nuns are not known in [the Convent]328-the convent by the names [they]298-the nuns bore before [they]298-the nuns left [the world]389-the world . [I]4673-the bishop happen to know that [the Prioress]373-the prioress , before [she]373-the prioress professed , was [Mora]144-mora , [Countess of [Norelle]42-norelle]5105-countess of norelle . [I]4673-the bishop know this because , years ago , [I]4673-the bishop saw [her]144-mora at [the Court]4621-the court , when [she]144-mora was [a maid of honour to [the Queen]4576-the queen]5107-a maid of honour to the queen ; very young and lovely ; yet , even then remarkable for wisdom , piety , and a certain sweet dignity of deportment . Sometimes now , when [she]144-mora receives [me]4673-the bishop in the severe habit of [her]144-mora Order , [I]4673-the bishop find [myself]4673-the bishop remembering the flow of beautiful hair , soft as spun silk , bound by a circlet of gold round the regal head ; the velvet and ermine ; the jewels at [her]144-mora breast . Yet do [I]4673-the bishop chide [myself]4673-the bishop for recalling things which [these holy women]5109-these holy women have renounced , and doubtless would fain forget . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop struck a silver gong with [his]4673-the bishop left hand .

At once a distant door opened in the dark panelling and [two black - robed figures]1403-two black - robed figures glided in .

" Kindle a fire on the hearth , "[4673-the bishop] commanded [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ; adding to [[his]4673-the bishop guest]1405-his guest : " The evening air strikes chilly . Also [I]4673-the bishop greatly love the smell of burning wood . It is pungent to the nostrils , and refreshing to the brain . "[4673-the bishop]

[The monks]4870-the monks hastened to kindle the wood and to fan it into a flame .

Presently , the fire blazing brightly , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop rose , and signed to [the monks]4870-the monks to place the chairs near the great fireplace . This [they]4870-the monks did ; and , making profound obeisance , withdrew .

Thus [the Bishop]4673-the bishop and [the Knight]764-the knight , alone once more , were seated in the firelight . As it illumined the white and silver doublet , and glowed in the rubies , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop conceived the whimsical fancy that [the Knight]764-the knight might well be [some splendid archangel]1413-some splendid archangel , come down to force [the Convent]328-the convent gates and carry off [a nun]412-a nun to [heaven]335-heaven . And [the Knight]764-the knight , watching the leaping flame flicker on [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's crimson robes and silvery hair , saw the lenient smile upon the saintly face and took courage as [he]4673-the bishop realised how kindly was the heart , filled with most human sympathy , which beat beneath the cross of gold upon [the Prelate]1326-the prelate 's breast .

Leaning forward , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop lifted the faggot - fork and moved one of the burning logs so that a jet of blue smoke , instead of mounting the chimney , came out toward them on the hearth .

[Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester sat back and inhaled it with enjoyment .

" This is refreshing , "[154-symon of worcester] [he]154-symon of worcester said . " This soothes and yet braces the mind . And now , [[my]154-symon of worcester son]5057-my son , let [us]5111-our return to the question of [your]5057-my son own private concerns . First , let [me]154-symon of worcester ask [Hugh]132-hugh , [dear lad]5112-dear lad , as [friend]5113-friend and [counsellor]5114-counsellor [I]154-symon of worcester ask it are [you]132-hugh able now to tell [me]154-symon of worcester the name of [the woman [you]132-hugh desire to [we]5111-our d]5115-the woman you desire to we d ? "[154-symon of worcester]

" Nay , [[my]764-the knight dear lord]5116-my dear lord , "[764-the knight] replied [the Knight]764-the knight , " that [I]764-the knight can not do . [I]764-the knight guard [her]5115-the woman you desire to we d name , as [I]764-the knight would guard [mine]764-the knight honour . If as may [[our]5111-our Lady]4260-our lady be pleased to grant [she]5115-the woman you desire to we d consent to fly with [me]764-the knight , [her]5115-the woman you desire to we d name will still be [mine]764-the knight to guard ; yet then [all men]5118-all men may know it , so [they]5118-all men speak it with due respect and reverence . But if as may [[our]5111-our blessed [Lady]5120-lady]4297-our blessed lady forbid [she]5115-the woman you desire to we d withhold [herself]5115-the woman you desire to we d from [me]764-the knight , so that three days hence [I]764-the knight ride away alone ; then must [I]764-the knight ride away leaving no shadow of reproach on [her]5115-the woman you desire to we d fair fame . [Her]5115-the woman you desire to we d name will be forever in [my]764-the knight heart ; but no word of [mine]764-the knight shall have left it , in the mind of [any man]4301-any man , linked with broken vows , or [a forsaken lover]5122-a forsaken lover . "[764-the knight]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop looked long and earnestly at [the Knight]764-the knight .

" That being so , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said at length , " for want of any better name , [I]4673-the bishop needs must call [her]5115-the woman you desire to we d by the name [she]5115-the woman you desire to we d bears in [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery , and now speak with [you]5057-my son of [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine . "[4673-the bishop]

[Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent frowned .

" [I]132-hugh care not to hear of this [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh said .

" Yet [I]4673-the bishop fear [me]4673-the bishop [you]132-hugh must summon patience to hear of [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine for a few moments , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , quietly ; ' seeing that [I]0-i have here a letter from [the Prioress]373-the prioress [herself]373-the prioress , in which [she]373-the prioress sends [you]132-hugh a message . . . . Ah ! [I]0-i marvel not that [you]132-hugh are taken by surprise , [[my]0-i dear]4718-my dear [Knight]129-the knight ; but keep [your]132-hugh seat , and let not [your]132-hugh hand fly so readily to [your]132-hugh sword . To transfix [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother 's gracious epistle on [your]132-hugh blade 's keen point , would not tend to elucidate [her]427-the reverend mother meaning ; nor could it alter the fact that [she]427-the reverend mother sends [you]132-hugh important counsel concerning [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine . "[427-the reverend mother]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop lighted a wax taper standing at [his]4673-the bishop elbow , drew a letter from the folds of [his]4673-the bishop sash , slowly unfolded and held it to the light .

[The Knight]764-the knight sat silent , [his]764-the knight face in shadow . The leaping flame of the fire played on [his]764-the knight sword hilt and on the rubies across [his]764-the knight breast .

As the parchment crackled between [the Bishop]92-bishop 's fingers , [the Knight]764-the knight kept [himself]764-the knight well in hand ; but [he]764-the knight prayed [he]764-the knight might not have need to speak , nor to meet [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's eyes . These [the saints]4874-the saints be praised were now intent upon the closely written page .

The light of the taper illumined the almost waxen whiteness of the gentle face , and gleamed upon the [Bishop]92-bishop 's ring . [The Knight]764-the knight , fixing [his]764-the knight eyes upon the stone , saw it the colour of red wine .

At last [the Bishop]4673-the bishop began to speak with careful deliberation , [his]4673-the bishop eyes upon the letter , yet telling , instead of reading ; a method ofttimes maddening to [an anxious listener]1435-an anxious listener , eager to snatch the parchment and master its contents for [himself]4673-the bishop ; yet who must perforce wait to receive them , with due patience , from another .

" [The Prioress]373-the prioress relates to [me]4673-the bishop first of all a conversation [she]373-the prioress had , by [my]4673-the bishop suggestion , with [Sister Mary Serephine]163-sister mary serephine , in which [she]373-the prioress told that [lady]5126-lady much of what passed between [herself]373-the prioress and [me]4673-the bishop when [she]373-the prioress consulted [me]4673-the bishop upon the apparent desire of [this nun]5127-this nun to escape from [the Convent]328-the convent , renounce [her]373-the prioress vows , and return to [[her]373-the prioress lover]762-her lover and [the world]389-the world [[her]373-the prioress lover who had come to save [her]373-the prioress]5131-her lover who had come to save her . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop paused .

[The Knight]764-the knight stirred uneasily in [his]764-the knight seat . A net seemed to be closing around [him]764-the knight . Almost [he]764-the knight saw [himself]764-the knight compelled to ride to [Warwick]32-warwick in company with [this most undesired and undesirable nun]1438-this most undesired and undesirable nun , [Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop raised [his]4673-the bishop eyes from the letter and looked pensively into the fire .

" A most piteous scene took place , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " on the day when [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine first heard again the call of [the outer world]4980-the outer world . Most moving it was , as told [me]4673-the bishop by [the Prioress]373-the prioress . [The distraught nun]5134-the distraught nun lay upon the floor of [[her]5134-the distraught nun cell]321-her cell in an abandonment of frantic weeping . [She]5134-the distraught nun imitated the galloping of a horse with [her]5134-the distraught nun hands and feet , a ride of some sort evidently being in [her]5134-the distraught nun mind . At length [she]5134-the distraught nun lifted a swollen countenance , crying that [[her]5134-the distraught nun lover]762-her lover had come to save [her]5134-the distraught nun . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Knight]764-the knight clenched [his]764-the knight teeth , in despair . Almost , [he]764-the knight and [this fearsome nun]1441-this fearsome nun had arrived at [Warwick]32-warwick , and [she]1441-this fearsome nun was lifting a swollen countenance to [him]764-the knight that [he]764-the knight might embrace it .

Yet [Mora]144-mora well knew that [he]764-the knight had not come for any [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine ! [Mora]144-mora might deny [herself]144-mora to [him]764-the knight ; but [she]144-mora would not foist another upon [him]764-the knight . Only , alas ! [this grave and Reverend Prioress of whom [the Bishop]4673-the bishop spoke]1442-this grave and reverend prioress of whom the bishop spoke , hardly seemed one with [the woman of [his]764-the knight desire]1444-the woman of his desire ; [she]1441-this fearsome nun who , but three evenings before , had yielded [her]1441-this fearsome nun lips to [his]764-the knight , clasping [her]1441-this fearsome nun arms around [him]764-the knight ; loving , even while [she]1441-this fearsome nun denied [him]764-the knight .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop 's eyes were again upon the letter .

" [The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " with [her]91-mother sub - prioress usual instinctive sense of the helpfulness of outward surroundings , and desiring , with a fine justice , to give [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine and [[her]102-sister seraphine lover]762-her lover every possible advantage , arranged that the conversation should take place in [the Nunnery garden]5138-the nunnery garden , in a secluded spot where [they]5139-they could not be overheard , yet where the sunshine glinted , through overhanging branches , flecking , in golden patches , the soft turf ; where birds carolled , and spread swift wings ; where white clouds chased one another across the blue sky ; in fact , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , suddenly looking up , " where all Nature sang aloud of liberty and nonrestraint . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Knight]129-the knight 's eyes , frowning from beneath a shading hand , were gloomy and full of sombre fury .

It mattered not to [him]129-the knight in what surroundings this preposterous offer , that [she]1441-this fearsome nun should leave [the Convent]43-the convent and fly with [him]129-the knight to [Warwick]32-warwick , had been made to [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine . [Her]1441-this fearsome nun swollen countenance would be equally unattractive , whether lifted in [cell]1447-cell or [cloister]4771-cloister , or where white clouds chased one another across the blue sky !

[The Knight]764-the knight felt as if [he]764-the knight were being chased , and by something more to be feared than a white cloud . [Grim Nemesis]164-grim nemesis pursued [him]764-the knight . [This reverend prelate]1450-this reverend prelate , whom [he]129-the knight had deemed so wise , was well - nigh witless . Yet [Mora]144-mora knew the truth . Would [her]1441-this fearsome nun kind hands deal [him]129-the knight so base a blow ?

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop saw the brooding rage in [the Knight]129-the knight 's eyes , and [he]4673-the bishop lowered [his]4673-the bishop own to the letter , in time to hide their twinkling .

[Even the best and bravest of Knights]1452-even the best and bravest of knights , for having forced [his]129-the knight way into [a Nunnery]4901-a nunnery , pressed a suit upon [a nun]412-a nun , and escaped unscathed , deserved some punishment at the hands of [the Church]4592-the church !

" Which was generous in [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , ' since [she]1441-this fearsome nun was inclined , upon the whole , to disapprove this offering of liberty to [the restless nun]1457-the restless nun . [You]1458-you can well understand that , the responsibility for the good conduct of [that entire Community]1459-that entire community resting upon [the Prioress]373-the prioress , [she]1441-this fearsome nun is bound to regard with disfavour any innovation which might tend to provoke a scandal . "[1441-this fearsome nun]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop did not look up , or [he]4673-the bishop would have seen dull despair displacing [the Knight]764-the knight 's anger .

" However [she]1441-this fearsome nun appears faithfully to have laid before [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , [my]1441-this fearsome nun view of the matter , giving [her]1441-this fearsome nun to understand that [I]1441-this fearsome nun am inclined to be lenient concerning vows made under misapprehension ; also that , when there is not a true vocation , and a worldly spirit chafes against the cloistered life , [I]1441-this fearsome nun regard its presence within [the Community]483-the community as more likely to be harmful to the common weal , than the short - lived scandal which might arise if [those in power]5143-those in power should connive at an escape . "[1441-this fearsome nun]

[The Knight]764-the knight moved impatiently in [his]764-the knight seat .

" Could [we]5144-we arrive , [[my]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , " at the [Lady Prioress]165-lady prioress 's message , of which [you]4881-my lord spoke ? "[764-the knight]

" [We]5144-we are tending thither , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , unruffled . " Curb [your]764-the knight impatience . [[We]5144-we of [the Cloister]286-the cloister]5147-we of the cloister are wo nt to move slowly , with measured tread each step a careful following up of the step which went before not with the leaps and bounds and capers of [the laity]5149-the laity . In due time [we]5144-we shall reach the message .[4673-the bishop]

" Well , in this conversation [the Prioress]373-the prioress appears to have complied with [my]764-the knight suggestions , excepting in the matter of one most important detail , concerning which [she]373-the prioress used [her]373-the prioress own discretion . [I]764-the knight distinctly advised [her]373-the prioress to tell [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine that [we]5144-we were aware of [your]764-the knight arrival , and that to [my]764-the knight certain knowledge [you]764-the knight were in [the crypt]273-the crypt each afternoon at the hour when [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies pass to and from Vespers . In fact , [[my]764-the knight dear]4718-my dear [Knight]129-the knight , [I]764-the knight even went so far as to suggest to [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother to give [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine to understand that if [she]102-sister seraphine stepped aside , losing [her]102-sister seraphine way among the many pillars , [you]764-the knight would probably know what to do next .[764-the knight]

" But [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother writes "[4673-the bishop] at last [the Bishop]4673-the bishop began to read : " ' [I]4673-the bishop felt so sure from [your]764-the knight description of [the noble Knight who came to [you]764-the knight in [his]5156-the noble knight who came to you in his trouble trouble]5156-the noble knight who came to you in his trouble , that [he]5156-the noble knight who came to you in his trouble can not be [the lover of [this shallow - hearted little [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine]5158-this shallow - hearted little seraphine]5157-the lover of this shallow - hearted little seraphine , that [I]4673-the bishop deemed it wise not to tell [her]102-sister seraphine of [his]5156-the noble knight who came to you in his trouble arrival , nor to mention [your]764-the knight idea , that [the woman [he]5156-the noble knight who came to you in his trouble seeks]5159-the woman he seeks is to be found in [this Nunnery]4944-this nunnery . ' "[4673-the bishop]

The smothered sound which broke from [the Knight]764-the knight was a mixture of triumph , relief , and most bitter laughter .

" Now that is like [the Prioress]373-the prioress , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ; " thus to use [her]373-the prioress own judgment , setting at naught [my]4673-the bishop superior knowledge of the facts , and flouting [my]4673-the bishop authority ! A noble nature , [Hugh]132-hugh , and most lovable ; yet an imperious will , and a strength of character and purpose unusual in [a woman]813-a woman . Had [she]373-the prioress remained in [the world]389-the world and married , [[her]373-the prioress husband]5164-her husband would have found it somewhat difficult wholly to mould [her]373-the prioress to [his]5164-her husband will . Yet to possess [such a woman]5165-such a woman would have been worth adventuring much . But [I]4673-the bishop must not fret [you]764-the knight , [dear lad]5112-dear lad , by talking of [the Prioress]373-the prioress , when [your]764-the knight mind is intent upon arriving at the decision of [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine .[4673-the bishop]

" Well , [I]4673-the bishop fear [me]4673-the bishop , [I]4673-the bishop have but sorry news for [you]764-the knight . [The Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother writes : ' [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine expressed [herself]102-sister seraphine as completely satisfied with the cloistered life . [She]102-sister seraphine declared that [her]102-sister seraphine desire to return to [the world]389-the world had been but a passing phase , of which [she]102-sister seraphine was completely purged by the timely discipline of [Mother Sub - Prioress]324-mother sub - prioress , and by the fact that [she]102-sister seraphine has been appointed , with [Sister Mary Gabriel]166-sister mary gabriel , to embroider the new altar - cloth for [the Chapel]5170-the chapel . [She]102-sister seraphine talked more eagerly about a stitch [she]102-sister seraphine is learning from [Mary Gabriel]166-sister mary gabriel , than about any of those by - gone memories , which certainly had seemed most poignantly revived in [her]102-sister seraphine ; and [I]4673-the bishop had no small difficulty in turning [her]102-sister seraphine mind from the all - absorbing question as to how to obtain the right tint for the pomegranates . [[My]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , to a mind thus intent upon needle - work for [the Altar of [God]89-god]5172-the altar of god , [I]4673-the bishop could scarce have brought [myself]4673-the bishop to mention the call of [an earthly lover]4887-an earthly lover , even had [I]4673-the bishop believed [[your]4881-my lord Knight]5174-your knight to be seeking [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine . [Her]102-sister seraphine heart is now wedded to the Cloister . ' "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop looked up .

" Therefore , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , [we]5176-we must conclude that [your]5057-my son secret interview , whenever or wherever it took place , had no effect will bear no lasting fruit . "[4673-the bishop] [The Bishop]4673-the bishop could not resist this allusion to the pomegranates of [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine .

But [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent , face to face with the suspended portcullis of [his]132-hugh fate , trampled all such gossamer beneath impatient feet .

[He]132-hugh moistened [his]132-hugh dry lips .

" The message , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh said .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop lifted the letter .

" ' But , ' "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop read , " ' if [you]4881-my lord still believe [[your]4881-my lord noble Knight]5177-your noble knight to be [the lover of [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine]5178-the lover of seraphine , then [I]4673-the bishop pray [you]4881-my lord to tell [him]5177-your noble knight this from [me]4673-the bishop . [No nun worthy of [a brave man]5180-a brave man 's love]5179-no nun worthy of a brave man 's love , would consent to break [her]5179-no nun worthy of a brave man 's love vows . [A nun who could renounce [her]5179-no nun worthy of a brave man 's love vows to go to [him]5177-your noble knight]5181-a nun who could renounce her vows to go to him , would wrong [herself]5179-no nun worthy of a brave man 's love and [him]5177-your noble knight , bringing no blessing to [[his]5177-your noble knight home]5182-his home . Better an empty hearth , than a hearth where broods a curse . [I]4673-the bishop ask [you]4881-my lord , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , to give this as a message to [that noble Knight]5184-that noble knight from [me]4673-the bishop [the Prioress of [this House]5020-this house]5185-the prioress of this house and to bid [him]5177-your noble knight go in peace , praying for a heart submissive to the will of [God]89-god . ' "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop 's voice fell silent . [He]4673-the bishop had maintained its quiet tones , yet perforce had had to rise to something of the dignity of this final pronouncement of [the Prioress]373-the prioress , and [he]4673-the bishop spoke the last words with deep emotion .

[Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent leaned forward , [his]132-hugh elbows on [his]132-hugh knees ; then dropped [his]132-hugh head upon [his]132-hugh hands , and so stayed motionless .

The portcullis had fallen . Its iron spikes transfixed [his]132-hugh very soul .

[She]1473-her was [his]132-hugh , yet lost to [him]132-hugh .

This final word of [her]1473-her authority , this speaking , through [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's mouth , yet with the dignity of [[her]1473-her own high office]1475-her own high office , all seemed of set intent , to beat out the last ray of hope within [him]132-hugh .

As [he]132-hugh sat silent , with bowed head , wild thoughts chased through [his]132-hugh brain . [He]132-hugh was back with [her]1473-her in the subterranean way . [He]132-hugh knelt at [her]1473-her feet in the yellow circle of the lantern 's light . [Her]1473-her tender hands , [[her]1473-her woman]1476-her woman 's hands , [her]1473-her firm yet gentle hands , fell on [his]132-hugh head ; the fingers moved , with soothing touch , in and out of [his]132-hugh hair . Then when [his]132-hugh love and longing broke through [his]132-hugh control came [her]1473-her surrender .

Ah , when [she]1473-her was in [his]132-hugh arms , why did [he]132-hugh loose [her]1473-her ? Or , when [she]1473-her had unlocked the door , and the dim , grey light , like a pearly dawn at sea , stole downward from [the crypt]273-the crypt , why , like [a fool]1478-a fool , did [he]132-hugh mount the steps alone , and leave [her]1473-her standing there ? Why did [he]132-hugh not fling [his]132-hugh cloak about [her]1473-her , and carry [her]1473-her up , whether [she]1473-her would or no ? " Why ? "[132-hugh] cried the demon of despair in [his]132-hugh soul . " Ah , why ! "[132-hugh]

But , even then , [his]132-hugh own true heart made answer . [He]132-hugh had loosed [her]1473-her because [he]132-hugh loved [her]1473-her too well to hold [her]1473-her to [him]132-hugh when [she]1473-her had seemed to wish to stand free . And [he]132-hugh had gone alone , because never would [he]132-hugh force [a woman]813-a woman to come with [him]132-hugh against [her]1473-her will . [His]132-hugh very strength was safeguard to [her]1473-her weakness .

[Presently Hugh]132-hugh heard [the Bishop]4673-the bishop folding [the Prioress]373-the prioress 's letter . [He]132-hugh lifted [his]132-hugh head and held out [his]132-hugh hand .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop was slipping the letter into [his]4673-the bishop sash .

[He]4673-the bishop paused . [Those]1483-those eyes implored . That outstretched hand demanded .

" Nay , [dear lad]5112-dear lad , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " [I]4673-the bishop may not give it [you]5112-dear lad , because it mentions [the White Ladies]117-the white ladies by name , the Order , and [poor little shallow , changeful [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine [herself]102-sister seraphine]5188-poor little shallow , changeful seraphine herself , But this much [I]4673-the bishop will do : as [you]5112-dear lad may not have it , [none other]4529-none other shall . "[4673-the bishop] With which [the Bishop , unfolding the Prioress]1485-the bishop , unfolding the prioress 's letter , flung it upon the burning logs .

Together [they]1486-they watched it curl and blacken ; uncurl again , and slowly flake away . Long after the rest had fallen to ashes , this sentence remained clear : " Better an empty hearth ; than a hearth where broods a curse . "[4673-the bishop] The flames played about it , but still it remained legible ; white letters , upon a black ground ; then , letters of fire upon grey ashes .

Of a sudden [the Knight]764-the knight , seizing the faggot - fork , dashed out the words with a stroke .

" [I]764-the knight would risk the curse , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight cried , with passion . " By [Pilate]168-pilate 's water , [I]764-the knight would risk the curse ! "[764-the knight] " [I]4673-the bishop know [you]5112-dear lad would , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " and , by [our]1486-they Lady 's crown , [I]4673-the bishop would have let [you]5112-dear lad risk it , believing , as [I]4673-the bishop do , that it would end in blessing . But listen , [Hugh]132-hugh . In asking what [you]5112-dear lad asked , [you]5112-dear lad scarce know what [you]5112-dear lad did . [You]5112-dear lad need not say ' yea , ' nor ' nay , ' but [I]4673-the bishop incline to think with [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , that [the woman [you]5112-dear lad sought]5191-the woman you sought was not foolish [little Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , turned one way by the neighing of [a palfrey]5192-a palfrey , another by the embroidering of a pomegranate . There are [women of finer mould in that Nunnery]5193-women of finer mould in that nunnery , [any one of whom may be [[your]5112-dear lad lost betrothed]5083-your lost betrothed]5194-any one of whom may be your lost betrothed . But of this [we]1486-they may be sure : whosoever [she]5191-the woman you sought be , [the Prioress]373-the prioress knows [her]5191-the woman you sought , and knew of whom [she]373-the prioress wrote when [she]373-the prioress sent [you]5112-dear lad that message . [She]5191-the woman you sought has the entire confidence of all in [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery . [I]4673-the bishop verily believe [she]5191-the woman you sought knows [them]5193-women of finer mould in that nunnery better than does [[their]5193-women of finer mould in that nunnery confessor]5198-their confessor [a saintly old man]5199-a saintly old man , but dim .[4673-the bishop]

" Now , listen to [me]764-the knight . [I]764-the knight said [you]5112-dear lad knew not what [you]5112-dear lad asked . [Hugh]132-hugh , [[my]764-the knight lad]5200-my lad , if [you]5112-dear lad had won [[your]5112-dear lad betrothed]4739-your betrothed away , [you]5112-dear lad would have had much to learn and much to unlearn . Believe [me]764-the knight , [I]764-the knight know [women]4202-women , as [only a priest of many years]5203-only a priest of many years ' standing can know [them]4202-women . [Women]4202-women are either bad or good . The bad are bad below [man]4362-man 's understanding , because [their]4202-women badness is not leavened by one grain of honour ; a fact the worst of [men]4397-men will ever fail to grasp . The good are good above [man]4362-man 's comprehension , because [their]4202-women perfect purity of heart causeth the spirit ever to triumph over the flesh ; and [their]4202-women love - instinct is the instinct of self - sacrifice . [Every true woman]5208-every true woman is a Madonna in [the home]5209-the home , or fain would be , if [[her]5208-every true woman man]5210-her man would let [her]5208-every true woman . To [such a woman]5165-such a woman , each promise of [a child]5212-a child is an Annunciation ; [[our]5213-our Lady]4260-our lady 's awe and wonder , whisper again in the temple of [her]4260-our lady inner being ; for [her]4260-our lady love has deified [the man [she]4260-our lady loves]5215-the man she loves ; and , it seems to [her]4260-our lady , [a child of [his]5215-the man she loves and [hers]5217-hers]5216-a child of his and hers must be [a holy babe]5218-a holy babe , born into [the world]389-the world to help redeem it . And so it would be , could [she]4260-our lady but have [her]4260-our lady way . But too often [the man]4228-the man fails to understand , and so spoils the perfect plan . And [she]4260-our lady to whom love means self - sacrifice , sacrifices all even [her]4260-our lady noblest ideals sooner than fail a call upon [her]4260-our lady love . Yet [I]764-the knight say again , could [the Madonna]146-the madonna instinct have had full sway , [the world]389-the world would have been redeemed ere now to holiness , to happiness , to health .[764-the knight]

" [You]5222-you looked high , [[my]764-the knight son]5057-my son , by [your]5222-you own shewing . [You]5222-you loved high . [Your]5222-you love was worthy , for [you]5222-you remained faithful , when [you]5222-you believed [you]5222-you had been betrayed . Let [your]5222-you consolation now be the knowledge that [she]4260-our lady also was faithful , and that it is a double faithfulness which keeps [her]4260-our lady from responding to the call of [your]5222-you love . Seek union with [her]4260-our lady on the spiritual plane , and some day in [the Realm]5224-the realm where all noble things shall attain unto full perfection [you]5222-you may yet give thanks that [your]5222-you love was not allowed to pass through the perilous pitfalls of an earthly union . "[764-the knight]

[The Knight]764-the knight looked at the delicate face of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , with its wistful smile , its charm of extreme refinement .

Yes ! Here spoke [the Prelate]1326-the prelate , [the Idealist]1492-the idealist , [the Mystic]1220-the mystic .

But [the Knight]764-the knight was [a man]4482-a man and [a lover]4976-a lover .

[His]764-the knight dark face flushed , and [his]764-the knight eyes grew bright with inward fires such as [the Bishop]4673-the bishop could hardly be expected to understand .

" [I]4673-the bishop want not [spiritual planes]5225-spiritual planes , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " nor realms of perfection . [I]4673-the bishop want [[my]4673-the bishop own wife]5226-my own wife , in [[my]4673-the bishop own home]5227-my own home ; and , could [I]4673-the bishop have won [her]5226-my own wife [there]333-there , [I]4673-the bishop have not much doubt but that [I]4673-the bishop could have lifted [her]5226-my own wife over any perilous pitfalls that came in [her]5226-my own wife way . "[4673-the bishop]

" True , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , at once gently acquiescent ; for [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester invariably yielded a point which had been misunderstood . For over - rating a mind with which [he]154-symon of worcester conversed , this was ever [his]154-symon of worcester self - imposed penance . " [Your]5057-my son great strength would be fully equal to lifting [ladies]5230-ladies over pitfalls . Which recalls to [my]154-symon of worcester mind a scene in this day 's events , which [I]154-symon of worcester would fain describe to [you]5057-my son before [we]5231-we part . "[154-symon of worcester]

CHAPTER XXII

WHAT [BROTHER PHILIP]160-brother philip HAD TO TELL

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop sat back in [his]4673-the bishop chair , smiling , as at a mental picture which gave [him]4673-the bishop pleasure , coupled with some amusement .

Ignoring [the Knight]129-the knight 's sullen silence , [he]4673-the bishop began [his]4673-the bishop story in the cheerful voice which takes for granted a willing and [an interested listener]1500-an interested listener .

" When [the Prioress]373-the prioress and [myself]4673-the bishop were discussing [your]5057-my son hopes , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , and [I]4673-the bishop was urging , in [your]5057-my son interests , liberty of flight for [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , [I]4673-the bishop informed [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother that the carrying out of [your]5057-my son plans , carefully laid in order to keep any scandal concerning [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies from reaching [the city]1177-the city , would involve for [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine a ride of many hours to [Warwick]32-warwick , almost immediately upon safely reaching [the Star hostel]5237-the star hostel . This seemed as nothing to [the lover who , by [his]5238-the lover who , by his own shewing own shewing]5238-the lover who , by his own shewing , had ofttimes seen [her]102-sister seraphine ' ride like a bird , all day , on [the moors]4601-the moors . ' But to [us]5240-us [who know the effect of monastic life and how quickly such matters as these become lost arts through disuse]5241-who know the effect of monastic life and how quickly such matters as these become lost arts through disuse , this romantic ride in the late afternoon and on into the summer night , loomed large as a possible obstacle to the successful flight of [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine .[4673-the bishop]

" Therefore , in order that [our]5240-us little bird might try [her]102-sister seraphine wings , regain [her]102-sister seraphine seat and mastery of a horse , and rid [herself]102-sister seraphine of a first painful stiffness , [I]4673-the bishop persuaded [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother to grant [the nuns]298-the nuns a Play Day , in honour of [my]4673-the bishop visit , promising to send [them]298-the nuns [my]4673-the bishop white palfrey , suitably caparisoned , in safe charge of [a good lay - brother]5244-a good lay - brother , so that [all nuns who pleased ,]5245-all nuns who pleased , might ride in [the river meadow]5045-the river meadow . [You]5247-you would not think it , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , with a smile , " but [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies dearly love such sport , when it is lawful . [They]288-the white ladies have an aged ass which [they]288-the white ladies gleefully mount in turns , on Play Days , in [the courtyard]775-the courtyard and in [the meadow]5250-the meadow . Therefore riding is not altogether strange to [them]288-the white ladies , although [my]4673-the bishop palfrey , [Iconoklastes]169-iconoklastes , is somewhat of an advance upon [their]288-the white ladies mild ass , [Sheba]170-sheba . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Knight]764-the knight 's sad face had brightened at mention of the beasts .

" Wherefore ' [Iconoklastes]169-iconoklastes ' ? "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight asked , with interest . It struck [him]764-the knight as a curious name for a palfrey .

" Because , "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , ' soon after [I]0-i had bought [him]764-the knight [he]764-the knight trampled to ruin , in a fit of misplaced merriment , some flower beds on which [I]0-i had spent much precious time and care , and of which [I]0-i was inordinately fond . "[0-i]

" [Brute]171-brute , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , puzzled , but unwilling to admit it . " Methinks [I]764-the knight should have named [him]764-the knight ' [Devil]101-the devil , ' for the doing of such diabolic mischief . "[764-the knight]

" Nay , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , gently . " [The Devil]101-the devil would have spared [my]4673-the bishop flower beds . They were a snare unto [me]4673-the bishop . "[4673-the bishop]

" And wherefore ' Sheba ' ? "[764-the knight] queried [the Knight]764-the knight .

" [I]4673-the bishop named [her]764-the knight so , when [I]4673-the bishop gave [her]764-the knight to [the Prioress]373-the prioress , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " in reply to a question put to [me]4673-the bishop by [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother . [The ass]5253-the ass was elderly and mild , even then , but [a handsome creature , of good breed]5254-a handsome creature , of good breed . [The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress asked [me]4673-the bishop whether [she]764-the knight still had too much spirit to be easily managed by [the lay - sisters]311-the lay - sisters . [I]4673-the bishop answered that [her]764-the knight name was ' [Sheba]170-sheba . ' "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop paused and rubbed [his]4673-the bishop hands softly over each other , in gleeful enjoyment of the recollection .

But [the Knight]764-the knight again looked blank .

" Did that content [the Prioress]373-the prioress ? "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight asked ; but chiefly for love of mentioning [her]1510-her name .

" Perfectly , "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " [She]373-the prioress smiled and said : ' That is well . ' And the name stuck to the ass , though [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother and [I]4673-the bishop alone understood its meaning . "[4673-the bishop]

" About the Play Day ? "[764-the knight] suggested [the Knight]764-the knight , growing restive .

" Ah , yes ! About the Play Day . The time chosen was after noon on this day , in order that [the Prioress]373-the prioress might first accomplish [her]373-the prioress talk with [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , thus clearing the way for [our]5258-our experiment . Although written last evening , [I]92-bishop had not received [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's decisive letter , when [Iconoklastes]169-iconoklastes set forth ; and , [I]92-bishop confess , [I]92-bishop looked forward with keen interest , to questioning [the lay - brother]5259-the lay - brother on [his]5259-the lay - brother return . As [I]92-bishop have told [you]5260-you , [I]92-bishop had doubts concerning [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine ; but [I]92-bishop knew [the Prioress]373-the prioress would see to it that [my]92-bishop meaning and intention reached [the member of the Community]5262-the member of the community actually concerned , were [she]102-sister seraphine [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine or another ; and [I]92-bishop should have light , both on the identity of [the lady]5263-the lady and on [her]5263-the lady probable course of action , when report reached [me]92-bishop as to which of [the nuns]298-the nuns had taken the riding seriously . Therefore , with no little interest , [I]92-bishop awaited the return of [Iconoklastes]169-iconoklastes , in charge of [Brother Philip]160-brother philip . "[92-bishop]

[The Bishop]92-bishop lifted the faggot - fork and , bending over the hearth , began to build the logs , quickening the dying flame .

" Well ? "[764-the knight] cried [the Knight]764-the knight , chafing like a charger on the curb . " Well , [[my]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord ? And then ? "[764-the knight]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop stood the faggot - fork in its corner .

" [I]160-brother philip paused , [[my]160-brother philip son]5057-my son , that [you]764-the knight might say : ' Wherefore "[160-brother philip] [Philip]160-brother philip " ? ' "[4673-the bishop]

" The names of [men]4397-men interest [me]764-the knight not , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , with impatience . " [I]764-the knight care but to know the reason for the names of beasts . "[764-the knight] " Quite right , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " [Adam]120-adam named [the beasts]5268-the beasts ; [Eve]119-eve named [the men]5269-the men . Yet , [I]4673-the bishop would like [you]764-the knight to ask ' [Wherefore "[4673-the bishop] Philip]160-brother philip , " ' because [the Prioress]373-the prioress at once put that question , when [she]373-the prioress heard [me]4673-the bishop call [Brother Mark]172-brother mark by [his]172-brother mark new name . "[4673-the bishop]

" Wherefore ' [Philip]160-brother philip ' ? "[1517-the knight , with averted eyes] asked [the Knight , with averted eyes]1517-the knight , with averted eyes .

" Because ' [Philip]160-brother philip ' signifies ' [a lover of horses]5271-a lover of horses . ' [I]4673-the bishop named [the good brother]5272-the good brother so , when [he]5272-the good brother developed a great affection for all the steeds in [[my]4673-the bishop stables]5273-my stables .[4673-the bishop]

" Well , at length [Brother Philip]160-brother philip returned , leading [the palfrey]5274-the palfrey . [I]4673-the bishop had been riding upon [the heights above [the town]4629-the town]5275-the heights above the town , on [my]4673-the bishop comely black mare , [Shulamite]173-shulamite . "[4673-the bishop]

Again [the Bishop]4673-the bishop paused , and shot a merry challenge at [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent ; but realising at once that [the Knight]764-the knight could brook no more delay , [he]764-the knight hastened on .

" Riding into [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , just as [Philip]160-brother philip led in [the palfrey]5274-the palfrey , [I]764-the knight bade [him]160-brother philip first to see to [Icon]174-icon 's comfort ; then come to [[my]764-the knight chamber]5279-my chamber and report . Before long [the lay - brother]5259-the lay - brother appeared .[764-the knight]

" Now [Brother Philip]160-brother philip is [an excellent teller of stories]5281-an excellent teller of stories . [He]160-brother philip does not need to mar them by additions , because [his]160-brother philip quickness of observation takes in every detail , and [his]160-brother philip excellent memory lets nothing slip . [He]160-brother philip has a faculty for recalling past scenes in pictures , and tells a story as if describing a thing just happening before [his]160-brother philip mental vision : the sole draw - back to so vivid a memory being , that if the picture grows too mirth provoking , [Brother Philip]160-brother philip is seized with spasms of the diaphragm , and further description becomes impossible . On this occasion , [I]764-the knight saw at once that [the good brother]5272-the good brother 's inner vision teemed with pictures . [I]764-the knight settled [myself]764-the knight to listen .[764-the knight]

" Aye , it had been a wonderful scene , and more merriment , so [the lay - sisters]311-the lay - sisters afterwards told [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , than ever known before at any Play Day .[764-the knight]

" [Icon]174-icon was led in state from [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , down into [the river meadow]5045-the river meadow .[764-the knight]

" At first the great delight was to crowd round [him]174-icon , pat [him]174-icon , stroke [his]174-icon mane , finger [his]174-icon trappings ; cry out words of ecstatic praise and admiration , and attempt to feed [him]174-icon with all manner of unsuitable food .[764-the knight]

" [Icon]174-icon , [I]764-the knight gather , behaved much as [most males]5286-most males behave on finding [themselves]5286-most males the centre of [a crowd of [admiring women]5288-admiring women]5287-a crowd of admiring women . [He]174-icon pawed the ground , and swished [his]174-icon tail ; arched [his]174-icon neck , and looked from side to side ; munched cakes [he]174-icon did not want , winking a large and roguish eye at [Brother Philip]160-brother philip ; and finally , ignoring all the rest , fixed a languorous gaze upon [the Prioress]373-the prioress , [she]373-the prioress being [the only lady present who stood apart , regarding the scene , but taking no share in the general adulation]5290-the only lady present who stood apart , regarding the scene , but taking no share in the general adulation .[764-the knight]

" At length the riding began ; [Brother Philip]160-brother philip keeping firm hold on [Icon]174-icon , while [the entire party of nuns]5291-the entire party of nuns undertook to mount [the nun who had elected to ride]5292-the nun who had elected to ride . Each time [Brother Philip]160-brother philip attempted a description of this part of the proceedings [he]160-brother philip was at once seized with such spasms in the region of [his]160-brother philip girdle , that speech became an impossibility ; [he]160-brother philip could but hold [himself]160-brother philip helplessly , looking at [me]764-the knight from out streaming eyes , until a fresh peep at [his]160-brother philip mental picture again bent [him]160-brother philip double .[764-the knight]

" Much as [I]764-the knight prefer a story complete , from start to finish , [I]764-the knight was constrained to command [Brother Philip]160-brother philip to pass on to scenes which would allow [him]160-brother philip some possibility of articulate speech .[764-the knight]

" The sternness of [my]764-the knight tones gave to [the good brother]5272-the good brother the necessary assistance . In a voice still weak and faltering , but gaining firmness as it proceeded , [he]160-brother philip described the riding .[764-the knight]

" [Most of [the nuns]298-the nuns]5294-most of the nuns rode but a few yards , held in place by so many willing hands that , from a distance , only the noble head of [Icon]174-icon could be seen above [the moving crowd]5296-the moving crowd , surmounted by the terrified face of [the riding nun]5297-the riding nun ; who , hastening to exclaim that [her]5297-the riding nun own delight must not cause [her]5297-the riding nun to keep [others]482-others from participation , would promptly fall off into the waiting arms held out to catch [her]5297-the riding nun ; at once becoming , when safely on [her]5297-the riding nun feet , [the boldest encourager of the next aspirant to a seat upon the back of [Icon]174-icon]5299-the boldest encourager of the next aspirant to a seat upon the back of icon .[764-the knight]

" [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine proved a disappointment . [She]102-sister seraphine had been wo nt to boast so much of [her]102-sister seraphine own palfrey , [her]102-sister seraphine riding , and [her]102-sister seraphine hunting , that [the other nuns]644-the other nuns had counted upon seeing [her]102-sister seraphine gallop gaily over [the field]4581-the field .[764-the knight]

" The humble and short - lived attempts were all made first . Then [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , bidding [the others]805-the others stand aside , was swung by [one tall sister]5303-one tall sister , acting according to [her]102-sister seraphine instructions , neatly into the saddle .[764-the knight]

" [She]102-sister seraphine gathered up the reins , as to the manner born , "[764-the knight] and bade [Brother Philip]160-brother philip loose the bridle . But the palfrey , finding [himself]160-brother philip no longer hemmed in by [a heated , pressing crowd]1520-a heated , pressing crowd , gave , for very gladness of heart , a gay little gambol .

" [Whereupon]175-mary antony , [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , almost unseated , shrieked to [Brother Philip]160-brother philip to hold the bridle , rating [him]160-brother philip soundly for having let go . "[160-brother philip] [He]160-brother philip then led [Icon]174-icon about [the meadow]5250-the meadow , [the nuns]298-the nuns following in procession ; [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine all the while complaining ; first of the saddle , which gripped [her]102-sister seraphine where it should not , leaving an empty space there where support was needed ; then of [the palfrey]5274-the palfrey 's paces ; then of a twist in [her]102-sister seraphine garments twice the procession stopped to adjust them ; then of the ears of the horse which twitched for no reason , and presently pointed at nothing a sure sign of frenzy ; and next of [his]160-brother philip eye , which rolled round and was vicious .

" At this , [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , long weary of promenading , yet determined not to be left behind while [others followed on]5304-others followed on , exclaimed that if the eye of the creature were vicious , then must [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine straightway dismount , and [the brute]5305-the brute be led back to the seat where [the Prioress]373-the prioress sat watching .[4673-the bishop]

" To this [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine gladly agreed , and [a greatly sobered procession]5307-a greatly sobered procession returned to the top of [the field]4581-the field .[4673-the bishop]

" But gaiety was quickly restored by [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]175-mary antony , who , armed with [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's permission , insisted on mounting .[4673-the bishop]

" Willing hands , miscalculating the exceeding lightness of [her]102-sister seraphine aged body , lifted [her]102-sister seraphine higher than need be , above the back of the palfrey . [Whereupon Mary Antony]175-mary antony , parting [her]102-sister seraphine feet , came down straddling ![4673-the bishop]

" Firm as a limpet , [she]102-sister seraphine sat thus upon [Icon]174-icon . No efforts of [the nuns]298-the nuns could induce [her]102-sister seraphine to shift [her]102-sister seraphine position . [Commanding Brother Philip]160-brother philip , seeing ' [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop ' was now safely mounted , to lead on and not keep [him]751-the lord bishop standing , [old Antony]175-mary antony rode off in triumph , blessing [the nuns]298-the nuns right and left , as [she]102-sister seraphine passed .[4673-the bishop]

" Never were heard such shrieks of merriment ! Even [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress sank upon a seat to laugh with less fatigue . [Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine 's fretful complaints were forgotten .[4673-the bishop]

" Twice round [the field]4581-the field went [old Antony]175-mary antony , with fingers uplifted . [Icon]174-icon stepped carefully , arching [his]174-icon neck and walking as if [he]174-icon well knew that [he]174-icon bore on [his]174-icon back , ninety odd years of brave gaiety .[4673-the bishop]

" Well , that made of the Play Day a success . But the best of all was yet to come . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop took up the faggot - fork , and again tended the fire . [He]4673-the bishop seemed to find it difficult to tell that which must next be told .

[The Knight]129-the knight was breathing quickly . [He]129-the knight sat immovable ; yet the rubies on [his]129-the knight breast glittered continuously , like so many eager , fiery eyes .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop went on , speaking rapidly , the faggot - fork still in [his]4673-the bishop hand , [his]4673-the bishop face turned to the fire .

" [They]298-the nuns had lifted [Mary Antony]175-mary antony down , and were crowding round [Icon]174-icon , patting and praising [him]174-icon , when a message came from [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , bidding [Brother Philip]160-brother philip to bring the palfrey into [the courtyard]775-the courtyard ; [the nuns]298-the nuns to remain in [the field]4581-the field .[4673-the bishop]

" [They]298-the nuns watched [the beautiful creature]5318-the beautiful creature pace through the archway and disappear , and [none]315-none knew quite what would happen next . [Philip]160-brother philip heard [them]298-the nuns discussing it later .[4673-the bishop]

" [Some]5320-some thought [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had sent for [his]4673-the bishop palfrey . [Others]482-others , that [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother had feared for the safety of [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister ; or , lest [her]427-the reverend mother brave example should fire the rest to be too venturesome . Yet all eyes were turned toward the archway , vaguely expectant .[4673-the bishop]

" And then[4673-the bishop]

" [They]298-the nuns heard the hoofs of [Icon]174-icon ring on the flagstones of [the courtyard]775-the courtyard .[4673-the bishop]

" [They]298-the nuns heard the calm voice of [the Prioress]373-the prioress . Could it be [she]373-the prioress who was coming ?[4673-the bishop]

" Out from the archway , into the sunshine , alone and fearless ; [the Prioress]373-the prioress rode upon [Icon]174-icon . On [her]373-the prioress face was the light of a purposeful radiance . [The palfrey]5274-the palfrey stepped as if proud of the burden [he]5274-the palfrey carried .[4673-the bishop]

" [She]373-the prioress smiled and would have cried out gaily to [the groups]5329-the groups as [she]373-the prioress passed . But , with one accord , [the nuns]298-the nuns dropped to [their]298-the nuns knees , with clasped hands , and faces uplifted , adoring . Always [they]298-the nuns loved [her]373-the prioress , revered [her]373-the prioress , and thought [her]373-the prioress beautiful . But this vision of [the Prioress]373-the prioress , whom [none]315-none had ever seen mounted , riding forth into the sunshine on the snow - white palfrey , filled [their]298-the nuns hearts with praise and with wonder .[4673-the bishop]

" [Brother Philip]160-brother philip leaned against the archway , watching . [He]160-brother philip knew [his]160-brother philip hand upon the bridle was no longer needed , from the moment when [he]160-brother philip saw [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother gather up the reins in [her]93-the reverend mother left hand , lay [her]93-the reverend mother right gently on the neck of [Icon]174-icon , and , bending , speak low in [his]160-brother philip ear .[4673-the bishop]

" [She]93-the reverend mother sat a horse said [Philip]160-brother philip as only [they]298-the nuns can sit , who have ridden from childhood .[4673-the bishop]

" [She]93-the reverend mother walked [him]160-brother philip round [the meadow]5250-the meadow once , then gently shook the reins , and [he]160-brother philip broke into a trot .[4673-the bishop]

" [The watching nuns]5334-the watching nuns , now on [their]5334-the watching nuns feet again , shrieked aloud , with fright and glee .[4673-the bishop]

" At [the extreme end of [the meadow]5250-the meadow]5335-the extreme end of the meadow , wheeling sharply , [she]93-the reverend mother let [him]160-brother philip out into a canter .[4673-the bishop]

" [The nuns at this]5337-the nuns at this were petrified into dumbness . [One and all]5338-one and all held [their]5334-the watching nuns breath ; while [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress [nobody]5339-nobody quite knew why turned upon [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , and shook [her]102-sister seraphine .[4673-the bishop]

" And the next moment [the Prioress]373-the prioress was among [them]5334-the watching nuns , walking the palfrey slowly , settling [her]373-the prioress veil , which had streamed behind [her]373-the prioress as [she]373-the prioress cantered , bending to speak to [one and another]5341-one and another , as [she]373-the prioress passed .[4673-the bishop]

" And the light of new life was in [her]373-the prioress eyes . [Her]373-the prioress cheeks glowed , [she]373-the prioress seemed [a girl]1168-a girl again .[4673-the bishop]

" Reining in [Iconoklastes]169-iconoklastes , [she]373-the prioress paused beside [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress and said "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop broke off , while [he]4673-the bishop carefully stood the faggot - fork up in its corner .

" [She]373-the prioress paused and said : ' [None]315-none need remain here longer than [they]315-none will . But , being up and mounted , and [[our]5344-our Lord [Bishop]92-bishop]4861-our lord bishop in no haste for the return of [his]4673-the bishop palfrey , it is [my]4673-the bishop intention to ride for an hour . ' "[4673-the bishop]

[Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester turned and looked full at [the Knight]764-the knight .

" And [the Prioress]373-the prioress rode for an hour , "[154-symon of worcester] [he]154-symon of worcester said . " For a full hour , in the sunshine , on [the soft turf of [the river meadow]5045-the river meadow]5347-the soft turf of the river meadow , [THE PRIORESS]91-mother sub - prioress TRIED [HER]91-mother sub - prioress WINGS . "[154-symon of worcester]

CHAPTER XXIII

THE MIDNIGHT ARRIVAL

[Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh sat speechless , returning [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's steady gaze .

No fear was in [his]4673-the bishop face ; only a great surprise .

Presently into the eyes of both there crept a look which was half - smile , half - wistful sorrow , but wholly trustful ; a look to which , as yet , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop alone held the key .

" So [you]4673-the bishop know , [[my]132-hugh lord]4881-my lord , "[132-hugh] said [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent .

" Yes , [[my]132-hugh son]5057-my son ; [I]132-hugh know . "[132-hugh]

" Since this morning ? "[132-hugh]

" Nay , then ! Since the first day [you]5057-my son arrived with [your]5057-my son story ; asking such careful questions , carelessly . But be not wroth with [yourself]5057-my son , [Hugh]132-hugh . [Faithful to the hilt]5351-faithful to the hilt , have [you]5057-my son been . Only [no true lover]5352-no true lover was ever [a diplomat]5353-a diplomat ! Matters which mean more than life , can not be dissembled by true hearts from keen eyes . "[132-hugh]

" Then why all the talk concerning [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine ? "[764-the knight] demanded [the Knight]764-the knight .

" [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , [[my]132-hugh son]5057-my son , has served a useful purpose in various conversations . Never before , in the whole of [her]102-sister seraphine little shallow , selfish life has [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine been so disinterestedly helpful . That [you]5057-my son sat here just now , thinking [me]132-hugh witless beyond belief , just when [I]132-hugh most desired not to appear to know too much , [I]132-hugh owe to the swollen countenance of [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine . "[132-hugh]

" [[My]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , "[764-the knight] exclaimed [the Knight]764-the knight , overcome with shame . " [[My]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord ! How knew [you]5057-my son "[764-the knight]

" Peace , [lad]5357-lad ! Fash not [thyself]5358-thyself over it . Is it not a part of [[my]132-hugh sacred office]5359-my sacred office to follow in the footsteps of [[my]132-hugh Master]5360-my master and to be [a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart]5361-a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart ? Also , respecting , yea , approving [your]5057-my son reasons for reticence , [I]132-hugh would have let [you]5057-my son depart not suspecting [my]132-hugh knowledge of that which [you]5057-my son wished to conceal , were it not that [we]5362-we must now face this fact together : Since penning that message of apparent finality , [the Prioress]373-the prioress has tried [her]373-the prioress wings . "[132-hugh]

A rush of bewildered joy flooded the face of [the Knight]764-the knight .

" [Reverend Father]4875-reverend father ! "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , " think [you]4875-reverend father that means hope for [me]764-the knight ? "[764-the knight]

[Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester considered this question carefully , sitting in [his]154-symon of worcester favourite attitude , [his]154-symon of worcester lips compressed against [his]154-symon of worcester finger - tips .

At length ; " [I]154-symon of worcester think it means just this , "[154-symon of worcester] [he]154-symon of worcester said . " A conflict , in [her]373-the prioress , between the mental and the physical ; between reason and instinct ; thought and feeling . [The calm , collected mind]5365-the calm , collected mind sent [you]5057-my son that reasoned message of final refusal . [The sentient body , vibrant with bounding life]5366-the sentient body , vibrant with bounding life , instinctively prepares itself for the possibility of the ride with [you]5057-my son to [Warwick]32-warwick . This gives equal balance to the scale . But a third factor will be called in , finally to decide the matter . By that [she]373-the prioress will abide ; and neither [you]5057-my son nor [I]154-symon of worcester , neither [earth]4391-earth nor hell , neither things past , things present , nor things to come , could avail to move [her]373-the prioress . "[154-symon of worcester]

" And that third factor ? "[764-the knight] questioned [the Knight]764-the knight .

" Is [the Spiritual]5368-the spiritual , "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , solemnly , with uplifted face .

" With that , there came over [the Knight]129-the knight a sudden sense of compunction . [He]129-the knight began for the first time to see the matter as it must appear to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop and [the nun]461-the nun . [His]129-the knight own obstinate and determined self - seeking shamed [him]129-the knight . "[1535-you] [You]1535-you have been very good to [me]0-i , [[my]0-i lord]4881-my lord , " [he]0-i said humbly . "[1535-you] [You]1535-you have been most kind and most generous , when indeed [you]1535-you had just cause to be angry . "[1535-you]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop lowered [his]4673-the bishop eyes from the rafters , and bent them in questioning gaze upon [Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh .

" Angry , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son ? And wherefore should [I]4673-the bishop be angry ? "[4673-the bishop]

" That [I]4673-the bishop should have sought , and should still be seeking , to tempt [the Prioress]373-the prioress to wrong - doing . "[4673-the bishop] [The Bishop]4673-the bishop 's questioning gaze took on a brightness which almost became the light of sublime contempt .

" [You]4673-the bishop tempt [her]373-the prioress ? "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " Tempt [her]373-the prioress to wrong - doing ! [The man]4228-the man lives not , who could succeed in that !
