[She]373-the prioress will not come to [you]5057-my son unless [she]373-the prioress knows it to be right to come , and believes it to be wrong to stay . If [I]4673-the bishop thought [you]4673-the bishop were tempting [her]373-the prioress , think [you]5057-my son [I]4673-the bishop would stand aside and watch the conflict ? Nay ! But [I]4673-the bishop stand aside and wait while [she]373-the prioress of purer , clearer vision , and walking nearer Heaven than [you]5057-my son or [I]4673-the bishop discerns the right , and , choosing it , rejects the wrong . Should [she]373-the prioress be satisfied that life with [you]5057-my son is indeed [God]89-god 's will for [her]373-the prioress and [I]4673-the bishop tell [you]5057-my son honestly , it will take a miracle to bring this about [she]373-the prioress will come to [you]5057-my son . But [she]373-the prioress will not come to [you]5057-my son unless , in so doing , [she]373-the prioress is choosing what to [her]373-the prioress is the harder part . "[4673-the bishop]

" The harder part ! "[764-the knight] exclaimed [the Knight]764-the knight . " [You]5057-my son forget , [[my]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , [she]373-the prioress loves [me]764-the knight . "[764-the knight]

" Do [I]4673-the bishop forget ? "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " Have [you]5057-my son found [me]1326-the prelate given to forgetting ? The very fact that [she]373-the prioress loves [you]5057-my son , is the heaviest factor against [you]5057-my son just now . To [such women]4929-such women there comes ever the instinctive feeling , that that which would be sweet must be wrong , and the hard path of renunciation the only right one . [They]4929-such women climb not [Zion]176-zion 's mount to reach the crown . [They]4929-such women turn and wend [their]4929-such women way through [Gethsemane]45-gethsemane to [Calvary]6-calvary , sure that thus alone can [they]4929-such women at last inherit . And what can [we]5376-we say ? Are [they]4929-such women not following in the footsteps of [the Son of God]5377-the son of god ? [I]1326-the prelate fear [my]1326-the prelate nature turns another way . [I]1326-the prelate incline to follow [King David]177-king david , or [Solomon]178-solomon in all [his]178-solomon glory , chanting glad Songs of Ascent , from [the Palace]1309-the palace on [Mount Zion]46-mount zion to [the Temple on [Mount Moriah]47-mount moriah]5379-the temple on mount moriah . All things harmonious , in sound , form , or colour , seem to [me]1326-the prelate good and , therefore , right . But long years in [Italy]40-italy have soaked [me]1326-the prelate in the worship of [the beautiful]5380-the beautiful , inextricably intermingled with the adoration of [the Divine]5381-the divine . [I]1326-the prelate mistrust [mine]1326-the prelate own judgment , and [I]1326-the prelate fear [me]1326-the prelate "[1326-the prelate] said [the Prelate]1326-the prelate , whose gentle charity had won so many to religion " [I]1326-the prelate greatly fear [me]1326-the prelate , [I]1326-the prelate am far from being Christlike . But [I]1326-the prelate recognise the spirit of self - crucifixion , when [I]1326-the prelate see it . And the warning that [I]1326-the prelate give [you]5382-you , is not because [I]1326-the prelate forget , but because [I]1326-the prelate remember . "[1326-the prelate]

As the last words fell in solemn utterance from [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's lips , the silence without was broken by the loud clanging of the outer bell ; followed by hurrying feet in [the courtyard]775-the courtyard below , the flare of torches shining up upon the casements , and the unbarring of the gate .

" It must be close on midnight , "[132-hugh] said [Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh ; " a strange hour for an arrival . "[132-hugh]

[The banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall , on [the upper floor of [the Palace]1309-the palace]1545-the upper floor of the palace , had casements at the extreme end , facing the door , which gave upon [the courtyard]775-the courtyard .

[The Knight]764-the knight walked over to one of these casements standing open , kneeled upon the high window - seat , and looked down .

" [A horseman]5383-a horseman has ridden in , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , " and ridden fast . [His]5383-a horseman steed is flecked with foam , and stands with spreading nostrils , panting . . . . [The rider]5384-the rider has passed within . . . . [[Your]5382-you men]4871-your men , [[my]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , are leading away the steed . "[764-the knight] [The Knight]764-the knight returned to [his]764-the knight place . " [Brave beast]5387-brave beast ! Methinks [they]4871-your men would do well to mix [his]5383-a horseman warm mash with ale . "[764-the knight]

[Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester made no reply .

[He]154-symon of worcester sat erect , with folded hands , a slight flush upon [his]154-symon of worcester cheeks , listening for footsteps which must be drawing near .

[They]1550-they came .

The door , at the far end of [the hall]1551-the hall , opened .

[The gaunt Chaplain]1552-the gaunt chaplain stood in the archway , making obeisance .

" Well ? "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , dispensing with the usual formalities .

" [[My]1550-they lord]4881-my lord , [[your]4881-my lord messenger]5389-your messenger has returned , and requests an audience without delay . "[1550-they]

" Bid [him]5389-your messenger enter , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , gripping the arms of the chair , and leaning forward .

[The Chaplain]1334-the chaplain , half - turning , beckoned with uplifted hand ; then stood aside , as rapid feet approached .

[A young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained]1556-a young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained , appeared in the doorway . Not pausing for any monkish salutations or genuflections , [he]1556-a young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained strode some half - dozen paces up [the hall]1551-the hall ; then swung off [his]1556-a young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained hat , stopped short with [his]1556-a young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained spurs together , and bowed in soldierly fashion toward the great fireplace .

Thrusting [his]1556-a young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained hand into [his]1556-a young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained breast , [he]1556-a young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained drew out a packet , heavily sealed .

" [I]1556-a young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained bring from [Rome]37-rome , "[1556-a young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained] [he]1556-a young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained said and [his]1556-a young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained voice rang through [the chamber]627-the chamber " for [[my]1556-a young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained Lord Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]92-bishop , a letter from [[His]4673-the bishop Holiness [the Pope]5391-the pope]5390-his holiness the pope . "[1556-a young man , clad in a brown riding - suit , dusty and travel - stained]

[The Knight]764-the knight sprang to [his]764-the knight feet . [The Bishop]4673-the bishop rose , [a noble figure in crimson and gold]1561-a noble figure in crimson and gold , and the dignity of [his]4673-the bishop high office straightway enveloped [him]4673-the bishop .

In complete silence , [he]4673-the bishop stretched out [his]4673-the bishop right hand for the letter .

[The dusty traveller]1562-the dusty traveller came forward quickly , knelt at [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's feet , and placed the missive in [his]4673-the bishop hands .

As [the Bishop]4673-the bishop lifted [the Pope]5391-the pope 's letter and , stooping [his]4673-the bishop head , kissed the papal seal , [the Knight]764-the knight kneeled on one knee , [his]764-the knight hand upon [his]764-the knight sword - hilt , [his]764-the knight eyes bent on the ground .

So for a moment there was silence . [The sovereignty of [Rome]37-rome]1567-the sovereignty of rome [, stretching a mighty arm across]1568-, stretching a mighty arm across [the seas]1569-the seas , asserted its power in [the English hall]1570-the english hall .

Then [the Bishop]4673-the bishop placed the letter upon a small table at [his]4673-the bishop right hand , seated [himself]4673-the bishop , and signed to [both men]1572-both men to rise .

" How has it fared with [you]916-the youth , [Roger]179-young roger de berchelai ? "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop asked , kindly .

" Am [I]916-the youth in time , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father ? "[916-the youth] exclaimed [the youth]916-the youth , eagerly . " [I]916-the youth acted on [your]155-reverend father orders . No expense was spared . [I]916-the youth chartered [the best vessel [I]916-the youth could find]5392-the best vessel i could find , and had set sail within an hour of galloping into [the port]5393-the port . [We]5394-we made a good passage , and being fortunate in securing relays of horses along the route , [I]916-the youth was in [Rome]37-rome twenty - four hours sooner than [we]5394-we had reckoned . [I]916-the youth rode in at sunset ; and , [your]155-reverend father name and seal passing [me]916-the youth on everywhere , [your]155-reverend father letter , [[my]916-the youth lord]4881-my lord , was in the Holy [Father]155-reverend father 's hands ere the glow had faded from [the distant hills]5396-the distant hills .[916-the youth]

" [I]4673-the bishop was right royally entertained by [Cardinal Ferrari]95-the french cardinal ; and , truth to tell , a soft couch and silken quilts were welcome , after many nights of rough lodging , in [the wayside inns of [Normandy]48-normandy and [Italy]40-italy]5397-the wayside inns of normandy and italy . Moreover , having galloped ahead of time , [I]4673-the bishop felt free to take a long night 's repose .[4673-the bishop]

" But next morning , soon after the pigeons began to coo and circle , [I]916-the youth was called and bid to hasten . Then , while [I]916-the youth broke [my]916-the youth fast with many strange and tasty dishes , seated in a marble court , with fountains playing and vines o'erhanging , [the Cardinal]5398-the cardinal returned , [he]5398-the cardinal having been summoned already to the bedchamber of [the Pope]5391-the pope , where the reply of [[His]5391-the pope Holiness]5400-his holiness lay , ready sealed .[916-the youth]

" Whereupon , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , [I]4673-the bishop lost no time in setting forth , picking up on [my]4673-the bishop return journey each mount there where [I]4673-the bishop had left it , until [I]4673-the bishop galloped into the port where [[our]5402-us vessel]5403-our vessel waited .[4673-the bishop]

" Then , alas , came delay , and glad indeed was [I]916-the youth , that [I]916-the youth had not been tempted to linger in [Rome]37-rome ; for the winds were contrary ; some days passed before [we]5402-us could set sail ; and when at last [I]916-the youth prevailed upon [the mariners]5404-the mariners to venture , a great storm caught [us]5402-us in mid - channel , threatening to rend the sails to ribbons and , lifting [us]5402-us high , hurl [us]5402-us all to perdition . Helpless and desperate , for [the sailors]5405-the sailors had lost all control , [I]916-the youth vowed that if the storm might abate and [we]5402-us come safe to [harbour]5406-harbour [I]916-the youth would when [I]916-the youth succeed to [[[my]916-the youth father]4597-my father 's lands in [Gloucestershire]49-gloucestershire]5408-my father 's lands in gloucestershire give to [the worthy Abbot of an Abbey adjoining [[our]5402-us estate]5410-our estate]5409-the worthy abbot of an abbey adjoining our estate , [a meadow , concerning which [he]5409-the worthy abbot of an abbey adjoining our estate and [[his]5409-the worthy abbot of an abbey adjoining our estate monks]5412-his monks have long broken the tenth commandment and other commands as well , a trout stream running through [it]5411-a meadow , concerning which he and his monks have long broken the tenth commandment and other commands as well , a trout stream running through it , and the dearest delight of , and the dearest delight of]5411-a meadow , concerning which he and his monks have long broken the tenth commandment and other commands as well , a trout stream running through it , and the dearest delight of [the Abbot]5413-the abbot being fat trout for supper ; and of [the monks]4870-the monks , to lie on [their]4870-the monks bellies tickling the trout as [they]4870-the monks hide in the cool holes under [the banks of [the stream]5416-the stream]5415-the banks of the stream . But when [[my]916-the youth father]4597-my father finds [the monks]4870-the monks thus poaching , [he]4597-my father comes up behind [them]4870-the monks , and up [they]4870-the monks get quickly or try to ! So , in mid - channel , remembering [my]916-the youth sins , [I]916-the youth remembered running to tell [[my]916-the youth father]4597-my father that if [he]4597-my father came quickly [he]4597-my father would find [the good Brothers]5420-the good brothers flat on [their]5420-the good brothers bellies , sleeves rolled back , heads hanging over the water , toes well tucked into the turf , deeply intent upon tickling . Then [I]916-the youth would run by a short cut , hide in the hazels , and watch while [[my]916-the youth father]4597-my father stalked up through [the meadow]5250-the meadow , caught and belaboured [the poachers]5423-the poachers . [My]916-the youth derisive young laughter seemed now to howl and shriek through the rigging . So [I]916-the youth vowed that if the storm abated and [we]5424-we came safe to port , [the monks]4870-the monks should be given [that meadow]5426-that meadow . Upon which the storm did abate , and to [port]5427-port [we]5424-we came and what [[my]916-the youth father]4597-my father will say , [I]916-the youth know not ! Fearing vexation to [you]4673-the bishop , [[my]916-the youth lord]4881-my lord , from this untoward delay , on landing [I]916-the youth rode as fast as [mine]916-the youth own good horse could carry [me]916-the youth . Am [I]916-the youth in time ? "[916-the youth]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop smiled as [he]4673-the bishop looked into the blue eyes and open countenance of [young Roger de Berchelai]179-young roger de berchelai , [a youth wholly devoted to [his]179-young roger de berchelai service]1575-a youth wholly devoted to his service . Here was [another who remembered in pictures]1576-another who remembered in pictures , and [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester loved the gallop , and rush , and breeze of [the sea]1577-the sea , which had swept through [the chamber]627-the chamber , in the eager young voice of [[his]154-symon of worcester envoy]1579-his envoy .

" Yes , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " [You]5057-my son have returned , not merely in time , but with two days to spare . Was there ever [fleeter messenger]5431-fleeter messenger ! Indeed [my]4673-the bishop choice was well made and [my]4673-the bishop trust well placed . Now [you]5057-my son must sup and then take a much - needed rest , [dear lad]5112-dear lad ; and to - morrow tell [me]4673-the bishop if [you]5057-my son had need to spend more than [I]4673-the bishop gave [you]5057-my son . "[4673-the bishop]

Raising [his]4673-the bishop voice , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop called [[his]4673-the bishop Chaplain]1582-his chaplain ; whereupon [that sinister figure]1583-that sinister figure at once appeared in the doorway .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop gave orders concerning the entertaining of [the young Esquire of [Berchelai]50-berchelai]1585-the young esquire of berchelai ; then added ; " And let [the chapel]5170-the chapel be lighted , [Father Benedict]180-father benedict . So soon as the aurora appears in [the east]5434-the east , [I]4673-the bishop shall celebrate mass , in thanksgiving for the blessing of a letter from [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father , and for the safe return of [[my]4673-the bishop messenger]5436-my messenger . [I]4673-the bishop shall not need [your]180-father benedict presence nor that of [any of [the brethren]5438-the brethren]5437-any of the brethren , save [those whose watch it chances to be . . . . Benedicite]5439-those whose watch it chances to be . . . . benedicite . "[4673-the bishop]

" Deus , "[180-father benedict] responded [Father Benedict]180-father benedict , bowing low .

[Young Roger]181-young roger , gay and glad , knelt and kissed [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's ring ; then , rising , flung back a strand of fair hair which fell over [his]181-young roger forehead , and said : " A bath , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , would be even more welcome than supper and bed . It shames [me]4673-the bishop to have come in such travel - stained plight into [your]180-father benedict presence , and that of [this noble knight]5441-this noble knight , "[4673-the bishop] with a bow to [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent .

" Nay , "[132-hugh] said [Hugh]132-hugh , smiling in friendly response . " Travel - stains gained in such fashion , are more to be desired than silks and fine linen . [I]132-hugh would [I]132-hugh could go to rest this night knowing [I]132-hugh had accomplished as much . "[132-hugh]

" Go and have [thy]180-father benedict bath , [boy]5442-boy , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " This will give [[my]4673-the bishop monks]5443-my monks time to tickle , catch , and cook , trout for [thy]180-father benedict supper ! Ah , [[thou]180-father benedict young rascal]5444-thou young rascal ! But that field is [Corban]182-corban , remember . Sup well , rest well , and the blessing of [the Lord]4319-the lord be with [thee]180-father benedict . "[4673-the bishop]

The brown riding - suit vanished through the archway .

[Father Benedict]180-father benedict 's lean hand pulled the door to .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop and [the Knight]764-the knight were once more alone .

CHAPTER XXIV

[THE POPE]5391-the pope 'S MANDATE

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop and [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent were once more alone . It was characteristic of both that [they]1592-they sat for some minutes in unbroken silence .

Then [the Bishop]4673-the bishop put out [his]4673-the bishop hand , took up the packet from [Rome]37-rome , and looked at [the Knight]764-the knight .

[Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh rose , walked over to the casement , and leaned out into the still , summer night .

[He]132-hugh could hear [the Bishop]4673-the bishop breaking the seals of [the Pope]5391-the pope 's letter .

Below in [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , all was quiet . The great gates were barred . [He]132-hugh wondered whether the steaming horse had been well rubbed down , clothed , and given a warm mash mixed with ale .

[He]132-hugh could hear [the Bishop]4673-the bishop unfolding the parchment , which crackled .

The moon , in [her]1599-she first quarter , rode high in the heavens . [The towers of St. Mary 's church]1600-the towers of st. mary 's church looked black against the sky .

[The Palace]1309-the palace stood on the same side of [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral as [the main street of [the city]1177-the city]1603-the main street of the city , in the direct route to [the Foregate]51-the foregate , [the Tithing]1605-the tithing , and [the White Ladies ' Nunnery at [Whytstone]3-whytstone]1606-the white ladies ' nunnery at whytstone . How strange to remember , that beneath [him]132-hugh lay that mile - long walk in darkness ; that just under [the Palace]1309-the palace , so near [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral , [she]1599-she and [he]132-hugh , pacing together , had known the end of [their]1609-their strange pilgrimage to be at hand . Yet then

[He]132-hugh could hear [the Bishop]4673-the bishop turning the parchment .

How freely the silvery moon sailed in this stormy sky , like a noble face looking calmly out , and ever out again , from amid perplexities and doubts .

In two nights ' time , the moon would be well - nigh full . Would [he]132-hugh be riding to [Warwick]32-warwick alone , or would [she]1599-she be beside [him]132-hugh ?

As [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had said , [he]4673-the bishop had described [her]1599-she as riding all day , like a bird , on [the moors]4601-the moors . Yet now [he]132-hugh loved best to picture [her]1599-she riding forth upon [Icon]174-icon into [the river meadow]5045-the river meadow , [her]1599-she veil streaming behind [her]1599-she ; " on [her]1599-she face the light of a purposeful radiance . "[1599-she]

Ah , would [she]1599-she come ? Would [she]1599-she come , or would [she]1599-she stay ? Would [she]1599-she stay , or would [she]1599-she come ?

The moon was now hidden by a cloud ; but [he]132-hugh could see the edge of the cloud silvering .

If the moon sailed forth free , before [he]132-hugh had counted to twelve , [she]1599-she would come .

[He]132-hugh began to count , slowly .

At nine , the moon was still hidden ; and [the Knight]764-the knight 's heart failed [him]132-hugh .

But at ten , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop called : " [Hugh]132-hugh ! "[4673-the bishop] and turning from the casement [the Knight]764-the knight answered to the call .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop held in [his]4673-the bishop hands the [Pope]183-pope 's letter , and also a legal - looking document , from which seals depended .

" This doth closely concern [you]764-the knight , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , with some emotion , and placed the parchment in [the Knight]764-the knight 's hands .

[Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent could have mastered its contents by the light of the wax taper burning beside [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's chair . But some instinct [he]132-hugh could not have explained , caused [him]132-hugh to carry it over to the table in the centre of [the hall]1551-the hall , whereon four wax candles still burned . [He]132-hugh stood to read the document , with [his]132-hugh back to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , [his]132-hugh head bent close to the flame of the candles .

Once , twice , thrice , [the Knight]764-the knight read it , before [his]764-the knight bewildered brain took in its full import . Yet it was clear and unmistakable a dispensation , signed and sealed by [the Pope]5391-the pope , releasing [Mora]144-mora , [Countess of [Norelle]42-norelle]5105-countess of norelle , from all vows and promises taken and made when [she]144-mora entered [the Nunnery of [the White Ladies of]1627-the white ladies of [Worcester]1-worcester]1626-the nunnery of the white ladies of worcester , at [Whytstone]3-whytstone , in [the parish of dairies]1628-the parish of dairies , and later on when [she]144-mora became [Prioress of that same Nunnery]1629-prioress of that same nunnery ; and furthermore stating that this full absolution was granted because it had been brought to the knowledge of [[His]132-hugh Holiness]5400-his holiness that [this noble lady]1631-this noble lady had entered the cloistered life owing to a wicked and malicious plot designed to wrest [[her]144-mora castle]1632-her castle and estates from [her]144-mora , and also to part [her]144-mora from [a valiant Knight]1633-a valiant knight , at that time fighting in the Holy Wars , to whom [she]144-mora was betrothed .

Furthermore the deed empowered [Symon]154-symon of worcester , [Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]1222-bishop of worcester or [any priest [he]154-symon of worcester might appoint]1635-any priest he might appoint , to unite in marriage [the Knight Crusader]1636-the knight crusader , [Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh , and [Mora de Norelle]144-mora , [sometime Prioress of [the White Ladies of [Worcester]1-worcester]283-the white ladies of worcester]1637-sometime prioress of the white ladies of worcester .

[The Knight]764-the knight walked back to the hearth and stood before [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , the parchment in [his]764-the knight hand .

" [[My]764-the knight Lord [Bishop]92-bishop]4963-my lord bishop , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , " do [I]764-the knight dream ? "[764-the knight]

[Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester smiled . " Nay , [[my]154-symon of worcester son]5057-my son . Surely no dream of thine was ever signed by [[His]154-symon of worcester Holiness]5400-his holiness , nor bore suspended from it the great seal of [the Vatican]5450-the vatican ! The document [you]5057-my son hold will be sufficient answer to all questions , and will ensure [[your]5057-my son wife]4531-your wife 's position at Court and [her]4531-your wife standing in [the outer world]4980-the outer world should [she]4531-your wife elect to re - enter it .[154-symon of worcester]

" But whether [she]4531-your wife shall do this , or no , is not a matter upon which [the Church]4592-the church would give a decisive or even an authoritative pronouncement ; and [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father adds , in , [his]5435-the holy father letter to [me]4673-the bishop , further important instructions .[4673-the bishop]

" Firstly : that it must be [the Prioress]373-the prioress 's own wish and decision , apart from any undue pressure from without , to resign [her]4531-your wife office and to accept this dispensation , freeing [her]4531-your wife from [her]4531-your wife vows .[154-symon of worcester]

" Secondly ; that [she]4531-your wife must leave [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery and [the neighbourhood]4630-the neighbourhood , secretly ; if it be possible , appearing in [her]4531-your wife new position , as [[your]5057-my son wife]4531-your wife , without much question being raised as to whence [she]4531-your wife came .[4673-the bishop]

" Thirdly : that when [her]4531-your wife absence becomes known in [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery , [I]154-symon of worcester am authorized solemnly to announce that [she]4531-your wife has been moved on by [me]154-symon of worcester , secretly , with the knowledge and approval of [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father , to a place where [she]4531-your wife was required for higher service . "[154-symon of worcester]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop smiled as [he]4673-the bishop pronounced the final words . There was triumph in [his]4673-the bishop eye .

[The Knight]764-the knight still looked as if [he]764-the knight felt [himself]764-the knight to be dreaming ; yet on [his]764-the knight face was a great gladness of expectation .

" And , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop exclaimed joyously , " what news for [her]4531-your wife ! Shall [you]4881-my lord send it , in the morn , or [yourself]4881-my lord take it to [her]4531-your wife ? "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop 's lips were pressed against [his]4673-the bishop finger - tips .

" [I]4673-the bishop know not , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop answered , slowly ; " [I]4673-the bishop know not that [I]4673-the bishop shall either take or send it . "[4673-the bishop]

" But , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , surely ! It will settle all doubts , solve all questions , remove all difficulties "[4673-the bishop]

" Tut ! Tut ! Tut ! "[4673-the bishop] exclaimed [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " Good heavens , [man]4362-man ! Dare [I]4673-the bishop [we]5464-we d [you]4362-man to [a woman [you]4362-man know so little]5465-a woman you know so little ? Not for one instant , into [her]4531-your wife consideration of the matter , will have entered any question as to what [Church or State]5466-church or state might say or do . For [her]4531-your wife the question stands upon simpler , truer , lines , not involved by rule or dogma : ' Is it right for [me]4673-the bishop , or wrong for [me]4673-the bishop ? Is it the will of [God]89-god that [I]4673-the bishop should do this thing ? ' "[4673-the bishop]

" But if [you]4362-man tell [her]4531-your wife , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , of [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father 's dispensation and permission ; what will [she]4531-your wife then say ? "[4673-the bishop]

" What will [she]4531-your wife then say ? "[4673-the bishop] [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester softly laughed , as at something which stirred an exceeding tender memory . " [She]4531-your wife will probably say : ' [You]4362-man amaze [me]154-symon of worcester , [my lord]4881-my lord ! Indeed , [[my]154-symon of worcester lord]4881-my lord , [you]4362-man amaze [me]154-symon of worcester ! [His]5435-the holy father Holiness [the Pope]5391-the pope may rule at [Rome]37-rome ; [you]4362-man , [[my]154-symon of worcester Lord Bishop]4963-my lord bishop , rule in [the cities of [this diocese]5474-this diocese]5473-the cities of this diocese ; but [I]154-symon of worcester rule in [this Nunnery]4944-this nunnery , and while [I]154-symon of worcester rule [here]4536-here , such a thing as this shall never be ! ' "[154-symon of worcester]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop gently passed [his]4673-the bishop hands the one over the other , as was [his]4673-the bishop habit when a recollection gave [him]4673-the bishop keen mental pleasure .

" That is what [the Prioress]373-the prioress would probably say , [[my]4673-the bishop dear]4718-my dear [Knight]129-the knight , were [I]4673-the bishop so foolish as to flaunt before [her]373-the prioress this most priceless parchment . And yet [I]4673-the bishop know not . It may be wise to send it , or to show it without much comment , simply in order that [she]373-the prioress may see the effect upon the mind of [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father [himself]5435-the holy father , of a full knowledge of the complete facts of the case . "[4673-the bishop]

" [[My]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , with much earnestness , " how came that full knowledge to [His]5435-the holy father Holiness in [Rome]37-rome ? "[764-the knight]

" When first [you]764-the knight came to [me]4673-the bishop , "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " with this grievous tale of wrong and treachery , [I]4673-the bishop knew that if [you]764-the knight won [your]764-the knight way with [Mora]144-mora , [we]5481-we must be armed with highest authority for the marriage and for [her]144-mora return to [the world]389-the world , or sorrow and much trial for [her]144-mora might follow , with , perhaps , danger for [you]764-the knight . Therefore [I]4673-the bishop resolved forthwith to lay the whole matter , without loss of time , before [the Pope]5391-the pope [himself]5391-the pope . [I]4673-the bishop know [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father well ; [his]5435-the holy father openness of mind , [his]5435-the holy father charity and kindliness ; [his]5435-the holy father firm desire to do justly , and to love mercy . Moreover , [his]5435-the holy father friendship for [me]4673-the bishop is such , that [he]5435-the holy father would not lightly refuse [me]4673-the bishop a request . Also [he]5435-the holy father would , of [his]5435-the holy father kindness , incline to be guided by [my]4673-the bishop judgment .[4673-the bishop]

" Wherefore , no sooner were all the facts in [my]764-the knight possession , those [you]764-the knight told [me]764-the knight , those [I]764-the knight already knew , and those [I]764-the knight did for [myself]764-the knight deduce from both , than [I]764-the knight sent for [young Roger de Berchelai]179-young roger de berchelai , whose wits and devotion [I]764-the knight could safely trust , gave [him]179-young roger de berchelai all [he]179-young roger de berchelai would need for board and lodging , [boats]5485-boats and steeds , that [he]179-young roger de berchelai might accomplish the journey in the shortest possible time , and despatched [him]179-young roger de berchelai to [Rome]37-rome with a written account of the whole matter , under [my]764-the knight private seal , to [[His]179-young roger de berchelai Holiness [the Pope]5391-the pope]5390-his holiness the pope . "[764-the knight]

[The Knight]764-the knight stood during this recital , [his]764-the knight eyes fixed in searching question upon [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's face .

Then : " [[My]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , ' such kindness on [your]1650-you part , passes all understanding . That [you]1650-you should have borne with [me]0-i while [I]0-i told [my]0-i tale , was much . That [you]1650-you should tacitly have allowed [me]0-i the chance to have speech with [[my]0-i betrothed]4565-my betrothed , was more . But that , all this time , while [I]0-i was giving [you]1650-you half - confidence , and [she]4565-my betrothed no confidence at all , [you]1650-you should have been working , spending , planning for [us]1652-us , risking much if [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father had taken [your]1650-you largeness of heart and breadth of mind amiss ! All this , [you]1650-you did , for [Mora]144-mora and for [me]0-i ! That [you]1650-you were , as [you]1650-you tell [me]0-i , a frequent guest in [[my]0-i childhood 's home]1654-my childhood 's home , holding [[my]0-i parents]1655-my parents in warm esteem , might account for the exceeding kindness of the welcome [you]1650-you did give [me]0-i . But this generosity this wondrous goodness [I]0-i stand amazed , confounded ! That [you]1650-you should do so great a thing to make it possible that [I]0-i should [we]1652-us d the Prioress It passes understanding ! "[1652-us]

When [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent ceased speaking , [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester did not immediately make reply . [He]154-symon of worcester sat looking into the fire , fingering , with [his]154-symon of worcester left hand , the gold cross at [his]154-symon of worcester breast , and drumming , with the fingers of [his]154-symon of worcester right , upon the carved lion 's head which formed the arm of [his]154-symon of worcester chair .

It seemed as if [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had , of a sudden , grown restive under [the Knight]764-the knight 's gratitude ; or as if some train of thought had awakened within [him]154-symon of worcester , to which [he]154-symon of worcester did not choose to give expression , and which must be beaten back before [he]154-symon of worcester allowed [himself]154-symon of worcester to speak .

At length , folding [his]154-symon of worcester hands , [he]154-symon of worcester made answer to [the Knight]764-the knight , still looking into the fire , a certain air of detachment wrapping [him]154-symon of worcester round , as with an invisible yet impenetrable shield .

" [You]1650-you overwhelm [me]154-symon of worcester , [[my]154-symon of worcester dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh , with [your]132-hugh gratitude . It had not seemed to [me]154-symon of worcester that [my]154-symon of worcester action in this matter would demand either thanks or explanation . There are occasions when to do less than [our]5490-our best , would be to sin against all that which [we]5490-our hold most sacred . To [my]154-symon of worcester mind , the most useful definition of sin , in the sacred writings , is that of [the apostle [Saint James]184-saint james , most practical of [all the inspired writers]5492-all the inspired writers]5491-the apostle saint james , most practical of all the inspired writers , when [he]184-saint james said : ' To [him]5491-the apostle saint james , most practical of all the inspired writers that knoweth to do good , and doeth it not , to [him]5491-the apostle saint james , most practical of all the inspired writers it is sin . ' [I]154-symon of worcester knew quite clearly the ' good ' to be done in this case . Therefore no gratitude is due to [me]154-symon of worcester for failing to fall into the sin of omission .[154-symon of worcester]

" Also , [[my]154-symon of worcester son]5057-my son , [many who seem to deserve the gratitude of [others]482-others]5494-many who seem to deserve the gratitude of others , would be found not to deserve it , if the entire inward truth of motive could be fully revealed .[154-symon of worcester]

" With [me]154-symon of worcester it is well - nigh a passion that all good things should attain unto full completeness .[154-symon of worcester]

" It may be [I]154-symon of worcester was better able to give full understanding to [your]132-hugh tale because , for love of [a woman]813-a woman , [I]154-symon of worcester dwelt seven years in exile from [this land]4399-this land , fearing lest [my]154-symon of worcester great love for [her]813-a woman , which came to [me]154-symon of worcester all unsought , should by becoming known to [her]813-a woman lead [her]813-a woman young heart , as yet fresh and unawakened , to respond . There was never any question of breaking [my]154-symon of worcester vows ; and [I]154-symon of worcester hold not with love - friendships between [man]4362-man and [woman]4226-woman , there where marriage is not possible . [They]5500-they are , at best , selfish on the part of [the man]4228-the man . [They]5500-they keep [the woman]809-the woman from entering into [her]809-the woman kingdom . The crown of womanhood is to bear [children]4304-children to [the man [she]809-the woman loves]5215-the man she loves to take [her]809-the woman place in [[his]5215-the man she loves home]5182-his home , as [wife]4520-wife and [mother]827-mother . [The man who can not offer this , yet stands in the way of the man who can , is [a poor and an unworthy lover]5509-a poor and an unworthy lover]5508-the man who can not offer this , yet stands in the way of the man who can , is a poor and an unworthy lover . "[154-symon of worcester]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop paused , unclasped [his]4673-the bishop hands , withdrew [his]4673-the bishop steadfast regard from the fire , and sat back in [his]4673-the bishop chair . The stone in [his]4673-the bishop ring gleamed blue , the colour of forget - me - nots beside [a meadow brook]1660-a meadow brook .

Presently [he]4673-the bishop looked at [the silent Knight]763-the silent knight . There was a kindly smile , in [his]4673-the bishop eyes , rather than upon [his]4673-the bishop lips .

" It may be , [[my]4673-the bishop dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh , that this heart discipline of [mine]4673-the bishop of which , by the way , [I]4673-the bishop have never before spoken has made [me]4673-the bishop quick to understand the sufferings of [other men]5511-other men . Also it may explain the great desire [I]4673-the bishop always experience to see [a truly noble woman]5512-a truly noble woman come to the full completion of [her]5512-a truly noble woman womanhood .[4673-the bishop]

" [I]4673-the bishop returned to [England]22-england not long after [[your]763-the silent knight betrothed]4739-your betrothed had entered the cloistered life in [the Whytstone Nunnery]5514-the whytstone nunnery . [I]4673-the bishop was appointed to [this See of [Worcester]1-worcester]5515-this see of worcester , which appointment gave [me]4673-the bishop the spiritual control of [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies . "[4673-the bishop]

" [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise ! [The Knight]764-the knight spoke with conviction ; yet , even as [he]764-the knight spoke , the amazing truth rushed in upon [him]764-the knight , and struck [him]764-the knight dumb . Of a sudden [he]764-the knight knew why [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's eyes had instantly won [his]764-the knight fearless confidence . [A trusted friend of [his]764-the knight childhood]1667-a trusted friend of his childhood had looked out at [him]764-the knight from [their]1667-a trusted friend of his childhood dear depths . Often [he]764-the knight had searched [his]764-the knight memory , since [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had claimed knowledge of [him]764-the knight in [his]764-the knight boyhood , and had marvelled that no recollection of [Symon]154-symon of worcester as a guest in [[[his]764-the knight parents]1669-his parents ' home]1670-his parents ' home came back to [him]764-the knight .

Now in this moment of revelation how clearly [he]764-the knight could see the figure of [the famous priest]1671-the famous priest , in brown habit , cloak , and hood , a cord at [his]764-the knight waist , with tonsured head , full brown beard , and sandalled feet , pacing [the great hall]1672-the great hall , standing in [the armoury]4627-the armoury , or climbing [the Cumberland hills]1674-the cumberland hills to visit [the chapel of the Holy Mount]1675-the chapel of the holy mount and [the hermit who dwelt beside [it]1675-the chapel of the holy mount]1676-the hermit who dwelt beside it .

As is the way with childhood 's memories , the smallest , most trivial details leapt up vivid , crystal clear . The present was forgotten , the future disregarded , in the sudden intimate dearness of that long - ago past .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop allowed time for this realisation . Then [he]4673-the bishop spoke .

" True , [the ship]5529-the ship foundered , [Hugh]132-hugh ; true , none who sailed in [her]5529-the ship were seen again . "[4673-the bishop]

" [Father]185-father gervaise ! "[764-the knight] exclaimed [the Knight]764-the knight , with deep emotion ; " [Father]185-father gervaise "[764-the knight] Then , [his]764-the knight voice broke . What strange thing had happened ? " [Father]185-father gervaise , "[132-hugh] said [Hugh]132-hugh , when [he]132-hugh could trust [his]132-hugh voice , " in [her]1680-one , greatly loved and long mourned last words to [me]132-hugh , [[my]132-hugh mother]4598-my mother spoke of [you]185-father gervaise . ' And , in the dawn of the new day , [her]4598-my mother spirit passed . "[132-hugh]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop laid [his]4673-the bishop hand upon [the Knight]764-the knight 's bowed head . " [Father]185-father gervaise , "[132-hugh] said [Hugh]132-hugh , brokenly , " knew [you]185-father gervaise how much [she]5557-thy gentle mother had to bear ? [He]189-sir hugo carried [his]189-sir hugo shield untarnished . If [he]189-sir hugo was feared by [[his]189-sir hugo friends]5582-his friends , [he]189-sir hugo was also feared by [[his]189-sir hugo foes]5583-his foes . Brave [he]189-sir hugo was and fearless . One thing [he]189-sir hugo lacked ; and often , alas , [they who lack just one thing]5584-they who lack just one thing , lack all .[4673-the bishop]

" [Hugo]189-sir hugo d'Argent knew not love for [[his]189-sir hugo fellow - men]5585-his fellow - men . To be [a man]4482-a man , was to earn [his]189-sir hugo frown ; all things human called forth [his]189-sir hugo disdain . Nor had [he]189-sir hugo any self - conceit . [He]189-sir hugo realised in [himself]189-sir hugo [[his]189-sir hugo own worst foe]5589-his own worst foe . Lest [we]5590-we fall into this snare , it is well daily to pray : ' [O Lover of Mankind]5591-o lover of mankind , grant unto [me]132-hugh truly to love [[my]132-hugh fellow - men]5592-my fellow - men ; to honour [them]5592-my fellow - men , until [they]5592-my fellow - men prove worthless ; to trust [them]5592-my fellow - men , until [they]5592-my fellow - men prove faithless ; and ever to expect better of [them]5592-my fellow - men , than [I]132-hugh expect of [myself]132-hugh ; to think better of [them]5592-my fellow - men , than [I]132-hugh think of [myself]132-hugh . ' Let [us]5590-we go through life , [[my]132-hugh son]5057-my son , searching for good in [others]482-others , not for evil ; [we]5590-we may miss the good , if [we]5590-we search not for it ; the evil , alas , will find [us]5590-we , quite soon enough , unsought . "[132-hugh]

[Suddenly Hugh]132-hugh lifted [his]1685-i head .

" [Father]185-father gervaise , "[1685-i] [he]1685-i said , " [the starling]5595-the starling ! " [I]4673-the bishop do remember , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . ' "[4673-the bishop]

" Then listen , [dear Father]5601-dear father . Ah , how often have [I]1685-i wished to tell [you]5601-dear father this ! Soon after [you]5601-dear father were gone , [that starling]5602-that starling rudely taught [me]1685-i a hard lesson . Gaining strength , one day [he]5602-that starling left [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , ran through the buttery , and wandered in [the garden]358-the garden . [I]1685-i followed , whistling and watching . It greatly delighted the bird to find [himself]5602-that starling on turf . There had been rain . The grass was wet . Presently a rash worm , gliding from its hole , adventured forth . [The starling]5595-the starling ran to the worm , calling it ' [Hugh]132-hugh . ' ' [Hugh]132-hugh ! [Hugh]132-hugh ! ' [he]5595-the starling cried , and tugged it from the earth . ' [Hugh]132-hugh ! [Hugh]132-hugh ! ' and pecked it , where helpless it lay squirming . Then , shouting ' [Hugh]132-hugh ! ' once more , gobbled it down . [I]1685-i stood with heavy heart , for [I]1685-i had thought that [starling]5606-starling loved [me]1685-i with a true , personal love , when [he]5606-starling ran at [my]1685-i approach shouting [my]1685-i name . Yet now [I]1685-i knew it was the food [I]1685-i carried , [he]5606-starling called ' [Hugh]132-hugh ' ; it was the food , not [me]1685-i , [he]5606-starling loved . Glad was [I]1685-i when , [his]5606-starling wing grown strong , [he]5606-starling flew away . It cut [me]1685-i to the heart to hear the worms , the grubs , the snails , the caterpillars , all called ' [Hugh]132-hugh ' ! "[1685-i]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop smiled , then sighed . " [Poor little eager heart]5607-poor little eager heart , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " learning so hard a lesson , all alone ! Yet is it a lesson , [lad]5357-lad , sooner or later learned in sadness by all generous hearts . . . . And now , leaving the past , with all its memories , let [us]5609-us return to the present , and face the uncertain future . Also , [dear Knight]5610-dear knight , [I]4673-the bishop must ask [you]5610-dear knight to remember , even when [we]5609-us are alone , that [[your]5610-dear knight old friend]5611-your old friend , [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise , in [his]185-father gervaise brown habit , lies at [the bottom of [the ocean]5540-the ocean]5539-the bottom of the ocean ; yet that [[your]5610-dear knight new friend]5614-your new friend , [[Symon]154-symon of worcester of [Worcester]1-worcester]5615-symon of worcester , holds [you]5610-dear knight and [your]5610-dear knight interests very near [his]154-symon of worcester heart . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop put out [his]4673-the bishop hand .

[Hugh]132-hugh seized and kissed it , knowing this was [his]132-hugh farewell to [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise . Then [he]132-hugh rose to [his]132-hugh feet .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop said nothing ; but an indefinable change came over [him]4673-the bishop . Again [he]4673-the bishop extended [his]4673-the bishop hand . [The Knight]764-the knight kneeled , and kissed [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's ring .

" [I]4673-the bishop thank [you]4673-the bishop , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " for [your]4673-the bishop great trust in [me]4673-the bishop . [I]4673-the bishop will not prove unworthy . "[4673-the bishop] With this [he]4673-the bishop went back to [his]4673-the bishop seat .

[The Bishop]92-bishop , lifting the faggot - fork , carefully stirred and built up the logs .

" What were [we]5617-we saying , [[my]92-bishop dear]4718-my dear [Knight]129-the knight , when [we]5617-we strayed into a side issue ? Ah , [I]92-bishop remember ! [I]92-bishop was telling [you]129-the knight of [my]92-bishop appointment to [the See of [Worcester]1-worcester]5619-the see of worcester , and [my]92-bishop belief that [the Prioress]373-the prioress failed to recognise in [me]92-bishop , one [she]373-the prioress had known long years before . "[92-bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop put by the faggot - fork and turned from the fire .

" [I]92-bishop found the promise of that radiant girlhood more than fulfilled . [She]373-the prioress was changed ; [she]373-the prioress shewed obvious signs of having passed through the furnace ; but pure gold can stand the fire . The strength of purpose , the noble outlook upon life , the gracious tenderness for [others]482-others , had matured and developed . Even the necessary restrictions of monastic life could not modify the grand lines both mental , and physical on which Nature had moulded [her]373-the prioress .[92-bishop]

" [I]92-bishop endeavoured to think no thoughts concerning [her]373-the prioress , other than should be thought of [a holy lady who has taken vows of celibacy]5622-a holy lady who has taken vows of celibacy . Yet , seeing [her]373-the prioress so fitted to have made [house]5623-house [home]305-home for [a man]4482-a man , helping [him]4482-a man upward , and to have been [the mother of a fine race of sons]5626-the mother of a fine race of sons and [daughters]4920-daughters , [I]92-bishop felt it grievous that in leaving [the world]389-the world for a reason which in no sense could be considered a true vocation , [she]373-the prioress should have cut [herself]373-the prioress off from such powers and possibilities .[92-bishop]

" So passed the years in the calm service of [God]89-god and of [the Church]55-the church ; yet always [I]92-bishop seemed aware that a crisis would come , and that , when that crisis came , [she]373-the prioress would need [me]92-bishop . "[92-bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop paused and looked at [the Knight]764-the knight .

[Hugh]132-hugh 's face was in shadow ; but , as [the Bishop]4673-the bishop looked at [him]132-hugh , the rubies on [his]132-hugh breast glittered in the firelight , as if some sudden thought had set [him]132-hugh strongly quivering .

At sight of which , a flash of firm resolve , like the swift drawing of a sword , broke o'er [the Bishop]92-bishop 's calmness . It was quick and powerful ; it seemed to divide asunder soul and spirit , joints and marrow , and to discern the thoughts and intents of the heart . And before that two - edged blade could sheathe itself again , swiftly [the Bishop]4673-the bishop spoke .

" Therefore , [[my]4673-the bishop dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh , when [you]132-hugh arrived with [your]132-hugh tale of wrong and treachery , all unconsciously to [yourself]132-hugh , every word [you]132-hugh spoke of [[your]132-hugh betrothed]4739-your betrothed revealed [her]373-the prioress to [the man who had loved [her]373-the prioress while [you]132-hugh were yet [a youth]5632-a youth , with [your]132-hugh spurs to win , and all life before [you]132-hugh]5631-the man who had loved her while you were yet a youth , with your spurs to win , and all life before you .[4673-the bishop]

" [I]4673-the bishop saw in [your]132-hugh arrival , and in the strange tale [you]132-hugh told , a wondrous chance for [her]373-the prioress of that fuller development of life for which [I]4673-the bishop knew [her]373-the prioress to be so perfectly fitted .[4673-the bishop]

" It had seemed indeed the irony of fate that , while [I]4673-the bishop had fled and dwelt in exile lest [my]4673-the bishop presence should hold [her]373-the prioress back from marriage , the treachery of [others]482-others should have driven [her]373-the prioress into a life of celibacy .[4673-the bishop]

" Therefore while , with [my]4673-the bishop tacit consent , [you]132-hugh went to work in [your]132-hugh own way , [I]4673-the bishop sent [[my]4673-the bishop messenger]5436-my messenger to [Rome]37-rome bearing to [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father a full account of all , petitioning a dispensation from vows taken owing to deception , and asking leave to unite in the holy sacrament of marriage [these long - sundered lovers]5636-these long - sundered lovers , undertaking that no scandal should arise therefrom , either in [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery or in [the City of [Worcester]1-worcester]5638-the city of worcester .[4673-the bishop]

" As [you]132-hugh have seen , [[my]4673-the bishop messenger]5436-my messenger this night returned ; and [we]5640-we now find [ourselves]5640-we armed with the full sanction of [His]5435-the holy father Holiness , providing [the Prioress]373-the prioress , of [her]373-the prioress own free will , desires to renounce the high position [she]373-the prioress has won in [her]373-the prioress holy calling , and to come to [you]132-hugh . "[4673-the bishop]

[The quiet voice]1697-the quiet voice ceased speaking .

[The Knight]764-the knight rose slowly to [his]764-the knight feet . At first [he]764-the knight stood silent . Then [he]764-the knight spoke with a calm dignity which proved [him]764-the knight worthy of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's trust .

" [I]764-the knight greatly honour [you]4673-the bishop , [[my]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said ; " and were [our]5643-we ages and conditions other than they are , so that [we]5643-we might fight for [the woman [we]5643-we love]5644-the woman we love , [I]764-the knight should be proud to cross swords with [you]4673-the bishop . "[764-the knight]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop sat looking into the fire . A faint smile flickered at the corners of the sensitive mouth . The fights [he]4673-the bishop had fought for [the woman [he]4673-the bishop loved]876-the woman he loved had been of sterner quality than the mere crossing of knightly swords .

[Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent spoke again .

" Profoundly do [I]132-hugh thank [you]4673-the bishop , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , for all that [you]4673-the bishop have done ; and even more , for that which [you]4673-the bishop did not do . It was six years after [her]876-the woman he loved first sojourn at [the Court]4621-the court that [I]132-hugh met [Mora]144-mora , loved [her]876-the woman he loved , and won [her]876-the woman he loved ; and well [I]132-hugh know that the sweet love [she]876-the woman he loved gave to [me]132-hugh was a love from which [no man]4683-no man had brushed the bloom . "[132-hugh]

[Hugh]132-hugh paused .

[Those]1702-those kindly and very luminous eyes were still bent upon the fire . Was [the Bishop]4673-the bishop finding it hard to face the fact that [his]4673-the bishop life 's secret had now , by [his]4673-the bishop own act , passed into the keeping of [another]1284-another ?

[Hugh]132-hugh moved a pace nearer .

" And deeply do [I]132-hugh love [you]4673-the bishop , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , for [your]4673-the bishop wondrous goodness to [her]876-the woman he loved , and for [her]876-the woman he loved sake to [me]132-hugh . And [I]132-hugh pray heaven , "[132-hugh] added [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent simply , " that if [she]876-the woman he loved come to [me]132-hugh , [she]876-the woman he loved may never know that [she]876-the woman he loved once won the love of so greatly better [a man]4482-a man than [he]4482-a man who won [hers]876-the woman he loved . "[132-hugh]

With which [the Knight]764-the knight dropped upon one knee , and humbly kissed the hem of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's robe .

[Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester was greatly moved .

" [[My]154-symon of worcester son]5057-my son , "[154-symon of worcester] [he]154-symon of worcester said , " [we]5649-we are at one in desiring [her]876-the woman he loved happiness and highest good . For the rest , [God]89-god , and [her]876-the woman he loved own pure heart , must guide [her]876-the woman he loved feet into the way of peace . "[154-symon of worcester]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop rose , and went to the casement .

" The aurora breaks in the east . The dawn is near . Come with [me]154-symon of worcester , [Hugh]132-hugh , to [the chapel]5170-the chapel . [We]5649-we pray for [[His]4482-a man Holiness]5400-his holiness , giving thanks for [his]4482-a man gracious letter and mandate ; [we]5649-we praise for the safe return of [[my]154-symon of worcester messenger]5436-my messenger . But [we]5649-we will also offer up devout petition that [the Prioress]373-the prioress may have clear light at this parting of the ways , and that [our]5649-we enterprise may be brought to a happy conclusion . "[154-symon of worcester]

So , presently , in [the dimly - lighted chapel]1708-the dimly - lighted chapel , [the Knight]764-the knight knelt alone ; while , away at the high altar , remote , wrapt , absorbed in the supreme act of [[his]4673-the bishop priestly office]1710-his priestly office , stood [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , celebrating mass .

Yet one anxious prayer ascended from the hearts of both .

And , in the pale dawn of that new day , [the woman for whom both [the Knight]764-the knight and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop prayed , kept vigil in [[her]1712-the woman for whom both the knight and the bishop prayed , kept vigil in her cell , before the shrine of the madonna cell]321-her cell , before [the shrine of [the Madonna]435-the madonna]485-the shrine of the madonna]1712-the woman for whom both the knight and the bishop prayed , kept vigil in her cell , before the shrine of the madonna .

" [Blessed Virgin]145-blessed virgin , "[1712-the woman for whom both the knight and the bishop prayed , kept vigil in her cell , before the shrine of the madonna] [she]1712-the woman for whom both the knight and the bishop prayed , kept vigil in her cell , before the shrine of the madonna said ; " [thou]5654-thou who lovedst [Saint Joseph]190-saint joseph , being betrothed to [him]190-saint joseph , yet didst keep [thyself]5655-thyself an holy shrine consecrate to [the Lord]4319-the lord and [His]4319-the lord need of [thee]5654-thou oh , grant unto [me]1712-the woman for whom both the knight and the bishop prayed , kept vigil in her cell , before the shrine of the madonna strength to put from [me]1712-the woman for whom both the knight and the bishop prayed , kept vigil in her cell , before the shrine of the madonna this constant torment at the thought of [his]4319-the lord sufferings to whom once [I]1712-the woman for whom both the knight and the bishop prayed , kept vigil in her cell , before the shrine of the madonna gave [my]1712-the woman for whom both the knight and the bishop prayed , kept vigil in her cell , before the shrine of the madonna troth , and to reconsecrate [myself]1712-the woman for whom both the knight and the bishop prayed , kept vigil in her cell , before the shrine of the madonna wholly to the service of [[my]1712-the woman for whom both the knight and the bishop prayed , kept vigil in her cell , before the shrine of the madonna Lord]4881-my lord . "[1712-the woman for whom both the knight and the bishop prayed , kept vigil in her cell , before the shrine of the madonna]

Thus [these three]1718-these three knelt , as a new day dawned .

And [the Knight]764-the knight prayed : " Give [her]373-the prioress to [me]764-the knight ! "[764-the knight]

And [the Bishop]4673-the bishop prayed : " Guide [her]373-the prioress feet into the way of peace . "[4673-the bishop]

And [the Prioress]373-the prioress , with hands crossed upon [her]373-the prioress breast and eyes uplifted , said : " Cause [me]373-the prioress to know the way wherein [I]373-the prioress should walk ; for [I]373-the prioress lift up [my]373-the prioress soul unto [Thee]5658-thee . "[373-the prioress]

The silver streaks of the aurora paled before soaring shafts of gold , bright heralds of the rising sun .

Then from [the Convent garden]560-the convent garden trilled softly the first notes , poignant but passing sweet , of [the robin]339-the robin 's song .

CHAPTER XXV

[MARY ANTONY]175-mary antony RECEIVES [THE BISHOP]4673-the bishop

The morning after the return from [Rome]37-rome of [[the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's messenger]1726-the bishop 's messenger , [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]175-mary antony , chanced to be crossing [the Convent courtyard]1728-the convent courtyard , when there came a loud knocking on the outer gates .

[Mary Antony]175-mary antony , hastening , thrust aside [the buxom porteress]1729-the buxom porteress , and [herself]175-mary antony opened the guichet , and looked out .

[The Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop , mounted upon [his]751-the lord bishop white palfrey , waited without ; [Brother Philip]160-brother philip in attendance . What a bewildering surprise ! What a fortunate thing , thought [old Antony]175-mary antony , that [she]175-mary antony should chance to be there to deal with such an emergency .

Never did [the Bishop]4673-the bishop visit [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery , without sending [a messenger]4543-a messenger beforehand to know whether [the Prioress]373-the prioress could see [him]4673-the bishop , stating the exact hour of [his]4673-the bishop proposed arrival ; so that , when the great doors were flung wide and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop rode into [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , [the Prioress]373-the prioress would be standing at the top of the steps to receive [him]4673-the bishop ; [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress in attendance in the background ; [the other holy ladies upon [their]1738-the other holy ladies upon their knees within the entrance knees within the entrance]1738-the other holy ladies upon their knees within the entrance ; [Mary Antony]175-mary antony , well out of sight , yet where peeping was possible , because [she]175-mary antony loved to see [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother kneel and kiss [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's ring , rising to [her]427-the reverend mother feet again without pause , making of the whole movement one graceful , deep obeisance . After which , [Mary Antony]175-mary antony , still peeping , greatly loved to see [the Prioress]373-the prioress mount the wide , stone staircase with [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ; each [shewing]1743-shewing a courtly deference to [the other]4704-the other .

[One of [Mary Antony]175-mary antony 's most exalted dreams of heaven]1745-one of mary antony 's most exalted dreams of heaven , was of a place where [she]175-mary antony should sit upon [a jasper seat]1746-a jasper seat and see [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother and [the great Lord Bishop]1748-the great lord bishop mounting together [interminable flights of golden stairs]1749-interminable flights of golden stairs ; while [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress and [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca looked through black bars , somewhere down below , whence [they]1750-they would have a good view of [Mary Antony]175-mary antony on [her]175-mary antony jasper seat , but no glimpse of the golden stairs or of the radiant figures which [she]175-mary antony watched ascending .

So much for the usual visits of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , when everything was in readiness for [his]4673-the bishop reception .

But now , all unexpected , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop waited without the gate , and [Mary Antony]175-mary antony had to deal with this emergency . Crying to [the porteress]4960-the porteress to open wide , [she]175-mary antony hastened to the steps . . . . It was impossible to summon [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother in time . . . . [The Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop must not be kept waiting ! . . . Even now the great doors were rolling back . [Mary Antony]175-mary antony mounted the six steps ; then turned in the doorway .

[The Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop must be received . There was [nobody else to do it]1757-nobody else to do it . [She]175-mary antony would receive [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop !

As [she]175-mary antony saw [him]4673-the bishop riding in upon [Icon]174-icon , blessing [the porteress]4960-the porteress as [he]4673-the bishop passed , [she]175-mary antony remembered how [she]175-mary antony had ridden round [the river meadow]5045-the river meadow as [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . Now [she]175-mary antony must play [her]175-mary antony part as [the Prioress]373-the prioress .

So it came to pass that , as [he]4673-the bishop rode up to the door and dismounted , flinging [his]4673-the bishop rein to [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop found [himself]4673-the bishop confronted by the queer little figure of [the aged lay - sister , drawn up to its full height and obviously upheld by a sense of importance and dignity]1764-the aged lay - sister , drawn up to its full height and obviously upheld by a sense of importance and dignity .

As [the Bishop]4673-the bishop reached the entrance , [she]175-mary antony knelt and kissed [his]4673-the bishop ring ; then tried to rise quickly , failed , and clutching at [his]4673-the bishop hand , exclaimed : " [Devil]101-the devil take [my]175-mary antony old knee - joints ! "[175-mary antony]

Never before had [the Bishop]4673-the bishop been received with such a formula ! Never had [his]4673-the bishop ring been kissed by [a lay - sister]1767-a lay - sister ! But remembering the scene when [old Antony]175-mary antony rode round the field upon [Icon]174-icon , [he]4673-the bishop understood that [she]175-mary antony now was playing the part of [Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress .

" Good - day , [worthy Mother]91-mother sub - prioress , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , as [he]4673-the bishop raised [her]175-mary antony . " The spirit is willing [I]4673-the bishop know , but , in [your]4673-the bishop case , the knee - joints are weak . But no wonder , for [they]5659-they have done [you]4673-the bishop long service . Why , [I]4673-the bishop get up slowly from kneeling , yet [my]4673-the bishop knees are thirty years younger than [yours]4673-the bishop . . . . Nay [I]4673-the bishop will not mount to [[the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's chamber]5660-the reverend mother 's chamber until [you]4673-the bishop acquaint [her]93-the reverend mother of [my]4673-the bishop arrival . Take [me]4673-the bishop round to [the garden]358-the garden , and there let [me]4673-the bishop wait in the shade , while [you]4673-the bishop seek [her]93-the reverend mother . "[4673-the bishop]

Greatly elated at the success of [her]175-mary antony effort , and emboldened by [his]1768-his charming condescension , [Mary Antony]175-mary antony led [the Bishop]4673-the bishop through the rose - arch ; and , casting a furtive glance at [his]1768-his face from behind the curtain of [her]175-mary antony veil , ventured to hope there was naught afoot which could bring trouble or care to [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother .

[Mary Antony]175-mary antony was trotting beside [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , down the long walk between the yew hedges , when [she]175-mary antony gave vent to this anxious question .

At once [the Bishop]4673-the bishop slackened speed .

" Not so fast , [Sister Antony]85-mary antony , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " [I]4673-the bishop pray [you]85-mary antony to remember [mine]4673-the bishop age , and to moderate [your]85-mary antony pace . Why should [you]85-mary antony expect trouble or anxiety for [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother ? "[4673-the bishop]

" Nay , "[85-mary antony] said [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , " [I]85-mary antony expect naught ; [I]85-mary antony saw naught ; [I]85-mary antony heard naught ! ' Twas all [mine]85-mary antony own mistake , counting with [my]85-mary antony peas . [I]85-mary antony told [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother so , and set [her]93-the reverend mother mind at rest by carrying up six peas , saying that [I]85-mary antony had found six and not five in [my]85-mary antony wallet . "[85-mary antony]

" Let [us]5662-us pause , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " and look at this lily . How lovely are its petals . How tall and white it shews against the hedge . Why did [you]85-mary antony need to set [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's mind at rest , [Sister Antony]85-mary antony , by carrying up six peas ? "[4673-the bishop]

" Because , "[264-the old lay - sister] said [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , " when [I]264-the old lay - sister had counted as [they]5663-they returned , [the twenty holy ladies who had gone to Vespers]5664-the twenty holy ladies who had gone to vespers , yet [another passed making twenty - one]5665-another passed making twenty - one . Upon which [I]264-the old lay - sister ran and reported to [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , saying in [my]264-the old lay - sister folly , that [I]264-the old lay - sister feared the twenty - first was [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha , returned to walk amongst [the Living]4786-the living , [she]87-sister agatha being over fifty years numbered with [the Dead]686-the dead . Yet many a time , just before dawn , have [I]264-the old lay - sister heard [her]87-sister agatha rapping on the cloister door ; aye , many a time tap ! tap ! tap ! But what good would there be in opening to [a poor lady [you]85-mary antony helped thrust into [her]87-sister agatha shroud]5669-a poor lady you helped thrust into her shroud , nigh upon sixty years before ? So ' Tap away ! ' says [I]264-the old lay - sister ; ' tap away , [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha ! Try [Saint Peter]125-saint peter at [the gates of [Paradise]5-paradise]5670-the gates of paradise . [Old Antony]103-mary antony knows better than to let [you]87-sister agatha in . ' "[264-the old lay - sister]

" What said [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother when [you]4673-the bishop reported on [a twenty - first White Lady]4471-a twenty - first white lady ? "[4673-the bishop] asked [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother bid [me]4673-the bishop begone , while [she]427-the reverend mother [herself]427-the reverend mother dealt with the wraith of [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha . "[4673-the bishop]

" And why did [you]4673-the bishop not go ? "[4673-the bishop] asked [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , quietly .

Completely taken aback , [Mary Antony]103-mary antony 's ready tongue failed [her]103-mary antony . [She]103-mary antony stood stock still and stared at [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . [Her]103-mary antony gums began to rattle and [she]103-mary antony clapped [her]103-mary antony knuckles against them , horror and dismay in [her]103-mary antony eyes .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop looked searchingly into the frightened old face , and there read all [he]4673-the bishop wanted to know . Then [he]4673-the bishop smiled ; and , taking [her]103-mary antony gently by the arm , paced on between the yew hedges .

" [Sister Antony]85-mary antony , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , and the low tones of [his]4673-the bishop voice fell like quiet music upon [old Antony]85-mary antony 's perturbed spirit ; " [you]85-mary antony and [I]4673-the bishop , [dear Sister Antony]85-mary antony , love [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother so truly and so faithfully , that there is nothing [we]5674-we would not do , to save [her]427-the reverend mother a moment 's pain . [We]5674-we know how noble and how good [she]427-the reverend mother is ; and that [she]427-the reverend mother will always decide aright , and follow in the footsteps of [[our]5674-we blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady and [all the holy saints]5676-all the holy saints . But others there are , who do not love [her]427-the reverend mother as [we]5674-we love [her]427-the reverend mother , or know [her]427-the reverend mother as [we]5674-we know [her]427-the reverend mother ; and [they]5677-they might judge [her]427-the reverend mother wrongly . Therefore [we]5674-we must tell to [none]315-none , that which [we]5674-we know how [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , alone , dealt with [that visitor]5680-that visitor , who was not the wraith of [Sister Agatha]87-sister agatha . "[4673-the bishop]

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony peeped up at [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . A light of great joy was on [her]85-mary antony face . [Her]85-mary antony eyes had lost their look of terror , and began to twinkle cunningly .

" [I]85-mary antony know naught , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony said . " [I]85-mary antony saw naught ; [I]85-mary antony heard naught . "[85-mary antony]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop smiled .

" How many peas were left in [your]85-mary antony wallet , [Sister Antony]85-mary antony ? "[4673-the bishop]

" Five , "[85-mary antony] chuckled [Mary Antony]85-mary antony .

" Why did [you]4673-the bishop shew six to [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother ? "[4673-the bishop]

" To set [her]427-the reverend mother mind at rest , "[264-the old lay - sister] whispered [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister .

" To cause [her]427-the reverend mother to think that [you]4673-the bishop had heard naught , seen naught , and knew naught ? "[4673-the bishop]

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony nodded , chuckling again .

" [Faithful old heart]5682-faithful old heart ! "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " What gave [thee]85-mary antony this thought ? "[4673-the bishop]

" [[Our]5683-our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady , in answer to [her]4297-our blessed lady petition , sharpened the wits of [old Antony]85-mary antony . "[4673-the bishop] [The Bishop]4673-the bishop sighed . " May [[our]5683-our blessed [Lady]5686-lady]4297-our blessed lady keep [them]5687-them sharp , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop murmured , half aloud .

" Amen , "[85-mary antony] said [Mary Antony]85-mary antony with fervour .

CHAPTER XXVI

LOVE NEVER FAILETH

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop awaited [the Prioress]373-the prioress on that stone seat under the beech , from which [the robin]339-the robin had carried off the pea .

[He]4673-the bishop saw [her]373-the prioress coming through [the sunlit cloisters]1787-the sunlit cloisters .

As [she]373-the prioress moved down the steps , and came swiftly toward [him]4673-the bishop , [he]4673-the bishop was conscious at once of an indefinable change in [her]373-the prioress .

Had that ride upon [Icon]174-icon set [her]373-the prioress free from trammels in which [she]373-the prioress had been hitherto immeshed ?

As [she]373-the prioress reached [him]4673-the bishop , [he]4673-the bishop took both [her]373-the prioress hands , so that [she]373-the prioress should not kneel .

" Already [I]4673-the bishop have been received with obeisance , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said ; and told [her]373-the prioress of [old [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's quaint little figure , standing to do the honours in the doorway]1788-old mary antony 's quaint little figure , standing to do the honours in the doorway .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress , at this , laughed gaily , and in [her]373-the prioress turn told [the Bishop]4673-the bishop of the scene , on this very spot , when [old Antony]85-mary antony displayed [her]85-mary antony peas to [the robin]339-the robin .

" What peas ? "[4673-the bishop] asked [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ; and so heard the whole story of the twenty - five peas and the daily counting , and of the identifying of certain of the peas with [various members of [the Community]483-the community]1793-various members of the community . " And a large , white pea , chosen for its fine aspect , was [myself]373-the prioress , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress ; " and , leaving [the Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress and [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , [Master Robin]98-master robin swooped down and flew off with [me]373-the prioress ! Hearing cries of distress , [I]373-the prioress hastened hither , to find [Mary Antony]85-mary antony denouncing [the robin]339-the robin as ' [Knight of the Bloody Vest]4389-knight of the bloody vest , ' and making loud lamentations over [my]373-the prioress abduction . [Her]339-the robin imaginings become more real to [her]339-the robin than realities . "[373-the prioress]

" [She]339-the robin hath a faithful heart , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " and a shrewd wit . "[4673-the bishop]

" [Faithful]5691-faithful ? Aye , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , " faithful and loving . Yet it is but lately [I]373-the prioress have realised , the love , beneath [her]339-the robin carefulness and devotion . "[373-the prioress] [The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress bent [her]91-mother sub - prioress level brows , looking away to the overhanging branches of [the Pieman]547-the pieman 's tree . " How quickly , in these places , [we]5692-we lose the very remembrance of the meaning of personal , human love . [We]5692-we grow so soon accustomed to allowing [ourselves]5692-we to dwell only upon the abstract or the divine . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

" That is a loss , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . [He]4673-the bishop turned and began to pace slowly toward [the cloister]286-the cloister ; " a grievous loss , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter . Sooner than that [you]4891-my daughter should suffer that loss , beyond repair , [I]4673-the bishop would let [the daring Knight of the Bloody Vest]5694-the daring knight of the bloody vest carry [you]4891-my daughter off on swift wing . Better a robin 's nest , if , love be there , than [a nunnery full of dead hearts]5695-a nunnery full of dead hearts . "[4673-the bishop]

[He]4673-the bishop heard the quick catch of [her]91-mother sub - prioress breath , but gave [her]91-mother sub - prioress no chance to speak .

" ' And now abideth faith , hope , love , [these three]1718-these three , ' "[4673-the bishop] quoted [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ; " ' but the greatest of these is love . ' "[4673-the bishop]

[They]1802-they were moving through [the cloisters]316-the cloisters . [The Prioress]373-the prioress turned in the doorway , pausing that [the Bishop]4673-the bishop might pass in before [her]373-the prioress .

" This , [[my]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , with a fine sweep of [her]373-the prioress arm , " is the abode of Faith and Hope , and also of that divine Love , which excelleth both Hope and Faith . "[373-the prioress]

" Nay , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " [I]4673-the bishop pray [you]373-the prioress , listen . ' Love suffereth long , and is kind ; love envieth not ; love vaunteth not itself , is not puffed up ; doth not behave itself unseemly ; seeketh not [her]91-mother sub - prioress own ; is not easily provoked , thinking no evil ; rejoiceth not in iniquity , but rejoiceth in the truth ; beareth all things , believeth all things , hopeth all things , endureth all things . Love never faileth . ' Methinks , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , in a tone of gentle meditation , as [he]4673-the bishop entered [[the Prioress]373-the prioress 's cell]1809-the prioress 's cell , " [the apostle]5698-the apostle was speaking of a most human love ; yet [he]5698-the apostle rated it higher than faith and hope . "[4673-the bishop]
