" Are [you]4673-the bishop still dwelling upon [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , [[my]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord ? "[373-the prioress] inquired [the Prioress]373-the prioress , and in [her]373-the prioress voice [he]4673-the bishop heard the sound of a gathering storm .

" Nay , [[my]4673-the bishop dear]4718-my dear [Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , seating [himself]4673-the bishop in the Spanish chair , and laying [his]4673-the bishop biretta upon the table near by ; " [I]4673-the bishop speak not of self - love , nor does the apostle whose words [I]4673-the bishop quote . [I]4673-the bishop take it , [he]4673-the bishop writes of human love , sanctified ; upborne by faith and hope , yet greater than either ; just as a bird is greater than its wings , yet can not mount without them . [We]5701-we must have faith , [we]5701-we must have hope ; then [our]5701-we poor earthly loves can rise from the lower level of self - seeking and self - pleasing and take their place among those things that are eternal . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress had placed [her]91-mother sub - prioress chair opposite [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . [She]91-mother sub - prioress was very pale , and [her]91-mother sub - prioress lips trembled . [She]91-mother sub - prioress made so great an effort to speak with calmness , that [her]91-mother sub - prioress voice sounded stern and hard .

" Why this talk of earthly loves , [[my]91-mother sub - prioress Lord]4881-my lord [Bishop]92-bishop , in [a place where all earthly love]5703-a place where all earthly love has been renounced and forgotten ? "[91-mother sub - prioress]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop , seeing those trembling lips , ignored the hard tones , and answered , very tenderly , with a simple directness which scorned all evasion :

" Because , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , [I]4673-the bishop am here to plead for [Hugh]132-hugh . "[4673-the bishop]

CHAPTER XXVII

[THE WOMAN]191-the woman AND [HER]191-the woman CONSCIENCE

" For [Hugh]132-hugh ? "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress . And then again , in low tones of incredulous amazement , " For [Hugh]132-hugh ! What know [you]92-bishop of [Hugh]132-hugh , [[my]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord ? "[373-the prioress]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop looked steadfastly at [the Prioress]373-the prioress , and replied with exceeding gravity and earnestness :

" [I]4673-the bishop know that in breaking [your]92-bishop solemn troth to [him]132-hugh , [you]92-bishop are breaking a very noble heart ; and that in leaving [[his]132-hugh home]5182-his home desolate , [you]92-bishop are robbing [him]132-hugh not only of [his]132-hugh happiness but also of [his]132-hugh faith . [Men]4397-men are apt to rate [our]4397-men holy religion , not by its theories , but by the way in which it causeth [us]4397-men to act in [our]4397-men dealings with [them]4397-men . If [you]92-bishop condemn [Hugh]132-hugh to sit beside [his]132-hugh hearth , through the long years , [a lonely , childless man]5708-a lonely , childless man , [you]92-bishop take [the Madonna]435-the madonna from [[his]132-hugh home]5182-his home ; if [you]92-bishop take [your]92-bishop love from [him]132-hugh , [I]4673-the bishop greatly fear lest [you]92-bishop should also rob [him]132-hugh of [his]132-hugh belief in the love of [God]89-god . [I]4673-the bishop do not say that these things should be so ; [I]4673-the bishop say that [we]5711-we must face the fact that thus they are . And remember between [a man]4482-a man and [woman of noble birth]5713-woman of noble birth , [each with a stainless escutcheon]5714-each with a stainless escutcheon , each believing [the other to be the soul of honour]5715-the other to be the soul of honour , a broken troth is no light matter . "[4673-the bishop]

" [I]373-the prioress did not break [my]373-the prioress troth , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , " until [I]373-the prioress believed that [Hugh]132-hugh had broken [his]132-hugh . [I]373-the prioress had suffered sore anguish of heart and humiliation of spirit , over the news of [his]132-hugh marriage with [[his]132-hugh cousin]5716-his cousin [Alfrida]137-alfrida , ere [I]373-the prioress resolved to renounce [the world]389-the world and enter [the cloister]286-the cloister . "[373-the prioress] " But [Hugh]132-hugh did not [we]5719-we d [[his]132-hugh cousin]5716-his cousin , nor [any other woman]5721-any other woman , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " [He]132-hugh was true to [you]373-the prioress in every thought and act , even after [he]132-hugh also had passed through sore anguish of heart by reason of [your]373-the prioress supposed marriage with [another suitor]5722-another suitor . "[4673-the bishop]

" [I]373-the prioress learned the truth but a few days since , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress . " For seven long years [I]373-the prioress thought [Hugh]132-hugh false to [me]373-the prioress . For seven long years [I]373-the prioress believed [him]132-hugh [the husband of [another woman]4746-another woman]5723-the husband of another woman , and schooled [myself]373-the prioress to forget every memory of past tenderness . "[373-the prioress]

" [You]373-the prioress were both deceived , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " [You]373-the prioress have both passed through [deep waters]5072-deep waters . [You]373-the prioress each owe it to [the other]4704-the other to make all possible reparation . "[4673-the bishop]

" For seven holy years , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , firmly , " [I]373-the prioress have been [the bride of [Christ]105-christ]4707-the bride of christ . "[373-the prioress]

" Do [you]91-mother sub - prioress love [Hugh]132-hugh ? "[4673-the bishop] asked [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

There was silence in [the chamber]627-the chamber .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress desired , most fervently , to take [her]91-mother sub - prioress stand as one dead to all earthly loves and desires . Yet each time [she]91-mother sub - prioress opened [her]91-mother sub - prioress lips to reply , a fresh picture appeared in the mirror of [her]91-mother sub - prioress mental vision , and closed them .

[She]91-mother sub - prioress saw [herself]91-mother sub - prioress , with hand outstretched , clasping [Hugh]132-hugh 's as [they]1824-they kneeled together before [the shrine of [the Madonna]435-the madonna]485-the shrine of the madonna . [She]91-mother sub - prioress could feel the rush of pulsing life flow from [his]132-hugh hand to the palm of [hers]91-mother sub - prioress , and so upward to [her]91-mother sub - prioress poor numbed heart , making it beat its wings like a caged bird .

[She]91-mother sub - prioress felt again the strength and comfort of the strong arm on which [she]91-mother sub - prioress leaned , as slowly through the darkness [she]91-mother sub - prioress and [Hugh]132-hugh paced in silence , side by side .

[She]91-mother sub - prioress remembered each time when obedience had seemed strangely sweet , and [she]91-mother sub - prioress had loved the manly abruptness of [his]132-hugh commands .

[She]91-mother sub - prioress saw [Hugh]132-hugh , in the ring of yellow light cast by the lantern , kneeling at [her]91-mother sub - prioress feet . [She]91-mother sub - prioress felt [his]132-hugh hair , thick and soft , between [her]91-mother sub - prioress fingers .

And then [she]91-mother sub - prioress remembered that shuddering sob , and the instant breaking down of every barrier . [He]132-hugh was [hers]91-mother sub - prioress , to comfort ; [she]91-mother sub - prioress was [his]132-hugh , to soothe [his]132-hugh pain . Then the exquisite moment of yielding ; the relief of the clasp of [his]132-hugh strong arms ; the passing away of the suffering of long years , as [she]91-mother sub - prioress felt [his]132-hugh lips on [hers]91-mother sub - prioress , and surrendered to the hunger of [his]132-hugh kiss .

Then one last picture when loyal to [her]91-mother sub - prioress wish , felt rather than expressed , [he]132-hugh had freed [her]91-mother sub - prioress , and passed , without further word or touch , up into that dim grey light like a pearly dawn at sea passed , and been lost to view ; [she]91-mother sub - prioress saw [herself]91-mother sub - prioress left in utter loneliness , the heavy door locked by [her]91-mother sub - prioress own turning of the key , [he]132-hugh on one side , [she]91-mother sub - prioress on the other , for ever ; [she]91-mother sub - prioress saw [herself]91-mother sub - prioress lying beneath the ground , in darkness and desolation , [her]91-mother sub - prioress face in the damp dust where [his]132-hugh feet had stood .

" Do [you]373-the prioress love [Hugh]132-hugh ? "[4673-the bishop] again demanded [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

And [the Prioress]373-the prioress lifted eyes full of suffering , reproach , and pain , but also full of courage and truth , to [his]132-hugh face , and answered simply : " Alas , [[my]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord , [I]373-the prioress do . "[373-the prioress]

The silence thereafter following was tense with conflict . [The Bishop]4673-the bishop turned [his]4673-the bishop eyes to the figure of [the Redeemer upon the cross]1830-the redeemer upon the cross , self - sacrifice personified , while [the Prioress]373-the prioress mastered [her]373-the prioress emotion .

Then : " ' Love never faileth , ' "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop gently .

But [the Prioress]373-the prioress had regained command over [herself]373-the prioress , and the gentle words were to [her]373-the prioress a challenge . [She]373-the prioress donned , forthwith , the breastplate of holy resolve , and drew [her]373-the prioress sword .

" [My]373-the prioress Lord [Bishop]92-bishop , [you]92-bishop have wrung from [me]373-the prioress a confession of [my]373-the prioress love ; but in so doing , [you]92-bishop have wrung from [me]373-the prioress a confession of sin . [A nun]412-a nun may not yield to such love as [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent still desires to win from [me]373-the prioress . With long hours of prayer and vigil , have [I]373-the prioress sought to purge [my]373-the prioress soul from the stain of a weak yielding even for ' a moment ' to the masterful insistence of [this man]4855-this man , who forced [himself]4855-this man , by the subterfuge of a sacrilegious masquerade , into the sacred precincts of [[our]5731-our Nunnery]5732-our nunnery . [I]373-the prioress know not whom [he]4855-this man bribed "[373-the prioress] continued [the Prioress]373-the prioress , flashing an indignant glance of suspicion at [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" ' Love thinking no evil , ' "[154-symon of worcester] murmured [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester .

" But [I]373-the prioress do know , that [somebody in high authority]5733-somebody in high authority must have connived at [his]4855-this man plotting , or [he]4855-this man could not have found [himself]4855-this man alone in [the crypt]273-the crypt at the hour of Vespers , in such wise as to assume [our]5731-our dress and , mingling with [the returning procession]5735-the returning procession , gain entrance to [the cloisters]316-the cloisters . And [somebody]5737-somebody must still be aiding and abetting [his]4855-this man plans , or [he]4855-this man could not be , as [he]4855-this man [himself]4855-this man told [me]373-the prioress [he]4855-this man would be , daily in [the crypt]273-the crypt alone , during the hour when [we]5731-our pass to and from [the clerestory]5739-the clerestory . It angers [me]373-the prioress , [[my]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord , to think that [one who should , in this , be on [my]373-the prioress side , taketh part against [me]373-the prioress]5741-one who should , in this , be on my side , taketh part against me . "[373-the prioress]

" ' Is not easily provoked , ' "[4673-the bishop] quoted [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" In fact [I]373-the prioress am tempted , [[my]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , rising to [her]373-the prioress feet , tall and indignant , " [I]373-the prioress am almost tempted , [[my]373-the prioress Lord [Bishop]92-bishop]4963-my lord bishop , to forget the reverence which [I]373-the prioress owe to [[your]92-bishop high office]5744-your high office "[373-the prioress]

" ' Doth not behave itself unseemly , ' "[154-symon of worcester] murmured [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester , putting on [his]154-symon of worcester biretta .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress turned [her]373-the prioress back upon [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , and walked over to the window . [She]373-the prioress was so angry that [she]373-the prioress felt the tears stinging beneath [her]373-the prioress eyelids ; yet at the same time [she]373-the prioress experienced a most incongruous desire to kneel down beside that beautiful and dignified figure , rest [her]373-the prioress head against [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's knees , and pour out the cruel tale of conflicts , uncertainties and strivings , temptations and hard - won victories , which , had lately made up the sum of [her]373-the prioress nights and days . [He]4673-the bishop had been [[her]373-the prioress trusted friend]1841-her trusted friend and [counsellor]5114-counsellor during all these years . Yet now [she]373-the prioress knew [him]4673-the bishop arrayed against [her]373-the prioress , and [she]373-the prioress feared [him]4673-the bishop more than [she]373-the prioress feared [Hugh]132-hugh . [Hugh]132-hugh wrestled with [her]373-the prioress feelings ; and , on the plane of the senses , [she]373-the prioress knew [her]373-the prioress will would triumph . But [the Bishop]4673-the bishop wrestled with [her]373-the prioress mentality ; and behind [his]4673-the bishop calm gentleness was a strength of intellect which , if [she]373-the prioress yielded at all , would seize and hold [her]373-the prioress , as steel fingers in a velvet glove .

[She]373-the prioress returned to [her]373-the prioress seat , composed but determined .

" [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " [I]373-the prioress pray [you]155-reverend father to pardon [my]373-the prioress too swift indignation . To [you]155-reverend father [I]373-the prioress look to aid [me]373-the prioress in this time of difficulty . [I]373-the prioress grieve for the sorrow and disappointment to [a brave and noble knight]5745-a brave and noble knight , [a loyal lover]5746-a loyal lover , and a most faithful heart . But [I]373-the prioress can not reward faith with un - faith . If [I]373-the prioress broke [my]373-the prioress sacred vows in order to give [myself]373-the prioress to [him]5745-a brave and noble knight , [I]373-the prioress should not bring a blessing to [[his]5745-a brave and noble knight home]5182-his home . Better an empty hearth than a hearth where broods a curse . Besides , [we]5748-we never could live down the scandal caused . [I]373-the prioress should be anathema to all . [The Pope]5391-the pope [himself]5391-the pope would doubtless excommunicate [us]5748-we . It would mean endless sorrow for [me]373-the prioress , and danger for [Hugh]132-hugh . On [these grounds]5750-these grounds , alone , it can not be . "[373-the prioress]

Then [the Bishop]4673-the bishop drew from [his]4673-the bishop sash a folded sheet of vellum .

" [[My]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " when [Hugh]132-hugh came to [me]4673-the bishop with [his]132-hugh grievous tale of treachery and loss , [he]132-hugh refused to give [me]4673-the bishop the name of [the woman [he]132-hugh sought]5752-the woman he sought , saying only that [he]132-hugh believed [she]5752-the woman he sought was to be found among [the White Ladies of [Worcester]1-worcester]283-the white ladies of worcester . When [I]4673-the bishop asked [her]5752-the woman he sought name [he]132-hugh answered : ' Nay , [I]4673-the bishop guard [her]5752-the woman he sought name , as [I]4673-the bishop would guard [mine]4673-the bishop honour . If [I]4673-the bishop fail to win [her]5752-the woman he sought back ; if [she]5752-the woman he sought withhold [herself]5752-the woman he sought from [me]4673-the bishop , so that [I]4673-the bishop ride away alone ; then must [I]4673-the bishop ride away leaving no shadow of reproach on [her]5752-the woman he sought fair fame . [Her]5752-the woman he sought name will be for ever in [my]4673-the bishop heart , ' said [Hugh]132-hugh , ' but no word of [mine]4673-the bishop shall have left it , in the mind of [any man]4301-any man , linked with a broken troth or [a forsaken lover]5122-a forsaken lover . ' [I]4673-the bishop tell [you]5752-the woman he sought this , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , lest [you]5752-the woman he sought should misjudge [a very loyal knight]5757-a very loyal knight .[4673-the bishop]

" But [no true lover]5352-no true lover was ever [a diplomat]5353-a diplomat . [Hugh]132-hugh had not talked long with [me]91-mother sub - prioress , before [you]5752-the woman he sought stood clearly revealed . A few careful questions settled the matter , beyond a doubt . Whereupon , [[my]91-mother sub - prioress dear]4718-my dear Prioress "[91-mother sub - prioress]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop paused . It became suddenly difficult to proceed . The clear eyes of [the Prioress]373-the prioress were upon [him]4673-the bishop .

" Whereupon , [[my]91-mother sub - prioress lord]4881-my lord ? "[91-mother sub - prioress]

" Whereupon [I]91-mother sub - prioress realised an early dream of [mine]91-mother sub - prioress seemed promised a possible fulfilment . [I]91-mother sub - prioress knew [Hugh]132-hugh as [a lad]5762-a lad It is a veritable passion with [me]91-mother sub - prioress that all things should attain unto their full perfection In short , [I]91-mother sub - prioress sent [a messenger]4543-a messenger to [Rome]37-rome , bearing a careful account of the whole matter , in a private letter from [myself]91-mother sub - prioress to [[His]132-hugh Holiness [the Pope]5391-the pope]5390-his holiness the pope . Last evening , [[my]91-mother sub - prioress messenger]5436-my messenger returned , bringing a letter from [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father , with this enclosed . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop held out the folded document .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress rose , took it from [him]4673-the bishop , and unfolded it .

As [she]91-mother sub - prioress read the opening lines , the amazement on [her]91-mother sub - prioress face quickly gathered into a frown .

" What ! "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress said . " The name and rank [I]91-mother sub - prioress resigned on entering this Order ! Who dares to write or speak of [me]91-mother sub - prioress as ' [Mora]144-mora , [Countess of [Norelle]42-norelle]5105-countess of norelle ' ? "[91-mother sub - prioress] " Merely [His]4673-the bishop Holiness [the Pope]5391-the pope , and [the Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]5770-the bishop of worcester , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop meekly , in an undertone , not meaning [the Prioress]373-the prioress to hear ; and , indeed , [she]91-mother sub - prioress ignored this answer , [her]91-mother sub - prioress words having been an angry ejaculation , rather than a question .

But there was worse to come .

" Dispensation ! "[373-the prioress] exclaimed [the Prioress]373-the prioress .

" Absolution ! "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress cried , a little further on .

And at last , reading rapidly , in tones of uncontrollable anger and indignation : " ' Empowers [Symon]154-symon of worcester , [Lord Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]5771-lord bishop of worcester , or [any priest [he]154-symon of worcester may appoint]5772-any priest he may appoint , to unite in the holy sacrament of marriage [the Knight - Crusader]5773-the knight - crusader , [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent , and [Mora de Norelle]144-mora , [sometime Prioress of [the White Ladies of [Worcester]1-worcester]283-the white ladies of worcester]1637-sometime prioress of the white ladies of worcester . ' [Sometime Prioress]192-sometime prioress ? In very truth , [they]5776-they have dared so to write it ! [SOMETIME Prioress]192-sometime prioress ! It will be well [they]5776-they should understand [she]144-mora is Prioress NOW not some time or any time , but NOW and HERE ! "[91-mother sub - prioress]

[She]91-mother sub - prioress turned upon [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" [[My]91-mother sub - prioress lord]4881-my lord , [the Church]55-the church seems to be bringing its powers to bear on the side of [the World]33-the world , [the Flesh]4830-the flesh , and [the Devil]404-the devil , leaving [a woman]813-a woman and [her]813-a woman conscience to stand alone and battle unaided with [the grim forces arrayed against [her]813-a woman]5781-the grim forces arrayed against her . But [you]4881-my lord shall see that [she]144-mora knows how to deal with any weapon of [the adversary]5782-the adversary which happens to fall into [her]144-mora hands . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

Upon which [the Prioress]373-the prioress rent the mandate from top to bottom , then across and again across ; flung the pieces upon the floor , and set [her]91-mother sub - prioress foot upon them .

" Thus [I]91-mother sub - prioress answer , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress cried , " [your]4673-the bishop attempt , [[my]91-mother sub - prioress lord]4881-my lord , to induce [the Pope]5391-the pope to release [me]91-mother sub - prioress from vows which [I]91-mother sub - prioress hold to be eternally sacred and binding . And if [you]4673-the bishop are bent upon divorcing [a nun]412-a nun from [her]412-a nun Heavenly Union , and making [her]412-a nun to become the chattel of [a man]4482-a man , [you]4673-the bishop must seek [her]412-a nun elsewhere than in [the Convent of [the White Ladies of [Worcester]1-worcester]283-the white ladies of worcester]5787-the convent of the white ladies of worcester , [[my]91-mother sub - prioress Lord [Bishop]92-bishop]4963-my lord bishop ! "[91-mother sub - prioress]

So spoke [the angry Prioress]1853-the angry prioress , making the quiet chamber to ring with [her]1853-the angry prioress scorn and indignation .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop had made no attempt to prevent the tearing of the document . When [she]1853-the angry prioress flung it upon the floor , placing [her]1853-the angry prioress foot upon the fragments , [he]4673-the bishop merely looked at them regretfully , and then back upon [her]1853-the angry prioress face , back into those eyes which flamed on [him]4673-the bishop in furious indignation . And in [his]4673-the bishop own there was a look so sorrowful , so deeply wounded , and yet withal so tenderly understanding , that it quelled and calmed the anger of [the Prioress]373-the prioress .

[Her]1853-the angry prioress eyes fell slowly , from the serene sadness of that quiet face , to the silver cross , studded with oriental amethysts , at [his]4673-the bishop breast ; to the sash girdling [his]4673-the bishop purple cassock ; to the hand resting on [his]4673-the bishop knees ; to the stone in [his]4673-the bishop ring , from which the rich colour had faded , leaving it pale and clear , like a large teardrop on [the Bishop]92-bishop 's finger ; to [his]4673-the bishop shoes , with their strange Italian buckles ; then along the floor to [her]1853-the angry prioress own angry foot , treading upon the torn fragments of that precious document , procured , at such pains and cost , from [His]4673-the bishop Holiness at [Rome]37-rome .

Then , suddenly , [the Prioress]373-the prioress faltered , weakened , fell upon [her]1853-the angry prioress knees , with a despairing cry , clasped [her]1853-the angry prioress hands upon [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's knees , and laid [her]1853-the angry prioress forehead upon them .

" Alas , "[1853-the angry prioress] [she]1853-the angry prioress sobbed , " what have [I]1853-the angry prioress done ! In [my]1853-the angry prioress pride and arrogance , [I]1853-the angry prioress have spoken ill to [you]5790-you , [[my]1853-the angry prioress lord]4881-my lord , who have ever shewn [me]1853-the angry prioress most considerate kindness ; and in a moment of ill - judged resentment , [I]1853-the angry prioress have committed sacrilege against [the Holy Father]193-the holy father , rending the deed which bears [his]193-the holy father signature . Alas , woe is [me]1853-the angry prioress ! In striving to do right , [I]1853-the angry prioress have done most grievous wrong ; in seeking not to sin , lo , [I]1853-the angry prioress have sinned beyond belief ! "[1853-the angry prioress]

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress wept , [her]91-mother sub - prioress head upon [her]91-mother sub - prioress hands , clasped and resting upon [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's knees .

[Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester laid [his]154-symon of worcester hand very gently upon that bowed head , and as [he]154-symon of worcester did so [his]154-symon of worcester eyes sought again the figure of [the Christ upon the cross]1859-the christ upon the cross . [The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress would have been startled indeed , had [she]91-mother sub - prioress lifted [her]91-mother sub - prioress head and seen those eyes heretofore shrewd , searching , kindly , or twinkling and gay , now full of an unfathomable pain . But , sobbing with [her]91-mother sub - prioress face hidden , [the Prioress]373-the prioress was conscious only of [her]91-mother sub - prioress own sufferings .

Presently [the Bishop]4673-the bishop began to speak .

" [We]5792-we did not mean to overrule [your]373-the prioress judgment , or to force [your]373-the prioress inclination , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter . If [we]5792-we appear to have done so , the blame is [mine]4673-the bishop alone . This mandate is drawn up entirely along the lines of [my]4673-the bishop suggestion , owing to [my]4673-the bishop influence with [His]4673-the bishop Holiness , and based upon particulars furnished by [me]4673-the bishop . Now let [me]4673-the bishop read to [you]373-the prioress the private letter from [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father to [myself]4673-the bishop , giving further important conditions . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop drew forth and unfolded the letter from [Rome]37-rome , and very slowly , that each syllable might carry weight , [he]4673-the bishop read it aloud .

As the gracious and kindly words fell upon [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress 's ear , commanding that no undue pressure should be brought to bear upon [her]91-mother sub - prioress , and insisting that it must be entirely by [her]91-mother sub - prioress own wish , if [she]91-mother sub - prioress resigned [her]91-mother sub - prioress office and availed [herself]91-mother sub - prioress of this dispensation from [her]91-mother sub - prioress vows , [she]91-mother sub - prioress felt humbled to the dust at thought of [her]91-mother sub - prioress own violence , and of the injustice of [her]91-mother sub - prioress angry words .

[Her]91-mother sub - prioress weeping became so heartbroken , that [the Bishop]4673-the bishop again laid [his]4673-the bishop left hand , with kindly comforting touch , upon [her]91-mother sub - prioress bowed head .

As [he]4673-the bishop read [the Pope]5391-the pope 's most particular injunctions as to the manner in which [she]91-mother sub - prioress must leave [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery and take [her]91-mother sub - prioress place in [the world]389-the world once more , so as to prevent any public scandal , [she]91-mother sub - prioress fell silent from sheer astonishment , holding [her]91-mother sub - prioress breath to listen to the final clause empowering [the Bishop]4673-the bishop to announce within [the Convent]328-the convent , when [her]91-mother sub - prioress absence became known , that [she]91-mother sub - prioress had been moved on by [him]4673-the bishop , secretly , with the knowledge and approval of [the Pope]5391-the pope , to a place where [she]91-mother sub - prioress was required for higher service .

" Higher service , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress , [her]373-the prioress face still hidden . " Higher service ? Can it be that [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father really speaks of the return to earthly love and marriage , the pleasures of [the world]389-the world , and the joys of [home]305-home life , as ' higher service ' ? "[373-the prioress]

The grief , the utter disillusion , the dismayed question in [her]373-the prioress tone , moved [the Bishop]4673-the bishop to compunction .

" [Mine]4673-the bishop was the phrase , to begin with , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop admitted . " [I]4673-the bishop used it to [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father , and [I]4673-the bishop confess that , in using it , [I]4673-the bishop did mean to convey that which , as [you]4891-my daughter well know . [I]4673-the bishop have long believed , that wifehood and motherhood , if worthily performed , may rank higher in the Divine regard than vows of celibacy . But , in adopting the expression , [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father , [we]5801-we may rest assured , had no thought of undervaluing the monastic life , or the high position within it to which [you]4891-my daughter have attained . [I]4673-the bishop should rather take it that [he]4673-the bishop was merely accepting [my]4673-the bishop assurance that the new vocation to which [you]4891-my daughter were called would , in [your]4891-my daughter particular case , be higher service . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress , lifting [her]373-the prioress head , looked long into [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's face , without making reply .

[Her]373-the prioress eyes were drowned in tears ; dark shadows lay beneath them . Yet the light of a high resolve , unconquerable within [her]373-the prioress , shone through this veil of sorrow , as when the sun , behind it , breaks through the mist , victorious , chasing by its clear beams the baffling fog .

Seeing that look , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop knew , of a sudden , that [he]4673-the bishop had failed ; that [the Knight]764-the knight had failed ; that the all - powerful pronouncement from [the Vatican]5450-the vatican had failed .

[The woman]809-the woman and [her]809-the woman conscience held the field .

Having conquered [her]809-the woman own love , having mastered [her]809-the woman own natural yearning for [[her]809-the woman lover]762-her lover , [she]809-the woman would overcome with ease [all other assailants]1879-all other assailants .

In two days ' time [Hugh]132-hugh would ride away alone . Unless a miracle happened , [Mora]144-mora would not be with [him]132-hugh .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop faced defeat as [he]4673-the bishop looked into those clear eyes , fearless even in [their]1881-their sorrowful humility .

" Oh , [child]828-child , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " [you]828-child love [Hugh]132-hugh ! Can [you]828-child let [him]132-hugh ride forth alone , accompanied only by [the grim spectres of unfaith and of despair]5803-the grim spectres of unfaith and of despair ? [His]132-hugh hope , [his]132-hugh faith , [his]132-hugh love , all centre in [you]828-child . [Another Prioress]5804-another prioress can be found for [this Nunnery]4944-this nunnery . [No other bride]5806-no other bride can be found for [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent . [He]132-hugh will have [[his]132-hugh own betrothed]1166-his own betrothed , or [none]315-none . "[4673-the bishop]

Still kneeling , [the Prioress]373-the prioress threw back [her]373-the prioress head , looking upward , with clasped hands .

" [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " [I]373-the prioress will not go to [the man [I]373-the prioress love]5809-the man i love , trailing broken vows , like chains , behind [me]373-the prioress . There could be no harmony in life 's music . Whene'er [I]373-the prioress moved , where'er [I]373-the prioress trod , [I]373-the prioress should hear the constant clanking of those chains . [No man]4683-no man can set [me]373-the prioress free from vows made to [God]89-god . But "[373-the prioress]

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress paused , looking past [the Bishop]4673-the bishop at the gracious figure of [the Madonna]435-the madonna . [She]91-mother sub - prioress had remembered , of a sudden , how [Hugh]132-hugh had knelt there , saying : " [Blessed Virgin]145-blessed virgin . . . help [this woman of mine]4756-this woman of mine to understand that if [she]4756-this woman of mine break [her]4756-this woman of mine troth to [me]132-hugh , holding [herself]4756-this woman of mine from [me]132-hugh , now , when [I]132-hugh am come to claim [her]4756-this woman of mine , [she]4756-this woman of mine sends [me]132-hugh out to an empty life , to a hearth beside which [no woman]4757-no woman will sit , to a home forever desolate . "[132-hugh]

" But ? "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , leaning forward . " Yes , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter ? But ? "[4673-the bishop]

" But if [[our]5814-our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady [herself]4297-our blessed lady vouchsafed [me]4673-the bishop a clear sign that [my]4673-the bishop first duty is to [Hugh]132-hugh , if [she]4297-our blessed lady absolved [me]4673-the bishop from [my]4673-the bishop vows , making it evident that [God]89-god 's will for [me]4673-the bishop is that , leaving [the Cloister]286-the cloister , [I]4673-the bishop should [we]5814-our d [Hugh]132-hugh and dwell with [him]132-hugh in [[his]132-hugh home]5182-his home ; then [I]4673-the bishop would strive to bring [myself]4673-the bishop to do this thing . But [I]4673-the bishop can take release from none save from [[our]1887-our Lord]4256-our lord , to Whom those vows were made , or from [[our]1887-our Lady , who knoweth the heart of [a woman]813-a woman , and whose grace hath been with [me]4673-the bishop all through the strivings and conflicts of the years that are past]5819-our lady , who knoweth the heart of a woman , and whose grace hath been with me all through the strivings and conflicts of the years that are past . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop sighed . " Alas , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said ; " alas , poor [Hugh]132-hugh ! "[4673-the bishop]

For that [[our]1887-our Lady]4260-our lady should vouchsafe a clear sign , would have to be a miracle ; and , though [he]4673-the bishop would not have admitted it to [the Prioress]373-the prioress , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop believed , in [his]4673-the bishop secret heart , that the age of miracles was past .

One so fixed in [her]4260-our lady determination , so persistent in [her]4260-our lady assertion , so loud in [her]4260-our lady asseveration , would scarce be likely to hear the inward whisperings of Divine suggestion .

Therefore , should [[our]1887-our Lady]4260-our lady intervene with clear guidance , that intervention must be miraculous . And [the Bishop]4673-the bishop sighing , said : " Alas , poor [Hugh]132-hugh ! "[4673-the bishop]

[His]4673-the bishop eye fell upon the fragments of rent vellum on the floor . [He]4673-the bishop held out [his]4673-the bishop hand .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress gathered up the fragments , and placed them in [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's outstretched hand .

" Alas , [[my]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " [you]4673-the bishop were witness of [my]373-the prioress grievous sin in thus rending the gracious message of [[His]132-hugh Holiness]5400-his holiness . Will it please [you]4673-the bishop to appoint [me]373-the prioress a penance , if such an act can indeed be expiated ? "[373-the prioress]

" The sin , [[my]373-the prioress daughter]4891-my daughter , as [I]373-the prioress will presently explain , is scarcely so great as [you]4673-the bishop think it . But , such as it is , it arose from a lack of calmness and of that mental equipoise which sails unruffled through a sea of contradiction . The irritability which results in displays of sudden temper is so foreign to [your]4673-the bishop nature that it points to [your]4673-the bishop having passed through a time of very special strain , both mental and physical ; probably overlong vigils and fastings , while [you]4673-the bishop wrestled with this anxious problem upon which so much , in the future , depends .[373-the prioress]

" As [you]4673-the bishop ask [me]373-the prioress for penance , [I]373-the prioress will give [you]4673-the bishop two : one which will set right [your]4673-the bishop ill - considered action ; the other which will help to remedy the cause of that action .[373-the prioress]

" The first is , that [you]4673-the bishop place these fragments together and , taking a fresh piece of vellum , make a careful copy of this writing which [you]4673-the bishop destroyed .[373-the prioress]

" The second is that , in order to regain the usual equipoise of [your]4673-the bishop mental attitude , [you]4673-the bishop ride to - day , for an hour , in [the river meadow]5045-the river meadow . [My]373-the prioress white palfrey , [Iconoklastes]169-iconoklastes , shall be in [the courtyard]775-the courtyard at noon . Yesterday , [[my]373-the prioress daughter]4891-my daughter , [you]4673-the bishop rode for pleasure . To - day [you]4673-the bishop will ride for penance ; and incidentally "[373-the prioress] an irrepressible little smile crept round the corners of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's mouth , and twinkled in [his]4673-the bishop eyes " incidentally , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , [you]4673-the bishop will work off a certain stiffness from which [you]4673-the bishop must be suffering , after the unwonted exercise . Ah [me]4673-the bishop ! "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " that is ever the Divine method . Punishments should be remedial , as well as deterrent . There is much stiffness of mind of which [we]5828-we must be rid before [we]5828-we can stoop to the portal of [God]89-god 's ' whosoever ' and , passing through the narrow gate , enter [the Kingdom of Heaven]5829-the kingdom of heaven as [little children]5830-little children . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop rose , and giving [his]4673-the bishop hand to [the Prioress]373-the prioress raised [her]373-the prioress to [her]373-the prioress feet .

" [[My]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord , "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress said , " as ever [you]4673-the bishop are most kind to [me]373-the prioress . Yet [I]373-the prioress fear [you]4673-the bishop have been too lenient for [my]373-the prioress own peace of mind . To have destroyed in anger the mandate of [[His]4673-the bishop Holiness]5400-his holiness "[373-the prioress]

" Nay , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " The mandate of [[His]4673-the bishop Holiness]5400-his holiness , inscribed upon parchment , from which hangs the great seal of [the Vatican]5450-the vatican , is safely placed among [my]4673-the bishop most precious documents . [You]4891-my daughter have but destroyed the result of an hour 's careful work . [I]4673-the bishop rose betimes this morning to make this copy . [I]4673-the bishop should not have allowed [you]4891-my daughter to tear it , had not the writing been [my]4673-the bishop own . But [I]4673-the bishop took pains to reproduce exactly the peculiar style of lettering [they]5836-they use in [Rome]37-rome , and [you]4891-my daughter will do the same in [your]4891-my daughter copy . "[4673-the bishop]

Turning , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop knelt for a few moments in prayer before [the Madonna]146-the madonna . [He]4673-the bishop could not have explained why , but somehow the only hope for [Hugh]132-hugh seemed to be connected with this spot .

Yet it was hardly reassuring that , when [he]4673-the bishop lifted grave and anxious eyes , [[our]1901-our Lady]4260-our lady gently smiled , and [the sweet Babe]1903-the sweet babe looked merry .

Rising , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop turned , with unwonted sternness , to [the Prioress]373-the prioress .

" Remember , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " [Hugh]132-hugh rides away to - morrow night ; rides away , never to return . "[4673-the bishop]

[Her]373-the prioress steadfast eyes did not falter .

" [He]132-hugh had better have ridden away five days ago , [[my]373-the prioress lord]4881-my lord . [He]132-hugh had [my]373-the prioress answer , and [I]373-the prioress bade [him]132-hugh go . By staying [he]132-hugh has but prolonged [his]132-hugh suspense and [my]373-the prioress pain . "[373-the prioress]

" Yes , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop slowly , " [he]132-hugh had better have ridden away ; or , better still , have never come upon this fruitless quest . "[4673-the bishop]

[He]4673-the bishop moved toward the door .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress reached it before [him]4673-the bishop .

With [her]91-mother sub - prioress hand upon the latch : " [Your]4673-the bishop blessing , [Reverend Father]4875-reverend father , "[373-the prioress] entreated [the Prioress]373-the prioress , rather breathlessly .

" Benedicite , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , with uplifted fingers , but with eyes averted ; and passed out .

CHAPTER XXVIII

[THE WHITE STONE

Old Mary Antony]103-mary antony was at the gate , when [the Bishop]4673-the bishop rode out from [the courtyard]775-the courtyard .

Thrusting [the porteress]4960-the porteress aside , [she]103-mary antony pressed forward , standing with anxious face uplifted , as [the Bishop]4673-the bishop approached .

[He]4673-the bishop reined in [Icon]174-icon , and , bending from the saddle , murmured : " Take care of [her]4960-the porteress , [Sister Antony]85-mary antony . [I]4673-the bishop have left [her]4960-the porteress in some distress . "[4673-the bishop]

" Hath [she]4960-the porteress decided aright ? "[264-the old lay - sister] whispered [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister .

" [She]4960-the porteress always decides aright , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " But [she]4960-the porteress is so made that [she]4960-the porteress will thrust happiness from [her]4960-the porteress with both hands unless [[our]5839-our Lady]4260-our lady should [herself]4960-the porteress offer it , by vision or revelation . [I]4673-the bishop could wish [[thy]4960-the porteress gay little [Knight of the Bloody Vest]194-knight of the bloody vest]5841-thy gay little knight of the bloody vest might indeed fly with [her]4960-the porteress to [his]194-knight of the bloody vest nest and teach [her]4960-the porteress a few sweet lessons , in the green privacy of [some leafy paradise]5842-some leafy paradise . But [I]4673-the bishop tell [thee]4960-the porteress too much , [worthy Mother]91-mother sub - prioress . Keep a silent tongue in that shrewd old head of thine . [Minister]5843-minister to [her]4960-the porteress ; and send word to [me]4673-the bishop if [I]4673-the bishop am needed . Benedicite . "[4673-the bishop]

An hour later , mounted upon [his]1915-he black mare , [Shulamite]173-shulamite , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop rode to [the high ground]1917-the high ground , on [the north - east]1918-the north - east , above [the city]1177-the city , from whence [he]1915-he could look down upon [the river meadow]5045-the river meadow .

As [he]1915-he had done on the previous day , [he]1915-he watched [the Prioress]373-the prioress riding upon [Icon]174-icon . Once [she]373-the prioress put the horse to so sudden and swift a gallop that [the Bishop , watching from afar]1922-the bishop , watching from afar , reined back [Shulamite]173-shulamite almost on to [her]173-shulamite haunches , in a sudden fear that [Icon]174-icon was about to leap into [the stream]5416-the stream .

For an hour [the Prioress]373-the prioress rode , with flying veil , white on the white steed ; a fair marble group , quickened into motion .

Then , that penance being duly performed , [she]373-the prioress vanished through the archway .

Turning [Shulamite]173-shulamite , [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester rode slowly down [the hill]1925-the hill , passed southward , and entered [the city]1177-the city by [[Friar]195-friar 's Gate]1927-friar 's gate ; and so to [the Palace]1309-the palace , where [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent waited .

[The Bishop]92-bishop led [him]154-symon of worcester , through [a postern]1929-a postern , into [the garden]358-the garden ; and there on [a wide lawn]1931-a wide lawn , out of earshot of [any possible listeners]1932-any possible listeners , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop and [the Knight]764-the knight walked up and down in earnest conversation .

At length : " To - morrow , in the early morn , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , " [I]764-the knight send [[her]373-the prioress tire - woman]5844-her tire - woman on to [Warwick]32-warwick , with all [her]373-the prioress effects , keeping back only the riding suit . Should [she]373-the prioress elect to come , [we]5845-our must be free to ride without drawing rein . Even so [we]5845-our shall reach [Warwick]32-warwick only something before midnight . "[764-the knight]

" [She]373-the prioress tore it up and planted [her]373-the prioress foot upon it , "[4673-the bishop] remarked [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" [I]764-the knight will not give up hope , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight .

" Nothing short of a miracle , [[my]764-the knight son]5057-my son , will change [her]373-the prioress mind , or move [her]373-the prioress from [her]373-the prioress fixed resolve . "[764-the knight]

" Then [[our]5845-our Lady]4260-our lady will work a miracle , "[764-the knight] declared [the Knight]764-the knight bravely . " [I]764-the knight prayed ' Send [her]373-the prioress to [me]764-the knight ! ' and [[our]5845-our blessed [Lady]5849-lady]4297-our blessed lady smiled . "[764-the knight]

" A sculptured smile , [dear lad]5112-dear lad , is ever there . Had [you]764-the knight prayed ' Hold [her]373-the prioress from [me]764-the knight ! ' [[our]5845-our Lady]4260-our lady would equally have smiled . "[764-the knight]

" Nay , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight ; " [I]764-the knight keep [my]764-the knight trust in prayer . "[764-the knight]

[They]1940-they paused at the parapet overhanging [the river]1941-the river .

" [I]764-the knight was successful , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , " in dealing with [Eustace]187-earl eustace de norelle , [[her]4260-our lady nephew]5852-her nephew . There will be no need to apply to [the King]4555-the king . The ambition was [[his]187-earl eustace de norelle mother]1063-his mother 's . Now [Eleanor]138-eleanor is dead , [he]187-earl eustace de norelle cares not for [the Castle]5855-the castle . Next month [he]187-earl eustace de norelle weds [an heiress]5856-an heiress , with large estates , and has no wish to lay claim to [[Mora]144-mora 's home]5857-mora 's home . All is now once more as it was when [she]4260-our lady left [it]5857-mora 's home . [[Her]4260-our lady own people]5858-her own people are in charge . [I]764-the knight plan to take [her]4260-our lady [there]333-there when [we]5860-we leave [Warwick]32-warwick , riding northward by easy stages . "[764-the knight]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop , stooping , picked up a smooth , white stone , and flung it into [the river]1941-the river . It fell with a splash , and sank . The water closed upon it . It had vanished instantly from view .

Then [the Bishop]4673-the bishop spoke . " [Hugh]132-hugh , [[my]4673-the bishop dear lad]5861-my dear lad , [she]4260-our lady thought it was [the Pope]5391-the pope 's own deed and signature , yet [she]4260-our lady tore it across , and then again across ; flung it upon the ground , and set [her]4260-our lady foot upon it . [I]4673-the bishop deem it now as impossible that [the Prioress]373-the prioress should change [her]4260-our lady mind upon this matter , as that [we]5864-we should ever see again that stone which now lies deep on [the river - bed]5865-the river - bed . "[4673-the bishop]

It was a high dive from the parapet ; and , to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , watching the spot where [the Knight]764-the knight cleft [the water]1948-the water , the moments seemed hours .

But when [the Knight]764-the knight reappeared , the white stone was in [his]764-the knight hand .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop went down to the water - gate .

" Bravely done , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son ! "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop called , as [the Knight]764-the knight swam to the steps . " [You]764-the knight deserve to win . "[4673-the bishop] But to [himself]4673-the bishop [he]4673-the bishop said : " [Fighting men]5867-fighting men and [quick - witted women]5868-quick - witted women will be ever with [us]5869-us , gaining [their]5867-fighting men ends by strenuous endeavour . But the age of miracles is past . "[4673-the bishop]

[Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh mounted the steps .

" [I]132-hugh shall win , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh said , and shook [himself]132-hugh like a great shaggy dog .

[The Bishop , over whom fell a shower]1952-the bishop , over whom fell a shower , carefully wiped the glistening drops from [his]4673-the bishop garments with a fine Italian handkerchief .

" Go in , [boy]5442-boy , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " and get dry . Send [[thy]4673-the bishop man]5871-thy man for another suit , unless it would please [thee]4673-the bishop better that [Father Benedict]180-father benedict should lend [thee]4673-the bishop a cassock ! Give [me]4673-the bishop the stone . It may well serve as a reminder of that famous sacred stone from which [the Convent]328-the convent takes [its]328-the convent name . Methinks [we]5873-us have , between [us]5873-us , contrived something of an omen , concluding in [thy]4673-the bishop favour . "[4673-the bishop]

Presently [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , alone in [[his]4673-the bishop library]1954-his library , stood the white stone upon the iron - bound chest within which [he]4673-the bishop had placed [the Pope]5391-the pope 's mandate .

" The age of miracles is past , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said again . " Iron no longer swims , neither do stones rise from the depths of [a river]5874-a river , unless the Divine command be supplemented by the grip of strong human fingers .[4673-the bishop]

" Stand there , [thou]5875-thou little tombstone of [our]5873-us hopes . Mark [the place where lies [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father 's mandate]5876-the place where lies the holy father 's mandate , ecclesiastically all - powerful , yet rendered null and void by the faithful conscience and the firm will of [a woman]813-a woman . [God]89-god send [us]5873-us [more such women]5879-more such women ! "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop sounded a silver gong , and when [[his]4673-the bishop body - servant]1957-his body - servant appeared , pointed to the handkerchief , damp and crumpled , upon the table .

" Dry this , [Jasper]196-jasper , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " and bring [me]4673-the bishop another somewhat larger . These dainty trifles can not serve , when ' tears run down like a river . ' Nay , look not distressed , [[my]4673-the bishop good fellow]5880-my good fellow . [I]4673-the bishop do but jest . [Yonder wet Knight]197-yonder wet knight hath given [me]4673-the bishop a shower - bath . "[4673-the bishop] CHAPTER XXIX

THE VISION OF [MARY ANTONY]85-mary antony

On the afternoon following [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's unexpected visit to [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery , [the Prioress]373-the prioress elected to walk last in the procession to and from [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral , placing [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress first . It was [her]373-the prioress custom occasionally to vary the order of procession . Sometimes [she]373-the prioress walked thirteenth , with twelve before , and twelve behind [her]373-the prioress .

[She]373-the prioress had at first inclined on this day , after [her]373-the prioress strenuous time with [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , followed by the hour 's ride upon [Icon]174-icon , not to go to Vespers . Then [her]373-the prioress heart failed [her]373-the prioress , and [she]373-the prioress went . On these two afternoons this and the morrow [Hugh]132-hugh would still be in [the crypt]273-the crypt . [She]373-the prioress should not so much as glance toward the pillar at the foot of the winding stairway leading to [the clerestory]5739-the clerestory ; yet it would be sweet to feel [him]132-hugh to be standing there as [she]373-the prioress passed ; sweet to know that [he]132-hugh heard the same sounds as fell upon [her]373-the prioress ear .

To - day , and again on the morrow , [she]373-the prioress might yield to this yearning for the comfort of [his]132-hugh nearness ; but never again , for [Hugh]132-hugh would not return .

[She]373-the prioress had wondered whether [she]373-the prioress dared ask [him]132-hugh , by [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , on a given date once a year to attend High Mass in [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral , so that [she]373-the prioress might know [him]132-hugh to be under the same roof , worshipping , at the same moment , the same blessed manifestation of the Divine Presence .

But almost at once [she]373-the prioress had dismissed the desire , realising that comfort such as this , could be comfort but to the heart of [a woman]813-a woman , more likely torment to [a man]4482-a man . Also that should [his]132-hugh fancy incline [him]132-hugh to seek companionship and consolation in the love of [another]1284-another , a yearly pilgrimage to [Worcester]1-worcester for [her]1284-another sake , would stand in the way of [his]132-hugh future happiness .

Walking last in that silent procession back to [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery , [the Prioress]373-the prioress walked alone with [her]373-the prioress sadness . [Her]373-the prioress heart was heavy indeed .

[She]373-the prioress had angered [[her]373-the prioress old friend]1972-her old friend , [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester . After being infinitely patient , when [he]1972-her old friend might well have had cause for wrath , [he]1972-her old friend had suddenly taken a sterner tone , and departed in a certain aloofness , leaving [her]373-the prioress with the fear that [she]373-the prioress had lost [him]132-hugh , also , beyond recall .

Thus [she]373-the prioress walked in loneliness and sorrow .

As [she]373-the prioress passed up the steps into [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , [she]373-the prioress noted that [Mary Antony]85-mary antony was not in [[her]85-mary antony accustomed place]1974-her accustomed place .

Slightly wondering , and half unconsciously explaining to [herself]373-the prioress that [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister had probably for some reason gone forward with [the Sub - Prioress]419-the sub - prioress , [the Prioress]373-the prioress moved down [the now empty passage]1978-the now empty passage and entered [[her]373-the prioress own cell]287-her own cell .

On the threshold [she]373-the prioress paused , astonished .

In front of [the shrine of the Madonna]485-the shrine of the madonna , knelt [Mary Antony]85-mary antony in a kind of trance , hands clasped , eyes fixed , lips parted , the colour gone from [her]85-mary antony cheeks , yet a radiance upon [her]85-mary antony face , like the after - glow of a vision of exceeding glory .

[She]85-mary antony appeared to be wholly unconscious of the presence of [the Prioress]373-the prioress , who recovering from [her]373-the prioress first astonishment , closed the door , and coming forward laid [her]373-the prioress hand gently upon [the old woman]430-the old woman 's shoulder .

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's eyes remained fixed , but [her]85-mary antony lips moved incessantly . Bending over [her]85-mary antony , [the Prioress]373-the prioress could make out disjointed sentences . " Gone ! . . . But it was at [[our]5881-our Lady]4260-our lady 's bidding . . . . [Flown]198-flown ? Ah , [gay little Knight of the Bloody Vest]5883-gay little knight of the bloody vest ! Nay , it must have been [the archangel Gabriel]5884-the archangel gabriel , or maybe [Saint George]199-saint george , in shining armour . . . . How shall [we]5881-our live without [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother ? But the will of [[our]5881-our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady must be done . "[373-the prioress]

" [Antony]85-mary antony ! "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress . " Wake up , dear [Antony]85-mary antony ! [You]85-mary antony are dreaming again . [You]85-mary antony are thinking of the robin and the pea . [I]373-the prioress have not gone from [you]85-mary antony ; nor am [I]373-the prioress going . See ! [I]373-the prioress am here . "[373-the prioress]

[She]373-the prioress turned the old face about , and brought [herself]373-the prioress into [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's field of vision .

Slowly a light of recognition dawned in those fixed eyes ; then came a cry , as of fear and of a great dismay ; then a gasping sound , a clutching of the air . [Mary Antony]85-mary antony had fallen prone , before [the shrine of the Madonna]485-the shrine of the madonna .

An hour later [she]85-mary antony lay upon [her]85-mary antony bed , whither [they]1986-they had carried [her]85-mary antony . [She]85-mary antony had recovered consciousness , and partaken of wine and bread .

The colour had returned to [her]85-mary antony cheeks , when [the Prioress]373-the prioress came in , dismissed [the lay - sister]337-the lay - sister in attendance , closed the door , and sat down beside the couch .

" [Thou]85-mary antony art better , dear [Antony]85-mary antony , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress . " [They]1986-they tell [me]373-the prioress [thy]85-mary antony strength has returned , and this strange fainting is over . [Thou]85-mary antony must lie still yet awhile ; but will it weary [thee]85-mary antony to speak ? "[373-the prioress]

" Nay , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , [I]373-the prioress should dearly love to speak . [My]373-the prioress soul is full of wonder ; yet to none saving to [you]93-the reverend mother , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , can [I]373-the prioress tell of that which [I]373-the prioress have seen . "[373-the prioress]

" Tell [me]373-the prioress all , [dear Antony]85-mary antony , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress . " [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca says [thy]85-mary antony symptoms point to a Divine Vision . "[373-the prioress]

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony chuckled . " For once [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca speaks the truth , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony said . " Have patience with [me]85-mary antony , [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , and [I]85-mary antony will tell [you]85-mary antony all . "[85-mary antony]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress gently stroked the worn hands lying outside the coverlet .

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony looked very old in bed . Were it not for the bright twinkling eyes , [she]85-mary antony looked too old ever again to stand upon [her]85-mary antony feet . Yet how [she]85-mary antony still bustled upon those same old feet ! How diligently [she]85-mary antony performed [her]85-mary antony own duties , and shewed to [the other lay - sisters]1992-the other lay - sisters how [they]1992-the other lay - sisters should have performed [theirs]1992-the other lay - sisters !

Forty years ago , [she]85-mary antony had chosen [[her]85-mary antony nook in [the Convent burying - ground]309-the convent burying - ground]1993-her nook in the convent burying - ground . [She]85-mary antony was even then , among [the older members of [the Community]483-the community]1995-the older members of the community ; yet [most of those who saw [her]85-mary antony choose it]1997-most of those who saw her choose it , now lay in [their]1997-most of those who saw her choose it own .

" [She]85-mary antony will outlive [us]5887-us all , "[91-mother sub - prioress] said [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress one day , sourly ; angered by some trick of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's .

" [She]85-mary antony is like an ancient parrot , "[90-sister mary rebecca] cried [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , anxious to agree with [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress .

Which when [Mary Antony]85-mary antony heard , [she]90-sister mary rebecca chuckled , and snapped [her]90-sister mary rebecca fingers .

" Please [God]89-god , [I]90-sister mary rebecca shall live long enough , "[90-sister mary rebecca] [she]90-sister mary rebecca said , " to thrust [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress into a sackcloth shroud ; also , to crack nuts upon the sepulchre of [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca . "[90-sister mary rebecca]

But none of these remarks reached [the Prioress]373-the prioress . [She]85-mary antony loved [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , knowing [the aged body]2000-the aged body held a faithful and zealous heart , and a mind which , in its quaint simplicity , oft seemed to [the Prioress]373-the prioress like the mind of [a little child]4768-a little child and of such is [the Kingdom of Heaven]57-the kingdom of heaven .

" There is no need for patience , [dear Antony]85-mary antony , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress . " [I]373-the prioress can sit in stillness beside [thee]85-mary antony , until [thy]85-mary antony tale be fully told . Begin at the beginning . "[373-the prioress]

The slanting rays of the late afternoon sun , piercing through the narrow window , fell in a golden band of light upon the folded hands , lighting up the aged face with an almost unearthly radiance .

" [I]85-mary antony was in [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , "[85-mary antony] began [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , " awaiting the return from Vespers of [the holy Ladies]332-the holy ladies . "[85-mary antony] [I]0-i go there betimes , because at that hour [I]0-i am accustomed to hold converse with [a little vain man in a red jerkin , who comes to see [me]0-i , when [he]2004-a little vain man in a red jerkin , who comes to see me , when he knows me to be alone knows [me]0-i to be alone]2004-a little vain man in a red jerkin , who comes to see me , when he knows me to be alone . [I]0-i tell [him]2004-a little vain man in a red jerkin , who comes to see me , when he knows me to be alone tales such as [he]2004-a little vain man in a red jerkin , who comes to see me , when he knows me to be alone never hears elsewhere . To - day [I]0-i planned to tell [him]2004-a little vain man in a red jerkin , who comes to see me , when he knows me to be alone how [the great Lord Bishop]1748-the great lord bishop , arriving unannounced , rode into [the courtyard]775-the courtyard ; and , seeing [old Antony]85-mary antony standing in the doorway , mistook [her]85-mary antony for [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother . That was a great moment in the life of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , and confers upon [her]85-mary antony added dignity .

" ' So turn out [thy]85-mary antony toes , and make [thy]85-mary antony best bow , and behave [thee]85-mary antony as [a little layman]5890-a little layman should behave in the presence of one who hath been mistaken for one holding so high an office in [Holy Church]5891-holy church . '[1748-the great lord bishop]

" Thus , "[85-mary antony] explained [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , " had [I]85-mary antony planned to strike awe into the little red breast of that over - bold robin . "[85-mary antony]

" And came the robin to [the cloisters]316-the cloisters ? "[373-the prioress] inquired [the Prioress]373-the prioress , presently , for [Mary Antony]85-mary antony lay upon [her]85-mary antony pillow laughing to [herself]85-mary antony , nodding and bowing , and making [her]85-mary antony fingers hop to and fro on the coverlet , as a bird might hop with toes out turned . Nor would [she]85-mary antony be recalled at once to the happenings of the afternoon .

" [The great Lord Bishop]92-bishop did address [me]373-the prioress as ' [worthy Mother]5893-worthy mother , ' "[373-the prioress] [she]373-the prioress remarked ; " not ' [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , ' as [we]5894-our address [[our]5894-our noble Prioress]5895-our noble prioress . And this has given [me]373-the prioress much food for thought . Is it better to be worthy and not [reverend]5896-reverend , or [reverend]5896-reverend and not worthy ? [Our]5894-our large white sow , when [she]85-mary antony did contrive to have more little pigs in [her]85-mary antony litters , than ever [our]5894-our sows had before ; and , after a long and fruitful life , furnished [us]5894-our with two excellent hams , a boar 's head , and much bacon , was [a worthy sow]5898-a worthy sow ; but never was [she]85-mary antony reverend , not even when [Mother Sub - Prioress]324-mother sub - prioress pronounced the blessing over [her]85-mary antony face , much beautified by decoration grand ivory tusks , and a lemon in [her]85-mary antony mouth ! Never , in life , had [she]85-mary antony looked so fair ; which is indeed , [I]373-the prioress believe , the case with many . Yet , for all [her]85-mary antony worthiness , [she]85-mary antony was not [reverend]5896-reverend . Also [I]373-the prioress have heard tell of [a certain Prior]5901-a certain prior , not many miles from [here]4536-here , who , borrowing money , never repays it ; who oppresses [the poor]4220-the poor , driving [them]4220-the poor from the Priory gate ; who maltreats [the monks]4870-the monks , and is kind unto [none]315-none , saving unto [himself]5901-a certain prior . [He]5901-a certain prior it seems is [reverend]5896-reverend but not worthy . While [thou]5907-thou , [Master Redbreast]114-master redbreast , art certainly not [reverend]5896-reverend ; [the saints]4874-the saints , and [thine]5907-thou own conscience , alone know whether [thou]5907-thou art worthy .[373-the prioress]

" This , "[85-mary antony] explained [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , " was how [I]85-mary antony had planned to point a moral to that jaunty little worldling . "[85-mary antony]

" [They]5910-they who are [reverend]5896-reverend must strive to be also worthy , "[373-the prioress] said [the Prioress]373-the prioress ; " while [they]5910-they who count [themselves]5910-they to be worthy , must think charitably of those to whom [they]5910-they owe reverence . Came the robin to [thee]85-mary antony in [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , [Antony]85-mary antony ? "[373-the prioress]

[The old woman]430-the old woman 's manner changed . [She]430-the old woman fixed [her]430-the old woman eyes upon [the Prioress]373-the prioress , and spoke with an air of detachment and of mystery . The very simplicity of [her]430-the old woman language seemed at once to lift the strange tale [she]430-the old woman told , into sublimity .

" Aye , [he]5913-he came . But not for crumbs ; not for cheese ; not to gossip with [old Antony]85-mary antony .[430-the old woman]

" [He]5913-he stood upon the coping , looking at [me]430-the old woman with [his]5913-he bright eye .[430-the old woman]

" ' Well , [little vain man]5914-little vain man ! ' said [I.]430-the old woman But [he]5913-he moved not .[430-the old woman]

" ' Well , [Master Pieman]111-master pieman , ' [I]430-the old woman said , ' art come to spy on [holy ladies]5915-holy ladies ? ' But never a flutter , never a chirp , gave [he]5913-he .[430-the old woman]

" So grave and yet war - like was [his]5913-he aspect , that at length [I]430-the old woman said : ' Well , [Knight of the Bloody Vest]194-knight of the bloody vest ! Hast [thou]5913-he come to carry off again [[our]5916-our noble Prioress]5895-our noble prioress ? ' Upon which , instantly , [he]5913-he lifted up [his]5913-he voice , and burst into song ; then flew to the doorway , turning and chirping , as if asking [me]430-the old woman to follow .[430-the old woman]

" Greatly marvelling at this behaviour on the part of the little bird [I]430-the old woman love , [I]430-the old woman forthwith set out to follow [him]5913-he .[430-the old woman]

" Along [the passage]497-the passage , on swift wing , [he]5913-he flew ; in and out of [the empty cells]5919-the empty cells , as if in search of something . ' Then , while [I]430-the old woman was yet some little way behind , [he]5913-he vanished into [the [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's cell]428-the reverend mother 's cell , and came not forth again .[430-the old woman]

" Laughing to [myself]430-the old woman at such presumption , [I]430-the old woman followed , saying : ' [Ha]5921-ha , [thou]194-knight of the bloody vest [Knight of the Bloody Vest]4389-knight of the bloody vest ! What doest [thou]194-knight of the bloody vest there ? [The Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother is away . What seekest [thou]194-knight of the bloody vest in [[her]427-the reverend mother chamber]4322-her chamber , [Knight of the Bloody Vest]4389-knight of the bloody vest ? '[430-the old woman]

" But , reaching the doorway , at that moment , [I]430-the old woman found [myself]430-the old woman struck dumb by what [I]430-the old woman saw .[430-the old woman]

" [No robin]5926-no robin was there , but [a most splendid Knight]5927-a most splendid knight , in shining armour , kneeled upon [his]5927-a most splendid knight knees before the shrine of [[our]5928-our Lady]4260-our lady . A blood - red cross was on [his]5927-a most splendid knight breast . [His]5927-a most splendid knight dark head was uplifted . On [his]5927-a most splendid knight noble face was a look of pleading and of prayer .[430-the old woman]

" Marvelling , but unafraid , [I]430-the old woman crept in , and kneeled behind [that splendid Knight]5930-that splendid knight . The look of pleading upon [his]5927-a most splendid knight face , inclined [me]430-the old woman also to prayer . [His]5927-a most splendid knight lips moved , as [I]430-the old woman had seen at the first ; but while [I]430-the old woman stood upon [my]430-the old woman feet , [I]430-the old woman could hear no words . As soon as [I]430-the old woman too kneeled , [I]430-the old woman heard [the Knight]764-the knight saying : ' Give [her]4260-our lady to [me]430-the old woman ! Give [her]4260-our lady to [me]430-the old woman ! ' And at last : ' [Mother of [God]89-god]4434-mother of god , send [her]4260-our lady to [me]430-the old woman ! Take pity on a hungry heart , [a lonely home]893-a lonely home , [a desolate hearth]894-a desolate hearth , and send [her]4260-our lady to [me]430-the old woman ! ' "[430-the old woman]

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony paused , fixing [her]85-mary antony eyes upon the rosy strip of sky , seen through [her]85-mary antony narrow window . Absorbed in the recital of [her]85-mary antony vision , [she]85-mary antony appeared to have forgotten the presence of [the Prioress]373-the prioress . [She]85-mary antony paused ; and there was silence in [the cell]291-the cell , for [the Prioress]373-the prioress made no sound .

Presently the old voice went on , once more .

" When [the splendid Knight]5935-the splendid knight said : ' Send [her]4260-our lady to [me]85-mary antony , ' a most wondrous thing did happen .[85-mary antony]

" [Our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady , lifting [her]4297-our blessed lady head , looked toward the door . Then raising [her]4297-our blessed lady hand , [she]4297-our blessed lady beckoned .[85-mary antony]

" No sooner did [[our]5937-our Lady]4260-our lady beckon , than [I]85-mary antony heard steps coming along [the passage that passage which [I]85-mary antony knew to be empty]5939-the passage that passage which i knew to be empty . [The Knight]764-the knight heard them , also ; for [his]764-the knight heart began to beat so loudly that kneeling behind [I]85-mary antony could hear it .[85-mary antony]

" [[Our]5937-our blessed [Lady]5942-lady]4297-our blessed lady smiled .[85-mary antony]

" Then in through the doorway came [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , walking with [her]93-the reverend mother head held high , and sunlight in [her]93-the reverend mother eyes , as [I]85-mary antony have ofttimes seen [her]93-the reverend mother walk in [the garden]358-the garden in Springtime , when the birds are singing , and a scent of lilac is all around .[85-mary antony]

" [She]5942-lady did not see old [Mary Antony]85-mary antony ; but moving straight to where [the Knight]764-the knight was kneeling , kneeled down beside [him]764-the knight .[85-mary antony]

" Then [the splendid Knight]5935-the splendid knight did hold out [his]5935-the splendid knight hand . But [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's hands were clasped upon the cross at [her]5942-lady breast , and [she]5942-lady would not put [her]5942-lady hand into [the Knight]764-the knight 's ; but lifting [her]5942-lady eyes to [[our]5947-our Lady]4260-our lady [she]5942-lady said : ' [Holy Mother of God]89-god , except [thou]5949-thou [thyself]5949-thou send [me]85-mary antony to [him]764-the knight , [I]85-mary antony can not go . "[85-mary antony]

" And again [the Knight]764-the knight said : ' Give [her]4260-our lady to [me]85-mary antony ! Give [her]4260-our lady to [me]85-mary antony ! [Blessed Virgin]145-blessed virgin , give [her]4260-our lady to [me]85-mary antony ! ' "[85-mary antony] And the tears ran down the face of [old Antony]85-mary antony , because both those noble hearts were wrung with anguish . Yet only [the merry Babe]2015-the merry babe , peeping over the two bowed heads , saw that [old Antony]85-mary antony was there .

" Then a wondrous thing did happen .[85-mary antony]

" Stooping from [her]5942-lady marble throne [[our]5951-our Lady]4260-our lady leaned , and taking [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's hand in [hers]5942-lady , placed it [herself]5942-lady in the outstretched hand of [the Knight]764-the knight . "[85-mary antony] At once a sound like many chimes of silver bells filled the air , and a voice , so wonderful that [I]0-i did fall upon [my]0-i face to the floor , said :

" ' TAKE [HER]4260-our lady ; [SHE]4260-our lady HATH BEEN EVER THINE . [I]85-mary antony HAVE BUT KEPT [HER]4260-our lady FOR [THEE]145-blessed virgin . ' "[85-mary antony]

" When [I]85-mary antony lifted [my]85-mary antony head once more , [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother and [the splendid Knight]5935-the splendid knight had risen . [Heaven]142-heaven was in [their]5955-their eyes . [Her]4260-our lady hand was in [his]5935-the splendid knight . [His]5935-the splendid knight arm was around [her]4260-our lady .[85-mary antony]

" As [I]85-mary antony looked , [they]5955-their turned together , passed out through the doorway , and paced slowly down [the passage]497-the passage .[85-mary antony]

" [I]85-mary antony heard [their]5955-their steps growing fainter and yet more faint , until [they]5955-their reached [the cloisters]316-the cloisters . Then all was still . "[85-mary antony]

" Then [I]85-mary antony heard other steps arriving . [I]85-mary antony still kneeled on , fearful to move ; because those earthly steps were drowning the sound of the silver chimes which filled the air .[85-mary antony]

" Then why , then [I]85-mary antony saw [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , returned and returned alone .[85-mary antony]

" So [I]85-mary antony cried out , because [she]4260-our lady had left [that splendid Knight]5930-that splendid knight . And , as [I]85-mary antony cried , the silver bells fell silent , all grew dark around [me]85-mary antony , and [I]85-mary antony knew no more , until [I]85-mary antony woke up in [mine]85-mary antony own bed , tended by [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , and [Sister Teresa]113-sister teresa ; with [Abigail noisy hussy]99-sister abigail ! helping to fetch and carry .[85-mary antony]

" But when [I]85-mary antony close [mine]85-mary antony eyes Ah , then ! Yes , [I]85-mary antony hear again the sound of silver chimes . And some day [I]85-mary antony shall hear shall hear again that wondrous voice of voice of tenderness , which said : ' Take [her]85-mary antony , [she]85-mary antony hath been ever ever ' "[85-mary antony]

The old voice which had talked for so long a time , wavered , weakened , then of a sudden fell silent .

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony had dropped off to sleep .

Slowly [the Prioress]373-the prioress rose , feeling [her]373-the prioress way , as one blinded by too great a light .

[She]373-the prioress stood for some moments leaning against the doorpost , [her]373-the prioress hand upon the latch , watching the furrowed face upon the pillow , gently slumbering ; still illumined by a halo of sunset light .

Then [she]373-the prioress opened the door , and passed out ; closing it behind [her]373-the prioress .

As [the Prioress]373-the prioress closed the door , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony opened one eye .

Yea , verily ! [She]85-mary antony was alone !

[She]85-mary antony raised [herself]85-mary antony upon the couch , listening intently .

Far away in the distance , [she]85-mary antony fancied [she]85-mary antony could hear the door of [[the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother 's chamber]5660-the reverend mother 's chamber shut yes ! and the turning of the key within the lock .

Then [Mary Antony]85-mary antony arose , tottered over to the crucifix , and , falling on [her]85-mary antony knees , lifted clasped hands to [the dying Redeemer]5549-the dying redeemer .

" [O God]5960-o god , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony said , " full well [I]85-mary antony know that to lie concerning holy things doth damn the soul forever . But [the great Lord Bishop]1748-the great lord bishop said [she]1748-the great lord bishop would thrust happiness from [her]1748-the great lord bishop with both hands , unless [[our]5962-our Lady]4260-our lady vouchsafed a vision . Gladly will [I]85-mary antony bear the endless torments of hell fires , that [she]4260-our lady may know fulness of joy and pleasures for evermore . But , oh , [Son of [Mary]85-mary antony]5964-son of mary , by the sorrows of [[our]5962-our Lady]4260-our lady 's heart , by the yearnings of [her]4260-our lady love , [I]85-mary antony ask that once a year [I]85-mary antony may come out to sit just for one hour on [my]85-mary antony jasper seat , and see [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother walk , between [the great Lord Bishop]1748-the great lord bishop and [the splendid Knight]5935-the splendid knight , up the wide golden stair .
