And some day at last , [O Saviour Christ]200-christ , [I]85-mary antony ask it of [Thy]200-christ wounds , ' [Thy]200-christ dying love , [Thy]200-christ broken heart , may the sin of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony [her]85-mary antony great sin , [her]85-mary antony sin of thus lying about holy things be forgiven [her]85-mary antony , because because [she]103-mary antony loved "[85-mary antony]

[Old Mary Antony]103-mary antony fell forward on the stones . This time , [she]103-mary antony had really swooned .

It took the combined efforts of [Sister Teresa]113-sister teresa , [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , and [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , to bring [her]103-mary antony back once more to consciousness . It added to [their]2021-their anxiety that [they]2021-their could not call [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , [she]427-the reverend mother having already sent word that [she]427-the reverend mother would not come to the evening meal , and must not be disturbed , as [she]427-the reverend mother purposed passing the night in prayer and vigil .

CHAPTER XXX

THE HARDER PART

Dawn broke a silver rift in the purple sky and presently stole , in pearly light , through the oriel window . Upon [the Prioress]373-the prioress 's table , lay a beautifully executed copy of [the Pope]5391-the pope 's mandate . Beside it , carefully pieced together , the torn fragments of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's copy .

Also , open upon the table , lay the Gregorian Sacramentary , and near to it strips of parchment upon which [the Prioress]373-the prioress had copied two of those ancient prayers , appending to each a careful translation .

These are the sixth century prayers which [the Prioress]373-the prioress had found comfort in copying and translating , during the long hours of [her]373-the prioress vigil .

O God , [the Protector of all that trust in [Thee]2029-thee]2028-the protector of all that trust in thee , without Whom nothing is strong , nothing is holy ; Increase and multiply upon [us]2030-our [Thy]2029-thee mercy , that [Thou]2029-thee being [[our]2030-our ruler and guide]2031-our ruler and guide , [we]2030-our may so pass through things temporal , that [we]2030-our finally lose not the things eternal ; Grant this , [O heavenly Father]2032-o heavenly father , for [Jesus Christ]2033-jesus christ 's sake [[our]2030-our Lord]4256-our lord . Amen .

And on another strip of parchment :

O Lord , [we]2030-our beseech [Thee]2029-thee mercifully to receive the prayers of [[Thy]2029-thee people who call upon [Thee]2029-thee]2035-thy people who call upon thee ; and grant that [they]2035-thy people who call upon thee may both perceive and know what things [they]2035-thy people who call upon thee ought to do , and also may have grace and power faithfully to fulfil the same : through [Jesus Christ]2036-jesus christ [[our]2030-our Lord]4256-our lord . Amen .

Then , in that darkest hour before the dawn , [she]2038-she had opened the heavy clasps of an even older volume , and copied a short prayer from the Gelasian Sacramentary , under date A.D. 492 .

Lighten [our]2030-our darkness , [we]2030-our beseech [Thee]2029-thee O Lord , and [my]0-i [Thy]2029-thee great mercy defend [us]2030-our from all perils and dangers of this night ; for the love of [[Thy]2029-thee only Son]2039-thy only son , [[our]2030-our Saviour]2040-our saviour , [Jesus Christ]2041-jesus christ . Amen .

This appeared to have been copied last of all . The ink was still wet upon the parchment .

The candles had burned down to the sockets , and gone out . [The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress 's chair , pushed back from the table , was empty . As the dawn crept in , it discovered [her]2038-she kneeling before the shrine of [the Madonna]435-the madonna , absorbed in prayer and meditation .

[She]2038-she had not yet taken [her]2038-she final decision as to the future ; but [her]2038-she hesitation was now rather the slow , wondering , opening of the mind to accept an astounding fact , than any attempt to fight against it .

Not for one moment could [she]2038-she doubt that [[our]2030-our Lady]4260-our lady , in answer to [Hugh]132-hugh 's impassioned prayers , had chosen to make plain the Divine will , by means of this wonderful and most explicit vision to [the aged lay - sister]2044-the aged lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony .

When , having left [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , as [she]2038-she supposed , asleep , [the Prioress]373-the prioress had reached [[her]373-the prioress own cell]287-her own cell , [her]373-the prioress first adoring cry , as [she]373-the prioress prostrated [herself]373-the prioress before [the shrine]1134-the shrine , had taken the form of the thanksgiving once offered by [the Saviour]2048-the saviour : " [I]373-the prioress thank [Thee]2048-the saviour , [O Father]5968-o father , [Lord of [Heaven and earth]5970-heaven and earth]5969-lord of heaven and earth , that [Thou]2048-the saviour hast hid these things from [the wise and prudent]5971-the wise and prudent , and hast revealed them unto babes . "[373-the prioress]

[She]373-the prioress and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had indeed been wise and prudent in [their]2050-their own estimation , as [they]2050-their discussed this difficult problem . Yet to [them]2050-their no clear light , no Divine vision , had been vouchsafed .

It was to [this aged nun]2051-this aged nun , the most simple so thought [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress the most humble , [the most childlike in [the community]483-the community]2052-the most childlike in the community , that the revelation had been given .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress remembered the nosegay of weeds offered to [[our]2055-our Lady]4260-our lady ; the games with peas ; the childish pleasure in the society of [the robin]339-the robin ; all the many indications that second - childhood had gently come at the close of the long life of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony ; just as the moon begins as a sickle turned one way and , after coming to the full , wanes at length to a sickle turned the other way ; so , after ninety years of life 's pilgrimage , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony was [a little child]4768-a little child again and of such is [the Kingdom of Heaven]5829-the kingdom of heaven ; and to such the Divine will is most easily revealed .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress was conscious that [she]373-the prioress and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop the wise and prudent had so completely arrived at decisions , along the lines of [their]2050-their own points of view , that [their]2050-their minds were not ready to receive a Divine unveiling . But the simple , childlike mind of [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , full only of humble faith and loving devotion , was ready ; and to [her]373-the prioress the manifestation came .

No shade of doubt as to the genuineness of the vision entered the mind of [the Prioress]373-the prioress . [She]373-the prioress and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop alone knew of [the Knight]764-the knight 's intrusion into [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery , and of [her]373-the prioress interview with [him]764-the knight in [[her]373-the prioress cell]321-her cell .

Before going in search of [the intruder]2068-the intruder , [she]373-the prioress had ordered [Mary Antony]85-mary antony to [the kitchens]4328-the kitchens ; and disobedience to a command of [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , was a thing undreamed of in [the Convent]328-the convent .

Afterwards , [her]373-the prioress anxiety lest any question should come up concerning the return of [a twenty - first White Lady]4471-a twenty - first white lady when but twenty had gone , was completely set at rest by that which had seemed to [her]373-the prioress old [Antony]85-mary antony 's fortunate mistake in believing [herself]373-the prioress to have been mistaken .

In recounting the fictitious vision , with an almost uncanny cleverness , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony had described [the Knight]764-the knight , not as [he]764-the knight had appeared in [[the Prioress]373-the prioress 's cell]1809-the prioress 's cell , in tunic and hose , a simple dress of velvet and cloth , but in full panoply as [a Knight - Crusader]2076-a knight - crusader . The shining armour and the blood - red cross , fully in keeping with the vision , would have precluded the idea of an eye - witness of the actual scene , had such a thought unconsciously suggested itself to [the Prioress]373-the prioress .

As it was , it seemed beyond question that all the knowledge of [Hugh]132-hugh shewn by [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , of [his]132-hugh person [his]132-hugh attitude , [his]132-hugh very words , could have come to [her]373-the prioress by Divine revelation alone . That being so , how could [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress presume to doubt the climax of the vision , when [our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady placed [her]4297-our blessed lady hand in [Hugh]132-hugh 's , uttering the wondrous words : " Take [her]373-the prioress . [She]373-the prioress hath been ever thine . [I]4297-our blessed lady have but kept [her]373-the prioress for [thee]5972-thee . "[4297-our blessed lady]

Over and over [the Prioress]373-the prioress repeated these words ; over and over [she]373-the prioress thanked [[our]2081-our Lady]4260-our lady for having vouchsafed so explicit a revelation . Yet was [she]373-the prioress distressed that [her]373-the prioress inmost spirit failed to respond , acclaiming the words as divine . [She]373-the prioress knew they must be divine , yet could not feel that they were so .

As dawn crept into [the cell]291-the cell , [she]373-the prioress found [herself]373-the prioress repeating again and again " A sign , a sign ! [Thy]5973-thy will was hid from [me]373-the prioress ; yet [I]373-the prioress accept its revelation through this babe . But [I]373-the prioress ask a sign which shall speak to [mine]373-the prioress own heart , also ! A sign , a sign ! "[373-the prioress]

[She]373-the prioress rose and opened wide the casement , not of the oriel window , but of one to the right of [the group of [the Virgin and child]616-the virgin and child]2084-the group of the virgin and child , and near by it .

[She]373-the prioress was worn out both in mind and body , yet could not bring [herself]373-the prioress to leave [the shrine]1134-the shrine or to seek [her]373-the prioress couch .

[She]373-the prioress remembered the example of [that reverend and holy man]2087-that reverend and holy man , [Bishop Wulstan]201-bishop wulstan . [She]373-the prioress had lately been reading , in the Chronicles of [Florence]202-florence , [the monk of [Worcester]1-worcester]2088-the monk of worcester , how " in [his]201-bishop wulstan early life , when appointed to be [chanter]5974-chanter and [treasurer of the Church]5975-treasurer of the church , [Wulstan]201-bishop wulstan embraced the opportunity of serving [God]89-god with less restraint , giving [himself]201-bishop wulstan up to a contemplative life , going into [the church]4592-the church day and night to pray and read the Bible . So devoted was [he]201-bishop wulstan to sacred vigils that not only would [he]201-bishop wulstan keep [himself]201-bishop wulstan awake during the night , but day and night also ; and when the urgency of nature at last compelled [him]201-bishop wulstan to sleep , [he]201-bishop wulstan did not pamper [his]201-bishop wulstan limbs by resting on a bed or coverings , but would lie down for a short time on one of the benches of [the Church]4592-the church , resting [his]201-bishop wulstan head on the book which [he]201-bishop wulstan had used for praying or reading . "[202-florence]

[The Prioress]373-the prioress chanced to have read this passage aloud , in [the Refectory]4794-the refectory , two days before .

As [she]373-the prioress stood in the dawn light , overcome with sleep , yet unwilling to leave [her]373-the prioress vigil at [the shrine]1134-the shrine , [she]373-the prioress remembered the example of [this greatly revered Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]2092-this greatly revered bishop of worcester , " [a man of great piety and dovelike simplicity]5978-a man of great piety and dovelike simplicity , one beloved of [God]89-god , and of the people whom [he]2092-this greatly revered bishop of worcester [ruled in all things , "[2092-this greatly revered bishop of worcester] dead just over a hundred years , yet ever living in the memory of all]5979-ruled in all things , " dead just over a hundred years , yet ever living in the memory of all .

So , remembering [his]2092-this greatly revered bishop of worcester example , [the Prioress]373-the prioress went to [her]373-the prioress table , and shutting the clasps of [her]373-the prioress treasured Gregorian Sacramentary , placed it on the floor before [the shrine of [the Virgin]608-the virgin]823-the shrine of the virgin .

Then , flinging [her]373-the prioress cloak upon the ground , and a silk covering over the book , [she]373-the prioress sank down , stretched [her]373-the prioress weary limbs upon the cloak and laid [her]373-the prioress head on [the Sacramentary]2096-the sacramentary , trusting that some of the many sacred prayers therein contained would pass into [her]373-the prioress mind while [she]373-the prioress slept .

Yet still [her]373-the prioress spirit cried : " A sign , a sign ! However slight , however small ; a sign [mine]373-the prioress own heart can understand . "[373-the prioress]

Whether [she]373-the prioress slept a few moments only or an hour , [she]373-the prioress could not tell . Yet [she]373-the prioress felt strangely rested , when [she]373-the prioress was awakened by the sound of a most heavenly song outpoured . It flooded [her]373-the prioress cell with liquid trills , as of little silver bells .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress opened [her]373-the prioress eyes , without stirring .

Sunlight streamed in through the open window ; and lo , upon the marble hand of [the Madonna]435-the madonna , that very hand which , in the vision , had taken [hers]435-the madonna and placed it within [Hugh]132-hugh 's , stood [[Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's robin]2099-mary antony 's robin , [that gay little Knight of the Bloody Vest]2100-that gay little knight of the bloody vest , pouring forth so wonderful a song of praise , and love , and fulness of joy , that it seemed as if [his]132-hugh little ruffling throat must burst with the rush of joyous melody .

[The robin]339-the robin sang . [Our Lady]4260-our lady smiled . [The Babe]438-the babe on [her]4260-our lady knees looked merry .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress lay watching , not daring to move ; [her]91-mother sub - prioress head resting on the Sacramentary . Then into [her]91-mother sub - prioress mind there came the suggestion of a test a sign .

" If [he]132-hugh fly around [the chamber]627-the chamber , "[91-mother sub - prioress] [she]91-mother sub - prioress whispered , " [my]91-mother sub - prioress place is [here]4536-here . But if [he]132-hugh fly straight out into the open , then doth [[our]2104-our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady bid [me]91-mother sub - prioress also to arise and go . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

And , scarce had [she]91-mother sub - prioress so thought , when , with a last triumphant trill of joy , straight from [[our]2104-our Lady]4260-our lady 's hand , like an arrow from the bow , the robin shot through the open casement , and out into [the sunny , newly - awakened world beyond]2106-the sunny , newly - awakened world beyond .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress rose , folded [her]373-the prioress cloak , placed the book back upon the table ; then kneeled before the shrine , took off [her]373-the prioress cross of office , and laid it upon [[our]2104-our Lady]4260-our lady 's hand , from whence the little bird had flown .

Then with bowed head , pale face , hands meekly crossed upon [her]373-the prioress breast , [the Prioress]373-the prioress knelt long in prayer .

The breeze of an early summer morn , blew in at the open window , and fanned [her]373-the prioress cheek .

In [the garden without]2110-the garden without , [the robin]339-the robin sang to [[his]339-the robin mate]4424-his mate .

At length [the Prioress]373-the prioress rose , moving as [one who walked in a strange dream , passed into [the inner cell]618-the inner cell , and sought [her]373-the prioress couch]2114-one who walked in a strange dream , passed into the inner cell , and sought her couch .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop 's prayer had been answered .

[The Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress had been given grace and strength to choose the harder part , believing the harder part to be , in very deed , [God]89-god 's will for [her]91-mother sub - prioress .

And , as [she]91-mother sub - prioress laid [her]91-mother sub - prioress head at last upon the pillow , a prayer from the Gregorian Sacramentary slipped into [her]91-mother sub - prioress mind , calming [her]91-mother sub - prioress to sleep , with its message of overruling power and eternal peace .

Almighty and everlasting [God]89-god , Who dost govern all things in [heaven and earth]5970-heaven and earth ; Mercifully bear the supplications of [[Thy]2118-thy people]2119-thy people , and grant [us]2120-our [Thy]2118-thy peace , all the days of [our]2120-our life ; through [Jesus Christ]2121-jesus christ [[our]2120-our Lord]4256-our lord . Amen .

CHAPTER XXXI

THE CALL OF THE CURLEW

For the last time , [the Knight]764-the knight waited in [the crypt]273-the crypt .

[The men - at - arms]773-the men - at - arms , having deposited [their]773-the men - at - arms burden before the altar , leaned each against a pillar , stolid and unobservant , but ready to drop to [their]773-the men - at - arms knees so soon as the chanting of Vespers should reach [the crypt]273-the crypt from [the choir above]2127-the choir above .

[The man upon the stretcher]1111-the man upon the stretcher lay motionless , with bandaged head ; yet there was an alert brightness in [his]1111-the man upon the stretcher eyes , and the turn of [his]1111-the man upon the stretcher head betokened [one who listened]2129-one who listened . A cloak of dark blue , bordered with silver , covered [him]1111-the man upon the stretcher , as a pall .

[Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent stood in the shadow of a pillar facing the narrow archway in the wall from which the winding stairs led up to [the clerestory]5739-the clerestory .

From this position [he]132-hugh could also command a view of the steps leading up into [the crypt]273-the crypt from the underground way , and of the ground to be traversed by [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies as [they]288-the white ladies passed from the steps to the staircase in the wall .

Here [the Knight]764-the knight kept [his]764-the knight final vigil .

A strange buoyancy possessed [him]764-the knight . [He]764-the knight seemed to have left [his]764-the knight despondence , like a heavy weight , at [the bottom of [the river]1941-the river]2134-the bottom of the river . From the moment when , [his]764-the knight breath almost exhausted , [he]764-the knight had seen and grasped [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's stone , bringing it in triumph to the surface , [Hugh]132-hugh had felt sure [he]764-the knight would win . Aye , even before [Symon]154-symon of worcester had flung the stone ; when , in reply to the doubt cast by [him]764-the knight on [[our]2137-our Lady]4260-our lady 's smile , [the Knight]764-the knight had said : " [I]764-the knight keep [my]764-the knight trust in prayer , "[764-the knight] a joyous confidence had then and there awakened within [him]764-the knight . [He]764-the knight had stretched out the right hand of [his]764-the knight withered faith , and lo , it had proved strong and vital .

Yet as , in the heavy silence of [the crypt]273-the crypt , [he]764-the knight heard the turning of the key in the lock , [his]764-the knight heart stood still , and every emotion hung suspended , as [the first veiled figure shadowy and ghostlike]2141-the first veiled figure shadowy and ghostlike moved into view .

It was not [she]4260-our lady .

[The Knight]194-knight of the bloody vest 's pulses throbbed again . [His]764-the knight heart pounded violently as , keeping [their]2142-their measured distances , nine , ten , eleven , white figures passed .

Then twelfth : [a tall nun]2143-a tall nun , almost [her]2143-a tall nun height ; yet not [she]4260-our lady .

Then thirteenth : Oh , [blessed Virgin]2144-blessed virgin ! Oh , [saints of [God]89-god]2145-saints of god ! [Mora]144-mora ! [She]144-mora , [herself]144-mora . Never could [he]764-the knight fail to recognize [[her]144-mora carriage]2146-her carriage , the regal poise of [her]144-mora head . However veiled , however shrouded , [he]764-the knight could not be mistaken . It was [Mora]144-mora ; and that [she]144-mora should be walking in this central position meant that [she]144-mora might with comparative safety , step aside . Yet , even this

But , at that moment , passing [him]764-the knight , [she]144-mora turned [her]144-mora head , and for an instant [her]144-mora eyes met the eyes of [the Knight looking out from the shadows]2147-the knight looking out from the shadows .

Another moment and [she]144-mora had vanished up the winding stairway in the wall .

But that instant was enough . As [her]144-mora eyes met [his]764-the knight , [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent knew that [[his]132-hugh betrothed]4943-his betrothed was once more [his]132-hugh own .

[His]132-hugh heart ceased pounding ; [his]132-hugh pulses beat steadily .

The calm of a vast , glad certainty enfolded [him]132-hugh ; a joy beyond belief . Yet [he]132-hugh knew now that [he]132-hugh had been sure of it , ever since [he]132-hugh came up from the depths of [the Severn]58-the severn into the summer sunshine , grasping the white stone .

" [I]4870-the monks keep [my]4870-the monks trust in prayer . . . . Give [her]144-mora to [me]4870-the monks ! Give [her]144-mora to [me]4870-the monks ! [Blessed Virgin]145-blessed virgin , give [her]144-mora to [me]4870-the monks ! ' A sculptured smile ' ? Nay , [[my]4870-the monks lord]4881-my lord . [I]4870-the monks keep [my]4870-the monks trust in prayer ! "[4870-the monks] The solemn chanting of [the monks]4870-the monks , stole down from the distant choir . Vespers had begun . [The Knight]764-the knight strode to the altar , and knelt for some minutes , [his]764-the knight hands clasped upon the crossed hilt of [his]764-the knight sword .

Then [he]764-the knight rose , and spoke in low tones to [[his]764-the knight men - at - arms]2151-his men - at - arms .

" When a thrush calls , [you]2151-his men - at - arms will leave [the crypt]273-the crypt , and guard the entrance from without ; allowing [none]315-none , on any pretext , to pass within . When a blackbird whistles [you]2151-his men - at - arms will return , lift the stretcher , and pass with it , as heretofore , from [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral to [the hostel]5987-the hostel . "[764-the knight]

Next [the Knight]764-the knight , returning to the altar , bent over [the bandaged man upon the stretcher]2153-the bandaged man upon the stretcher .

" [Martin]133-martin , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , speaking very low , so that [[his]764-the knight trusted foster - brother]2154-his trusted foster - brother alone could hear [him]764-the knight . " All is well . [Our]5988-we pilgrimage is about to end , as [we]5988-we have hoped , in a great recovery and restoration . When the call of a curlew sounds , leap from the stretcher , leave the bandages beside it ; go to the entrance , guarding it from within ; but turn not [thy]2151-his men - at - arms head this way , until a blackbird whistles ; upon which lose [thyself]2151-his men - at - arms among the pillars , letting [no man]4683-no man see [thee]2151-his men - at - arms , until [we]5988-we have passed out . After which , make [thy]2151-his men - at - arms way out , as best [thou]2151-his men - at - arms canst , and join [me]764-the knight at [the hostel]5987-the hostel , entering by [the garden]358-the garden and window , without letting [thyself]2151-his men - at - arms be seen in [the courtyard]775-the courtyard . "[764-the knight]

The keen eyes below the bandage , smiled assent .

Stooping , [the Knight]764-the knight lifted the cloak , fastened it to [his]764-the knight left shoulder , and drew it around [him]764-the knight , holding the greater part of it in many folds in [his]764-the knight right hand . Then [he]764-the knight moved back into the shadow of the pillar .

Above , [the monks]4870-the monks sang Nunc Dimittis .

By and by the voices fell silent .

Vespers were over .

Careful , shuffling feet were coming down the stairs within the wall .

[One by one the white figures]2157-one by one the white figures reappeared .

[The Knight]764-the knight stood back , rigid , holding [his]764-the knight breath .

As [each nun]849-each nun stepped from the archway in the wall , on to the floor of [the crypt]273-the crypt , and moved toward the steps leading down to [the subterranean way]714-the subterranean way , [she]849-each nun passed from the view of [the nun]461-the nun following [her]849-each nun , who was still one turn up [the staircase]2163-the staircase . It was upon this [the Knight]764-the knight had counted , when [he]764-the knight laid [his]764-the knight plains .

Six Seven Eight [Blessed Saint Joseph]190-saint joseph ! How slowly [they]2165-they walked !

Nine Ten Eleven [The Knight]764-the knight gripped the cloak and moved a step further back into the shadow .

Twelve

Were all the pillars rocking ? Was [the great new Cathedral]2167-the great new cathedral coming down upon [his]764-the knight head ?

Thirteen

[The Prioress]373-the prioress was beside [him]764-the knight in the shadow .

[She]373-the prioress had stepped aside .

[The twelfth White Lady]2169-the twelfth white lady was moving on , [her]2169-the twelfth white lady back toward [them]2165-they .

[The fourteenth]2170-the fourteenth was shuffling down , but had not yet appeared .

[Hugh]132-hugh slipped [his]132-hugh left arm about [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , holding [her]91-mother sub - prioress close to [him]132-hugh ; then flung the folds of the cloak completely around [her]2169-the twelfth white lady , and over [his]132-hugh left shoulder , pressing [her]2169-the twelfth white lady head down upon [his]132-hugh breast .

Thus [they]2165-they stood , motionless ; [her]2169-the twelfth white lady face hidden , [his]132-hugh eyes bent upon the narrow archway in the wall .

[The fourteenth White Lady]2171-the fourteenth white lady appeared ; evidently noted a wider gap than [she]2169-the twelfth white lady expected between [herself]2169-the twelfth white lady and [the distant figure almost at the steps]2172-the distant figure almost at the steps , and hastened forward .

[The fifteenth]2173-the fifteenth also hastened .

[The sixteenth]2174-the sixteenth chanced to have taken the stairs more quickly and , appearing almost immediately , noticed no gap .

Seventeen Eighteen Nineteen Twenty [Not one]2175-not one had turned [her]2175-not one head in the direction of the pillar . [The procession]2176-the procession was moving , with stately tread , along its accustomed way .

A delicious sense of security enveloped [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent .

[The woman [he]132-hugh loved]876-the woman he loved was in [his]132-hugh arms ; [she]876-the woman he loved was [his]132-hugh to shield , to guard , to hold for evermore .

Twenty - one Twenty - two [She]876-the woman he loved had come to [him]132-hugh come to [him]132-hugh of [her]876-the woman he loved own free will . Holding [her]876-the woman he loved thus , [he]132-hugh remembered those wondrous moments at the entrance to [the crypt]273-the crypt . How hard it had been to loose [her]876-the woman he loved and leave [her]876-the woman he loved . Yet how glad [he]132-hugh now was that [he]132-hugh had done so .

Twenty - three Twenty - four When [all these white figures]2179-all these white figures are gone , [safely]2180-safely started on [their]2179-all these white figures mile - long walk , the door shut and locked behind [them]2179-all these white figures then [he]132-hugh will fold back the cloak , turn [her]876-the woman he loved sweet face up to [his]132-hugh , and lay [his]132-hugh lips on [hers]876-the woman he loved .

Twenty - five

Praise [the holy saints]2181-the holy saints ! The last ! But what [an old ferret]2182-an old ferret !

Yes ; [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress gave [the Knight]764-the knight a moment of alarm . [She]91-mother sub - prioress peered to right and left . Almost [she]91-mother sub - prioress saw the glint of the silver on the blue . Almost , yet not quite .

[Sniffing]203-sniffing , [she]91-mother sub - prioress passed on , walking as if [her]91-mother sub - prioress feet were angry , each with the other for being before it . [She]91-mother sub - prioress tweaked at [her]91-mother sub - prioress veil , as [she]91-mother sub - prioress turned and descended the steps .

[Hugh]132-hugh glowed and thrilled from head to foot .

At last !

Almost

The sound of a closing door .

Slowly a key turned , grated in the lock , and was withdrawn .

Then silence .

But at sound of the turning key , [the woman in [his]132-hugh arms]2184-the woman in his arms shivered , the slow , cold shudder of a soul in pain ; and suddenly [he]132-hugh knew that in coming to [him]132-hugh [she]2184-the woman in his arms had chosen that which now seemed to [her]2184-the woman in his arms the harder part .

With the first revulsion of feeling occasioned by this knowledge , came a strong impulse to put [her]2184-the woman in his arms from [him]132-hugh , to leap down [the stairway]2185-the stairway , force open the heavy door , thrust [her]2184-the woman in his arms into the passage leading to [[her]2184-the woman in his arms Nunnery]1181-her nunnery , and shut the door upon [her]2184-the woman in his arms ; then go out [himself]132-hugh into [the world]389-the world to seek , in one wild search , every possible form of sin and revelry .

But this ungoverned impulse lasted but for the moment in which [his]132-hugh passionate joy , recoiling upon [himself]132-hugh , struck [him]132-hugh a blinding , a bewildering blow .

In ten seconds [he]132-hugh had recovered . [His]132-hugh arms tightened more securely around [her]2184-the woman in his arms .

[She]2184-the woman in his arms had come to [him]132-hugh . Whatever complex emotions might now be stirring within [her]2184-the woman in his arms , this fact was beyond question . Also , [she]2184-the woman in his arms had come of [her]2184-the woman in his arms own free will . [The foot which had dared to stamp upon the torn fragments of the Pope]2188-the foot which had dared to stamp upon the torn fragments of the pope 's mandate , had , with an equal courage , stepped aside from the way of convention and had brought [her]2184-the woman in his arms within the compass of [his]132-hugh arms .

[He]132-hugh could not put [her]2184-the woman in his arms from [him]132-hugh . [She]2184-the woman in his arms was [his]132-hugh to hold and keep . But [she]2184-the woman in his arms was [his]132-hugh also to shield and guard ; aye , to shield not from outward dangers only , but from anything in [himself]132-hugh which might cause [her]2184-the woman in his arms pain or perplexity , thus making more difficult [her]2184-the woman in his arms noble act of self - surrender .

Words spoken by [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , in [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall , came back to [him]132-hugh with fuller significance .

A joy arose within [him]132-hugh , deeper far than the rapture of passion ; the joy of a faithful patience , of [a strong man]2191-a strong man 's mastery over the strongest thing in [himself]132-hugh , of [a lover]4976-a lover 's comprehension , by sure instinct , of that which no words , however clear and forcible , could have succeeded in making plain .

[His]132-hugh love arose , a kingly thing , crowned by [her]2184-the woman in his arms trust in [him]132-hugh .

As [he]132-hugh folded back the cloak , [he]132-hugh stood with eyes uplifted to the arched roof above [his]132-hugh head . And the vision [he]132-hugh saw , in the dim pearly light , was a vision of the Madonna in [[his]132-hugh home]5182-his home .

The shelter of the cloak removed , [the Prioress]373-the prioress looked around with startled eyes , full of an unspeakable shrinking ; then upward to the face of [[her]373-the prioress lover]762-her lover , and saw it transfigured by the light of holy purpose and of a great resolve .

But , even as [she]373-the prioress looked , [he]132-hugh took [his]132-hugh arm from about [her]373-the prioress , stepped a pace forward , leaving [her]373-the prioress in the shadow , and whistled thrice the Do - it - now call of the thrush .

Instantly [the men - at - arms]773-the men - at - arms leapt to [their]773-the men - at - arms feet , and making quickly for the entrance to [the Cathedral]35-the cathedral from [the crypt]273-the crypt , stood to hold it from without , against [all comers]2198-all comers .

As [their]773-the men - at - arms running feet rang on the steps , softly there sounded through [the crypt]273-the crypt the plaintive call of the curlew .

[The man lying upon the stretcher]2200-the man lying upon the stretcher rose , leaving [his]2200-the man lying upon the stretcher bandages behind ; and , without glancing to right or left , passed quickly in and out amongst the forest of columns , and was lost to view . The entrance [he]132-hugh had to guard from within , was out of sight of the altar . To all intents and purposes , [the two who still stood motionless in the shadow]2201-the two who still stood motionless in the shadow , were now alone .

Then [the Knight]764-the knight turned to [the Prioress]373-the prioress , took [her]373-the prioress right hand with [his]764-the knight left , and led [her]373-the prioress forward to the altar .

There [he]764-the knight loosed [her]373-the prioress hand as [they]773-the men - at - arms knelt side by side ; [he]764-the knight clasping [his]764-the knight upon the crossed hilt of [his]764-the knight sword ; [she]373-the prioress crossing [hers]373-the prioress upon [her]373-the prioress breast .

Presently [the Prioress]373-the prioress drew the marriage ring from the third finger of [her]373-the prioress left hand , and gave it to [the Knight]764-the knight .

Divining [her]373-the prioress desire , [he]764-the knight rose , laid the ring upon the altar , then knelt again .

Then rising , [he]764-the knight took the ring , kissed it reverently , and slipped it upon the little finger of [his]764-the knight own left hand .

The sad eyes of [the Prioress]373-the prioress , watching [him]764-the knight , said to this neither " yea "[373-the prioress] nor " nay . "[373-the prioress]

Rising [she]373-the prioress waited meekly to know [his]764-the knight will for [her]373-the prioress . [The Knight]764-the knight , the blue cloak over [his]764-the knight arm , turned to the stretcher , picked up the bandages , then , spoke , very low , without looking at [the Prioress]373-the prioress .

" Lay thyself down thereon , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said . " [I]764-the knight grieve to ask it of [thee]373-the prioress , [Mora]144-mora ; but there is no other way of taking [thee]373-the prioress hence , unobserved . "[764-the knight] [The Prioress]373-the prioress took two steps forward , and stood beside the stretcher .

It was many years since [she]373-the prioress had lain in any human presence . Standing , walking , sitting , kneeling , [she]373-the prioress had been seen by [the nuns]298-the nuns ; but lying never .

Though [her]373-the prioress cross of office and sacred ring were gone , [her]373-the prioress dignity and authority seemed still to belong to [her]373-the prioress while [she]373-the prioress stood , stately and tall , upon [her]373-the prioress feet .

[She]373-the prioress hesitated . The apologetic tone [the Knight]764-the knight had used , seemed warrant for [her]373-the prioress hesitancy , and rendered compliance more difficult .

Each moment it became more impossible to place [herself]373-the prioress upon the stretcher .

" Lie down , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , sternly .

At the curt word of command , [the Prioress]373-the prioress shuddered again ; but , without a word , [she]373-the prioress laid [herself]373-the prioress down upon the stretcher , closing [her]373-the prioress eyes , and crossing [her]373-the prioress hands upon [her]373-the prioress breast . So white [she]373-the prioress was , so still , so rigid ; as [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent , the bandages in [his]132-hugh hand , stood looking down upon [her]373-the prioress , [she]373-the prioress seemed the marble effigy of [a recumbent Prioress]2214-a recumbent prioress , graven upon [a tomb]2215-a tomb ; save that , as [the Knight looked upon that beautiful , proud face]2216-the knight looked upon that beautiful , proud face , two burning tears forced their way from beneath the closed lids and rolled helplessly down the pale cheeks .

[She]373-the prioress did not see the look of tender compunction , of adoring love , in [Hugh]132-hugh 's eyes . [Her]373-the prioress shame , [her]373-the prioress utter humiliation , seemed complete .

Not when [she]373-the prioress took off [her]373-the prioress jewelled cross , and placed it upon [[our]2217-our Lady]4260-our lady 's hand ; not when [she]373-the prioress stepped aside and allowed [herself]373-the prioress to be hidden by the cloak ; not even when [she]373-the prioress removed [her]373-the prioress ring and handed it to [Hugh]132-hugh , did [she]373-the prioress cease to be [Prioress of [the White Ladies of [Worcester]1-worcester]283-the white ladies of worcester]2219-prioress of the white ladies of worcester ; but when [she]373-the prioress laid [herself]373-the prioress down before [the shrine of [Saint Oswald]153-saint oswald]4857-the shrine of saint oswald , full length upon the stretcher , at [[her]373-the prioress lover]762-her lover 's feet .

[Hugh]132-hugh stooped , and hid the bandages beside [her]373-the prioress . [He]132-hugh could not bring [himself]132-hugh to touch or to disguise that lovely head . Instead , [he]132-hugh covered [her]373-the prioress completely with the cloak ; saying , in deep tones of infinite tenderness :

" [[Our]5993-our Lady]4260-our lady be with [thee]373-the prioress . It will not be for long . "[132-hugh]

Then , shrill through [the silent crypt]2223-the silent crypt , rang the dear call of the blackbird .

CHAPTER XXXII

A GREAT RECOVERY AND RESTORATION

[Symon]154-symon of worcester , [Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]1222-bishop of worcester , attended by [[his]154-symon of worcester Chaplain]1582-his chaplain , chanced to be walking through [the Precincts]1113-the precincts on [his]154-symon of worcester way from [the Priory]2227-the priory to [the Palace]1309-the palace , just as [the men - at - arms bearing the stretcher]2229-the men - at - arms bearing the stretcher came through the great door of [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral .

[Father Benedict]180-father benedict , cowled , and robed completely in black , a head and shoulders taller than [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , walked behind [him]154-symon of worcester , a somewhat sinister figure .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop stopped . " Precede [me]4673-the bishop to [the Palace]1309-the palace , [Father Benedict]180-father benedict , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " [I]4673-the bishop wish to have speech with [[yonder]5996-yonder Knight who , [I]4673-the bishop think , comes this way]194-knight of the bloody vest . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Chaplain]1334-the chaplain stood still , made deep obeisance , jerked [his]1334-the chaplain cowl more closely over [his]1334-the chaplain face , and strode away .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop waited , [a radiant figure , in the afternoon sunshine]2235-a radiant figure , in the afternoon sunshine . [His]4673-the bishop silken cassock , [his]4673-the bishop silvery hair , [his]4673-the bishop blue eyes , so vivid and searching , not only made a spot on which light concentrated , but almost seemed themselves to give forth light .

The steady tramp of [the men - at - arms]773-the men - at - arms drew nearer .

[Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent walked beside the stretcher , head erect , eyes shining , [his]132-hugh hand upon the hilt of [his]132-hugh sword .

When [the Bishop]4673-the bishop saw the face of [the Knight]764-the knight , [he]4673-the bishop moved to meet [the little procession]1112-the little procession as it approached .

[He]4673-the bishop held up [his]4673-the bishop hand , and [the men - at - arms]773-the men - at - arms halted .

" Good - day to [you]132-hugh , [Sir Hugh]132-hugh , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " Hath [your]132-hugh pilgrimage to [the shrine of [the blessed Saint [Oswald]153-saint oswald]1130-the blessed saint oswald worked the recovery [you]132-hugh hoped]5997-the shrine of the blessed saint oswald worked the recovery you hoped ? "[4673-the bishop]

" Aye , [[my]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , "[764-the knight] replied [the Knight]764-the knight , " a great recovery and restoration . [We]6000-we start for [Warwick]32-warwick in an hour 's time . "[764-the knight] " Wonderful ! "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " [[Our]6000-we Lady]4260-our lady and [the holy Saint]6002-the holy saint be praised ! But [you]132-hugh are wise to keep [the patient]6003-the patient well covered . However complete the restoration , great care is required at first , and over - exertion must be avoided . "[4673-the bishop]

" [Your]4673-the bishop blessing for [the patient]6003-the patient , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , uncovering .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop moved nearer . [He]4673-the bishop laid [his]4673-the bishop hand upon the form beneath the blue and silver cloak .

" Benedictio Domini sit vobiscum , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . Then added , in a lower tone : " Be not afraid , neither be [thou]6005-thou dismayed . . . . Go in peace . "[4673-the bishop]

[The two men who loved [the Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress]2246-the two men who loved the prioress , looked steadily at [one another]666-one another .

[The men - at - arms]773-the men - at - arms moved forward with [their]773-the men - at - arms burden .

[The Knight]764-the knight smiled as [he]764-the knight walked on beside [the stretcher]1119-the stretcher .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop hastened to [the Palace]1309-the palace .

It was [the Knight]764-the knight who had smiled , and there was glory in [his]764-the knight eyes , and triumph in the squaring of [his]764-the knight broad shoulders , the swing of [his]764-the knight stride , and the proud poise of [his]764-the knight head .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop was white to the lips . [His]4673-the bishop hands trembled as [he]4673-the bishop walked .

[He]4673-the bishop feared [he]4673-the bishop feared sorely this that [they]2246-the two men who loved the prioress had accomplished .

It was one thing to theorize , to speculate , to advise , when [the Prioress]373-the prioress was safe in [[her]373-the prioress Nunnery]1181-her nunnery . It was quite another , to know that [she]373-the prioress was being carried through [the streets of [Worcester]1-worcester]1108-the streets of worcester , helpless , upon a stretcher ; that when that blue pall was lifted , [she]373-the prioress would find [herself]373-the prioress in [a hostel]2258-a hostel , alone with [[her]373-the prioress lover]762-her lover , surrounded by [men]4397-men , not [a woman within call]2261-a woman within call .

The heart of [a nun]412-a nun was a thing well known to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , and [he]4673-the bishop trembled at thought of this , which [he]4673-the bishop had helped to bring about .

Also [he]4673-the bishop marvelled greatly that [the Prioress]373-the prioress should have changed [her]373-the prioress mind ; and [he]4673-the bishop sought in vain to conjecture the cause of that change .

Arrived in [the courtyard of [the Palace]1309-the palace]2265-the courtyard of the palace , [he]4673-the bishop called for [Brother Philip]160-brother philip .

" Saddle [me]4673-the bishop [Shulamite]173-shulamite , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " Also mount [Jasper]196-jasper on [[our]6006-our fastest nag]6007-our fastest nag , with saddle - bags . [We]6006-our ride to [Warwick]32-warwick ; and must start within a quarter of an hour . "[4673-the bishop]

A portion of that time [the Bishop]4673-the bishop spent writing in [the library]2268-the library .

When [he]4673-the bishop was mounted , [he]4673-the bishop stooped from the saddle and spoke to [Brother Philip]160-brother philip . " [Philip]160-brother philip , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " [a very noble lady]6008-a very noble lady , betrothed to [Sir Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh , has just arrived at [the Star hostel]5237-the star hostel , where for some days [he]132-hugh has awaited [her]6008-a very noble lady . [She]6008-a very noble lady rides with [the Knight]764-the knight forthwith to [Warwick]32-warwick , where [they]6006-our will join [me]4673-the bishop at [the Castle]59-the castle . It is [my]4673-the bishop wish to lend [Iconoklastes]169-iconoklastes to [the lady]5263-the lady . Therefore [I]4673-the bishop desire [thee]160-brother philip to saddle [the palfrey]5274-the palfrey precisely as [he]132-hugh was saddled when [he]132-hugh went to [the Convent of [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies]6013-the convent of the white ladies for [their]6006-our pleasuring and play . Lead [him]132-hugh , without delay , to [the hostel]5987-the hostel ; deliver [him]132-hugh over to [the men - at - arms of [Sir Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh]6016-the men - at - arms of sir hugh d'argent , and see that [they]6016-the men - at - arms of sir hugh d'argent hand this letter at once to [the Knight]764-the knight , that [he]132-hugh may give it to [[his]132-hugh lady]5043-his lady . Lose not a moment , [[my]4673-the bishop good [Philip]160-brother philip]6019-my good philip . Look to see [me]4673-the bishop return to - morrow . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop gathered up the reins , and started out , at a brisk pace , for [the Warwick road]2270-the warwick road .

The letter [he]4673-the bishop had intrusted to [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , sealed with [his]4673-the bishop own signet , was addressed to [Sir Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh . But within was written :

Will [the Countess of Norelle]2271-the countess of norelle be pleased to accept of the palfrey Iconoklastes as a marriage gift from [[her]2271-the countess of norelle old friend]1972-her old friend [Symon Wygorn]204-symon wygorn .

CHAPTER XXXIII

[MARY ANTONY HOLDS THE FORT

Mary Antony]2273-mary antony holds the fort mary antony awaited in [the cloisters]316-the cloisters the return of [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies from Vespers .

[The old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister was not in the mood for gay chatter to [the robin]339-the robin , nor even for quaint converse with [herself]264-the old lay - sister .

[She]264-the old lay - sister sat upon the stone seat , looking very frail , and wearing a wistful expression , quite unlike [her]264-the old lay - sister usual alert demeanour .

As [she]264-the old lay - sister sat , [she]264-the old lay - sister slowly dropped the twenty - five peas from [her]264-the old lay - sister right hand , to [her]264-the old lay - sister left , and back again .

A wonderful thing had happened on that afternoon , just before [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies set forth to [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral . [All]410-all were assembling in [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , when word arrived that [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother wished to speak , in [[her]427-the reverend mother cell]321-her cell , with [Sister Mary Antony]85-mary antony . Hastening thither [she]264-the old lay - sister found [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother standing , very white and silent , very calm and steadfast , looking out from the oriel window .

At first [she]427-the reverend mother did not turn ; and [Mary Antony]85-mary antony stood waiting , just within the doorway .

Then [she]427-the reverend mother turned , and said : " Ah , dear [Antony]85-mary antony ! "[427-the reverend mother] in tones which thrilled the heart of [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister .

" Come hither , [Antony]85-mary antony , "[427-the reverend mother] [she]427-the reverend mother said ; and even as [she]427-the reverend mother said it , moved to meet [her]264-the old lay - sister .

A few simple instructions [she]427-the reverend mother gave , concerning matters in [the Refectory]4794-the refectory and [kitchen]2287-kitchen . Then said : " Now [I]427-the reverend mother must go . [The nuns]298-the nuns wait . "[427-the reverend mother]

Then of a sudden [she]427-the reverend mother put [her]427-the reverend mother arms about [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister .

" Good - bye , [[my]427-the reverend mother [Antony]85-mary antony]4376-my antony , "[427-the reverend mother] [she]427-the reverend mother said . " [Thy]264-the old lay - sister love and devotion have been very precious to [me]427-the reverend mother . The Presence of [the Lord]4319-the lord abide with [thee]264-the old lay - sister in blessing , while [we]6023-we are gone . "[427-the reverend mother]

And , stooping , [she]427-the reverend mother kissed [her]427-the reverend mother gently on the brow ; then passed from [the cell]291-the cell .

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony stood as one that dreamed .

It was so many years since any touch of tenderness had reached [her]85-mary antony .

And now those gracious arms around [her]85-mary antony ; those serene eyes looking upon [her]85-mary antony with love in [their]2290-their regard , and a something more , which [her]85-mary antony old heart failed to fathom ; those lips , whose every word of command [she]85-mary antony and [the whole Community]2291-the whole community hastened to obey , leaving a kiss upon [her]85-mary antony brow !

Long after [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies had formed into procession and left [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony stood as one that dreamed . Then , remembering [her]85-mary antony duties , [she]85-mary antony hurried to [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , but found [them]316-the cloisters empty ; down the steps to [the crypt passage]2295-the crypt passage ; the door was locked on the inside ; the key gone .

The procession had started , and [Mary Antony]85-mary antony had failed to be at [her]85-mary antony post . [The White Ladies]288-the white ladies had departed uncounted . [Mary Antony]85-mary antony had not been there to count [them]288-the white ladies .

Never before had [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother sent for [her]85-mary antony when [she]85-mary antony should have been on duty [elsewhere]2298-elsewhere .

Hastening to remedy [her]85-mary antony failure , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony drew the bag of peas from [her]85-mary antony wallet , opened it , and hurrying from [cell]1447-cell to [cell]1447-cell , took out a pea at each , as [she]85-mary antony verified its emptiness ; until five - and - twenty peas lay in [her]85-mary antony hand .

So now [she]85-mary antony waited , [her]85-mary antony error repaired ; yet ever with [her]85-mary antony then , as [she]85-mary antony ran , and now , as [she]85-mary antony waited [she]85-mary antony felt the benediction of [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother 's kiss , the sense of [her]85-mary antony encircling arms , the wonder of [her]85-mary antony gracious words .

" The Presence of [the Lord]4319-the lord abide with [thee]6025-thee in blessing . "[85-mary antony]

Yes , a heavenly calm was in [the cloisters]316-the cloisters . [The Devil]101-the devil had stayed away . [Heaven]335-heaven seemed very near . [Even that little vain man]2304-even that little vain man , [the robin]339-the robin , appeared to be busy elsewhere . [Mary Antony]85-mary antony was quite alone .

" While [we]2306-we are gone . "[85-mary antony] But [they]2306-we would not now be long . [Mary Antony]85-mary antony could tell by the shadows on the grass , and the slant of the sunshine through a certain arch , that the hour of return drew near .

[She]85-mary antony would kneel beside the topmost step , and see [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother pass ; [she]85-mary antony would look up at that serene face which had melted into tenderness ; would see the firm line of those beautiful lips

Suddenly [Mary Antony]85-mary antony knew that [she]85-mary antony would not be able to look . Not just yet could [she]85-mary antony bear to see [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother 's countenance , without that expression of wonderful tenderness . And even as [she]85-mary antony realised this , the key grated in the lock below .

Taking up [her]85-mary antony position at the top of the steps , the five - and - twenty peas in [her]85-mary antony right hand , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony quickly made up [her]85-mary antony mind . [She]85-mary antony could not lift [her]85-mary antony eyes to [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's face . [She]85-mary antony would count the passing feet .

[The young lay - sister who carried the light , stumped up the steps]2309-the young lay - sister who carried the light , stumped up the steps , and set down the lantern with a clatter . [She]2309-the young lay - sister who carried the light , stumped up the steps plumped on to [her]2309-the young lay - sister who carried the light , stumped up the steps knees opposite to [Mary Antony]85-mary antony .

" [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca leads to - day , "[2309-the young lay - sister who carried the light , stumped up the steps] [she]2309-the young lay - sister who carried the light , stumped up the steps chanted in a low voice , " and all the way [hath]6026-hath stepped upon [my]2309-the young lay - sister who carried the light , stumped up the steps heels . "[2309-the young lay - sister who carried the light , stumped up the steps]

But [Mary Antony]85-mary antony took no notice of this information , which , at any other time , would have delighted [her]85-mary antony .

Head bowed , eyes on the ground , [she]85-mary antony awaited the passing feet .

[They]2310-they came , moving slow and sedate .

[They]2310-they passed stepping two by two , out of [her]85-mary antony range of vision ; moving along [the cloister]286-the cloister , dying away in the distance .

All had passed .

Nay ! Not all ? Another comes ! Surely , another comes ?

[Sister Abigail]99-sister abigail , lifting the lantern , rose up noisily .

" What wait [you]85-mary antony for , [Sister Antony]85-mary antony ? [The holy Ladies]332-the holy ladies have by now entered [[their]332-the holy ladies cells]299-their cells . "[99-sister abigail]

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony lifted startled eyes .

The golden bars of sunlight fell across [an empty cloister]2312-an empty cloister .

A few white figures in [the passage]497-the passage , seen in the distance through the open door , were vanishing , one by one , into [[their]2314-their cells]299-their cells .

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony covered [her]85-mary antony dismay with indignation .

" Be off , [thou]6029-thy impudent hussy ! Hold [thy]6029-thy noisy tongue and hang [thy]6029-thy rattling lantern on a nail ; or , better still , hold [thy]6029-thy lantern , and hang [thyself]6030-thyself , holding it , upon the nail . If [I]85-mary antony am piously minded to pray here until sunset , that is no concern of thine . Be off , [I]85-mary antony say ! "[85-mary antony]

Left alone , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony slowly opened [her]85-mary antony right hand , and peered into the palm .

One pea lay within it .

[She]85-mary antony went over to the seat and counted , with trembling fingers , the peas from [her]85-mary antony left hand .

Twenty - four ! [One holy Lady]2316-one holy lady had therefore not returned . This must be reported at once to [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother . In [her]85-mary antony excitement , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony forgot the emotion which had so recently possessed [her]85-mary antony .

Bustling down the steps , [she]85-mary antony drew the key from the door , paused one moment to peep into the dank darkness , listening for running footsteps or a voice that called ; then closed the door , locked it , drew forth the key , and hurried to [the [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's cell]428-the reverend mother 's cell .

The door stood ajar , just as [she]85-mary antony had left [it]2319-it .

[She]85-mary antony knocked , but entered without waiting to be bidden , crying : " Oh , [Reverend Mother]4474-reverend mother ! [Twenty - five holy Ladies]6032-twenty - five holy ladies went to Vespers , and but twenty - four have "[85-mary antony]

Then [her]85-mary antony voice died away into silence .

[[The Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother 's cell]428-the reverend mother 's cell was empty .

[Stock]205-stock - still stood [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , while [her]85-mary antony world crumbled from beneath [her]85-mary antony old feet and [her]85-mary antony heaven rolled itself up like a scroll , from over [her]85-mary antony head , and departed .

[[The Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother 's cell]428-the reverend mother 's cell was empty .

[It]2324-it was [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother who had not returned .

" Good - bye , [[my]2324-it [Antony]85-mary antony]4376-my antony . The Presence of [the Lord]6034-the lord abide with [thee]85-mary antony in blessing , while [we]6035-we are gone . "[2324-it] Ah , gone ! Never to return !

Once again [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister stood as one that dreamed ; but this time instead of beatific joy , there was a forlorn pathos in the dreaming .

Presently a door opened , and a step sounded , far away in the passage beyond [the Refectory stairs]453-the refectory stairs .

Instantly a look of cunning and determination replaced the helpless dismay on the old face . [She]85-mary antony quickly closed the cell door , hung up the crypt key in [its]2328-its accustomed place ; then kneeling before the shrine of [the Madonna]435-the madonna : " [Blessed Virgin]145-blessed virgin , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony prayed , with clasped hands uplifted ; " be pleased to sharpen once again the wits of old [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . "[85-mary antony]

Rising , [she]85-mary antony found the key of [[the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's cell]428-the reverend mother 's cell , passed out , closing the door behind [her]85-mary antony ; locked it , and slipped the key into [her]85-mary antony wallet .

[The passage]497-the passage was empty . [All the nuns]505-all the nuns were spending in prayer and meditation the time until the Refectory bell should ring .

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony appeared in [the kitchen]2333-the kitchen , only a few minutes later than usual .

" Prepare [you]2334-her subordinates the evening meal , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony said to [[her]85-mary antony subordinates]2334-her subordinates . " [I]85-mary antony care not what [the holy Ladies]332-the holy ladies feed upon this even , nor how badly it be served . [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother again elects to spend the night in prayer and fasting . [So Mother Sub - Prioress]6037-so mother sub - prioress will spit out a curse upon [the viands]6038-the viands ; or [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca will miaul over [them]6038-the viands like an old cat that sees a tom in every shadow , though [all toms]6039-all toms have long since fled at [her]85-mary antony approach . Serve at the usual hour ; and let [Abigail]99-sister abigail ring the Refectory bell . [I]85-mary antony am otherwise employed . And remember . [Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother is on no account to be disturbed . "[85-mary antony]

[The porteress]4960-the porteress , at the gate , jumped well - nigh out of [her]4960-the porteress skin when , turning , [she]4960-the porteress found [Mary Antony]85-mary antony at [her]4960-the porteress elbow .

" Beshrew [me]4960-the porteress , [Sister Antony]85-mary antony ! "[4960-the porteress] [she]4960-the porteress exclaimed . " Wherefore "[4960-the porteress]

" Whist ! "[85-mary antony] said [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . " Speak not so loud . Now listen , [Mary Mark]206-mary mark . Saw [you]206-mary mark [the great Lord Bishop]1748-the great lord bishop yesterday , a - walking with [Mary Antony]85-mary antony ? Ha , ha ! [Yea]6041-yea , verily ! ' [Worthy Mother]5893-worthy mother , ' [[his]1748-the great lord bishop lordship]6043-his lordship called [me]85-mary antony . ' [Worthy Mother]207-worthy mother , ' with [his]1748-the great lord bishop hand upon [his]1748-the great lord bishop heart . And into [the gardens]6044-the gardens [he]1748-the great lord bishop walked with [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . Wherefore , [you]206-mary mark ask ? Wherefore should [the great Lord Bishop]1748-the great lord bishop walk in [the Convent garden]560-the convent garden with [an old lay - sister]6047-an old lay - sister , who ceased to be [a comely wench]6048-a comely wench more than half a century ago ? Because , [Sister Mark]206-mary mark , if [you]206-mary mark needs must know , [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop is full of anxious fears for [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , and knoweth that [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , old though [she]85-mary antony be , is able to tend and watch over [her]93-the reverend mother . [The Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop and [the Worthy Mother]6051-the worthy mother both fear that [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother fasts too often , and spends too many hours in vigil . [The Reverend Father]5052-the reverend father has therefore deputed [the Worthy Mother]6051-the worthy mother to watch in this matter , and to let [him]5052-the reverend father know at once if [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother imperils [her]6051-the worthy mother health again , by too lengthy a fast or vigil . And , lo ! this very day , [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother purposes not coming to the evening meal , and intends spending the whole night in prayer and vigil , before [[our]6057-our Lady]4260-our lady 's shrine . Therefore [the Worthy Mother]6051-the worthy mother [I]85-mary antony , [myself]85-mary antony must start at once to fetch [the great Lord Bishop]1748-the great lord bishop ; and [you]85-mary antony , [Sister Mary Mark]206-mary mark , must open the gate and let [me]85-mary antony be gone . "[85-mary antony]

[The porteress]4960-the porteress gazed , round - eyed and amazed .

" Nay , [Sister Mary Antony]85-mary antony , that can [I]4960-the porteress not , without an order from [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother [herself]427-the reverend mother . And even then , [you]85-mary antony could not walk so far as to [the Lord Bishop 's Palace]6062-the lord bishop 's palace . [I]4960-the porteress doubt if [you]85-mary antony would even reach the Fore - gate . "[4960-the porteress] " That [I]85-mary antony should , and shall ! "[85-mary antony] cried [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . " And , if [my]85-mary antony old legs fail [me]85-mary antony , [many a gallant]6063-many a gallant will dismount and offer [me]85-mary antony [his]6063-many a gallant horse . Thus in fine style shall [I]85-mary antony ride into [Worcester city]302-worcester city . Didst [thou]6065-thou not see [me]85-mary antony bestride [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop 's white palfrey on Play Day ? "[85-mary antony]

[Sister Mary Mark]206-mary mark broke into laughter .

" Aye , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony said , " [my]85-mary antony sides have but lately ceased aching . [I]85-mary antony pray [you]85-mary antony , [Sister Antony]85-mary antony , call not that sight again into [my]85-mary antony mind . "[85-mary antony] " Then open the door , [Mary Mark]206-mary mark , and let [me]4960-the porteress go . "[4960-the porteress]

" Nay , that [I]85-mary antony dare not do . "[85-mary antony]

" Then , if [I]4960-the porteress fail to do as bidden by [the great Lord Bishop]1748-the great lord bishop , [I]4960-the porteress shall tell [[his]1748-the great lord bishop lordship]6043-his lordship that [thou]6069-thou , and thine obstinacy , stood in the way of the fulfilment of [my]4960-the porteress purpose . "[4960-the porteress]

[The porteress]4960-the porteress wavered .

" Bring [me]4960-the porteress leave from [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , [Sister Antony]85-mary antony . "[4960-the porteress]

" Nay , that can [I]85-mary antony not , "[85-mary antony] said [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , " as [any fool]6071-any fool might see , when [I]85-mary antony go without [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother 's knowledge to report to [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop by [his]751-the lord bishop private command . Even [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother [herself]427-the reverend mother obeys the commands of [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop . "[85-mary antony]

[Sister Mary Mark]206-mary mark hesitated . [She]85-mary antony certainly had seen [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop pass under the rose - arch , and enter [the garden]358-the garden , in close converse with [Sister Mary Antony]85-mary antony . Yet [her]85-mary antony trust at the gate was given to [her]85-mary antony by [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother . " See here , [Mary Mark]206-mary mark , "[85-mary antony] said [Sister Antony]85-mary antony . " [I]85-mary antony must send a message forthwith to [Mother Sub - Prioress]324-mother sub - prioress . [You]206-mary mark shall take it , leaving [me]85-mary antony in charge of the gate , as often [I]85-mary antony am left , by order of [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , when [you]206-mary mark are bidden elsewhere . If , on [your]206-mary mark return and [you]206-mary mark need not to hurry [you]206-mary mark find [me]85-mary antony gone , [none]315-none can blame [you]206-mary mark . Yet when [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop rides in at sunset , [he]751-the lord bishop will give [you]206-mary mark [his]751-the lord bishop blessing and , like enough , something besides . "[85-mary antony]

[Mary Mark]206-mary mark 's hesitation vanished .

" [I]2340-she will take [your]85-mary antony message , [Sister Antony]85-mary antony , "[2340-she] [she]2340-she said meekly .

" Go , by way of [the kitchens]4328-the kitchens and the Refectory stairs , to [the cell of [Mother Sub - Prioress]324-mother sub - prioress]4465-the cell of mother sub - prioress . Say that [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother purposes passing the night in prayer and vigil , will not come to the evening meal , and desires [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress to take [her]91-mother sub - prioress place . Also that for no cause whatever is [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother to be disturbed . "[2340-she]

[Sister Mary Mark]206-mary mark , being thus given a legitimate reason for leaving [her]2340-she post and gaining [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's favour without giving cause for displeasure to [the Prioress]373-the prioress , departed , by way of [the kitchens]4328-the kitchens , to carry [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's message .

No sooner was [she]2340-she out of sight , than [Mary Antony]85-mary antony seized the key , unlocked the great doors , pulled them apart , and left them standing ajar , the key in the lock ; then hastened back across [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , passed under the rose - arch , and creeping beneath the shelter of the yew hedge , reached the steps up to [the cloisters]316-the cloisters ; slipped unobserved through the cloister door , and up [the empty passage]2346-the empty passage ; unlocked [the Reverend Mother 's cell]428-the reverend mother 's cell , entered [it]428-the reverend mother 's cell , and softly closed and locked the door behind [her]85-mary antony .

Then in order to make it impossible to yield to any temptation to open the door [she]85-mary antony withdrew the key , and flung it through the open window , far out into [the shrubbery]2348-the shrubbery .

Thus did [Mary Antony]85-mary antony prepare to hold [the fort]2349-the fort , until the coming of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . CHAPTER XXXIV

MORA [DE NORELLE

Symon]208-de norelle symon , [Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]1222-bishop of worcester , chid [himself]208-de norelle symon for restlessness . Surely for once [his]208-de norelle symon mind had lost control of [his]208-de norelle symon limbs .

No sooner did [he]208-de norelle symon decide to walk the smooth lawns around [the Castle]5855-the castle , than [he]208-de norelle symon found [himself]208-de norelle symon mounting to the battlements ; and now , though [he]208-de norelle symon had installed [himself]208-de norelle symon for greatly needed repose in a deep seat in [the hall chamber]2353-the hall chamber , yet here [he]208-de norelle symon was , pacing the floor , or moving from one window to another .

By dint of hard riding [he]208-de norelle symon had reached [Warwick]32-warwick while the sun , though already dipped beneath the horizon , still flecked the sky with rosy clouds , and spread a golden mantle over the west .

[The lord of the Castle]2354-the lord of the castle was away , in attendance on [the King]4555-the king ; but all was in readiness for the arrival of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , and great preparations had been made for the reception of [Sir Hugh d'Argent]2357-sir hugh d'argent . [[His]2357-sir hugh d'argent people]2358-his people , having left [Worcester]1-worcester early that morning , were about in [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , as [the Bishop]4673-the bishop rode in .

As [he]208-de norelle symon passed through the doorway , [an elderly woman , buxom , comely]2361-an elderly woman , buxom , comely , and of motherly aspect , whom [he]208-de norelle symon easily divined to be [the tire - woman of whom [the Knight]764-the knight had spoken]2362-the tire - woman of whom the knight had spoken , came forward to meet [him]208-de norelle symon .

" Good [[my]2361-an elderly woman , buxom , comely lord]4881-my lord , "[2361-an elderly woman , buxom , comely] [she]2361-an elderly woman , buxom , comely said , [her]2361-an elderly woman , buxom , comely eagerness allowing of scant ceremony , " comes [Sir Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent hither this night ? "[2361-an elderly woman , buxom , comely]

" Aye , "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , looking with kindly eyes upon [[Mora]144-mora 's old nurse]2365-mora 's old nurse . " Within two hours , [he]132-hugh should be [here]4536-here . "[4673-the bishop]

" Comes [he]132-hugh alone , [[my]209-mistress deborah lord]4881-my lord ? "[209-mistress deborah] asked [Mistress Deborah]209-mistress deborah .

" Nay , "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " [the Countess of [Norelle]42-norelle]2271-the countess of norelle , [a very noble lady to whom [the Knight]764-the knight is betrothed]6088-a very noble lady to whom the knight is betrothed , rides hither with [him]132-hugh . "[4673-the bishop]

" [The saints]4874-the saints be praised ! "[430-the old woman] exclaimed [the old woman]430-the old woman , and turned away to hide [her]430-the old woman tears .

Whilst [[his]4673-the bishop body - servant]1957-his body - servant prepared a bath and laid out [his]4673-the bishop robes , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop mounted to the ramparts and watched the gold fade in the west . [He]4673-the bishop glanced at [the river below]2370-the river below , threading its way through [the pasture land]2371-the pasture land ; at the billowy masses of trees ; at [the gay parterre]2372-the gay parterre , bright with summer flowers . Then [he]4673-the bishop looked long in the direction of [[the city]1177-the city from which [he]4673-the bishop had come]2374-the city from which he had come .

During [his]4673-the bishop strenuous ride , the slow tramp of [the men - at - arms]773-the men - at - arms , had sounded continually in [his]4673-the bishop ears ; the outline of [that helpless figure , lying at full length upon the stretcher]2376-that helpless figure , lying at full length upon the stretcher , had been ever before [his]4673-the bishop eyes .

[He]4673-the bishop could not picture the arrival at [the hostel]5987-the hostel , the removal of the covering , the uprising of [the Prioress]373-the prioress to face life anew , enfolded in the arms of [[her]373-the prioress lover]762-her lover .

As in a weary dream , in which the mind can make no headway , but returns again and yet again to the point of distress , so , during the entire ride , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had followed [that stretcher]2381-that stretcher through [the streets of [Worcester city]302-worcester city]2382-the streets of worcester city , until it seemed to [him]4673-the bishop as if , before the pall was lifted , the long - limbed , graceful form beneath it would have stiffened in death .

" A corpse for [a bride]6091-a bride ! A corpse for [a bride]6091-a bride ! "[2384-the black mare shulamite] the hoofs of [the black mare Shulamite]2384-the black mare shulamite had seemed to beat out upon [the road]4623-the road . " Alas , [poor Knight]6093-poor knight ! A corpse for [a bride]6091-a bride ! "[2384-the black mare shulamite]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop came down from the battlements .

When [he]4673-the bishop left [[his]4673-the bishop chamber]2387-his chamber an hour later , [he]4673-the bishop had donned those crimson robes which [he]4673-the bishop wore on the evening when [the Knight]764-the knight supped with [him]4673-the bishop at [the Palace]1309-the palace .

As [he]4673-the bishop paced up and down [the lawns]2390-the lawns , the gold cross at [his]4673-the bishop breast gleamed in the evening light .

A night - hawk , flying high overhead and looking downward as it flew , might have supposed that a great scarlet poppy had left its clump in the flower - beds , and was promenading on the turf .

[A steward]2391-a steward came out to ask when it would please [the Lord Bishop]92-bishop to sup .

To the hovering hawk , a blackbird seemed to have hopped out , confronting and arresting the promenading poppy .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop said [he]4673-the bishop would await the arrival of [Sir Hugh]132-hugh ; but [he]4673-the bishop turned and followed [the man]4228-the man into [the Castle]5855-the castle .

And now [he]4673-the bishop sat in [the great hall chamber]2395-the great hall chamber .

Two hours had passed since [his]4673-the bishop arrival .

Unless something unforeseen had occurred [the Knight]764-the knight 's cavalcade must be [here]4536-here before long . [He]4673-the bishop had planned to start within the hour ; and , though [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had ridden fast , [they]2399-they could scarcely have taken more than an hour longer to do the distance .

But supposing [the Prioress]373-the prioress had faltered at the last , and had besought to be returned to [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery ? Would [the chivalry of [the Knight]764-the knight]2402-the chivalry of the knight have stood such a test ? And , having left in secret , how could [she]373-the prioress return openly ? Would the way through [the crypt]273-the crypt be possible ?

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop began to wish that [he]4673-the bishop had ridden to [the Star hostel]5237-the star hostel and awaited [developments]210-developments [there]333-there , instead of hastening on before .

[The hall chamber]2353-the hall chamber was in [the centre of [the Castle]5855-the castle]2409-the centre of the castle . [[Its]2353-the hall chamber casements]2411-its casements looked out upon [the gardens]6044-the gardens . Thus it came about that [he]4673-the bishop did not hear [a cavalcade]2413-a cavalcade ride into [the courtyard]775-the courtyard . [He]4673-the bishop did not hear the shouting of [the men]5269-the men , the ring of hoofs on the paving stones , the champing of horses .

[He]4673-the bishop sat in a great carved chair beside the fireplace in [the hall chamber]2353-the hall chamber , forcing [himself]4673-the bishop to stillness , yet tormented by anxiety ; half minded to order a fresh horse and to ride back to [Worcester]1-worcester .

Suddenly , without any warning , the door , leading from [the ante - chamber at the further end of [the hall]1551-the hall]2417-the ante - chamber at the further end of the hall , opened .

Framed in the doorway appeared a vision , which for a moment led [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester to question whether [he]154-symon of worcester dreamed , so beautiful beyond belief was [the woman in a green riding - dress]2419-the woman in a green riding - dress , looking at [him]154-symon of worcester with starry eyes , [her]2419-the woman in a green riding - dress cheeks aglow , a veil of golden hair falling about [her]2419-the woman in a green riding - dress shoulders .

Oh , [Mora]144-mora , [child of delight]2420-child of delight ! Has the exquisite promise of [thy]144-mora girlhood indeed fulfilled itself thus ? Have the years changed [thee]144-mora so little -and yet so greatly ?

" [The captive exile]6095-the captive exile hasteneth "[144-mora] ; exile , long ago , for [thy]144-mora sake ; seeking to be free , yet captive still , caught once and forever in the meshes of that golden hair .

Oh , [Mora]144-mora , [child of delight]2420-child of delight ! Must all this planning for [thy]144-mora full development and perfecting of joy , involve the poignant anguish of thus seeing [thee]144-mora again ?

[Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester rose and stood , [a noble figure in crimson and gold]1561-a noble figure in crimson and gold , at the top of [the hall]1551-the hall . But for the silver moonlight of [his]154-symon of worcester hair , [he]154-symon of worcester might have been [a man in [his]154-symon of worcester prime]2424-a man in his prime so erect was [his]154-symon of worcester carriage , so keen and bright were [his]154-symon of worcester eyes .

[The tall woman in the doorway]2425-the tall woman in the doorway gave a little cry ; then moved quickly forward .

" [You]154-symon of worcester ? "[2425-the tall woman in the doorway] [she]2425-the tall woman in the doorway said . " [You]154-symon of worcester ! [The priest who is to [we]6097-we d [us]6097-we]6096-the priest who is to we d us ? [You]154-symon of worcester ! "[2425-the tall woman in the doorway]

[He]154-symon of worcester stood [his]154-symon of worcester ground , awaiting [her]2425-the tall woman in the doorway approach .

" Yes , [I]154-symon of worcester , "[154-symon of worcester] [he]154-symon of worcester said ; " [I.]154-symon of worcester "[154-symon of worcester]

Half - way across [the hall]1551-the hall , [she]2425-the tall woman in the doorway paused .
