" No , "[2425-the tall woman in the doorway] [she]2425-the tall woman in the doorway said , as if to [herself]2425-the tall woman in the doorway . " [I]2425-the tall woman in the doorway dream . It is not [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise . It is [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . "[2425-the tall woman in the doorway] [She]2425-the tall woman in the doorway drew nearer .

Earnestly [he]154-symon of worcester looked upon [her]2425-the tall woman in the doorway , striving to see in [her]2425-the tall woman in the doorway the Prioress of [Whytstone]3-whytstone the friend of all these happy , peaceful , blessed years . But [the Prioress]373-the prioress had vanished .

[Mora de Norelle]144-mora stood before [him]154-symon of worcester , taller by half a head than [he]154-symon of worcester , flushed by long galloping in the night breeze ; nerves strung to breaking point ; eyes bright with the great unrest of a headlong leap into a new world . Yet the firm sweet lips were there , unchanged ; and , even as [he]154-symon of worcester marked them , they quivered and parted .

" [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , "[2425-the tall woman in the doorway] [she]2425-the tall woman in the doorway said , " [I]2425-the tall woman in the doorway have chosen , even as [you]154-symon of worcester prayed [I]2425-the tall woman in the doorway might do , the harder part . "[2425-the tall woman in the doorway] [She]2425-the tall woman in the doorway flung aside the riding - whip [she]2425-the tall woman in the doorway carried ; and folding [her]2425-the tall woman in the doorway hands , held them up before [him]154-symon of worcester . " For [Christ]200-christ 's sake , [[my]2425-the tall woman in the doorway Lord [Bishop]92-bishop]4963-my lord bishop , pray for [me]2425-the tall woman in the doorway ! "[2425-the tall woman in the doorway]

[He]154-symon of worcester took those folded hands in [his]154-symon of worcester , gently parted them , and held them against the cross upon [his]154-symon of worcester heart .

" [You]2425-the tall woman in the doorway have chosen rightly , [[my]154-symon of worcester child]4262-my child , "[154-symon of worcester] [he]154-symon of worcester said ; " [we]6101-we will pray that grace and strength may be vouchsafed [you]2425-the tall woman in the doorway , so that [you]2425-the tall woman in the doorway may continue , without faltering , along the pathway of this fresh vocation . "[154-symon of worcester]

[She]2425-the tall woman in the doorway looked at [him]154-symon of worcester with searching gaze . The kind and gentle eyes of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop met [hers]2425-the tall woman in the doorway without wavering ; also without any trace of the fire the keen brightness which had startled [her]2425-the tall woman in the doorway as [she]2425-the tall woman in the doorway stood in the doorway .

" [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , "[2425-the tall woman in the doorway] [she]2425-the tall woman in the doorway said , and there was a strange note of bewildered question in [her]2425-the tall woman in the doorway voice : " [I]2425-the tall woman in the doorway pray [you]154-symon of worcester , tell [me]2425-the tall woman in the doorway what [you]154-symon of worcester bid [penitents]6102-penitents to remember as [they]6102-penitents kneel in prayer before the crucifix ? "[2425-the tall woman in the doorway]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop looked full into those starry grey eyes bent upon [him]4673-the bishop , and [his]4673-the bishop own did not falter . [His]4673-the bishop mild voice took on a shade of sternness as befitted the solemn subject of [her]2425-the tall woman in the doorway question .

" [I]4673-the bishop tell [them]6102-penitents , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , to remember , the sacred Wounds that bled and the Heart that broke for [them]6102-penitents . "[4673-the bishop]

[She]2425-the tall woman in the doorway drew [her]2425-the tall woman in the doorway hands from beneath [his]4673-the bishop , and stepped back a pace .

" The Heart that broke ? "[2425-the tall woman in the doorway] [she]2425-the tall woman in the doorway said . " That broke ? Do hearts break ? "[2425-the tall woman in the doorway] [she]2425-the tall woman in the doorway cried . " Nay , rather , [they]6102-penitents turn to stone . "[2425-the tall woman in the doorway] [She]2425-the tall woman in the doorway laughed wildly , then caught [her]2425-the tall woman in the doorway breath . [The Knight]764-the knight had entered [the hall]1551-the hall .

With free , glad step , and head uplifted , [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent came to [them]2432-us , where [they]2432-us stood .

" [[My]132-hugh Lord [Bishop]92-bishop]4963-my lord bishop , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh said , " [you]92-bishop have been too good to [us]2432-us . [I]132-hugh sent [Mora]144-mora on alone that [she]144-mora might find [you]92-bishop here , not telling [her]144-mora who was [the prelate who had so graciously offered to [we]2432-us d [us]2432-us]6105-the prelate who had so graciously offered to we d us , knowing how much it would mean to [her]144-mora that it should be [you]92-bishop , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father . "[132-hugh]

" Gladly am [I]4673-the bishop here for that purpose , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " having as [you]92-bishop know , the leave and sanction of [[His]6105-the prelate who had so graciously offered to we d us Holiness]5400-his holiness for so doing . Shall [we]2432-us proceed at once to [the chapel]5170-the chapel , or do [you]92-bishop plan first to sup ? "[4673-the bishop]

" Nay , [Father]4643-father , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight . " [[My]764-the knight betrothed]4565-my betrothed has ridden far and needs food first , and then a good night 's rest . If it will not too much delay [your]92-bishop return to [Worcester]1-worcester , [I]764-the knight would pray [you]92-bishop to [we]2435-we d [us]2435-we in the morning . "[764-the knight]

Knowing how determined [Hugh]132-hugh had been , in laying [his]132-hugh plans , to be [we]2435-we d at once on reaching [Warwick]32-warwick , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop looked up quickly , wishing to understand what had wrought this change .

[He]4673-the bishop saw on [the Knight]764-the knight 's face that look of radiant peace which [the Prioress]373-the prioress had seen , when first the cloak was turned back in [the crypt]273-the crypt ; and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , having passed that way [himself]4673-the bishop , knew that to [Hugh]132-hugh had come the revelation which comes but to the true , lover the deepest of all joys , that of putting [himself]132-hugh on one side , and of thinking , first and only , of the welfare of [the beloved]2441-the beloved .

And seeing this , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop let go [his]4673-the bishop fears , and in [his]4673-the bishop heart thanked [God]89-god . " It is well planned , [Hugh]132-hugh , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " [I]4673-the bishop am here until the morning . "[4673-the bishop]

At which [the Knight]764-the knight turning , strode quickly to the door , and beckoned .

Then back [he]764-the knight came , leading by the hand [the buxom , motherly old dame , seen on arrival by [the Bishop]4673-the bishop]2444-the buxom , motherly old dame , seen on arrival by the bishop . Who , when [the Lady Mora]144-mora saw , [she]144-mora gave a cry , and ran to meet [her]144-mora .

" [Debbie]209-mistress deborah ! "[144-mora] [she]144-mora cried , " Oh , [Debbie]209-mistress deborah ! Let [us]6111-we go [home]305-home ! "[144-mora]

And with that the tension broke all on a sudden , and with [[her]144-mora old nurse]2446-her old nurse 's arms around [her]144-mora , [she]144-mora sobbed on the faithful bosom which had been the refuge of [her]144-mora childhood 's woes .

" There , [[my]209-mistress deborah pretty]6113-my pretty ! "[209-mistress deborah] said [Deborah]209-mistress deborah , as best [she]209-mistress deborah could for [her]209-mistress deborah own sobs . " There , there ! [We]6111-we are at [home]305-home , now [we]6111-we are together . Come and see the chamber in which [we]6111-we shall sleep , just as [we]6111-we slept long years ago , when [you]6113-my pretty were [a babe]6115-a babe , [[my]209-mistress deborah dear]4718-my dear . "[209-mistress deborah]

So , with [[her]144-mora old nurse]2446-her old nurse 's arms about [her]144-mora , [she]144-mora , who had come in so proudly , went gently out in a soft mist of tears .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop turned away .

" Love never faileth , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop murmured , half aloud .

[Hugh]132-hugh turned with [him]4673-the bishop , and laughed ; but in [his]132-hugh laughter there was no vexation , no bitterness , no unrest . It was the happy laugh of a heart aglow with a hope amounting to certainty .

" There were two of [us]6117-us the other night , [[my]4673-the bishop dear lord]5116-my dear lord , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said ; " but now old [Debbie]209-mistress deborah has appeared , methinks there are three ! "[4673-the bishop]

CHAPTER XXXV

IN [THE ARBOUR OF GOLDEN ROSES]60-the arbour of golden roses

The next day dawned , clear and radiant ; a perfect summer morning .

[Mora]144-mora awoke soon after five o'clock .

Notwithstanding the fatigue of the previous day , the strain and stress of heart , and the late hour at which [she]144-mora had at length fallen asleep , the mental habit of years overcame the physical need of further slumber .

[Her]144-mora first conscious thought was for the rope which worked over a pulley through a hole in the wall of [[her]144-mora cell]321-her cell , enabling [her]144-mora from , within to ring the great bell in [the passage]497-the passage , thus rousing [the entire community]633-the entire community . It had been [her]144-mora invariable habit to do this [herself]144-mora . [She]144-mora liked [the nuns]298-the nuns to feel that the call to begin a new day came to [them]298-the nuns from the hand of [[their]298-the nuns Prioress]847-their prioress . Realising the difficulty of early rising , especially after night vigils , it pleased [her]144-mora that [[her]144-mora nuns]839-her nuns should know that the fact of the bell resounding through [the Convent]328-the convent proved that [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother was already on [her]427-the reverend mother feet .

Yet now , looking toward the door , [she]144-mora could see no rope . And what meant those sumptuous tapestry hangings ?

[She]144-mora leapt from [her]144-mora couch , and gazed around [her]144-mora .

Why fell [her]144-mora hair about [her]144-mora , as a golden cloud ? that beautiful hair , which in some Orders would have been shorn from [her]144-mora head ; and , in this , must ever be closely braided , covered , and never seen . Still half - bewildered , [she]144-mora flung it back ; gazing at the unfamiliar , yet well - remembered , garments laid ready for [her]144-mora use .

Sometimes [she]144-mora had had such dreams as this dreams in which [she]144-mora was back in [the world]389-the world , wearing its garments , tasting its pleasures , looking again upon forbidden things .

Why should [she]144-mora not now be dreaming ?

Then a sound fell upon [her]144-mora ear ; a sound , long forgotten , yet so familiar that as [she]144-mora heard it , [she]144-mora felt [herself]144-mora [a child]5212-a child at [home]305-home again the soft , contented snoring of old [Debbie]209-mistress deborah , fast asleep .

Sound is ever more convincing than sight . [The blind]2460-the blind live in a world of certainties . Not so , [the deaf]2461-the deaf .

[Mora]144-mora needed not to turn and view the comely countenance of [[her]144-mora old nurse]2446-her old nurse sleeping upon a couch in a corner . At sound of that soft purring snore , [she]144-mora knew all [she]144-mora needed to know knew [she]144-mora was no longer [Prioress]2463-prioress , knew [she]144-mora had renounced [her]144-mora vows ; knew that even now [the Convent]328-the convent was waking and wondering , as last night it must have marvelled and surmised , and to - morrow would question and condemn ; knew that this was [her]209-mistress deborah wedding morn ; that this robe of softest white , with jewelled girdle , and jewelled circlet to crown [her]209-mistress deborah hair , were old [Debbie]209-mistress deborah 's choice for [her]209-mistress deborah of suitable attire in which to stand beside [[her]209-mistress deborah bridegroom]2465-her bridegroom at the altar .

Passing into [an alcove]2466-an alcove , [she]209-mistress deborah bathed and clothed [herself]209-mistress deborah , even putting on the jewelled band to clasp the shining softness of [her]209-mistress deborah hair . [Debbie]209-mistress deborah 's will on these points had never been disputed , and truly it mattered little to [Mora]144-mora what [she]144-mora wore , since wimple and holy veil were forever laid aside .

[She]144-mora passed softly from [the chamber]627-the chamber , without awakening [the old nurse]2468-the old nurse , made [her]144-mora way down [a winding stair]2469-a winding stair , out through a postern door , and so into [the gardens]6044-the gardens bathed in early morning sunshine .

Seeking to escape observation from the Castle walls or windows , [she]144-mora made [her]144-mora way through [a rose - garden]2471-a rose - garden to where a high yew hedge surrounded [a bowling - green]2472-a bowling - green . At the further end of [this secluded place]2473-this secluded place stood [a rustic summer - house]2474-a rustic summer - house , now a veritable bower of yellow roses .

Bending [her]144-mora head , [Mora]144-mora passed through an archway of yew , down three stone steps , and so on to [the lawn]2475-the lawn .

Then , out from [the arbour]2476-the arbour stepped [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , in [his]4673-the bishop violet cassock and biretta , [his]4673-the bishop breviary in [his]4673-the bishop hand .

If this first sight of [[Hugh]132-hugh 's bride]2478-hugh 's bride , in bridal array , on [her]2478-hugh 's bride wedding morning , surprised or stirred [him]4673-the bishop , [he]4673-the bishop gave no sign of unusual emotion .

As [he]4673-the bishop came to meet [her]144-mora , [his]4673-the bishop lips smiled kindly , and in [his]4673-the bishop eyes was that half whimsical , half tender look , [she]144-mora knew so well . [He]4673-the bishop might have been riding into [the courtyard of [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery]2479-the courtyard of the nunnery , and [she]144-mora standing on the steps to receive [him]4673-the bishop , so natural was [his]4673-the bishop greeting , so wholly as usual did [he]4673-the bishop appear .

" [You]144-mora are up betimes , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , as [I]4673-the bishop guessed [you]144-mora would be ; also [you]144-mora have come hither , as [I]4673-the bishop hoped [you]144-mora might do . Am [I]4673-the bishop the first to wish [you]144-mora joy , on this glad day ? "[4673-the bishop]

" The first , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said . " Even [[my]144-mora good [Deborah]209-mistress deborah]6120-my good deborah slept through [my]144-mora rising . [I]144-mora woke at the accustomed hour , to ring the Convent bell , and found [myself]144-mora [Prioress]2463-prioress no longer , but [bride an earthly bride]6122-bride an earthly bride expected to deck [herself]6122-bride an earthly bride with jewels for an earthly bridal . "[144-mora]

" ' Even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit , which is in the sight of [God of great price]6123-god of great price , ' "[4673-the bishop] quoted , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , a retrospective twinkle in [his]4673-the bishop eye .

" Alas , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , [I]4673-the bishop fear that ornament was never [mine]4673-the bishop . "[4673-the bishop]

" Yet [you]2482-her must wear it now , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter . [I]4673-the bishop have heard it is an ornament greatly admired by [husbands]6126-husbands . "[4673-the bishop]

Standing in the sunlight , all unconscious of [her]2482-her wondrous beauty , [she]2482-her opened startled eyes on [him]4673-the bishop ; then dropped to [her]2482-her knees upon the turf . " [Your]4673-the bishop blessing , [Reverend Father]4875-reverend father , "[2482-her] [she]2482-her said , and there was a wild sob in [her]2482-her voice . " Oh , [I]2482-her entreat [your]4673-the bishop blessing , on this [my]2482-her bridal day ! "[2482-her]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop laid [his]4673-the bishop hands upon the bright coronet of [her]2482-her hair , and blessed [her]2482-her with the threefold Aaronic blessing ; then raised [her]2482-her , and bade [her]2482-her walk with [him]4673-the bishop across [the turf]2484-the turf .

Into [the arbour]2476-the arbour [he]4673-the bishop led [her]2482-her , beneath a cascade of fragrant yellow roses . There , upon a rustic table was spread a dainty repast new milk , fruit freshly gathered , white rolls , and most golden pats of butter , the dew of the dairy yet upon them .

" Come , [[my]154-symon of worcester daughter]4891-my daughter , "[154-symon of worcester] said [[Symon]154-symon of worcester of [Worcester]1-worcester]5615-symon of worcester , gaily . " [We]6129-we of [the Church , who know the value of these early hours]6130-the church , who know the value of these early hours , let [us]6129-we break [our]6129-we fast together . "[154-symon of worcester]

" Is it magic , [[my]2482-her lord]4881-my lord ? "[2482-her] [she]2482-her asked , suddenly conscious of unmistakable hunger .

" Nay , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " but [I]4673-the bishop was out a full hour ago . And [the dairy wench]6132-the dairy wench was up before [me]4673-the bishop . So between [us]6129-we [we]6129-we contrived this simple repast . "[4673-the bishop]

So , while [the bridegroom]2488-the bridegroom and [old Deborah]209-mistress deborah still slumbered and slept , [the bride]2489-the bride and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop broke [their]2491-their fast together in a bower of roses ; and [his]4673-the bishop eyes were the eyes of [a merry schoolboy out on a holiday]1280-a merry schoolboy out on a holiday ; and the colour came back to [her]2482-her cheeks and [she]2482-her smiled and grew light - hearted , as always in [their]2491-their long friendship , when [he]4673-the bishop came to [her]2482-her in this gay mood .

Yet , presently , when [she]2482-her had eaten well , and seemed strengthened and refreshed , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop leaned back in [his]4673-the bishop seat , saying with sudden gravity :

" And now , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , will [you]4891-my daughter tell [me]4673-the bishop how it has come to pass that [you]4891-my daughter have been led to feel it right to take this irrevocable step , renouncing [your]4891-my daughter vows , and keeping [your]4891-my daughter troth to [Hugh]132-hugh ? When last [we]2491-their spoke together [you]4891-my daughter declared that naught would suffice but a clear sign , vouchsafed [you]4891-my daughter from [[our]2491-their Lady [herself]6134-our lady herself]6134-our lady herself , making it plain that [your]4891-my daughter highest duty was to [Hugh]132-hugh , and that [Heaven]142-heaven absolved [you]4891-my daughter from [your]4891-my daughter vows . Was such a sign vouchsafed ? "[4673-the bishop]

" Indeed it was , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , in wondrous fashion , [[our]2491-their Lady]4260-our lady choosing as the mouthpiece of [her]6134-our lady herself will , by means of a most explicit and unmistakable revelation , one so humble and so simple , that [I]4673-the bishop could but exclaim : ' [Thou]6137-thou hast hid these things from [the wise and prudent]5971-the wise and prudent , and hast revealed them unto [babes]6139-babes . ' "[4673-the bishop]

" And who , "[4673-the bishop] asked [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , [his]4673-the bishop eyes upon a peach which [he]4673-the bishop was peeling with extreme care ; " who , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , was [the babe]438-the babe ? "[4673-the bishop]

" [The old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . "[4673-the bishop]

" Ah , "[4673-the bishop] murmured [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " [an ancient babe]6143-an ancient babe . Yet truly , [a most worthy babe]6144-a most worthy babe . Almost , [I]4673-the bishop should be inclined to say , [a wise and prudent babe]6145-a wise and prudent babe . "[4673-the bishop]

" Nay , [[my]144-mora Lord]4881-my lord [Bishop]92-bishop , "[144-mora] cried [Mora]144-mora , with a sharp decision of tone which made it please [him]4673-the bishop to imagine that , should [he]4673-the bishop look up from the peach , [he]4673-the bishop would see the severe lines of the wimple and scapulary : " [you]92-bishop and [I]4673-the bishop were the wise and prudent , arguing for and against , according to [our]6147-our own theories and reason . But to [this babe]6148-this babe , [[our]6147-our Lady]4260-our lady vouchsafed a clear vision . "[4673-the bishop]

" Tell [me]4673-the bishop of it , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , splitting [his]4673-the bishop peach and removing the stone which [he]4673-the bishop carefully washed , and slipped into [his]4673-the bishop sash . [The Bishop]4673-the bishop always kept peach stones , and planted them .

[She]2498-she told [him]4673-the bishop . [She]2498-she began at the beginning , and told [him]4673-the bishop all , to the minutest detail ; the full description of [Hugh]132-hugh the amazingly correct repetition , in the vision , of the way in which [she]2498-she and [Hugh]132-hugh had actually kneeled together before [the shrine of [the blessed Virgin]628-the blessed virgin]2499-the shrine of the blessed virgin , of [their]2501-their very words and actions ; and , finally , the sublime and gracious tenderness of [[our]2502-our Lady]4260-our lady 's pronouncement , clearly heard at the close of the vision , by [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister : " Take [her]2498-she ; [she]2498-she hath been ever thine . [I]4260-our lady have but kept [her]2498-she for [thee]2498-she . "[4260-our lady]

" What say [you]4673-the bishop to that , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father ? "[144-mora] exclaimed [Mora]144-mora , concluding .

" [I]4673-the bishop scarce know what to say , "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " For lack of anything better , [I]4673-the bishop fall back upon [my]4673-the bishop favourite motto , and [I]4673-the bishop say : ' Love never faileth . ' "[4673-the bishop]

Now , generally , [she]144-mora delighted in the exceeding aptness of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's quotations ; but this time it seemed to [Mora]144-mora that [his]4673-the bishop favourite motto bore no sort of relevance .

[She]144-mora felt , with a chill of disappointment and a sense of vexation , that [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's mind had been so intent upon the fruit , that [he]4673-the bishop had not fully taken in the wonder of the vision .

" It has naught to do with love , [[my]144-mora lord]4881-my lord , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said , rather coldly ; " unless [you]4673-the bishop mean the divine lovingkindness of [[our]6151-our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady . "[144-mora]

" Precisely , "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , leaning back in [his]4673-the bishop seat , and at length looking straight into [Mora]144-mora 's earnest eyes . " The divine lovingkindness of [[our]6151-our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady never faileth . "[4673-the bishop]

" [You]4673-the bishop agree , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , that the vision shed a clear light upon all [my]4673-the bishop perplexities ? "[4673-the bishop]

" Absolutely clear , "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " The love which arranged the vision saw to that . Revelations , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , are useless unless they are explicit . Had [[our]6151-our [Lady]6157-lady]4260-our lady merely waved [her]6157-lady marble hand , instead of stooping to take [yours]4891-my daughter and place it in that of [the Knight]764-the knight , [you]4891-my daughter might have thought [she]6157-lady was waving [him]764-the knight away , and bidding [you]4891-my daughter to remain . If [her]6157-lady marble hand moved at all , it is well that it moved in so definite and practical a manner . "[4673-the bishop]

" It seems to [me]144-mora , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , "[144-mora] said [Mora]144-mora , leaning upon the table , [her]144-mora face framed in [her]144-mora hands , and looking with knitted brows at [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ; " it almost seems to [me]144-mora that [you]4673-the bishop regard the entire vision with a measure of secret incredulity . "[144-mora]

" Nay , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter , there [you]4891-my daughter mistake . Yet , [I]4673-the bishop admit "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop paused , and considered ; as if anxious to say just so much , and neither more nor less . Continuing , [he]4673-the bishop spoke slowly , weighing each word . " Yet , [I]4673-the bishop frankly admit , [I]4673-the bishop would sooner for [mine]4673-the bishop own guidance listen for the Voice of [God within]89-god , or learn [His]89-god will from the written Word , than ask for miraculous signs , or act upon the visions of [others]482-others .[4673-the bishop]

" No doubt [you]4891-my daughter read , in the Chronicle [I]4673-the bishop lately lent [you]4891-my daughter , how ' in the year of [[our]6171-our Lord]4256-our lord eleven hundred and thirty - seven that time of many sorrows , of burning , pillaging , rapine and torture , when [the city of [York]61-york]6173-the city of york was burned together with [the principal monastery]6174-the principal monastery ; [the city of]271-the city of [Rochester]62-rochester was consumed ; also [the Church of Bath]6176-the church of bath , and [the city of]271-the city of [Leicester]63-leicester ; when owing to the absence of [King Stephen]212-king stephen abroad and the mildness of [his]212-king stephen rule when at [home]305-home , [the barons]6179-the barons greatly oppressed and ill - used [the Church]4592-the church and [the people]6181-the people while [many]408-many were standing at the Celebration of Mass at [Windsor]27-windsor , [they]408-many beheld the Crucifix , which was over the altar , moving and wringing its hands , now the right hand with the left , now the left with the right , after the manner of [those who are in distress]6183-those who are in distress . '[4673-the bishop]

" This wondrous sight convinced [those who saw it]6184-those who saw it that [the crucified Redeemer]6185-the crucified redeemer sympathised with the grievous sorrows of [the land]6186-the land . "[4673-the bishop] But no carven crucifix , wringing its hands before [a gazing crowd]2512-a gazing crowd , could so deeply convince [me]0-i of the sympathy of [the Redeemer]2513-the redeemer as to sit alone in [[mine]0-i own chamber]2514-mine own chamber and read from the book of [Isaiah]213-isaiah [the Prophet]2515-the prophet : ' Surely [He]2515-the prophet hath borne [our]2516-our griefs , and carried [our]2516-our sorrows . ' "[2515-the prophet]

[Mora]144-mora 's brow cleared .

" [I]2515-the prophet think [I]2515-the prophet understand , [[my]2515-the prophet lord]4881-my lord ; and that [you]4881-my lord should so feel , helps [me]2515-the prophet to confess to [you]4881-my lord a thing which [I]2515-the prophet have scarce dared admit to [myself]2515-the prophet . "[2515-the prophet]

" Doubtless , "[4673-the bishop] remarked [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " the medium of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony took from the solemnity of the pronouncement . " [[My]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , [my]4673-the bishop heart fails [me]4673-the bishop when [I]4673-the bishop think to - day of [[my]4673-the bishop empty cell]6197-my empty cell , and of the sore perplexity of [[my]4673-the bishop nuns]4977-my nuns . " So soon as [you]4881-my lord are [we]6200-we d , [[my]144-mora daughter]4891-my daughter , [I]144-mora ride back to [Worcester]1-worcester . [I]144-mora shall endeavour to reach [the Convent]328-the convent before the hour when [they]4977-my nuns leave for Vespers . "[144-mora]

" May [I]4673-the bishop beg , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , that [you]4881-my lord speak a word of especial kindness to [old Antony]85-mary antony , whose heart will be sore at [my]4673-the bishop departure ? ' "[4673-the bishop]

" [I]4673-the bishop will seek [old Antony]85-mary antony , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " and speak with [her]85-mary antony alone . "[4673-the bishop]

" [Father]155-reverend father , "[144-mora] said [Mora]144-mora , with deep emotion , " during all these years , [you]155-reverend father have been most good to [me]144-mora ; kind beyond words ; patient always . [I]144-mora fear [I]144-mora ofttimes tried [you]155-reverend father by being too firmly set on [my]144-mora own will and way . But , [I]144-mora pray [you]155-reverend father to believe , [I]144-mora ever valued [your]155-reverend father counsel and could scarce have lived without [your]155-reverend father friendship . Last night , on first entering [the Castle]5855-the castle , [I]144-mora fear [I]144-mora spoke wildly and acted strangely . [I]144-mora was sore overwrought . "[144-mora]

" For whom did [you]155-reverend father take [me]4673-the bishop , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter ? "[4673-the bishop] asked [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" For one of whom [you]155-reverend father have oft reminded [me]4673-the bishop , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , if [I]4673-the bishop may say so without offence , seeing [I]4673-the bishop speak of [a priest who was the ideal of [my]4673-the bishop girlhood]6211-a priest who was the ideal of my girlhood 's dreams . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop smiled , and [his]4673-the bishop blue eyes looked into [Mora]144-mora 's with an expression of quiet interest .

" [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise ? "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " Preacher at [the Court]4621-the court ? Indeed , [I]4673-the bishop knew [him]185-father gervaise , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter ; and more than knew [him]185-father gervaise . [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise and [I]4673-the bishop had [the same grandparents]6218-the same grandparents . "[4673-the bishop]

" Ah , "[144-mora] cried [Mora]144-mora , eagerly , " then that accounts for a resemblance which from the first has haunted [me]144-mora , making of [our]6219-our friendship , at once , so sweetly intimate a thing . The voice and the eyes alone were like but , ah , so like ! [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise wore a beard , which hid [his]185-father gervaise mouth and chin ; but [his]185-father gervaise blue eyes had in them that kindly yet searching look , though not merry as yours oft are , [[my]144-mora lord]4881-my lord ; and [your]4881-my lord voice has ever made [me]144-mora think of [his]185-father gervaise .[144-mora]

" And once just once [his]185-father gervaise eyes looked at [me]4673-the bishop , across [the Castle hall]6221-the castle hall at [Windsor]27-windsor , with a deep glow of fire in them ; a look which made [me]4673-the bishop feel called to an altar whereon , if [I]4673-the bishop could but stand the test of fire , [I]4673-the bishop should be forever purified , uplifted , blest as was never [earthly maid]6222-earthly maid before , save only [[our]6219-our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady . All that night [I]4673-the bishop dreamed of it , and [my]4673-the bishop whole soul was filled with it , yet never again did [I]4673-the bishop see [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise . The next morning [he]185-father gervaise left [the Court]4621-the court , and soon after sailed for [Spain]64-spain ; and on the passage thither [the ship]5529-the ship foundered in a great storm , and [he]185-father gervaise , with [all on board]6226-all on board , perished . Heard [you]4673-the bishop of that , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord ? "[4673-the bishop]

" [I]4673-the bishop heard it , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" [All]410-all believed it , and mourned [him]185-father gervaise ; for by all [he]185-father gervaise was beloved . But never could [I]4673-the bishop feel that [he]185-father gervaise was dead . Always for [me]4673-the bishop it seemed that [he]185-father gervaise still lived . And last night when [I]4673-the bishop entered across [the great hall chamber]2395-the great hall chamber , it seemed as if , once more , the eyes of [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise looked upon [me]4673-the bishop , with that glowing fire in them , which called [me]4673-the bishop to an altar . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop smiled again , and there was in [his]4673-the bishop look a gentle merriment .

" [You]4673-the bishop were over - strained , [[my]4673-the bishop daughter]4891-my daughter . When [you]4673-the bishop drew near , [you]4673-the bishop found instead of [a ghostly priest with eyes of fire , drowned many years ago]6231-a ghostly priest with eyes of fire , drowned many years ago , off the coast of [Spain]64-spain [[your]4673-the bishop old friend]5611-your old friend , [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester , who had stolen a march on [you]4673-the bishop , by reason of the swift paces of [his]5611-your old friend good mare , [Shulamite]173-shulamite . "[4673-the bishop]

[Mora]144-mora leaned forward , and laid [her]144-mora hand on [his]4673-the bishop .

" Mock not , [[my]144-mora friend]6233-my friend , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said . " There was a time when [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise stood to [me]144-mora for all [my]144-mora heart held dearest . Yet [I]144-mora loved [him]4673-the bishop , not as [a girl]1168-a girl loves [a man]4482-a man , but rather as [a nun]412-a nun loves [[her]412-a nun Lord]6237-her lord . [He]4673-the bishop stood to [me]144-mora for all that was noblest and best ; and , above all , for all that was vital and alive in life and in religion ; strong to act ; able to endure . [He]4673-the bishop confessed [me]144-mora once , and told [me]144-mora , when [I]144-mora kneeled before the crucifix , to say of [Him]4673-the bishop Who hangs thereon : ' [He]4673-the bishop ever liveth to make intercession for [us]6238-us . ' Never have [I]144-mora forgotten it . And sometimes when [I]144-mora say the sacred words , and , saying them , [my]144-mora mind turns to [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise , an echo seems to whisper to [my]144-mora spirit : ' [He]4673-the bishop , also , liveth . ' "[144-mora]

[Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester rose .

" [[My]154-symon of worcester daughter]4891-my daughter , "[154-symon of worcester] [he]154-symon of worcester said , " the sun is high in the heavens . [We]6238-us must not linger here . [Hugh]132-hugh will be seeking [[his]132-hugh bride]4744-his bride , and [Mistress Deborah]209-mistress deborah be waxing anxious over the escape of [her]209-mistress deborah charge . The morning meal will be ready in [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall ; after which [we]6238-us must to [the chapel]5170-the chapel , for the marriage . Then , without delay , [I]154-symon of worcester ride to [Worcester]1-worcester to make all right at [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery . Let [us]6238-us go . "[154-symon of worcester]

As [Mora]144-mora walked beside [him]154-symon of worcester across [the sunny lawn]2523-the sunny lawn , " [Father]185-father gervaise , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said , " think [you]185-father gervaise the heart of [a nun]412-a nun can ever become again as the heart of [other women]6245-other women ? "[144-mora]

CHAPTER XXXVI

STRONG TO ACT ; ABLE TO ENDURE

Back to [Worcester]1-worcester rode [the Bishop]92-bishop .

[Gallop ! Gallop]215-gallop ! gallop ! along [the grassy rides]2524-the grassy rides , beside [the hard highway]2525-the hard highway .

Hasten good Shulamite , black and comely still , though flecked with foam .

Important work lies ahead . Every moment is precious .

If [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress should send to [the Palace]1309-the palace , mischief will be done , which it will not be easy to repair .

If news of the flight of [the Prioress]373-the prioress reaches [the city of]271-the city of [Worcester]1-worcester , [a hundred tongues , spiteful , ignorant , curious]2529-a hundred tongues , spiteful , ignorant , curious , or merely idle , will at once start wagging .

Gallop , gallop , [Shulamite]173-shulamite !

How impossible to overtake a rumour , if it have an hour 's start of [you]2530-you . As well attempt to catch up the water which first rushed through the sluice - gates , opened an hour before [you]2530-you reached [the dam]2531-the dam .

How impossible to remake a reputation once broken . Before the priceless Venetian goblet fell from the table on to the flagged floor , one hand put forth in time might have hindered its fall . But failing that timely hand when , a second later , it lies in a hundred pieces , the hands of [the whole world]4773-the whole world are powerless to make it again as it was before it fell .

Faster , faster , [Shulamite]173-shulamite !

When [the messenger of [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress]2533-the messenger of mother sub - prioress reports the absence of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , [he]2533-the messenger of mother sub - prioress will most certainly be sent in haste to [Father Benedict]180-father benedict , who will experience a sinister joy at the prospect of following [his]180-father benedict long nose into [the Prioress 's empty cell]2535-the prioress 's empty cell , who will scent out scandal where there is but a fragrance of lilies , and tear to pieces [Mora]144-mora 's reputation , with as little compunction as a wolf tears a lamb .

Gallop , gallop , [Shulamite]173-shulamite ! If no hand be put forth to save it , between [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress and [Father Benedict]180-father benedict , this crystal bowl will be broken into a hundred pieces .

At length [the Bishop]4673-the bishop drew rein , and walked [his]4673-the bishop mare a mile . [He]4673-the bishop had left [Warwick]32-warwick ten miles behind [him]4673-the bishop . [He]4673-the bishop would soon be half - way to [Worcester]1-worcester .

[He]4673-the bishop had left [Warwick]32-warwick behind [him]4673-the bishop !

It seemed to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop that , ever since [he]4673-the bishop had first known [Mora de Norelle]144-mora , [he]4673-the bishop had always been riding away and leaving behind . For [her]144-mora sake [he]4673-the bishop rode away , leaving behind [the Court]4621-the court , [[his]4673-the bishop various offices]2539-his various offices , [his]4673-the bishop growing influence and popularity .

For [her]144-mora sake [he]4673-the bishop left [his]4673-the bishop identity as [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise at [the bottom of [the ocean]5540-the ocean]5539-the bottom of the ocean , taking up [his]4673-the bishop life again , in [Italy]40-italy , under [his]4673-the bishop other name .

For [her]144-mora sake , when [he]4673-the bishop heard that [she]144-mora had entered [the Convent of the White Ladies]6013-the convent of the white ladies , [he]4673-the bishop obtained the appointment to [the see of [Worcester]1-worcester]5619-the see of worcester , leaving [the sunny land]2544-the sunny land [he]4673-the bishop loved , and the prospect of far higher preferment there .

And now for [her]144-mora sake [he]4673-the bishop rode away from [Warwick]32-warwick as fast as steed could carry [him]4673-the bishop , leaving [her]144-mora the bride of another , in whose hand [he]4673-the bishop had [himself]4673-the bishop placed [hers]144-mora , pronouncing [the Church]4592-the church 's blessing upon [their]2546-their union .

Riding away leaving behind ; leaving behind riding away . This was what [his]4673-the bishop love had ever brought [him]4673-the bishop .

Yet [he]4673-the bishop felt rich to - day , finding [himself]4673-the bishop in possession of the certain knowledge that [he]4673-the bishop had been right in judging necessary , that first departure into exile long years ago .

For had [not Mora]144-mora told [him]4673-the bishop little dreaming to whom [she]144-mora spoke that there was a time when [he]4673-the bishop had stood to [her]144-mora for all [her]144-mora heart held dearest ; yet that [she]144-mora had loved [him]4673-the bishop , not as [a girl]1168-a girl loves [a man]4482-a man , but rather as [a nun]412-a nun loves [[her]412-a nun Lord]6237-her lord .

But surely [a man]4482-a man would need to be divine to be so loved , and to hold such love aright . And , even then , when [that other man]2552-that other man arrived who would fain woo [her]144-mora to love [him]4673-the bishop as [a girl]1168-a girl loves [a man]4482-a man , would [her]144-mora heart be free to respond to the call of nature ? Nay . To all intents and purposes , [her]144-mora heart would be a cloistered thing ; yet would [she]144-mora be neither [bride of Christ]2555-bride of christ nor [bride of [man]4362-man]2556-bride of man . The fire in [his]4673-the bishop eyes would indeed have called [her]144-mora to an altar , and the sacrifice laid thereon would be the full completion of [her]144-mora womanhood .

" [I]4673-the bishop did well to pass into exile , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , reviewing the past , as [he]4673-the bishop rode . Yet deep in [his]4673-the bishop heart was the comfort of those words [she]144-mora had said : that once [he]4673-the bishop had stood to [her]144-mora for all [her]144-mora heart held dearest . [Mora]144-mora , [the girl]2559-the girl , had felt thus ; [Mora]144-mora , [the woman]809-the woman , remembered it ; and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , as [he]4673-the bishop thought of both , offered up a thanksgiving that neither [he]4673-the bishop nor [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise had done aught which was unworthy of the ideal of [her]144-mora girlhood 's dream .

Gathering up the reins , [he]4673-the bishop urged [Shulamite]173-shulamite to a rapid trot . There must be no lingering by the way .

Hasten , [Shulamite]173-shulamite ! Even now the sluice - gates may be opening . Even now the crystal bowl may be slipping from its pedestal , presently to lie in a hundred fragments on the ground .

Nay , trotting will scarce do . Gallop , gallop , [brave black mare]2562-brave black mare !

The city walls are just in sight .

Well done !

Not far from [the Convent]328-the convent gate , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop chanced , by great good fortune , upon [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , trying in the meadows the paces of a young horse , but lately purchased .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop bade [the lay - brother]5259-the lay - brother ride with [him]4673-the bishop to [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery and , so soon as [he]4673-the bishop should have dismounted , lead [Shulamite]173-shulamite to [the Palace stables]2568-the palace stables , carefully feed and tend [her]173-shulamite ; then bring [him]160-brother philip out a fresh mount .

As [they]2569-they rode forward : " Hath any message arrived at [the Palace]1309-the palace from [the Convent]328-the convent , [Philip]160-brother philip ? "[4673-the bishop] inquired [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " None , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord . "[4673-the bishop]

" Or at [the Priory]67-the priory ? "[4673-the bishop]

" Nay , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord . But [I]4673-the bishop did hear , at [the Priory]67-the priory , a strange rumour "[4673-the bishop]

" Rumours are rarely worth regarding or repeating , [Brother Philip]160-brother philip . "[4673-the bishop]

" True , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord . Yet having so lately aided [her]173-shulamite to ride upon [Icon]174-icon "[4673-the bishop]

" ' [Her]173-shulamite ' ? With whom then is rumour making free ? And what saith this Priory rumour concerning ' [her]173-shulamite ' ? "[4673-the bishop] " [They]6251-they say [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , [hath]6253-hath fled [the Convent]328-the convent . "[4673-the bishop]

" [Mary Antony]85-mary antony ! "[4673-the bishop] exclaimed [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , and [his]4673-the bishop voice held the most extraordinary combination of amazement , relief , and incredulity . " But , in heaven 's name , [good brother]6255-good brother , wherefore should [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister leave [the Convent]328-the convent ? "[4673-the bishop]

" [They]6251-they say [she]264-the old lay - sister was making [her]264-the old lay - sister way into [the city]1177-the city in search of [you]4673-the bishop , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord ; but [she]264-the old lay - sister hath not reached [the Palace]1309-the palace . "[4673-the bishop]

" Any other rumour , [Philip]160-brother philip ? "[4673-the bishop]

" Nay , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , none ; save that [the Prioress]373-the prioress is distraught with anxiety concerning [the aged nun]6263-the aged nun , and has commanded that the underground way to [the Cathedral crypt]297-the cathedral crypt be searched ; though , indeed , [the porteress]4960-the porteress confesses to having let [Sister Mary Antony]85-mary antony out at the gate . "[4673-the bishop]

" Rumour again , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " and not a word of truth in it , [I]4673-the bishop warrant . Deny it , right and left , [[my]4673-the bishop good [Philip]160-brother philip]6019-my good philip ; and say , on [my]4673-the bishop authority , that [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother hath most certainly not caused [the crypt]273-the crypt way to be searched . [I]4673-the bishop would [I]4673-the bishop could lay hands on [the originator of these foolish tales]6269-the originator of these foolish tales . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop spoke with apparent vexation , but [his]4673-the bishop heart had bounded in the upspring of a great relief . Was [he]4673-the bishop after all in time to save with outstretched hand that most priceless crystal bowl ?

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop dismounted outside [the Convent]328-the convent gate . [He]4673-the bishop took [Shulamite]173-shulamite 's nose into [his]4673-the bishop hand , and spoke gently in [her]173-shulamite ear .

Then : " Lead [her]173-shulamite [home]305-home , [Philip]160-brother philip , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " and surround [her]173-shulamite with tenderest care . [Her]173-shulamite brave heart hath done wonders this day . It is for [us]6271-us to see that [her]173-shulamite body doth not pay the penalty . Here ! Take [her]173-shulamite rein , and go . "[4673-the bishop]

[Mary Mark]206-mary mark looked out through [the wicket]2576-the wicket , in response to a knocking on the door . [She]2577-her gasped when [she]2577-her saw [the Lord Bishop]92-bishop , on foot , without the gate .

Quickly [she]2577-her opened , wide , and wider ; hiding [her]2577-her buxom form behind the door .

But [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had no thought for [Mary Mark]206-mary mark , nor inclination to play hide - and - seek with [a conscience - stricken porteress]2579-a conscience - stricken porteress .

Avoiding the front entrance , [he]4673-the bishop crossed [the courtyard]775-the courtyard to the right , passed beneath the rose - arch , along [the yew walk]2581-the yew walk , and over [the lawn]2475-the lawn , to the seat under the beech , where two days before [he]4673-the bishop had awaited the coming of [the Prioress]373-the prioress .

Here [he]4673-the bishop paused for a moment , looking toward [the silent cloisters]2584-the silent cloisters , and picturing [her]2577-her tall figure , [her]2577-her flowing veil and stately tread , advancing toward [him]4673-the bishop over [the sunny lawn]2523-the sunny lawn .

Yet no . Even in these surroundings [he]4673-the bishop could not see [her]2577-her now as [Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress . Even across [the Convent lawn]2586-the convent lawn there moved to meet [him]4673-the bishop [the lovely woman with jewelled girdle , white robe , and coronet of golden hair [the bride of [Hugh]132-hugh]2588-the bride of hugh]2587-the lovely woman with jewelled girdle , white robe , and coronet of golden hair the bride of hugh .

Perhaps this was the hardest moment to [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester , in the whole of that hard day .

It was the one time when [he]4673-the bishop thought of [himself]4673-the bishop .

" [I]4673-the bishop have lost [her]2577-her ! "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " Holy Jesu [Thou]6272-thou Whose heart did break after three hours of darkness and of God - forsaken loneliness have pity ! The light of [my]4673-the bishop life is gone from [me]4673-the bishop , yet must [I]4673-the bishop live . "[4673-the bishop]

Overwhelmed by this sudden realisation of loss , worn out in mind and exhausted in body , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop sank upon the seat .

[Mora]144-mora was safe with [Hugh]132-hugh . That much had been accomplished .

For the rest , things must take their own course . [He]4673-the bishop could do no more go no further .

Then [he]4673-the bishop heard again [her]2587-the lovely woman with jewelled girdle , white robe , and coronet of golden hair the bride of hugh voice in the arbour of golden roses , saying , in those low sweet tones which thrilled [his]4673-the bishop very soul : " [He]2591-the little knight of the bloody vest stood to [me]2587-the lovely woman with jewelled girdle , white robe , and coronet of golden hair the bride of hugh for all that was vital and alive , in life and in religion ; strong to act ; able to endure . "[2587-the lovely woman with jewelled girdle , white robe , and coronet of golden hair the bride of hugh]

During five minutes [the Bishop]4673-the bishop sat , eyes closed , hands firmly clasped .

So still [he]4673-the bishop sat , that [the little Knight of the Bloody Vest]2591-the little knight of the bloody vest , watching , with bright eyes , from the tree overhead , almost made up [his]2591-the little knight of the bloody vest mind to drop to the other end of the seat . [He]2591-the little knight of the bloody vest was missing [Sister Mary Antony]85-mary antony , who had not appeared at all that morning . This meant neither crumbs nor cheese , and [the " little vain man]6273-the " little vain man "[91-mother sub - prioress] was hungry .

But at the end of five minutes [the Bishop]4673-the bishop rose , calm and purposeful ; moved firmly up [the lawn]2475-the lawn , mounted the steps , and passed into [the cloisters]316-the cloisters .

CHAPTER XXXVII

WHAT [MOTHER SUB - PRIORESS]91-mother sub - prioress KNEW

[Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress had applied [her]91-mother sub - prioress eye , for the fiftieth time , to the keyhole ; but naught could [she]91-mother sub - prioress see in [[the Prioress]373-the prioress 's cell]1809-the prioress 's cell , save a portion of the great wooden cross against the opposite wall .

[Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , mounted upon a stool , attempted to spy through the hole over the rope and pulley by means of which [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother rang the Convent bell . But all [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca saw , after bumping [her]90-sister mary rebecca head upon a beam , and [her]90-sister mary rebecca nose on the wall , owing to the impossibility of getting it out of the way of [her]90-sister mary rebecca eye , was a portion of the top of [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother 's window .

[She]90-sister mary rebecca cried out , as a great discovery , that the curtains were drawn back ; upon which , [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , exclaiming , tartly , that that had been long ago observed from [the garden below]2599-the garden below , pushed the stool in [her]90-sister mary rebecca anger , and sent [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca flying .

Jumping to save [herself]90-sister mary rebecca , [she]90-sister mary rebecca alighted heavily on the feet of [Sister Teresa]113-sister teresa , striking [Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine full in the face with [her]90-sister mary rebecca elbow , and scattering , to right and left , [the crowd]2600-the crowd around the door .

This cleared a view for [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress straight down [the passage]497-the passage and through the big open door , to [the cloisters]316-the cloisters ; when , looking up to scold [Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca for taking such a leap , to bid [Sister Teresa]113-sister teresa cease writhing , and [Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine to shriek in [[her]102-sister seraphine cell]321-her cell with the door shut , if shriek [she]102-sister seraphine must [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress saw [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , alone and unattended , walking toward [them]2605-we from [the cloisters]316-the cloisters .

" Benedicite , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , as [he]4673-the bishop approached . " [I]4673-the bishop am fortunate in chancing to find [the whole community]2291-the whole community assembled . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop 's uplifted fingers brought [the nuns]298-the nuns to [their]298-the nuns knees ; but [they]298-the nuns rose at once to [their]298-the nuns feet again and crowded behind [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress as , taking a step forward , [she]91-mother sub - prioress hastened to explain the situation .

" [[My]91-mother sub - prioress Lord [Bishop]92-bishop]4963-my lord bishop , [you]92-bishop find [us]2605-we in much distress . [The Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother is locked into [[her]93-the reverend mother cell]321-her cell , and [we]2605-we fear that , after a long night of vigil and fasting , [she]93-the reverend mother hath swooned . [We]2605-we can not get an answer by much knocking , and [we]2605-we have no means of forcing the door , which is of most massive strength and thickness . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop looked searchingly into the ferrety face of [Mother Sub - Prioress]324-mother sub - prioress , but [he]4673-the bishop saw naught there save genuine distress and perplexity .

[He]4673-the bishop looked at the massive door , and at [the excited crowd of [nuns]2613-nuns]2612-the excited crowd of nuns . [He]4673-the bishop even gave [himself]4673-the bishop time to note that the nose and lip of [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine were beginning to swell , and to experience a whimsical wish that [the Knight]764-the knight could see [her]102-sister seraphine .

Then [his]4673-the bishop calm , observant eye turned again to [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress .

" And why do [you]91-mother sub - prioress make so sure , [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , that [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother is indeed within [[her]427-the reverend mother cell]321-her cell ? "[4673-the bishop] " Because [we]6279-we know [her]427-the reverend mother to be , "[91-mother sub - prioress] replied [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , as tartly as [she]91-mother sub - prioress dared , when addressing [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop . " Permit [me]91-mother sub - prioress , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , to recount to [you]155-reverend father the happenings of the last twenty hours .[91-mother sub - prioress]

" Soon after [her]427-the reverend mother return from [Vespers]17-vespers , yestereven , [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother sent word by [Mary Antony]85-mary antony that [she]427-the reverend mother purposed again spending the night in prayer and vigil , and would not be present at the evening meal ; also that [she]427-the reverend mother must not , on any account whatever , be disturbed . [Mary Antony]85-mary antony took this message to [the kitchens]4328-the kitchens , bidding [the younger lay - sisters]1024-the younger lay - sisters to prepare the meal without [her]85-mary antony , saying [she]427-the reverend mother cared not how badly it was served , seeing [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother would not be there to partake of it . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

[Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress paused to sniff , and to give [the other nuns]644-the other nuns an opportunity for ejaculations concerning [Sister Antony]85-mary antony . But [their]644-the other nuns awe of [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop , and [their]644-the other nuns genuine anxiety for [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , kept [them]644-the other nuns silent .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop stroked [his]4673-the bishop chin , keeping the corners of [his]4673-the bishop mouth firmly in place by means of [his]4673-the bishop thumb and finger . [Old Antony]103-mary antony was delectably funny when [she]103-mary antony said these things [herself]103-mary antony ; but [she]103-mary antony was delectably funnier , when [her]103-mary antony remarks were repeated by [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress .

" [The old creature]6282-the old creature , "[91-mother sub - prioress] continued [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , eyeing [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's meditative hand suspiciously , " then betook [herself]6282-the old creature to the outer gates , told [the porteress]4960-the porteress that [she]6282-the old creature had [your]4673-the bishop orders , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , to report to [you]4673-the bishop if [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother again elected to pass a night in vigil and in fasting , because [you]4673-the bishop and [she]6282-the old creature [you]4673-the bishop and [she]6282-the old creature forsooth ! were made anxious by the too constant fasting and the too prolonged vigils of [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother . [Mary Mark]206-mary mark very properly refused to allow the old "[91-mother sub - prioress]

" [Lay - sister]6286-lay - sister , "[4673-the bishop] interposed [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , sternly .

[Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress gasped ; then made obeisance : " [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister to leave [the Convent]328-the convent . [Whereupon Sister Antony]217-whereupon sister antony sent [Mary Mark]206-mary mark to deliver [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's message to [me]91-mother sub - prioress , bribing [her]6282-the old creature , with the promise of a gift from [you]4673-the bishop , [[my]91-mother sub - prioress lord]4881-my lord , to leave [her]6282-the old creature the key . When [the porteress]4960-the porteress returned , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony was gone , having left the great doors ajar , and the key within the lock . [She]6282-the old creature has not been seen since . Did [she]6282-the old creature reach [the Palace]1309-the palace , and speak with [you]4673-the bishop , [[my]91-mother sub - prioress lord]4881-my lord ? Is [she]6282-the old creature now in safety at [the Palace]1309-the palace ? "[91-mother sub - prioress]

" Nay , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop gravely . " [Sister Mary Antony]85-mary antony hath not been seen at [the Palace]1309-the palace . "[4673-the bishop]

" Alack - a - day ! "[99-sister abigail] exclaimed [Sister Abigail]99-sister abigail ; ' [she]2623-she will have fallen by the way , and perished ! [She]2623-she was too old to face [the world]389-the world or attempt to reach [the city]1177-the city . "[2623-she]

" Peace , [girl]6295-girl ! "[419-the sub - prioress] commanded [the Sub - Prioress]419-the sub - prioress . " [Thy]419-the sub - prioress comments and [thy]419-the sub - prioress wailings mend not the matter , and do but incense [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop . "[419-the sub - prioress]

Nothing could have appeared less incensed than [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's benign countenance . But [he]4673-the bishop had spoken sternly to [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , therefore [she]419-the sub - prioress endeavoured to put [herself]419-the sub - prioress in the right by charging [him]4673-the bishop , at the first opportunity , with unreasonable irritation .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop reassured [Sister Abigail]99-sister abigail , with a smile ; then , pointing toward the closed door : " Proceed with [your]6295-girl recital , [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " [You]6295-girl have as yet given [me]4673-the bishop no proof confirming [your]6295-girl belief that [the Prioress]373-the prioress is within [the cell]291-the cell . "[4673-the bishop]

" When the absence of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony became known , [[my]91-mother sub - prioress lord]4881-my lord , "[91-mother sub - prioress] continued [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , " [we]6300-we felt it right to acquaint [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother with [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister 's flight . [I]91-mother sub - prioress , [myself]91-mother sub - prioress , knocked upon this door ; but the only reply [I]91-mother sub - prioress received was the continuous low chanting of prayers , from within ; not so much a clear chanting , as a murmur ; and whenever , during the night , [nuns]2613-nuns listened at the door , or ventured again to tap , the sound of [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's voice , reciting psalms or prayers , reached [them]2613-nuns . As [you]4881-my lord may remember , [[my]91-mother sub - prioress lord]4881-my lord , the ground upon the other side of [the building]1118-the building is on a lower level than [the cloister lawn]6306-the cloister lawn . The windows of [[the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother 's cell]428-the reverend mother 's cell are therefore raised above the shrubbery and it is not possible to see into [the chamber]627-the chamber . But [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , who went round after dark , noted that [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother had lighted [her]427-the reverend mother tapers and drawn [her]427-the reverend mother curtains . This morning the light is extinguished , the curtains are drawn back , and the casement flung open . Moreover at the usual hour for rising , [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother rang the bell , as is [her]427-the reverend mother custom , to waken [the nuns]298-the nuns rang it from within [[her]427-the reverend mother cell]321-her cell , by means of this rope and pulley . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

" Ah , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" [Sister Abigail]99-sister abigail , up already , thereupon ran to [[the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's cell]428-the reverend mother 's cell ; and , the bell still swinging , tapped and asked if [she]427-the reverend mother might bring in milk and bread . Once more the only answer was the low chanting of prayers . Also , [Sister Abigail]99-sister abigail declares , the voice was so weak and faltering , [she]99-sister abigail scarce knew it for [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's . And since then , [[my]91-mother sub - prioress lord]4881-my lord , there has been silence within [the cell]291-the cell , and a sore sense of fear within [our]6317-our hearts ; for it is unlike [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother to keep [her]427-the reverend mother door locked , when [the entire community]633-the entire community calls and knocks without . "[91-mother sub - prioress]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop lifted [his]4673-the bishop hand .

" In that speak [you]91-mother sub - prioress truly , [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , "[4673-the bishop] said [he]4673-the bishop . " Also [I]4673-the bishop must tell [you]91-mother sub - prioress without further delay , that [the Prioress]373-the prioress is not within [[her]373-the prioress cell]321-her cell . "[4673-the bishop]

" Not within [[her]373-the prioress cell]321-her cell ! "[91-mother sub - prioress] exclaimed [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress .

" Not within [[her]373-the prioress cell]321-her cell ! "[4673-the bishop] shrieked a score of terrified voices , like seagulls calling to [each other , before a gathering storm]2631-each other , before a gathering storm .

" [The Prioress]373-the prioress left [the Convent]328-the convent yesterday afternoon , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " with [my]4673-the bishop knowledge and approval ; travelling at once , with a sufficient escort , to a place some distance from [Worcester]1-worcester , where [I]4673-the bishop also spent the night . [I]4673-the bishop have come to bring [you]91-mother sub - prioress a message from [[His]373-the prioress Holiness [the Pope]5391-the pope]5390-his holiness the pope , sent to [me]4673-the bishop direct from [Rome]37-rome . . . . [The Holy Father]5435-the holy father bids [me]4673-the bishop say that [[your]91-mother sub - prioress Prioress]6328-your prioress has been moved on by [me]4673-the bishop , with [his]5435-the holy father full knowledge and approval , to a place where [she]6328-your prioress is required for higher service . Perhaps [I]4673-the bishop may also tell [you]91-mother sub - prioress , "[4673-the bishop] added [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , looking with kindly sympathy upon all the blankly disconcerted faces , " that this morning [I]4673-the bishop [myself]4673-the bishop performed a solemn rite , for which [I]4673-the bishop held [the Pope]5391-the pope 's especial mandate , setting apart [[your]91-mother sub - prioress late Prioress]6330-your late prioress for this higher service . [She]6328-your prioress grieved that it was not possible to bid [you]91-mother sub - prioress farewell . [She]6328-your prioress sends [you]91-mother sub - prioress loving greetings , [her]6328-your prioress thanks for loyalty and obedience , and prays that the blessing of [the Lord]4319-the lord may ever be with [you]91-mother sub - prioress . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop ceased speaking .

At first there was an amazed silence .

Then the unexpected happened . [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , without any warning , broke into passionate weeping .

Never before had [Mother Sub - Prioress]324-mother sub - prioress been known to weep . The sight petrified [the Convent]328-the convent . Yet somehow all knew that [she]324-mother sub - prioress wept because , in the hard old nut which did duty for [her]324-mother sub - prioress heart , there was a kernel of deep love for [[their]2637-their noble Prioress]2638-their noble prioress .

[The other nuns]644-the other nuns wept , because [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress wept .

The sobbing became embarrassing in its completeness . Wheresoever [the Bishop]4673-the bishop looked [he]4673-the bishop was confronted by [a weeping nun]2641-a weeping nun . Suddenly [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress dried [her]91-mother sub - prioress eyes , holding [herself]91-mother sub - prioress once more in control . It had just occurred to [her]91-mother sub - prioress that [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's word could not be taken against the evidence of all [their]2637-their senses ! On that very morning , at five o'clock the Convent call to rise had been rung from within [[the Prioress]373-the prioress 's cell]1809-the prioress 's cell !

So [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress dried [her]91-mother sub - prioress eyes , punished [her]91-mother sub - prioress nose for sharing in the general breakdown , and looking with belligerent eye at [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , said : " If [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother be not within [[her]373-the prioress cell]321-her cell , perhaps it will please [you]4673-the bishop , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , to inform [the Convent]328-the convent who is within [it]321-her cell ! "[4673-the bishop]

" That point , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " can speedily be settled . "[4673-the bishop]

[He]4673-the bishop took from [his]4673-the bishop girdle [the Prioress]373-the prioress 's master - key , handed over to [him]4673-the bishop before [he]4673-the bishop left [Warwick]32-warwick .

Fitting it into the lock , [he]4673-the bishop opened the door of [the cell]291-the cell , and entered , followed by [the Sub - Prioress]419-the sub - prioress and [a crowd of palpitating , eager nuns]2650-a crowd of palpitating , eager nuns .

A few paces from the door [the Bishop]4673-the bishop paused , signing to [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress to come forward , but restraining , with uplifted hand , those who pressed in behind [her]373-the prioress .

[The chamber]627-the chamber was very still .

[The chair of [the Prioress]373-the prioress]2653-the chair of the prioress was empty .

But , before [the shrine of [the Madonna]435-the madonna]485-the shrine of the madonna , there lay , stretched upon the floor , the unconscious form of [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony .

CHAPTER XXXVIII

[THE BISHOP KEEPS VIGIL

Old Mary Antony]218-the bishop keeps vigil old mary antony lay dying .

[The Bishop]218-the bishop keeps vigil old mary antony had not allowed [her]85-mary antony to be carried from [the cell of [the Prioress]373-the prioress]1064-the cell of the prioress , to [her]85-mary antony own . [He]4673-the bishop had commanded that [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's couch be moved from [the inner room]614-the inner room and placed before [the shrine of [the Virgin]608-the virgin]823-the shrine of the virgin . On this lay [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , while [the Bishop]4673-the bishop [himself]4673-the bishop kept watch beside [her]85-mary antony .

The evening light came in through the open casement , illumining the calm old face , from which the soothing hand of death was already smoothing the wrinkles .

Five hours had passed since [they]2664-they found [her]85-mary antony .

It had taken long to restore [her]85-mary antony to consciousness ; and so soon as [she]85-mary antony awoke to [her]85-mary antony surroundings , and recognised [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , and the many faces around [her]85-mary antony , [she]85-mary antony relapsed into silence , refusing to answer any questions , yet keeping [her]85-mary antony eyes anxiously fixed upon the door .

Seeing which , [Sister Teresa]113-sister teresa slipped from [the room]495-the room and ran secretly to tell [the Lord Bishop]751-the lord bishop , who had paid but a brief visit to [the Palace]1309-the palace and was now pacing [the lawn below [the cloisters]316-the cloisters]2668-the lawn below the cloisters .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop came at once ; when , seeing [him]4673-the bishop enter , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony gave a cry , striving to raise [herself]85-mary antony from the pillows .

Moving to the bedside , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop laid [his]4673-the bishop hand upon the shaking hands , which had been clasped at sight of [him]4673-the bishop .

An eager question was in the eyes lifted to [his]4673-the bishop .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop bent over the couch .

" Yes , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , and smiled .

The anxious look faded . The eyes closed . A triumphant smile illumined the dying face .

Turning , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop asked a few whispered questions of [the Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress .

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony had taken a sip of wine , but seemed to find it impossible to partake of food . [She]85-mary antony had been so long without , that now nature refused it .

" Undoubtedly [she]85-mary antony is dying , "[91-mother sub - prioress] said [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , not unkindly , but in the matter - of - fact tone of [one to whom the hard outline of a fact is unsoftened by the atmosphere of imagination or of sympathy]2674-one to whom the hard outline of a fact is unsoftened by the atmosphere of imagination or of sympathy .

" [I]4673-the bishop know it , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , in low tones . " Therefore am [I]4673-the bishop come to confess [[our]6336-our sister]6337-our sister and to administer the final rites and consolations of [the Church]4592-the church . [I]4673-the bishop have with [me]4673-the bishop all that is needed . [You]6339-you may now withdraw , and leave [me]4673-the bishop to watch alone beside [Sister Mary Antony]85-mary antony . "[4673-the bishop]

" [We]6336-our sent for [Father Peter]219-father peter , "[91-mother sub - prioress] began [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , " but [she]91-mother sub - prioress paid no heed to any of [his]219-father peter questions , neither would [she]91-mother sub - prioress "[91-mother sub - prioress]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop took one step toward [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , with uplifted hand , pointing to the door .

[Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress hastened out .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop followed [her]91-mother sub - prioress into [the passage]497-the passage , where [a waiting crowd of nuns]2679-a waiting crowd of nuns created that atmosphere of excited tension , which seizes [certain minds at the near approach of death]2680-certain minds at the near approach of death .

" [I]4673-the bishop bid [you]6339-you all to go to [[your]6339-you cells]6340-your cells , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " there to spend the next hour in earnest prayer for [the passing soul of [this aged nun who , during so long a time]6342-this aged nun who , during so long a time , has lived and worked in [this Convent]6343-this convent]6341-the passing soul of this aged nun who , during so long a time , has lived and worked in this convent . Let every door be closed . [I]4673-the bishop keep the final vigil alone . When [I]4673-the bishop need help [I]4673-the bishop shall ring the Convent bell . "[4673-the bishop]

Immovable in [the passage]497-the passage stood [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , until [every figure]2684-every figure had vanished ; every door had closed .

Then [he]4673-the bishop re - entered [[the Prioress]373-the prioress 's cell]1809-the prioress 's cell , and shut the door .

[He]4673-the bishop placed the holy oil on the step , before [the shrine of [the Madonna]435-the madonna]485-the shrine of the madonna , just where [old Antony]85-mary antony had knelt when [she]85-mary antony had prayed [[our]2689-our blessed [Lady]2691-lady]4297-our blessed lady to be pleased to sharpen [her]85-mary antony old wits .

Then [he]4673-the bishop drew forth a tiny flask of rare Italian workmanship , let fall a few drops from it into a spoonful of wine , and firmly poured the liquid between [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister 's parted lips .

One anxious moment ; then [he]4673-the bishop heard [her]264-the old lay - sister swallow .

At that , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop drew [the Prioress]373-the prioress 's chair to the side of the couch , and sat down to await events .

In a few moments the stertorous breathing ceased , the open mouth closed . [Mary Antony]85-mary antony sighed thrice , as [a little child that has wept before sleeping sighs in its sleep]2695-a little child that has wept before sleeping sighs in its sleep .

Then [she]85-mary antony opened [her]85-mary antony eyes , and fixed them on [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" [Reverend Father]155-reverend father "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony began , then chuckled , gleefully . [Her]85-mary antony voice had come back , and with it a great activity of brain , though the hands upon the coverlet seemed to belong to [someone else]2697-someone else , and [she]85-mary antony hoped [they]2698-they would not rise up and strike [her]85-mary antony . [Her]85-mary antony feet , [she]85-mary antony could not feel at all ; but , seeing that [she]85-mary antony was most comfortably lying there where [she]85-mary antony best loved to be , why should [she]85-mary antony require feet ? Feet are such tired things . [One]4240-one rests better without them .

" Speak low , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , bending forward . " Speak low , [dear Sister Antony]85-mary antony ; partly to spare [thy]85-mary antony strength ; and partly because , though [I]4673-the bishop have sent [all the White Ladies]414-all the white ladies to [[their]414-all the white ladies cells]299-their cells , [[our]6346-our good Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , in [her]91-mother sub - prioress natural anxiety for [thy]85-mary antony welfare , may be outside the door , even now . "[4673-the bishop]

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony chuckled .

" If [we]6346-our could but thrust a nail through into [her]91-mother sub - prioress ear , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony whispered . Then suddenly serious , [she]85-mary antony put the question which already [her]85-mary antony eyes had asked : " Did [I]85-mary antony succeed in keeping from [them]414-all the white ladies the flight of [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother , until [you]4673-the bishop arrived , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father ? "[85-mary antony] " Yes , faithful heart , wise beyond all expectation , [you]4673-the bishop did . "[85-mary antony]

Again [Mary Antony]85-mary antony chuckled .

" [I]85-mary antony locked them out , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony said , with a knowing wink , " but [I]85-mary antony also took [them]414-all the white ladies in . [Yea]6348-yea , verily , [I]85-mary antony took [them]414-all the white ladies in ! Scores of times [they]414-all the white ladies called [me]85-mary antony ' [Reverend Mother]4474-reverend mother . ' ' Open the door , [I]85-mary antony humbly pray [you]4673-the bishop , [Reverend Mother]4474-reverend mother , ' pleaded [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress at the keyhole . ' Dixi : Custodiam vias meas , ' chanted [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , in a beauteous voice ! . . . ' Open , open , [Reverend Mother]4474-reverend mother ! ' besought [a multitude]6352-a multitude without . ' Quid multiplicati sunt gui tribulant [me]85-mary antony ! ' intoned [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , within . . . . ' Most dear and [Reverend Mother]4474-reverend mother , ' crooned [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , at midnight , ' [I]85-mary antony have something of deepest importance to say ' ' Dixit insipiens , ' was [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's appropriate response . [Eh]220-eh , and [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , thinking none could observe [her]90-sister mary rebecca , had already been round , in the moonlight , and attempted to climb a tree .
