All [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother 's windows were closely curtained ; but [old Antony]85-mary antony had [her]85-mary antony eye to a crack , and the sight of [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca climbing , made all the other trees to shake with laughter , but is not a sight to be described to [the great Lord Bishop]1748-the great lord bishop . . . . Nay , then ! "[85-mary antony] with a startled cry " Why doth this knotted finger rise up and shake itself at [me]4673-the bishop ? "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop took the worn old hand , now stone cold , laid it back upon the quilt , and covered it with [his]4673-the bishop own .

The drug [he]4673-the bishop had administered had indeed revived the powers , but the over - excited brain was inclined to wander .

[He]4673-the bishop recalled it with a name which [he]4673-the bishop knew would act as a potent spell .

" Would [you]4673-the bishop have news of [the Prioress]373-the prioress , [Sister Antony]85-mary antony ? "[4673-the bishop]

[Instantly]221-instantly the eyes grew eager .

" Is [she]373-the prioress safe , [Reverend Father]4875-reverend father ? Is [she]373-the prioress well ? Hath [she]373-the prioress taken happiness to [her]373-the prioress with both hands , not thrusting it away ? "[221-instantly]

" [Happiness]222-happiness hath taken [her]373-the prioress by both hands , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " This morning [I]4673-the bishop blest [her]373-the prioress union with [a noble knight to whom [she]373-the prioress was betrothed]6357-a noble knight to whom she was betrothed before [she]373-the prioress came hither . "[4673-the bishop]

" [I]85-mary antony know , "[85-mary antony] whispered [old Antony]85-mary antony ecstatically . " [I]85-mary antony heard it all , [I]85-mary antony and [my]85-mary antony meat chopper , hidden in there ; [I]85-mary antony and [[my]85-mary antony meat chopper]6358-my meat chopper not willing to let [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother face danger alone . And [I]85-mary antony did thrust the handle of [the chopper]985-the chopper between [my]85-mary antony gums , that [I]85-mary antony might not cry ' Bravely done ! ' when [the noble Knight]986-the noble knight and [[his]986-the noble knight men]5031-his men - at - arms flung a rope over a strong bough , and hanged [that clerkly fellow somewhat lean and out at elbows]6362-that clerkly fellow somewhat lean and out at elbows . Oh , ah ? It was bravely done ! [I]85-mary antony heard it all ! [I]85-mary antony saw it all ! "[85-mary antony]

Then the joy faded ; a look of shame and grief came into [the old face]361-the old face .

" But having thus seen and heard has led [me]4673-the bishop into grievous sin , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father . Alas , [I]4673-the bishop have lied about holy things , sinning , [I]4673-the bishop fear [me]4673-the bishop , beyond forgiveness , though indeed [I]4673-the bishop did it , meaning to do well . May [I]4673-the bishop tell [you]155-reverend father all , [Reverend Father]4875-reverend father , that [you]155-reverend father may judge whether in that which [I]4673-the bishop did , [I]4673-the bishop acted according to [[our]6364-our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady 's will and intention , or whether the deceitfulness of [mine]4673-the bishop own heart has led [me]4673-the bishop into mortal sin ? "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop looked anxiously at the sun dipping slowly in the west . The effect of the drug [he]4673-the bishop had given should last an hour , if care were taken of this spurious strength . [He]4673-the bishop judged a quarter of that time to have already sped .

" Tell [me]4673-the bishop from the beginning , without reserve , [dear Antony]85-mary antony , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " But speak low , for [my]4673-the bishop ear only . Remember [possible listeners outside the door]6366-possible listeners outside the door . "[4673-the bishop]

So presently the whole tale was told , with many a quaint twist of [old Antony]85-mary antony 's . And [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's heart melted to tenderness as [she]85-mary antony whispered the story , and [he]4673-the bishop realised the greatness of the devotion which had gone forward , without a thought of self , in the bold endeavour to bring happiness to [the Prioress [she]85-mary antony loved]2706-the prioress she loved , yet the anxious conscience , which now trembled at the thought of that which the fearless heart had done .

" [I]4673-the bishop lied about holy things ; [I]4673-the bishop put words into [[our]6364-our blessed [Lady]6368-lady]4297-our blessed lady 's mouth ; [I]4673-the bishop said [she]85-mary antony moved [her]85-mary antony hand . But [you]4673-the bishop did tell [me]4673-the bishop , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , that [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother was so made that unless there was a vision or revelation from [[our]6364-our Lady]4260-our lady , [she]85-mary antony would thrust away [her]85-mary antony happiness with both hands . And there would not have been a vision if [old Antony]85-mary antony had not contrived one . Yet [I]4673-the bishop fear [me]4673-the bishop , for the sin of that contriving , [I]4673-the bishop shall never find forgiveness ; [my]4673-the bishop soul must ever stay in torment . "[4673-the bishop]

Tears coursed down the wrinkled cheeks .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop kneeled beside the bed .

" [Dear Antony]115-dear antony , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " Listen to [me]4673-the bishop . ' Perfect love casteth out fear , because fear hath torment . ' [You]115-dear antony have loved with a perfect love . [You]115-dear antony need have no fear . Trust in the love of [God]89-god , in the precious blood of [the Redeemer]2513-the redeemer , which cleanseth from all sin , in the understanding tenderness of [[our]6364-our Lady , who knoweth [a woman]813-a woman 's heart]6372-our lady , who knoweth a woman 's heart . [You]115-dear antony meant to do right ; and if , honestly intending to do well , [you]115-dear antony used the wrong means , Divine love , judging [you]115-dear antony by [your]115-dear antony intention , will pardon the mistake . ' If [we]6364-our confess [our]6364-our sins , [He]6374-he is faithful and just to forgive [us]6364-our [our]6364-our sins , and to cleanse [us]6364-our from all unrighteousness . ' Think no more of [yourself]115-dear antony , in this . Dwell solely on [[our]6364-our Lord]4256-our lord . Silence [your]115-dear antony own fears , by repeating : ' [He]6374-he is faithful and just . ' "[4673-the bishop]

" Think [you]115-dear antony , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , "[2708-the pathetic voice] quavered [the pathetic voice]2708-the pathetic voice , " that [They]6376-they will sometimes let [old Antony]85-mary antony out of hell for an hour , to sit on [her]85-mary antony jasper seat and see [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother walk up [the golden stairs]6378-the golden stairs , with [the splendid Knight]5935-the splendid knight on one side and [the great Lord Bishop]1748-the great lord bishop on the other ? "[2708-the pathetic voice]

" [Sister Mary Antony]85-mary antony , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , clearly and solemnly , " there is no place in hell for so faithful and so loving a heart . [You]115-dear antony shall go straight to [[your]115-dear antony jasper seat]6381-your jasper seat ; and because , with [the Lord]4319-the lord , one day is as a thousand years , and a thousand years as one day , [your]115-dear antony eyes will scarce have time to grow used to the great glory , before [you]115-dear antony see [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother coming , walking between [the two who have faithfully loved [her]93-the reverend mother]6383-the two who have faithfully loved her ; and [you]115-dear antony , who have also loved [her]93-the reverend mother faithfully , will also mount the golden stair , and together [we]6384-we all shall kneel before the throne of [God]89-god , and understand at last the full meaning of those words of wonder : [GOD]89-god IS LOVE . "[4673-the bishop]

A look of ineffable joy lit up the dying face .

" Straight to [[my]2710-her jasper seat]6385-my jasper seat , "[2710-her] [she]2710-her said , " to watch to wait "[2710-her]

Then came the sudden fading of the spurious strength . [The Bishop]4673-the bishop put out [his]4673-the bishop hand and reached for the holy oil .

The golden sunset light flooded [the chamber]627-the chamber with radiance .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop still watched beside the couch .

Having rallied sufficiently to make [her]2710-her last confession , short and simple as [a child]5212-a child 's ; having received absolution and the last sacred rites of [the Church]4592-the church , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony had slipped into a peaceful slumber .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop had to bend over and listen , to make sure that [she]2710-her still breathed .

Suddenly [she]2710-her opened [her]2710-her eyes and looked full into [his]4673-the bishop .

" Did [you]4673-the bishop [we]6386-we d [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother to [the splendid Knight]5935-the splendid knight ? "[2710-her] [she]2710-her asked , and [her]2710-her voice was strong again and natural , with the little chuckle of curiosity and humour in it , as of old .

" This morning , "[4673-the bishop] answered [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " [I]4673-the bishop wedded [them]6389-them . "[4673-the bishop]

" Did [he]5935-the splendid knight kiss [her]2710-her ? "[85-mary antony] asked [old Antony]85-mary antony , with an indescribable twinkle of gleeful enjoyment , though those twinkling eyes seemed the only living thing in the old face .

" Nay , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " [They]6389-them who truly kiss , kiss not in public . "[4673-the bishop]

" Ah , "[85-mary antony] whispered [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . " Yea , verily ! [I]85-mary antony know that to be true . "[85-mary antony]

[She]2710-her lifted wandering fingers and , after much groping , touched [her]2710-her forehead , with a happy smile .

Not knowing what else the action could mean , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop leaned forward and made the sign of the cross on [her]2710-her brow .

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony gave that peculiar little chuckle of enjoyment , which had always marked [her]85-mary antony pleasure when [the very learned]2720-the very learned made mistakes . It gave [her]85-mary antony so great a sense of cleverness .

After this the light faded from the old eyes , and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had begun to think [they]2722-they would not again open upon [this world]2723-this world , when a strange thing happened .

There was a flick of wings , and in , through the open window , flew the robin .

First [he]2724-he perched on the marble hand of [the Madonna]435-the madonna . Then , with a joyful chirp , dropped straight to the couch on which lay [Mary Antony]85-mary antony .

At sound of that chirp , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony opened [her]85-mary antony eyes , and saw [her]85-mary antony much loved little bird hopping gaily on the coverlet .

" Hey , [thou little vain man]4201-thou little vain man ! "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony said . " Ah , [naughty Master Pieman]111-master pieman ! Art come to look upon [old Antony]85-mary antony in [her]430-the old woman bed ? [The great Lord Bishop]92-bishop will have [thee]2724-he hanged . "[85-mary antony]

[The robin]339-the robin hopped nearer , and pecked gently at the hand which so oft had fed [him]2724-he , now lying helpless on the quilt .

A look of exquisite delight came into [the old woman]430-the old woman 's eyes .

" Ah , [[my]85-mary antony little Knight of the Bloody Vest]6391-my little knight of the bloody vest , "[85-mary antony] [she]85-mary antony whispered , " dost want [thy]6391-my little knight of the bloody vest cheese ? Wait a minute , while [old Antony]85-mary antony searches in [her]430-the old woman wallet . "[85-mary antony]

[She]85-mary antony sat up suddenly , as if to reach for something .

Then a startled look came into [her]85-mary antony face . [She]85-mary antony stretched out appealing hands to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

Instantly [he]4673-the bishop caught them in [his]4673-the bishop .

" Fear not , dear [Antony]85-mary antony , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " All is well . "[4673-the bishop]

The robin , spreading [his]339-the robin wings , flew out at the window . And the loving spirit of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony went with [him]339-the robin .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop laid [the worn - out body]2730-the worn - out body gently back upon the couch , closed the eyes , and folded the hands upon the breast .

Then [he]4673-the bishop walked over to the window , and stood looking at [the golden ramparts of [that sunset city]2732-that sunset city]2731-the golden ramparts of that sunset city , glowing against the delicate azure of the evening sky .

Great loneliness of soul came to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , standing thus in [the empty cell]960-the empty cell .

[The Prioress]373-the prioress had gone ; [the robin]339-the robin had gone ; [Mary Antony]85-mary antony had gone ; and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop greatly wished that [he]4673-the bishop might go , also .

Presently [he]4673-the bishop turned to [the Prioress]373-the prioress 's table . [She]373-the prioress had sent to [the Palace]1309-the palace the copy [she]373-the prioress had made , and the copy [she]373-the prioress had mended , of [the Pope]5391-the pope 's mandate . But [she]373-the prioress had left upon the table the strips of parchment upon which [she]373-the prioress had inscribed , on the night of [her]373-the prioress vigil , copies and translations of ancient prayers from the Sacramentaries . [The Bishop]4673-the bishop gathered these up , reading them as [he]4673-the bishop stood . Two [he]4673-the bishop slipped into [his]4673-the bishop sash , but the third [he]4673-the bishop took to the couch and placed beneath the folded hands .

" Take this with [thee]6392-thee to [thy]6392-thee jasper seat , [dear faithful heart]6393-dear faithful heart , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said ; " for truly it was given unto [thee]6392-thee to perceive and know what things [thou]6392-thee oughtest to do , and also to have grace and power faithfully to fulfil the same . "[4673-the bishop]

[The peaceful face , growing beautiful with that solemn look of eternal youth which death]2742-the peaceful face , growing beautiful with that solemn look of eternal youth which death brings , even to [the aged]2743-the aged , seemed to smile , as the precious parchment passed into the keeping of those folded hands .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop knelt long in prayer and thanksgiving . At length , with uplifted face , [he]4673-the bishop said : " And grant , O [[my]4673-the bishop God]6394-my god , that [I]4673-the bishop too may be faithful , unto the very end . "[4673-the bishop]

Then [he]4673-the bishop rose , and rang the Convent bell .

CHAPTER XXXIX

[THE " SPLENDID KNIGHT]6395-the " splendid knight "[6395-the " splendid knight]

On [the steps of [Warwick Castle]68-warwick castle]2745-the steps of warwick castle stood [the Knight]764-the knight and [[his]764-the knight bride]4744-his bride .

[Their]2748-their eyes still lingered on the archway through which the noble figure of [Symon]154-symon of worcester , [Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]1222-bishop of worcester , mounted upon [his]154-symon of worcester black mare , [Shulamite]173-shulamite , had just disappeared from view .

The marriage had taken place in [the Castle chapel]2750-the castle chapel , half an hour before , with an astonishing amount of pomp and ceremony . [Priests]2751-priests and [acolytes]2752-acolytes had appeared from unexpected places . Madonna lilies , on graceful stem , gleamed white in the shadows of [the sacred place]2753-the sacred place . Solemn music rose and fell ; the deep roll of the Gregorian chants , beginning with a low hum as of giant bees in a vast field of clover ; swelling , in full - throated unison , a majestic volume of sound which rang against the rafters , waking echoes in the clerestory ; then rumbling back into silence .

Standing beneath the sacred canopy , [the bridal pair]2754-the bridal pair lifted [their]2754-the bridal pair eyes to the high altar and saw , amid a cloud of incense , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , in gorgeous vestments , descending the steps and coming toward [them]2754-the bridal pair .

To [Mora]144-mora , at the time , and afterwards in most thankful remembrance , the wonder of that which followed lay in the fact that where [she]144-mora had dreaded an inevitable sense of sacrilege in giving to another that which had been already consecrated to [God]89-god , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop so worded the service as to make [her]144-mora feel that [she]144-mora could still be spiritually [the bride of [Christ]200-christ]4707-the bride of christ , even while fulfilling [her]144-mora troth to [Hugh]132-hugh ; also that , in accepting the call to this new Vocation , [she]144-mora was not falling from [[her]144-mora old estate]2758-her old estate , but rather rising above it .

As the words were spoken which made [her]144-mora [a wife]4785-a wife , it seemed as if [the Bishop]4673-the bishop gently wrapped [her]144-mora about with a fresh mantle of dignity that dignity which had fallen from [her]144-mora in those moments of humiliation when , at [Hugh]132-hugh 's bidding [she]144-mora laid [herself]144-mora down upon the stretcher .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop voiced [the Church]4592-the church with a pomp and power which could not be withstood ; and when , in obedience to [his]4673-the bishop command [Hugh]132-hugh grasped [her]144-mora right hand with [his]132-hugh right hand , and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop laid [his]4673-the bishop own on either side of [their]2764-their clasped hands , and pronounced [them]2764-their [man]4362-man and [wife]4520-wife , it seemed indeed as if a Divine touch united [them]2764-their , as if a Divine voice ratified [their]2764-their vows and sanctified [their]2764-their union .

[Mora]144-mora had never before seen [the man]4228-the man so completely merged in [[his]4228-the man high office]2768-his high office .

And , when all was over , even as [he]4228-the man mounted [Shulamite]173-shulamite and rode away , [he]4228-the man rode out of [the courtyard]775-the courtyard with the air of [a Knight Templar riding forth]2770-a knight templar riding forth - to do battle in a Holy War .

It seemed to [Mora]144-mora that [she]144-mora had bidden farewell to [her]144-mora [old friend of the kindly smile , the merry eye , and the ready jest]2771-old friend of the kindly smile , the merry eye , and the ready jest , in the early hours of that morning , as together [they]2764-their left [the arbour of the golden roses]2772-the arbour of the golden roses .

There remained therefore but [one man]2773-one man to be considered : [the ' splendid Knight " of [old Antony]85-mary antony 's vision]6396-the ' splendid knight " of old antony 's vision ; [the lover who had pursued [her]144-mora into [[her]144-mora Nunnery]1181-her nunnery]6397-the lover who had pursued her into her nunnery ; wooed [her]144-mora in [[her]144-mora own cell]287-her own cell , unabashed by the dignity of [[her]144-mora office]806-her office ; mastered [her]144-mora will ; forced [her]144-mora numbed heart to awaken , disturbed by the thrill of an unwilling tenderness ; moved [her]144-mora to passion by the poignant anguish of a parting , which [she]144-mora regarded as inevitably final ; won [the Bishop]4673-the bishop over , to [his]4673-the bishop side , and , through [him]4673-the bishop , [the Pope]5391-the pope ; and finally , by the persistence of [his]4673-the bishop pleadings , moved [[our]2774-their blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady to vouchsafe a vision on [his]4673-the bishop behalf .[6396-the ' splendid knight " of old antony 's vision]

This was the ' splendid Knight " against whom the stars in [their]2774-their courses had most certainly not fought . Principalities and powers had all been for [him]4673-the bishop ; against [him]4673-the bishop , just [a woman]813-a woman and [her]813-a woman conscience , and [he]4673-the bishop had won .[6396-the ' splendid knight " of old antony 's vision]

When , at [their]2774-their first interview in [[her]2775-her cell]321-her cell , in reply to [her]2775-her demand : " Why are [you]2777-i not with [[your]2777-i wife]4531-your wife ? "[2777-i] [he]2777-i had answered : " [I]2777-i am with [[my]2777-i wife]4532-my wife ; [the only wife [I]2777-i have ever wanted]4533-the only wife i have ever wanted , [the only woman [I]2777-i shall ever [we]6409-we d]4534-the only woman i shall ever we d , is here "[2777-i] [she]2775-her stood ready to strike with ivory and steel , at the first attempt upon [her]2775-her inviolable chastity , and could afford to smile , in pitying derision , at so empty a boast .

But now ? If [he]2777-i said : " [[My]2777-i wife]4532-my wife is here , "[2777-i] and chose to seize [her]2775-her with possessive grasp , [she]2775-her must meekly fold [her]2775-her hands upon [her]2775-her breast , and say : " Even so , [[my]2775-her lord]4881-my lord . [I]2775-her am [yours]4881-my lord . Deal with [me]2775-her as [you]4881-my lord will . "[2775-her]

As [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's purple cloak and the hind quarters of [his]4673-the bishop noble black mare , disappeared from view , [the crowd which hitherto had surrounded the bridal pair]2779-the crowd which hitherto had surrounded the bridal pair , also vanished , as if at the wave of a magic wand . Thus for the first time , since those tense moments in [the Cathedral crypt]297-the cathedral crypt , [Mora]144-mora found [herself]144-mora alone with [Hugh]132-hugh .

[She]144-mora was not young enough to be embarrassed ; but [she]144-mora was old enough to be afraid ; afraid of [him]132-hugh , and afraid of [herself]144-mora ; afraid of [his]132-hugh masterful nature and imperious will , which had always inclined to break rather than bend anything which stood in [his]132-hugh way ; and afraid of something in [herself]144-mora which leapt up in response to this fierce strength in [him]132-hugh , yearning to be mastered , hungry to yield , wishful to obey ; yet which , if yielded to , would lay [her]144-mora spirit in the dust , and turn the awakened tenderness in [her]144-mora heart to scorn of [herself]144-mora , and anger against [him]132-hugh .

So [she]144-mora feared as [she]144-mora stood in the sunshine , watching the now empty archway through which [her]144-mora sole remaining link with Convent life had vanished ; conscious , without looking round , that [Debbie]209-mistress deborah , who had been curtseying behind [her]144-mora , was there no longer ; that [Martin Goodfellow]133-martin , who had held [Shulamite]173-shulamite 's bridle while [the Bishop]4673-the bishop mounted , had disappeared in one direction , [the rest of [the men]5269-the men]2782-the rest of the men in another ; intensely conscious that [she]144-mora and [Hugh]132-hugh were now alone ; and fearing , [she]144-mora shivered again , as [she]144-mora had shivered in [the crypt]273-the crypt ; then , of a sudden , knew that [she]144-mora had done so , and , with a swift impulse of shame and contrition , turned and looked at [Hugh]132-hugh .

[He]132-hugh was indeed [the ' splendid Knight " of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's vision]6412-the ' splendid knight " of mary antony 's vision ! [He]132-hugh had donned for [his]132-hugh bridal the dress of white and silver , which [he]132-hugh had last put on when [he]132-hugh supped at [the Palace]1309-the palace with [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . This set off , with striking effect , [his]132-hugh dark head and the noble beauty of [his]132-hugh countenance ; and [Mora]144-mora , who chiefly remembered [him]132-hugh as [a handsome youth , graceful and gay]6415-a handsome youth , graceful and gay , realised for the first time [his]132-hugh splendour as [a man]4482-a man , and the change wrought in [him]132-hugh by all [he]132-hugh had faced , endured , and overcome .[132-hugh]

In [the crypt]273-the crypt , the day before , and during the hours which followed , [she]2786-her had scarce let [herself]2786-her look at [him]2787-he ; and [he]2787-he , though always close beside [her]2786-her , had kept out of [her]2786-her immediate range of vision .

Since that infolding clasp in [the crypt]273-the crypt when [he]2787-he had flung the cloak about [her]2786-her , not once had [he]2787-he touched [her]2786-her , until [the Church]4592-the church just now bade [him]2787-he , with authority , to take [her]2786-her right hand , with [his]2787-he .

[Her]2786-her mind flew back to the happenings of the previous day . With the lightning rapidity of retrospective thought , [she]2786-her passed again through each experience from the moment when the call of the blackbird sounded in [the crypt]273-the crypt . The helpless horror of being lifted by unseen hands ; the slow , swinging progress , to the accompaniment of the measured tread of [the men - at - arms]773-the men - at - arms ; the stifling darkness , air and light shut out by the heavy cloak , and yet the clear consciousness of the moment when the stretcher passed from [the Cathedral]35-the cathedral into the sunshine without ; the sudden pause , as [the Bishop]4673-the bishop met the stretcher , and then as [she]2786-her lay helpless between [them]2793-them [Symon]154-symon of worcester 's question and [Hugh]132-hugh 's reply , with [their]2793-them subtlety of hidden meaning , which filled [her]2786-her with impotent anger , [shewing]2794-shewing as it did the completeness of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's connivance at [Hugh]132-hugh 's conspiracy . Then [Hugh]132-hugh 's request , and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's hand laid upon [her]2786-her , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's voice uplifted in blessing . Then once again the measured tramp , tramp , and the steady swing of [the stretcher]1119-the stretcher ; but now [the men]5269-the men 's heels rang on cobbles , and voices seemed everywhere ; cheery greetings , snatches of song , chance words concerning a bargain or a meeting , a light jest , a coarse oath ; and , all the while , the steady , tramp , tramp , and the ring of [Hugh]132-hugh 's spurs .

[She]2786-her grew faint and it seemed to [her]2786-her [she]2786-her was about to die beneath the cloak , and that when at length [Hugh]132-hugh removed it , it would prove a pall beneath which [he]132-hugh would find [a dead bride]2800-a dead bride .

" [Dead bride]6417-dead bride ! [Dead bride]6417-dead bride ! "[2802-his] sounded the tramping footsteps . And all the way [she]2786-her was haunted by the belief , assailing [her]2786-her confused senses in the darkness , that the spirit of [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise had met [the stretcher]1119-the stretcher ; that [his]2802-his was the voice which murmured low and tenderly ; " Be not afraid , neither be [thou]6419-thou dismayed . Go in peace . "[2802-his]

With this had come a horror of [the outer world]4980-the outer world , a wild desire for the safety and shelter of [the Cloister]286-the cloister , and an absolute physical dread of the moment when the covering cloak should be removed , and [she]2786-her would find [herself]2786-her alone with [[her]2786-her lover]762-her lover ; and , on rising from the stretcher , be seized by [his]132-hugh arms .

Yet when , having been tilted up steps , [she]2786-her was conscious of the silence of [passages]2806-passages and soon the even more complete quiet of [a room]2807-a room ; when the stretcher was set down , and [the bearers]1120-the bearers ' feet died away , [Hugh]132-hugh 's deep voice said gently : " Change [thy]2786-her garments quickly , [[my]132-hugh beloved]4702-my beloved . There is no time to lose . "[132-hugh] But [he]132-hugh laid no hand upon the cloak , and [his]132-hugh footsteps , also , died away .

Then pushing back the heavy folds and sitting up , [she]2786-her had found [herself]2786-her alone in a bedchamber , everything [she]2786-her could need laid ready to [her]2786-her hand ; while , upon the bed , lay [her]2786-her green riding - dress , discarded forever , eight years before !

[Her]2786-her mind refused to look back upon the half - hour that followed .

[She]2786-her saw [herself]2786-her next appearing in the doorway at the top of [a flight of eight steps]2809-a flight of eight steps , leading down into [the yard of [the hostelry]2811-the hostelry]2810-the yard of the hostelry , where [a cavalcade of men]2812-a cavalcade of men and horses waited ; while [Icon]174-icon , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's beautiful white palfrey , was being led to and fro , and [Hugh]132-hugh stood with an open letter in [his]132-hugh hand .

As [she]2786-her hesitated in the doorway , gazing down upon [the waiting , restive crowd]2814-the waiting , restive crowd , [Hugh]132-hugh looked up and saw [her]2786-her . Into [his]132-hugh eyes flashed a light of triumphant joy , of adoring love and admiration . [She]2786-her had avoided looking at [her]2786-her own reflection ; but [his]132-hugh face , as [he]132-hugh came up the steps , mirrored [her]2786-her loveliness . It had cost [her]2786-her such anguish of soul to divest [herself]2786-her of [her]2786-her sacred habit and don these gay garments belonging to a life long left behind , that [his]132-hugh evident delight in the change , moved [her]2786-her to an unreasonable resentment . Also that sudden blaze of love in [his]132-hugh dark eyes , dazzled [her]2786-her heart , even as a burst of sunshine might dazzle one used to perpetual twilight .

[She]2786-her took [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's letter , with averted eyes ; read it ; then moved swiftly down the steps to where [Icon]174-icon waited .

" Mount [me]2786-her , "[2786-her] [she]2786-her said to [Martin Goodfellow]133-martin , as [she]2786-her passed [him]133-martin ; and it was [Martin]133-martin who swung [her]2786-her into the saddle .

Then [she]2786-her trembled at what [she]2786-her had done , in yielding to this impulse which made [her]2786-her shrink from [Hugh]132-hugh .

As the black mane of [his]133-martin horse drew level with [Icon]174-icon 's head , and side by side [they]2816-they rode out from [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , [she]2786-her feared a thunder - cloud on [the Knight]764-the knight 's brow , and a sullen silence , as the best [she]2786-her could expect . But calm and cheerful , [his]133-martin voice fell on [her]2786-her ear ; and glancing at [him]133-martin furtively , [she]2786-her still saw on [his]133-martin face that light which dazzled [her]2786-her heart . Yet no word did [he]133-martin speak which all might not have heard , and not once did [he]133-martin lay [his]133-martin hand on [hers]2786-her . Each time [they]2816-they dismounted , [she]2786-her saw [him]133-martin sign to [Martin Goodfellow]133-martin , and it was [Martin]133-martin who helped [her]2786-her to alight .

All this , in rapid retrospect , passed through [Mora]144-mora 's mind as [she]2786-her stood alone beside [[her]2786-her splendid Knight]2819-her splendid knight , miserably conscious that [she]2786-her had shivered , and that [he]133-martin knew it ; and fearful lest [he]133-martin divined the shrinking of [her]2786-her soul away from [him]133-martin , away from love , away from all for which love stood . Alas , alas ! Why did [this man]4855-this man [this most human , ardent , loving man]2821-this most human , ardent , loving man hang all [his]4855-this man hopes of happiness upon the heart of [a nun]412-a nun ? Would it be possible that [he]4855-this man should understand , that eight years of cloistered life can not be renounced in a day ?

[Mora]144-mora looked at [him]133-martin again .

[The stern profile]2823-the stern profile might well be about to say : " Shudder again , and [I]2823-the stern profile will do to [thee]144-mora that which shall give [thee]144-mora cause to shudder indeed ! "[2823-the stern profile]

Yet , at that moment [he]133-martin spoke , and [his]133-martin voice was infinitely gentle .

" [Yonder]197-yonder wet knight rides [a true friend]6421-a true friend , "[133-martin] [he]133-martin said . " [One who has learned love 's deepest lesson]6422-one who has learned love 's deepest lesson . "[133-martin]

" What is love 's deepest lesson ? "[144-mora] [she]144-mora asked .

[He]133-martin turned and looked at [her]144-mora , and the fire of [his]133-martin dark eyes was drowned in tenderness .

" That true love means self - sacrifice , "[133-martin] [he]133-martin said . " Come , [[my]133-martin beloved]4702-my beloved . Let [us]6424-us walk in [the gardens]6044-the gardens , where [we]6424-us can talk at ease of [our]6424-us plans for the days to come . "[133-martin]

CHAPTER XL

THE HEART OF [A NUN]412-a nun

[Hugh]132-hugh and [Mora]144-mora passed together through [the great hall]1672-the great hall , along [the armoury]4627-the armoury , down the winding stair and so out into [the gardens]6044-the gardens .

[The Knight]764-the knight led the way across [the lawn]2475-the lawn and through [the rose garden]2830-the rose garden , toward the yew hedge and the bowling - green .

[Old Debbie]223-old debbie , looking from [her]223-old debbie casement , thought them beautiful beyond words as [she]223-old debbie watched [them]2831-them cross [the lawn]2475-the lawn [she]223-old debbie in white and gold , [he]764-the knight in white and silver ; [his]764-the knight dark head towering above [her]223-old debbie fair one , though [she]223-old debbie was uncommon tall . And , falling upon [her]223-old debbie knees , [old Debbie]223-old debbie prayed to [the Angel Gabriel]224-the angel gabriel that [she]223-old debbie might live to hold in [her]223-old debbie arms , and rock to sleep upon [her]223-old debbie bosom , sweet babes , both fair and dark : " [Fair little maids]6426-fair little maids , "[223-old debbie] [she]223-old debbie said , " and fine , [dark boys]6427-dark boys , "[223-old debbie] explaining to [Gabriel]224-the angel gabriel that which [she]223-old debbie thought would be most fit .

Meanwhile [Hugh]132-hugh and [Mora]144-mora , walking a yard apart all unconscious of these family plans , being so anxiously made for [them]2831-them at an upper casement bent [their]2831-them tall heads and passed under the arch in the yew hedge , crossed the bowling - green , and entered [the arbour of the golden roses]2772-the arbour of the golden roses .

[Hugh]132-hugh led the way ; yet [Mora]144-mora gladly followed . [The Bishop]92-bishop 's presence seemed to abide [here]4536-here , in comfort and protection .

All signs of the early repast were gone from the rustic table .

[Mora]144-mora took [her]144-mora seat there where in the early morning [she]144-mora had sat ; while [Hugh]132-hugh , not knowing [he]132-hugh did so , passed into [[the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's place]2836-the bishop 's place . The sun shone through the golden roses , hanging in clusters over the entrance .

The sense of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's presence so strongly pervaded [the place]2838-the place , that almost at once [Mora]144-mora felt constrained to speak of [him]4673-the bishop .

" [Hugh]132-hugh , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said , " very early this morning , long before [you]132-hugh were awake , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop and [I]144-mora broke [our]6429-our fast , in [this arbour]6430-this arbour , together . "[144-mora]

[The Knight]764-the knight smiled .

" [I]764-the knight knew that , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said . " In [his]4673-the bishop own characteristic way [the Bishop]4673-the bishop told it [me]764-the knight . ' [[My]764-the knight son]5057-my son , ' [he]764-the knight said , ' [you]5057-my son have reversed the sacred parable . In [your]5057-my son case it was [the bride - groom]6433-the bride - groom who , this morning , slumbered and slept . ' ' True , [[my]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , ' said [I.]764-the knight ' But there were [no foolish virgins]6435-no foolish virgins about . ' ' Nay , verily ! ' replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . ' [The two virgins awake at that hour]6437-the two virgins awake at that hour were pre - eminently wise : the one , making as the sun rose most golden pats of butter and crusty rolls ; the other , rising early to partake of them with appetite . Truly there were [no foolish virgins about]6438-no foolish virgins about . There was but [one foolish prelate]6439-one foolish prelate . ' "[764-the knight]

[She]2840-she , who so lately had been [Prioress of the White Ladies]4675-prioress of the white ladies , flushed with indignation at the words .

" Wherefore said [he]6439-one foolish prelate so ? "[2840-she] [she]2840-she inquired , severely . " [He]6439-one foolish prelate , who is always wiser than the wisest . "[2840-she]

[Hugh]132-hugh noted the heightened colour and the ready protest .

" Perhaps , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh suggested , speaking slowly , as if choosing [his]132-hugh words with care , " [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's head , being so wise , revealed to [him]132-hugh , in [himself]132-hugh , a certain foolishness of heart . "[132-hugh]

[Mora]144-mora struck the table with [her]144-mora hand .

" Nay then , verily ! "[144-mora] [she]144-mora cried . " Head and heart alike are wise ; and unlike [other men]5511-other men [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's head rules [his]132-hugh heart . "[144-mora]

" And a most noble heart , "[764-the knight] , [the Knight]764-the knight said , with calmness ; neither wincing at the blow upon the table , nor at the " unlike [other men]5511-other men , "[132-hugh] flung out in challenge .

Then , folding [his]132-hugh arms upon the table , and looking searchingly into the face of [[his]132-hugh bride]4744-his bride : " Tell [me]132-hugh , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh said , " during all these years , has this friendship with [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester meant much to [thee]4744-his bride ? "[132-hugh]

Something in [his]132-hugh tone arrested [Mora]144-mora . [She]144-mora answered , with an equal earnestness : " Yes , [Hugh]132-hugh . It has done more for [me]144-mora than can well be told . It has kept living and growing in [me]144-mora much that would otherwise have been stunted or dead ; an ever fresh flow of thought , where , but for [him]154-symon of worcester , would have been a stagnant pool . [My]144-mora sad heart might have grown bitter , [my]144-mora nature too austere , particularly when advancement to [high office]6444-high office brought with it an inevitable loneliness , had it not been for the interest and charm of [his]154-symon of worcester visits and missives ; [his]154-symon of worcester constant gifts and kindness . There is about [him]154-symon of worcester a light - hearted gaiety , a whimsical humour , a joy in life , which can not fail to wake responsive gladness in any heart with which [he]154-symon of worcester comes in contact . And mingled with [his]154-symon of worcester shrewd wisdom , [his]154-symon of worcester wide knowledge of [men]4397-men and matters , there is ever a tender charity , which thinks no evil , always believing in good and hoping for the best ; a love which never fails ; a kindness which makes one ashamed of harbouring hard or revengeful thoughts . "[144-mora]

[Hugh]132-hugh made no reply . [He]132-hugh sat with [his]132-hugh eyes fixed upon the beautiful face before [him]132-hugh , now glowing with enthusiasm . [He]132-hugh waited for something more . And presently it came .

" Also , "[144-mora] said [Mora]144-mora , slowly : " a very precious memory of [my]144-mora early days at [Court]6446-court , when as [a young maiden]6447-a young maiden [I]144-mora attended on [the Queen]4576-the queen , was kept alive by a remarkable likeness in [the Bishop]4673-the bishop to [one who was , as [I]144-mora learned this morning for the first time , actually near of kin to [him]4673-the bishop]6450-one who was , as i learned this morning for the first time , actually near of kin to him . Do [you]132-hugh remember , [Hugh]132-hugh , long years ago , that [I]144-mora spoke to [you]132-hugh of [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise ? "[144-mora]

" [I]764-the knight do remember , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight .

[She]2845-i leaned [her]2845-i elbows on the table , framed [her]2845-i face in [her]2845-i hands , and looked straight into [his]764-the knight eyes .

" [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise was more to [me]2845-i than [I]2845-i then told [you]132-hugh , [Hugh]132-hugh . "[2845-i]

" What was [he]185-father gervaise to [thee]132-hugh , [Mora]144-mora ? "[2845-i]

" [He]185-father gervaise was the Ideal of [[my]2845-i girlhood]6451-my girlhood . For a time , [I]2845-i thought of [him]185-father gervaise by day , [I]2845-i dreamed of [him]185-father gervaise by night . No word of [his]185-father gervaise have [I]2845-i ever forgotten . Many of [his]185-father gervaise sayings and precepts have influenced , and still deeply influence , [my]2845-i whole life . In fact , [Hugh]132-hugh , [I]2845-i loved [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise ; not as [a woman]813-a woman loves [a man]4482-a man ah , no ! But , rather , as [a nun]412-a nun loves [[her]412-a nun Lord]6237-her lord . "[2845-i]

" [I]764-the knight see , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight . " But [you]132-hugh were not then [a nun]412-a nun , [Mora]144-mora . "[764-the knight]

" No , [I]2845-i was not then [a nun]412-a nun . But [I]2845-i have been [a nun]412-a nun since then ; and that is how [I]2845-i can best describe [my]2845-i love for [[the Queen]4576-the queen 's Confessor]6460-the queen 's confessor . "[2845-i]

" Long after , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , " [you]132-hugh were betrothed to [me]764-the knight ? "[764-the knight]

" Yes , [Hugh]132-hugh . "[2845-i]

" How did [you]764-the knight love [me]764-the knight , [Mora]144-mora ? "[764-the knight]

Across the rustic table [they]2848-they looked full into [each other]2849-each other 's eyes . [Tragedy]225-tragedy , stalking around that rose - covered arbour , drew very near , and [they]2848-they knew it . [Almost]226-almost , [his]764-the knight grim shadow came between [them]2848-they and the sunshine .

Then [the Knight]764-the knight smiled ; and with that smile rushed back the flood - tide of remembrance ; remembrance of all which [their]2848-they young love had meant , of the sweet promise it had held .

[His]764-the knight eyes still holding [hers]2851-she , [she]2851-she smiled also .

The golden roses clustering in the entrance swayed and nodded in the sunlight , as a gently rising breeze fanned them to and fro .

" [Dear Knight]5610-dear knight , "[2851-she] [she]2851-she said , softly , a wistful tenderness in [her]2851-she voice , " [I]2851-she suppose [I]2851-she loved [you]5610-dear knight , as [a girl]1168-a girl loves [the man who has won [her]1168-a girl]6463-the man who has won her . "[2851-she]

" [Mora]144-mora , "[132-hugh] said [Hugh]132-hugh , " [I]132-hugh have something to tell [thee]144-mora . "[132-hugh]

" [I]2851-she listen , "[2851-she] [she]2851-she said .

" [[My]2851-she wife]4532-my wife so wholly , so completely , do [I]2851-she love [thee]5610-dear knight , that [I]2851-she would not consciously keep anything from [thee]5610-dear knight . So deeply do [I]2851-she love [thee]5610-dear knight , that [I]2851-she would sooner any wrong or sin of [mine]2851-she were known to [thee]5610-dear knight and by [thee]5610-dear knight forgiven , than that [thou]5610-dear knight shouldest think [me]2851-she one whit better than [I]2851-she am . "[2851-she]

[He]132-hugh paused .

[Her]2851-she eyes were tender and compassionate . Often [she]2851-she had listened , with a patient heart of charity , to the tedious , morbid , self - centred confessions of kneeling nuns , who watched with anxious eyes for the sign which would mean that [they]2852-they might clutch at the hem of [her]2851-she robe and press it to [their]2852-they lips in token that [they]2852-they were forgiven .

But [she]2851-she had had no experience of the sins of [men]4397-men . What had the ' splendid Knight " upon [his]132-hugh conscience , which must now be told [her]2851-she , in this sunny arbour , on the morning of [their]2852-they bridal day ?[2851-she]

[Her]2851-she heart throbbed painfully . Alas , it was still the heart of [a nun]412-a nun . It would not be controlled . Must [she]2851-she hear wild tales of wickedness and shame , of which [she]2851-she would but partly understand the meaning ?

Oh , for the calm of [the Cloister]286-the cloister ! Oh , for the sheltered purity of [[her]2851-she quiet cell]2856-her quiet cell !

Yet [his]132-hugh eyes , still meeting [hers]2851-she , were clear and fearless .

" [I]2851-she listen , "[2851-she] [she]2851-she said .

" [Mora]144-mora , not long ago a wondrous tale was told [me]132-hugh of [a man]4482-a man 's great love for [thee]2851-she a man , nobler than [I]132-hugh , in that [he]4482-a man mastered all selfish desires ; a love higher than [mine]132-hugh , in that it put [thy]2851-she welfare , in all things , first . Hearing this tale , [I]132-hugh failed both [myself]132-hugh and [thee]2851-she , for [I]132-hugh said : ' [I]132-hugh pray heaven that , if [she]2851-she come to [me]132-hugh , [she]2851-she may never know that [she]2851-she once won the love of so greatly better a man than [I.]132-hugh ' But , since [I]132-hugh clasped [thy]2851-she hand in [mine]132-hugh , and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , laying [his]4673-the bishop on either side , gave [thee]2851-she to be [[my]132-hugh wife]4532-my wife , [I]132-hugh have known there would be no peace for [me]132-hugh if [I]132-hugh feared to trust [thee]2851-she with this knowledge , because that [the man who loved [thee]2851-she]6468-the man who loved thee was [a better man than the man who , by [God]89-god 's mercy and [[our]6470-our Lady]4260-our lady 's grace , has won [thee]2851-she]6469-a better man than the man who , by god 's mercy and our lady 's grace , has won thee . "[132-hugh]

As [the Knight]764-the knight spoke thus , the grey eyes fixed on [his]764-the knight face grew wide with wonder ; soft , with a great compunction ; yet , at the corners , shewed a little crinkle in which [the Bishop]4673-the bishop would instantly have recognised the sign of approaching merriment .

Was this then a sample of the unknown sins of [men]4397-men ? Nothing here , surely , to cause the least throb of apprehension , even to the heart of [a nun]412-a nun ! But what strange tale had reached the ears of [this most dear and loyal Knight]2861-this most dear and loyal knight ? [She]412-a nun leaned a little nearer to [him]764-the knight , speaking in a tone which was music to [his]764-the knight heart .

" [Dear Knight of [mine]412-a nun]6472-dear knight of mine , "[412-a nun] [she]412-a nun said , " no tale of [a man]4482-a man 's love for [me]412-a nun can have been a true one . Yet am [I]412-a nun glad that , deeming it true , and feeling as it was [your]2851-she first impulse to feel , [you]2851-she now tell [me]412-a nun quite frankly what [you]2851-she felt , thus putting from [yourself]2851-she all sense of wrong , while giving [me]412-a nun the chance to say to [you]2851-she , that none more noble than [this faithful Knight]6474-this faithful knight can have loved [me]412-a nun ; for , saving a few Court pages , mostly popinjays , and [Humphry of Camforth]139-humphry , of whom the less said the better , [no other man]4714-no other man hath loved [me]412-a nun . "[412-a nun]

More kindly [she]412-a nun looked on [him]764-the knight than [she]412-a nun yet had looked . [She]412-a nun leaned across the table .

By reaching out [his]764-the knight arms [he]764-the knight could have caught [her]412-a nun lovely face between [his]764-the knight hands .

[Her]412-a nun eyes were merry . [Her]412-a nun lips smiled .

Greatly tempted was [the Knight]764-the knight to agree that , saving [himself]764-the knight , and [Humphry of Camforth]139-humphry , of whom the less said the better , none save [Court popinjays]28-court had loved [her]412-a nun . Yet in [his]764-the knight heart [he]764-the knight knew that ever between [them]2863-them would be this fact of [his]764-the knight knowledge of the love of [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise for [her]412-a nun , and of the noble renunciation inspired by that love . [He]764-the knight had no intention of betraying [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ; but [Mora]144-mora 's own explanation , making it quite clear that [she]412-a nun would not be likely to suspect the identity of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop with [[his]764-the knight supposed cousin]2866-his supposed cousin , [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise , seemed to [the Knight]764-the knight to remove the one possible reason for concealment . [He]764-the knight was willing to risk present loss , rather than imperil future peace .

With an effort which made [his]764-the knight voice almost stern : " The tale was a true one , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said .

[She]412-a nun drew back , regarding [him]764-the knight with grave eyes , [her]412-a nun hands folded before [her]412-a nun .

" Tell [me]412-a nun the tale , "[412-a nun] [she]412-a nun said , " and [I]412-a nun will pronounce upon its truth . "[412-a nun]

" Years ago , [Mora]144-mora , when [you]144-mora were [a young maiden at [the Court]4621-the court]6476-a young maiden at the court , attending on [the Queen]4576-the queen , [you]144-mora were most deeply loved by [one who knew [he]6479-one who knew he could never ask you in marriage could never ask [you]144-mora in marriage]6479-one who knew he could never ask you in marriage . That being so , so noble was [his]764-the knight nature and so unselfish [his]764-the knight love , that [he]764-the knight would not give [himself]764-the knight the delight of seeing [you]144-mora , nor the enjoyment of [your]144-mora friendship , lest , being so strong a thing , [his]764-the knight love even though unexpressed should reach and stir [your]144-mora heart to a response which , might hinder [you]144-mora from feeling free to give [yourself]144-mora , when [a man who could offer all]6480-a man who could offer all sought to win [you]144-mora . Therefore , [Mora]144-mora , [he]764-the knight left [the Court]4621-the court , [he]764-the knight left [the country]6482-the country . [He]764-the knight went to [foreign lands]6483-foreign lands . [He]764-the knight thought not of [himself]764-the knight . [He]764-the knight desired for [you]144-mora the full completion which comes by means of wedded love . [He]764-the knight feared to hinder this . So [he]764-the knight went . "[412-a nun]

[Her]2868-she face still expressed incredulous astonishment .

" [His]764-the knight name ? "[2868-she] [she]2868-she demanded , awaiting the answer with parted lips , and widely - open eyes .

" [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight .

[He]764-the knight saw [her]2868-she slowly whiten , till scarce a vestige of colour remained .

For some minutes [she]2868-she spoke no word ; [both]2870-both sat silent , [Hugh]132-hugh ruefully facing [his]132-hugh risks , and inclined to repent of [his]132-hugh honesty .

At length : " And who told [you]764-the knight this tale , "[2868-she] [she]2868-she said ; " this tale of the love of [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise for [a young maid]6484-a young maid , half [his]185-father gervaise age ? "[2868-she]

" [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester told it [me]764-the knight , three nights ago . "[764-the knight]

" How came [the Bishop]4673-the bishop to know so strange and so secret a thing ? And knowing it , how came [he]4673-the bishop to tell it to [you]764-the knight ? "[2868-she]

" [He]4673-the bishop had it from [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise [himself]4673-the bishop . [He]4673-the bishop told it to [me]764-the knight , because [his]4673-the bishop remembrance of the sacrifice made so long ago in order that the full completion of wifehood and motherhood might be thine , had always inclined [him]4673-the bishop to a wistful regret over [thy]764-the knight choice of the monastic life , with its resultant celibacy ; leading [him]4673-the bishop , from the first , to espouse and further [my]764-the knight cause . In wedding [us]6486-us to - day , methinks [the Bishop]4673-the bishop felt [he]4673-the bishop was at last securing the consummation of the noble renunciation made so long ago by [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise . "[764-the knight]

With a growing dread at [his]2871-i heart , [Hugh]132-hugh watched the increasing pallor of [her]2872-her face , the hard line of the lips which , but a few moments before , had parted in such gentle sweetness .

" Alas ! "[2871-i] [he]2871-i exclaimed , " [I]2871-i should not have told [thee]2872-her ! With [my]2871-i clumsy desire to keep nothing from [thee]2872-her , [I]2871-i have spoilt an hour which else might have been so perfect . "[2871-i]

" [You]132-hugh did well to tell [me]2872-her , [dear Knight of [mine]2872-her]6472-dear knight of mine , "[2872-her] [she]2872-her said , a ripple of tenderness passing across [her]2872-her stern face , as swiftly and gently as the breeze stirs a cornfield . " Nor is there anything in [this world]2723-this world so perfect as the truth . If the truth opened an abyss which plunged [me]2872-her into hell , [I]2872-her would sooner know it , than attempt to enter Paradise across the flimsy fabric of a lie ! "[2872-her]

[Her]2872-her voice , as [she]2872-her uttered these words , had in it the ring which was wo nt to petrify [wrong - doers of the feebler kind]2873-wrong - doers of the feebler kind among [[her]2872-her nuns]839-her nuns .

" [Dear Knight]228-hugh , had [the Bishop]4673-the bishop not forestalled [me]2872-her when [he]4673-the bishop named [his]4673-the bishop palfrey , truly [I]2872-her might have found a fine new name for [you]228-hugh ! But now , [I]2872-her pray [you]228-hugh of [your]228-hugh kindness , leave [me]2872-her alone with [my]2872-her fallen image for a little space , that [I]2872-her may gather up the fragments and give [them]6491-them decent burial . "[2872-her]

With which [her]2872-her courage broke . [She]2872-her stretched [her]2872-her clasped hands across the table and laid [her]2872-her head upon [her]2872-her arms .

[Despair]229-despair seized [the Knight]764-the knight as [he]764-the knight stood helpless , looking down upon that proud head laid low .

[He]764-the knight longed to lay [his]764-the knight hand upon the golden softness of [her]2872-her hair .

But [her]2872-her shoulders shook with a hard , tearless sob , and [the Knight]764-the knight fled from [the arbour]2476-the arbour .

As [he]764-the knight paced [the lawn]2475-the lawn , on which [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had promenaded the evening before , [Hugh]132-hugh cursed [his]764-the knight rashness in speaking ; yet knew , in the heart of [his]764-the knight heart , that [he]764-the knight could not have done otherwise . [Mora]144-mora 's words concerning truth , gave [him]764-the knight a background of comfort . Even so had [he]764-the knight ever [himself]764-the knight felt . But would it prove that [his]764-the knight honesty had indeed shattered [his]764-the knight chances of happiness , and [hers]2872-her ?

A new name ? . . . What might it be ? . . . What the mischief , had [the Bishop]4673-the bishop named [[his]4673-the bishop palfrey]2881-his palfrey ? . . . [Sheba]170-sheba ? Nay , that was the ass ! [Solomon]178-solomon ? Nay , that was the mare ! Yet how came a mare to be named [Solomon]178-solomon ? In [his]764-the knight disturbed mental state it irritated [him]764-the knight unreasonably that a mare should be called after [a king with [seven hundred wives]2883-seven hundred wives]2882-a king with seven hundred wives ! Then [he]764-the knight remembered " black , but comely , "[173-shulamite] and arrived at the right name , [Shulamite]173-shulamite . Of course ! Not [Solomon]178-solomon but [Shulamite]173-shulamite . [He]764-the knight had read that love - poem of [the unnamed Eastern shepherd]2884-the unnamed eastern shepherd , with [the Rabbi]2885-the rabbi in [the mountain fastness]2886-the mountain fastness . [The Rabbi]2885-the rabbi had pointed out that the word used in that description signified ' sunburned . " [The lovely Shulamite maiden , exposed to the Eastern sun]6492-the lovely shulamite maiden , exposed to the eastern sun while tending [[her]6492-the lovely shulamite maiden , exposed to the eastern sun kids]6493-her kids and keeping [the vineyards]6494-the vineyards , had tanned a ruddy brown , beside which [the daughters of [Jerusalem]69-jerusalem]6495-the daughters of jerusalem , enclosed in [[King Solomon]178-solomon 's scented harem]6496-king solomon 's scented harem , looked pale as wilting lilies . Remembering the glossy coat of the black mare , [Hugh]132-hugh wondered , with a momentary sense of merriment , whether [the Bishop]4673-the bishop supposed [the maiden of the "[2885-the rabbi] Song of Songs "]6498-the maiden of the " song of songs " to have been [an Ethiopian]6499-an ethiopian .[2885-the rabbi]

Then [he]764-the knight remembered " [Iconoklastes]169-iconoklastes . "[764-the knight] Yes , surely ! The palfrey was [Iconoklastes]169-iconoklastes . Now wherefore gave [the Bishop]4673-the bishop such a name to [his]4673-the bishop white palfrey ?

Striding blindly about [the lawn]2475-the lawn , of a sudden [the Knight]764-the knight stepped full on to [a flower - bed]2891-a flower - bed . At once [he]764-the knight seemed to hear [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's gentle voice : " [I]4673-the bishop named [him]4673-the bishop [Iconoklastes]169-iconoklastes because [he]4673-the bishop trampled to ruin some flower - beds on which [I]4673-the bishop spent much time and care , and of which [I]4673-the bishop was inordinately fond . "[4673-the bishop]

Ah ! . . . That was it ! The destroyer of fair bloom and blossom , of buds of promise ; of the loveliness of [a tended garden]2893-a tended garden . . . . Was this then what [he]4673-the bishop seemed to [Mora]144-mora ? [He]4673-the bishop , who had forced [her]144-mora to yield to the insistence of [his]4673-the bishop love ? . . . In [[her]144-mora chaste Convent cell]2894-her chaste convent cell , [she]144-mora could have remained true to this Ideal love of [[her]144-mora girlhood]2895-her girlhood : and , now that [she]144-mora knew it to have been called forth by love , could have received , mentally , its full fruition . Also , in time [she]144-mora might have discovered the identity of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop with [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise , and long years of perfect friendship might have proved a solace to [their]2897-their sundered hearts , had not [he]4673-the bishop the trampler upon flower - beds rudely intervened .

And yet [Mora]144-mora had been betrothed to [him]4673-the bishop , [her]144-mora love had been [his]4673-the bishop , long after [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise had left [the land]6186-the land .

How could [he]4673-the bishop win [her]144-mora back to be once more as [she]144-mora was when [they]2897-their parted on [the castle battlements]2899-the castle battlements eight years before ?

How could [he]4673-the bishop free [himself]4673-the bishop , and [her]144-mora , from these intangible , ecclesiastical entanglements ?

[He]4673-the bishop was reminded of [his]4673-the bishop difficulties when [he]4673-the bishop tried to walk disguised in the dress of [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies , and found [his]4673-the bishop stride impeded by those trailing garments . [He]4673-the bishop remembered the relief of wrenching them off , and stepping clear .

Why not now take the short , quick road to mastery ?

But instantly that love which seeketh not its own , the strange new sense so recently awakened in [him]4673-the bishop , laid its calm touch upon [his]4673-the bishop throbbing heart . Until that moment in the crypt the day before , [he]4673-the bishop had loved [Mora]144-mora for [his]4673-the bishop own delight , sought [her]144-mora for [his]4673-the bishop own joy . Now , [he]4673-the bishop knew that [he]4673-the bishop could take no happiness at the cost of one pang to [her]144-mora .

" [She]144-mora must be taught not to shudder , "[4673-the bishop] cried the masterfulness which was [his]4673-the bishop by nature .

" [She]144-mora must be given no cause to shudder , "[4673-the bishop] amended this new , loyal tenderness , which now ruled [his]4673-the bishop every thought of [her]144-mora .

Presently , returning to [the arbour]2476-the arbour , [he]4673-the bishop found [her]144-mora seated , [her]144-mora elbows on the table , [her]144-mora chin cupped in [her]144-mora hands .

[She]144-mora had been weeping ; yet [her]144-mora smile of welcome , as [he]4673-the bishop entered , held a quality [he]4673-the bishop had scarce expected .

[He]4673-the bishop spoke straight to the point . It seemed the only way to step clear of immeshing trammels .

" [Mora]144-mora , it cuts [me]4673-the bishop to the heart that , in striving to be honest with [you]144-mora , [I]4673-the bishop have all unwittingly trampled upon those flower - beds in which [you]144-mora long had tended fair blossoms of memory . Also [I]4673-the bishop fear this knowledge of a nobler love , makes it hard for [you]144-mora to contemplate life linked to a love which seems to [you]144-mora less able for self - sacrifice . "[4673-the bishop]

[She]144-mora gazed at [him]4673-the bishop , wide - eyed , in sheer amazement .

" [Dear Knight]228-hugh , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said , " true , [I]144-mora am disillusioned , but not in aught that concerns [you]4673-the bishop . [You]4673-the bishop trampled on [no flower - beds of [mine]144-mora]6500-no flower - beds of mine . [[My]144-mora shattered idol]6501-my shattered idol is the image of one whom [I]144-mora , with deepest reverence , loved , as [a nun]412-a nun might love [her]412-a nun Guardian Angel . [The Knight]764-the knight laughed , joyously . The relief at [his]764-the knight heart demanded that much vent . " Then , if [I]764-the knight failed [thee]144-mora , [Mora]144-mora , there would be but [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ? "[764-the knight]

" There would be but [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . "[764-the knight]

" Hush , "[2903-she] [she]2903-she said , sternly . " [You]764-the knight know not the heart of [a nun]412-a nun . "[2903-she]

" [I]2903-she listen , "[2903-she] [she]2903-she answered .

[Hugh]228-hugh stood in the entrance , among the yellow roses , leaning against the doorpost , [his]228-hugh arms folded on [his]228-hugh breast , [his]228-hugh feet crossed .

" [We]6516-we ride on to - day , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , " if [you]2903-she feel able for a few hours in the saddle , to the next stage in [our]6516-we journey . [He]764-the knight paused . [He]764-the knight could not hold on to the matter of fact tones in which [he]764-the knight had started . When [he]764-the knight spoke again , [his]764-the knight voice was low and very tender .

" [Mora]144-mora , [I]764-the knight am taking [thee]144-mora first to [[thine]6524-thine own home]6525-thine own home ; to [the place where , long years ago , [we]6516-we loved and parted]6526-the place where , long years ago , we loved and parted . Until [we]6516-we enter [there]333-there , [[my]764-the knight wife]4532-my wife , although this morning most truly [we]6516-we d , [we]6516-we will count [ourselves]6516-we but betrothed . Once in [[thy]144-mora home]4340-thy home , it shall be left to [thine]144-mora own choice to come to [mine]764-the knight when and how [thou]144-mora wilt . But , now it is safely accomplished , there is no further need for haste . The wings of [my]764-the knight swift desire shall be dipt to suit thine inclination . "[764-the knight]

[Hugh]228-hugh paused , looking upon [her]2907-her with a half - wistful smile . [She]2907-her made no answer ; so presently [he]228-hugh continued .

" [I]228-hugh have planned that , each day , [Mistress Deborah]209-mistress deborah , with the baggage and [a good escort]6537-a good escort , shall go by the most direct route , and [the best road]6538-the best road . [Martin]133-martin will take [Mistress Deborah]209-mistress deborah on a pillion behind [him]133-martin . But [they]6540-they tell [me]228-hugh [she]209-mistress deborah travels bravely on horseback . [We]6516-we will send [them]6540-they on ahead of [us]6516-we , and on arrival all will be in readiness for [thee]144-mora . If this weather holds , [we]6516-we shall ride each day through a world of sunshine and beauty ; and each day 's close , [[my]228-hugh wife]4532-my wife , will find [us]6516-we one day nearer [home]305-home . Does this please [thee]144-mora ? Have [I]228-hugh thought of all ? "[228-hugh]

Rising , [she]2908-she came and stood beside [him]2909-you in the entrance to [the arbour]2476-the arbour .

A golden rose , dipping from above , rested against [her]2908-she hair .

[Her]2908-she eyes were soft with tears .

" So perfectly have [you]2909-you thought and planned , [dear faithful Knight]6543-dear faithful knight , that [I]2908-she think [[our]6516-we blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady must have guided [you]2909-you . "[2908-she]

[She]2908-she hesitated ; half put out [her]2908-she hands ; but [his]2909-you not meeting them , folded them on [her]2908-she breast .

" [Hugh]228-hugh , it seems hard that [I]2909-you should clip [your]228-hugh splendid wings ; but oh , [Hugh]228-hugh ! Think [you]228-hugh the heart of [a nun]412-a nun can ever become again as the heart of [other women]6245-other women ? "[2909-you]

" Heaven forbid ! "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , fervently , thinking of [Eleanor]138-eleanor and [Alfrida]137-alfrida . And , as leaving [the arbour]2476-the arbour [they]2913-they walked together over [the lawn]2475-the lawn , [she]2908-she smiled , remembering , how that morning [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had answered the same question in precisely the same words . Whatever [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise might have said , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop and [the Knight]764-the knight were agreed !

Yet [she]2908-she wished , somewhat wistfully , that [this most dear and loyal Knight]2861-this most dear and loyal knight had taken [her]2908-she hands when [she]2908-she held them out . [She]2908-she would have liked to feel the strong clasp of [his]2861-this most dear and loyal knight upon them .

Possibly [[our]2913-they Lady , who knoweth the heart of [a woman]813-a woman]2919-our lady , who knoweth the heart of a woman , had guided [the Knight]764-the knight in this matter also . CHAPTER XLI

WHAT [THE BISHOP]4673-the bishop REMEMBERED

[Symon]154-symon of worcester , [Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]1222-bishop of worcester , sat in [[his]154-symon of worcester library]1954-his library , in the cool of the day .

[He]154-symon of worcester was weary , with a weariness which surpassed all [his]154-symon of worcester previous experience of weariness , all [his]154-symon of worcester imaginings as to how weary , in body and spirit , [a man]4482-a man could be , yet continue to breathe and think .

With some , extreme fatigue leads to restlessness of body . Not so with [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . The more tired [he]154-symon of worcester was , the more perfectly still [he]154-symon of worcester sat ; [his]154-symon of worcester knees crossed , [his]154-symon of worcester elbows on the arms of [his]154-symon of worcester chair , the fingers of both hands pressed lightly together , [his]154-symon of worcester head resting against the high back of the chair , [his]154-symon of worcester gaze fixed upon the view across [the river]1941-the river .

As [he]154-symon of worcester looked with unseeing eyes upon [the wide stretch of meadow]2928-the wide stretch of meadow , [the distant woods]2929-the distant woods and the soft outline of [the Malvern hills]2930-the malvern hills , [he]154-symon of worcester was thinking how good it would be never again to leave [this quiet room]2931-this quiet room ; never to move from this chair ; never again to see [a human being]2932-a human being ; never to have to smile when [he]154-symon of worcester was heart - sick , or to bow when [he]154-symon of worcester felt ungracious !

Those who knew [the Bishop]4673-the bishop best , often spoke together of [his]154-symon of worcester wondrous vitality and energy , [their]2934-they favourite remark being : that [he]154-symon of worcester was never tired . [They]2934-they might with more truth have said that [they]2934-they had never known [him]154-symon of worcester to appear tired .

It had long been a rule in [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's private code , that weariness , either of body or spirit , must not be shewn to [others]482-others . The more tired [he]154-symon of worcester was , the more ready grew [his]154-symon of worcester smile , the more alert [his]154-symon of worcester movements , the more gracious [his]154-symon of worcester response to any call upon [his]154-symon of worcester sympathy or interest .

[He]154-symon of worcester never sighed in company , as did [Father Peter]219-father peter when , having supped too well off jolly of salmon , roast venison , and raisin pie , [he]154-symon of worcester was fain to let indigestion pass muster for melancholy .

[He]154-symon of worcester never yawned in Council , either gracefully behind [his]154-symon of worcester hand , as did [the lean Spanish Cardinal]95-the french cardinal ; or openly and unashamed , as did [the round and rosy Abbot of [Evesham]71-evesham]2937-the round and rosy abbot of evesham , displaying to the fascinated gaze of [the brethren in stalls opposite , a cavernous throat , a red and healthy tongue , and a particularly fine set of teeth]2938-the brethren in stalls opposite , a cavernous throat , a red and healthy tongue , and a particularly fine set of teeth .

Moreover [the Bishop]4673-the bishop would as soon have thought of carrying a garment from the body of [a plague - stricken patient]2940-a plague - stricken patient into the midst of [a family of healthy children]2941-a family of healthy children , as of entering an assemblage with a jaded countenance or a languorous manner .

Therefore : " [He]154-symon of worcester is never weary , "[5582-his friends] said [[his]154-symon of worcester friends]5582-his friends .

" [He]154-symon of worcester knoweth not the meaning of fatigue , "[2943-his acquaintances] agreed [[his]154-symon of worcester acquaintances]2943-his acquaintances .

" There is no merit in labour which is not in anywise a burden , but , rather , a delight , "[2944-those who envied his powers] pronounced [those who envied [his]154-symon of worcester powers]2944-those who envied his powers .

" [He]154-symon of worcester is possessed , "[2945-his enemies] sneered [[his]154-symon of worcester enemies]2945-his enemies , " by [a most energetic demon]6548-a most energetic demon ! Were [that demon exorcised]6549-that demon exorcised , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop would collapse , exhausted . "[2945-his enemies] " [He]154-symon of worcester is filled , "[2946-his admirers] said [[his]154-symon of worcester admirers]2946-his admirers , " by the Spirit of [God]89-god , and is thus so energized that [he]154-symon of worcester can work incessantly , without experiencing ordinary human weakness . "[2946-his admirers]

And [none]315-none knew that it was a part of [his]154-symon of worcester religion to [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester , to hide [his]154-symon of worcester weariness from [others]482-others .

Yet once when , in [[her]2949-her chamber]4322-her chamber , [he]154-symon of worcester sat talking with [the Prioress]373-the prioress , [she]2949-her had risen , of a sudden , saying : " [You]154-symon of worcester are tired , [Father]219-father peter . Rest there in silence , while [I]2949-her work at [my]2949-her missal . "[2949-her]

[She]2949-her had passed to the table ; and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had sat resting , just as [he]154-symon of worcester was sitting now , save that [his]154-symon of worcester eyes could then dwell on [her]2949-her face , as [she]2949-her bent , absorbed , over the illumination .

After a while [he]154-symon of worcester had asked : " How knew [you]2949-her that [I]154-symon of worcester was tired , [[my]154-symon of worcester dear]4718-my dear [Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress ? "[154-symon of worcester] Without lifting [her]2949-her eyes , [she]2949-her had made answer : " Because , [[my]2949-her Lord [Bishop]92-bishop]4963-my lord bishop , [you]154-symon of worcester twice smiled when there was no occasion for smiling . "[2949-her] Another period of restful silence , while [she]2949-her worked , and [he]154-symon of worcester watched [her]2949-her working . Then [he]154-symon of worcester had remarked : " [[My]154-symon of worcester friends]5062-my friends say [I]154-symon of worcester am never tired . "[154-symon of worcester]

And [she]2949-her had answered : " [They]5062-my friends would speak more truly if [they]5062-my friends said that [you]4673-the bishop are ever brave . "[2949-her]

It had amazed [the Bishop]4673-the bishop to find [himself]154-symon of worcester thus understood . Moreover [he]154-symon of worcester could scarce put on [his]154-symon of worcester biretta , so crowned was [his]154-symon of worcester head by the laurels of [her]2949-her praise . Also this had been the only time when [he]154-symon of worcester had wondered whether [the Prioress]373-the prioress really believed [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise to be at [the bottom of [the ocean]5540-the ocean]5539-the bottom of the ocean . It is ever an astonishment to [a man]4482-a man when the unerring intuition of [a woman]813-a woman is brought to bear upon [himself]4482-a man .

Now , in this hour of [his]154-symon of worcester overwhelming fatigue , [he]154-symon of worcester recalled that scene . Closing [his]154-symon of worcester eyes on the distant view , and opening them upon the enchanted vistas of memory , [he]154-symon of worcester speedily saw that calm face , with its chastened expression of fine self - control , bending above the page [she]2949-her was illuminating . [He]154-symon of worcester saw the severe lines of the wimple , the folds of the flowing veil , the delicate movement of the long fingers , and yes ! resting upon [her]2949-her bosom the jewelled cross , sign of [[her]2949-her high office]752-her high office .

Thus looking back , [he]154-symon of worcester vividly recalled the extraordinary restfulness of sitting there in silence , while [she]2949-her worked . No words were needed . [Her]2949-her very presence , and the fact that [she]2949-her knew [him]154-symon of worcester to be weary , rested [him]154-symon of worcester .

[He]154-symon of worcester looked again . But now the folds of the wimple and veil were gone . A golden circlet clasped the shining softness of [her]2949-her hair . [The Bishop]4673-the bishop opened tired eyes , and fixed them once again upon [the landscape]2961-the landscape .

[He]4673-the bishop supposed the long rides on two successive days had exhausted [him]4673-the bishop physically ; and the strain of securing and ensuring the safety and happiness of [the woman who was dearer to [him]4673-the bishop than life]2962-the woman who was dearer to him than life , had reacted now in a mental lassitude which seemed unable to rise up and face the prospect of the lonely years to come .

The thought of [her]2949-her as now with [the Knight]764-the knight , did not cause [him]4673-the bishop suffering . [His]4673-the bishop one anxiety was lest anything unforeseen should arise , to prevent the full fruition of [their]2964-their happiness .

[He]4673-the bishop had never loved [her]2949-her as [a man]4482-a man loves [the woman [he]4482-a man would [we]2967-we d]2966-the woman he would we d ; at least , if that side of [his]4673-the bishop love had attempted to arise , it had instantly been throttled and flung back .

It seemed to [him]4673-the bishop that , from the very beginning [he]4673-the bishop had ever loved [her]2949-her as [Saint Joseph]190-saint joseph must have loved the maiden intrusted to [his]4673-the bishop keeping [his]4673-the bishop , yet not [his]4673-the bishop ; called , in the inspired dream , " [Mary]102-sister seraphine , [[thy]4673-the bishop wife]4342-thy wife "[190-saint joseph] ; but so called only that [he]4673-the bishop might have the right to guard and care for [her]2949-her [she]2949-her who was [shrine of the Holiest , o'ershadowed by the power of the Highest]2968-shrine of the holiest , o'ershadowed by the power of the highest ; Mother of [God]89-god , most blessed Virgin forever .

It seemed to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop that [his]4673-the bishop joy in watching over [Mora]144-mora , since [his]4673-the bishop appointment to [the See of [Worcester]1-worcester]5619-the see of worcester , had been such as [Saint Joseph]190-saint joseph could well have understood ; and now [he]4673-the bishop had accomplished the supreme thing ; and , in so doing , had left [himself]4673-the bishop desolate .

On the afternoon of the previous day , so soon as the body of [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister had been removed from [[the Prioress]373-the prioress 's cell]1809-the prioress 's cell , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had gathered together all those things which [Mora]144-mora specially valued and which [she]144-mora had asked [him]4673-the bishop to secure for [her]144-mora ; mostly [his]4673-the bishop gifts to [her]144-mora .

The Sacramentaries , from which [she]144-mora so often made copies and translations , now lay upon [his]4673-the bishop table .

[His]4673-the bishop tired eyes dwelt upon them . How often [he]4673-the bishop had watched the firm white fingers opening those heavy clasps , and slowly turning the pages .

The books remained ; yet [her]144-mora presence was gone .

[His]4673-the bishop weary brain repeated , over and over , this obvious fact ; then began a hypothetical reversal of it . Supposing the books had gone , and [her]144-mora presence had remained ? . . . Presently a catalogue formed itself in [his]4673-the bishop mind of all those things which might have gone , unmissed , unmourned , if [her]144-mora dear presence had remained . . . . Before long [the Palace]1309-the palace . . . [the City]1177-the city . . . [the Cathedral itself]2977-the cathedral itself . . . all had swelled the list . . . . [He]4673-the bishop was alone with [Mora]144-mora and the sunset ; . . . and the battlements of glory were the radiant walls of [heaven]335-heaven ; . . . and soon [he]4673-the bishop and [she]144-mora were walking up [old [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's golden stair]2979-old mary antony 's golden stair together . . . .

Hush ! . . . " So [He]4673-the bishop giveth [His]4673-the bishop beloved sleep . "[144-mora]
