[The Bishop]4673-the bishop had but just returned from laying to rest , in [the burying - ground of [the Convent]328-the convent]2981-the burying - ground of the convent , the worn - out body of [the aged lay - sister]2044-the aged lay - sister .

When [he]4673-the bishop had signified that [he]4673-the bishop intended [himself]4673-the bishop to perform the last rites , [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress had ventured upon amazed expostulation .

Such an honour had never , in the history of [the Community]483-the community , been accorded even to [the Canonesses]2985-the canonesses , much less to [a lay - sister]1767-a lay - sister . Surely [Father Peter]219-father peter or [the Prior]2987-the prior ? Had it been [the Prioress]373-the prioress [herself]373-the prioress , why then

[Few]230-few can remember the petrifying effect of a flash of sudden anger in the kindly eyes of [[Symon]154-symon of worcester of [Worcester]1-worcester]5615-symon of worcester . [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress will never forget it .

So , with as much pomp and circumstance as if [she]373-the prioress had been [Prioress of [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies]4675-prioress of the white ladies , [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's humble remains were laid in that plot in [the Convent burying - ground which [she]373-the prioress had chosen for [herself]373-the prioress]2992-the convent burying - ground which she had chosen for herself , half a century before .

Much sorrow was shewn , by [the entire Community]633-the entire community . The great loss [they]633-the entire community had sustained by the mysterious passing of [the Prioress]373-the prioress from [their]633-the entire community midst , weighed heavily upon [them]633-the entire community ; and seemed , in some way which [they]633-the entire community could not fathom , to be connected with the death of [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister .

As the solemn procession slowly wended [its]2996-its way from [the Chapel]5170-the chapel , along the Cypress Walk , and so , across [the orchard]4382-the orchard , to [the burying - ground]2999-the burying - ground , the tears which ran down the chastened faces of [the nuns]298-the nuns , were as much a tribute of love to [[their]633-the entire community late Prioress]3001-their late prioress , as a sign of sorrow for the loss of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . [The little company of lay - sisters]3002-the little company of lay - sisters sobbed without restraint . [Sister Abigail]99-sister abigail , so often called " [noisy hussy]6555-noisy hussy "[99-sister abigail] by [old Antony]85-mary antony , fully , on this final occasion , justified the name .

As [the procession]2176-the procession was re - forming to leave [the grave]3004-the grave , [Sister Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine felt that the moment had now arrived , [old Antony]85-mary antony being disposed of , when [she]85-mary antony might suitably become the centre of attention , and be carried , on the return journey . [She]85-mary antony therefore fell prone upon the ground , in a fainting fit .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop , [[his]4673-the bishop chaplain]1582-his chaplain , [the priests]3007-the priests and [acolytes]2752-acolytes , paused uncertain what to do .

[Sister Teresa]113-sister teresa , and [other nuns]3009-other nuns , would have hastened to raise [her]85-mary antony , but the command of [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress rang sharp and clear .

" Let [her]85-mary antony lie ! If [she]85-mary antony choose to remain with [the Dead]686-the dead , it is but small loss to [the Living]4786-the living . "[85-mary antony]

And with hands devoutly crossed upon [her]85-mary antony breast , ferret face peering to right and left from out the curtain of [her]85-mary antony veil , [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress moved forward at the head of [the nuns]298-the nuns .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop 's procession , which had wavered , continued to lead the way ; solemn chanting began ; and , as [the Bishop]4673-the bishop turned into [the Cypress Walk]3013-the cypress walk [he]4673-the bishop saw the flying figure of [Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine running among the trees in [the orchard]4382-the orchard , trying to catch up , and to take [her]102-sister seraphine place again , unnoticed , among the rest .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop smiled , remembering [his]4673-the bishop many talks with [the Prioress]373-the prioress concerning [Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , and [the Knight]764-the knight 's dismay when [he]4673-the bishop feared [they]3018-they were foisting [the wayward nun]475-the wayward nun upon [him]4673-the bishop .

Then [he]4673-the bishop sighed as [he]4673-the bishop realised that the control of [the Convent]328-the convent had now passed into the able hands of [Mother Sub - Prioress]324-mother sub - prioress ; and that , in these unusual circumstances , the task of selecting and appointing [a new Prioress]3022-a new prioress , fell to [him]4673-the bishop .

Perhaps [his]4673-the bishop conversations on this subject , first with [the Prior]2987-the prior , and later on with [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , partly accounted for [his]4673-the bishop extreme fatigue , now that [he]4673-the bishop found [himself]4673-the bishop at last alone in [[his]4673-the bishop library]1954-his library .

But the reward of [those " whose strength is to sit still , "]6558-those " whose strength is to sit still , "[6558-those " whose strength is to sit still , "] had come to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

Soon after [he]4673-the bishop fixed [his]4673-the bishop eyes upon [the Gregorian and Gelasian Sacramentaries]3026-the gregorian and gelasian sacramentaries , [his]4673-the bishop eyelids gently began to droop . Sleep was already upon [him]4673-the bishop when [he]4673-the bishop decided to let [the Palace]1309-the palace , [the City]1177-the city , yea , even [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral go , if [he]4673-the bishop might but keep [the Prioress]373-the prioress . And as [he]4673-the bishop walked with [Mora]144-mora up [the golden stair]3031-the golden stair , [his]4673-the bishop mind was at rest ; [his]4673-the bishop weary body slept . A very few minutes of sleep sufficed [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

[He]4673-the bishop awoke as suddenly as [he]4673-the bishop had fallen asleep ; and , as [he]4673-the bishop awoke , [he]4673-the bishop seemed to hear [himself]4673-the bishop say : " Nay , [Hugh]228-hugh . None save [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . "[4673-the bishop]

[He]4673-the bishop sat up , wondering what this sentence could mean ; also when and where it had been spoken .

As [he]4673-the bishop wondered , [his]4673-the bishop eye fell upon the white stone which [he]4673-the bishop had flung into [the Severn]58-the severn , and which [the Knight]764-the knight , diving from the parapet , had retrieved from [the river bed]3034-the river bed . The stone seemed in some way connected with this chance sentence which had repeated itself in [his]4673-the bishop brain .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop rose , walked over to [his]4673-the bishop deed chest , took the white stone in [his]4673-the bishop hand and stood motionless , [his]4673-the bishop eyes fixed upon it , wrapped in thought . Then [he]4673-the bishop passed out on to [the lawn]2475-the lawn , and paced slowly to and fro between the archway leading from [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , to the parapet overlooking [the river]1941-the river .

Yes ; it was [here]4536-here .

[He]4673-the bishop had ridden in on [Shulamite]173-shulamite , from [the heights above [the town]4629-the town]5275-the heights above the town , whence [he]4673-the bishop had watched [the Prioress]373-the prioress ride in [the river meadow]5045-the river meadow .

[He]4673-the bishop had found [Hugh]228-hugh d'Argent awaiting [him]4673-the bishop , and together [they]3044-they had paced [this lawn]3045-this lawn in earnest conversation .

[Hugh]228-hugh had been anxious to hear every detail of [his]228-hugh visit to [the Convent]328-the convent and the scene in [[the Prioress]373-the prioress 's cell]1809-the prioress 's cell when [he]228-hugh had shewn [her]373-the prioress the copy of [the Pope]5391-the pope 's mandate , just received from [Rome]37-rome . In speaking of the possible developments which might take place in the course of the next few hours , [Hugh]228-hugh had asked whether [any in [the Convent]328-the convent]3050-any in the convent , beside [Mora]144-mora [herself]144-mora , knew of [his]228-hugh presence in [Worcester]1-worcester , or that [he]228-hugh had managed to obtain entrance to [the cloisters]316-the cloisters by [the crypt passage]2295-the crypt passage , to make [his]228-hugh way disguised to [[Mora]144-mora 's cell]3054-mora 's cell , and to have speech with [her]144-mora .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop had answered that [none]315-none knew of this , save [the old lay - sister [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , who was wholly devoted to [the Prioress]373-the prioress , made shrewd by ninety years of experience in outwitting [[her]85-mary antony superiors]3059-her superiors]3057-the old lay - sister mary antony , who was wholly devoted to the prioress , made shrewd by ninety years of experience in outwitting her superiors , and could be completely trusted .

" How came [she]373-the prioress to know ? "[4673-the bishop] [the Bishop]4673-the bishop seemed to remember that [the Knight]764-the knight had asked . And [he]4673-the bishop had made answer that [he]4673-the bishop had as yet no definite information , but was inclined to suspect that when [the Prioress]373-the prioress had bidden [the old woman]430-the old woman begone , [she]373-the prioress had slipped into some place of concealment from whence [she]373-the prioress had seen and heard something of what passed in [the cell]291-the cell .

To this [the Knight]764-the knight had made no comment ; and now , walking up and down [the lawn]2475-the lawn , the white stone in [his]764-the knight hand , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop could not feel sure how far [Hugh]228-hugh had taken in the exact purport of the words ; yet well [he]4673-the bishop knew that sentences which pass almost unnoticed when heard with a mind preoccupied , are apt to return later on , with full significance , should anything occur upon which [they]3068-they shed a light .

This then was the complication which had brought [the Bishop]4673-the bishop out to pace [the lawn]2475-the lawn , recalling each step in the conversation , there where it had taken place .

Sooner or later , [Mora]144-mora will tell [[her]144-mora husband]5164-her husband of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's wondrous vision . If [she]144-mora reaches the conclusion , uninterrupted , all will be well . [The Knight]764-the knight will realise the importance of concealing the fact of [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister 's knowledge by non - miraculous means of [his]764-the knight presence in [the cell]291-the cell , and [his]764-the knight suit to [the Prioress]373-the prioress . But should [she]144-mora preface [her]144-mora recital by remarking that [none in the Community]3076-none in the community had knowledge of [his]764-the knight visit , [the Knight]764-the knight will probably at once say : " Nay , there [you]4673-the bishop are mistaken ! [I]764-the knight have it from [the Bishop]4673-the bishop that [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , knew of it , having stayed hidden where [she]264-the old lay - sister saw and heard much that passed ; yet being very faithful , and more than common shrewd , could so said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop be most completely trusted . "[764-the knight]

Whereupon irreparable harm would be done ; for , at once , [Mora]144-mora would realise that [she]144-mora had been deceived ; and [her]144-mora peace of mind and calm of conscience would be disturbed , if not completely overthrown .

One thing seemed clear to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

[Hugh]228-hugh must be warned . Probably no harm had as yet been done . The vision was so sacred a thing to [Mora]144-mora , that weeks might elapse before [she]144-mora spoke of it to [[her]144-mora husband]5164-her husband .

With as little delay as possible [Hugh]228-hugh must be put upon [his]228-hugh guard .

CHAPTER XLII

THE WARNING

Alert , determined , all trace of lassitude departed , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop returned to [the library]2268-the library , laid the stone upon the deed chest , sat down at a table and wrote a letter . [He]4673-the bishop had made up [his]4673-the bishop mind as to what must be said , and not once did [he]4673-the bishop pause or hesitate over a word .

While still writing , [he]4673-the bishop lifted [his]4673-the bishop left hand and struck upon a silver gong .

When [[his]4673-the bishop servant]3082-his servant entered , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop spoke without raising [his]4673-the bishop eyes from the table .

" Request [Brother Philip]160-brother philip to come here , without loss of time . "[4673-the bishop]

When [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , having signed [his]4673-the bishop letter , laid down the pen , and looked up , [Brother Philip]160-brother philip stood before [him]4673-the bishop .

" [Philip]160-brother philip , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , ' select [a trustworthy messenger from among [the stable men]3087-the stable men]3086-a trustworthy messenger from among the stable men , [one possessed of wits as well as muscle]3088-one possessed of wits as well as muscle ; mount [him]3086-a trustworthy messenger from among the stable men on a good beast , supply [him]3086-a trustworthy messenger from among the stable men with whatsoever [he]3086-a trustworthy messenger from among the stable men may need for a possible six days ' journey . Bring [him]3086-a trustworthy messenger from among the stable men to [me]0-i so soon as [he]3086-a trustworthy messenger from among the stable men is ready to set forth . [He]3086-a trustworthy messenger from among the stable men must bear a letter , of much importance , to [Sir Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh ; and , seeing that [I]0-i know only [the Knight]764-the knight 's route and stopping places , on [his]3086-a trustworthy messenger from among the stable men northward ride , but not [his]3086-a trustworthy messenger from among the stable men time of starting , which may have been yesterday or may not be until to - morrow , [[my]0-i messenger]5436-my messenger must ride first to [Warwick]32-warwick , which if [the Knight]764-the knight has left , [he]3086-a trustworthy messenger from among the stable men must then follow in [his]3086-a trustworthy messenger from among the stable men tracks until [he]3086-a trustworthy messenger from among the stable men overtake [him]764-the knight . "[3086-a trustworthy messenger from among the stable men]

" [[My]160-brother philip lord]4881-my lord , "[160-brother philip] said [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , " the sun is setting and the daylight fades . [The messenger]4548-the messenger can not now reach [Warwick]32-warwick until long after nightfall . Would it not be safer to have all in readiness , and let [him]4548-the messenger start at dawn . [He]4548-the messenger would then arrive early in the day , and could speedily overtake [the most worshipful Knight who , riding with [[his]4548-the messenger lady]5043-his lady , will do the journey by short stages]6565-the most worshipful knight who , riding with his lady , will do the journey by short stages . "[160-brother philip]

" Nay , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " the matter allows of no delay . Mount [him]4548-the messenger so well , that [he]4548-the messenger shall outdistance all dangers . [He]4548-the messenger must start within half an hour . "[4673-the bishop]

[Brother Philip]160-brother philip , bowing low , withdrew .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop bent again over the table , and read what [he]160-brother philip had written . Glancing quickly through the opening greetings , [he]4673-the bishop considered carefully what followed .

" This comes to [you]160-brother philip , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , by [messenger]6568-messenger , riding in urgent haste , because the advice herein contained is of extreme importance .[4673-the bishop]

" On no account let [Mora]144-mora know that which [I]4673-the bishop told [you]160-brother philip here , four days since , as [we]6569-we paced [the lawn]2475-the lawn ; namely : that [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , was aware of [your]160-brother philip visit to [the Convent]328-the convent , and had , from some place of concealment , seen and heard much of what passed in [[Mora]144-mora 's cell]3054-mora 's cell . How far [you]160-brother philip realised this , when [I]4673-the bishop made mention of it , [I]4673-the bishop know not . [You]160-brother philip made no comment . It mattered little , then ; but has now become a thing of extreme importance .[4673-the bishop]

" On that morning , finding [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister knew more than [any supposed]6575-any supposed , and was wholly devoted to [the Prioress]373-the prioress , [I]4673-the bishop had chanced to remark to [her]264-the old lay - sister as [I]4673-the bishop rode out of [the courtyard]775-the courtyard that [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother would thrust happiness from [her]264-the old lay - sister with both hands unless [[our]6578-our Lady]4260-our lady [herself]4260-our lady offered it , by vision or revelation .[4673-the bishop]

" Whereupon , [[my]4673-the bishop dear [Knight]228-hugh]6580-my dear knight , that faithful old heart using wits [she]4260-our lady had prayed [[our]6578-our Lady]4260-our lady to sharpen , contrived a vision of [her]4260-our lady own devising , so wondrously contrived , so excellently devised , that [Mora]144-mora not dreaming of [old Antony]85-mary antony 's secret knowledge could not fail to believe it true . In fact , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , [you]5057-my son may praise heaven for [an old woman]6583-an old woman 's wits , for , as [you]5057-my son will doubtless some day hear from [Mora]144-mora [herself]144-mora , [they]6584-they gave [you]5057-my son [[your]5057-my son wife]4531-your wife ![4673-the bishop]

" But beware lest any chance words of yours lead [Mora]144-mora to suspect the genuineness of the vision . It would cost [HER]144-mora [her]144-mora peace of mind . It might cost [YOU]5057-my son [her]144-mora presence .[4673-the bishop]

" Meanwhile [the aged lay - sister]2044-the aged lay - sister died yesterday , after having mystified [the entire Community]633-the entire community by locking [herself]2044-the aged lay - sister into [[the Prioress]373-the prioress 's cell]1809-the prioress 's cell , and remaining [there]333-there , from the time [she]2044-the aged lay - sister found [it]333-there empty when [the nuns]298-the nuns returned from [Vespers]17-vespers , until [I]4673-the bishop arrived on the following afternoon . [She]2044-the aged lay - sister thus prevented any questionings concerning [Mora]144-mora 's flight , and averted possible scandal . But the twenty - four hours without food or drink cost [the old woman]430-the old woman [her]2044-the aged lay - sister life . [A faithful heart]6593-a faithful heart indeed , and [a most shrewd wit]6594-a most shrewd wit ![4673-the bishop]

" Some day , if occasion permit , [I]0-i will recount to [you]3094-you the full story of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's strategy . It is well worth the hearing . "[0-i] [I]0-i trust [your]3094-you happiness is complete ; and [hers]3095-hers , [Hugh]228-hugh , [hers]3095-hers !

" But [we]6595-we must take no risks ; and never must [we]6595-we forget that , in dealing with [Mora]144-mora , [we]6595-we are dealing with the heart of [a nun]412-a nun .[0-i]

" Therefore , [[my]3095-hers son]5057-my son , be wary . Heaven grant this may reach [you]5057-my son without delay , and in time to prevent mischief . "[3095-hers]

When [the messenger]4548-the messenger , fully equipped for [his]4548-the messenger journey , was brought before [the Bishop]4673-the bishop by [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , this letter lay ready , sealed , and addressed to [Sir Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent , at [Warwick Castle]68-warwick castle in the first place , but failing [there]333-there , to each successive stopping place upon [the northward road]3099-the northward road , including [Castle Norelle]21-castle norelle , which , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had gathered , was to be reached on the seventh day after leaving [Warwick]32-warwick .

So presently [the messenger]4548-the messenger swung into the saddle , and rode out through the great gates . In a leathern wallet at [his]4548-the messenger belt , was the letter , and a good sum of money for [his]4548-the messenger needs on the journey ; and in [his]4548-the messenger somewhat stolid mind , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's very simple instructions simple , yet given with so keen a look , transfixing [the man]4228-the man , that it seemed to [the honest fellow]3104-the honest fellow [he]4548-the messenger had received [them]3105-them from the point of a blue steel blade .

[He]4548-the messenger was to ride to [Warwick]32-warwick , without drawing rein ; to wake [the porter at the gate]3106-the porter at the gate , and [the seneschal within]3107-the seneschal within , no matter at what hour [he]4548-the messenger arrived . If [the Knight]764-the knight were still at [the Castle]5855-the castle , the letter must be placed in [his]4548-the messenger hands so soon as [he]4548-the messenger left [[his]4548-the messenger chamber]2387-his chamber in the morning . But had [he]4548-the messenger already gone from [Warwick]32-warwick , [the messenger]4548-the messenger , after food and rest for [himself]4548-the messenger and [his]4548-the messenger horse , was to ride on to the next stage and , if needful , to the next , until [he]4548-the messenger overtook [Sir Hugh]132-hugh and delivered into [his]4548-the messenger own hands , with as much secrecy as possible , the letter .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop passed along [the gallery]3113-the gallery , after [the messenger]4548-the messenger had left [the library]2268-the library , mounted to [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall and watched [him]4548-the messenger ride away , from that casement , overlooking [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , from which [Hugh]132-hugh had looked down upon the arrival of [Roger de Berchelai]179-young roger de berchelai , bringing the letter from [Rome]37-rome .

A great relief filled the mind of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop as [he]4673-the bishop heard the clattering hoofs of the fastest nag in [[his]4548-the messenger stables]3119-his stables , ring on the paving stones without , and die away in the distance .

A serious danger would be averted , if [the Knight]764-the knight were warned in time .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop prayed that [his]4673-the bishop letter might reach [Hugh]132-hugh 's hands before [Mora]144-mora was moved to speak to [him]4673-the bishop of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's vision .

[He]4673-the bishop blamed [himself]4673-the bishop bitterly for not having sooner recalled that conversation on [the lawn]2475-the lawn . How easy it would have been , after hearing [Mora]144-mora 's story in [the arbour]2476-the arbour , to have given [Hugh]132-hugh a word of caution before leaving [Warwick]32-warwick .

Just after sunset , [one of [[the Bishop]92-bishop 's men , who had remained behind at [Warwick]32-warwick]3125-the bishop 's men , who had remained behind at warwick]3124-one of the bishop 's men , who had remained behind at warwick , reached [the Palace]1309-the palace , bringing news that [the Knight]764-the knight , [[his]764-the knight Lady]5043-his lady , and [[their]3129-their entire retinue]3130-their entire retinue , had ridden out from [Warwick]32-warwick in the afternoon of the previous day .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop chafed at the delay this must involve , yet rejoiced at the prompt beginning of the homeward journey , having secretly feared lest [Hugh]132-hugh should find some difficulty in persuading [[his]764-the knight bride]4744-his bride to set forth with [him]764-the knight .

After all , [they]3129-their were but two days ahead of the messenger who , by fast riding , might overtake [them]3129-their on the morrow . [Mistress Deborah]209-mistress deborah , even on a pillion , should prove a substantial impediment to rapid progress .

But , alas , before noon on the day following , [Brother Philip]160-brother philip appeared in haste , with an anxious countenance .

[The messenger]4548-the messenger had returned , footsore and exhausted , bruised and wounded , with scarce a rag to [his]4548-the messenger back .

In [the forest]6518-the forest , while still ten miles from [Warwick]32-warwick , overtaken by the darkness , [he]4548-the messenger had met [a band of robbers , who had taken [his]4548-the messenger horse and all [he]4548-the messenger possessed]3135-a band of robbers , who had taken his horse and all he possessed , leaving [him]4548-the messenger for dead , in [a ditch by [the wayside]3137-the wayside]3136-a ditch by the wayside . Being but stunned and badly bruised , when [he]4548-the messenger came to [himself]4548-the messenger [he]4548-the messenger thought it best to make [his]4548-the messenger way back to [Worcester]1-worcester and there report [his]4548-the messenger misadventure .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop listened to this luckless tale in silence .

When it was finished [he]4673-the bishop said , gently : " [[My]4673-the bishop good [Philip]160-brother philip]6019-my good philip , [thou]6599-thou art proved right , and [I]4673-the bishop , wrong . Had [I]4673-the bishop been guided by [thee]6599-thou , [I]4673-the bishop should not have lost a good horse , nor which is of greater importance at this juncture twenty - four hours of most precious time . "[4673-the bishop]

[Brother Philip]160-brother philip made a profound obeisance , looking deeply ashamed of [his]160-brother philip own superior foresight and wisdom , and miserably wishful that [the Reverend Father]5052-the reverend father had been right , and [he]4548-the messenger , wrong .

" However , "[4673-the bishop] continued [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , after a moment of rapid thought , " [I]4673-the bishop must forgo the melancholy luxury of meditating upon [my]4673-the bishop folly , until after [we]6600-we have taken prompt measures , so far as may be , to put right the mischief it has wrought .[4673-the bishop]

" This time , [my]4673-the bishop good [Philip]160-brother philip , [you]160-brother philip shall be the bearer of [my]4673-the bishop letter . Take with [you]160-brother philip , as escort , two of [[our]6600-we men]6601-our men more , if [you]160-brother philip think needful . Ride straight from here , by the most direct route to [Castle Norelle]21-castle norelle , [the home of [the noble Countess]6603-the noble countess , lately wedded to [Sir Hugh]132-hugh]6602-the home of the noble countess , lately wedded to sir hugh . [I]4673-the bishop will make [you]160-brother philip a plan of [the road]4623-the road .[4673-the bishop]

" If , when [you]160-brother philip reach [the place]2838-the place , [Sir Hugh]132-hugh and [[his]132-hugh bride]4744-his bride have arrived , ask to have speech with [the Knight]764-the knight alone , and put the letter into [his]764-the knight own hands . But if [they]6608-they are yet on the way , ride to meet [them]6608-they , by [a road]6609-a road [I]4673-the bishop will clearly indicate . Only be careful to keep out of sight of all save [the Knight]764-the knight or [[his]764-the knight body - servant]1957-his body - servant , [Martin Goodfellow]133-martin .[4673-the bishop]

" The letter delivered , and the answer in [thy]160-brother philip hands , return , to [me]4673-the bishop as speedily as may be , without [overpressing men]6612-overpressing men or steeds . How soon canst [thou]160-brother philip set forth ? "[4673-the bishop]

" Within the hour , [[my]160-brother philip lord]4881-my lord , "[160-brother philip] said [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , joyfully , cured of [his]160-brother philip shame by this call to immediate service ; " with [an escort of three]6614-an escort of three , that [we]6615-we may ride by night as well as by day . "[160-brother philip]

" Good , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ; and , as [the lay - brother]5259-the lay - brother , bowing low , hastened from [the chamber]627-the chamber , [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester drew toward [him]4673-the bishop writing materials , and penned afresh [his]154-symon of worcester warning to [the Knight]764-the knight ; not at such length as in the former missive , but making very clear the need for silence concerning [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's previous knowledge of [his]154-symon of worcester visit to [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery , lest [Mora]144-mora should come to doubt the genuineness of the vision which had brought [her]144-mora to [her]144-mora great decision , and which in very truth had been wholly contrived by the loving heart and nimble wits of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony .

So once again [the Bishop]4673-the bishop stood at the casement in [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall ; and , looking down into [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , saw [faithful Philip]160-brother philip , with [an escort fully armed]3149-an escort fully armed , ride out at the Palace gates .

No time had been lost in repairing the mistake . Yet there was heavy foreboding at [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's heart , as [he]4673-the bishop paced slowly down [the hall]1551-the hall .

Greatly [he]4673-the bishop feared lest this twenty - four hours ' delay should mean mischief wrought , which could never be undone .

Passing into [the chapel]5170-the chapel , [he]4673-the bishop kneeled long before [the shrine of [Saint Joseph]190-saint joseph]3153-the shrine of saint joseph praying , with an intense fervour of petition , that [his]4673-the bishop warning might reach [the Knight]764-the knight before any word had passed [his]4673-the bishop lips which could shake [Mora]144-mora 's belief in that which was to [her]144-mora the sole justification for the important step [she]144-mora had taken .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop prayed and fasted ; fasted , prayed , and kept vigil . And all the night through , in thought , [he]4673-the bishop followed [Brother Philip]160-brother philip and [[his]160-brother philip escort]3156-his escort as [they]3157-they rode northward , through [the forests]4422-the forests , up [the glens]3159-the glens , and over [the moors]4601-the moors , making direct for [[Mora]144-mora 's home]5857-mora 's home , to which [she]144-mora and [Hugh]132-hugh were travelling by a more roundabout way .

CHAPTER XLIII

MORA MOUNTS TO [THE BATTLEMENTS]3162-the battlements

The moonlight , shining in at the open casement , illumined , with its clear radiance , [the chamber which had been , during the years of [her]144-mora maidenhood]3163-the chamber which had been , during the years of her maidenhood , [[Mora de Norelle]144-mora 's sleeping apartment]3164-mora de norelle 's sleeping apartment .

[It]3163-the chamber which had been , during the years of her maidenhood held many treasures of childhood . Every familiar thing within [it]3163-the chamber which had been , during the years of her maidenhood , whispered of the love and care of [those long passed into the realm of silence and of mystery]3165-those long passed into the realm of silence and of mystery ; [a noble father , slain in battle]3166-a noble father , slain in battle ; [a gentle mother]3167-a gentle mother , unable to survive [him]3166-a noble father , slain in battle , the call to [her]3167-a gentle mother of the spirit of [[her]3167-a gentle mother Warrior]3168-her warrior , being more compelling than the need of [the beautiful young daughter , to whom both had been devoted]3169-the beautiful young daughter , to whom both had been devoted .

[The chamber]627-the chamber seemed to [Mora]144-mora full of tender and poignant memories .

How many girlish dreams had been dreamed while [her]144-mora healthy young body rested upon that couch , after wild gallops over [the moors]4601-the moors , or a long day 's climbing among [the rocky hills]3172-the rocky hills , searching for rare ferns and flowers to transplant into [[her]144-mora garden]3173-her garden .

In [this room]3174-this room [she]144-mora had mourned [[her]144-mora father]3175-her father , with [her]144-mora strong young arms wrapped around [[her]144-mora weeping mother]3176-her weeping mother .

In [this room]3174-this room [she]144-mora had wept for [[her]144-mora mother]3178-her mother , with none to comfort [her]144-mora , saving [the faithful nurse]3179-the faithful nurse , [Deborah]209-mistress deborah .

To [this room]3174-this room [she]144-mora had fled in wrath , after the scene with , [[her]144-mora half - sister]3181-her half - sister , [Eleanor]138-eleanor , who had tried to despoil [her]144-mora of [her]144-mora heritage the noble Castle and lands left to [her]144-mora by [[her]144-mora father]3175-her father , and confirmed to [her]144-mora , with succession to [[her]144-mora father]3175-her father 's title , by [the King]4555-the king . These [Eleanor]138-eleanor desired for [[her]138-eleanor son]4607-her son ; but neither bribes nor cajolery , threats , nor cruel insinuations , had availed to induce [Mora]144-mora to give up [her]144-mora rightful possession [the home of [her]144-mora childhood]3186-the home of her childhood .

Before the effects of this storm had passed , [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent had made [his]132-hugh first appearance upon the scene , riding into [the courtyard]775-the courtyard as [[a King]3188-a king 's messenger]3189-a king 's messenger , but also making [himself]132-hugh known to [the young Countess]3190-the young countess as [a near neighbour , heir to [a castle]3192-a castle and [lands , not far distant]3193-lands , not far distant , among [the Cumberland hills]1674-the cumberland hills]3191-a near neighbour , heir to a castle and lands , not far distant , among the cumberland hills .

With both it had been love at first sight . [His]132-hugh short and ardent courtship had , unbeknown to [him]132-hugh , required not so much to win [her]3190-the young countess heart , as to overcome [her]3190-the young countess maidenly resistance , rendered stubborn by the consciousness that [her]3190-the young countess heart had already ranged itself on the side of [[her]3190-the young countess lover]762-her lover .

When at last , vanquished by [his]132-hugh eager determination , [she]3190-the young countess had yielded and become betrothed to [him]132-hugh , it had seemed to [her]3190-the young countess that life could hold no sweeter joy .

But [he]132-hugh , hard to content , ever headstrong and eager , already having taken the cross , and being now called at once to join [the King]4555-the king in [Palestine]24-palestine , begged for immediate marriage that [he]132-hugh might take [her]3190-the young countess with [him]132-hugh to [the Court of [the new Queen]3198-the new queen , to which [[his]132-hugh cousin]5716-his cousin [Alfrida]137-alfrida had already been summoned]3197-the court of the new queen , to which his cousin alfrida had already been summoned ; or , if [he]132-hugh must leave [her]3190-the young countess behind , at least leave [her]3190-the young countess , not affianced [maid]4518-maid , but [wedded wife]3201-wedded wife .

Here [Eleanor]138-eleanor and [[her]138-eleanor husband]5164-her husband had interposed ; and , assuming the position of [natural guardians]3203-natural guardians , had refused to allow the marriage to take place . This necessitated the consent of [the King]4555-the king , which could not be obtained , [he]4555-the king being in [the Holy Land]72-the holy land ; and [Hugh]132-hugh had no wish to make application to [the Queen - mother]3205-the queen - mother , then acting regent during the absence of [the King]4555-the king ; or to allow [[his]132-hugh betrothed]4943-his betrothed to be brought again into association with [the Court at [Windsor]27-windsor]3208-the court at windsor .

[Mora]144-mora secretly glad to keep yet a little longer the sweet bliss of betrothal , with its promise of unknown yet deeper joys to come resisted [Hugh]132-hugh 's attempts to induce [her]144-mora to defy [Eleanor]138-eleanor , flout [her]144-mora wrongful claim to authority , and [we]3209-we d [him]132-hugh without obtaining the Royal sanction . Steeped in the bliss of having taken one step into an unimagined state of happiness , [she]138-eleanor felt no necessity or inclination hurriedly to take another .

Yet when , upheld by the ecstasy of those final moments together , [she]138-eleanor had let [him]132-hugh go , as [she]138-eleanor watched [him]132-hugh ride away , a strange foreboding of coming ill had seized [her]138-eleanor , and a restless yearning , which [she]138-eleanor could not understand , yet which [she]138-eleanor knew would never be stilled until [she]138-eleanor could clasp [his]132-hugh head again to [her]138-eleanor breast , feel [his]132-hugh crisp hair in [her]138-eleanor fingers , and know [him]132-hugh safe , and [her]138-eleanor own .

[This chamber]3210-this chamber then had witnessed long hours of prayer and vigil , as [she]138-eleanor knelt at the shrine in [the nook between the casements]3211-the nook between the casements , beseeching [[our]3209-we Lady]4260-our lady and [Saint Joseph]190-saint joseph for the safe return of [[her]138-eleanor lover]762-her lover .

Then came the news of [Hugh]132-hugh 's supposed perfidy ; and from [this chamber]3210-this chamber [she]138-eleanor had gone forth to hide [her]138-eleanor broken heart in [the sacred refuge of [the Cloister]286-the cloister]3215-the sacred refuge of the cloister ; to offer to [God]89-god and the service of [Holy Church]5891-holy church , the life which had been robbed of all natural joys by the faithlessness of [a man]4482-a man .

And this had happened eight years ago , as [men]4397-men count time . But as [nuns]2613-nuns count it ? And [lovers]913-lovers ? A lifetime ? A night ?

It had seemed indeed a lifetime to [the Prioress of the White Ladies]1156-the prioress of the white ladies , during the first days of [her]138-eleanor return to [the world]389-the world . But to [the woman who now kneeled at the casement , drinking in the balmy sweetness of the summer night , looking with soft yearning eyes at the well - remembered landscape flooded in silvery moonlight]3224-the woman who now kneeled at the casement , drinking in the balmy sweetness of the summer night , looking with soft yearning eyes at the well - remembered landscape flooded in silvery moonlight , it seemed a night .

A night since [she]138-eleanor stood on the battlements , [[her]138-eleanor lover]762-her lover 's arms about [her]138-eleanor .

A night since [she]138-eleanor said : " [Thou]6616-thou wilt come back to [me]138-eleanor , [Hugh]132-hugh . . . . [My]138-eleanor love will ever be around [thee]132-hugh as a silver shield . "[138-eleanor]

A night since , as the last words [he]762-her lover should hear from [her]138-eleanor lips , [she]138-eleanor had said : " [Maid]4518-maid or [wife]4520-wife , [God]89-god knows [I]138-eleanor am all thine own . Thine , and none other 's , forever . "[138-eleanor]

Of all the memories connected with [this chamber]3210-this chamber , the clearest to - night was of the hungry ache at [her]138-eleanor heart , when [Hugh]132-hugh had gone . It had seemed to [her]138-eleanor then that never could that ache be stilled , until [she]138-eleanor could once again clasp [his]132-hugh head to [her]138-eleanor breast . [She]138-eleanor knew now that it never had been stilled . Dulled , ignored , denied ; called by other names ; but stilled never .

On this night it was as sweetly poignant as on that other night eight years ago , when [she]138-eleanor had slowly descended to [this very room]3227-this very room , from the moonlit battlements .

Yet to - night [she]138-eleanor was [maid]4518-maid and [wife]4520-wife . [Moreover Hugh]132-hugh was [here]4536-here , under [this very roof]3231-this very roof . Yet had [he]132-hugh bidden [her]138-eleanor a grave good - night , without so much as touching [her]138-eleanor hand . Yet [his]132-hugh dark eyes had said : " [I]132-hugh love [thee]138-eleanor . "[132-hugh]

Kneeling at the casement , [Mora]144-mora reviewed the days since [they]3232-they rode forth from [Warwick]32-warwick .

It had been a wondrous experience for [her]138-eleanor [she]138-eleanor , who had been [Prioress of the White Ladies]4675-prioress of the white ladies thus to ride out into [the radiant , sunny world]3234-the radiant , sunny world .

[Hugh]132-hugh was ever beside [her]138-eleanor , watchful , tender , shielding [her]138-eleanor from any possible pain or danger , yet claiming nothing , asking nothing , for [himself]132-hugh .

One night , not being assured of the safety of the place where [they]3232-they lodged , [she]138-eleanor found afterwards that [he]132-hugh had lain all night across the threshold of [the chamber within which [she]138-eleanor and [Debbie]209-mistress deborah slept]3235-the chamber within which she and debbie slept .

Another night [she]138-eleanor saw [him]132-hugh pacing softly up and down beneath [her]138-eleanor window .

Yet when each morning came , and [they]3232-they began a new day together , [he]132-hugh greeted [her]138-eleanor gaily , with clear eye and unclouded brow ; not as one chilled or disappointed , or vexed to be kept from [his]132-hugh due .

And oh , the wonder of each new day ! The glory of those rides over the mossy softness of [the woodland paths]3236-the woodland paths , where the sunlight fell , in dancing patches , through the thick , moving foliage , and shy deer peeped from the bracken , with soft eyes and gentle movements ; out on to [the wild liberty of the moors]3237-the wild liberty of the moors , where [Icon]174-icon , snuffing the fresher air , would stretch [his]132-hugh neck and gallop for pure joy at having left [cobbled streets]3238-cobbled streets and paved courtyards far behind [him]132-hugh . And ever [they]3232-they rode northward , and [home]305-home drew nearer . Looking back upon those long hours spent alone together , [Mora]144-mora realised how simply and easily [she]138-eleanor had grown used to being with [Hugh]132-hugh , and how entirely this was due to [his]132-hugh unselfishness and tact . [He]132-hugh talked with [her]138-eleanor constantly ; yet never of [his]132-hugh own feelings regarding [her]138-eleanor .

[He]132-hugh told [her]138-eleanor of [his]132-hugh adventures in [Eastern lands]4619-eastern lands ; of the happenings in [England]22-england during the past eight years , so far as [he]132-hugh had been able to learn them ; of [[his]132-hugh home and property]3241-his home and property ; of [hers]138-eleanor , and of the welcome which awaited [her]138-eleanor from [[her]138-eleanor people]3242-her people .

[He]132-hugh never spoke of [the Convent]328-the convent , nor of the eventful days through which [he]132-hugh and [she]138-eleanor had so recently passed .

So successfully did [he]132-hugh dominate [her]138-eleanor mind in this , that almost it seemed to [her]138-eleanor [she]138-eleanor too was returning [home]305-home after a long absence in [a foreign land]3245-a foreign land .

[Her]138-eleanor mind awoke to unrestrained enjoyment of each hour , and to the keen anticipation of [the traveller homeward bound]3246-the traveller homeward bound .

Each day spent in [[Hugh]132-hugh 's company]3247-hugh 's company seemed to wipe out one , or more , of the intervening years , so that when , toward evening , on the seventh day , the grey turrets of [[her]138-eleanor old home]3248-her old home came in sight , it might have been but yesterday [they]3249-they had parted , on those same battlements , and [she]138-eleanor had watched [him]132-hugh ride away , until the firwood from which [they]3249-they were now emerging , had hidden [him]132-hugh from view .

Kneeling at [her]138-eleanor casement , [her]138-eleanor mind seemed lost in a whirlpool of emotion , as [she]138-eleanor reviewed the hour of [their]3249-they arrival . [The road]4623-the road up to the big gates every tree and hillock , every stock and stone , loved and familiar , recalling childish joys and sorrows , adventure and enterprise . Then the passing in through the gates , [the familiar faces]3251-the familiar faces , the glad greetings ; [Zachary]231-zachary white - haired , but still rosy and stalwart at the foot of the steps ; and , in the doorway , just where loneliness might have gripped [her]138-eleanor , [old Debbie]209-mistress deborah , looking as if [she]209-mistress deborah had never been away , waiting with open arms . So this was the moment foreseen by [Hugh]132-hugh when [he]132-hugh had planned an early start , that morning , for [Mistress Deborah]209-mistress deborah , and a more roundabout ride for [her]209-mistress deborah .

[She]138-eleanor turned , with an impulsive gesture , holding out to [him]132-hugh [her]138-eleanor left hand , that [he]132-hugh might cross the threshold with [her]138-eleanor . But [the Knight]764-the knight was stooping to examine the right forehoof of [her]138-eleanor palfrey , [she]138-eleanor having fancied [Icon]174-icon had trod tenderly upon [it]3253-it during the last half - mile ; so [she]138-eleanor passed in alone .

Afterwards [she]138-eleanor overheard [old Debbie]209-mistress deborah say , in [her]209-mistress deborah most scolding tones : " [She]209-mistress deborah did stretch out [her]209-mistress deborah hand to [you]764-the knight , [Sir Hugh]132-hugh , and [you]764-the knight saw it not ! "[209-mistress deborah] But [the Knight]764-the knight 's deep voice made courteous answer : " There is no look or gesture of [hers]209-mistress deborah , however slight , good [Mistress Deborah]209-mistress deborah , which doth escape [me]764-the knight . "[764-the knight] And at this [her]138-eleanor heart thrilled far more than if [he]764-the knight had met [her]138-eleanor hand , responsive ; knowing that thus [he]764-the knight did faithfully keep [his]764-the knight pledge to [her]138-eleanor , and that [he]764-the knight could so keep it , only by never relaxing [his]764-the knight stern hold upon [himself]764-the knight .

Yet almost [she]138-eleanor began to wish [him]764-the knight less stern and less faithful , so much did [she]138-eleanor long to feel for one instant the strong clasp of [his]764-the knight arms about [her]138-eleanor . By [his]764-the knight rigid adherence to [his]764-the knight promise , [she]138-eleanor felt [herself]138-eleanor punished for having shuddered . Why had [she]138-eleanor shuddered ? . . . Would [she]138-eleanor shudder now ? This wonderful first evening had quickly passed , in going from [chamber]3255-chamber to [chamber]3255-chamber , walking in [the gardens]6044-the gardens , and supping with [Hugh]132-hugh in [the dining - hall]3258-the dining - hall , waited on by [Mark]206-mary mark and [Beaumont]232-beaumont , with [Zachary]231-zachary to supervise , pour the wine , and stand behind [her]138-eleanor chair .

Then a final walk on [the terrace]3259-the terrace ; a grave good - night upon the stairs ; and , at last , this time of quiet thought , in [[her]138-eleanor own chamber]3260-her own chamber .

[She]138-eleanor could not realise that [she]138-eleanor was wedded to [Hugh]132-hugh ; but [her]138-eleanor heart awoke to the fact that truly [she]138-eleanor was betrothed to [him]132-hugh . And [she]138-eleanor was happy deeply happy .

Leaving the casement , [she]138-eleanor kneeled before [the shrine of [the Virgin]608-the virgin [there]333-there where [she]138-eleanor had put up so many impassioned prayers for the safe return of [[her]138-eleanor lover]762-her lover]3261-the shrine of the virgin there where she had put up so many impassioned prayers for the safe return of her lover .

" [Blessed Virgin]145-blessed virgin , "[138-eleanor] [she]138-eleanor said , " [I]138-eleanor thank [thee]145-blessed virgin for sending [me]138-eleanor [home]305-home . "[138-eleanor]

Years seemed to roll from [her]138-eleanor . [She]138-eleanor felt [herself]138-eleanor [a child]5212-a child again . [She]138-eleanor longed for [[her]138-eleanor mother]3178-her mother 's understanding tenderness . Failing that , [she]138-eleanor turned to [the sweet Mother of [God]89-god]3267-the sweet mother of god .

The image before which [she]138-eleanor knelt , [shewed]3268-shewed [[our]3269-our Lady]4260-our lady standing , tall and fair and gracious , [the Infant Saviour]233-the infant saviour , seated upon [her]4260-our lady left hand , [her]4260-our lady right hand holding [Him]233-the infant saviour leaning against [her]4260-our lady , [His]233-the infant saviour baby arms outstretched . Neither [the Babe]438-the babe nor [[His]233-the infant saviour Mother]1063-his mother smiled . [Each]415-each looked grave and somewhat sad .

" [Home]305-home , "[144-mora] whispered [Mora]144-mora . " [Blessed Virgin]145-blessed virgin [I]144-mora thank [thee]145-blessed virgin for sending [me]144-mora [home]305-home . "[144-mora]

" Nay , "[144-mora] answered a voice within [her]144-mora . " [I]144-mora sent [thee]144-mora not [home]305-home . [I]144-mora gave [thee]144-mora to [him]132-hugh to whom [thou]144-mora didst belong . [He]132-hugh hath brought [thee]144-mora [home]305-home . What said the vision ? ' Take [her]144-mora . [She]144-mora is thine own . [I]144-mora have but kept [her]144-mora for [thee]144-mora . ' "[144-mora]

Yet [Hugh]132-hugh knew naught of this gracious message knew naught of the vision which had given [her]144-mora to [him]132-hugh . Until to - night [she]144-mora had felt it impossible to tell [him]132-hugh of it . Now [she]144-mora longed that [he]132-hugh should share with [her]144-mora the wonder .

[She]144-mora sought [[her]144-mora couch]615-her couch , but sleep would not come . The moonlight was too bright ; [the room]495-the room too sweetly familiar . [Moreover]234-moreover it seemed but yesterday that [she]144-mora had parted from [Hugh]132-hugh , in such an ecstasy of love and sorrow , up on the battlements .

A great desire seized [her]144-mora to mount to those battlements , and to stand again just where [she]144-mora had stood when [she]144-mora bade [him]132-hugh farewell .

[She]144-mora rose .

Among the garments put ready for [her]144-mora use , chanced to be the robe of sapphire velvet which [she]144-mora had worn on that night .

[She]144-mora put it on ; with jewels at [her]144-mora breast and girdle . Then , with the mantle of ermine falling from [her]144-mora shoulders , and [her]144-mora beautiful hair covering [her]144-mora as a veil , [she]144-mora left [[her]144-mora chamber]4322-her chamber , passed softly along [the passage]497-the passage , found the winding stair , and mounted to the ramparts .

As [she]144-mora stepped out from [the turret stairway]3278-the turret stairway , [she]144-mora exclaimed at the sublime beauty of the scene before [her]144-mora ; [the sleeping world]3279-the sleeping world at midnight , bathed in the silvery light of the moon ; the shadows of [the firs]3280-the firs , lying like black bars across [the road]4623-the road to [the Castle gate]3282-the castle gate .

" There [I]144-mora watched [him]132-hugh ride away , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said , with a sweep of [her]144-mora arm toward [the road]4623-the road , " watched , until [the dark woods]6624-the dark woods swallowed [him]132-hugh . And here "[144-mora] with a sweep toward [the turret]3284-the turret " here , [we]3285-we parted . "[144-mora]

[She]144-mora turned ; then caught [her]144-mora breath .

Leaning against the wall with folded arms , stood [Hugh]132-hugh .

[CHAPTER XLIV]235-chapter xliv

" [I]144-mora LOVE [THEE]144-mora "[144-mora]

[Mora]144-mora stood , for some moments , speechless ; and [Hugh]132-hugh did not stir . [They]3285-we faced [one another]666-one another , in the weird , white light .

At last : " Did [you]132-hugh make [me]144-mora come ? "[144-mora] [she]144-mora whispered .

" Nay , [[my]132-hugh beloved]4702-my beloved , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh answered at once ; " unless constant thought of [thee]144-mora , could bring [thee]144-mora to [me]132-hugh . [I]132-hugh pictured [thee]144-mora peacefully sleeping . "[132-hugh]

" [I]144-mora could not sleep , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said . " It seemed to [me]144-mora [[our]3285-we Lady]4260-our lady was not pleased , because , dear [Knight]228-hugh , [I]144-mora have failed , in all these days , to tell [you]228-hugh of [her]4260-our lady wondrous and especial grace which sent [me]144-mora to [you]228-hugh . "[144-mora]

" [I]764-the knight have wondered , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight ; " but [I]764-the knight knew there would come a time when [I]764-the knight should hear what caused [thy]144-mora mind to change . That it was a thing of much import , [I]764-the knight felt sure . [The Bishop]4673-the bishop counselled [me]764-the knight to give up hope . But [I]764-the knight had besought [[our]3285-we Lady]4260-our lady to send [thee]144-mora to [me]764-the knight , and [I]764-the knight could not lose [my]764-the knight trust in prayer . "[764-the knight]

" It was indeed [[our]3285-we blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady who sent [me]144-mora , "[144-mora] said [Mora]144-mora , very softly . " [Hugh]132-hugh , dare [I]144-mora stay and tell [you]132-hugh the whole story , here and now ? What if [we]3285-we are discovered , alone upon the ramparts , at this hour of the night ? "[144-mora]

[Hugh]132-hugh could not forbear a smile .

" [Dear Heart]236-dear heart , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh said , " [we]3285-we shall not be discovered . And , if [we]3285-we were , methinks [we]3285-we have the right to be together , on [the ramparts]6630-the ramparts , or off them , at any hour of the day or night . "[132-hugh]

A low wooden seat ran along beneath the parapet .

[Mora]144-mora sat down and motioned [the Knight]764-the knight to a place beside [her]144-mora .

" Sit here , [Hugh]132-hugh . Then [we]3285-we can talk low . "[144-mora]

" [I]764-the knight listen better standing , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight ; but [he]764-the knight came near , put one foot on the seat , leaned [his]764-the knight elbow on [his]764-the knight knee , [his]764-the knight chin in [his]764-the knight hand , and stood looking down upon [her]144-mora .

" [Hugh]132-hugh , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said , " [I]144-mora withstood [your]132-hugh pleadings ; [I]144-mora withstood [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's arguments ; [I]144-mora withstood the yearnings of [my]144-mora own poor heart . [I]144-mora tore up [the Pope]5391-the pope 's mandate , and set [my]144-mora foot upon it . [I]144-mora said that nothing could induce [me]144-mora to break [my]144-mora vows , unless [[our]6633-our Lady [herself]6134-our lady herself]6134-our lady herself gave [me]144-mora a clear sign that [my]144-mora highest duty was to [you]132-hugh , thus absolving [me]144-mora from [my]144-mora vows , and making it evident that [God]89-god 's will for [me]144-mora was that [I]144-mora should leave [the Cloister]286-the cloister , and keep [my]144-mora early troth to [you]132-hugh . "[144-mora]

" And gave [[our]6633-our [Lady]6637-lady]4260-our lady such a sign ? "[764-the knight] asked [the Knight]764-the knight , [his]764-the knight dark eyes fixed on [Mora]144-mora 's face .

[She]144-mora lifted it , white and lovely ; radiant in the moonlight .

" Better than a sign , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said . " [[Our]6633-our Lady]4260-our lady vouchsafed a wondrous vision , in which [her]6637-lady own voice was heard , giving command and consent . "[144-mora]

[The Knight]764-the knight , crossing [himself]764-the knight , dropped upon [his]764-the knight knees , lifting [his]764-the knight eyes heavenward in fervent praise and adoration . [He]764-the knight raised to [his]764-the knight lips a gold medallion , which [he]764-the knight wore around [his]764-the knight neck , containing a picture of [the Virgin]608-the virgin , and kissed it devoutly ; then overcome by emotion , [he]764-the knight covered [his]764-the knight face with [his]764-the knight hands and knelt with bowed head , reciting in a low voice , the Salve Regina .

[Mora]144-mora watched [him]764-the knight , with deep gladness of heart . This fervent joy and devout thanksgiving differed so greatly from the half - incredulous , whimsically amused , mental attitude with which [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester had received [her]144-mora recital of the miracle . [Hugh]132-hugh 's reverent adoration filled [her]144-mora with happiness .

Presently [he]764-the knight rose and stood beside [her]144-mora again , expectant , eager .

" Tell [me]764-the knight more ; nay , tell [me]764-the knight all , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said .

" The vision , "[144-mora] began [Mora]144-mora , " was given to [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . "[144-mora] " [Mary Antony]85-mary antony ? "[132-hugh] queried [Hugh]132-hugh , with knitted brow . " ' [The old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony ' ? Why do [I]132-hugh know that name ? [I]132-hugh seem to remember that [the Bishop]4673-the bishop spoke of [her]264-the old lay - sister , as [we]6642-we walked together in [the Palace garden]6643-the palace garden , the day following the arrival of [the messenger from [Rome]37-rome]6644-the messenger from rome . Methinks [the Bishop]4673-the bishop said that [she]264-the old lay - sister alone knew of [my]132-hugh intrusion into [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery ; but that [she]264-the old lay - sister , being faithful , could be trusted . "[132-hugh]

" Nay , [Hugh]132-hugh , "[144-mora] answered [Mora]144-mora , " [you]132-hugh mistake . It was [I]144-mora who told [you]132-hugh so , even before [I]144-mora knew [you]132-hugh were [the intruder]2068-the intruder , while yet addressing [you]132-hugh as [[Sister Seraphine]102-sister seraphine 's ' Cousin [Wilfred]106-wilfred]6648-sister seraphine 's ' cousin wilfred . ' [I]144-mora said that [you]132-hugh had been thwarted in [your]132-hugh purpose by the faithfulness of [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , who never fails to count [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies , as [they]288-the white ladies go , and as [they]288-the white ladies return , and who had reported to [me]144-mora that [one more had returned than went]4515-one more had returned than went . Afterward [I]144-mora was greatly perplexed as to what explanation [I]144-mora should make to [Mary Antony]85-mary antony ; when , to [my]144-mora relief , [she]85-mary antony came and confessed that [hers]85-mary antony was the mistake , [she]85-mary antony having counted wrongly . Glad indeed was [I]144-mora to let it rest at that ; so neither [she]85-mary antony , nor any in [the Convent]328-the convent , knew aught of [your]132-hugh entrance there or [your]132-hugh visit to [[my]144-mora cell]4261-my cell . [The Bishop]4673-the bishop , [you]132-hugh , and [I]144-mora , alone know of it . "[144-mora]

" Then [I]764-the knight mistake , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight . " But [I]764-the knight felt certain [I]764-the knight had heard the name , and that [the owner thereof]6655-the owner thereof had some knowledge of [my]764-the knight movements . Now , [I]764-the knight pray [thee]3294-her , [dear Heart]6512-dear heart , tell [me]764-the knight all . "[764-the knight]

So sitting there on the ramparts of [[her]3294-her old home]3248-her old home , the stillness of the fragrant summer night all around , [Mora]144-mora told from the beginning the wondrous history of the trance of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , and [the blessed vision]3296-the blessed vision then vouchsafed to [her]3294-her .

[The Knight]764-the knight listened with glowing eyes . Once [he]764-the knight interrupted to exclaim : " Oh , true ! Most true ! More true than [thou]6657-thou canst know . Left alone in [[thy]6657-thou cell]4373-thy cell , [I]764-the knight kneeled to [[our]6659-our Lady]4260-our lady , saying those very words : ' [Mother of God]89-god , send [her]4260-our lady to [me]764-the knight ! Take pity on a hungry heart , [a lonely home]893-a lonely home , [a desolate hearth]894-a desolate hearth , and send [her]4260-our lady to [me]764-the knight . ' [I]764-the knight was alone . Only [[our]6659-our Lady whom [I]764-the knight besought]6663-our lady whom i besought , heard those words pass [my]764-the knight lips . "[764-the knight]

Again [Hugh]132-hugh kneeled , kissed the medallion , and lifted to heaven eyes luminous with awe and worship .

Continuing , [Mora]144-mora told [him]132-hugh all , even to each detail of [her]144-mora long night vigil and [her]144-mora prayer for a sign which should be given direct to [herself]144-mora , so soon granted by the arrival and flight of the robin . But this failed to impress [Hugh]132-hugh , wholly absorbed in the vision , and unable to see where any element of hesitation or of uncertainty could come in . Hearing it from [Mora]144-mora , [he]132-hugh was spared the quaint turn which was bound to be given to any recital , however sacred , heard direct from old [Mary Antony]85-mary antony .

[The Knight]764-the knight was [a Crusader]3299-a crusader . Many a fight [he]764-the knight had fought for that cause representing the highest of Christian ideals . Also , [he]764-the knight had been [a pilgrim]3300-a pilgrim , and had visited [innumerable holy shrines]3301-innumerable holy shrines . For years , [his]764-the knight soul had been steeped in religion , in [that Land where true religion had its birth , and all within [him]764-the knight , which was strongest and most manly]3302-that land where true religion had its birth , and all within him , which was strongest and most manly , had responded with a simplicity of faith , yet with a depth of ardent devotion , which made [his]764-the knight religion the most vital part of [himself]764-the knight . This it was which had given [him]764-the knight a noble fortitude in bearing [his]764-the knight sorrow . This it was which now gave [him]764-the knight a noble exultation in accepting [his]764-the knight great happiness . It filled [him]764-the knight with rapture , that [[his]764-the knight wife]5587-his wife should have been given to [him]764-the knight in direct response to [his]764-the knight own earnest petition .

When at length [Mora]144-mora stood up , stretching [her]144-mora arms above [her]144-mora head and straightening [her]144-mora supple limbs :

" [[My]764-the knight beloved]4702-my beloved , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , " if the vision had not been given , wouldst [thou]6665-thou not have come to [me]764-the knight ? Should [I]764-the knight have had to ride away from [Worcester]1-worcester alone ? "[764-the knight]

Standing beside [him]764-the knight , [she]144-mora answered , tenderly :

" [Dear [Hugh]228-hugh , [my]144-mora most faithful and loyal Knight]228-hugh , being [here]4536-here and oh so glad to be here how can [I]144-mora say it ? Yet [I]144-mora must answer truly . But for the vision , [I]144-mora should not have come . [I]144-mora could not have broken [my]144-mora vows . No blessing would have followed had [I]144-mora come to [you]228-hugh , trailing broken vows , like chains behind [me]144-mora . But [[our]6667-our Lady]4260-our lady [herself]4260-our lady set [me]144-mora free and bid [me]144-mora go . Therefore [I]144-mora came to [you]228-hugh ; and therefore am [I]144-mora here . "[144-mora]

" Tell [me]144-mora again the words [[our]6667-our Lady]4260-our lady said , when [she]4260-our lady put [thy]4260-our lady hand in [mine]144-mora . "[144-mora]

" [[Our]6667-our Lady]4260-our lady said : ' Take [her]4260-our lady . [She]4260-our lady hath been ever thine . [I]144-mora have but kept [her]4260-our lady for [thee]4260-our lady . ' "[144-mora]

Then [she]3304-she paled , [her]3304-she heart began to beat fast , and the colour came and went in [her]3304-she cheeks ; for [he]3305-my had come very near , and [she]3304-she could hear the sharp catch of [his]3305-my breath .

" [Mora]144-mora , [[my]3305-my beloved]4702-my beloved , "[3305-my] [he]3305-my said , " every fibre of [my]3305-my being cries out for [thee]144-mora . Yet [I]3305-my want [thy]144-mora happiness before [my]3305-my own ; and , above and beyond all else , [I]3305-my want the Madonna in [[my]3305-my home]4615-my home . Even at [[our]6673-our Lady]4260-our lady 's bidding [I]3305-my can not take [thee]144-mora . Not until [thine]4260-our lady own sweet lips shall say : ' Take [me]3305-my ! [I]3305-my have been ever thine . ' "[3305-my]

[She]3306-i lifted [her]3306-i eyes to [his]3305-my . In the moonlight , [her]3306-i face seemed almost unearthly , in its pure loveliness ; and , as on that night so long ago , [he]3305-my saw [her]3306-i eyes , brighter than any jewels , shining with love and tears .

" [Dear man of [mine]3306-i]4522-dear man of mine , "[3306-i] [she]3306-i whispered , " to - night [we]6673-our are betrothed . But to - morrow [I]3306-i will ride [home]305-home with [thee]144-mora . To - morrow shall be indeed [our]6673-our bridal day . [I]3306-i will say all [I]3306-i will say anything [I]3306-i will say everything [thou]144-mora wilt ! Nay , see ! The dawn is breaking in the east . Call it ' to - day ' TO - DAY , [dear Knight]5610-dear knight ! But now let [me]3306-i flee away , to fathom [my]3306-i strange happiness alone . Then , to sleep in [[mine]3306-i own chamber]2514-mine own chamber , and to awake refreshed , and ready to go with [thee]144-mora , [Hugh]228-hugh , when and where and how [thou]144-mora wilt . "[3306-i]

[The Knight]764-the knight folded [his]764-the knight arms across [his]764-the knight breast .

" Go , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , softly , " and [[our]6673-our Lady]4260-our lady be with [thee]144-mora . [Our]6673-our spirits to - night have had [their]6673-our fill of holy happiness . [I]764-the knight ask no higher joy than to watch the breaking of the day which gives [thee]144-mora to [me]764-the knight , knowing [thee]144-mora to be safely sleeping in [[thy]144-mora chamber below]6680-thy chamber below . "[764-the knight]

" [I]3308-i love [thee]144-mora ! "[3308-i] [she]3308-i whispered ; and fled .

[Hugh]228-hugh d'Argent watched the dawn break a silver rift in the purple sky .

[His]228-hugh heart was filled with indescribable peace and gladness .

It meant far more to [him]228-hugh that [[his]228-hugh bride]4744-his bride should have come to [him]228-hugh in obedience to a divine vision , than if [his]228-hugh love had mastered [her]4744-his bride will , and [she]4744-his bride had yielded despite [her]4744-his bride own conscience .

Also [he]228-hugh knew that at last [his]228-hugh patient self - restraint had won its reward . The heart of [a nun]412-a nun feared [him]228-hugh no longer . [The woman [he]228-hugh loved]876-the woman he loved was as wholly [his]228-hugh as [she]876-the woman he loved had ever been .

As the sun began to gild the horizon , flecking the sky with little rosy clouds , [Hugh]228-hugh turned into the turret archway , went down the steps , and sought [[his]228-hugh chamber]2387-his chamber . No sooner was [he]228-hugh stretched upon [his]228-hugh couch , than , for very joy , [he]228-hugh fell asleep .

But beyond [the dark fir woods]3313-the dark fir woods , and over [the hills on the horizon]3314-the hills on the horizon , [four horsemen]3315-four horsemen , having ridden out from [a wayside inn]3316-a wayside inn before the dawn , watched , as [they]3315-four horsemen rode , the widening of that silver rift in the sky , and the golden tint , heralding the welcome appearance of the sun .

So soundly slept [Hugh]228-hugh d'Argent that , three hours later , be did not wake when a loud knocking on the outer gates roused [the porter]3317-the porter ; nor , though [his]228-hugh casement opened on to [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , did [he]228-hugh hear the noisy clatter of hoofs , as [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , with [[his]160-brother philip escort of [three mounted men]3320-three mounted men]3319-his escort of three mounted men , rode in .

Not until a knocking came on [his]228-hugh own door did [the Knight]764-the knight awake and , leaping from [his]228-hugh bed , see as in a strange , wild dream [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , dusty and haggard , standing on the threshold , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's letter in [his]160-brother philip hand .

CHAPTER XLV

THE SONG OF THE THRUSH

The morning sun already poured into [[her]3323-her room]3324-her room , when [Mora]144-mora opened [her]3323-her eyes , waking suddenly with that complete wide - awakeness which follows upon profound and dreamless slumber .

Even as [she]3323-her woke , [her]3323-her heart said : " [Our]6681-our bridal day ! The day [I]3323-her give [myself]3323-her to [Hugh]228-hugh ! The day [he]228-hugh leads [me]3323-her [home]305-home . "[3323-her]

[She]3323-her stretched [herself]3323-her at full length upon the couch , [her]3323-her hands crossed upon [her]3323-her breast , and let the delicious joy of [her]3323-her love sweep over [her]3323-her , from the soles of [her]3323-her feet to the crown of [her]3323-her head .

[The world]389-the world without lay bathed in sunshine ; [her]3323-her heart within was flooded by the radiance of this new and perfect realisation of [her]3323-her love for [Hugh]228-hugh .

[She]3323-her lay quite still while it enveloped [her]3323-her .

Ten days ago , [[our]3326-our Lady]4260-our lady had given [her]3328-her to [Hugh]228-hugh .

Eight days ago , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , voicing [the Church]55-the church , had done the same .

But to - day [she]3323-her [she]3323-her [herself]3323-her was going to give [herself]3323-her to [[her]3323-her lover]762-her lover .

This was the true bridal ! For this [he]228-hugh had waited . And the reward of [his]228-hugh chivalrous patience was to be , that to - day , of [her]3323-her own free will [she]3323-her would say ; " [Hugh]228-hugh , [[my]3323-her husband]6683-my husband , take [me]3323-her [home]305-home . "[3323-her]

[She]3323-her smiled to remember how , riding forth from [the city gates of [Warwick]32-warwick]3331-the city gates of warwick , [she]3323-her had planned within [herself]3323-her that , once safely established in [[her]3323-her own castle]3332-her own castle , [she]3323-her would abide there days , weeks , perhaps even , months !

[She]3323-her stretched [her]3323-her arms wide , then flung them above [her]3323-her head .

" Take [me]3323-her [home]305-home , "[3323-her] [she]3323-her whispered . " [Hugh]228-hugh , [[my]3323-her husband]6683-my husband , take [me]3323-her [home]305-home . "[3323-her]

A thrush in the coppice below , whistled in liquid notes : " Do it now ! Do it now ! Do it now ! "[3323-her] Laughing joyously , [Mora]144-mora leapt from [her]144-mora bed and looked out upon a sunny summer 's day , humming with busy life , fragrant with scent of flowers , thrilling with songs of birds .

" What [a bridal morn]6688-a bridal morn ! "[144-mora] [she]144-mora cried . " All nature says ' Awake ! Arise ! ' Yet [I]144-mora have slept so late . [I]144-mora must quickly prepare [myself]144-mora to find and to greet [[my]144-mora lover]6689-my lover . "[144-mora]

" Do it now ! "[3333-the morn] sang the thrush .

Half an hour later , fresh and fragrant as [the morn]3333-the morn , [Mora]144-mora left [[her]144-mora chamber]4322-her chamber and made [her]144-mora way to the great staircase .

Hearing shouting in [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , and the trampling of horses ' feet , [she]144-mora paused at a casement , and looked down .

To [her]144-mora surprise [she]144-mora saw the well - remembered figure of [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , mounted ; with [him]160-brother philip three other horsemen wearing the [Bishop]92-bishop 's livery , and [Martin Goodfellow]133-martin leading [Hugh]228-hugh 's favourite steed , ready saddled .

Much perplexed , [she]144-mora passed down [the staircase]2163-the staircase , and out on to [the terrace where [she]144-mora had bidden [them]3338-them to prepare the morning meal]3337-the terrace where she had bidden them to prepare the morning meal .

From [the terrace]3259-the terrace [she]144-mora looked into [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall , and [her]144-mora perplexity grew ; for there [Hugh]228-hugh d'Argent , booted and spurred , ready for a journey , strode up and down .

For two turns [she]144-mora watched [him]228-hugh , noting [his]228-hugh knitted brows , and the heavy forward thrust of [his]228-hugh chin .

Then , lifting [his]228-hugh eyes as [he]228-hugh swung round for the third time , [he]228-hugh saw [her]144-mora , outside in the sunlight ; such a vision of loveliness as might well make [a man]4482-a man 's heart leap .

[He]228-hugh paused in [his]228-hugh rapid walk , and stood as if rooted to the spot , making no move toward [her]144-mora .

For a moment , [Mora]144-mora hesitated .

" Do it now ! "[228-hugh] sang the thrush .

CHAPTER XLVI

" HOW SHALL [I]228-hugh LET [THEE]6690-thee GO ? "[228-hugh]

[Mora]144-mora passed swiftly into [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall .

" [Hugh]228-hugh , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said , and came to [him]228-hugh . " [Hugh]228-hugh , [[my]144-mora husband]6683-my husband , this is [our]6692-our bridal day . Will [you]228-hugh take [me]144-mora to [[our]6692-our home]6693-our home ? "[144-mora]

[His]228-hugh eyes , as they met [hers]144-mora , were full of a dumb misery .

Then a fierce light of passion , a look of wild recklessness , flashed into [them]3343-them . [He]228-hugh raised [his]228-hugh arms , to catch [her]144-mora to [him]228-hugh ; then let [them]3344-them fall again , glancing to right and left , as if seeking some way of escape .

But , seeing the amazement on [her]144-mora face , [he]228-hugh mastered , by a mighty effort , [his]228-hugh emotion , and spoke with calmness and careful deliberation .

" Alas , [Mora]144-mora , "[228-hugh] [he]228-hugh said , " it is a hard fate indeed for [me]228-hugh on this day , of all days , to be compelled to leave [thee]144-mora . But in the early morn there came a letter which obliges [me]228-hugh , without delay , to ride south , in order to settle a matter of extreme importance . [I]228-hugh trust not to be gone longer than nine days . [You]144-mora , being safely established in [[your]144-mora own home]6694-your own home , amongst [[your]144-mora own people]6695-your own people , [I]228-hugh can leave without anxious fears . Moreover , [Martin Goodfellow]133-martin will remain here representing [me]228-hugh , and will in all things do [your]144-mora bidding . "[228-hugh]

" From whom is this letter , [Hugh]228-hugh , which takes [you]228-hugh from [me]228-hugh , on such a day ? "[228-hugh]

" It is from [a man well known to [me]228-hugh , dwelling in [a city]6697-a city four days ' journey from here]6696-a man well known to me , dwelling in a city four days ' journey from here . "[228-hugh]

" Why not say at once : ' It is from [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , written from [[his]4673-the bishop Palace in [the city of]271-the city of [Worcester]1-worcester]6699-his palace in the city of worcester ' ? "[228-hugh]

[Hugh]228-hugh frowned .

" How knew [you]228-hugh that ? "[228-hugh] [he]228-hugh asked , almost roughly .

" [[My]228-hugh dear]4718-my dear [Knight]228-hugh , hearing much champing of horses in [[my]228-hugh courtyard]6702-my courtyard , [I]228-hugh looked down from a casement and saw [a lay - brother well known to [me]228-hugh]6703-a lay - brother well known to me , and [three other horsemen wearing the Bishop]6704-three other horsemen wearing the bishop 's livery . What can [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester have written which takes [you]228-hugh from [me]228-hugh on this day , of all days ? "[228-hugh]

" That [I]228-hugh can not tell [thee]228-hugh , "[228-hugh] [he]228-hugh made answer . " But [he]154-symon of worcester writes , without much detail , of a matter about which [I]228-hugh must know fullest details , without loss of time . [I]228-hugh have no choice but to ride and see [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , face to face . It is not a question which can be settled by writing nor could it wait the passing to and fro of [messengers]6706-messengers . Believe [me]228-hugh , [Mora]144-mora , it is urgent . Naught but exceeding urgency could force [me]228-hugh from [thee]228-hugh on this day . "[228-hugh]

" Has it to do with [my]3345-my flight from [the Convent]328-the convent ? "[3345-my] [she]3345-my asked .

[He]228-hugh bowed [his]228-hugh head .

" Will [you]3345-my tell [me]228-hugh the matter on [your]3345-my return , [Hugh]228-hugh ? "[228-hugh]

" [I]228-hugh know not , "[228-hugh] [he]228-hugh answered , with face averted . " [I]228-hugh can not say . "[228-hugh] Then with sudden violence : " Oh , [[my]228-hugh God]6394-my god , [Mora]144-mora , ask [me]228-hugh no more ! See [the Bishop]92-bishop , [I]228-hugh must ! Speak with [him]92-bishop , [I]228-hugh must ! In nine days at the very most , [I]228-hugh will be back with [thee]3346-her . Duty takes [me]228-hugh , [[my]228-hugh beloved]4702-my beloved , or [I]228-hugh would not go . "[228-hugh]

[Her]3346-her mind responded instinctively to the word " duty , "[3346-her] " Go then , [dear Knight]5610-dear knight , "[3346-her] [she]3346-her said . " Settle this business with [[Symon]154-symon of worcester of [Worcester]1-worcester]5615-symon of worcester . [I]3346-her have no desire to know its purport . If it concerns [my]3346-her flight from [the Convent]328-the convent , surely [the Pope]5391-the pope 's mandate is all - sufficient . But , be it what it may , in the hands of [[my]3346-her faithful Knight]6714-my faithful knight and of [[my]3346-her trusted friend]6715-my trusted friend , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , [I]3346-her may safely leave [it]6717-it . [I]3346-her do but ask that , the work accomplished , [you]3347-he come with all speed back to [me]3346-her . "[3346-her]

With a swift movement [he]3347-he dropped on one knee at [her]3346-her feet .

" Send [me]3347-he away with a blessing , "[3347-he] [he]3347-he said . " Bless [me]3347-he before [I]3347-he go . "[3347-he]

[She]3346-her laid [her]3346-her hands on the bowed head .

" Alas ! "[3346-her] [she]3346-her cried , " how shall [I]3346-her let [thee]3347-he go ? "[3346-her]

Then , pushing [her]3346-her fingers deeper into [his]3347-he hair and bending over [him]3347-he , with infinite tenderness : " How shall [[thy]3347-he wife]4342-thy wife bless [thee]3347-he ? "[3346-her] [she]3346-her whispered .
