[He]3347-he caught [his]3347-he breath , as the fragrance of the newly gathered roses at [her]3346-her bosom reached and enveloped [him]3347-he .

" Bless [me]3347-he , "[3347-he] [he]3347-he said , hoarsely , " as [the Prioress of the White Ladies]1156-the prioress of the white ladies used to bless [[her]1156-the prioress of the white ladies nuns]839-her nuns , and [the Poor at [the Convent]328-the convent gate]6721-the poor at the convent gate . "[3347-he]

" [Dear Heart]236-dear heart , "[3346-her] [she]3346-her said , and smiled . " That seems so long ago ! "[3346-her] Then , as with bent head [he]3347-he still waited , [she]3346-her steadied [her]3346-her voice , lifting [her]3346-her hands from off [him]3347-he ; then laid them back upon [his]3347-he head , with reverent and solemn touch . " [The Lord]4319-the lord bless [thee]3347-he , "[3346-her] [she]3346-her said , " and keep [thee]3347-he ; and may [[our]6724-our blessed Lady , who hath restored [me]3346-her to [thee]3347-he]6725-our blessed lady , who hath restored me to thee , bring [thee]3347-he safely back to [me]3346-her again . "[3346-her]

At that , [Hugh]228-hugh raised [his]3347-he head and looked up into [her]3346-her face , and the misery in [his]3347-he eyes stirred [her]3346-her tenderness as it had never been stirred by the vivid love - light or the soft depths of passion [she]3346-her had heretofore seen in [them]3348-them .

[Her]3346-her lips parted ; [her]3346-her breath came quickly . [She]3346-her would have caught [him]3347-he to [her]3346-her bosom ; [she]3346-her would have kissed away this unknown sorrow ; [she]3346-her would have smothered the pain , in the sweetness of [her]3346-her embrace .

But bending swiftly [he]3347-he lifted the hem of [her]3346-her robe and touched it with [his]3347-he lips ; then , rising , turned and left [her]3346-her without a word ; without a backward look .

[He]3347-he left [her]3346-her standing there , alone in [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall . And as [she]3346-her stood listening , with beating heart , to the sound of [his]3347-he voice raised in command ; to the quick movements of [his]3347-he horse 's hoofs on the paving stones , as [he]3347-he swung into the saddle ; to the opening of the gates and the riding forth of [the little cavalcade]3350-the little cavalcade , a change seemed to have come over [her]3346-her . [She]3346-her ceased to feel [herself]3346-her [a happy , yielding bride]3351-a happy , yielding bride , a traveller in [distant lands]3352-distant lands , after long journeyings , once more at [home]305-home .

[She]3346-her seemed to be again [Prioress of the White Ladies]4675-prioress of the white ladies . The calm fingers of [the Cloister]286-the cloister fastened once more upon [her]3346-her pulsing heart . The dignity of office developed [her]3346-her .

And wherefore ?

Was it because , when [her]3346-her lips had bent above [him]3347-he in surrendering tenderness , [[her]3346-her husband]5164-her husband had chosen to give [her]3346-her the sign of reverent homage accorded to [a prioress]3357-a prioress , rather than the embrace which would have sealed [her]3346-her surrender ?

Or was it because [he]3347-he had asked [her]3346-her to bless [him]3347-he as [she]3346-her had been wo nt to bless [the Poor]4220-the poor at the Convent gate ?

Or was it the unconscious action of [his]3347-he mind upon [hers]3346-her , [he]3347-he being suddenly called to face some difficulty which had arisen , concerning [their]3359-their marriage , or [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's share in [her]3346-her departure from [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery ?

The clang of the closing gates sounded in [her]3346-her ears as a knell .

[She]3346-her shivered ; then remembered how [she]3346-her had shivered at sound of the turning of the key in the lock of the crypt - way door . How great the change wrought by eight days of love and liberty . [She]3346-her had shuddered then at being irrevocably shut out from [the Cloister]286-the cloister . [She]3346-her shuddered now because the arrival of [a messenger from [the Bishop]4673-the bishop]3363-a messenger from the bishop , and something indefinable in [Hugh]228-hugh 's manner , had caused [her]3346-her to look back .

[She]3346-her stood quite still . [None]315-none came to seek [her]3346-her . [She]3346-her seemed to have turned to stone .

It was not the first time this looking back had had a petrifying effect upon [a woman]813-a woman . [She]3346-her remembered [[Lot]237-lot 's wife]3367-lot 's wife , going forward led by the gentle pressure of [an angel]3368-an angel 's hand , yet looking back the moment that pressure was removed .

[She]3346-her had gone forward , led by the sweet angel of [our Lady]4260-our lady 's gracious message . Why should [she]3346-her look back ? Rather would [she]3346-her act upon the sacred precept : " Forgetting those things which are behind , and reaching forth unto those things which are before "[3346-her] this , said [the apostle Saint Paul]238-the apostle saint paul , was the one thing to do . Undoubtedly now it was the one and only thing for [her]3346-her to do ; leaving all else which might have to be done , to [[her]3346-her husband]5164-her husband and to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" This one thing [I]3346-her do , "[3346-her] [she]3346-her said aloud ; " this one thing [I]3346-her do . "[3346-her] And moving forward , in the strength of that resolve , [she]3346-her passed out into the sunshine .

" Do it now ! "[3374-a messenger from the vatican] sang the thrush , in the rowan - tree .

CHAPTER XLVII

[THE BISHOP]4673-the bishop IS TAKEN UNAWARES

[Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester , seated before a table in [the library]2268-the library , pondered a letter which had reached [him]154-symon of worcester the evening before , brought by [a messenger from [the Vatican]5450-the vatican]3374-a messenger from the vatican .

It was a call to return to [the land [he]154-symon of worcester loved best]3376-the land he loved best ; [the land of sunshine and flowers]3377-the land of sunshine and flowers , of soft speech and courteous ways ; the land of heavenly beauty and seraphic sounds ; and , moreover , to return as [a Cardinal of [Holy Church]5891-holy church]3378-a cardinal of holy church .

[His]154-symon of worcester acceptance or refusal must be penned before night . [The messenger]4548-the messenger expected to start upon [his]154-symon of worcester return journey early on the morrow .

Should [he]154-symon of worcester go ? Or should [he]154-symon of worcester stay ?

Was all now well for [Mora]144-mora ? Or did [she]144-mora yet need [him]154-symon of worcester ?

Surely never had [Cardinal]95-the french cardinal 's hat hung poised for such a reason ! How little would [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father dream that a question affecting the happiness or unhappiness of [a woman]813-a woman could be a cause of hesitancy .

Presently , with a quick movement , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop lifted [his]4673-the bishop head . [The library]2268-the library was far removed from [the courtyard]775-the courtyard ; but surely [he]4673-the bishop heard the clatter of horses ' hoofs upon the raving stones .

[He]4673-the bishop had hardly hoped for [Brother Philip]160-brother philip 's return until after sunset ; yet with fast riding

If [the Knight]764-the knight 's answer were in all respects satisfactory If [Mora]144-mora 's happiness was assured why , then

[He]4673-the bishop sounded the silver gong .

[[His]4673-the bishop servant]3082-his servant entered .

" What [horsemen]6726-horsemen have just now ridden into [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , [Jasper]196-jasper ? "[3082-his servant]

" [[My]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , [Brother Philip]160-brother philip has this moment returned , and with [him]160-brother philip "[4673-the bishop]

" Bid [Brother Philip]160-brother philip to come hither , instantly . "[3082-his servant]

" May it please [you]4881-my lord , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord "[4673-the bishop]

" Naught will please [me]4673-the bishop , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " but that [my]4673-the bishop commands be obeyed without parley or delay . "[4673-the bishop]

[Jasper]196-jasper 's obeisance took [him]196-jasper through the door .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop bent over the letter from [Rome]37-rome , shading [his]4673-the bishop face with [his]4673-the bishop hand .

[He]4673-the bishop could scarcely contain [his]4673-the bishop anxiety ; but [he]4673-the bishop did not wish to give [Brother Philip]160-brother philip occasion to observe [his]4673-the bishop tremulous eagerness to receive [the Knight]764-the knight 's reply .

[He]4673-the bishop heard the door open and close , and a firm tread upon the floor . It struck [him]4673-the bishop , even then , that [the lay - brother]5259-the lay - brother had not been wo nt to enter [his]4673-the bishop presence with so martial a stride , and [he]4673-the bishop wondered at the ring of spurs . But [his]4673-the bishop mind was too intently set upon [Hugh]228-hugh d'Argent 's letter , to do more than unconsciously notice these things .

" [Thou]160-brother philip art quickly returned , [[my]4673-the bishop good [Philip]160-brother philip]6019-my good philip , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , without looking round . " [Thou]160-brother philip has done better than [my]4673-the bishop swiftest expectations . Didst [thou]160-brother philip give [my]4673-the bishop letter thyself into the hands of [Sir Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent , and hast [thou]160-brother philip brought [me]4673-the bishop back an answer from [that most noble Knight]6731-that most noble knight ? "[4673-the bishop]

Wherefore did [Brother Philip]160-brother philip make no reply ?

Wherefore did [his]160-brother philip breath come sharp and short not like [a stout lay - brother who has hurried]3392-a stout lay - brother who has hurried ; but , rather , like [a desperate man who has clenched [his]3393-a desperate man who has clenched his teeth to keep control of his tongue teeth to keep control of [his]3393-a desperate man who has clenched his teeth to keep control of his tongue tongue]3393-a desperate man who has clenched his teeth to keep control of his tongue ?

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop wheeled in [his]4673-the bishop chair , and found [himself]4673-the bishop looking full into the face of [Hugh d'Argent Hugh]3395-hugh d'argent hugh , haggard , dusty , travel - stained , with eyes , long strangers to sleep , regarding [him]3395-hugh d'argent hugh with a sombre intensity .

" [You]6731-that most noble knight ! "[4673-the bishop] exclaimed [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , surprised out of [his]4673-the bishop usual gentle calm . " [You]6731-that most noble knight ? Here ! "[4673-the bishop] " Yes , [I]764-the knight , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , " [I]764-the knight ! Does it surprise [you]4673-the bishop , [[my]764-the knight Lord Bishop]4963-my lord bishop , that [I]764-the knight should be [here]4536-here ? Would it not rather surprise [you]4673-the bishop , in view of that which [you]4673-the bishop saw fit to communicate to [me]764-the knight by letter , that [I]764-the knight should fail to be here and here as fast as horse could bring [me]764-the knight ? "[764-the knight]

" Naught surprises [me]4673-the bishop , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , testily . " [I]4673-the bishop have lived so long in [the world]389-the world , and had to do with [so many crazy fools]6735-so many crazy fools , that [human vagaries]6736-human vagaries no longer have power to surprise [me]4673-the bishop . And , by [[our]6737-our Lady]4260-our lady , [Sir Knight]129-the knight , [I]4673-the bishop care not where [you]129-the knight are , so that [you]129-the knight have left safe and well , [her]4260-our lady peace of mind undisturbed , [the woman whom [I]4673-the bishop acting as mouthpiece of [the Pope and Holy Church]6740-the pope and holy church]6739-the woman whom i acting as mouthpiece of the pope and holy church gave , not two weeks ago , into [your]129-the knight care and keeping . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Knight]764-the knight 's frown was thunderous .

" It might be well , [[my]764-the knight Lord Bishop]4963-my lord bishop , to leave [[our]6737-our blessed [Lady]6743-lady]4297-our blessed lady 's name out of this conversation . It hath too much been put to shameful and treacherous use . [Mora]144-mora is safe and well . How far [her]4260-our lady peace of mind can be left undisturbed , [I]764-the knight am here to discover . [I]764-the knight require , before aught else , the entire truth . "[764-the knight]

But [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had had time to recover [his]4673-the bishop equanimity . [He]4673-the bishop rose with [his]4673-the bishop most charming smile , both hands out - stretched in gracious welcome .

" Nay , [[my]4673-the bishop dear Knight]6580-my dear knight , before [aught]6745-aught else [you]6580-my dear knight require a bath ! Truly it offends [my]4673-the bishop love of the beautiful to see [you]6580-my dear knight in this dusty plight . "[4673-the bishop] [He]4673-the bishop struck upon the gong . " Also [you]6580-my dear knight require a good meal , served with a flagon of [my]4673-the bishop famous Italian wine . [You]6580-my dear knight did well to come here in person , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son . If naught hath been said to [Mora]144-mora , no harm is done ; and together [we]6747-we can doubly safeguard the matter . [I]4673-the bishop rejoice that [you]6580-my dear knight have come . But the strain of rapid travelling , when anxiety drives , is great . . . . [Jasper]196-jasper , prepare a bath for [Sir Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent in [[mine]4673-the bishop own bath - chamber]6748-mine own bath - chamber ; cast into it some of that fragrant and refreshing powder sent to [me]4673-the bishop by [the good brethren of [Santa Maria Novella]73-santa maria novella]6749-the good brethren of santa maria novella . While [the noble Knight]986-the noble knight bathes , lay out in the ante - chamber the complete suit of garments [he]986-the noble knight was wearing on the day when the sudden fancy seized [him]986-the noble knight to have a swim in [[our]6747-we river]6751-our river . [I]4673-the bishop conclude they have been duly dried and pressed and laid by with sweet herbs ? . . . Good . That is well . Now , [[my]4673-the bishop dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh , allow [Jasper]196-jasper to attend [you]132-hugh . [He]196-jasper will give [his]196-jasper whole mind to [your]132-hugh comfort . Send word to [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , [Jasper]196-jasper , that [I]4673-the bishop will speak with [him]196-jasper here . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop accompanied [the Knight]764-the knight to the door of [the library]2268-the library ; watched [him]764-the knight stride along [the gallery]3113-the gallery , silent and sullen , in the wake of the hastening [Jasper]196-jasper ; then turned and walked slowly back to the table , smiling , and gently rubbing [his]764-the knight hands together as [he]764-the knight walked .

[He]764-the knight had gained time , and [he]764-the knight had successfully regained [his]764-the knight sense of supremacy . Taken wholly by surprise , [he]764-the knight had not felt able to cope with [this gaunt , dusty , desperately determined Knight]3405-this gaunt , dusty , desperately determined knight . But [the Knight]764-the knight would leave more than mere travel stains behind , in the scented waters of the bath ! [He]764-the knight would reappear clothed and in [his]764-the knight right mind . A good meal and a flagon of Italian wine would further improve that mind , mellowing it and rendering it pliable and easy to convince ; though truly it passed comprehension why [the Knight]764-the knight should need convincing , or of what ! Even more incomprehensible was it , that [a man wedded to [Mora]144-mora]3408-a man wedded to mora , not two weeks since , should of [his]3408-a man wedded to mora own free will elect to leave [her]144-mora .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop turned .

[Brother Philip]160-brother philip stood in the doorway , bowing low .

" Come in , [[my]4673-the bishop good [Philip]160-brother philip]6019-my good philip , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ; " come in , and shut the door . . . . "[4673-the bishop]

CHAPTER XLVIII

A STRANGE CHANCE

On the fourth day of [[her]144-mora husband]5164-her husband 's absence , [Mora]144-mora climbed to the battlements to watch the glories of a most gorgeous sunset .

Also [she]144-mora loved to find [herself]144-mora again there where [she]144-mora and [Hugh]132-hugh had spent that wonderful hour in the moonlight , when [she]144-mora had told [him]5164-her husband of the vision , and afterwards had given [him]5164-her husband the promise that on the morrow [he]5164-her husband should take [her]144-mora to [[his]5164-her husband home]5182-his home .

[She]144-mora paused in the low archway at the top of [the winding stair]3413-the winding stair , remembering how [she]144-mora had turned a moment there , to whisper : " [I]144-mora love [thee]5164-her husband . "[144-mora] Ah , how often [she]144-mora had said it since : " [Dear man of [mine]144-mora]4522-dear man of mine , [I]144-mora love [thee]5164-her husband ! Come back to [me]144-mora safe ; come back to [me]144-mora soon ; [I]144-mora love [thee]5164-her husband ! "[144-mora]

That [he]5164-her husband should have had to leave [her]144-mora just as [her]144-mora love was ready to respond to [his]5164-her husband , had caused that love to grow immeasurably in depth and intensity .

Also [she]144-mora now realised , more fully , [his]5164-her husband fine self - control , [his]5164-her husband chivalrous consideration for [her]144-mora , [his]5164-her husband noble unselfishness . From the first , [he]5164-her husband had been so perfect to [her]144-mora ; and now [her]144-mora one desire was that , if [her]144-mora love could give it , [he]5164-her husband should have [his]5164-her husband reward .

Ah , when would [he]5164-her husband come ! When would [he]5164-her husband come !

[She]144-mora could not keep from shading [her]144-mora eyes and looking along [the road]4623-the road to the point where it left [the fir wood]776-the fir wood , though this was but the fourth day since [Hugh]132-hugh 's departure the day on which , by fast riding and long hours , [he]132-hugh might arrive at [Worcester]1-worcester and the ninth was the very earliest [she]144-mora dared hope for [his]132-hugh return .

How slowly , slowly , passed the days . Yet they were full of a quiet joy and peace .

From the moment when [she]144-mora had stepped out into the sunshine , resolved to go steadily forward without looking back , [she]144-mora had thrown [herself]144-mora with zest and pleasure into investigating and arranging [[her]144-mora house and [estate]3417-estate]3416-her house and estate .

Also , on the second day an idea had come to [her]144-mora with [her]144-mora first waking thoughts , which [she]144-mora had promptly put into execution .

Taking [Martin Goodfellow]133-martin with [her]144-mora [she]144-mora had ridden over to [[Hugh]132-hugh 's home]3418-hugh 's home ; had found it , as [she]144-mora expected , greatly needing [a woman]813-a woman 's hand and mind , and had set to work at once on those changes and arrangements most needed , so that all should be in readiness when [Hugh]132-hugh , returning , would take [her]144-mora [home]305-home .

Under [her]144-mora direction [the chamber which should be [hers]144-mora]3421-the chamber which should be hers was put into perfect order ; [her]144-mora own things were transported thither , and all was made so completely ready , that at any moment [she]144-mora and [Hugh]132-hugh could start , without need of baggage or [attendants]3422-attendants , and ride together [home]305-home .

[This chamber]3210-this chamber had two doors , the one leading down a flight of steps on to [a terrace]3425-a terrace , the other opening directly into [the great hall]1672-the great hall , [the central chamber of [the house]4604-the house]3427-the central chamber of the house .

[Mora]144-mora loved to stand in this doorway , looking into [the noble apartment]3429-the noble apartment , with [its]3429-the noble apartment huge fireplace , massive carved chairs on either side of the hearth , weapons on the walls , trophies of feats of arms , all those things which made it [home]305-home to [Hugh]132-hugh , and to remember that of this place [he]132-hugh had said in [his]132-hugh petition to [[our]3431-our Lady]4260-our lady : " Take pity on [a lonely home]893-a lonely home , [a desolate hearth]894-a desolate hearth . . . and send [her]4260-our lady to [me]132-hugh . "[132-hugh]

No longer should it be lonely or desolate . Aye , and no longer should [his]132-hugh faithful heart be hungry .

On this day [she]144-mora had been over for the third time , riding by [the road]4623-the road , because [she]144-mora and [Martin]133-martin both carried packages of garments and other things upon [their]3434-their saddles ; but returning by a shorter way through [the woods]5596-the woods , silent and mossy , most heavenly cool and green .

This journey had served to complete [her]144-mora happy preparations . So now , should [Hugh]132-hugh arrive , even at sunset , and be wishful to ride on without delay , [she]144-mora could order the saddling of [Icon]174-icon , and say : " [I]174-icon am ready , [dear Knight]5610-dear knight ; let [us]6759-us go . "[174-icon]

[She]144-mora stood on the Castle wall , gazing at the blood - red banners of the sunset , flaming from the battlements of a veritable city of gold ; then , shading [her]144-mora eyes , turned to look once again along [the road]4623-the road .

And , at that moment , out from the dark fir wood there rode [a horseman]5383-a horseman , alone .

For one moment only did [her]144-mora heart leap in the wild belief that [Hugh]132-hugh had returned . The next instant [she]144-mora knew this could not be [he]132-hugh ; even before [her]144-mora eyes made out [a stranger]3438-a stranger .

[She]144-mora watched [him]3438-a stranger leave [the road]4623-the road , and turn up [the winding path which led to [the Castle]5855-the castle gate]3440-the winding path which led to the castle gate ; saw [the porter]3317-the porter go to the grating in answer to a loud knocking without ; saw [him]3438-a stranger fetch [old Zachary]231-zachary , who in [his]3438-a stranger turn sent for [Martin Goodfellow]133-martin ; upon which the gates were opened wide , and [the stranger]3443-the stranger rode into [the courtyard]775-the courtyard .

[Whereupon Mora]144-mora thought it time that [she]144-mora should descend from the battlements and find out who [this unexpected visitor]3445-this unexpected visitor might be .

At the head of the great staircase , [she]144-mora met [Martin]133-martin .

" [Lady]5126-lady , "[133-martin] [he]133-martin said , " there waits [a man below who urgently desires speech with [Sir Hugh]132-hugh]6761-a man below who urgently desires speech with sir hugh . Learning from [us]6762-us that [the Knight]764-the knight hath ridden south , and is like to be away some days longer , [he]6761-a man below who urgently desires speech with sir hugh begs to have word with [you]5126-lady , alone ; yet refuses to state [his]6761-a man below who urgently desires speech with sir hugh business or to give [his]6761-a man below who urgently desires speech with sir hugh name . [Master Zachary]231-zachary greatly hopeth that it may be [your]5126-lady pleasure that [we]6762-us bid [the fellow]4552-the fellow forthwith depart , telling [him]6761-a man below who urgently desires speech with sir hugh if [he]6761-a man below who urgently desires speech with sir hugh so will to ride back in six days ' time , when [the worshipful Knight , whom [he]6761-a man below who urgently desires speech with sir hugh desires to see]6765-the worshipful knight , whom he desires to see , will have returned . "[133-martin]

[Mora]144-mora knitted [her]144-mora brows . It did not please [her]144-mora that [Zachary]231-zachary and [Martin Goodfellow]133-martin should arrange together what [she]144-mora should do . " Describe [him]4552-the fellow , [Martin]133-martin , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said . " What manner of man is [he]4552-the fellow ? "[144-mora]

" [Swarthy]240-swarthy , "[133-martin] said [Martin]133-martin , " and soldierly ; somewhat of a dare - devil , but on [his]4552-the fellow best behaviour . [Zachary]231-zachary and [I]133-martin would suggest "[133-martin]

" [I]144-mora will see [him]4552-the fellow , "[144-mora] said [Mora]144-mora , beginning to descend the stairs . " [I]144-mora will see [him]4552-the fellow in [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall , and alone . [You]144-mora , [Martin]133-martin , can wait without , entering on the instant if [I]144-mora call . Tell [Zachary]231-zachary to bid [them]3447-them prepare a meal of bread and meat , with a flagon of wine , or a pot of good ale , which [I]144-mora may offer to [this traveller]6767-this traveller , should [he]4552-the fellow need refreshment . "[144-mora]

[She]144-mora was standing in [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall , on the very spot where [Hugh]132-hugh had kneeled at [their]3447-them parting , when [the swarthy fellow , soldierly , yet somewhat of a dare - devil]3448-the swarthy fellow , soldierly , yet somewhat of a dare - devil , entered .

Most certainly [he]132-hugh was on [his]132-hugh best behaviour . [He]132-hugh doffed [his]132-hugh cap at first sight of [her]144-mora , advanced a few paces , then stood still , bowing low ; came forward a few more paces , then bowed again .

[She]144-mora spoke .

" [You]132-hugh wished to see [[my]144-mora husband]6683-my husband , [Friend]5113-friend , and speak with [him]132-hugh ? [He]132-hugh is away and hardly can return before five days , at soonest . Is [your]132-hugh business with [Sir Hugh]132-hugh such as [I]144-mora can pass on to [him]132-hugh for [you]132-hugh , by word of mouth ? "[144-mora]

[She]144-mora hoped [those]3449-those bold , dark eyes did not perceive how [she]144-mora glowed to speak for the first time , to another , of [Hugh]132-hugh as [[her]144-mora husband]5164-her husband .

[He]132-hugh answered , and [his]132-hugh words were blunt ; [his]132-hugh manner , frank and soldierly .

" [Most noble Lady]6770-most noble lady , failing [the Knight]764-the knight , whom [I]132-hugh have ridden far to find , [my]132-hugh business may most readily be told to [you]144-mora .[132-hugh]

" Years ago , on [a Syrian battle - field]6772-a syrian battle - field it was [my]132-hugh good fortune , in the thick of the fray , to find [myself]132-hugh side by side with [Sir Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent . [The Infidels]6773-the infidels struck [me]132-hugh down ; and , sorely wounded , [I]132-hugh should have been at [their]6773-the infidels mercy , had not [the noble Knight]986-the noble knight , seeing [me]132-hugh fall , wheeled [his]986-the noble knight horse and , riding back , hewn [his]986-the noble knight way through to [me]132-hugh , scattering [[mine]132-hugh assailants]6775-mine assailants right and left . Then , helping [me]132-hugh to mount behind [him]986-the noble knight , galloped with [me]132-hugh back to [camp]4572-camp . Whereupon [I]132-hugh swore , by the holy Cross at [Lucca]74-lucca , that if ever the chance came [my]132-hugh way to do a service to [Sir Hugh]132-hugh of the Silver Shield , [I]132-hugh would travel to [the world]389-the world 's end to do it .[132-hugh]

" Ten nights ago , [I]132-hugh chanced to be riding through [a wood somewhere betwixt [Worcester]1-worcester and [Warwick]32-warwick]6778-a wood somewhere betwixt worcester and warwick . [A band of lawless fellows]6779-a band of lawless fellows coming by , [I]132-hugh and [[my]132-hugh steed]6780-my steed drew off the path , taking cover in a thicket . But [a solitary horseman]6781-a solitary horseman , riding from [Worcester]1-worcester , failed to avoid [them]6779-a band of lawless fellows . Within sight of [my]132-hugh hiding - place [he]6781-a solitary horseman was set upon , made to dismount , stripped and bidden to return on foot to [the place from whence [he]6781-a solitary horseman came]6782-the place from whence he came . [I]132-hugh could do naught to help [him]6781-a solitary horseman . [We]6783-we were two , to [a round dozen]6784-a round dozen . [The robbers]6785-the robbers took the money from [his]6781-a solitary horseman wallet . Within it [they]6785-the robbers found also a letter , which [they]6785-the robbers flung away as worthless . [I]132-hugh marked where it fell , close to [my]132-hugh hiding - place .[132-hugh]

" When the affray was over , [[their]6785-the robbers victim]6786-their victim having fled and [the lawless band]6787-the lawless band ridden off , [I]132-hugh came forth , picked up the letter and slipped it into [mine]132-hugh own wallet . So soon as the sun rose [I]132-hugh drew forth the letter , when , to [my]132-hugh amaze , [I]132-hugh found it addressed to [[my]132-hugh brave rescuer]6788-my brave rescuer , [the Knight of the Silver Shield and Azure Pennant]6789-the knight of the silver shield and azure pennant . It appeared to be of importance as , failing [Warwick Castle]68-warwick castle , [six halting places]6790-six halting places , all on [the northward road]3099-the northward road , were named on the outside ; also it was marked to be delivered with most urgent haste .[132-hugh]

" It seemed to [me]132-hugh that now had come [my]132-hugh chance , to do this brave Knight service . Therefore have [I]132-hugh ridden from place to place , following ; and , after some delay , [I]132-hugh find [myself]132-hugh at length at [Castle Norelle]21-castle norelle , only to hear that [he]6788-my brave rescuer to whom [I]132-hugh purposed to hand the letter has ridden south by [another road]6792-another road . Thus is [my]132-hugh endeavour to serve [him]6788-my brave rescuer rendered fruitless . "[132-hugh]

" Nay , [Friend]5113-friend , "[144-mora] said [Mora]144-mora , much moved by this recital . " Not fruitless . Give [me]144-mora the letter [you]5113-friend have thus rescued and faithfully attempted , to deliver . [[My]144-mora husband]6683-my husband returns in five days . [I]144-mora will then hand [him]6788-my brave rescuer the letter and tell [him]6788-my brave rescuer [your]5113-friend tale . Most grateful will [he]6788-my brave rescuer be for [your]5113-friend good service , and moved by [your]5113-friend loyal remembrance . "[144-mora]

[The swarthy fellow]3451-the swarthy fellow drew from [his]3451-the swarthy fellow wallet a letter , heavily sealed , and inscribed at great length . [He]3451-the swarthy fellow placed it in [Mora]144-mora 's hands .

[Her]144-mora clear eyes dwelt upon [his]3451-the swarthy fellow countenance with searching interest . It was wonderful to [her]144-mora to see before [her]144-mora [a man whose life [Hugh]132-hugh had saved , so far away , on [an Eastern battle - field]3453-an eastern battle - field]3452-a man whose life hugh had saved , so far away , on an eastern battle - field .

" In [[my]144-mora husband]6683-my husband 's name , [I]144-mora thank [you]3451-the swarthy fellow , [Friend]5113-friend , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said . " And now [[my]144-mora people]6797-my people will put before [you]3451-the swarthy fellow food and wine . [You]3451-the swarthy fellow must have rest and refreshment before [you]3451-the swarthy fellow again set forth . "[144-mora]

" [I]3443-the stranger thank [you]144-mora , no , "[3443-the stranger] replied [the stranger]3443-the stranger . " [I]3443-the stranger must ride on , without delay . [I]3443-the stranger bid [you]144-mora farewell , [Lady]5126-lady ; and [I]3443-the stranger do but wish the service , which a strange chance has enabled [me]3443-the stranger to render to [the Knight]764-the knight , had been of greater importance and had held more of risk or danger . "[3443-the stranger]

[He]3443-the stranger bowed low , and departed . A few moments later [he]3443-the stranger was riding out at the gates , and making for [the northward road]3099-the northward road .

Had [Brother Philip]160-brother philip chanced to be at hand , [he]160-brother philip could not have failed to note that [the swarthy stranger]3456-the swarthy stranger was mounted upon the fastest nag in [[the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's stable]3458-the bishop 's stable .

For a life of lawlessness , rapine , and robbery , does not debar [a man]4482-a man from keeping an oath sworn , out of honest gratitude , in cleaner , better days .

Left alone , [Mora]144-mora passed on to [the terrace]3259-the terrace and , in the clearer light , examined this soiled and much inscribed missive .

To [her]144-mora amazement [she]144-mora recognised the well - known script of [Symon]154-symon of worcester , [Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]1222-bishop of worcester . How many a letter had reached [her]144-mora hands addressed in these neat characters .

Yet [Hugh]132-hugh had left [her]144-mora , and gone upon this ride of many days to [Worcester]1-worcester in order to see [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , because [he]4673-the bishop had received a letter telling [him]4673-the bishop , without sufficient detail , a matter of importance . Probably the letter [she]144-mora now held in [her]144-mora hands should have reached [him]4673-the bishop first . Doubtless had [he]4673-the bishop received it , [he]4673-the bishop need not have gone .

Pondering this matter , and almost unconscious that [she]144-mora did so , [Mora]144-mora broke the seals . Then paused , even as [she]144-mora began to unfold the parchment , questioning whether to read it or to let it await [Hugh]132-hugh 's return .

But not long did [she]144-mora hesitate . It was upon a matter which closely concerned [her]144-mora . That much [Hugh]132-hugh had admitted . It might be imperative to take immediate action concerning this first letter , which by so strange a mishap had arrived after the other . Unless [she]144-mora mastered its contents , [she]144-mora could not act .

Ascending [the turret stairway]3278-the turret stairway , [Mora]144-mora stepped again on to [the battlements]3162-the battlements .

The golden ramparts in the west had faded ; but a blood - red banner still floated above the horizon . The sky overhead was clear .

Sitting upon the seat on which [she]144-mora had sat while telling [Hugh]132-hugh of [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's most blessed and wondrous vision , [Mora]144-mora unfolded and read [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's letter .

CHAPTER XLIX

TWICE DECEIVED

The blood - red banner had drooped , dipped , and vanished .

The sky overhead had deepened to purple , and opened starry eyes upon [the world beneath]3466-the world beneath . Each time [the silent woman , alone upon the battlements]3467-the silent woman , alone upon the battlements , lifted a sorrowful face to the heavens , yet another bright eye seemed to spring wide and gaze down upon [her]144-mora .

At length the whole expanse of the sky was studded with stars ; the planets hung luminous ; the moon , already waning , rose large and golden from behind the firs , growing smaller and more silvery as [she]144-mora mounted higher .

[Mora]144-mora covered [her]144-mora face with [her]144-mora hands . The summer night was too full of scented sweetness . The stars sang together . The moon rode triumphant in the heavens . In this [her]144-mora hour of darkness [she]144-mora must shut out the brilliant sky . [She]144-mora let [her]144-mora face sink into [her]144-mora hands , and bowed [her]144-mora head upon [her]144-mora knees .

Blow after blow had fallen upon [her]144-mora from [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's letter .

First that [the Bishop]4673-the bishop [himself]4673-the bishop was plotting to deceive [her]144-mora , and seemed to take [Hugh]132-hugh 's connivance for granted .

Then that [she]144-mora had been hoodwinked by [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony , on the evening of [Hugh]132-hugh 's intrusion into [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery ; that this hoodwinking was known to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , and appeared but to cause [him]4673-the bishop satisfaction , tempered by a faint amusement .

Then the overwhelming news that [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's vision had been an imposition , devised and contrived by the almost uncannily shrewd wits of [the old woman]430-the old woman ; and that [the Bishop]4673-the bishop advised [the Knight]764-the knight to praise [heaven]335-heaven for those wits , and to beware lest any chance word of [his]4673-the bishop should lead [her]144-mora [Mora]144-mora to doubt the genuineness of the vision , and to realise that [she]144-mora had been hocussed , hoodwinked , outwitted ! In fact [the Bishop]4673-the bishop and [[her]144-mora husband]5164-her husband were to become , and to continue indefinitely , parties to [old Antony]85-mary antony 's deception .

[She]144-mora now understood the full significance of the half - humorous , half - sceptical attitude adopted by [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , when [she]144-mora recounted to [him]4673-the bishop the history of the vision . No wonder [he]4673-the bishop had called [Mary Antony]85-mary antony [a " most wise and prudent babe]6800-a " most wise and prudent babe . "[4673-the bishop]

But even as [her]144-mora anger rose , not only against [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , but against [the old woman [she]144-mora had loved and trusted and who had so deceived [her]144-mora]3480-the old woman she had loved and trusted and who had so deceived her , [she]144-mora came upon the news of the death of [the aged lay - sister]2044-the aged lay - sister and the account of [her]2044-the aged lay - sister devoted fidelity , even to the end .

[Mary Antony]85-mary antony living , was often [a pathetic figure]3482-a pathetic figure ; [Mary Antony]85-mary antony dead , disarmed anger .

And , after all , [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister and [her]264-the old lay - sister spurious vision faded into insignificance in view of the one supreme question : What course would [Hugh]132-hugh take ? Would [he]132-hugh keep silence and thus tacitly become [a party to the deception]3484-a party to the deception ; or would [he]132-hugh , at all costs , tell [her]144-mora the truth ?

It was evidence of the change [her]144-mora love had wrought in [her]144-mora , that this one point was so paramount , that until it was settled , [she]144-mora could not bring [herself]144-mora to contemplate other issues .

[She]144-mora remembered , with hopeful comfort , [his]132-hugh scrupulous honesty in the matter of [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise . Yet wherefore had [he]132-hugh gone to consult with [the Bishop]4673-the bishop unless [he]132-hugh intended to fall in with [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's suggestions ?

Not until [she]144-mora at last sought [[her]144-mora chamber]4322-her chamber and knelt before [the shrine of [the Madonna]435-the madonna]485-the shrine of the madonna , did [she]144-mora realise that [her]144-mora justification in leaving [the Convent]328-the convent was gone , if there had been no vision .

" [Blessed Virgin]2144-blessed virgin , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora pleaded , with clasped hands uplifted ; " [I]144-mora , who have been twice deceived tricked into entering [the Cloister]286-the cloister , and tricked into leaving it [I]144-mora beseech [thee]2144-blessed virgin , by the sword which pierced through thine own soul also , grant [me]144-mora now a vision which shall be , in very deed , a VISION OF TRUTH . "[144-mora]

CHAPTER L

[THE SILVER SHIELD

The Bishop]3491-the silver shield the bishop sat at the round table in [the centre of [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall]3492-the centre of the banqueting hall , sipping water from [his]4673-the bishop purple goblet while [the Knight]764-the knight dined .

[They]3495-they were not alone . [Lay - brethren , with sandalled feet]3496-lay - brethren , with sandalled feet , moved noiselessly to and fro ; and [Brother Philip]160-brother philip stood immovable behind [the Reverend Father]5052-the reverend father 's chair .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop discoursed pleasantly of many things , watching [Hugh]132-hugh the while , and blessing the efficacy of the bath . [It]3499-it had , undoubtedly , cleansed away much beside travel - stains .

The thunder - cloud had lifted from [the Knight]764-the knight 's brow ; [his]764-the knight eyes , though tired , were no longer sombre ; [his]764-the knight manner was more than usually courteous and deferential , as if to atone for the defiant brusquerie of [his]764-the knight first appearance .

[He]764-the knight listened in absolute silence to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's gentle flow of conversation ; but this was a trait [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had observed in [him]764-the knight before ; and , after all , a lapse into silence could be easily understood when [a man]4482-a man had travelled far , on meagre fare , and found [himself]4482-a man seated at a well - spread board .

Yet [the Knight]764-the knight ate but sparingly of the good cheer , so lavishly provided ; and the famous Italian wine , [he]764-the knight scarce touched at all .

The meal over , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop dismissed [Brother Philip]160-brother philip and [the attendant monks]3506-the attendant monks , and , rising , went to [his]4673-the bishop chair near the hearth , motioning [the Knight]764-the knight to the one opposite .

Thus [they]3508-they found [themselves]3508-they seated again as [they]3508-they had sat on the night of the arrival of [[the Pope]5391-the pope 's messenger]3510-the pope 's messenger ; save that now no fire burned upon the hearth ; no candles were lighted on the table . Instead , the summer sunshine poured in through open casements .

" Well , [[my]4673-the bishop dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , ' suppose [you]764-the knight now tell [me]0-i the reason which brings [you]764-the knight hither . It must surely be a matter of grave importance which could cause so devoted [a lover]4976-a lover and [husband]3513-husband to leave [[his]3513-husband bride]4744-his bride , and go a five days ' journey from [her]4744-his bride , within two weeks of the bridal day . "[764-the knight]

" [I]764-the knight have come , [[my]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , speaking slowly and with evident effort , " to learn from [your]4881-my lord lips the entire truth concerning that vision which caused [the Prioress of the White Ladies]1156-the prioress of the white ladies to hold [herself]1156-the prioress of the white ladies free to renounce [her]1156-the prioress of the white ladies vows , leave [[her]1156-the prioress of the white ladies Nunnery]1181-her nunnery , and give [herself]1156-the prioress of the white ladies in marriage where [she]1156-the prioress of the white ladies had been betrothed before entering [the Cloister]286-the cloister . "[764-the knight]

" Tut ! "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " [The White Ladies]288-the white ladies have [no Prioress]6809-no prioress . [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress doth exercise the functions of [that office]6810-that office until such time as [the Prior]2987-the prior and [myself]4673-the bishop shall make a fresh appointment . [We]6812-we are not here to talk of [prioresses]6813-prioresses , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , but of [that most noble and gracious lady who , by the blessing of [God]89-god and [our]3518-our Lady]6815-that most noble and gracious lady who , by the blessing of god and our lady 's especial favour , is now [[your]5057-my son wife]4531-your wife . See to it that [you]5057-my son continue to deserve [your]5057-my son great good fortune . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Knight]764-the knight made no protest at the mention of [[our]3518-our Lady]4260-our lady ; but [his]764-the knight left hand moved to the medallion hanging by a gold chain from [his]764-the knight neck , covered it and clasped it firmly .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop paused ; but finding that [the Knight]764-the knight had relapsed into silence , continued :

" So [you]5057-my son wish the entire history of the inspired devotion of [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony may [God]89-god rest [her]264-the old lay - sister soul . "[1572-both men] [Both men]1572-both men crossed [themselves]1572-both men devoutly , as [the Bishop]4673-the bishop named [the Dead]686-the dead . " Shall [I]4673-the bishop give it [you]5057-my son now , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , or will [you]5057-my son wait until the morrow , when a good night 's rest shall fit [you]5057-my son better to enjoy the recital ? "[4673-the bishop]

" [[My]132-hugh lord]4881-my lord , "[132-hugh] said [Hugh]132-hugh , " ere this sun sets , [I]132-hugh hope to be many miles on [my]132-hugh homeward way . "[132-hugh]

" In that case , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , " [I]4673-the bishop must tell [you]5057-my son this moving story , without further delay . "[4673-the bishop]

So , beginning with [her]4673-the bishop custom of counting [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies by means of the dried peas , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop gave [the Knight]764-the knight the whole history of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's share in the happenings in [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery on the day of [his]764-the knight intrusion , and those which followed ; laying especial stress on [her]4673-the bishop devotion to [Mora]144-mora , and [her]4673-the bishop constant prayers to [[our]3530-our Lady]4260-our lady to sharpen [her]4673-the bishop old wits .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop had undoubtedly intended to introduce into the recital somewhat more of mysticism and sublimity than the actual facts warranted . But once launched thereon , [his]4673-the bishop sense of humour could not be denied its full enjoyment in this first telling of the entire tale . Full justice [he]4673-the bishop did to the pathos , but [he]4673-the bishop also shook with mirth over the ludicrous . As [he]4673-the bishop quoted [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister 's odd manner and movements could be seen ; [her]85-mary antony mumbling lips , and cunning wink . And here was [Mother Sub - Prioress]91-mother sub - prioress , ferret - faced and peering ; and here [Sister Mary Rebecca]90-sister mary rebecca , long - nosed , flat - footed , eager to scent out and denounce wrong doing . And at last [the Bishop]4673-the bishop told of [his]4673-the bishop talk with [Mora]144-mora in the arbour of golden roses ; and lo , there was [Mora]144-mora , devout , adoring , wholly believing . " [Thou]6820-thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent and hast revealed them unto babes "[144-mora] ; and here , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop [himself]4673-the bishop , half amused , half incredulous : " [An ancient babe]6143-an ancient babe ! Truly , [a most wise and prudent babe]6822-a most wise and prudent babe . "[4673-the bishop] Then the scene outside [[the Prioress]373-the prioress 's cell]1809-the prioress 's cell when [the Bishop]4673-the bishop unlocked the door ; the full confession and the touching death of old [Mary Antony]85-mary antony .

To it all [the Knight]764-the knight listened silently , shading [his]764-the knight face with [his]764-the knight right hand .

" Therefore , [[my]154-symon of worcester son]5057-my son , "[154-symon of worcester] concluded [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester , " when on a sudden [I]154-symon of worcester remembered [our]6824-our conversation on [the lawn]2475-the lawn , and that [I]154-symon of worcester had told [you]5057-my son of [my]154-symon of worcester belief that [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister knew of [your]5057-my son visit to [the Convent]328-the convent and had seen [you]5057-my son in [[Mora]144-mora 's cell]3054-mora 's cell , [I]154-symon of worcester hastened to send [you]5057-my son a warning , lest [you]5057-my son should , unwittingly , mention this fact to [Mora]144-mora , and raise a doubt in [her]144-mora mind concerning the genuineness of the vision , thus destroying [her]144-mora peace , and threatening [her]144-mora happiness and [your]5057-my son own . Hath [she]144-mora already told [you]5057-my son of the vision ? "[154-symon of worcester]

Still shielding [his]3540-his face [the Knight]764-the knight spoke , very low :

" The evening before [the messenger]4548-the messenger arrived , bringing [your]5057-my son letter , [[my]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , [Mora]144-mora told [me]764-the knight of the vision . "[764-the knight]

" Said [you]764-the knight aught concerning [my]764-the knight words to [you]764-the knight ? "[764-the knight]

" So soon as [she]144-mora mentioned the name of [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , [I]764-the knight said that [I]764-the knight seemed to recall that [you]764-the knight , [[my]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , had told [me]764-the knight [she]144-mora alone knew of [my]764-the knight visit to [the Convent]328-the convent . But [Mora]144-mora at once said nay , that it was [she]144-mora [herself]144-mora who had told [me]764-the knight so , even while [I]764-the knight stood undiscovered in [[her]144-mora cell]321-her cell ; but that afterward [the lay - sister]337-the lay - sister had confessed [herself]337-the lay - sister mistaken . This seemed to [me]764-the knight to explain the matter , therefore [I]764-the knight said no more ; nor did [I]764-the knight , for a moment , doubt the truth and wonder of the vision . "[764-the knight]

" For that , [the saints]4874-the saints be praised , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " Then no harm is done . [You]132-hugh and [I]4673-the bishop , alone , know the entire story ; and [you]132-hugh and [I]4673-the bishop , who would safeguard [Mora]144-mora 's happiness with [our]6836-our lives , must see to it that [she]144-mora never has cause for misgivings . "[4673-the bishop]

[Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent lifted [his]132-hugh head , and looked full at [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" [[My]132-hugh lord]4881-my lord , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh said , " had there been no vision , no message from [[our]6836-our Lady]4260-our lady , no placing by [her]144-mora of [Mora]144-mora 's hand in [mine]132-hugh , think [you]132-hugh [she]144-mora would have left [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery and come to [me]132-hugh ? "[132-hugh]

" Nay , [dear lad]5112-dear lad , that [I]132-hugh know [she]144-mora would not . On that very morning , as [I]132-hugh told [you]5112-dear lad , [she]144-mora set [her]144-mora foot upon [the Pope]5391-the pope 's mandate , and would accept no absolving from [her]144-mora vows . Naught would suffice , said [she]144-mora , but a direct vision and revelation from [[our]6842-our Lady [herself]144-mora]6134-our lady herself . "[132-hugh]

" But , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , slowly , " was there a vision , [[my]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord ? Was there a revelation ? Was there a spoken message or a given sign ? "[764-the knight]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop met the earnest eyes , full of a deep searching . [He]4673-the bishop stirred uneasily ; then smiled , waving a deprecatory hand .

" Between [ourselves]6842-our , [[my]764-the knight dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh though even so , it is not well to be too explicit between [ourselves]6842-our of course nothing well miraculous happened , beyond the fact that [[our]6842-our Lady]4260-our lady most certainly sharpened the wits of [old Antony]85-mary antony . Therefore is it , that [you]4673-the bishop undoubtedly owe [[your]4673-the bishop wife]4531-your wife to those same wits , and may praise [[our]6842-our Lady]4260-our lady for sharpening them . "[764-the knight]

Then it was that [the Knight]764-the knight rose to [his]764-the knight feet .

" And [I]764-the knight refuse , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said , " to owe [[my]764-the knight wife]4532-my wife to sacrilege , fraud , and falsehood . "[764-the knight]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop leaned forward , gripping with both hands the arms of [his]4673-the bishop chair . [His]4673-the bishop face was absolutely colourless ; but [his]4673-the bishop eyes , like blue steel , seemed to transfix [the Knight]764-the knight , who could not withdraw [his]764-the knight regard from those keen points of light .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop 's whisper , when at length [he]4673-the bishop spoke , was more alarming than if [he]4673-the bishop had shouted .

" [Fool]4233-fool ! "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " [Ungrateful , unspeakable fool]6851-ungrateful , unspeakable fool ! What mean [you]4673-the bishop by such words ? "[4673-the bishop]

" Call [me]764-the knight [fool]4233-fool if [you]4673-the bishop will , [[my]764-the knight Lord Bishop]4963-my lord bishop , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , ' so long as [I]0-i give not [mine]0-i own conscience cause to call [me]0-i knave . "[764-the knight]

" What mean [you]4673-the bishop by such words ? "[4673-the bishop] persisted [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " [I]4673-the bishop mean , [[my]4673-the bishop lord]4881-my lord , that if the truth opened out an abyss which plunged [me]4673-the bishop into [hell]5078-hell , [I]4673-the bishop would sooner know it than attempt to enter [Paradise]5-paradise across the flimsy fabric of a lie . "[4673-the bishop]

Now during many days , [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester had worked incessantly , suffered much , accomplished much , surrendered much , lost much . Perhaps it is hardly to be wondered at , that , at this juncture , [he]154-symon of worcester lost [his]154-symon of worcester temper .

" By [Saint Peter]125-saint peter 's keys ! "[154-symon of worcester] [he]154-symon of worcester cried , " [I]154-symon of worcester care not , [Sir Knight]6856-sir knight , whether [you]6856-sir knight drop to hell or climb to [Paradise]5-paradise . But it is [my]154-symon of worcester business to see to it that [you]6856-sir knight do not disturb the peace of mind of [the woman [you]6856-sir knight have]6857-the woman you have [we]6858-we d. Therefore [I]154-symon of worcester warn [you]6856-sir knight , that if [you]6856-sir knight ride from here set upon so doing , [you]6856-sir knight will not reach [your]6856-sir knight destination alive . "[154-symon of worcester]

[The Knight]764-the knight smiled . The film of weariness lifted as if by magic from [his]764-the knight eyes , and they shone bright and serene .

" [I]764-the knight can not draw [my]764-the knight sword upon threats , [[my]764-the knight Lord [Bishop]92-bishop]4963-my lord bishop ; but let those threats take human shape , and by [Saint George]199-saint george , [I]764-the knight shall find pleasure in rendering a good account of them . With this same sword [I]764-the knight once did hew [my]764-the knight way through a score of Saracens . Think [you]92-bishop [a dozen Worcester cut - throats]6860-a dozen worcester cut - throats could keep [me]764-the knight from reaching [[my]764-the knight wife]4532-my wife ? "[764-the knight]

Something in the tone with which [the Knight]764-the knight spoke these final words calmed [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ; something in the glance of [his]764-the knight eye quelled [the angry Prelate]3555-the angry prelate . In the former [he]764-the knight recognised a depth of love such as [he]764-the knight had not hitherto believed possible to [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent ; in the latter , calm courage , nay , a serene joy at the prospect of danger , against which [his]4673-the bishop threats and fury could but break themselves , even as stormy waves against [the granite rocks of [the Cornish coast]3557-the cornish coast]3556-the granite rocks of the cornish coast .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop possessed that somewhat rare though valuable faculty , the ability to recognise instantly , and instantly to accept , the inevitable . Also when [he]4673-the bishop had made a false move , [he]4673-the bishop knew it , and was preparing to counteract it almost before [[his]4673-the bishop opponent]3559-his opponent had perceived the mistake .

So rarely was [the Bishop]4673-the bishop angry , that [his]4673-the bishop anger now affected [him]4673-the bishop physically , with a sickening sense of faintness . With closed eyes , [he]4673-the bishop leaned [his]4673-the bishop head against the back of the chair . [His]4673-the bishop face , always white and delicate , now appeared as if carved in ivory . [His]4673-the bishop lips fell apart , but no breath issued from them . Except for a slight twitching of the eyelids , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's countenance was lifeless .

Startled and greatly alarmed , [Hugh]132-hugh looked around for some means whereby [he]132-hugh might summon help , but could see none .

Hastening to the table , [he]764-the knight poured wine into the Venetian goblet , brought it back , and moistened the [Bishop]92-bishop 's lips . Then kneeling on one knee loosed the cold fingers from [their]3562-their grip .

Presently [the Bishop]4673-the bishop opened [his]4673-the bishop eyes no longer points of blue steel , but soft and dreamy like a mist of bluebells on [distant hills]670-distant hills . [He]4673-the bishop looked , with unseeing gaze , into the anxious face on a level with [his]4673-the bishop own ; then turned [his]4673-the bishop eyes slowly upon the ruby goblet which [the Knight]764-the knight had lifted from the floor and was trying to hold to [his]764-the knight lips .

Waving it away , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop slipped the finger and thumb of [his]4673-the bishop left hand into [his]4673-the bishop sash , and drew out a small gold box of exquisite workmanship , set with emeralds .

At this [he]4673-the bishop gazed for some time , as if uncertain what to do with it ; then touched a spring and as the lid flew open , sat up and took from the box a tiny white tablet . This [he]4673-the bishop dropped into the wine .

[The Knight]764-the knight , watching with anxious eyes , saw it rapidly dissolve as it sank to the bottom .

But all consciousness of the tablet , the wine , or [the kneeling Knight]3568-the kneeling knight , appeared to have instantly faded from [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's mind . [He]4673-the bishop lay back gazing dreamily at a banner which , for no apparent reason , stirred and wafted to and fro , as it hung from an oaken beam , high up among the rafters .

" Wherefore doth it waft ? "[4673-the bishop] murmured [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , thereby adding greatly to [the Knight]764-the knight 's alarm . " Wherefore ? Wherefore ? Wherefore doth it waft ? "[4673-the bishop]

" Drink this , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , "[764-the knight] urged [the Knight]764-the knight . " [I]764-the knight implore [you]4673-the bishop , [[my]764-the knight dear lord]5116-my dear lord , raise [yourself]4673-the bishop and drink . "[764-the knight]

" Methinks there must be a draught , "[4673-the bishop] mused [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" Yea , truly , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , " of [your]4673-the bishop famous Italian wine . [Father]155-reverend father , [I]764-the knight pray [you]4673-the bishop drink . "[764-the knight]

" Among the rafters , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . But [he]4673-the bishop sat up , took the goblet from [the Knight]764-the knight 's hand , and slowly sipped its contents .

Almost at once , a faint tinge of colour shewed in [his]4673-the bishop cheeks and on [his]4673-the bishop lips ; [his]4673-the bishop eyes grew bright . [He]4673-the bishop smiled at [the Knight]764-the knight , as [he]4673-the bishop placed the empty goblet on the table beside [him]4673-the bishop .

" Ah , [[my]4673-the bishop dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , extending [his]4673-the bishop hand ; " it is good to find [you]132-hugh [here]4536-here . Let [us]6865-us continue [our]6865-us conversation , if [you]132-hugh are sufficiently rested and refreshed . [I]4673-the bishop have much to say to [you]132-hugh . "[4673-the bishop]

In the reaction of a great relief , [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent seized the extended hand and fervently kissed [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's ring .

It was the reverent homage of a loyal heart . [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester , as with a Benedicite [he]154-symon of worcester graciously acknowledged it , suffered a slight twinge of conscience ; almost as unusual an experience as the ebullition of temper . [He]154-symon of worcester took up the conversation exactly at that point to which it best suited [him]154-symon of worcester to return , namely , there where [he]154-symon of worcester had made the first false step .

" Therefore , [[my]4673-the bishop dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh , [I]4673-the bishop have now given [you]132-hugh in detail the true history of the vision , making it clear that [we]6865-us owe it , alas ! to earthly devotion , rather than to Divine interposition though indeed the one may well be the means used by the other . It remains for [us]6865-us to consider , and to decide upon , the best line to take with [Mora]144-mora in order to safeguard most surely [her]144-mora peace of mind , and permanently to secure [her]144-mora happiness . "[4673-the bishop]

" [I]764-the knight have considered , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , simply ; " and [I]764-the knight have decided . "[764-the knight]

" What have [you]132-hugh decided to do , [[my]154-symon of worcester son]5057-my son ? "[154-symon of worcester] questioned [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester , in [his]154-symon of worcester smoothest tones .

" To make known to [Mora]144-mora , so soon as [I]154-symon of worcester return , the entire truth . "[154-symon of worcester]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop cast [his]4673-the bishop eyes upward , to see whether the banner still waved .

It did .

Undoubtedly there must be a current of air among the rafters .

" And what effect do [you]132-hugh suppose such a communication will have , [[my]764-the knight son]5057-my son , upon the mind of [[your]132-hugh wife]4531-your wife ? "[764-the knight]

" [I]4673-the bishop am not called to face suppositions , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father ; [I]4673-the bishop am simply confronted by facts . "[4673-the bishop]

" Precisely , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , precisely , "[4673-the bishop] replied [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , pressing [his]4673-the bishop finger - tips together , and raising them to [his]4673-the bishop lips . " Yet even while dealing with causes , it is well sometimes to consider effects , lest [they]6871-they take [us]6872-us wholly unawares . Do [you]132-hugh realise that , as [[your]132-hugh wife]4531-your wife felt justified in leaving [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery and wedding [you]132-hugh , solely by reason of [[our]6872-us Lady]4260-our lady 's miraculously accorded permission , when [she]4531-your wife learns that that permission was not miraculous , [she]4531-your wife will cease to feel justified ? "[4673-the bishop]

" [I]764-the knight greatly fear it , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight .

" Do [you]132-hugh [yourself]132-hugh now consider that [she]4531-your wife was not justified ? "[4673-the bishop]

" Nay ! "[764-the knight] answered [the Knight]764-the knight , with sudden vehemence . " Always , since [I]764-the knight learned how [we]6872-us had been tricked by [[her]4531-your wife sister]6876-her sister , [I]764-the knight have held [her]4531-your wife to be rightfully [mine]764-the knight . [Heaven]142-heaven knew , when [she]4531-your wife made [her]4531-your wife vows , that [I]764-the knight was faithful , and [she]4531-your wife therefore still [[my]764-the knight betrothed]4565-my betrothed . [Heaven]142-heaven allowed [me]764-the knight to discover the truth , and to find [her]4531-your wife alive , and still unwed . To [my]764-the knight thinking , no Divine pronouncement was required ; and when [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father 's mandate arrived bringing the Church 's sanction , why then indeed naught seemed to stand between [us]6872-us . But [Mora]144-mora thought otherwise . "[764-the knight]

A tiny gleam came into [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's eyes ; an exceedingly refined edition of the look of cunning which used to peep out of [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony 's .

" Have [you]764-the knight ever heard tell , [[my]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son , that two negatives make an affirmative ? Think [you]764-the knight not that , in something the same way , two deceptions may make a truth . [Mora]144-mora was deceived into entering [the Convent]328-the convent , and deceived into leaving [it]328-the convent ; but from out that double deception arises the great truth that [she]144-mora has , in the sight of Heaven , been all along [yours]764-the knight . The first deception negatives the second , and the positive fact alone remains that [Mora]144-mora is wedded to [you]764-the knight , is [yours]764-the knight to guard and shield from sorrow ; and those whom [God]89-god hath joined together , let [no man]4683-no man put asunder . "[4673-the bishop]

[Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent passed [his]132-hugh hand across [his]132-hugh brow .

" [I]132-hugh trust the matter may appear thus to [Mora]144-mora , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh said .

The banner still wafted , gently . [The Bishop]92-bishop gave [himself]92-bishop time to ponder whence that draught could come .

Then : " It will not so appear , "[92-bishop] [he]92-bishop said . " [My]92-bishop good [Hugh]132-hugh , when [[your]764-the knight wife]4531-your wife learns from [you]764-the knight that [she]4531-your wife was tricked by [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , [she]4531-your wife will go back in mind to where [she]4531-your wife was before the spurious vision , and will feel [herself]4531-your wife to be still [Prioress of [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies]4675-prioress of the white ladies . "[92-bishop]

" [I]764-the knight have so felt [her]4531-your wife , since the knowledge reached [me]764-the knight , "[764-the knight] agreed [the Knight]764-the knight .

The efficacy of the soothing drug taken by [the Bishop]4673-the bishop was strained to its utmost .

" And what then do [you]764-the knight propose to do , [[my]92-bishop son]5057-my son , with [this wedded Prioress]6886-this wedded prioress ? Do [you]764-the knight expect [her]4531-your wife to remain with [you]764-the knight in [[your]764-the knight home]6887-your home , content to fulfil [her]4531-your wife wifely duties ? "[92-bishop]

" [I]764-the knight fear , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight sadly , " that [she]4531-your wife will leave [me]764-the knight . "[764-the knight]

" And [I]4673-the bishop am certain [she]4531-your wife will leave [you]764-the knight , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" It was largely this fear for the future which brought [me]92-bishop at once to [you]764-the knight , [[my]92-bishop lord]4881-my lord . If [Mora]144-mora desires , as [you]764-the knight say , to consider [herself]144-mora as [she]144-mora was , before [she]4531-your wife was tricked into leaving [the Convent]328-the convent , will [you]764-the knight arrange that [she]4531-your wife shall return , unquestioned , to [her]4531-your wife place as [Prioress of [the White Ladies of [Worcester]1-worcester]283-the white ladies of worcester]2219-prioress of the white ladies of worcester ? "[92-bishop]

" Impossible ! "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , shortly . " It is too late . [We]6892-we can have [[no Madonna]4765-no madonna groups in [Nunneries]6895-nunneries]6894-no madonna groups in nunneries , saving those carven in marble or stone . "[4673-the bishop]

To which there followed a silence , lasting many minutes .

Then [the Knight]764-the knight said , with effort , speaking very low : " It is not too late . "[764-the knight]

Instantly the keen eyes were searching [his]4673-the bishop face . A line of crimson leapt to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's cheek , as if a whip - lash had been drawn across it .

Presently : " [Fool]4233-fool ! "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop whispered , but the word savoured more of pitying tenderness than of scorn . Alas ! was there ever so knightly [a fool]1478-a fool , or [so foolish a knight]3593-so foolish a knight ! " What was the trouble , [boy]5442-boy ? Didst find that after all [she]4531-your wife loved [thee]5442-boy not ? "[3593-so foolish a knight]

" Nay , "[132-hugh] said [Hugh]132-hugh , quickly , " [I]132-hugh thank [God]89-god , and [[our]6892-we Lady]4260-our lady , that [[my]132-hugh wife]4532-my wife loves [me]132-hugh as [I]132-hugh never dreamed that such as [I]132-hugh could be loved by one so perfect in all ways as [she]4531-your wife . But at first all was so new and strange to [her]4531-your wife . It was wonder enough to be out in [the world]389-the world once more , free to come and go ; to ride abroad , looking on [men]4397-men and things . [I]132-hugh put [her]4531-your wife welfare first . . . . Nay , it was easy , loving [her]4531-your wife as [I]132-hugh loved , also greatly desiring the highest and the best . [Father]155-reverend father , [I]132-hugh wanted what [you]155-reverend father spoke of as the Madonna in [the Home]5209-the home . Therefore ' twas [I]132-hugh who made the plan [we]6892-we agreed that , the wedding having of necessity been so hurried , the courtship should follow , and [we]6892-we would count [ourselves]6892-we but [betrothed]6903-betrothed , even after reaching [Castle Norelle]21-castle norelle , for just so many days or weeks as [she]4531-your wife should please ; until such time as [she]4531-your wife [herself]4531-your wife should tell [me]132-hugh [she]4531-your wife was wishful that [I]132-hugh should take [her]4531-your wife [home]305-home . But each day of the ride northward had been more perfect than that which went before ; each hour of each day , sweeter than the preceding . Thus it came to pass that on the very evening of [our]6892-we arrival at [[Mora]144-mora 's home]5857-mora 's home , after parting for the night at the door of [[her]4531-your wife chamber]4322-her chamber , [we]6892-we met again on the battlements , where years before [we]6892-we had said farewell ; and there , seated in the moonlight , [she]4531-your wife told [me]132-hugh the wonder of [[our]6892-we Lady]4260-our lady 's grace in the vision ; and , afterwards , in words of perfect tenderness , the even greater wonder of [her]4531-your wife love , and that [she]4531-your wife was ready on the morrow to ride [home]305-home with [me]132-hugh . So [we]6892-we parted in a rapture so deep and pure , that sleep came , for very joy of it . But early in the morning [I]132-hugh was wakened by a rapping at [my]132-hugh door , and there stood [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , holding [your]132-hugh letter , [Reverend Father]155-reverend father . "[132-hugh]

" Alas ! "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " Would that [I]4673-the bishop had known [she]4531-your wife would have whereby to explain away [thy]132-hugh memory of that which [I]4673-the bishop had said . "[4673-the bishop]

Yet [the Bishop]4673-the bishop spoke perfunctorily ; [he]4673-the bishop spoke as one who , even while speaking , muses upon other matters . For , within [his]4673-the bishop secret soul , [he]4673-the bishop was fighting the hardest temptation yet faced by [him]4673-the bishop , in the whole history of [his]4673-the bishop love for [Mora]144-mora .

By rapid transition of mind , [he]4673-the bishop was back on the seat in [the garden of [the White Ladies ' Nunnery]3597-the white ladies ' nunnery]3596-the garden of the white ladies ' nunnery , left there by [Mary Antony]85-mary antony while [she]85-mary antony went to fetch [the Reverend Mother]427-the reverend mother . [He]4673-the bishop was looking up [the sunny lawn]2523-the sunny lawn toward [the cloisters]316-the cloisters , from out the shade of the great beech tree . Presently [he]4673-the bishop saw [the Prioress]373-the prioress coming , tall and stately , [her]373-the prioress cross of office gleaming upon [her]373-the prioress breast , [her]373-the prioress sweet eyes alight with welcome . And at once [they]3602-they were talking as [they]3602-they always talked together [he]4673-the bishop and [she]373-the prioress each word alive with its very fullest meaning ; each thought springing to meet the thought which matched it .

Next [he]4673-the bishop saw [himself]4673-the bishop again on [that same seat]3603-that same seat , looking up [the lawn]2475-the lawn to [the sunlit cloisters]1787-the sunlit cloisters ; realising that never again would [the Prioress]373-the prioress come to greet [him]4673-the bishop ; facing for the first time the utter loneliness , the irreparable loss to [himself]4673-the bishop , of that which [he]4673-the bishop had accomplished for [Hugh]132-hugh and [Mora]144-mora .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop 's immeasurable loss had been [Hugh]132-hugh 's infinite gain . And now that [Hugh]132-hugh seemed bent upon risking [his]132-hugh happiness , the positions were reversed . Would not [his]132-hugh loss , if [he]132-hugh persisted , be [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's gain ?

How easy to meet [her]373-the prioress on [the road]4623-the road , [a few miles from [Worcester]1-worcester]3610-a few miles from worcester ; to proceed , with much pomp and splendour , to [the White Ladies ' Nunnery]3597-the white ladies ' nunnery ; to bid [them]3612-them throw wide the great gates ; to ride in and , then and there , reinstate [Mora]144-mora as [Prioress]2463-prioress , announcing that the higher service upon which [the Holy Father]5435-the holy father had sent [her]373-the prioress had been duly accomplished . Picture the joy in [the bereaved Community]3615-the bereaved community ! But , above and beyond all , picture what it would mean to have [her]373-the prioress there again ; to see [her]373-the prioress , speak with [her]373-the prioress , sit with [her]373-the prioress , when [he]132-hugh would . No more loneliness of soul , no more desolation of spirit ; and [Mora]144-mora 's conscience at rest ; [her]373-the prioress mind content .

But at that , being that it concerned [the woman [he]132-hugh loved]876-the woman he loved , [the true soul of [him]132-hugh]3617-the true soul of him spoke up , while [his]132-hugh imaginative reason fell silent .

Never again could [the woman who had told [Hugh]132-hugh]3618-the woman who had told hugh d'Argent , in words of perfect tenderness , the wonder of [her]3618-the woman who had told hugh love , and that [she]3618-the woman who had told hugh was ready on the morrow to ride [home]305-home with [him]132-hugh , be content in the calm of [the Cloister]286-the cloister .

If [Hugh]132-hugh persisted in this folly of frankness and disturbed [her]3618-the woman who had told hugh peace , [she]3618-the woman who had told hugh might leave [him]132-hugh .

If [the Bishop]4673-the bishop made the way easy , [she]3618-the woman who had told hugh might return to [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery .

But all the true life of [her]3618-the woman who had told hugh would be left behind with [[her]3618-the woman who had told hugh lover]762-her lover .

[She]3618-the woman who had told hugh would bring to [the Cloister]286-the cloister a lacerated conscience , and a broken heart .

Surely [the two men who loved [her]3618-the woman who had told hugh , if [they]3625-the two men who loved her , if they thrust away all thought of self , and thought only of her thrust away all thought of self , and thought only of [her]3618-the woman who had told hugh]3625-the two men who loved her , if they thrust away all thought of self , and thought only of her , could save [her]3618-the woman who had told hugh this anguish .

At once [the Bishop]4673-the bishop resolved to do [his]4673-the bishop part .

" [[My]4673-the bishop dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " [you]132-hugh did well to come to [me]4673-the bishop in order to consult over these plans before taking the irrevocable step which should set them in motion . And [I]4673-the bishop shall not be [here]4536-here . [Hugh]132-hugh rose to [his]132-hugh feet and bowed . An immense scorn blazed in [his]132-hugh eyes .

" [[My]132-hugh Lord]4881-my lord [High Cardinal]241-high cardinal , [I]132-hugh congratulate [you]241-high cardinal ! [The Knight]764-the knight paused , amazed . [The Bishop , who seldom laughed aloud]3628-the bishop , who seldom laughed aloud , was laughing . Yet no ! [The Bishop , who never wept]3629-the bishop , who never wept , seemed near to weeping .

The scales fell from [Hugh]132-hugh 's eyes , even before [the Bishop]4673-the bishop spoke . [He]3629-the bishop , who never wept realised a love as great as [his]3629-the bishop , who never wept own .

" Ah , [foolish lad]6924-foolish lad ! "[154-symon of worcester] said [[Symon]154-symon of worcester of [Worcester]1-worcester]5615-symon of worcester ; " bent upon thine own ways , and easy to deceive . " [[My]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , humbly , " forgive the wrong [I]764-the knight did [you]4881-my lord . " True , "[764-the knight] replied [the Knight]764-the knight , " but [I]764-the knight can not feel justified in taking [her]6925-her , and all [she]6925-her would give [me]764-the knight , knowing [she]6925-her gives it , with a free heart , because of [her]6925-her faith in the vision . " To withhold a truth is not to lie , "[4673-the bishop] asserted [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" [[My]132-hugh lord]4881-my lord , "[132-hugh] replied [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent , rising to [his]132-hugh feet and standing erect , [his]132-hugh hand upon [his]132-hugh sword , " [I]132-hugh can not reason of these things ; [I]132-hugh can not define the difference between withholding a truth and stating a lie . But when [mine]132-hugh Honour sounds a challenge , [I]132-hugh hear ; and [I]132-hugh ride out to do battle against [myself]132-hugh , if need be ; or , if it must so be , against another . On [Eastern battle - fields]6938-eastern battle - fields , in Holy War , [I]132-hugh won a name known throughout all [the camp]4567-the camp , known also to [the enemy]6940-the enemy : ' [The Knight of the Silver Shield]6941-the knight of the silver shield . ' [Our]6942-our name is [Argent]242-argent , and [we]6942-our ever have the right to carry a pure silver shield . But [I]132-hugh won the name because [my]132-hugh shield was always bright ; because not once in battle did it fall in the dust ; because it never was allowed to tarnish . So bright it was , that as [I]132-hugh rode , bearing it before [me]132-hugh , reflecting the rays of the sun , it dazzled and blinded [the enemy]6940-the enemy .
