[[My]132-hugh lord]4881-my lord , [I]132-hugh can not tarnish [my]132-hugh silver shield by conniving at falsehood , or keeping silence when [mine]132-hugh [Honour]243-honour bids [me]132-hugh speak . "[132-hugh]

Looking at [the gallant figure before [him]3637-he]3636-the gallant figure before him , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's soul responded to the noble words , and [he]3637-he longed to praise them and applaud . But [he]3637-he thought of [Mora]144-mora 's peace of mind , [Mora]144-mora 's awakened heart and dawning happiness . For [her]144-mora sake [he]3637-he must make a final stand .

" [[My]3637-he dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh , "[3637-he] [he]3637-he said , " all this talk , of a silver shield and of the challenge of honour , is well enough for [the warrior on the battle - field]6946-the warrior on the battle - field . But [the lover]6947-the lover has to learn the harder lesson ; [he]3637-he has to give up [Self]244-self , even the Self which holds honour dear . When [you]4718-my dear polished [your]4718-my dear silver shield , keeping it so bright , what saw [you]4718-my dear reflected therein ? Why , [your]4718-my dear own proud face . Even so , now , [you]4718-my dear fear the faintest tarnish on [your]4718-my dear sense of honour , but [you]4718-my dear will keep that silver shield bright at [Mora]144-mora 's expense , riding on proudly alone in [your]4718-my dear glory , reflecting the sun , dazzling [all beholders]6948-all beholders , while [[your]4718-my dear wife who loved and trusted [you]4718-my dear , [Mora]144-mora , who told [you]4718-my dear the sweet wonder of [her]144-mora love in words of deepest tenderness , lies desolate in the dark , with a shattered life , and a broken heart]6949-your wife who loved and trusted you , mora , who told you the sweet wonder of her love in words of deepest tenderness , lies desolate in the dark , with a shattered life , and a broken heart . [Hugh]132-hugh , [I]3637-he would have [you]4718-my dear think of the treasure of [her]144-mora golden heart , rather than of the brightness of [your]4718-my dear own selfish , silver shield . "[3637-he]

" Selfish ! "[764-the knight] cried [the Knight]764-the knight . " Selfish ! Is it selfish to hold honour dear ? Is it selfish to be ashamed to deceive [the woman one loves]6950-the woman one loves ? Have [I]764-the knight , who have so striven in all things to put [her]144-mora welfare first , been selfish towards [[my]764-the knight wife]4532-my wife in this hour of crisis ? "[764-the knight]

[He]764-the knight sat down , heavily ; leaned [his]764-the knight elbows on [his]764-the knight knees , and dropped [his]764-the knight head into [his]764-the knight hands .

This attitude of utter dejection filled [the Bishop]4673-the bishop with thankfulness . Was [he]764-the knight , in the very moment when [he]764-the knight had given up all hope of winning , about to prove [the victor]3641-the victor ?

" Perilously selfish , [[my]764-the knight dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh , "[764-the knight] [he]764-the knight said . " But , thank [Heaven]142-heaven , no harm has yet been done . Listen to [me]764-the knight and [I]764-the knight will shew [you]132-hugh how [you]132-hugh may keep [your]132-hugh honour safely untarnished , yet withhold from [Mora]144-mora all knowledge which might cause [her]144-mora disquietude of mind , thus securing [her]144-mora happiness and [your]132-hugh own . "[764-the knight]

[CHAPTER LI

TWO NOBLE HEARTS]245-chapter li two noble hearts GO DIFFERENT WAYS

On that same afternoon , an hour before sunset , [the two men who loved [Mora]144-mora]3642-the two men who loved mora faced [one another]666-one another , for a final farewell . [The Bishop]4673-the bishop had said all [he]4673-the bishop had to say . Without interruption , [his]4673-the bishop words had flowed steadily on ; eloquent , logical , conciliatory , persuasive .

At first [he]4673-the bishop had talked to the top of [the Knight]764-the knight 's head , to the clenched hands , to the arms outstretched across the table .

[He]4673-the bishop had wondered what thoughts were at work beneath the crisp thickness of that dark hair . [He]4673-the bishop had wished the rigid attitude of tense despair might somewhat relax . [He]4673-the bishop had used the most telling inflexions of [his]4673-the bishop persuasive voice in order to bring this about , but without success . [He]4673-the bishop had wished [the Knight]764-the knight would break silence , even to rage or to disagree . To that end [he]4673-the bishop had cast as [a bait]3647-a bait an intentional slip in a statement of facts ; and , later on , a palpable false deduction in a weighty argument . But [the Knight]764-the knight had not risen to either .

After a while [Hugh]132-hugh had lifted [his]132-hugh head , and leaned back in [his]132-hugh chair ; fixing [his]132-hugh eyes , in [his]132-hugh turn , upon the banner hanging from the rafters .

It had ceased to wave gently to and fro . [Probably Father Benedict]180-father benedict had closed the trap - door , concealed behind an upright beam , through which [he]4673-the bishop was wo nt to peer down into [the banqueting hall below]3649-the banqueting hall below , in order to satisfy [himself]4673-the bishop that all was well and that [the Reverend Father]5052-the reverend father needed naught .

Let it be here recorded that this exceeding vigilance , on the part of [Father Benedict]180-father benedict , met with but scant reward . For , having deduced a draught , and its reason , from the slight stirring of the banner during [his]4673-the bishop conversation with [the Knight]764-the knight , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop gave certain secret instructions to [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , with the result that the next time [the Chaplain]1334-the chaplain peered down upon [a private conference]3654-a private conference [he]1334-the chaplain found , at [its]3654-a private conference close , the door by which [he]1334-the chaplain had gained access to [the roof chamber]3655-the roof chamber barred on the outside , and , forcing it , [he]1334-the chaplain was in no better case , the ladder which connected [it]3654-a private conference with another disused chamber below having been removed . Thereafter [Father Benedict]180-father benedict watched [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , and [[his]4673-the bishop guest]1405-his guest , partake of three meals , before [he]180-father benedict could bring [himself]180-father benedict to make known [his]180-father benedict predicament , and beg to be released . And , even then , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop was amazingly slow in locating the place from which issued the agitated voice imploring assistance . [Several brethren]3659-several brethren were summoned to help ; so that quite [a little crowd]3660-a little crowd stood gazing up at the pallid countenance of [Father Benedict]180-father benedict , framed in the trap - door as , lying upon [his]180-father benedict very empty stomach , [he]180-father benedict called down replies to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's questions ; vainly striving to give a plausible reason for the peculiar situation in which [he]180-father benedict was discovered .

But , to return to the interview which brought about this later development .

[The Knight]764-the knight had lifted [his]764-the knight head , yet had still remained silent and impassive .

Where at length [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had paused , awaiting comment of some kind , [Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh , removing [his]132-hugh eyes from the rafters , had asked : " When , [[my]132-hugh lord]4881-my lord , do [you]4673-the bishop propose to meet [the Prioress]373-the prioress , should [[my]132-hugh wife]4532-my wife , upon learning the truth , elect to return to [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery ? "[132-hugh]

Thus had [the Bishop]4673-the bishop been forced to realise that the flow of [his]4673-the bishop eloquence , the ripple of [his]4673-the bishop humour , the strong current of [his]4673-the bishop arguments , the gentle lapping of [his]4673-the bishop tenderness , the breakers of [his]4673-the bishop threats , and the thunderous billows of [his]4673-the bishop denunciations , had alike expended themselves against the rock of [the Knight]764-the knight 's unshakable resolve , and left it standing .

[Whereupon]180-father benedict , in silence , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had risen , and had led the way to [the library]2268-the library .

Here [they]3668-they now faced [one another]666-one another in final farewell .

[Each]415-each knew that [his]415-each loss would be the other 's gain ; [his]415-each gain , the other 's irreparable loss .

Yet , at that moment , each thought only of [Mora]144-mora 's peace of soul . [They]3668-they did but differ in [their]3668-they conception of the way in which that peace might best be preserved and maintained .

" [I]764-the knight must take [her]6957-her cross of office , [[my]764-the knight Lord]4881-my lord [Bishop]92-bishop , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , with decision .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop went to a chest , standing in one corner of [the room]495-the room , opened it , and bent over it , [his]4673-the bishop back to [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent ; then , slipping [his]4673-the bishop hand into [his]4673-the bishop bosom drew therefrom a cross of gold gleaming with emeralds . Shutting down the massive lid of the chest , [he]4673-the bishop returned , and placed the cross in the outstretched hand of [the Knight]764-the knight .

" [I]4673-the bishop entrust it to [you]132-hugh , [[my]4673-the bishop dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh , only on one condition : that it shall without fail return to [me]4673-the bishop in two weeks ' time . Should [you]132-hugh decide to tell [[your]132-hugh wife]4531-your wife the true history of the vision , [I]4673-the bishop must see this cross of office upon [her]4531-your wife breast when [I]4673-the bishop meet [her]4531-your wife riding back to [Worcester]1-worcester , once more [Prioress of [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies]4675-prioress of the white ladies . If , on the other hand , wiser counsel prevails , and [you]132-hugh decide not to tell [her]4531-your wife , [you]132-hugh must , by swift messenger , at once return it to [me]4673-the bishop in a sealed packet . "[4673-the bishop]

" [I]764-the knight shall tell [her]4531-your wife , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight . " If [she]4531-your wife elects to leave [me]764-the knight , [you]132-hugh will see the cross upon [her]4531-your wife breast , [[my]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord . If [she]4531-your wife elects to stay , [you]132-hugh shall receive it by [swift messenger]6964-swift messenger . "[764-the knight]

" [She]4531-your wife will leave [you]764-the knight , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " If [you]764-the knight tell [her]4531-your wife , [she]4531-your wife will leave [you]764-the knight . "[4673-the bishop]

" [She]4531-your wife loves [me]764-the knight , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight ; and [he]764-the knight said it with a tender reverence , and such a look upon [his]764-the knight face , as [a man]4482-a man wears when [he]4482-a man speaks of [his]4482-a man faith in [God]89-god .

" [Hugh]132-hugh , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , sadly ; " [Hugh]132-hugh , [[my]4673-the bishop dear lad]5861-my dear lad , [you]132-hugh have but little experience of the heart of [a nun]412-a nun . The more [she]4531-your wife loves , the more determined will [she]4531-your wife be to leave [you]132-hugh , if [you]132-hugh [yourself]132-hugh give [her]4531-your wife reason to think [her]4531-your wife love unjustified . The very thing which is now a cause of bliss will instantly become a cause for fear . [She]4531-your wife will flee from joy , as all pure hearts flee from sin ; because , owing to [your]132-hugh folly , [her]4531-your wife joy will seem to [her]4531-your wife to be sinful . [[My]4673-the bishop son]5057-my son ! "[4673-the bishop] [the Bishop]4673-the bishop stretched out [his]4673-the bishop hands ; a passion of appeal was in [his]4673-the bishop voice " [God]89-god and [Holy Church]5891-holy church have given [you]132-hugh [[your]132-hugh wife]4531-your wife . If [you]132-hugh tell [her]3682-she this thing , [you]132-hugh will lose [her]3682-she . "[4673-the bishop]

" [I]764-the knight must take with [me]764-the knight the dress [she]3682-she left behind , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , ' so that , should [she]3682-she decide to go , [she]3682-she may ride back fully robed . "[764-the knight]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop went again to the chest , raised the heavy lid , and lifted out the white garments rolled together . At sight of [them]3684-they [both men]1572-both men fell silent , as in presence of the dead ; and [the Knight]764-the knight felt [his]764-the knight heart grow cold with apprehension , as [he]764-the knight received [them]3687-them from [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's hand .

[They]3684-they passed together through the doorway leading to [the river terrace]3689-the river terrace , and so down [the lawn]2475-the lawn , under the arch , and into [the courtyard]775-the courtyard .

There [Brother Philip]160-brother philip waited , mounted , while [another lay - brother]3692-another lay - brother held [the Knight]764-the knight 's horse .

As [they]3684-they came in sight of the horses : " [Philip]160-brother philip will see [you]764-the knight a few miles on [your]764-the knight way , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop .

" [I]764-the knight thank [you]4673-the bishop , [Father]180-father benedict , "[764-the knight] replied [the Knight]764-the knight , " but it is not needful . [The good Brother]5272-the good brother has had many long days in the saddle . "[764-the knight]

" It is most needful , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " Let [Philip]160-brother philip ride beside [you]764-the knight until [you]764-the knight have passed through [the Monk 's Wood]75-the monk 's wood , and are well on to the open ground beyond . There , if [you]764-the knight will , [you]764-the knight may bid [him]160-brother philip turn back . "[4673-the bishop]

" Is this to ensure the safety of [the Worcester cut - throats]6971-the worcester cut - throats , [[my]764-the knight lord]4881-my lord ? "[764-the knight]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop smiled .

" Possibly , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said . " [Saracens]134-the saracens may be hewn in pieces , with impunity . But [we]6973-we can not allow [[our]6973-we Worcester lads]6974-our worcester lads rashly to ride to such a fate . Also , [[my]4673-the bishop dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh , [you]132-hugh carry things of so great value that [we]6973-we must not risk a scuffle . These are troublous times , and dangers lurk around [the city]1177-the city . Three miles from [here]4536-here [you]132-hugh may dismiss [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , and ride forward alone . "[4673-the bishop]

Arrived at the horses , [the Knight]764-the knight put away safely , that which [he]764-the knight carried , into [his]764-the knight saddle - bag . Then [he]764-the knight dropped on one knee , baring [his]764-the knight head for the [Bishop]92-bishop 's blessing .

[Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester gave it . Then , bending , added in low tones : " And may [God]89-god and [the blessed Saints]6978-the blessed saints aid [thee]154-symon of worcester to a right judgment in all things . "[764-the knight]

" Amen , "[132-hugh] said [Hugh d'Argent]132-hugh , and kissed [the Bishop]92-bishop 's ring .

Then [he]764-the knight mounted ; and , without one backward look , rode out through the Palace gates , closely followed by [Brother Philip]160-brother philip . CHAPTER LII

[THE ANGEL - CHILD]3699-the angel - child

[Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester turned , walked slowly across [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , made [his]154-symon of worcester way to [the parapet above [the river]1941-the river]3701-the parapet above the river , and stood long , with bent head , watching the rapid flow of [the Severn]58-the severn .

[His]154-symon of worcester eyes rested upon [the very place where [the Knight]764-the knight had cleft the water in [his]764-the knight impulsive dive]3703-the very place where the knight had cleft the water in his impulsive dive after the white stone , made , by [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's own words , to stand to [him]154-symon of worcester for [his]154-symon of worcester chances of winning [the Prioress]373-the prioress . Yet should that sudden leap be described as " impulsive "[92-bishop] ? [The Bishop]92-bishop , ever [a stickler for accuracy in descriptive words]3707-a stickler for accuracy in descriptive words , considered this .

Nay , not so much " impulsive "[92-bishop] as " prompt . "[92-bishop] Even as [the warrior who , having tested [his]764-the knight trusty sword , knowing its readiness in the scabbard and the strength of [his]764-the knight own right arm , draws , on the instant , when surprised by [the enemy]6940-the enemy]3708-the warrior who , having tested his trusty sword , knowing its readiness in the scabbard and the strength of his own right arm , draws , on the instant , when surprised by the enemy . Prompt , not impulsive . A swift action , based upon an assured certainty of power , and a steadfast determination , of long standing , to win at all costs .

[The Bishop]92-bishop 's hand rested upon the parapet . The stone in [his]92-bishop ring held neither blue nor purple lights . Its colour had paled and faded . It shone as [the Prioress]373-the prioress had once seen it shine like a large tear - drop on the [Bishop]92-bishop 's finger .

Deep dejection was in the [Bishop]92-bishop 's attitude . With the riding away of [the Knight]764-the knight , something strong and vital seemed to have passed out of [his]92-bishop life .

A sense of failure oppressed [him]92-bishop . [He]92-bishop had not succeeded in bending [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent to [his]92-bishop will , neither had [he]92-bishop risen to a frank appreciation of the loyal chivalry which would not enjoy happiness at the expense of honour .

While [his]92-bishop mind refused to accept [the Knight]764-the knight 's code , [his]92-bishop soul yearned to rise up and acclaim it .

Yet , working to the last for [Mora]144-mora 's peace of mind , [he]92-bishop had maintained [his]92-bishop tone of scornful disapproval .

[He]92-bishop would never again have the chance to cry " Hail ! "[92-bishop] to the Silver Shield . The deft fingers of [[his]92-bishop sophistry]3713-his sophistry had striven to loosen [the Knight]764-the knight 's shining armour . How far [they]3715-they had succeeded , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop could not tell . But , as [he]4673-the bishop watched [the swiftly moving river]3717-the swiftly moving river , [he]4673-the bishop found [himself]4673-the bishop wishing that [his]4673-the bishop task had been to strengthen , rather than to weaken ; to gird up and brace , rather than subtly to unbuckle and disarm . Yet by so doing , would [he]4673-the bishop not have been ensuring [his]4673-the bishop own happiness , bringing back the joy of life to [his]4673-the bishop own heart , at the expense of the two whom [he]4673-the bishop had given to be each other 's in the Name of [the Divine Trinity]3718-the divine trinity ?

If [Hugh]132-hugh persisted in [his]132-hugh folly , [he]132-hugh would lose [[his]132-hugh bride]4744-his bride , yet would [the Bishop]4673-the bishop meet and reinstate [the Prioress]373-the prioress with a clear conscience , having striven to the very last to dissuade [the Knight]764-the knight .

If , on the other hand , [Hugh]132-hugh , growing wiser as [he]132-hugh rode northward , decided to keep silence , why then [the sunny land]2544-the sunny land [he]132-hugh loved , and [[the Cardinal]5398-the cardinal 's office]3725-the cardinal 's office , for [Symon]154-symon of worcester , [Bishop of [Worcester]1-worcester]1222-bishop of worcester .

But meanwhile , two weeks of uncertainty ; and [the Bishop]4673-the bishop could not abide uncertainty .

[He]4673-the bishop turned from [the river]1941-the river and began to pace [the lawn]2475-the lawn slowly from end to end , [his]4673-the bishop head bent , [his]4673-the bishop hands clasped behind [him]4673-the bishop .

Each time [he]4673-the bishop reached the wall between [the garden]358-the garden and [the courtyard]775-the courtyard , [he]4673-the bishop found [himself]4673-the bishop confronted by two rose trees , a red and a white , climbing so near together that their branches intertwined , crimson blooms resting their rich petals against the fragrant fairness of [their]3732-their white neighbours .

Presently these roses became symbolic to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop the white , of the fair presence of [the Prioress]373-the prioress ; the red , of the high honour awaiting [him]4673-the bishop in [Rome]37-rome .

[He]4673-the bishop was seized by the whimsical idea that , were [he]4673-the bishop to close [his]4673-the bishop eyes , beseech the blessed [Saint Joseph]190-saint joseph to guide [his]4673-the bishop hand , take three steps forward , and pluck the first blossom [his]4673-the bishop fingers touched , [he]4673-the bishop might put an end to this tiresome uncertainty .

But [he]4673-the bishop smiled at the childishness of the fancy . It savoured of [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony , playing with [her]264-the old lay - sister peas and confiding in [her]264-the old lay - sister robin . Moreover [the Bishop]4673-the bishop never did anything with [his]4673-the bishop eyes shut . [He]4673-the bishop would have slept with them open , had not [Nature]246-nature decreed otherwise .

Once again [he]4673-the bishop paced the full length of [the lawn]2475-the lawn , [his]4673-the bishop hands clasped behind [his]4673-the bishop back , [his]4673-the bishop eyes looking beyond [the river]1941-the river to [the distant hills]5396-the distant hills .

" Will [she]3741-a little maiden come , or shall [I]4673-the bishop go ? Shall [I]4673-the bishop depart , or will [she]3741-a little maiden return ? "[4673-the bishop]

As [he]4673-the bishop turned at [the parapet]363-the parapet , a voice seemed to whisper with insistence : " A white rose for [her]3741-a little maiden pure presence in [the Cloister]286-the cloister . A red rose for [Rome]37-rome . "[3741-a little maiden] And , as [he]4673-the bishop reached the wall again , the bright eyes of [a little maiden]3741-a little maiden peeped at [him]4673-the bishop through the archway .

[He]4673-the bishop stood quite still and looked at [her]3741-a little maiden .

Never had [he]4673-the bishop seen so lovely [an elf]3742-an elf . A sunbeam had made its home in each lock of [her]3741-a little maiden tumbled hair . [Her]3741-a little maiden little brown face had the soft bloom of a ripe nectarine ; [her]3741-a little maiden eyes , the timid glance of a startled fawn .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop smiled .

The bright eyes lost their look of fear , and sparkled responsive .

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop beckoned .

[The little maid]3745-the little maid stole through the archway ; then , gaining courage flew over the turf , and stood between [the Bishop]4673-the bishop and the roses .

" How camest [thou]3745-the little maid here , [[my]154-symon of worcester little one]6980-my little one ? "[154-symon of worcester] questioned [Symon of Worcester]154-symon of worcester , in [his]154-symon of worcester softest tones .

" The big gate stood open , [sir]6981-sir , and [I]154-symon of worcester ran in . "[154-symon of worcester]

" And what is [thy]3745-the little maid name , [[my]154-symon of worcester little maid]6982-my little maid ? "[154-symon of worcester]

" [Verity]247-verity , "[3747-the child] whispered [the child]3747-the child , shyly , blushing to speak [her]3747-the child own name .

" Ah , "[4673-the bishop] murmured [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " Hath Truth indeed come in at [my]4673-the bishop open gate ? "[4673-the bishop]

Then , smiling into the little face lifted so confidingly to [his]4673-the bishop : " Dost [thou]3745-the little maid want something , [Angel - child]6983-angel - child , that [I]154-symon of worcester can give [thee]3745-the little maid ? "[154-symon of worcester]

One little bare , brown foot rubbed itself nervously over the other . Five little brown , bare toes wriggled themselves into the grass . " Be not afraid , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " Ask what [thou]3745-the little maid wilt and [I]4673-the bishop will give it [thee]3745-the little maid , unto the half of [[my]4673-the bishop kingdom]6984-my kingdom . [Yea]3745-the little maid , even the head of [Father Benedict]180-father benedict , in a charger . "[4673-the bishop]

" A rose , "[3747-the child] said [the child]3747-the child , eagerly ignoring the proffered head of [Father Benedict]180-father benedict and half [[the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's kingdom]3752-the bishop 's kingdom . " A rose from that lovely tree ! [Their]6985-their pretty faces looked at [me]92-bishop over the wall . "[92-bishop] [The Bishop]92-bishop 's lips still smiled ; but [his]92-bishop eyes , of a sudden , grew grave .

" [Blessed Saint Joseph]190-saint joseph ! "[92-bishop] [he]92-bishop murmured beneath [his]92-bishop breath , and crossed [himself]92-bishop .

Then , bending over [the little maid]3745-the little maid , [he]92-bishop laid [his]92-bishop hand upon the tumbled curls .

" Truly , [[my]92-bishop little [Verity]247-verity]6986-my little verity , "[92-bishop] [he]92-bishop said , " [thou]6987-thou shalt gather [thyself]6987-thou a rose , and [thou]6987-thou shall gather one for [me]92-bishop . [I]92-bishop leave [thee]6987-thou free to make [thy]6987-thou choice . See ! [I]92-bishop clasp [my]92-bishop hands behind [me]92-bishop thus . Then [I]92-bishop shall turn and walk slowly up [the lawn]2475-the lawn . So soon as [my]92-bishop back is turned , pluck [thou]6987-thou two roses . Fly with those little brown feet after [me]92-bishop , and place one of the roses whichever [thou]6987-thou wilt in [my]92-bishop hands . Then run [home]305-home [thyself]6987-thou , with the other . Farewell , [little Angel - child]6990-little angel - child . May the blessing of [[Bethlehem]248-bethlehem 's purple hills]6991-bethlehem 's purple hills be ever thine . "[92-bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop turned and paced slowly up [the lawn]2475-the lawn , head bent , hands clasped behind [him]4673-the bishop .

The small bare feet made no sound on the turf . But before [the Bishop]92-bishop was half - way across [the lawn]2475-the lawn , the stem of a rose was thrust between [his]92-bishop fingers . As they closed over it , a gay ripple of laughter sounded behind [him]92-bishop , fading fleetly into the distance .

[The Angel - child]3699-the angel - child had made [her]3699-the angel - child choice , and had flown with [her]3699-the angel - child own rose , leaving [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's destiny in [his]92-bishop clasped hands .

Without pausing or looking round , [he]92-bishop paced onward , gazing for a while at [the sparkling water]3759-the sparkling water ; then beyond it , to [the distant woods through which [the Knight]764-the knight was riding]3760-the distant woods through which the knight was riding .

Presently [he]92-bishop turned , still with [his]92-bishop hands behind [him]92-bishop , passed to the garden - door , left standing wide , and entered [the library]2268-the library .

But not until [he]92-bishop kneeled before [the shrine of [Saint Joseph]190-saint joseph]3153-the shrine of saint joseph did [he]92-bishop move forward [his]92-bishop right hand , and bring into view the rose placed therein by [Verity]247-verity .

It was many years since [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had wept . [He]92-bishop had not thought ever to weep again . Yet , at sight of the rose , plucked for [him]92-bishop by [the Angel - child]3699-the angel - child , something gave way within [him]92-bishop , and [he]92-bishop fell to weeping helplessly .

[Saint Joseph]190-saint joseph , bearded and stalwart , seemed to look down with compassion upon the bowed head with its abundant silvery hair .

Even thus , it may be , had [he]92-bishop [himself]92-bishop wept when , after [his]92-bishop time of hard mental torture , [the Angel of the Lord]3766-the angel of the lord appeared unto [him]92-bishop , saying : " Fear not . "[3766-the angel of the lord]

After a while [the Bishop]4673-the bishop left [the shrine]1134-the shrine , went over to the deed chest , and laid the rose beside the white stone .

" There , [[my]4673-the bishop dear]4718-my dear [Hugh]132-hugh , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop murmured ; " [thy]190-saint joseph stone , and [my]4673-the bishop rose . Truly they look well together . Each represents the triumph of firm resolve . Yet [mine]4673-the bishop will shortly fade and pass away ; while thine , [dear lad]5112-dear lad , will abide forever . "[4673-the bishop]

[The Bishop]4673-the bishop seated [himself]4673-the bishop at [his]4673-the bishop table , and sounded the silver gong .

[A lay - brother]3770-a lay - brother appeared .

" Benedicite , "[4673-the bishop] said [the Bishop]4673-the bishop . " Request [Fra Andrea Filippo]249-fra andrea filippo at once to come hither . [I]4673-the bishop must have speech with [him]249-fra andrea filippo , without delay . "[4673-the bishop]

CHAPTER LIII

ON [THE HOLY MOUNT]76-the holy mount

On the ninth day since [Hugh]132-hugh 's departure , the day when fast riding might make [his]132-hugh return possible before nightfall , [Mora]144-mora rose early .

At the hour when [she]144-mora had been wo nt to ring the Convent bell , [she]144-mora was walking swiftly over [the moors]4601-the moors and climbing [the heather - clad hills]3773-the heather - clad hills .

[She]144-mora had remembered [a little chapel]3774-a little chapel , high up in [the mountains]4420-the mountains , where dwelt [a holy Hermit]3776-a holy hermit , held in high repute for [his]3776-a holy hermit saintliness of life , [his]3776-a holy hermit wisdom in the giving of spiritual counsel , and [his]3776-a holy hermit skill in ministering to [the sick]3777-the sick .

It had come to [Mora]144-mora , as [she]144-mora prayed and pondered during the night , that if [she]144-mora could make full confession to [this holy man]3778-this holy man , [he]3778-this holy man might be able to throw some clear beam of light upon the dark tangle of [her]144-mora perplexity .

This hope was strongly with [her]144-mora as [she]144-mora walked .

" Lighten [my]144-mora darkness ! Lead [me]144-mora in [a plain path]6994-a plain path ! "[144-mora] was the cry of [her]144-mora bewildered soul .

It seemed to [her]144-mora that [she]144-mora had two issues to consider . First : the question as to whether [Hugh]132-hugh , guided by [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , would keep silence ; thus making [himself]132-hugh a party to [her]144-mora deception . Secondly : the position in which [she]144-mora was placed by the fact that [she]144-mora had left [the Convent]328-the convent , owing to that deception . But , for the moment the first issue was so infinitely the greater , that [she]144-mora found [herself]144-mora thrusting the second into the background , allowing [herself]144-mora to be conscious of it merely as a question to be faced later on , when the all - important point of [Hugh]132-hugh 's attitude in the matter should be settled .

[She]144-mora walked forward swiftly , one idea alone possessing [her]144-mora : that [she]144-mora hastened toward possible help .

[She]144-mora did not slacken speed until [the chapel]5170-the chapel came into view , [its]5170-the chapel grey walls glistening in the morning light , a clump of feathery rowan trees beside [it]5170-the chapel ; at [its]5170-the chapel back a mighty rock , flung down in bygone centuries from [the mountain which towered behind [it]5170-the chapel]3782-the mountain which towered behind it . From a deep cleft in this rock sprang a young oak , dipping its fresh green to the roof of [the chapel]5170-the chapel ; all around [it]5170-the chapel , in every crack and cranny , parsley fern , hare - bells on delicate , swaying stalks , foxgloves tall and straight , and glorious bunches of purpling heather .

Nearby was [the humble dwelling of [the Hermit]3785-the hermit]3784-the humble dwelling of the hermit . The door stood ajar .

Softly approaching , [Mora]144-mora lifted [her]144-mora hand , and knocked .

[No voice]3786-no voice replied .

The sound of [her]144-mora knock did but make evident the presence of a vast solitude .

Pushing open the door , [she]144-mora ventured to look within .

[[The Hermit]3785-the hermit 's cell]3788-the hermit 's cell was empty . The remains of a frugal meal lay upon the rough wooden table . Also an open breviary , much thumbed and worn . At the further end of the table , a little pile of medicinal herbs heaped as if shaken hastily from the wallet which lay beside [them]3789-them . Probably [the holy man]3790-the holy man , even while at an early hour [he]3790-the holy man broke [his]3790-the holy man fast , had been called to [some sick bedside]3791-some sick bedside .

[Mora]144-mora turned from the doorway and , shading [her]144-mora eyes , scanned [the landscape]2961-the landscape .

At first [she]144-mora could see only sheep , slowly moving from tuft to tuft as [they]3793-they nibbled the short grass ; or goats , jumping from rock to rock , and suddenly disappearing in the high bracken .

But soon , on [a distant ridge]3794-a distant ridge , [she]144-mora perceived [two figures]3795-two figures and presently made out the brown robe and hood of [the Hermit]3785-the hermit , and [a little , barefoot peasant boy]3797-a little , barefoot peasant boy , running to keep up with [his]3797-a little , barefoot peasant boy rapid stride . [They]3795-two figures vanished over [the crest of [the hill]1925-the hill]3798-the crest of the hill , and [Mora]144-mora alone in [this wild solitude]3800-this wild solitude realised that many hours might elapse ere [the Hermit]3785-the hermit returned .

This check to the fulfilment of [her]144-mora purpose , instead of disappointing [her]144-mora , flooded [her]144-mora heart with a sudden sense of relief .

The interior of [[the Hermit]3785-the hermit 's cell]3788-the hermit 's cell had recalled , so vividly , the austerities of the cloistered life .

[The Hermit]250-the hermit 's point of view would probably have been so completely from within .

It would have been impossible that [he]250-the hermit should comprehend the wonder the growing wonder of these days , since [she]144-mora and [Hugh]132-hugh rode away from [Warwick]32-warwick , culminating in that exquisite hour on the battlements when [she]144-mora had told [him]250-the hermit of the vision , whispered [her]144-mora full surrender , and yet [he]250-the hermit faithful and patient even then had touched [her]144-mora only with [his]250-the hermit glowing eyes .

How could [a holy Hermit]3776-a holy hermit , dwelling alone among [great silent hills]3805-great silent hills , realise the tremendous force of a strong mutual love , the glow , the gladness , the deep , sweet unrest , the call of soul to soul , the throb of hearts , filling the purple night with the soft beat of angels ' wings ?

How could [a holy Hermit]3776-a holy hermit understand the shock to [Hugh]132-hugh , how fathom the maddening torment of suspense , the abyss of hope deferred , into which [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's letter must have plunged [him]250-the hermit , coming so soon after [he]250-the hermit had said : " [I]250-the hermit ask no higher joy , than to watch the breaking of the day which gives [thee]144-mora to [[my]250-the hermit home]4615-my home "[250-the hermit] ? But the breaking of the day had brought the stern necessity which took [him]250-the hermit from [her]144-mora .

Yet why ? How much was in that second letter ? Was it less detailed than the first ? Had [Hugh]132-hugh ridden [south]3808-south to learn the entire truth ? Or had [he]132-hugh ridden south to arrange with [the Bishop]4673-the bishop for [her]144-mora complete and permanent deception ?

Standing on [this mountain plateau]3810-this mountain plateau the morning breeze blowing about [her]144-mora , the sun mounting triumphant in the heavens " as [a bridegroom]6996-a bridegroom coming out of [[his]6996-a bridegroom chamber]2387-his chamber , "[132-hugh] and all around the scent of heather , the hum of bees , the joyful trill of the soaring lark ; [her]144-mora own body bounding with life after the swift climb it seemed to [Mora]144-mora impossible that [Hugh]132-hugh should withstand the temptation to hold to [his]132-hugh happiness , at all costs . And how could [a saintly Hermit]3811-a saintly hermit judge [him]132-hugh as mercifully as [she]144-mora [the woman who loved [him]132-hugh]3812-the woman who loved him knew that [he]132-hugh should be judged ?

[She]144-mora felt thankful for [the good man]3813-the good man 's absence , yet baffled in [her]144-mora need for help .

Looking back toward [the humble dwelling]3814-the humble dwelling , [she]144-mora perceived a rough device of carved lettering on a beam over the doorway . [She]144-mora made out Latin words , and going nearer [she]144-mora , who for years had worked so continuously at copying and translating , read them without difficulty .

" WITH [HIM]132-hugh , IN [THE HOLY MOUNT]6998-the holy mount , "[144-mora] was inscribed across the doorway of [[the Hermit]3785-the hermit 's dwelling]3816-the hermit 's dwelling . [Mora]144-mora repeated the words , and again repeated them ; and , as [she]144-mora did so there stole over [her]144-mora the sense of an Unseen Presence in this solitude .

" With [Him]132-hugh , in [the Holy Mount]77-the holy mount . "[144-mora]

[She]144-mora turned to [the chapel]5170-the chapel . Over that doorway also were carven letters . Moving closer , [she]144-mora looked up and read them . " AND WHEN [THEY]6999-they HAD LIFTED UP [THEIR]6999-they EYES , [THEY]6999-they SAW [NO MAN]4683-no man , SAVE JESUS ONLY . "[144-mora]

[Mora]144-mora opened the door and entered [the tiny chapel]3818-the tiny chapel . At first , coming in from the outer brightness it seemed dark ; but [she]144-mora had left the door standing wide , and light poured in behind [her]144-mora .

Then [she]144-mora lifted up [her]144-mora eyes and saw ; and seeing , understood the meaning of the legend above the entrance .

In [that little chapel]3819-that little chapel was one Figure , and [one Figure]3820-one figure only . [No pictured saints]3821-no pictured saints were [there]333-there . No image of [[our]3823-our Lady]4260-our lady . No crucifix hung on the wall .

But , in a niche above the altar , stood [a wondrous figure of the Christ]3825-a wondrous figure of the christ ; [not dying , not dead]3826-not dying , not dead ; not glorified and ascending ; but [the Christ as very man , walking the earth in human form , yet calmly , unmistakably , triumphantly Divine]3827-the christ as very man , walking the earth in human form , yet calmly , unmistakably , triumphantly divine . The marble form was carved by the same hand as the Madonna which [the Bishop]4673-the bishop had brought from [Rome]37-rome , and placed in [[Mora]144-mora 's cell at [the Convent]328-the convent]3829-mora 's cell at the convent . It had been [his]4673-the bishop gift to [[his]4673-the bishop old friend]3831-his old friend [the Hermit]250-the hermit . At first sight of it , [Mora]144-mora remembered hearing it described by [the Bishop]4673-the bishop [himself]4673-the bishop . Then the beauty of the sculpture took hold upon [her]144-mora , and [she]144-mora forgot all else .

It lived ! The face wore a look of searching tenderness ; on the lips , a smile of loving comprehension ; in the out - stretched hands , an attitude of infinite compassion .

[Mora]144-mora fell upon [her]144-mora knees . Instinctively [she]144-mora recalled the earnest injunction of [Father Gervaise]185-father gervaise to [[his]185-father gervaise penitents]5548-his penitents that , when kneeling before the crucifix , [they]5548-his penitents should repeat : " [He]185-father gervaise ever liveth to make intercession for [us]5548-his penitents . "[5548-his penitents] And , strangely enough , there came back with this the remembrance of the wild voice of [Mary Seraphine]102-sister seraphine , shrieking , when told to contemplate [the dying Redeemer]5549-the dying redeemer : " [I]102-sister seraphine want life not death ! "[102-sister seraphine]

Here was Life indeed ! Here was [the Saviour of [the world]389-the world]3835-the saviour of the world , in mortal guise , the Word made manifest .

[Mora]144-mora lifted [her]144-mora eyes and read the words , illumined in letters of gold around the arch of the niche , gleaming in the sunlight above the patient head of [the Man Divine]3837-the man divine .

" IN ALL POINTS TEMPTED LIKE AS [WE]5548-his penitents ARE , YET WITHOUT SIN . "[144-mora]

And higher still , above the arch :

" [A GREAT HIGH PRIEST]7001-a great high priest . . . . PASSED INTO [THE HEAVENS]78-the heavens . "[144-mora]

In the silence and stillness of that utter solitude , [she]144-mora who had so lately been [Prioress of the White Ladies]4675-prioress of the white ladies kneeled and worshipped .

[The Unseen Presence]79-the unseen presence drew nearer .

[She]144-mora closed [her]144-mora eyes to the sculptured form .

The touch of [[her]144-mora Lord]6237-her lord was upon [her]144-mora heart .

[She]144-mora had prayed in [[her]144-mora cell]321-her cell that [His]3841-his pierced feet nailed to the wood might become as dear to [her]144-mora as the Baby feet on [the Virgin Mother]488-the virgin mother 's knees . In [her]144-mora anguish of cloistered sorrow , that prayer had been granted .

But out in [the world of]3843-the world of [living men]3844-living men and things , [she]144-mora needed more . [She]144-mora needed Feet that walked and moved , passed in and out of [house]5623-house and [home]305-home ; paused by the hearth ; went to the wedding feast ; moved to [the fresh closed grave]3847-the fresh closed grave ; Feet that had sampled the dust of life 's highway ; Feet that had trod rough places , yet never tripped nor stumbled .

" Tempted in all points . "[132-hugh] . . . Then here was One Who could understand [Hugh]132-hugh 's hard temptation ; Who could pity , if [Hugh]132-hugh fell . Here was [One Who would comprehend the breaking of [her]144-mora poor human heart]3848-one who would comprehend the breaking of her poor human heart if , loving [Hugh]132-hugh as [she]144-mora now loved , [she]144-mora yet must leave [him]132-hugh .

" [A great High Priest]7001-a great high priest . "[3848-one who would comprehend the breaking of her poor human heart] . . . What need of [any other priest]3849-any other priest , while " with [Him]132-hugh in [the Holy Mount]77-the holy mount "[3848-one who would comprehend the breaking of her poor human heart] ? Passed into [the heavens]3850-the heavens , yet ever living to make intercession for [us]3851-us .

Deep peace stole into [her]144-mora heart , as [she]144-mora knelt in absorbed communion in this sacred place , where , for the first time , in [her]144-mora religious life , [she]144-mora had found [herself]144-mora with " Jesus only . "[144-mora]

" Ah , [blessed Lord]7003-blessed lord ! "[144-mora] [she]144-mora cried at length , " [[Thou]7004-thou Who knowest the heart of [a man]4482-a man]7005-thou who knowest the heart of a man , and canst divine the heart of [a woman]813-a woman , grant unto [me]144-mora this day a true vision ; a vision which shall make clear to [me]144-mora , without any possibility of doubt , what is [Thy]7004-thou will for [me]144-mora . "[144-mora]

CHAPTER LIV

THE UNSEEN PRESENCE

[The world]389-the world was [a new and a wonderful world]3853-a new and a wonderful world as , leaving [the chapel]5170-the chapel , [Mora]144-mora turned [her]144-mora steps homeward . [She]144-mora had been wo nt to regard temptation itself as sinful , but now this sacred fact " in all points tempted like as [we]7008-we are "[144-mora] seemed to sanctify the state of being tempted , providing [she]144-mora could add the three triumphant words : " Yet without sin . "[144-mora]

As [she]144-mora walked , with springy step , down the grassy paths among the heather , [the Unseen Presence]3855-the unseen presence moved beside [her]144-mora .

It seemed strange that [she]144-mora should have found in [the world]389-the world this sweet secret of the Perpetual Presence , which had evaded [her]144-mora in [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery . Often when [her]144-mora duties had taken [her]144-mora elsewhere in [the Convent]328-the convent , or during the walk through the underground way on the return from [the Cathedral]279-the cathedral , or even when walking for refreshment in [the Convent garden]560-the convent garden , [she]144-mora would yearn for the holy stillness of [the chapel]5170-the chapel , or to be back in [[her]144-mora cell]321-her cell that [she]144-mora might kneel at [the shrine of [the Virgin]608-the virgin]823-the shrine of the virgin and there realise the adorable purity of [[our]3865-our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady 's heart ; or , prostrating [herself]144-mora before the crucifix , gaze upon those pierced feet , then slowly lift [her]144-mora eyes to the other sacred wounds , and force [her]144-mora mind to realise and [her]144-mora cold heart to receive the mighty fact that [the Divine Redeemer]3867-the divine redeemer thus hung and suffered for [her]144-mora sins .

Transports of realisation had come to [her]144-mora in [[her]144-mora cell]321-her cell , or when [she]144-mora kept vigil in [the Convent chapel]3869-the convent chapel , or when from the height of [the Cathedral clerestory]3870-the cathedral clerestory [she]144-mora gazed down upon [the High Altar]3871-the high altar , the lighted candles , the swinging censers , and heard the chanting of [the monks]4870-the monks , and the tinkle of the silver bell . But these transports had resulted from [her]144-mora own determination to realise and to respond . The mental effort over , they faded , and [her]144-mora heart had seemed colder than before , [her]144-mora spirit more dead , [her]144-mora mind more prone to apathy . The greater the effort to force [herself]144-mora to apprehend , the more complete had been the reaction of non - realisation .

But now , in this deep wonder of new experience , there was no effort . [She]144-mora had but waited with every inlet of [her]144-mora being open to receive . And now the power was a Real Presence within , revealing an equally Real Presence without . [The Risen Christ]251-the risen christ moved beside [her]144-mora as [she]144-mora walked . [Her]144-mora eyes were no longer holden that [she]144-mora should not know [Him]3873-him , for the promised Presence of [the Paracletos]252-the paracletos filled [her]144-mora , unveiling [her]144-mora spiritual vision , whispering within [her]144-mora glowing heart ; " It is [the Lord]4319-the lord ! "[252-the paracletos]

" Which Voice [we]7010-we heard , "[125-saint peter] wrote [Saint Peter]125-saint peter , " when [we]7010-we were with [Him]3873-him in [the Holy Mount]77-the holy mount . "[125-saint peter] [She]144-mora , too , had first heard it there ; but , as [she]144-mora descended , it was with [her]144-mora still . The songs of the birds , the rush of [the stream]5416-the stream , the breeze in the pines , the bee on the wing , all [Nature]246-nature seemed to say : " It is [the Lord]4319-the lord ! "[246-nature]

Sorrow , suffering , disillusion might await [her]144-mora on [the plain]3875-the plain ; but , with the Presence beside [her]144-mora , and the Voice within , [she]144-mora felt strong to face [them]3876-them , and to overcome .

[Noon]253-noon found [her]144-mora in [[her]144-mora garden]3173-her garden , calm and serene ; yet wondering , with quickening pulses , whether at nightfall or even at sunset , [Hugh]132-hugh would ride in ; and what [she]144-mora must say if , giving some other reason for [his]132-hugh journey to [Worcester]1-worcester , [he]132-hugh deceived [her]144-mora as [others]482-others had deceived ; failed [her]144-mora as [others]482-others had failed .

And wondering thus , [she]144-mora rose and moved with slow step to [the terrace]3259-the terrace .

For a while [she]144-mora stood pondering this hard question , [her]144-mora eyes lifted to [the distant hills]5396-the distant hills .

Then something impelled [her]144-mora to turn and glance into [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall , and there on the spot where [he]132-hugh had knelt that [she]144-mora might bless [him]132-hugh at parting stood [Hugh]132-hugh , [his]132-hugh arms folded , [his]132-hugh eyes fixed upon [her]144-mora , waiting till [she]144-mora should see [him]132-hugh .

CHAPTER LV

THE HEART OF [A WOMAN]813-a woman

For a space , through the casement , [they]3884-they looked into [one another]666-one another 's eyes ; [she]144-mora , standing in the full glory of the summer sunshine , a radiant vision of glowing womanhood ; [he]132-hugh , in the shade of [the banqueting - hall]3886-the banqueting - hall , gaunt and travel - stained , yet in [his]132-hugh eyes the light of that love which never faileth . But , even as [she]144-mora looked , those dark eyes wavered , shifted , turned away , as if [he]132-hugh could not bear any longer to gaze upon [her]144-mora in the sunlight .

An immense pity filled [Mora]144-mora 's heart . [She]144-mora knew [he]132-hugh was going to fail [her]144-mora ; yet the pathos of that failure lay in the fact that it was the very force of [his]132-hugh love which rendered the temptation so insuperable .

Swiftly [she]144-mora passed into [the banqueting hall]1359-the banqueting hall , went to [him]132-hugh where [he]132-hugh stood , put up [her]144-mora arms about [his]132-hugh neck , and lifted [her]144-mora lips to [his]132-hugh .

" [I]144-mora thank [God]89-god , [[my]144-mora beloved]4702-my beloved , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora said , " that [He]132-hugh hath brought [thee]4702-my beloved in safety back to [me]144-mora . "[144-mora]

[Hugh]132-hugh 's arms , flung around [her]144-mora , strained [her]144-mora to [him]132-hugh . But [he]132-hugh kept [his]132-hugh head erect . The muscles of [his]132-hugh neck were like iron bands under [her]144-mora fingers . [She]144-mora could see the cleft in [his]132-hugh chin , the firm curve of [his]132-hugh lips . [His]132-hugh eyes were turned from [her]144-mora .

[She]144-mora longed to say : " [Hugh]132-hugh , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's first letter , lost on its way , [hath]7014-hath reached [my]132-hugh hands . Already [I]132-hugh know the true story of the vision . "[132-hugh]

Yet instead [she]144-mora clung to [his]132-hugh neck , crying : " Kiss [me]144-mora , [Hugh]132-hugh ! Kiss [me]144-mora ! "[144-mora]

[She]144-mora could not rob [[her]144-mora man]5210-her man of [his]132-hugh chance to be faithful . Also , if [he]132-hugh were going to fail [her]144-mora , it were better [he]132-hugh should fail and [she]144-mora know it , than that [she]144-mora should forever have the torment of questioning : " Had [I]144-mora not spoken , would [he]132-hugh have kept silence ? "[144-mora]

Yet , while [he]132-hugh was still [hers]144-mora , [his]132-hugh honour untarnished , [she]144-mora longed for the touch of [his]132-hugh lips .

" Kiss [me]144-mora , "[144-mora] [she]144-mora whispered again , not knowing how ten - fold more hard [she]144-mora thus made it for [him]132-hugh .

But loosing [his]132-hugh arms from around [her]144-mora , [he]132-hugh took [her]144-mora face between [his]132-hugh hands , looking long into [her]144-mora eyes , with such a yearning of hunger , grief , and regret , that [her]144-mora heart stood still . Then , just as , rendered dizzy by [his]132-hugh nearness , [she]144-mora closed [her]144-mora eyes , [she]144-mora felt [his]132-hugh lips upon [her]144-mora own .

For a moment [she]144-mora was conscious of nothing save that [she]144-mora was [his]132-hugh .

Then [her]144-mora mind flew back to the last time [they]3889-they had stood , thus . Again the underground smell of damp earth seemed all about [them]3889-they ; again [her]144-mora heart was torn by love and pity ; again [she]144-mora seemed to see [Hugh]132-hugh , passing up from the darkness into that pearly light which came stealing down from [the crypt]273-the crypt and [she]144-mora realised that this second kiss held also the anguish of parting , rather than the rapture of reunion .

Before [she]144-mora could question the meaning of this , [Hugh]132-hugh released [her]144-mora , gently loosed [her]144-mora hands from about [his]132-hugh neck , and led [her]144-mora to a seat .

Then [he]132-hugh thrust [his]132-hugh hand into [his]132-hugh breast , and when [he]132-hugh drew it forth [she]144-mora saw that [he]132-hugh held something in [his]132-hugh palm , which gleamed as the light fell upon it .

Standing before [her]144-mora , [his]132-hugh eyes bent upon that which lay in [his]132-hugh hand , [Hugh]132-hugh spoke . " [Mora]144-mora , [I]132-hugh have to tell [thee]144-mora a strange tale , which will , [I]132-hugh greatly fear , cause [thee]144-mora much sorrow and perplexity . But first [I]132-hugh would give [thee]144-mora this , sent to [thee]144-mora by [the Bishop]4673-the bishop with [his]4673-the bishop most loving greetings ; who also bids [me]132-hugh say that if , after [my]132-hugh tale is told , [thy]144-mora choice should be to return to [Worcester]1-worcester , [he]4673-the bishop [himself]4673-the bishop will meet [thee]144-mora , and welcome [thee]144-mora , conduct [thee]144-mora to [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery and there reinstate [thee]144-mora [Prioress of [the White Ladies]288-the white ladies]4675-prioress of the white ladies , with due pomp and highest honour . [I]132-hugh tell [thee]3891-her this at once to spare [thee]3891-her all [I]132-hugh can of shock and anguish in the hearing of that which must follow . "[132-hugh]

Kneeling before [her]3891-her , [Hugh]132-hugh laid [her]3891-her jewelled cross of office on [her]3891-her lap .

" [[My]132-hugh wife]4532-my wife , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh said simply , speaking very low , with bent head , " before [I]132-hugh tell [thee]3891-her more [I]132-hugh would have [thee]3891-her know [thyself]3891-her free to go back to the point where first [thy]3891-her course was guided by the vision of [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister , [Mary Antony]85-mary antony . Therefore [I]132-hugh bring [thee]3891-her [thy]3891-her cross of office as [Prioress of the White Ladies]4675-prioress of the white ladies . "[132-hugh]

[She]3891-her laughed aloud , in the great gladness of [her]3891-her relief ; in the rapture of [her]3891-her pride in [him]132-hugh .

" How can [[thy]132-hugh wife]4342-thy wife be [Prioress of the White Ladies]4675-prioress of the white ladies ? "[3891-her] [she]3891-her cried , and caught [his]132-hugh head to [her]3891-her breast , there where the jewelled cross used to lie , raining tears and kisses on [his]132-hugh hair .

For a moment [he]132-hugh yielded , speaking , with [his]132-hugh face pressed against [her]3891-her , words of love beyond [her]3891-her imagining .

Then [he]132-hugh regained control .

" Oh , hush , [[my]132-hugh beloved]4702-my beloved ! "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh said . " Hold [me]132-hugh not ! Let [me]132-hugh go , or [[our]7025-our Lady]4260-our lady knoweth [I]132-hugh shall even now fail in the task which lies before [me]132-hugh . "[132-hugh]

" [[Our]7025-our Lord , Who knoweth the heart of [a man]4482-a man]7027-our lord , who knoweth the heart of a man , "[3891-her] [she]3891-her said , " hath made [[my]3891-her man]7029-my man so strong that [he]7029-my man will not fail . "[3891-her]

But [she]3891-her let [him]132-hugh go ; and rising , [the Knight]764-the knight stood before [her]3891-her .

" The letter brought to [me]132-hugh by [Brother Philip]160-brother philip , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh began , " told [me]132-hugh something of that which [I]132-hugh am about to tell [thee]3891-her . But [I]132-hugh could not speak of it to [thee]3891-her until [I]132-hugh knew it in fullest detail , and had consulted with [the Bishop]4673-the bishop concerning its possible effect upon [thy]3891-her future . Hence [my]132-hugh instant departure to [Worcester]1-worcester . That which [I]132-hugh now shall tell [thee]3891-her , [I]132-hugh had , in each particular , from [the Bishop]4673-the bishop in most secret conversations . [He]4673-the bishop and [I]132-hugh , alone , know of this matter . "[132-hugh]

Then with [his]132-hugh arms folded upon [his]132-hugh breast , [his]132-hugh eye fixed upon [the sunny garden]3893-the sunny garden , beyond the window , deep sorrow , compunction , and , at times , awe in [his]132-hugh voice , [Hugh]132-hugh d'Argent recited the entire history of the pretended vision ; beginning with the hiding of [herself]3894-herself of [old Antony]85-mary antony in [the inner cell]618-the inner cell , [her]3894-herself anxiety concerning [the Reverend Mother]93-the reverend mother , confided to [the Bishop]4673-the bishop ; [his]132-hugh chance remark , resulting in [the old woman]430-the old woman 's cunningly devised plan to cheat [the Prioress]373-the prioress into accepting happiness .

And , as [he]132-hugh told it , the horror of the sacrilege fell as a dark shadow between [them]3899-them , eclipsing even the radiance of [their]3899-them love . Upon which being no longer blinded , [Mora]144-mora clearly perceived the other issue which [she]144-mora was called upon to face : If [[our]3900-our Lady]4260-our lady 's sanction miraculously given to the step [she]430-the old woman had taken in leaving [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery had after all not been given , what justification had [she]430-the old woman for remaining in [the world]389-the world ?

Presently [Hugh]132-hugh reached the scene of the full confession and death of [the old lay - sister]264-the old lay - sister . [He]132-hugh told it with reverent simplicity . None of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's flashes of humour had found any place in [the Knight]764-the knight 's recital .

But now [his]132-hugh voice , of a sudden , fell silent . The tale was told .

[Mora]144-mora had sat throughout leaning forward , [her]144-mora right elbow on [her]144-mora knee , [her]144-mora chin resting in the palm of [her]144-mora right hand ; [her]144-mora left toying with the jewelled cross upon [her]144-mora lap .

Now [she]144-mora looked up .

" [Hugh]132-hugh , [you]132-hugh have made no mention of [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's opinion as regards the effect of this upon [myself]144-mora . Did [he]4673-the bishop advise that [I]144-mora be told the entire truth ? "[144-mora]

[The Knight]764-the knight hesitated .

" Nay , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh admitted at length , seeing that [she]144-mora must have an answer . " [The Bishop]4673-the bishop had , as [you]144-mora indeed know , from the first considered [our]7034-our previous betrothal and [[your]144-mora sister]7035-your sister 's perfidy , sufficient justification for [your]144-mora release from all vows made through that deception . Armed with [the Pope]5391-the pope 's mandate , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop saw no need for a divine manifestation , nor did [he]4673-the bishop , from the first , believe in the vision of [this old lay - sister]7038-this old lay - sister . Yet , knowing [you]144-mora set great store by it , [he]4673-the bishop feared for [your]144-mora peace of mind , should [you]144-mora learn the truth . "[132-hugh]

" Did [he]4673-the bishop command [you]144-mora not to tell [me]132-hugh , [Hugh]132-hugh ? "[132-hugh]

" For love of [you]144-mora , [Mora]144-mora , out of tender regard for [your]144-mora happiness , [the Bishop]4673-the bishop counselled [me]132-hugh not to tell [you]144-mora . "[132-hugh] " [He]4673-the bishop would have had [you]144-mora to become [a party]7040-a party , with [himself]4673-the bishop , and [old Mary Antony]85-mary antony , in [my]132-hugh permanent deception ? "[132-hugh] [Hugh]132-hugh was [a loyal friend]3908-a loyal friend .

" [He]4673-the bishop would have had [me]132-hugh to become [a party]7040-a party , with [himself]4673-the bishop , in securing [your]144-mora permanent peace , [Mora]144-mora , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh said , sternly .

[She]3909-she loved [his]132-hugh sternness . So much did [she]3909-she adore [him]132-hugh for having triumphed where [she]3909-she had made sure that [he]132-hugh would fail , so much did [she]3909-she despise [herself]3909-she for having judged [him]132-hugh so poorly , rated [him]132-hugh so low , that [she]3909-she could have knelt upon the floor and clasped [his]132-hugh feet ! Yet must [she]3909-she strive for wisdom and calmness .

" Then how came [you]132-hugh to tell [me]3909-she , [Hugh]132-hugh , that which might well imperil not only [my]3909-she peace but [your]132-hugh own happiness ? "[3909-she]

" [Mora]144-mora , "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight , " if [I]764-the knight have done wrong , may [[our]7042-our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady pardon [me]764-the knight , and comfort [you]132-hugh . But [I]764-the knight could not take [my]764-the knight happiness knowing that it came to [me]764-the knight by reason of a deception practised upon [you]132-hugh . [Our]7042-our love must have its roots in perfect truthfulness and trust . Also [you]132-hugh and [I]764-the knight had together accepted the vision as divine . [I]764-the knight had kneeled in [your]132-hugh sight and praised [[our]7042-our blessed Lady]4297-our blessed lady for this especial grace vouchsafed on [my]764-the knight behalf . But now , knowing it to have been a sacrilegious fraud , every time [you]132-hugh spoke with joy of the special grace , every time [you]132-hugh blessed [[our]7042-our Lady]4260-our lady for [her]4260-our lady loving - kindness , [I]764-the knight , by [my]764-the knight silence , giving mute assent , should have committed sacrilege afresh . Aye , and in that wondrous moment which [you]132-hugh promised should soon come , when [you]132-hugh would have said : ' Take [me]764-the knight ! [I]764-the knight have been ever thine . [[Our]7042-our Lady]4260-our lady hath kept [me]764-the knight for [thee]132-hugh ! ' [mine]764-the knight honour would have been smirched forever had [I]764-the knight , keeping silence , taken advantage of [thy]132-hugh belief in words which [that old nun]7047-that old nun had [herself]7047-that old nun invented , and put into the mouth of [the blessed Virgin]628-the blessed virgin . [The Bishop]4673-the bishop held [me]764-the knight selfish because [I]764-the knight put [mine]764-the knight honour before [my]764-the knight need of [thee]132-hugh . [He]4673-the bishop said [I]764-the knight saw naught but [mine]764-the knight own proud face , in the bright mirror of [my]764-the knight silver shield . But "[764-the knight] [the Knight]764-the knight held [his]764-the knight right hand aloft , and spoke in solemn tones " methinks [I]764-the knight see there the face of [God]89-god , or the nearest [I]764-the knight know to [His]89-god face ; and , behind [Him]89-god , [I]764-the knight see [thy]132-hugh face , [[mine]764-the knight own beloved]4542-mine own beloved . [I]764-the knight needs must put this , which [I]764-the knight owe to honour and to [our]7051-our mutual trust , before [mine]764-the knight own content , and utter need of [thee]132-hugh . [I]764-the knight should be shamed , did [I]764-the knight do otherwise , to call [thee]132-hugh wife of [mine]764-the knight , to think of [thee]132-hugh as mistress of [[my]764-the knight home]4615-my home , and of [my]764-the knight heart [the Queen]4576-the queen . "[764-the knight]

[Mora]144-mora 's hand had sought [the Bishop]4673-the bishop 's letter ; but now [she]144-mora let it lie concealed . [She]144-mora could not dim the noble triumph of that moment , by any revelation of [her]144-mora previous knowledge . Had [Hugh]132-hugh failed , [she]144-mora must have produced the first letter . [Hugh]132-hugh having proved faithful , it might well wait .

A long silence fell between [them]3913-them . [Mora]144-mora , fingering the cross , looked on it with unseeing eyes . To [Hugh]132-hugh it seemed that this token of [[her]144-mora high office]752-her high office was becoming to [her]144-mora a thing of first importance .

" The dress is also here , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh said .

" What dress ? "[144-mora] [she]144-mora questioned , starting .

[He]132-hugh pointed to where [he]132-hugh had laid it : [her]144-mora white habit , scapulary , wimple , veil and girdle ; the dress of [a Prioress of the Order of the White Ladies]3915-a prioress of the order of the white ladies .

[She]144-mora turned [her]144-mora startled eyes upon it . Then quickly looked away .

" Did [you]132-hugh [yourself]132-hugh think a vision needed , in order that [I]132-hugh might be justified in leaving [the Convent]328-the convent , [Hugh]132-hugh ? "[132-hugh]

" Nay , then , "[132-hugh] [he]132-hugh cried , " always from the first [I]132-hugh held [thee]144-mora mine in the sight of Heaven . "[132-hugh]

" Are [you]132-hugh of opinion that , the vision being proved no vision , [I]132-hugh should go back ? "[132-hugh]

" No ! "[764-the knight] said [the Knight]764-the knight ; and the word fell like a blow from a battle - axe .

" Does [the Bishop]4673-the bishop expect that [I]132-hugh shall return ? "[132-hugh]

" Yes , "[764-the knight] replied [the Knight]764-the knight , groaning within [himself]764-the knight that [she]144-mora should have chanced to change the form of [her]144-mora question .

" [He]4673-the bishop would so expect , "[144-mora] mused [Mora]144-mora . " [He]4673-the bishop would be sure [I]144-mora should return . [He]4673-the bishop remembers [my]144-mora headstrong temper , and [my]144-mora imperious will . [He]4673-the bishop remembers how [I]144-mora tore [the Pope]5391-the pope 's mandate , placing [my]144-mora foot upon it . [He]4673-the bishop knows [I]144-mora said how that naught would suffice [me]144-mora but a divine vision . Also [he]4673-the bishop knoweth well the heart of [a nun]412-a nun ; and when [I]144-mora asked [him]4673-the bishop if the heart of [a nun]412-a nun could ever become as the heart of [other women]6245-other women , [he]4673-the bishop did most piously ejaculate : ' Heaven forbid ? ' "[144-mora]

Little crinkles of merriment showed faintly at the corners of [her]144-mora eyes . [The Bishop]4673-the bishop would have seen them , and smiled responsive . But [the sad Knight]3919-the sad knight saw them not . " [Mora]144-mora , "[4673-the bishop] [he]4673-the bishop said , " [I]4673-the bishop leave [thee]144-mora free . [I]4673-the bishop hold [thee]144-mora to no vows made through falsehood and fraud . [I]4673-the bishop rate [thy]144-mora peace of mind before [mine]4673-the bishop own content ; [thy]144-mora true well - being , before [mine]4673-the bishop own desires . Leaving [thee]144-mora free , dear Heart , [I]4673-the bishop must leave [thee]144-mora free to choose . Loving [thee]144-mora as [I]4673-the bishop love [thee]144-mora , [I]4673-the bishop can not stay here , yet leave [thee]144-mora free . [My]4673-the bishop anguish of suspense would hamper [thee]144-mora . Therefore [I]4673-the bishop purpose now to ride to [[my]4673-the bishop own home]5227-my own home . [Martin]133-martin will ride with [me]4673-the bishop . But tomorrow [he]133-martin will return , to ask if there is a message ; and the next day , and the next . [The Bishop]92-bishop allowed four days for hesitation . If [thy]144-mora decision should be to return to [the Nunnery]397-the nunnery , [his]133-martin command is that [thou]144-mora ride the last stage of the journey fully robed , wearing [thy]144-mora cross of office . [He]133-martin [himself]133-martin will meet [thee]144-mora five miles [this side of [Worcester]1-worcester]7062-this side of worcester , and riding in , with much pomp and ceremony , will announce to [the Community]483-the community that , the higher service to which [[His]133-martin Holiness]5400-his holiness sent [thee]144-mora , being accomplished "[4673-the bishop]

" Accomplished , [Hugh]132-hugh ? "[3921-her]

[The Knight]764-the knight smiled , wearily . " [I]764-the knight quote [the Bishop]4673-the bishop , [Mora]144-mora . [He]4673-the bishop will explain that [he]4673-the bishop now reinstates [thee]144-mora as [Prioress of the Order]7066-prioress of the order . [The entire Community]633-the entire community will , [he]4673-the bishop says , rejoice ; and [he]4673-the bishop [himself]4673-the bishop will be ever at hand to make sure that all is right for [thee]144-mora . "[764-the knight]

" These plans are well and carefully laid , [Hugh]132-hugh . "[3921-her]

" [[They]7068-they who love [thee]144-mora]7069-they who love thee have seen to that , [Mora]144-mora . "[764-the knight]

" Who will ride with [me]3921-her from here to [Worcester]1-worcester ? "[3921-her]

" [Martin Goodfellow]133-martin , and [a little band of [thine own people]7071-thine own people]7070-a little band of thine own people . [A swifter messenger]7072-a swifter messenger will go before to warn [the Bishop]4673-the bishop of [thy]144-mora coming . "[764-the knight]

" And what of [thee]144-mora ? "[3921-her] [she]3921-her asked .

" Of [me]764-the knight ? "[764-the knight] repeated [the Knight]764-the knight , as if at first the words conveyed to [him]764-the knight no meaning . " Oh , [I]764-the knight shall go forth , seeking a worthy cause for which to fight ; praying [God]89-god [I]764-the knight may soon be counted worthy to fall in battle . "[764-the knight]

[She]3921-her pressed [her]3921-her clasped hands there where [his]764-the knight face had rested .

" And if [I]3921-her find [I]3921-her can not go back , [Hugh]132-hugh ? If [I]3921-her decide to stay ? "[3921-her]

[He]764-the knight swung round and looked at [her]3921-her .

" [Mora]144-mora , is there hope ? [The Bishop]4673-the bishop said there was none . "[764-the knight]

" [Hugh]132-hugh , "[3921-her] [she]3921-her made answer slowly , speaking with much earnestness , ' shall [I]0-i not be given a true vision to guide [me]0-i in this perplexity ? " "[3921-her] [[Our]3923-our Lady]4260-our lady grant it , " [he]764-the knight said . "[3921-her] If [you]3921-her decide to stay , one word will bring [me]0-i back . If not , [Mora]144-mora this is [our]3923-our final parting . "[144-mora]

[He]764-the knight took a step toward [her]3921-her .

[She]3921-her covered [her]3921-her face with [her]3921-her hands .

In a moment [his]764-the knight arms would be round [her]3921-her . [She]3921-her could not live through a third of those farewell kisses . [She]3921-her had not yet faced out the second question . But vision or no vision if [he]764-the knight touched [her]3921-her now , [she]3921-her would yield .

" Go ! "[3921-her] [she]3921-her whispered . " Ah , for pity 's sake , go ! The heart of [a nun]412-a nun might endure even this . But [I]3921-her ask [thy]412-a nun mercy for the heart of [a woman]813-a woman ! "[3921-her]

[She]3921-her heard the sob in [his]764-the knight throat , as [he]764-the knight knelt and lifted the hem of [her]3921-her robe to [his]764-the knight lips .

Then [his]764-the knight step across the floor .

Then the ring of horses ' hoofs upon the paving stones .

[She]3921-her was trembling from head to foot , yet [she]3921-her rose and went to the window overlooking [the courtyard]775-the courtyard .

[Mark]206-mary mark was shutting the gates . [Beaumont]232-beaumont held a neglected stirrup cup , and laughed as [he]232-beaumont drained it [himself]232-beaumont . [Zachary]231-zachary , stout and pompous , was mounting the steps .

[Hugh]132-hugh , [[her]3921-her husband]5164-her husband [Hugh]132-hugh , faithful beyond belief [Hugh]132-hugh , [[her]3921-her dear Knight of the Silver Shield]254-her dear knight of the silver shield had ridden off alone , to [the home to which [he]764-the knight so greatly longed to take [her]3921-her]3927-the home to which he so greatly longed to take her ; alone , with [his]764-the knight hopeless love , [his]764-the knight hungry heart , and [his]764-the knight untarnished honour .

Turning from the window [she]3921-her gathered up the habit of [her]3921-her Order and , clasping [her]3921-her cross of office , mounted to [[her]3921-her bedchamber]3928-her bedchamber , there to face out in solitude the hard question of the second issue .

CHAPTER LVI

THE TRUE VISION

To [[her]3921-her bedchamber]3928-her bedchamber went [Mora]144-mora [she]144-mora who had been [Prioress of the White Ladies]4675-prioress of the white ladies bearing in [her]3921-her arms the full robes of [her]3921-her Order , and in [her]3921-her hand the jewelled cross of [[her]3921-her high office]752-her high office . [She]3921-her went , expecting to spend hours in doubt and prayer and question before [the shrine of [the Virgin]608-the virgin]823-the shrine of the virgin . But , as [she]3921-her pushed open the door and entered [the sunlit chamber]3934-the sunlit chamber , on the very threshold [she]3921-her was met by a flash of inward illumination . Surely every question had already been answered ; the second issue had been decided , while the first was yet wholly uncertain .

[She]3921-her had said [she]3921-her must have a divine vision . Had [she]3921-her not this very day been granted a two - fold vision , both human and divine ; [the Divine]5381-the divine , stooping in unspeakable tenderness and comprehension to [the human]3936-the human ; [the Human , upborne on the mighty pinions of pure love and stainless honour]3937-the human , upborne on the mighty pinions of pure love and stainless honour in a self - sacrifice which lifted it to the Divine ?

In [the lonely chapel on [the mountain]3939-the mountain]3938-the lonely chapel on the mountain , [she]3921-her had seen [[her]3921-her Lord]6237-her lord . Not as [the Babe , heralded by angels]3941-the babe , heralded by angels , worshipped by [Eastern shepherds]3942-eastern shepherds , adored by [Gentile kings]3943-gentile kings , throned on [[His]3941-the babe , heralded by angels Mother]1063-his mother 's knee , wise - eyed and God - like , stretching omnipotent baby hands toward this mysterious homage which was [His]3941-the babe , heralded by angels due ; accepting , with baby omniscience , the gold , the frankincense , the myrrh , which typified [His]3941-the babe , heralded by angels mission ; nor as [the Divine Redeemer]3867-the divine redeemer nailed helpless to the cross of shame ; dead , that [the world]389-the world might live . These had been the visions of [her]3921-her cloistered years .

But in [the chapel on [the mountain]3939-the mountain]3947-the chapel on the mountain [she]3921-her had seen [Him]3941-the babe , heralded by angels as [the human Jesus]3949-the human jesus , tempted in all points like as [we]3950-we are , [His]3941-the babe , heralded by angels only visible halo the " yet without sin , "[3941-the babe , heralded by angels] which set upon [His]3941-the babe , heralded by angels brow in youth and manhood the divine seal of perfect purity , and in [His]3941-the babe , heralded by angels eyes the clear shining of uninterrupted intercourse with Heaven .

As [she]3921-her had left [the chapel]5170-the chapel , turning from the sculptured figure which had helped [her]3921-her to this realisation , [she]3921-her had become wondrously aware of the Unseen Presence of [the Christ]251-the risen christ , close beside [her]3921-her . " As seeing [Him]3941-the babe , heralded by angels Who is invisible "[3921-her] [she]3921-her had come down from [the mount]3952-the mount , conscious that [He]3941-the babe , heralded by angels went on before . [She]3921-her seemed to be following those blessed footsteps over the heather of [[her]3921-her native hills]3953-her native hills , even as [the disciples of old]3954-the disciples of old followed [them]3955-them through [the cornfields of [Judea]80-judea]3956-the cornfields of judea , and over [the grassy slopes of [Galilee]41-galilee]3957-the grassy slopes of galilee . Yet conscious also that [He]3941-the babe , heralded by angels moved beside [her]3921-her , with hand outstretched in case [her]3921-her spirit tripped ; and that , should [a hidden foe]3958-a hidden foe fling shafts from an ambush in the rear , even there that Unseen Presence would be behind [her]3921-her as a shield . " [Lo]255-lo [I]3941-the babe , heralded by angels am with [you]255-lo always , even unto the end of [the world]389-the world . "[3941-the babe , heralded by angels]

Strong in this most human vision of [the Divine]5381-the divine , [she]3921-her had come down from [the Holy Mount]6998-the holy mount , prepared to face the dumb demon [she]3921-her dreaded , the silent acquiescence in deception , which threatened to tear [her]3921-her happiness , bruise [her]3921-her spirit , and cast into the fire and into [the waters]3961-the waters to destroy them , those treasures which [her]3921-her heart had lately learned to hold so dear .

Prepared for this , [she]3921-her came ; and lo , [Heaven]142-heaven granted [her]3921-her the second vision . [She]3921-her saw deep into the heart of [a true man]3962-a true man 's faithfulness ; an example of chivalry , of profound reverence for holy things , which shamed [her]3921-her doubts of [him]3962-a true man ; a self - sacrifice which lifted the great human love , to which [she]3921-her , in [her]3921-her cloistered sanctity , had pictured [herself]3921-her as stooping , far above [her]3921-her , to the ideal of [the divine]5381-the divine . Was not this indeed a Vision of Truth ?

Crossing [the room]495-the room , [Mora]144-mora laid the robes [she]144-mora carried upon the couch . While mounting the stairs [she]144-mora had planned , in the secret of [[her]144-mora own chamber]3260-her own chamber , to clothe [herself]144-mora in them once again , to hang [her]144-mora jewelled cross about [her]144-mora neck , and thus once more [Prioress of the White Ladies]4675-prioress of the white ladies to kneel at [[our Lady]4260-our lady 's shrine]6164-our lady 's shrine , and implore guidance in this final decision . But now , [she]144-mora laid them gently down upon the bed .

[She]3921-her could not stand fast in this new liberty , with the heavy folds of that white habit entangling [her]3921-her feet in a yoke of bondage .

The heart , filled with a love so full of glowing tenderness for [[her]3921-her Knight of the Silver Shield]3969-her knight of the silver shield proved worthy , could not beat beneath a scapulary . Nor could [her]3921-her cross of office lie where [his]3969-her knight of the silver shield dear head had rested .
